title: Jeremiah Chapter 43 Verse 2
text: Then Azariah, the son of Hoshaiah, and Johanan, the son of Kareah, and all the men of pride, said to Jeremiah, You have said what is false: the Lord our God has not sent you to say, You are not to go into the land of Egypt and make your living-place there:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 43 Verse 3
text: But Baruch, the son of Neriah, is moving you against us, to give us up into the hands of the Chaldaeans so that they may put us to death, and take us away prisoners into Babylon.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 43 Verse 4
text: So Johanan, the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces, and all the people, did not give ear to the order of the Lord that they were to go on living in the land of Judah.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 43 Verse 5
text: But Johanan, the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces took all the rest of Judah who had come back into the land of Judah from all the nations where they had been forced to go;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 43 Verse 6
text: The men and the women and the children and the king's daughters, and every person whom Nebuzaradan, the captain of the armed men, had put under the care of Gedaliah, the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, and Jeremiah the prophet and Baruch, the son of Neriah;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 43 Verse 7
text: And they came into the land of Egypt; for they did not give ear to the voice of the Lord: and they came to Tahpanhes.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 43 Verse 8
text: Then the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah in Tahpanhes, saying,

title: Jeremiah Chapter 43 Verse 9
text: Take in your hand some great stones, and put them in a safe place in the paste in the brickwork which is at the way into Pharaoh's house in Tahpanhes, before the eyes of the men of Judah;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 43 Verse 10
text: And say to them, This is what the Lord of armies, the God of Israel, has said: See, I will send and take Nebuchadrezzar, the king of Babylon, my servant, and he will put the seat of his kingdom on these stones which have been put in a safe place here by you; and his tent will be stretched over them.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 43 Verse 11
text: And he will come and overcome the land of Egypt; those who are for death will be put to death, those who are to be prisoners will be made prisoners, and those who are for the sword will be given to the sword.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 43 Verse 12
text: And he will put a fire in the houses of the gods of Egypt; and they will be burned by him: and he will make Egypt clean as a keeper of sheep makes clean his clothing; and he will go out from there in peace.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 43 Verse 13
text: And the stone pillars of Beth-shemesh in the land of Egypt will be broken by him, and the houses of the gods of Egypt burned with fire.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 44 Verse 1
text: The word which came to Jeremiah about all the Jews who were living in the land of Egypt, in Migdol and at Tahpanhes and at Noph and in the country of Pathros, saying,

title: Jeremiah Chapter 44 Verse 2
text: The Lord of armies, the God of Israel, has said: You have seen all the evil which I have sent on Jerusalem and on all the towns of Judah; and now, this day they are waste and unpeopled;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 44 Verse 3
text: Because of the evil which they have done, moving me to wrath by burning perfumes in worship to other gods, who were not their gods or yours or the gods of their fathers.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 44 Verse 4
text: And I sent all my servants the prophets to you, getting up early and sending them, saying, Do not do this disgusting thing which is hated by me.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 44 Verse 5
text: But they gave no attention, and their ears were not open so that they might be turned from their evil-doing and from burning perfume to other gods.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 44 Verse 6
text: Because of this, my passion and my wrath were let loose, burning in the towns of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem; and they are waste and unpeopled as at this day.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 44 Verse 7
text: So now, the Lord, the God of armies, the God of Israel, has said, Why are you doing this great evil against yourselves, causing every man and woman, little child and baby at the breast among you in Judah to be cut off till not one is still living;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 44 Verse 8
text: Moving me to wrath with the work of your hands, burning perfumes to other gods in the land of Egypt, where you have gone to make a place for yourselves, so that you may become a curse and a name of shame among all the nations of the earth?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 44 Verse 9
text: Have you no memory of the evil-doing of your fathers, and the evil-doing of the kings of Judah, and the evil-doing of their wives, and the evil which you yourselves have done, and the evil which your wives have done, in the land of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 44 Verse 10
text: Even to this day their hearts are not broken, and they have no fear, and have not gone in the way of my law or of my rules which I gave to you and to your fathers.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 44 Verse 11
text: So this is what the Lord of armies, the God of Israel, has said: See, my face will be turned against you for evil, for the cutting off of all Judah;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 44 Verse 12
text: And I will take the last of Judah, whose minds are fixed on going into the land of Egypt and stopping there, and they will all come to their end, falling in the land of Egypt by the sword and by being short of food and by disease; death will overtake them, from the least to the greatest, death by the sword and by need of food: they will become an oath and a cause of wonder and a curse and a name of shame.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 44 Verse 13
text: For I will send punishment on those who are living in the land of Egypt, as I have sent punishment on Jerusalem, by the sword and by need of food and by disease:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 44 Verse 14
text: So that not one of the rest of Judah, who have gone into the land of Egypt and are living there, will get away or keep his life, to come back to the land of Judah where they are hoping to come back and be living again: for not one will come back, but only those who are able to get away.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 44 Verse 15
text: Then all the men who had knowledge that their wives were burning perfumes to other gods, and all the women who were present, a great meeting, answering Jeremiah, said,

title: Jeremiah Chapter 44 Verse 16
text: As for the word which you have said to us in the name of the Lord, we will not give ear to you.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 44 Verse 17
text: But we will certainly do every word which has gone out of our mouths, burning perfumes to the queen of heaven and draining out drink offerings to her as we did, we and our fathers and our kings and our rulers, in the towns of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem: for then we had food enough and did well and saw no evil.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 44 Verse 18
text: But from the time when we gave up burning perfumes to the queen of heaven and draining out drink offerings to her, we have been in need of all things, and have been wasted by the sword and by need of food.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 44 Verse 19
text: And the women said, When we were burning perfumes to the queen of heaven and draining out drink offerings to her, did we make cakes in her image and give her our drink offerings without the knowledge of our husbands?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 44 Verse 20
text: Then Jeremiah said to all the people, to the men and women and all the people who had given him that answer,

title: Jeremiah Chapter 44 Verse 21
text: The perfumes which you have been burning in the towns of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem, you and your fathers and your kings and your rulers and the people of the land, had the Lord no memory of them, and did he not keep them in mind?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 44 Verse 22
text: And the Lord was no longer able to put up with the evil of your doings and the disgusting things you did; and because of this your land has become a waste and a cause of wonder and a curse, with no one living in it, as at this day.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 44 Verse 23
text: Because you have been burning perfumes, and sinning against the Lord, and have not given ear to the voice of the Lord, or gone in the way of his law or his rules or his orders; for this reason this evil has come on you, as it is today.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 44 Verse 24
text: Further, Jeremiah said to all the people and all the women, Give ear to the word of the Lord, all those of Judah who are living in Egypt:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 44 Verse 25
text: This is what the Lord of armies, the God of Israel, has said: You women have said with your mouths, and with your hands you have done what you said, We will certainly give effect to the oaths we have made, to have perfumes burned to the queen of heaven and drink offerings drained out to her: then give effect to your oaths and do them.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 44 Verse 26
text: And now give ear to the word of the Lord, all you of Judah who are living in the land of Egypt: Truly, I have taken an oath by my great name, says the Lord, that my name is no longer to be named in the mouth of any man of Judah in all the land of Egypt, saying, By the life of the Lord God.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 44 Verse 27
text: See, I am watching over them for evil and not for good: all the men of Judah who are in the land of Egypt will be wasted by the sword and by need of food till there is an end of them.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 44 Verse 28
text: And those who get away safe from the sword will come back from the land of Egypt to the land of Judah, a very small number; and all the rest of Judah, who have gone into the land of Egypt and are living there, will see whose word has effect, mine or theirs.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 44 Verse 29
text: And this will be the sign to you, says the Lord, that I will give you punishment in this place, so that you may see that my words will certainly have effect against you for evil:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 44 Verse 30
text: The Lord has said, See, I will give up Pharaoh Hophra, king of Egypt, into the hands of those who are fighting against him and desiring to take his life, as I gave Zedekiah, king of Judah, into the hands of Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon, his hater, who had designs against his life.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 45 Verse 1
text: The words which Jeremiah the prophet said to Baruch, the son of Neriah, when he put these words down in a book from the mouth of Jeremiah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim, the son of Josiah, king of Judah; he said,

title: Jeremiah Chapter 45 Verse 2
text: This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, has said of you, O Baruch:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 45 Verse 3
text: You said, Sorrow is mine! for the Lord has given me sorrow in addition to my pain; I am tired with the sound of my sorrow, and I get no rest.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 45 Verse 4
text: This is what you are to say to him: The Lord has said, Truly, the building which I put up will be broken down, and that which was planted by me will be uprooted, and this through all the land;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 45 Verse 5
text: And as for you, are you looking for great things for yourself? Have no desire for them: for truly I will send evil on all flesh, says the Lord: but your life I will keep safe from attack wherever you go.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 46 Verse 1
text: The word of the Lord which came to Jeremiah the prophet about the nations.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 46 Verse 2
text: Of Egypt: about the army of Pharaoh-neco, king of Egypt, which was by the river Euphrates in Carchemish, which Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon, overcame in the fourth year of Jehoiakim, the son of Josiah, king of Judah.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 46 Verse 3
text: Get out the breastplate and body-cover, and come together to the fight.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 46 Verse 4
text: Make the horses ready, and get up, you horsemen, and take your places with your head-dresses; make the spears sharp and put on the breastplates.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 46 Verse 5
text: What have I seen? they are overcome with fear and turned back; their men of war are broken and have gone in flight, not looking back: fear is on every side, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 46 Verse 6
text: Let not the quick-footed go in flight, or the man of war get away; on the north, by the river Euphrates, they are slipping and falling.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 46 Verse 7
text: Who is this coming up like the Nile, whose waters are lifting their heads like the rivers?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 46 Verse 8
text: Egypt is coming up like the Nile, and his waters are lifting their heads like the rivers, and he says, I will go up, covering the earth; I will send destruction on the town and its people.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 46 Verse 9
text: Go up, you horses; go rushing on, you carriages of war; go out, you men of war: Cush and Put, gripping the body-cover, and the Ludim, with bent bows.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 46 Verse 10
text: But that day is the day of the Lord, the Lord of armies, a day of punishment when he will take payment from his haters: and the sword will have all its desire, drinking their blood in full measure: for there is an offering to the Lord, the Lord of armies, in the north country by the river Euphrates.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 46 Verse 11
text: Go up to Gilead and take sweet oil, O virgin daughter of Egypt: there is no help in all your medical arts; nothing will make you well.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 46 Verse 12
text: Your shame has come to the ears of the nations, and the earth is full of your cry: for the strong man is falling against the strong, they have come down together.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 46 Verse 13
text: The word which the Lord said to Jeremiah the prophet, of how Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon, would come and make war on the land of Egypt.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 46 Verse 14
text: Give the news in Migdol, make it public in Noph: say, Take up your positions and make yourselves ready; for on every side of you the sword has made destruction.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 46 Verse 15
text: Why has Apis, your strong one, gone in flight? he was not able to keep his place, because the Lord was forcing him down with strength.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 46 Verse 16
text: ... are stopped in their going, they are falling; and they say one to another, Let us get up and go back to our people, to the land of our birth, away from the cruel sword.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 46 Verse 17
text: Give a name to Pharaoh, king of Egypt: A noise who has let the time go by.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 46 Verse 18
text: By my life, says the King, whose name is the Lord of armies, truly, like Tabor among the mountains and like Carmel by the sea, so will he come.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 46 Verse 19
text: O daughter living in Egypt, make ready the vessels of a prisoner: for Noph will become a waste, it will be burned up and become unpeopled.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 46 Verse 20
text: Egypt is a fair young cow; but a biting insect has come on her out of the north.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 46 Verse 21
text: And those who were her fighters for payment are like fat oxen; for they are turned back, they have gone in flight together, they do not keep their place: for the day of their fate has come on them, the time of their punishment.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 46 Verse 22
text: She makes a sound like the hiss of a snake when they come on with strength; they go against her with axes, like wood-cutters.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 46 Verse 23
text: They will be cutting down her woods, for they may not be searched out; because they are like locusts, more than may be numbered.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 46 Verse 24
text: The daughter of Egypt will be put to shame; she will be given up into the hands of the people of the north.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 46 Verse 25
text: The Lord of armies, the God of Israel, has said: See, I will send punishment on Amon of No and on Pharaoh and on those who put their faith in him;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 46 Verse 26
text: And I will give them up into the hands of those who will take their lives, and into the hands of Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon, and into the hands of his servants: and later, it will be peopled as in the past, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 46 Verse 27
text: But have no fear, O Jacob, my servant, and do not be troubled, O Israel: for see, I will make you come back from far away, and your seed from the land where they are prisoners; and Jacob will come back, and will be quiet and in peace, and no one will give him cause for fear.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 46 Verse 28
text: Have no fear, O Jacob, my servant, says the Lord; for I am with you: for I will put an end to all the nations where I have sent you, but I will not put an end to you completely: though with wise purpose I will put right your errors, and will not let you go quite without punishment.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 47 Verse 1
text: The word of the Lord which came to Jeremiah the prophet about the Philistines, before Pharaoh's attack on Gaza.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 47 Verse 2
text: This is what the Lord has said: See, waters are coming up out of the north, and will become an overflowing stream, overflowing the land and everything in it, the town and those who are living in it; and men will give a cry, and all the people of the land will be crying out in pain.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 47 Verse 3
text: At the noise of the stamping of the feet of his war-horses, at the rushing of his carriages and the thunder of his wheels, fathers will give no thought to their children, because their hands are feeble;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 47 Verse 4
text: Because of the day which is coming with destruction on all the Philistines, cutting off from Tyre and Zidon the last of their helpers: for the Lord will send destruction on the Philistines, the rest of the sea-land of Caphtor.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 47 Verse 5
text: The hair is cut off from the head of Gaza; Ashkelon has come to nothing; the last of the Anakim are deeply wounding themselves.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 47 Verse 6
text: O sword of the Lord, how long will you have no rest? put yourself back into your cover; be at peace, be quiet.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 47 Verse 7
text: How is it possible for it to be quiet, seeing that the Lord has given it orders? against Ashkelon and against the sea-land he has given it directions.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 1
text: Of Moab. The Lord of armies, the God of Israel, has said: Sorrow on Nebo, for it has been made waste; Kiriathaim has been put to shame and is taken: the strong place is put to shame and broken down.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 2
text: The praise of Moab has come to an end; as for Heshbon, evil has been designed against her; come, let us put an end to her as a nation. But your mouth will be shut, O Madmen; the sword will go after you.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 3
text: There is the sound of crying from Horonaim, wasting and great destruction;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 4
text: Moab is broken; her cry has gone out to Zoar.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 5
text: For by the slope of Luhith they will go up, weeping all the way; for on the way down to Horonaim the cry of destruction has come to their ears.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 6
text: Go in flight, get away with your lives, and let your faces be turned to Aroer in the Arabah.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 7
text: For because you have put your faith in your strong places, you, even you, will be taken: and Chemosh will go out as a prisoner, his priests and his rulers together.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 8
text: And the attacker will come against every town, not one will be safe; and the valley will be made waste, and destruction will come to the lowland, as the Lord has said.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 9
text: Put up a pillar for Moab, for she will come to a complete end: and her towns will become a waste, without anyone living in them.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 10
text: Let him be cursed who does the Lord's work half-heartedly; let him be cursed who keeps back his sword from blood.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 11
text: From his earliest days, Moab has been living in comfort; like wine long stored he has not been drained from vessel to vessel, he has never gone away as a prisoner: so his taste is still in him, his smell is unchanged.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 12
text: So truly, the days are coming, says the Lord, when I will send to him men who will have him turned over till there is no more wine in his vessels, and his wine-skins will be completely broken.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 13
text: And Moab will be shamed on account of Chemosh, as the children of Israel were shamed on account of Beth-el their hope.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 14
text: How say you, We are men of war and strong fighters?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 15
text: He who makes Moab waste has gone up against her; and the best of her young men have gone down to their death, says the King, whose name is the Lord of armies.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 16
text: The fate of Moab is near, and trouble is coming on him very quickly.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 17
text: All you who are round about him, give signs of grief for him, and all you who have knowledge of his name, say, How is the strong rod broken, even the beautiful branch!

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 18
text: Come down from your glory, O people of Dibon, and take your seat in the place of the waste; for the attacker of Moab has gone up against you, sending destruction on your strong places.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 19
text: O daughter of Aroer, take your station by the way, on the watch: questioning him who is in flight, and her who has got away safe, say, What has been done?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 20
text: Moab has been put to shame, she is broken: make loud sounds of grief, crying out for help; give the news in Arnon, that Moab has been made waste.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 21
text: And punishment has come on the lowlands; on Holon and Jahzah, and on Mephaath,

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 22
text: And on Dibon, and on Nebo, and on Beth-diblathaim,

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 23
text: And on Kiriathaim, and on Beth-gamul, and on Beth-meon,

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 24
text: And on Kerioth, and on Bozrah, and on all the towns of the land of Moab, far and near.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 25
text: The horn of Moab is cut off, and his arm is broken, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 26
text: Make him full of wine, for his heart has been lifted up against the Lord: and Moab will be rolling in the food he was not able to keep down, and everyone will be making sport of him.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 27
text: For did you not make sport of Israel? was he taken among thieves? for whenever you were talking about him, you were shaking your head over him.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 28
text: O people of Moab, go away from the towns and take cover in the rock; be like the dove of the Arabah, which makes her living-place in holes.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 29
text: We have had word of the pride of Moab, how great it is; how he is lifted up in pride; and his great opinion of himself, and that his heart is lifted up.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 30
text: I have knowledge of his wrath, says the Lord, that it is nothing; his high-sounding words have done nothing.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 31
text: For this cause I will give cries of grief for Moab, crying out for Moab, even for all of it; I will be sorrowing for the men of Kir-heres.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 32
text: My weeping for you, O vine of Sibmah, will be more than the weeping of Jazer: your branches have gone over the sea, stretching even to Jazer: destruction has come down on your summer fruits and your cut grapes.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 33
text: All joy is gone; no longer are they glad for the fertile field and for the land of Moab; I have made the wine come to an end from the crushing vessels: no longer will the grapes be crushed with the sound of glad voices.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 34
text: The cry of Heshbon comes even to Elealeh; to Jahaz their voice is sounding; from Zoar even to Horonaim and to Eglath-shelishiyah: for the waters of Nimrim will become dry.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 35
text: And I will put an end in Moab, says the Lord, to him who is making offerings in the high place and burning perfumes to his gods.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 36
text: So my heart is sounding for Moab like the sound of pipes, and my heart is sounding like pipes for the men of Kir-heres: for the wealth he has got for himself has come to an end.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 37
text: For everywhere the hair of the head and the hair of the face is cut off: on every hand there are wounds, and haircloth on every body.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 38
text: On all the house-tops of Moab and in its streets there is weeping everywhere; for Moab has been broken like a vessel in which there is no pleasure, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 39
text: How is it broken down! how is Moab's back turned in shame! so Moab will be a cause of sport and of fear to everyone round about him.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 40
text: For the Lord has said, See, he will come like an eagle in flight, stretching out his wings against Moab.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 41
text: Kerioth is taken, and the strong places have been forced, and the hearts of Moab's men of war in that day will be like the heart of a woman in birth-pains.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 42
text: And Moab will come to an end as a people, because he has been lifting himself up against the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 43
text: Fear and death and the net have come on you, O people of Moab, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 44
text: He who goes in flight from the fear will be overtaken by death; and he who gets free from death will be taken in the net: for I will make this come on Moab, even the year of their punishment, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 45
text: Those who went in flight from the fear are waiting under the shade of Heshbon: for a fire has gone out from Heshbon and a flame from the house of Sihon, burning up the pride of Moab and the crown of the head of the violent ones.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 46
text: Sorrow is yours, O Moab! the people of Chemosh are overcome: for your sons have been taken away as prisoners, and your daughters made servants.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 48 Verse 47
text: But still, I will let the fate of Moab be changed in the last days, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 1
text: About the children of Ammon. These are the words of the Lord: Has Israel no sons? has he no one to take the heritage? why then has Milcom taken Gad for himself, putting his people in its towns?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 2
text: Because of this, see, the days are coming when I will have a cry of war sounded against Rabbah, the town of the children of Ammon; it will become a waste of broken walls, and her daughter-towns will be burned with fire: then Israel will take the heritage of those who took his heritage, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 3
text: Make sounds of grief, O Heshbon, for Ai is wasted; give loud cries, O daughters of Rabbah, and put haircloth round you: give yourselves to weeping, running here and there and wounding yourselves; for Milcom will be taken prisoner together with his rulers and his priests.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 4
text: Why are you lifted up in pride on account of your valleys, your flowing valley, O daughter ever turning away? who puts her faith in her wealth, saying, Who will come against me?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 5
text: See, I will send fear on you, says the Lord, the Lord of armies, from those who are round you on every side; you will be forced out, every man straight before him, and there will be no one to get together the wanderers.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 6
text: But after these things, I will let the fate of the children of Ammon be changed, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 7
text: About Edom. This is what the Lord of armies has said. Is there no more wisdom in Teman? have wise suggestions come to an end among men of good sense? has their wisdom completely gone?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 8
text: Go in flight, go back, take cover in deep places, you who are living in Dedan; for I will send the fate of Edom on him, even the time of his punishment.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 9
text: If men came to get your grapes, would they not let some be uncut on the vines? if thieves came by night, would they not make waste till they had enough?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 10
text: I have had Esau searched out, uncovering his secret places, so that he may not keep himself covered: his seed is wasted and has come to an end, and there is no help from his neighbours.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 11
text: Put in my care your children who have no father, and I will keep them safe; and let your widows put their faith in me.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 12
text: For the Lord has said, Those for whom the cup was not made ready will certainly be forced to take of it; and are you to go without punishment? you will not be without punishment, but will certainly be forced to take from the cup.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 13
text: For I have taken an oath by myself, says the Lord, that Bozrah will become a cause of wonder, a name of shame, a waste and a curse; and all its towns will be waste places for ever.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 14
text: Word has come to me from the Lord, and a representative has been sent to the nations, to say, Come together and go up against her, and take your places for the fight.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 15
text: For see, I have made you small among the nations, looked down on by men.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 16
text: ... the pride of your heart has been a false hope, O you who are living in the cracks of the rock, keeping your place on the top of the hill: even if you made your living-place as high as the eagle, I would make you come down, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 17
text: And Edom will become a cause of wonder: everyone who goes by will be overcome with wonder, and make sounds of fear at all her punishments.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 18
text: As at the downfall of Sodom and Gomorrah and their neighbouring towns, says the Lord, no man will be living in it, no son of man will have a resting-place there.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 19
text: See, he will come up like a lion from the thick growth of Jordan against the resting-place of Teman: but I will suddenly make him go in flight from her; and I will put over her the man of my selection: for who is like me? and who will put forward his cause against me? and what keeper of sheep will be able to keep his place before me?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 20
text: For this cause give ear to the decision of the Lord which he has made against Edom, and to his purposes designed against the people of Teman: Truly, they will be pulled away by the smallest of the flock; truly, he will make waste their fields with them.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 21
text: The earth is shaking with the noise of their fall; their cry is sounding in the Red Sea.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 22
text: See, he will come up like an eagle in flight, stretching out his wings against Bozrah: and the hearts of Edom's men of war on that day will be like the heart of a woman in birth-pains.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 23
text: About Damascus. Hamath is put to shame, and Arpad; for the word of evil has come to their ears, their heart in its fear is turned to water, it will not be quiet.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 24
text: Damascus has become feeble, she is turned to flight, fear has taken her in its grip: pain and sorrows have come on her, as on a woman in birth-pains.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 25
text: How has the town of praise been wasted, the place of joy!

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 26
text: So her young men will be falling in her streets, and all the men of war will be cut off in that day, says the Lord of armies.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 27
text: And I will have a fire lighted on the wall of Damascus, burning up the great houses of Ben-hadad.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 28
text: About Kedar and the kingdoms of Hazor, which Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon, overcame. This is what the Lord has said: Up! go against Kedar, and make an attack on the children of the east.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 29
text: Their tents and their flocks they will take; they will take away for themselves their curtains and all their vessels and their camels: they will give a cry to them, Fear on every side.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 30
text: Go in flight, go wandering far off, take cover in deep places, O people of Hazor, says the Lord; for Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon, has made a design against you, he has a purpose against you in mind.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 31
text: Up! go against a nation which is living in comfort and without fear of danger, says the Lord, without doors or locks, living by themselves.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 32
text: And their camels will be taken from them by force, and their great herds will come into the hands of their attackers: those who have the ends of their hair cut I will send in flight to all the winds; and I will send their fate on them from every side, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 33
text: And Hazor will be a hole for jackals, a waste for ever: no one will be living in it, and no son of man will have a resting-place there.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 34
text: The word of the Lord which came to Jeremiah the prophet about Elam, when Zedekiah first became king of Judah, saying,

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 35
text: This is what the Lord of armies has said: See, I will have the bow of Elam, their chief strength, broken.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 36
text: And I will send on Elam four winds from the four quarters of heaven, driving them out to all those winds; there will be no nation into which the wanderers from Elam do not come.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 37
text: And I will let Elam be broken before their haters, and before those who are making designs against their lives: I will send evil on them, even my burning wrath, says the Lord; and I will send the sword after them till I have put an end to them:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 38
text: I will put the seat of my power in Elam, and in Elam I will put an end to kings and rulers, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 49 Verse 39
text: But it will come about that, in the last days, I will let the fate of Elam be changed, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 1
text: The word which the Lord said about Babylon, about the land of the Chaldaeans, by Jeremiah the prophet.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 2
text: Give it out among the nations, make it public, and let the flag be lifted up; give the word and keep nothing back; say, Babylon is taken, Bel is put to shame, Merodach is broken, her images are put to shame, her gods are broken.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 3
text: For out of the north a nation is coming up against her, which will make her land waste and unpeopled: they are in flight, man and beast are gone.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 4
text: In those days and in that time, says the Lord, the children of Israel will come, they and the children of Judah together; they will go on their way weeping and making prayer to the Lord their God.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 5
text: They will be questioning about the way to Zion, with their faces turned in its direction, saying, Come, and be united to the Lord in an eternal agreement which will be kept in mind for ever.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 6
text: My people have been wandering sheep: their keepers have made them go out of the right way, turning them loose on the mountains: they have gone from mountain to hill, having no memory of their resting-place.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 7
text: They have been attacked by all those who came across them: and their attackers said, We are doing no wrong, because they have done evil against the Lord in whom is righteousness, against the Lord, the hope of their fathers.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 8
text: Go in flight out of Babylon, go out of the land of the Chaldaeans, and be like he-goats before the flocks.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 9
text: For see, I am moving and sending up against Babylon a band of great nations from the north country: and they will put their armies in position against her; and from there she will be taken: their arrows will be like those of an expert man of war; not one will come back without getting its mark.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 10
text: And the wealth of Chaldaea will come into the hands of her attackers: all those who take her wealth will have enough, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 11
text: Because you are glad, because you are lifted up with pride, you wasters of my heritage, because you are playing like a young cow put out to grass, and you make a noise like strong horses;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 12
text: Your mother will be put to shame; she who gave you birth will be looked down on: see, she will be the last of the nations, a waste place, a dry and unwatered land.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 13
text: Because of the wrath of the Lord no one will be living in it, and it will be quite unpeopled: everyone who goes by Babylon will be overcome with wonder, and make sounds of fear at all her punishments.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 14
text: Put your armies in position against Babylon on every side, all you bowmen; let loose your arrows at her, not keeping any back: for she has done evil against the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 15
text: Give a loud cry against her on every side; she has given herself up, her supports are overturned, her walls are broken down: for it is the payment taken by the Lord; give her payment; as she has done, so do to her.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 16
text: Let the planter of seed be cut off from Babylon, and everyone using the curved blade at the time of the grain-cutting: for fear of the cruel sword, everyone will be turned to his people, everyone will go in flight to his land.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 17
text: Israel is a wandering sheep; the lions have been driving him away: first he was attacked by the king of Assyria, and now his bones have been broken by Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 18
text: So this is what the Lord of armies, the God of Israel, has said: See, I will send punishment on the king of Babylon and on his land, as I have given punishment to the king of Assyria.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 19
text: And I will make Israel come back to his resting-place, and he will get his food on Carmel and Bashan, and have his desire in full measure on the hills of Ephraim and in Gilead.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 20
text: In those days and in that time, says the Lord, when the evil-doing of Israel is looked for, there will be nothing; and in Judah no sins will be seen: for I will have forgiveness for those whom I will keep safe.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 21
text: Go up against the land of Merathaim, even against it, and against the people of Pekod; put them to death and send destruction after them, says the Lord, and do everything I have given you orders to do.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 22
text: There is a sound of war in the land and of great destruction.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 23
text: How is the hammer of all the earth cut in two and broken! how has Babylon become a waste among the nations!

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 24
text: I have put a net for you, and you have been taken, O Babylon, without your knowledge: you have been uncovered and taken because you were fighting against the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 25
text: From his store-house the Lord has taken the instruments of his wrath: for the Lord, the Lord of armies, has a work to do in the land of the Chaldaeans.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 26
text: Come up against her one and all, let her store-houses be broken open: make her into a mass of stones, give her to the curse, till there is nothing of her to be seen.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 27
text: Put all her oxen to the sword; let them go down to death: sorrow is theirs, for their day has come, the time of their punishment.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 28
text: The voice of those who are in flight, who have got away safe from the land of Babylon, to give news in Zion of punishment from the Lord our God, even payment for his Temple.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 29
text: Send for the archers to come together against Babylon, all the bowmen; put up your tents against her on every side; let no one get away: give her the reward of her work; as she has done, so do to her: for she has been uplifted in pride against the Lord, against the Holy One of Israel.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 30
text: For this cause her young men will be falling in her streets, and all her men of war will be cut off in that day, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 31
text: See, I am against you, O pride, says the Lord, the Lord of armies, for your day has come, the time when I will send punishment on you.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 32
text: And pride will go with uncertain steps and have a fall, and there will be no one to come to his help: and I will put a fire in his towns, burning up everything round about him.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 33
text: This is what the Lord of armies has said: The children of Israel and the children of Judah are crushed down together: all those who took them prisoner keep them in a tight grip; they will not let them go.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 34
text: Their saviour is strong; the Lord of armies is his name: he will certainly take up their cause, so that he may give rest to the earth and trouble to the people of Babylon.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 35
text: A sword is on the Chaldaeans, says the Lord, and on the people of Babylon, and on her rulers and on her wise men.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 36
text: A sword is on the men of pride, and they will become foolish: a sword is on her men of war, and they will be broken.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 37
text: A sword is on all the mixed people in her, and they will become like women: a sword is on her store-houses, and they will be taken by her attackers.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 38
text: A sword is on her waters, drying them up; for it is a land of images, and their minds are fixed on false gods.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 39
text: For this reason the beasts of the waste land with the wolves will make their holes there and the ostriches will be living in it: never again will men be living there, it will be unpeopled from generation to generation.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 40
text: As when Sodom and Gomorrah and their neighbouring towns were overturned by God, says the Lord, so no man will be living in it, and no son of man will have a resting-place there.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 41
text: See, a people is coming from the north; a great nation and a number of kings will be put in motion from the inmost parts of the earth.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 42
text: Bows and spears are in their hands; they are cruel and have no mercy; their voice is like the thunder of the sea, and they go on horses; everyone in his place like men going to the fight, against you, O daughter of Babylon.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 43
text: The king of Babylon has had news of them, and his hands have become feeble: trouble has come on him and pain like the pain of a woman in childbirth.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 44
text: See, he will come up like a lion from the thick growth of Jordan against the resting-place of Teman: but I will suddenly make them go in flight from her; and I will put over her the man of my selection: for who is like me? and who will put forward his cause against me? and what keeper of sheep will keep his place before me?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 45
text: So give ear to the decision of the Lord which he has made against Babylon, and to his purposes designed against the land of the Chaldaeans; Truly, they will be pulled away by the smallest of the flock; truly, he will make waste their fields with them.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 50 Verse 46
text: At the cry, Babylon is taken! the earth is shaking, and the cry comes to the ears of the nations.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 1
text: The Lord has said: See, I will make a wind of destruction come up against Babylon and against those who are living in Chaldaea;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 2
text: And I will send men to Babylon to make her clean and get her land cleared: for in the day of trouble they will put up their tents against her on every side.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 3
text: Against her the bow of the archer is bent, and he puts on his coat of metal: have no mercy on her young men, give all her army up to the curse.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 4
text: And the dead will be stretched out in the land of the Chaldaeans, and the wounded in her streets.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 5
text: For Israel has not been given up, or Judah, by his God, by the Lord of armies; for their land is full of sin against the Holy One of Israel.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 6
text: Go in flight out of Babylon, so that every man may keep his life; do not be cut off in her evil-doing: for it is the time of the Lord's punishment; he will give her her reward.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 7
text: Babylon has been a gold cup in the hand of the Lord, which has made all the earth overcome with wine: the nations have taken of her wine, and for this cause the nations have gone off their heads.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 8
text: Sudden is the downfall of Babylon and her destruction: make cries of grief for her; take sweet oil for her pain, if it is possible for her to be made well.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 9
text: We would have made Babylon well, but she is not made well: give her up, and let us go everyone to his country: for her punishment is stretching up to heaven, and lifted up even to the skies.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 10
text: The Lord has made clear our righteousness: come, and let us give an account in Zion of the work of the Lord our God.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 11
text: Make bright the arrows; take up the body-covers: the Lord has been moving the spirit of the king of the Medes; because his design against Babylon is its destruction: for it is the punishment from the Lord, the payment for his Temple.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 12
text: Let the flag be lifted up against the walls of Babylon, make the watch strong, put the watchmen in their places, make ready a surprise attack: for it is the Lord's purpose, and he has done what he said about the people of Babylon.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 13
text: O you whose living-place is by the wide waters, whose stores are great, your end is come, your evil profit is ended.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 14
text: The Lord of armies has taken an oath by himself, saying, Truly, I will make you full with men as with locusts, and their voices will be loud against you.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 15
text: He has made the earth by his power, he has made the world strong in its place by his wisdom, and by his wise design the heavens have been stretched out:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 16
text: At the sound of his voice there is a massing of the waters in the heavens, and he makes the mists go up from the ends of the earth; he makes the thunder-flames for the rain and sends out the wind from his store-houses.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 17
text: Then every man becomes like a beast without knowledge; every gold-worker is put to shame by the image he has made: for his metal image is deceit, and there is no breath in them.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 18
text: They are nothing, a work of error: in the time of their punishment, destruction will overtake them.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 19
text: The heritage of Jacob is not like these; for the maker of all things is his heritage: the Lord of armies is his name.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 20
text: You are my fighting axe and my instrument of war: with you the nations will be broken; with you kingdoms will be broken;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 21
text: With you the horse and the horseman will be broken; with you the war-carriage and he who goes in it will be broken;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 22
text: With you man and woman will be broken; with you the old man and the boy will be broken; with you the young man and the virgin will be broken;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 23
text: With you the keeper of sheep with his flock will be broken, and with you the farmer and his oxen will be broken, and with you captains and rulers will be broken.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 24
text: And I will give to Babylon, and to all the people of Chaldaea, their reward for all the evil they have done in Zion before your eyes, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 25
text: See, I am against you, says the Lord, O mountain of destruction, causing the destruction of all the earth: and my hand will be stretched out on you, rolling you down from the rocks, and making you a burned mountain.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 26
text: And they will not take from you a stone for the angle of a wall or the base of a building; but you will be a waste place for ever, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 27
text: Let a flag be lifted up in the land, let the horn be sounded among the nations, make the nations ready against her; get the kingdoms of Ararat, Minni, and Ashkenaz together against her, make ready a scribe against her; let the horses come up against her like massed locusts.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 28
text: Make the nations ready for war against her, the king of the Medes and his rulers and all his captains, and all the land under his rule.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 29
text: And the land is shaking and in pain: for the purposes of the Lord are fixed, to make the land of Babylon an unpeopled waste.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 30
text: Babylon's men of war have kept back from the fight, waiting in their strong places; their strength has given way, they have become like women: her houses have been put on fire, her locks are broken.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 31
text: One man, running, will give word to another, and one who goes with news will be handing it on to another, to give word to the king of Babylon that his town has been taken from every quarter:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 32
text: And the ways across the river have been taken, and the water-holes ... burned with fire, and the men of war are in the grip of fear.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 33
text: For these are the words of the Lord of armies, the God of Israel: The daughter of Babylon is like a grain-floor when it is stamped down; before long, the time of her grain-cutting will come.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 34
text: Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon, has made a meal of me, violently crushing me, he has made me a vessel with nothing in it, he has taken me in his mouth like a dragon, he has made his stomach full with my delicate flesh, crushing me with his teeth.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 35
text: May the violent things done to me, and my downfall, come on Babylon, the daughter of Zion will say; and, May my blood be on the people of Chaldaea, Jerusalem will say.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 36
text: For this reason the Lord has said: See, I will give support to your cause, and take payment for what you have undergone; I will make her sea dry, and her fountain without water.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 37
text: And Babylon will become a mass of broken walls, a hole for jackals, a cause of wonder and surprise, without a living man in it.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 38
text: They will be crying out together like lions, their voices will be like the voices of young lions.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 39
text: When they are heated, I will make a feast for them, and overcome them with wine, so that they may become unconscious, sleeping an eternal sleep without awaking, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 40
text: I will make them go down to death like lambs, like he-goats together.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 41
text: How is Babylon taken! and the praise of all the earth surprised! how has Babylon become a cause of wonder among the nations!

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 42
text: The sea has come up over Babylon; she is covered with the mass of its waves.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 43
text: Her towns have become a waste, a dry and unwatered land, where no man has his living-place and no son of man goes by.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 44
text: And I will send punishment on Bel in Babylon, and take out of his mouth what went into it; no longer will the nations be flowing together to him: truly, the wall of Babylon will come down.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 45
text: My people, go out from her, and let every man get away safe from the burning wrath of the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 46
text: So that your hearts may not become feeble and full of fear because of the news which will go about in the land; for a story will go about one year, and after that in another year another story, and violent acts in the land, ruler against ruler.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 47
text: For this cause, truly, the days are coming when I will send punishment on the images of Babylon, and all her land will be shamed, and her dead will be falling down in her.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 48
text: And the heaven and the earth and everything in them, will make a song of joy over Babylon: for those who make her waste will come from the north, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 49
text: As Babylon had the dead of Israel put to the sword, so in Babylon the dead of all the land will be stretched out.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 50
text: You who have got away safe from the sword, go, waiting for nothing; have the Lord in memory when you are far away, and keep Jerusalem in mind.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 51
text: We are shamed because bitter words have come to our ears; our faces are covered with shame: for men from strange lands have come into the holy places of the Lord's house.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 52
text: For this reason, see, the days are coming, says the Lord, when I will send punishment on her images; and through all her land the wounded will be crying out in pain.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 53
text: Even if Babylon was lifted up to heaven, even if she had the high places of her strength shut in with walls, still I would send against her those who will make her waste, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 54
text: There is the sound of a cry from Babylon, and of a great destruction from the land of the Chaldaeans:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 55
text: For the Lord is making Babylon waste, and putting an end to the great voice coming out of her; and her waves are thundering like great waters, their voice is sounding loud:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 56
text: For the waster has come on her, even on Babylon, and her men of war are taken, their bows are broken: for the Lord is a rewarding God, and he will certainly give payment.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 57
text: And I will make her chiefs and her wise men, her rulers and her captains and her men of war, overcome with wine; their sleep will be an eternal sleep without awaking, says the King; the Lord of armies is his name.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 58
text: The Lord of armies has said: The wide walls of Babylon will be completely uncovered and her high doorways will be burned with fire; so peoples keep on working for nothing, and the weariness of nations comes to an end in the smoke.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 59
text: The order which Jeremiah the prophet gave to Seraiah, the son of Neriah, the son of Mahseiah, when he went with Zedekiah, the king of Judah, to Babylon in the fourth year of his rule. Now Seraiah was the chief controller of the house.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 60
text: And Jeremiah put in a book all the evil which was to come on Babylon.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 61
text: And Jeremiah said to Seraiah, When you come to Babylon, see that you give them all these words;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 62
text: And after reading them, say, O Lord, you have said about this place that it is to be cut off, so that no one will be living in it, not a man or a beast, but it will be unpeopled for ever.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 63
text: And it will be that, when you have come to an end of reading this book, you are to have a stone fixed to it, and have it dropped into the Euphrates:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 51 Verse 64
text: And you are to say, So Babylon will go down, never to be lifted up again, because of the evil which I will send on her: and weariness will overcome them. So far, these are the words of Jeremiah.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 52 Verse 1
text: Zedekiah was twenty-one years old when he became king; he was king for eleven years in Jerusalem: and his mother's name was Hamutal, the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 52 Verse 2
text: And he did evil in the eyes of the Lord, as Jehoiakim had done.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 52 Verse 3
text: And because of the wrath of the Lord this came about in Jerusalem and Judah, till he had sent them away from before him: and Zedekiah took up arms against the king of Babylon.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 52 Verse 4
text: And in the ninth year of his rule, on the tenth day of the tenth month, Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon, came against Jerusalem with all his army and took up his position before it, building earthworks all round it.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 52 Verse 5
text: So the town was shut in by their forces till the eleventh year of King Zedekiah.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 52 Verse 6
text: In the fourth month, on the ninth day of the month, the store of food in the town was almost gone, so that there was no food for the people of the land.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 52 Verse 7
text: Then an opening was made in the wall of the town, and all the men of war went in flight out of the town by night through the doorway between the two walls which was by the king's garden; (now the Chaldaeans were stationed round the town:) and they went by the way of the Arabah.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 52 Verse 8
text: And the Chaldaean army went after King Zedekiah and overtook him on the other side of Jericho, and all his army went in flight from him in every direction.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 52 Verse 9
text: Then they made the king a prisoner and took him up to the king of Babylon to Riblah in the land of Hamath to be judged.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 52 Verse 10
text: And the king of Babylon put the sons of Zedekiah to death before his eyes: and he put to death all the rulers of Judah in Riblah.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 52 Verse 11
text: And he put out Zedekiah's eyes; and the king of Babylon, chaining him in iron bands, took him to Babylon, and put him in prison till the day of his death.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 52 Verse 12
text: Now in the fifth month, on the tenth day of the month, in the nineteenth year of King Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon, Nebuzaradan, the captain of the armed men, a servant of the king of Babylon, came into Jerusalem.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 52 Verse 13
text: And he had the house of the Lord and the king's house and all the houses of Jerusalem, even every great house, burned with fire:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 52 Verse 14
text: And the walls round Jerusalem were broken down by the Chaldaean army which was with the captain.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 52 Verse 15
text: Then Nebuzaradan, the captain of the armed men, took away as prisoners the rest of the people who were still in the town, and those who had given themselves up to the king of Babylon, and the rest of the workmen.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 52 Verse 16
text: But Nebuzaradan, the captain of the armed men, let the poorest of the land go on living there, to take care of the vines and the fields.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 52 Verse 17
text: And the brass pillars which were in the house of the Lord, and the wheeled bases and the great brass water-vessel in the house of the Lord, were broken up by the Chaldaeans, who took all the brass away to Babylon.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 52 Verse 18
text: And the pots and the spades and the scissors for the lights and the spoons, and all the brass vessels used in the Lord's house, they took away.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 52 Verse 19
text: And the cups and the fire-trays and the basins and the pots and the supports for the lights and the spoons and the wide basins; the gold of the gold vessels, and the silver of the silver vessels, the captain of the armed men took away.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 52 Verse 20
text: The two pillars, the great water-vessel, and the twelve brass oxen which were under it, and the ten wheeled bases, which King Solomon had made for the house of the Lord: the brass of all these vessels was without weight.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 52 Verse 21
text: And as for the pillars, one pillar was eighteen cubits high, and twelve cubits measured all round, and it was as thick as a man's hand: it was hollow.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 52 Verse 22
text: And there was a crown of brass on it: the crown was five cubits high, circled with a network and apples all of brass; and the second pillar had the same.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 52 Verse 23
text: There were ninety-six apples on the outside; the number of apples all round the network was a hundred.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 52 Verse 24
text: And the captain of the armed men took Seraiah, the chief priest, and Zephaniah, the second priest, and the three door-keepers;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 52 Verse 25
text: And from the town he took the unsexed servant who was over the men of war, and seven of the king's near friends who were in the town, and the scribe of the captain of the army, who was responsible for getting the people of the land together in military order, and sixty men of the people of the land who were in the town.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 52 Verse 26
text: These Nebuzaradan, the captain of the armed men, took with him to the king of Babylon at Riblah.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 52 Verse 27
text: And the king of Babylon put them to death at Riblah in the land of Hamath. So Judah was taken prisoner away from his land.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 52 Verse 28
text: These are the people whom Nebuchadrezzar took away prisoner: in the seventh year, three thousand and twenty-three Jews:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 52 Verse 29
text: And in the eighteenth year of Nebuchadrezzar he took away as prisoners from Jerusalem eight hundred and thirty-two persons:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 52 Verse 30
text: In the twenty-third year of Nebuchadrezzar, Nebuzaradan, the captain of the armed men, took away as prisoners seven hundred and forty-five of the Jews: all the persons were four thousand and six hundred.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 52 Verse 31
text: And in the thirty-seventh year after Jehoiachin, king of Judah, had been taken prisoner, in the twelfth month, on the twenty-fifth day of the month, Evil-merodach, king of Babylon, in the first year after he became king, took Jehoiachin, king of Judah, out of prison.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 52 Verse 32
text: And he said kind words to him and put his seat higher than the seats of the other kings who were with him in Babylon.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 52 Verse 33
text: And his prison clothing was changed, and he was a guest at the king's table every day for the rest of his life.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 52 Verse 34
text: And for his food, the king gave him a regular amount every day till the day of his death, for the rest of his life.

title: Lamentations Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: See her seated by herself, the town which was full of people! She who was great among the nations has become like a widow! She who was a princess among the countries has come under the yoke of forced work!

title: Lamentations Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: She is sorrowing bitterly in the night, and her face is wet with weeping; among all her lovers she has no comforter: all her friends have been false to her, they have become her haters.

title: Lamentations Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: Judah has been taken away as a prisoner because of trouble and hard work; her living-place is among the nations, there is no rest for her: all her attackers have overtaken her in a narrow place.

title: Lamentations Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: The ways of Zion are sad, because no one comes to the holy meeting; all her doorways are made waste, her priests are breathing out sorrow: her virgins are troubled, and it is bitter for her.

title: Lamentations Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: Those who are against her have become the head, everything goes well for her haters; for the Lord has sent sorrow on her because of the great number of her sins: her young children have gone away as prisoners before the attacker.

title: Lamentations Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: And all her glory has gone from the daughter of Zion: her rulers have become like harts with no place for food, and they have gone in flight without strength before the attacker.

title: Lamentations Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: Jerusalem keeps in mind, in the days of her sorrow and of her wanderings, all the desired things which were hers in days gone by; when her people came into the power of her hater and she had no helper, her attackers saw their desire effected on her and made sport of her destruction.

title: Lamentations Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: Great is the sin of Jerusalem; for this cause she has become an unclean thing: all those who gave her honour are looking down on her, because they have seen her shame: now truly, breathing out grief, she is turned back.

title: Lamentations Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: In her skirts were her unclean ways; she gave no thought to her end; and her fall has been a wonder; she has no comforter: see her sorrow, O Lord; for the attacker is lifted up.

title: Lamentations Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: The hand of her hater is stretched out over all her desired things; for she has seen that the nations have come into her holy place, about whom you gave orders that they were not to come into the meeting of your people.

title: Lamentations Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: Breathing out grief all her people are looking for bread; they have given their desired things for food to give them life: see, O Lord, and take note; for she has become a thing of shame.

title: Lamentations Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: Come to me, all you who go by! Keep your eyes on me, and see if there is any pain like the pain of my wound, which the Lord has sent on me in the day of his burning wrath.

title: Lamentations Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: From on high he has sent fire into my bones, and it has overcome them: his net is stretched out for my feet, I am turned back by him; he has made me waste and feeble all the day.

title: Lamentations Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: A watch is kept on my sins; they are joined together by his hand, they have come on to my neck; he has made my strength give way: the Lord has given me up into the hands of those against whom I have no power.

title: Lamentations Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: The Lord has made sport of all my men of war in me, he has got men together against me to send destruction on my young men: the virgin daughter of Judah has been crushed like grapes under the feet of the Lord.

title: Lamentations Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: For these things I am weeping; my eye is streaming with water; because the comforter who might give me new life is far from me: my children are made waste, because the hater is strong.

title: Lamentations Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: Zion's hands are outstretched; she has no comforter; the Lord has given orders to the attackers of Jacob round about him: Jerusalem has become like an unclean thing among them.

title: Lamentations Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: The Lord is upright; for I have gone against his orders: give ear, now, all you peoples, and see my pain, my virgins and my young men have gone away as prisoners.

title: Lamentations Chapter 1 Verse 19
text: I sent for my lovers, but they were false to me: my priests and my responsible men were breathing their last breath in the town, while they were looking for food to give them new life.

title: Lamentations Chapter 1 Verse 20
text: See, O Lord, for I am in trouble; the inmost parts of my body are deeply moved; my heart is turned in me; for I have been uncontrolled: outside the children are put to the sword, and in the house there is death.

title: Lamentations Chapter 1 Verse 21
text: Give ear to the voice of my grief; I have no comforter; all my haters have news of my troubles, they are glad because you have done it: let the day of fate come when they will be like me.

title: Lamentations Chapter 1 Verse 22
text: Let all their evil-doing come before you; do to them as you have done to me for all my sins: for loud is the sound of my grief, and the strength of my heart is gone.

title: Lamentations Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: How has the daughter of Zion been covered with a cloud by the Lord in his wrath! he has sent down from heaven to earth the glory of Israel, and has not kept in memory the resting-place of his feet in the day of his wrath.

title: Lamentations Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: The Lord has given up to destruction all the living-places of Jacob without pity; pulling down in his wrath the strong places of the daughter of Judah, stretching out on the earth the wounded, even her king and her rulers.

title: Lamentations Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: In his burning wrath every horn of Israel has been cut off; his right hand has been turned back before the attacker: he has put a fire in Jacob, causing destruction round about.

title: Lamentations Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: His bow has been bent for the attack, he has taken his place with his hand ready, in his hate he has put to death all who were pleasing to the eye: on the tent of the daughter of Zion he has let loose his passion like fire.

title: Lamentations Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: The Lord has become like one fighting against her, sending destruction on Israel; he has sent destruction on all her great houses, making waste his strong places: increasing the grief and the sorrow of the daughter of Judah.

title: Lamentations Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: And he has violently taken away his tent, as from a garden; he has made waste his meeting-place: the Lord has taken away the memory of feast and Sabbath in Zion, and in the passion of his wrath he is against king and priest.

title: Lamentations Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: The Lord has given up his altar and has been turned in hate from his holy place; he has given up into the hands of the attacker the walls of her great houses: their voices have been loud in the house of the Lord as in the day of a holy meeting.

title: Lamentations Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: It is the Lord's purpose to make waste the wall of the daughter of Zion; his line has been stretched out, he has not kept back his hand from destruction: he has sent sorrow on tower and wall, they have become feeble together.

title: Lamentations Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: Her doors have gone down into the earth; he has sent destruction on her locks: her king and her princes are among the nations where the law is not; even her prophets have had no vision from the Lord.

title: Lamentations Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: The responsible men of the daughter of Zion are seated on the earth without a word; they have put dust on their heads, they are clothed in haircloth: the heads of the virgins of Jerusalem are bent down to the earth.

title: Lamentations Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: My eyes are wasted with weeping, the inmost parts of my body are deeply moved, my inner parts are drained out on the earth, for the destruction of the daughter of my people; because of the young children and babies at the breast who are falling without strength in the open squares of the town.

title: Lamentations Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: They say to their mothers, Where is grain and wine? when they are falling like the wounded in the open squares of the town, when their life is drained out on their mother's breast.

title: Lamentations Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: What example am I to give you? what comparison am I to make for you, O daughter of Jerusalem? what am I to make equal to you, so that I may give you comfort, O virgin daughter of Zion? for your destruction is great like the sea: who is able to make you well?

title: Lamentations Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: The visions which your prophets have seen for you are false and foolish; they have not made clear to you your sin so that your fate might be changed: but they have seen for you false words, driving you away.

title: Lamentations Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: All who go by make a noise with their hands at you; they make hisses, shaking their heads at the daughter of Jerusalem, and saying, Is this the town which was the crown of everything beautiful, the joy of all the earth?

title: Lamentations Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: All your haters are opening their mouths wide against you; making hisses and whistling through their teeth, they say, We have made a meal of her: certainly this is the day we have been looking for; it has come, we have seen it.

title: Lamentations Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: The Lord has done that which was his purpose; he has put into force the orders which he gave in the days which are past; pulling down without pity, he has made your hater glad over you, lifting up the horn of those who were against you.

title: Lamentations Chapter 2 Verse 18
text: Let your cry go up to the Lord: O wall of the daughter of Zion, let your weeping be flowing down like a stream day and night; give yourself no rest, let not your eyes keep back the drops of sorrow.

title: Lamentations Chapter 2 Verse 19
text: Up! give cries in the night, at the starting of the night-watches; let your heart be flowing out like water before the face of the Lord, lifting up your hands to him for the life of your young children who are falling down, feeble for need of food, at the top of every street.

title: Lamentations Chapter 2 Verse 20
text: Look! O Lord, see to whom you have done this! Are the women to take as their food the fruit of their bodies, the children who are folded in their arms? are the priest and the prophet to be put to death in the holy place of the Lord?

title: Lamentations Chapter 2 Verse 21
text: The young men and the old are stretched on the earth in the streets; my virgins and my young men have been put to the sword: you have sent death on them in the day of your wrath, causing death without pity.

title: Lamentations Chapter 2 Verse 22
text: As in the day of a holy meeting you have made fears come round me on every side, and no one got away or was kept safe in the day of the Lord's wrath: those who were folded in my arms, whom I took care of, have been sent to their destruction by my hater.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: I am the man who has seen trouble by the rod of his wrath.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: By him I have been made to go in the dark where there is no light.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: Truly against me his hand has been turned again and again all the day.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: My flesh and my skin have been used up by him and my bones broken.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: He has put up a wall against me, shutting me in with bitter sorrow.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: He has kept me in dark places, like those who have been long dead.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: He has put a wall round me, so that I am not able to go out; he has made great the weight of my chain.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: Even when I send up a cry for help, he keeps my prayer shut out.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: He has put up a wall of cut stones about my ways, he has made my roads twisted.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: He is like a bear waiting for me, like a lion in secret places.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: By him my ways have been turned on one side and I have been pulled in bits; he has made me waste.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: With his bow bent, he has made me the mark for his arrows.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: He has let loose his arrows into the inmost parts of my body.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: I have become the sport of all the peoples; I am their song all the day.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: He has made my life nothing but pain, he has given me the bitter root in full measure.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: By him my teeth have been broken with crushed stones, and I am bent low in the dust.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: My soul is sent far away from peace, I have no more memory of good.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 18
text: And I said, My strength is cut off, and my hope from the Lord.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 19
text: Keep in mind my trouble and my wandering, the bitter root and the poison.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 20
text: My soul still keeps the memory of them; and is bent down in me.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 21
text: This I keep in mind, and because of this I have hope.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 22
text: It is through the Lord's love that we have not come to destruction, because his mercies have no limit.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 23
text: They are new every morning; great is your good faith.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 24
text: I said to myself, The Lord is my heritage; and because of this I will have hope in him.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 25
text: The Lord is good to those who are waiting for him, to the soul which is looking for him.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 26
text: It is good to go on hoping and quietly waiting for the salvation of the Lord.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 27
text: It is good for a man to undergo the yoke when he is young.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 28
text: Let him be seated by himself, saying nothing, because he has put it on him.
