title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 29
text: Let him put his mouth in the dust, if by chance there may be hope.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 30
text: Let his face be turned to him who gives him blows; let him be full of shame.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 31
text: For the Lord does not give a man up for ever.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 32
text: For though he sends grief, still he will have pity in the full measure of his love.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 33
text: For he has no pleasure in troubling and causing grief to the children of men.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 34
text: In a man's crushing under his feet all the prisoners of the earth,

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 35
text: In his turning away the right of a man before the face of the Most High.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 36
text: In his doing wrong to a man in his cause, the Lord has no pleasure.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 37
text: Who is able to say a thing, and give effect to it, if it has not been ordered by the Lord?

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 38
text: Do not evil and good come from the mouth of the Most High?

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 39
text: What protest may a living man make, even a man about the punishment of his sin?

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 40
text: Let us make search and put our ways to the test, turning again to the Lord;

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 41
text: Lifting up our hearts with our hands to God in the heavens.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 42
text: We have done wrong and gone against your law; we have not had your forgiveness.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 43
text: Covering yourself with wrath you have gone after us, cutting us off without pity;

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 44
text: Covering yourself with a cloud, so that prayer may not get through.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 45
text: You have made us like waste and that for which there is no use, among the peoples.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 46
text: The mouths of all our haters are open wide against us.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 47
text: Fear and deep waters have come on us, wasting and destruction.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 48
text: Rivers of water are running down from my eyes, for the destruction of the daughter of my people.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 49
text: My eyes are streaming without stopping, they have no rest,

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 50
text: Till the Lord's eye is turned on me, till he sees my trouble from heaven.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 51
text: The Lord is unkind to my soul, more than all the daughters of my town.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 52
text: They who are against me without cause have gone hard after me as if I was a bird;

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 53
text: They have put an end to my life in the prison, stoning me with stones.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 54
text: Waters were flowing over my head; I said, I am cut off.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 55
text: I was making prayer to your name, O Lord, out of the lowest prison.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 56
text: My voice came to you; let not your ear be shut to my breathing, to my cry.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 57
text: You came near in the day when I made my prayer to you: you said, Have no fear.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 58
text: O Lord, you have taken up the cause of my soul, you have made my life safe.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 59
text: O Lord, you have seen my wrong; be judge in my cause.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 60
text: You have seen all the evil rewards they have sent on me, and all their designs against me.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 61
text: Their bitter words have come to your ears, O Lord, and all their designs against me;

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 62
text: The lips of those who came up against me, and their thoughts against me all the day.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 63
text: Take note of them when they are seated, and when they get up; I am their song.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 64
text: You will give them their reward, O Lord, answering to the work of their hands.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 65
text: You will let their hearts be covered over with your curse on them.

title: Lamentations Chapter 3 Verse 66
text: You will go after them in wrath, and put an end to them from under the heavens of the Lord.

title: Lamentations Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: How dark has the gold become! how changed the best gold! the stones of the holy place are dropping out at the top of every street.

title: Lamentations Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: The valued sons of Zion, whose price was the best gold, are looked on as vessels of earth, the work of the hands of the potter!

title: Lamentations Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: Even the beasts of the waste land have full breasts, they give milk to their young ones: the daughter of my people has become cruel like the ostriches in the waste land.

title: Lamentations Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: The tongue of the child at the breast is fixed to the roof of his mouth for need of drink: the young children are crying out for bread, and no man gives it to them.

title: Lamentations Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: Those who were used to feasting on delicate food are wasted in the streets: those who as children were dressed in purple are stretched out on the dust.

title: Lamentations Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: For the punishment of the daughter of my people is greater than the punishment of Sodom, which was overturned suddenly without any hand falling on her.

title: Lamentations Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: Her holy ones were cleaner than snow, they were whiter than milk, their bodies were redder than corals, their form was as the sapphire:

title: Lamentations Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: Their face is blacker than night; in the streets no one has knowledge of them: their skin is hanging on their bones, they are dry, they have become like wood.

title: Lamentations Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: Those who have been put to the sword are better off than those whose death is caused by need of food; for these come to death slowly, burned up like the fruit of the field.

title: Lamentations Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: The hands of kind-hearted women have been boiling their children; they were their food in the destruction of the daughter of my people.

title: Lamentations Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: The Lord has given full effect to his passion, he has let loose his burning wrath; he has made a fire in Zion, causing the destruction of its bases.

title: Lamentations Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: To the kings of the earth and to all the people of the world it did not seem possible that the attackers and the haters would go into the doors of Jerusalem.

title: Lamentations Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: It is because of the sins of her prophets and the evil-doing of her priests, by whom the blood of the upright has been drained out in her.

title: Lamentations Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: They are wandering like blind men in the streets, they are made unclean with blood, so that their robes may not be touched by men.

title: Lamentations Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: Away! unclean! they were crying out to them, Away! away! let there be no touching: when they went away in flight and wandering, men said among the nations, There is no further resting-place for them.

title: Lamentations Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: The face of the Lord has sent them in all directions; he will no longer take care of them: they had no respect for the priests, they gave no honour to the old men.

title: Lamentations Chapter 4 Verse 17
text: Our eyes are still wasting away in looking for our false help: we have been watching for a nation unable to give salvation.

title: Lamentations Chapter 4 Verse 18
text: They go after our steps so that we may not go in our streets: our end is near, our days are numbered; for our end has come.

title: Lamentations Chapter 4 Verse 19
text: Those who went after us were quicker than the eagles of the heaven, driving us before them on the mountains, waiting secretly for us in the waste land.

title: Lamentations Chapter 4 Verse 20
text: Our breath of life, he on whom the holy oil was put, was taken in their holes; of whom we said, Under his shade we will be living among the nations.

title: Lamentations Chapter 4 Verse 21
text: Have joy and be glad, O daughter of Edom, living in the land of Uz: the cup will be given to you in your turn, and you will be overcome with wine and your shame will be seen.

title: Lamentations Chapter 4 Verse 22
text: The punishment of your evil-doing is complete, O daughter of Zion; never again will he take you away as a prisoner: he will give you the reward of your evil-doing, O daughter of Edom; he will let your sin be uncovered.

title: Lamentations Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: Keep in mind, O Lord, what has come to us: take note and see our shame.

title: Lamentations Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: Our heritage is given up to men of strange lands, our houses to those who are not our countrymen.

title: Lamentations Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: We are children without fathers, our mothers are like widows.

title: Lamentations Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: We give money for a drink of water, we get our wood for a price.

title: Lamentations Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: Our attackers are on our necks: overcome with weariness, we have no rest.

title: Lamentations Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: We have given our hands to the Egyptians and to the Assyrians so that we might have enough bread.

title: Lamentations Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: Our fathers were sinners and are dead; and the weight of their evil-doing is on us.

title: Lamentations Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: Servants are ruling over us, and there is no one to make us free from their hands.

title: Lamentations Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: We put our lives in danger to get our bread, because of the sword of the waste land.

title: Lamentations Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: Our skin is heated like an oven because of our burning heat from need of food.

title: Lamentations Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: They took by force the women in Zion, the virgins in the towns of Judah.

title: Lamentations Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: Their hands put princes to death by hanging: the faces of old men were not honoured.

title: Lamentations Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: The young men were crushing the grain, and the boys were falling under the wood.

title: Lamentations Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: The old men are no longer seated in the doorway, and the music of the young men has come to an end.

title: Lamentations Chapter 5 Verse 15
text: The joy of our hearts is ended; our dancing is changed into sorrow.

title: Lamentations Chapter 5 Verse 16
text: The crown has been taken from our head: sorrow is ours, for we are sinners.

title: Lamentations Chapter 5 Verse 17
text: Because of this our hearts are feeble; for these things our eyes are dark;

title: Lamentations Chapter 5 Verse 18
text: Because of the mountain of Zion which is a waste; jackals go over it.

title: Lamentations Chapter 5 Verse 19
text: You, O Lord, are seated as King for ever; the seat of your power is eternal.

title: Lamentations Chapter 5 Verse 20
text: Why have we gone from your memory for ever? why have you been turned away from us for so long?

title: Lamentations Chapter 5 Verse 21
text: Make us come back to you, O Lord, and let us be turned; make our days new again as in the past.

title: Lamentations Chapter 5 Verse 22
text: But you have quite given us up; you are full of wrath against us.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: Now it came about in the thirtieth year, in the fourth month, on the fifth day of the month, while I was by the river Chebar among those who had been made prisoners, that the heavens were made open and I saw visions of God.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: On the fifth day of the month, in the fifth year after King Jehoiachin had been made a prisoner,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: The word of the Lord came to me, Ezekiel the priest, the son of Buzi, in the land of the Chaldaeans by the river Chebar; and the hand of the Lord was on me there.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: And, looking, I saw a storm-wind coming out of the north, a great cloud with flames of fire coming after one another, and a bright light shining round about it and in the heart of it was something coloured like electrum.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: And in the heart of it were the forms of four living beings. And this was what they were like; they had the form of a man.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: And every one had four faces, and every one of them had four wings.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: And their feet were straight feet; and the under sides of their feet were like the feet of oxen; and they were shining like polished brass.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: And they had the hands of a man under their wings; the four of them had faces on their four sides.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: They went without turning, every one went straight forward.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: As for the form of their faces, they had the face of a man, and the four of them had the face of a lion on the right side, and the four of them had the face of an ox on the left side, and the four of them had the face of an eagle.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: And their wings were separate at the top; two of the wings of every one were joined one to another, and two were covering their bodies.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: Every one of them went straight forward; wherever the spirit was to go they went; they went on without turning.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: And between the living beings it was like burning coals of fire, as if flames were going one after the other between the living beings; and the fire was bright, and out of the fire went thunder-flames.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: And the living beings went out and came back as quickly as a thunder-flame.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: Now while I was looking at the four living beings, I saw one wheel on the earth, by the side of the living beings, for the four of them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: The form of the wheels and their work was like a beryl; the four of them had the same form and design, and they were like a wheel inside a wheel.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: The four of them went straight forward without turning to one side.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: And I saw that they had edges, and their edges, even of the four, were full of eyes round about.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 1 Verse 19
text: And when the living beings went on, the wheels went by their side; and when the living beings were lifted up from the earth, the wheels were lifted up.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 1 Verse 20
text: Wherever the spirit was to go they went; and the wheels were lifted up by their side: for the spirit of the living beings was in the wheels.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 1 Verse 21
text: When these went on, the others went; and when these came to rest, the others came to rest; and when these were lifted up from the earth, the wheels were lifted up by their side: for the spirit of the living beings was in the wheels.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 1 Verse 22
text: And over the heads of the living beings there was the form of an arch, looking like ice, stretched out over their heads on high.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 1 Verse 23
text: Under the arch their wings were straight, one stretched out to another: every one had two wings covering their bodies on this side and two covering their bodies on that side.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 1 Verse 24
text: And when they went, the sound of their wings was like the sound of great waters to my ears, like the voice of the Ruler of all, a sound like the rushing of an army: when they came to rest they let down their wings.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 1 Verse 25
text: And there was a voice from the top of the arch which was over their heads: when they came to rest they let down their wings.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 1 Verse 26
text: And on the top of the arch which was over their heads was the form of a king's seat, like a sapphire stone; and on the form of the seat was the form of a man seated on it on high.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 1 Verse 27
text: And I saw it coloured like electrum, with the look of fire in it and round it, going up from what seemed to be the middle of his body; and going down from what seemed to be the middle of his body I saw what was like fire, and there was a bright light shining round him.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 1 Verse 28
text: Like the bow in the cloud on a day of rain, so was the light shining round him. And this is what the glory of the Lord was like. And when I saw it I went down on my face, and the voice of one talking came to my ears.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: And he said to me, Son of man, get up on your feet, so that I may say words to you.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: And at his words the spirit came into me and put me on my feet; and his voice came to my ears.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: And he said to me, Son of man, I am sending you to the children of Israel, to an uncontrolled nation which has gone against me: they and their fathers have been sinners against me even to this very day.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: And the children are hard and stiff-hearted; I am sending you to them: and you are to say to them, These are the words of the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: And they, if they give ear to you or if they do not give ear (for they are an uncontrolled people), will see that there has been a prophet among them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: And you, son of man, have no fear of them or of their words, even if sharp thorns are round you and you are living among scorpions: have no fear of their words and do not be overcome by their looks, for they are an uncontrolled people.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: And you are to give them my words, if they give ear to you or if they do not: for they are uncontrolled.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: But you, son of man, give ear to what I say to you, and do not be uncontrolled like that uncontrolled people: let your mouth be open and take what I give you.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: And looking, I saw a hand stretched out to me, and I saw the roll of a book in it;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: And he put it open before me, and it had writing on the front and on the back; words of grief and sorrow and trouble were recorded in it.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: And he said to me, Son of man, take this roll for your food, and go and say my words to the children of Israel.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: And, on my opening my mouth, he made me take the roll as food.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: And he said to me, Son of man, let your stomach make a meal of it and let your inside be full of this roll which I am giving you. Then I took it, and it was sweet as honey in my mouth.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: And he said to me, Son of man, go now to the children of Israel, and say my words to them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: For you are not sent to a people whose talk is strange and whose language is hard, but to the children of Israel;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: Not to a number of peoples whose talk is strange and whose language is hard and whose words are not clear to you. Truly, if I sent you to them they would give ear to you.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: But the children of Israel will not give ear to you; for they have no mind to give ear to me: for all the children of Israel have a hard brow and a stiff heart.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: See, I have made your face hard against their faces, and your brow hard against their brows.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: Like a diamond harder than rock I have made your brow: have no fear of them and do not be overcome by their looks, for they are an uncontrolled people.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: Then he said to me, Son of man, take into your heart all my words which I am about to say to you, and let your ears be open to them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: And go now to those who have been taken away as prisoners, to the children of your people, and say to them, This is what the Lord has said; if they give ear or if they do not.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: Then I was lifted up by the wind, and at my back the sound of a great rushing came to my ears when the glory of the Lord was lifted up from his place.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: And there was the sound of the wings of the living beings touching one another, and the sound of the wheels at their side, the sound of a great rushing.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: And the wind, lifting me up, took me away: and I went in the heat of my spirit, and the hand of the Lord was strong on me.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: Then I came to those who had been taken away as prisoners, who were at Telabib by the river Chebar, and I was seated among them full of wonder for seven days.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: And at the end of seven days, the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: Son of man, I have made you a watchman for the children of Israel: so give ear to the word of my mouth, and give them word from me of their danger.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 3 Verse 18
text: When I say to the evil-doer, Death will certainly be your fate; and you give him no word of it and say nothing to make clear to the evil-doer the danger of his evil way, so that he may be safe; that same evil man will come to death in his evil-doing; but I will make you responsible for his blood.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 3 Verse 19
text: But if you give the evil-doer word of his danger, and he is not turned from his sin or from his evil way, death will overtake him in his evil-doing; but your life will be safe.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 3 Verse 20
text: Again, when an upright man, turning away from his righteousness, does evil, and I put a cause of falling in his way, death will overtake him: because you have given him no word of his danger, death will overtake him in his evil-doing, and there will be no memory of the upright acts which he has done; but I will make you responsible for his blood.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 3 Verse 21
text: But if you say to the upright man that he is not to do evil, he will certainly keep his life because he took note of your word; and your life will be safe.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 3 Verse 22
text: And the hand of the Lord was on me there; and he said, Get up and go out into the valley and there I will have talk with you.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 3 Verse 23
text: Then I got up and went out into the valley; and I saw the glory of the Lord resting there as I had seen it by the river Chebar; and I went down on my face.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 3 Verse 24
text: Then the spirit came into me and put me on my feet; and he had talk with me and said to me, Go and keep yourself shut up inside your house.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 3 Verse 25
text: But see, O son of man, I will put bands on you, prisoning you in them, and you will not go out among them:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 3 Verse 26
text: And I will make your tongue fixed to the roof of your mouth, so that you have no voice and may not make protests to them: for they are an uncontrolled people.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 3 Verse 27
text: But when I have talk with you I will make your mouth open, and you are to say to them, This is what the Lord has said: Let the hearer give ear; and as for him who will not, let him keep his ears shut: for they are an uncontrolled people.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: And you, son of man, take a back and put it before you and on it make a picture of a town, even Jerusalem.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: And make an attack on it, shutting it in, building strong places against it, and making high an earthwork against it; and put up tents against it, placing engines all round it for smashing down its walls.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: And take a flat iron plate, and put it for a wall of iron between you and the town: and let your face be turned to it, and it will be shut in and you will make an attack on it. This will be a sign to the children of Israel.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: Then, stretching yourself out on your left side, take the sin of the children of Israel on yourself: for as long as you are stretched out, so long will the sin of the children of Israel be on you.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: For I have had the years of their sin measured for you by a number of days, even three hundred and ninety days: and you will take on yourself the sin of the children of Israel.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: And when these days are ended, turning on your right side, you are to take on yourself the sin of the children of Judah: forty days, a day for a year, I have had it fixed for you.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: And let your face be turned to where Jerusalem is shut in, with your arm uncovered, and be a prophet against it.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: And see, I will put bands on you; and you will be stretched out without turning from one side to the other till the days of your attack are ended.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: And take for yourself wheat and barley and different sorts of grain, and put them in one vessel and make bread for yourself from them; all the days when you are stretched on your side it will be your food.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: And you are to take your food by weight, twenty shekels a day: you are to take it at regular times.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: And you are to take water by measure, the sixth part of a hin: you are to take it at regular times.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: And let your food be barley cakes, cooking it before their eyes with the waste which comes out of a man.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: And the Lord said, Even so the children of Israel will have unclean bread for their food among the nations where I am driving them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: Then I said, Ah, Lord! see, my soul has never been unclean, and I have never taken as my food anything which has come to a natural death or has been broken by beasts, from the time when I was young even till now; no disgusting flesh has ever come into my mouth.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: Then he said to me, See, I have given you cow's waste in place of man's waste, and you will make your bread ready on it.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: And he said to me, Son of man, see, I will take away from Jerusalem her necessary bread: they will take their bread by weight and with care, measuring out their drinking-water with fear and wonder:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 4 Verse 17
text: So that they may be in need of bread and water and be wondering at one another, wasting away in their sin.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: And you, son of man, take a sharp sword, using it like a haircutter's blade, and making it go over your head and the hair of your chin: and take scales for separating the hair by weight.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: You are to have a third part burned with fire inside the town, when the days of the attack are ended; and a third part you are to take and give blows with the sword round about it; and give a third part for the wind to take away, and let loose a sword after them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: And take from them a small number of hairs, folding them in your skirts.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: And again take some of these and put them in the fire, burning them up in the fire; and say to all the children of Israel,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: This is what the Lord has said: This is Jerusalem: I have put her among the nations, and countries are round her on every side;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: And she has gone against my orders by doing evil more than the nations, and against my rules more than the countries round her: for they have given up my orders, and as for my rules, they have not gone in the way of them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: For this cause the Lord has said: Because you have been more uncontrolled than the nations round about you, and have not been guided by my rules or kept my orders, but have kept the orders of the nations round about you;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: For this cause the Lord has said: See, I, even I, am against you; and I will be judging among you before the eyes of the nations.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: And I will do in you what I have not done and will not do again, because of all your disgusting ways.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: For this cause fathers will take their sons for food among you, and sons will make a meal of their fathers; and I will be judge among you, and all the rest of you I will send away to every wind.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: For this cause, by my life, says the Lord, because you have made my holy place unclean with all your hated things and all your disgusting ways, you will become disgusting to me; my eye will have no mercy and I will have no pity.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: A third of you will come to death from disease, wasting away among you through need of food; a third will be put to the sword round about you; and a third I will send away to every wind, letting loose a sword after them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: So my wrath will be complete and my passion will come to rest on them; and they will be certain that I the Lord have given the word of decision, when my wrath against them is complete.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: And I will make you a waste and a name of shame among the nations round about you, in the eyes of everyone who goes by.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 5 Verse 15
text: And you will be a name of shame and a cause of bitter words, an example and a wonder to the nations round about you, when I give effect to my judging among you in wrath and in passion and in burning protests: I the Lord have said it:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 5 Verse 16
text: When I send on you the evil arrows of disease, causing destruction, which I will send to put an end to you; and, further, I will take away your necessary food.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 5 Verse 17
text: And I will send on you need of food and evil beasts, and they will be a cause of loss to you; and disease and violent death will go through you; and I will send the sword on you: I the Lord have said it.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: Son of man, let your face be turned to the mountains of Israel, and be a prophet to them, and say,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: You mountains of Israel, give ear to the words of the Lord: this is what the Lord has said to the mountains and the hills, to the waterways and the valleys: See, I, even I, am sending on you a sword for the destruction of your high places.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: And your altars will be made waste, and your sun-images will be broken: and I will have your dead men placed before your images.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: And I will put the dead bodies of the children of Israel in front of their images, sending your bones in all directions about your altars.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: In all your living-places the towns will become broken walls, and the high places made waste; so that your altars may be broken down and made waste, and your images broken and ended, and so that your sun-images may be cut down and your works rubbed out.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: And the dead will be falling down among you, and you will be certain that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: But still, I will keep a small band safe from the sword among the nations, when you are sent wandering among the countries.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: And those of you who are kept safe will have me in mind among the nations where they have been taken away as prisoners, how I sent punishment on their hearts which were untrue to me, and on their eyes which were turned to their false gods: and they will be full of hate for themselves because of the evil things which they have done in all their disgusting ways.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: And they will be certain that I am the Lord: not for nothing did I say that I would do this evil to them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: This is what the Lord has said: Give blows with your hand, stamping with your foot, and say, O sorrow! because of all the evil and disgusting ways of the children of Israel: for death will overtake them by the sword and through need of food and by disease.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 6 Verse 12
text: He who is far away will come to his death by disease; he who is near will be put to the sword; he who is shut up will come to his death through need of food; and I will give full effect to my passion against them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 6 Verse 13
text: And you will be certain that I am the Lord, when their dead men are stretched among their images round about their altars on every high hill, on all the tops of the mountains, and under every branching tree, and under every thick oak-tree, the places where they made sweet smells to all their images.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 6 Verse 14
text: And my hand will be stretched out against them, making the land waste and unpeopled, from the waste land to Riblah, through all their living-places: and they will be certain that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: And you, son of man, say, This is what the Lord has said to the land of Israel: An end has come, the end has come on the four quarters of the land.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: Now the end has come on you, and I will send my wrath on you, judging you for your ways, I will send punishment on you for all your disgusting acts.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: My eye will not have mercy on you, and I will have no pity: but I will send the punishment of your ways on you, and your disgusting works will be among you: and you will be certain that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: This is what the Lord has said: An evil, even one evil; see, it is coming.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: An end has come, the end has come; see, it is coming on you.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: The crowning time has come on you, O people of the land: the time has come, the day is near; the day will not be slow in coming, it will not keep back.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: Now, in a little time, I will let loose my passion on you, and give full effect to my wrath against you, judging you for your ways, and sending punishment on you for all your disgusting works.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 7 Verse 9
text: My eye will not have mercy, and I will have no pity: I will send on you the punishment of your ways, and your disgusting works will be among you; and you will see that I am the Lord who gives punishment.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 7 Verse 10
text: See, the day; see, it is coming: the crowning time has gone out; the twisted way is flowering, pride has put out buds.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 7 Verse 11
text: Violent behaviour has been lifted up into a rod of evil; it will not be slow in coming, it will not keep back.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 7 Verse 12
text: The time has come, the day is near: let not him who gives a price for goods be glad, or him who gets the price have sorrow:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 7 Verse 13
text: For the trader will not go back to the things for which he had his price, even while he is still living:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 7 Verse 14
text: And he who has given a price for goods will not get them, for my wrath is on all of them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 7 Verse 15
text: Outside is the sword, and inside disease and need of food: he who is in the open country will be put to the sword; he who is in the town will come to his end through need of food and disease.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 7 Verse 16
text: And those of them who get away safely will go and be in the secret places like the doves of the valleys, all of them will come to death, every one in his sin.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 7 Verse 17
text: All hands will be feeble and all knees without strength, like water.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 7 Verse 18
text: And they will put haircloth round them, and deep fear will be covering them; and shame will be on all faces, and the hair gone from all their heads.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 7 Verse 19
text: They will put out their silver into the streets, and their gold will be as an unclean thing; their silver and their gold will not be able to keep them safe in the day of the wrath of the Lord; they will not get their desire or have food for their need: because it has been the cause of their falling into sin.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 7 Verse 20
text: As for their beautiful ornament, they had put it on high, and had made the images of their disgusting and hated things in it: for this cause I have made it an unclean thing to them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 7 Verse 21
text: And I will give it into the hands of men from strange lands who will take it by force, and to the evil-doers of the earth to have for themselves; and they will make it unholy.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 7 Verse 22
text: And my face will be turned away from them, and they will make my secret place unholy: violent men will go into it and make it unholy.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 7 Verse 23
text: Make the chain: for the land is full of crimes of blood, and the town is full of violent acts.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 7 Verse 24
text: For this reason I will send the worst of the nations and they will take their houses for themselves: I will make the pride of their strength come to an end; and their holy places will be made unclean.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 7 Verse 25
text: Shaking fear is coming; and they will be looking for peace, and there will be no peace.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 7 Verse 26
text: Destruction will come on destruction, and one story after another; and the vision of the prophet will be shamed, and knowledge of the law will come to an end among the priests, and wisdom among the old.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 7 Verse 27
text: The king will give himself up to sorrow, and the ruler will be clothed with wonder, and the hands of the people of the land will be troubled: I will give them punishment for their ways, judging them as it is right for them to be judged; and they will be certain that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 8 Verse 1
text: Now in the sixth year, in the sixth month, on the fifth day of the month, when I was in my house and the responsible men of Judah were seated before me, the hand of the Lord came on me there.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 8 Verse 2
text: And looking, I saw a form like fire; from the middle of his body and down there was fire: and up from the middle of his body a sort of shining, like electrum.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 8 Verse 3
text: And he put out the form of a hand and took me by the hair of my head; and the wind, lifting me up between the earth and the heaven, took me in the visions of God to Jerusalem, to the way into the inner door facing to the north; where was the seat of the image of envy.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 8 Verse 4
text: And I saw the glory of the Lord there, as in the vision which I saw in the valley.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 8 Verse 5
text: Then he said to me, Son of man, now let your eyes be lifted up in the direction of the north; and on looking in the direction of the north, to the north of the doorway of the altar, I saw this image of envy by the way in.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 8 Verse 6
text: And he said to me, Son of man, do you see what they are doing? even the very disgusting things which the children of Israel are doing here, causing me to go far away from my holy place? but you will see other most disgusting things.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 8 Verse 7
text: And he took me to the door of the open place; and looking, I saw a hole in the wall.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 8 Verse 8
text: And he said to me, Son of man, make a hole in the wall: and after making a hole in the wall I saw a door.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 8 Verse 9
text: And he said to me, Go in and see the evil and disgusting things which they are doing here.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 8 Verse 10
text: So I went in and saw; and there every sort of living thing which goes flat on the earth, and unclean beasts, and all the images of the children of Israel, were pictured round about on the wall.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 8 Verse 11
text: And before them seventy of the responsible men of the children of Israel had taken their places, every man with a vessel for burning perfumes in his hand, and in the middle of them was Jaazaniah, the son of Shaphan; and a cloud of smoke went up from the burning perfume.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 8 Verse 12
text: And he said to me, Son of man, have you seen what the responsible men of the children of Israel do in the dark, every man in his room of pictured images? for they say, The Lord does not see us; the Lord has gone away from the land.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 8 Verse 13
text: Then he said to me, You will see even more disgusting things which they do.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 8 Verse 14
text: Then he took me to the door of the way into the Lord's house looking to the north; and there women were seated weeping for Tammuz.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 8 Verse 15
text: Then he said to me, Have you seen this, O son of man? you will see even more disgusting things than these.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 8 Verse 16
text: And he took me into the inner square of the Lord's house, and at the door of the Temple of the Lord, between the covered way and the altar, there were about twenty-five men with their backs turned to the Temple of the Lord and their faces turned to the east; and they were worshipping the sun, turning to the east.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 8 Verse 17
text: Then he said to me, Have you seen this, O son of man? is it a small thing to the children of Judah that they do the disgusting things which they are doing here? for they have made the land full of violent behaviour, making me angry again and again: and see, they put the branch to my nose.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 8 Verse 18
text: For this reason I will let loose my wrath: my eye will not have mercy, and I will have no pity.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 9 Verse 1
text: Then crying out in my hearing in a loud voice, he said, Let the overseers of the town come near, every man armed.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 9 Verse 2
text: And six men came from the way of the higher doorway looking to the north, every man with his axe in his hand: and one man among them was clothed in linen, with a writer's inkpot at his side. And they went in and took their places by the brass altar.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 9 Verse 3
text: And the glory of the God of Israel had gone up from the winged ones on which it was resting, to the doorstep of the house. And crying out to the man clothed in linen who had the writer's inkpot at his side,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 9 Verse 4
text: The Lord said to him, Go through the town, through the middle of Jerusalem, and put a mark on the brows of the men who are sorrowing and crying for all the disgusting things which are done in it.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 9 Verse 5
text: And to these he said in my hearing, Go through the town after him using your axes: do not let your eyes have mercy, and have no pity:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 9 Verse 6
text: Give up to destruction old men and young men and virgins, little children and women: but do not come near any man who has the mark on him: and make a start at my holy place. So they made a start with the old men who were before the house.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 9 Verse 7
text: And he said to them, Make the house unclean, make the open places full of dead: go forward and send destruction on the town.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 9 Verse 8
text: Now while they were doing so, and I was untouched, I went down on my face, and crying out, I said, Ah, Lord! will you give all the rest of Israel to destruction in letting loose your wrath on Jerusalem?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 9 Verse 9
text: Then he said to me, The sin of the children of Israel and Judah is very, very great, and the land is full of blood and the town full of evil ways: for they say, The Lord has gone away from the land, and the Lord does not see.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 9 Verse 10
text: And as for me, my eye will not have mercy, and I will have no pity, but I will send the punishment of their ways on their heads.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 9 Verse 11
text: Then the man clothed in linen, who had the inkpot at his side, came back and said, I have done what you gave me orders to do.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 10 Verse 1
text: Then looking, I saw that on the arch which was over the head of the winged ones there was seen over them what seemed like a sapphire stone, having the form of a king's seat.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 10 Verse 2
text: And he said to the man clothed in linen, Go in between the wheels, under the winged ones, and get your two hands full of burning coals from between the winged ones and send them in a shower over the town. And he went in before my eyes.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 10 Verse 3
text: Now the winged ones were stationed on the right side of the house when the man went in; and the inner square was full of the cloud.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 10 Verse 4
text: And the glory of the Lord went up from the winged ones and came to rest over the doorstep of the house; and the house was full of the cloud and the open square was full of the shining of the Lord's glory.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 10 Verse 5
text: And the sound of the wings of the winged ones was clear even in the outer square, like the voice of the Ruler of all.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 10 Verse 6
text: And when he gave orders to the man clothed in linen, saying, Take fire from between the wheels, from between the winged ones, then he went in and took his place at the side of a wheel.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 10 Verse 7
text: And stretching out his hand to the fire which was between the winged ones, he took some of it and went out.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 10 Verse 8
text: And I saw the form of a man's hands among the winged ones under their wings.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 10 Verse 9
text: And looking, I saw four wheels by the side of the winged ones, one wheel by the side of a winged one and another wheel by the side of another: and the wheels were like the colour of a beryl stone to the eye.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 10 Verse 10
text: In form the four of them were all the same, they seemed like a wheel inside a wheel.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 10 Verse 11
text: When they were moving, they went on their four sides without turning; they went after the head in the direction in which it was looking; they went without turning.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 10 Verse 12
text: And the edges of the four wheels were full of eyes round about.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 10 Verse 13
text: As for the wheels, they were named in my hearing, the circling wheels.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 10 Verse 14
text: And every one had four faces: the first face was the face of a winged one, and the second was the face of a man, and the third the face of a lion, and the fourth the face of an eagle.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 10 Verse 15
text: And the winged ones went up on high: this is the living being which I saw by the river Chebar.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 10 Verse 16
text: And when the winged ones went, the wheels went by their side: and when their wings were lifted to take them up from the earth, the wheels were not turned from their side.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 10 Verse 17
text: When they were at rest in their place, these were at rest; when they were lifted up, these went up with them: for the spirit of life was in them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 10 Verse 18
text: Then the glory of the Lord went out from the doorstep of the house, and came to rest over the winged ones.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 10 Verse 19
text: And the winged ones, lifting up their wings, went up from the earth before my eyes, with the wheels by their side: and they came to rest at the east doorway of the Lord's house; and the glory of the God of Israel was over them on high.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 10 Verse 20
text: This is the living being which I saw under the God of Israel by the river Chebar; and it was clear to me that they were the winged ones.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 10 Verse 21
text: Every one had four faces and every one had four wings; and hands like a man's hands were under their wings.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 10 Verse 22
text: As for the form of their faces, they were the faces whose form I saw by the river Chebar; when they went, every one of them went straight forward.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 11 Verse 1
text: And the wind, lifting me up, took me to the east doorway of the Lord's house, looking to the east: and at the door I saw twenty-five men; and among them I saw Jaazaniah, the son of Azzur, and Pelatiah, the son of Benaiah, rulers of the people.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 11 Verse 2
text: Then he said to me, Son of man, these are the men who are designing evil, who are teaching evil ways in this town:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 11 Verse 3
text: Who say, This is not the time for building houses: this town is the cooking-pot and we are the flesh.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 11 Verse 4
text: For this cause be a prophet against them, be a prophet, O son of man.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 11 Verse 5
text: And the spirit of the Lord came on me, and he said to me, Say, These are the words of the Lord: This is what you have said, O children of Israel; what comes into your mind is clear to me.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 11 Verse 6
text: You have made great the number of your dead in this town, you have made its streets full of dead men.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 11 Verse 7
text: For this reason the Lord has said: Your dead whom you have put down in its streets, they are the flesh, and this town is the cooking-pot: but I will make you come out from inside it.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 11 Verse 8
text: You have been fearing the sword, and I will send the sword on you, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 11 Verse 9
text: I will make you come out from inside the town and will give you up into the hands of men from other lands, and will be judge among you.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 11 Verse 10
text: You will come to your death by the sword; and I will be your judge in the land of Israel; and you will be certain that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 11 Verse 11
text: This town will not be your cooking-pot, and you will not be the flesh inside it; I will be your judge at the limit of the land of Israel;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 11 Verse 12
text: And you will be certain that I am the Lord: for you have not been guided by my rules or given effect to my orders, but you have been living by the orders of the nations round about you.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 11 Verse 13
text: Now while I was saying these things, death came to Pelatiah, the son of Benaiah. Then falling down on my face and crying out with a loud voice, I said, Ah, Lord! will you put an end to all the rest of Israel?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 11 Verse 14
text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 11 Verse 15
text: Son of man, your countrymen, your relations, and all the children of Israel, all of them, are those to whom the people of Jerusalem have said, Go far from the Lord; this land is given to us for a heritage:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 11 Verse 16
text: For this reason say, This is what the Lord has said: Though I have had them moved far off among the nations, and though I have sent them wandering among the countries, still I have been a safe place for them for a little time in the countries where they have come.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 11 Verse 17
text: Then say, This is what the Lord has said: I will get you together from the peoples, and make you come out of the countries where you have been sent in flight, and I will give you the land of Israel.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 11 Verse 18
text: And they will come there, and take away all the hated and disgusting things from it.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 11 Verse 19
text: And I will give them a new heart, and I will put a new spirit in them; and I will take the heart of stone out of their flesh and give them a heart of flesh:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 11 Verse 20
text: So that they may be guided by my rules and keep my orders and do them: and they will be to me a people, and I will be to them a God.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 11 Verse 21
text: But as for those whose heart goes after their hated and disgusting things, I will send on their heads the punishment of their ways, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 11 Verse 22
text: Then the wings of the winged ones were lifted up, and the wheels were by their side; and the glory of the God of Israel was over them on high.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 11 Verse 23
text: And the glory of the Lord went up from inside the town, and came to rest on the mountain on the east side of the town.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 11 Verse 24
text: And the wind, lifting me up, took me in the visions of God into Chaldaea, to those who had been taken away as prisoners. So the vision which I had seen went away from me.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 11 Verse 25
text: Then I gave an account to those who had been taken prisoners of all the things which the Lord had made me see.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 12 Verse 1
text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 12 Verse 2
text: Son of man, you are living among an uncontrolled people, who have eyes to see but see not, and ears for hearing but they do not give ear; for they are an uncontrolled people.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 12 Verse 3
text: And you, O son of man, by day, before their eyes, get ready the vessels of one who is taken away, and go away from your place to another place before their eyes: it may be that they will see, though they are an uncontrolled people.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 12 Verse 4
text: By day, before their eyes, take out your vessels like those of one who is taken away: and go out in the evening before their eyes, like those who are taken away as prisoners.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 12 Verse 5
text: Make a hole in the wall, before their eyes, and go out through it.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 12 Verse 6
text: And before their eyes, take your goods on your back and go out in the dark; go with your face covered: for I have made you a sign to the children of Israel.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 12 Verse 7
text: And I did as I was ordered: I took out my vessels by day, like those of one who is taken away, and in the evening I made a hole through the wall with a tent-pin; and in the dark I went out, taking my things on my back before their eyes.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 12 Verse 8
text: And in the morning the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 12 Verse 9
text: Son of man, has not Israel, the uncontrolled people, said to you, What are you doing?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 12 Verse 10
text: You are to say to them, This is what the Lord has said: This word has to do with the ruler in Jerusalem and all the children of Israel in it.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 12 Verse 11
text: Say, I am your sign: as I have done, so will it be done to them: they will go away as prisoners.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 12 Verse 12
text: And the ruler who is among them will take his goods on his back in the dark and go out: he will make a hole in the wall through which to go out: he will have his face covered so that he may not be seen.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 12 Verse 13
text: And my net will be stretched out on him, and he will be taken in my cords: and I will take him to Babylon to the land of the Chaldaeans; but he will not see it, and there death will come to him.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 12 Verse 14
text: And all his helpers round about him and all his armies I will send in flight to every wind; and I will let loose a sword after them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 12 Verse 15
text: And they will be certain that I am the Lord, when I send them in flight among the nations, driving them out through the countries.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 12 Verse 16
text: But a small number of them I will keep from the sword, from the need of food, and from disease, so that they may make clear all their disgusting ways among the nations where they come; and they will be certain that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 12 Verse 17
text: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 12 Verse 18
text: Son of man, take your food with shaking fear, and your water with trouble and care;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 12 Verse 19
text: And say to the people of the land, This is what the Lord has said about the people of Jerusalem and the land of Israel: They will take their food with care and their drink with wonder, so that all the wealth of their land may be taken from it because of the violent ways of the people living in it.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 12 Verse 20
text: And the peopled towns will be made waste, and the land will become a wonder; and you will be certain that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 12 Verse 21
text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 12 Verse 22
text: Son of man, what is this saying which you have about the land of Israel, The time is long and every vision comes to nothing?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 12 Verse 23
text: For this cause say to them, This is what the Lord has said: I have made this saying come to an end, and it will no longer be used as a common saying in Israel; but say to them, The days are near, and the effect of every vision.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 12 Verse 24
text: For there will be no more false visions or smooth use of secret arts in Israel.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 12 Verse 25
text: For I am the Lord; I will say the word and what I say I will do; it will not be put off: for in your days, O uncontrolled people, I will say the word and do it, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 12 Verse 26
text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 12 Verse 27
text: Son of man, see, the children of Israel say, The vision which he sees is for the days which are a long way off, and his words are of times still far away.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 12 Verse 28
text: Say to them then, This is what the Lord has said: Not one of my words will be put off any longer, but what I say I will do, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 13 Verse 1
text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 13 Verse 2
text: Son of man, be a prophet against the prophets of Israel, and say to those prophets whose words are the invention of their hearts, Give ear to the word of the Lord;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 13 Verse 3
text: This is what the Lord has said: A curse on the foolish prophets who go after the spirit which is in them and have seen nothing!

title: Ezekiel Chapter 13 Verse 4
text: O Israel, your prophets have been like jackals in the waste places.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 13 Verse 5
text: You have not gone up into the broken places or made up the wall for the children of Israel to take your place in the fight in the day of the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 13 Verse 6
text: They have seen visions without substance and made use of secret arts, who say, The Lord has said; and the Lord has not sent them: hoping that the word would have effect.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 13 Verse 7
text: Have you not seen a vision without substance and have you not falsely made use of secret arts, when you say, The Lord has said; though I have said nothing?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 13 Verse 8
text: So this is what the Lord has said: Because your words are without substance and your visions are false, see, I am against you, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 13 Verse 9
text: And my hand will be against the prophets who see visions without substance and who make false use of secret arts: they will not be in the secret of my people, and they will not be recorded in the list of the children of Israel, and they will not come into the land of Israel; and it will be clear to you that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 13 Verse 10
text: Because, even because they have been guiding my people into error, saying, Peace; when there is no peace; and in the building of a division wall they put whitewash on it:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 13 Verse 11
text: Say to those who put whitewash on it, There will be an overflowing shower; and you, O ice-drops, will come raining down; and it will be broken in two by the storm-wind.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 13 Verse 12
text: And when the wall has come down, will they not say to you, Where is the whitewash which you put on it?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 13 Verse 13
text: For this reason, the Lord has said: I will have it broken in two by a storm-wind in my passion; and there will be an overflowing shower in my wrath, and you, O ice-drops, will come raining angrily down.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 13 Verse 14
text: So I will let the wall, which you were covering with whitewash, be broken down; I will have it levelled to the earth so that its base is uncovered: it will come down, and destruction will come on you with it; and it will be clear to you that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 13 Verse 15
text: So I will let loose my passion on the wall in full measure, and on those who put whitewash on it; and I will say to you, Where is the wall, and where are those who put whitewash on it?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 13 Verse 16
text: Even the prophets of Israel who say words to Jerusalem, who see visions of peace for her when there is no peace, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 13 Verse 17
text: And you, son of man, let your face be turned against the daughters of your people, who are acting the part of prophets at their pleasure; be a prophet against them, and say,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 13 Verse 18
text: This is what the Lord has said: A curse is on the women who are stitching bands on all arms and putting veils on the heads of those of every size, so that they may go after souls! Will you go after the souls of my people and keep yourselves safe from death?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 13 Verse 19
text: And you have put me to shame among my people for a little barley and some bits of bread, sending death on souls for whom there is no cause of death, and keeping those souls living who have no right to life, by the false words you say to my people who give ear to what is false.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 13 Verse 20
text: For this cause the Lord has said: See, I am against your bands with which you go after souls, and I will violently take them off their arms; and I will let loose the souls, even the souls whom you go after freely.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 13 Verse 21
text: And I will have your veils violently parted in two, and will make my people free from your hands, and they will no longer be in your power for you to go after them; and you will be certain that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 13 Verse 22
text: Because with your false words you have given pain to the heart of the upright man when I had not made him sad; in order to make strong the hands of the evil-doer so that he may not be turned from his evil way and get life:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 13 Verse 23
text: For this cause you will see no more foolish visions or make false use of secret arts: and I will make my people free from your power; and you will be certain that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 14 Verse 1
text: Then certain of the responsible men of Israel came to me and took their seats before me.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 14 Verse 2
text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 14 Verse 3
text: Son of man, these men have taken their false gods into their hearts and put before their faces the sin which is the cause of their fall: am I to give ear when they come to me for directions?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 14 Verse 4
text: For this cause say to them, These are the words of the Lord: Every man of Israel who has taken his false god into his heart, and put before his face the sin which is the cause of his fall, and comes to the prophet; I the Lord will give him an answer by myself in agreement with the number of his false gods;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 14 Verse 5
text: So as to take the children of Israel in the thoughts of their hearts, because they have become strange to me through their false gods.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 14 Verse 6
text: For this cause say to the children of Israel, These are the words of the Lord: Come back and give up your false gods and let your faces be turned from your disgusting things.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 14 Verse 7
text: When any one of the men of Israel, or of those from other lands who are living in Israel, who has become strange to me, and takes his false gods into his heart, and puts before his face the sin which is the cause of his fall, comes to the prophet to get directions from me; I the Lord will give him an answer by myself:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 14 Verse 8
text: And my face will be turned against that man, and I will make him a sign and a common saying, cutting him off from among my people; and you will be certain that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 14 Verse 9
text: And if the prophet, tricked by deceit, says anything, it is I the Lord by whom he has been tricked, and I will put out my hand against him, and he will be cut off from among my people Israel.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 14 Verse 10
text: And the punishment of their sin will be on them: the sin of the prophet will be the same as the sin of him who goes to him for directions;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 14 Verse 11
text: So that the children of Israel may no longer go wandering away from me, or make themselves unclean with all their wrongdoing; but they will be my people, and I will be their God, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 14 Verse 12
text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 14 Verse 13
text: Son of man, when a land, sinning against me, does wrong, and my hand is stretched out against it, and the support of its bread is broken, and I make it short of food, cutting off man and beast from it:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 14 Verse 14
text: Even if these three men, Noah, Daniel, and Job, were in it, only themselves would they keep safe by their righteousness, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 14 Verse 15
text: Or if I send evil beasts through the land causing destruction and making it waste, so that no man may go through because of the beasts:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 14 Verse 16
text: Even if these three men were in it, by my life, says the Lord, they would not keep safe their sons or daughters, but only themselves, and the land would be made waste.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 14 Verse 17
text: Or if I send a sword against that land, and say, Sword, go through the land, cutting off from it man and beast:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 14 Verse 18
text: Even if these three men were in it, by my life, says the Lord, they would not keep safe their sons or daughters, but only themselves.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 14 Verse 19
text: Or if I send disease into that land, letting loose my wrath on it in blood, cutting off from it man and beast:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 14 Verse 20
text: Even if Noah, Daniel, and Job were in it, by my life, says the Lord, they would not keep son or daughter safe; only themselves would they keep safe through their righteousness.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 14 Verse 21
text: For this is what the Lord has said: How much more when I send my four bitter punishments on Jerusalem, the sword and need of food and evil beasts and disease, cutting off from it man and beast?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 14 Verse 22
text: But truly, there will still be a small band who will be safe, even sons and daughters: and they will come out to you, and you will see their ways and their doings: and you will be comforted about the evil which I have sent on Jerusalem, even about everything I have sent on it.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 14 Verse 23
text: They will give you comfort when you see their ways and their doings: and you will be certain that not for nothing have I done all the things I have done in it, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 15 Verse 1
text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 15 Verse 2
text: Son of man, what is the vine-tree more than any branching tree which is among the trees of the woods?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 15 Verse 3
text: Will its wood be used for any work? do men make of it a pin for hanging any vessel on?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 15 Verse 4
text: See, it is put into the fire for burning: the fire has made a meal of its two ends and the middle part of it is burned; is it good for any work?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 15 Verse 5
text: Truly, before it was cut down, it was not used for any purpose: how much less, when the fire has made a meal of it and it is burned, will it be made into anything?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 15 Verse 6
text: For this cause the Lord has said: Like the vine-tree among the trees of the woods which I have given to the fire for burning, so will I give the people of Jerusalem.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 15 Verse 7
text: And my face will be turned against them; and though they have come out of the fire they will be burned up by it; and it will be clear to you that I am the Lord when my face is turned against them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 15 Verse 8
text: And I will make the land a waste because they have done evil, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 1
text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 2
text: Son of man, make clear to Jerusalem her disgusting ways,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 3
text: And say, This is what the Lord has said to Jerusalem: Your start and your birth was from the land of the Canaanite; an Amorite was your father and your mother was a Hittite.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 4
text: As for your birth, on the day of your birth your cord was not cut and you were not washed in water to make you clean; you were not salted or folded in linen bands.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 5
text: No eye had pity on you to do any of these things to you or to be kind to you; but you were put out into the open country, because your life was hated at the time of your birth.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 6
text: And when I went past you and saw you stretched out in your blood, I said to you, Though you are stretched out in your blood, have life;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 7
text: And be increased in number like the buds of the field; and you were increased and became great, and you came to the time of love: your breasts were formed and your hair was long; but you were uncovered and without clothing.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 8
text: Now when I went past you, looking at you, I saw that your time was the time of love; and I put my skirts over you, covering your unclothed body: and I gave you my oath and made an agreement with you, says the Lord, and you became mine.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 9
text: Then I had you washed with water, washing away all your blood and rubbing you with oil.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 10
text: And I had you clothed with needlework, and put leather shoes on your feet, folding fair linen about you and covering you with silk.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 11
text: And I made you fair with ornaments and put jewels on your hands and a chain on your neck.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 12
text: And I put a ring in your nose and ear-rings in your ears and a beautiful crown on your head.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 13
text: So you were made beautiful with gold and silver; and your clothing was of the best linen and silk and needlework; your food was the best meal and honey and oil: and you were very beautiful.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 14
text: You were so beautiful that the story of you went out into all nations; you were completely beautiful because of my glory which I had put on you, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 15
text: But you put your faith in the fact that you were beautiful, acting like a loose woman because you were widely talked of, and offering your cheap love to everyone who went by, whoever it might be.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 16
text: And you took your robes and made high places for yourself ornamented with every colour, acting like a loose woman on them, without shame or fear.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 17
text: And you took the fair jewels, my silver and gold which I had given to you, and made for yourself male images, acting like a loose woman with them;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 18
text: And you took your robes of needlework for their clothing, and put my oil and my perfume before them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 19
text: And my bread which I gave you, the best meal and oil and honey which I gave you for your food, you put it before them for a sweet smell, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 20
text: And you took your sons and your daughters whom I had by you, offering even these to them to be their food. Was your loose behaviour so small a thing,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 21
text: That you put my children to death and gave them up to go through the fire to them?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 22
text: And in all your disgusting and false behaviour you had no memory of your early days, when you were uncovered and without clothing, stretched out in your blood.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 23
text: And it came about, after all your evil-doing, says the Lord,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 24
text: That you made for yourself an arched room in every open place.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 25
text: You put up your high places at the top of every street, and made the grace of your form a disgusting thing, opening your feet to everyone who went by, increasing your loose ways.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 26
text: And you went with the Egyptians, your neighbours, great of flesh; increasing your loose ways, moving me to wrath.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 27
text: Now, then, my hand is stretched out against you, cutting down your fixed amount, and I have given you up to the desire of your haters, the daughters of the Philistines who are shamed by your loose ways.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 28
text: And you went with the Assyrians, because of your desire which was without measure; you were acting like a loose woman with them, and still you had not enough.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 29
text: And you went on in your loose ways, even as far as the land of Chaldaea, and still you had not enough.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 30
text: How feeble is your heart, says the Lord, seeing that you do all these things, the work of a loose and overruling woman;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 31
text: For you have made your arched room at the top of every street, and your high place in every open place; though you were not like a loose woman in getting together your payment.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 32
text: The untrue wife who takes strange lovers in place of her husband!

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 33
text: They give payment to all loose women: but you give rewards to your lovers, offering them payment so that they may come to you on every side for your cheap love.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 34
text: And in your loose behaviour you are different from other women, for no one goes after you to make love to you: and because you give payment and no payment is given to you, in this you are different from them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 35
text: For this cause, O loose woman, give ear to the voice of the Lord:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 36
text: This is what the Lord has said: Because your unclean behaviour was let loose and your body uncovered in your loose ways with your lovers and with your disgusting images, and for the blood of your children which you gave to them;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 37
text: For this cause I will get together all your lovers with whom you have taken your pleasure, and all those to whom you have given your love, with all those who were hated by you; I will even make them come together against you on every side, and I will have you uncovered before them so that they may see your shame.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 38
text: And you will be judged by me as women are judged who have been untrue to their husbands and have taken life; and I will let loose against you passion and bitter feeling.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 39
text: I will give you into their hands, and your arched room will be overturned and your high places broken down; they will take your clothing off you and take away your fair jewels: and when they have done, you will be uncovered and shamed.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 40
text: And they will get together a meeting against you, stoning you with stones and wounding you with their swords.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 41
text: And they will have you burned with fire, sending punishments on you before the eyes of great numbers of women; and I will put an end to your loose ways, and you will no longer give payment.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 42
text: And the heat of my wrath against you will have an end, and my bitter feeling will be turned away from you, and I will be quiet and will be angry no longer.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 43
text: Because you have not kept in mind the days when you were young, but have been troubling me with all these things; for this reason I will make the punishment of your ways come on your head, says the Lord, because you have done this evil thing in addition to all your disgusting acts.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 44
text: See, in every common saying about you it will be said, As the mother is, so is her daughter.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 45
text: You are the daughter of your mother whose soul is turned in disgust from her husband and her children; and you are the sister of your sisters who were turned in disgust from their husbands and their children: your mother was a Hittite and your father an Amorite.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 46
text: Your older sister is Samaria, living at your left hand, she and her daughters: and your younger sister, living at your right hand, is Sodom and her daughters.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 47
text: Still you have not gone in their ways or done the disgusting things which they have done; but, as if that was only a little thing, you have gone deeper in evil than they in all your ways.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 48
text: By my life, says the Lord, Sodom your sister never did, she or her daughters, what you and your daughters have done.
