title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 49
text: Truly, this was the sin of your sister Sodom: pride, a full measure of food, and the comforts of wealth in peace, were seen in her and her daughters, and she gave no help to the poor or to those in need.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 50
text: They were full of pride and did what was disgusting to me: and so I took them away as you have seen.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 51
text: And Samaria has not done half your sins; but you have made the number of your disgusting acts greater than theirs, making your sisters seem more upright than you by all the disgusting things which you have done.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 52
text: And you yourself will be put to shame, in that you have given the decision for your sisters; through your sins, which are more disgusting than theirs, they are more upright than you: truly, you will be shamed and made low, for you have made your sisters seem upright.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 53
text: And I will let their fate be changed, the fate of Sodom and her daughters, and the fate of Samaria and her daughters, and your fate with theirs.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 54
text: So that you will be shamed and made low because of all you have done, when I have mercy on you.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 55
text: And your sisters, Sodom and her daughters, will go back to their first condition, and Samaria and her daughters will go back to their first condition, and you and your daughters will go back to your first condition.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 56
text: Was not your sister Sodom an oath in your mouth in the day of your pride,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 57
text: Before your shame was uncovered? Now you have become like her a word of shame to the daughters of Edom and all who are round about you, the daughters of the Philistines who put shame on you round about.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 58
text: The reward of your evil designs and your disgusting ways has come on you, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 59
text: For this is what the Lord has said: I will do to you as you have done, you who, putting the oath on one side, have let the agreement be broken.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 60
text: But still I will keep in mind the agreement made with you in the days when you were young, and I will make with you an eternal agreement.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 61
text: Then at the memory of your ways you will be overcome with shame, when I take your sisters, the older and the younger, and give them to you for daughters, but not by your agreement.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 62
text: And I will make my agreement with you; and you will be certain that I am the Lord:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 16 Verse 63
text: So that, at the memory of these things, you may be at a loss, never opening your mouth because of your shame; when you have my forgiveness for all you have done, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 17 Verse 1
text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 17 Verse 2
text: Son of man, give out a dark saying, and make a comparison for the children of Israel,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 17 Verse 3
text: And say, This is what the Lord has said: A great eagle with great wings, full of long feathers of different colours, came to Lebanon, and took the top of the cedar:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 17 Verse 4
text: Biting off the highest of its young branches, he took it to the land of Canaan, and put it in a town of traders.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 17 Verse 5
text: And he took some of the seed of the land, planting it in fertile earth, placing it by great waters; he put it in like a willow-tree.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 17 Verse 6
text: And its growth went on and it became a vine, low and widely stretching, whose branches were turned to him and its roots were under him: so it became a vine, putting out branches and young leaves.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 17 Verse 7
text: And there was another eagle with great wings and thick feathers: and now this vine, pushing out its roots to him, sent out its branches in his direction from the bed where it was planted, so that he might give it water.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 17 Verse 8
text: He had it planted in a good field by great waters so that it might put out branches and have fruit and be a strong vine.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 17 Verse 9
text: Say, This is what the Lord has said: Will it do well? will he not have its roots pulled up and its branches cut off, so that all its young leaves may become dry and it may be pulled up by its roots?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 17 Verse 10
text: And if it is planted will it do well? will it not become quite dry at the touch of the east wind, drying up in the bed where it was planted?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 17 Verse 11
text: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 17 Verse 12
text: Say now to this uncontrolled people, Are these things not clear to you? Say to them, See, the king of Babylon came to Jerusalem and took its king and its rulers away with him to Babylon;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 17 Verse 13
text: And he took one of the sons of the king and made an agreement with him; and he put him under an oath, and took away the great men of the land:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 17 Verse 14
text: So that the kingdom might be made low with no power of lifting itself up, but might keep his agreement to be his servants.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 17 Verse 15
text: But he went against his authority in sending representatives to Egypt to get from them horses and a great army. Will he do well? will he be safe who does such things? if the agreement is broken will he be safe?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 17 Verse 16
text: By my life, says the Lord, truly in the place of the king who made him king, whose oath he put on one side and let his agreement with him be broken, even in Babylon he will come to his death.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 17 Verse 17
text: And Pharaoh with his strong army and great forces will be no help to him in the war, when they put up earthworks and make strong walls for the cutting off of lives:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 17 Verse 18
text: For he put his oath on one side in letting the agreement be broken; and though he had given his hand to it, he did all these things; he will not get away safe.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 17 Verse 19
text: And so the Lord has said, By my life, truly, for my oath which he put on one side, and my agreement which has been broken, I will send punishment on his head.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 17 Verse 20
text: My net will be stretched out over him, and he will be taken in my cords, and I will send him to Babylon, and there I will be his judge for the wrong which he has done against me.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 17 Verse 21
text: All his best fighting-men will be put to the sword, and the rest will be sent away to every wind: and you will be certain that I the Lord have said it.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 17 Verse 22
text: This is what the Lord has said: Further, I will take the highest top of the cedar and put it in the earth; cutting off from the highest of his young branches a soft one, I will have it planted on a high and great mountain;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 17 Verse 23
text: It will be planted on the high mountain of Israel: it will put out branches and have fruit and be a fair cedar: under it all birds of every sort will make their living-place, resting in the shade of its branches.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 17 Verse 24
text: And it will be clear to all the trees of the field that I the Lord have made low the high tree and made high the low tree, drying up the green tree and making the dry tree full of growth; I the Lord have said it and have done it.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 18 Verse 1
text: The word of the Lord came to me again, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 18 Verse 2
text: Why do you make use of this saying about the land of Israel, The fathers have been tasting bitter grapes and the children's teeth are on edge?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 18 Verse 3
text: By my life, says the Lord, you will no longer have this saying in Israel.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 18 Verse 4
text: See, all souls are mine; as the soul of the father, so the soul of the son is mine: death will be the fate of the sinner's soul.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 18 Verse 5
text: But if a man is upright, living rightly and doing righteousness,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 18 Verse 6
text: And has not taken flesh with the blood for food, or given worship to the images of the children of Israel; if he has not had connection with his neighbour's wife, or come near to a woman at the time when she is unclean;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 18 Verse 7
text: And has done no wrong to any, but has given back to the debtor what is his, and has taken no one's goods by force, and has given food to him who was in need of it, and clothing to him who was without it;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 18 Verse 8
text: And has not given his money out at interest or taken great profits, and, turning his hand from evil-doing, has kept faith between man and man,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 18 Verse 9
text: And has been guided by my rules and has kept my laws and done them: he is upright, life will certainly be his, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 18 Verse 10
text: If he has a son who is a thief, a taker of life, who does any of these things,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 18 Verse 11
text: Who has taken flesh with the blood as food, and has had connection with his neighbour's wife,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 18 Verse 12
text: Has done wrong to the poor and to him who is in need, and taken property by force, and has not given back to one in his debt what is his, and has given worship to images and has done disgusting things,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 18 Verse 13
text: And has given out his money at interest and taken great profits: he will certainly not go on living: he has done all these disgusting things: death will certainly be his fate; his blood will be on him.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 18 Verse 14
text: Now if he has a son who sees all his father's sins which he has done, and in fear does not do the same:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 18 Verse 15
text: Who has not taken the flesh with the blood for food, or given worship to the images of the children of Israel, and has not had connection with his neighbour's wife,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 18 Verse 16
text: Or done wrong to any, or taken anything from one in his debt, or taken goods by force, but has given food to him who was in need of it, and clothing to him who was without it;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 18 Verse 17
text: Who has kept his hand from evil-doing and has not taken interest or great profits, who has done my orders and been guided by my rules: he will certainly not be put to death for the evil-doing of his father; life will certainly be his.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 18 Verse 18
text: As for his father, because he was cruel, took goods by force, and did what is not good among his people, truly, death will overtake him in his evil-doing.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 18 Verse 19
text: But you say, Why does not the son undergo punishment for the evil-doing of the father? When the son has done what is ordered and right, and has kept my rules and done them, life will certainly be his.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 18 Verse 20
text: The soul which does sin will be put to death: the son will not be made responsible for the evil-doing of the father, or the father for the evil-doing of the son; the righteousness of the upright will be on himself, and the evil-doing of the evil-doer on himself.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 18 Verse 21
text: But if the evil-doer, turning away from all the sins which he has done, keeps my rules and does what is ordered and right, life will certainly be his; death will not be his fate.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 18 Verse 22
text: Not one of the sins which he has done will be kept in memory against him: in the righteousness which he has done he will have life.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 18 Verse 23
text: Have I any pleasure in the death of the evil-doer? says the Lord: am I not pleased if he is turned from his way so that he may have life?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 18 Verse 24
text: But when the upright man, turning away from his righteousness, does evil, like all the disgusting things which the evil man does, will he have life? Not one of his upright acts will be kept in memory: in the wrong which he has done and in his sin death will overtake him.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 18 Verse 25
text: But you say, The way of the Lord is not equal. Give ear, now, O children of Israel; is my way not equal? are not your ways unequal?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 18 Verse 26
text: When the upright man, turning away from his righteousness, does evil, death will overtake him; in the evil which he has done death will overtake him.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 18 Verse 27
text: Again, when the evil-doer, turning away from the evil he has done, does what is ordered and right, he will have life for his soul.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 18 Verse 28
text: Because he had fear and was turned away from all the wrong which he had done, life will certainly be his, death will not be his fate.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 18 Verse 29
text: But still the children of Israel say, The way of the Lord is not equal. O children of Israel, are my ways not equal? are not your ways unequal?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 18 Verse 30
text: For this cause I will be your judge, O children of Israel, judging every man by his ways, says the Lord. Come back and be turned from all your sins; so that they may not be the cause of your falling into evil.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 18 Verse 31
text: Put away all your evil-doing in which you have done sin; and make for yourselves a new heart and a new spirit: why are you desiring death, O children of Israel?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 18 Verse 32
text: For I have no pleasure in the death of him on whom death comes, says the Lord: be turned back then, and have life.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 19 Verse 1
text: Take up now a song of grief for the ruler of Israel, and say,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 19 Verse 2
text: What was your mother? Like a she-lion among lions, stretched out among the young lions she gave food to her little ones.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 19 Verse 3
text: And one of her little ones came to growth under her care, and became a young lion, learning to go after beasts for his food; and he took men for his meat.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 19 Verse 4
text: And the nations had news of him; he was taken in the hole they had made: and, pulling him with hooks, they took him into the land of Egypt.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 19 Verse 5
text: Now when she saw that her hope was made foolish and gone, she took another of her little ones and made him into a young lion.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 19 Verse 6
text: And he went up and down among the lions and became a young lion, learning to go after beasts for his food; and he took men for his meat.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 19 Verse 7
text: And he sent destruction on their widows and made waste their towns; and the land and everything in it became waste because of the loud sound of his voice.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 19 Verse 8
text: Then the nations came against him from the kingdoms round about: their net was stretched over him and he was taken in the hole they had made.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 19 Verse 9
text: They made him a prisoner with hooks, and took him to the king of Babylon; they put him in the strong place so that his voice might be sounding no longer on the mountains of Israel.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 19 Verse 10
text: Your mother was in comparison like a vine, planted by the waters: she was fertile and full of branches because of the great waters.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 19 Verse 11
text: And she had a strong rod for a rod of authority for the rulers, and it became tall among the clouds and it was seen lifted up among the number of its branches.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 19 Verse 12
text: But she was uprooted in burning wrath, and made low on the earth; the east wind came, drying her up, and her branches were broken off; her strong rod became dry, the fire made a meal of it.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 19 Verse 13
text: And now she is planted in the waste land, in a dry and unwatered country.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 19 Verse 14
text: And fire has gone out from her rod, causing the destruction of her branches, so that there is no strong rod in her to be the ruler's rod of authority. This is a song of grief, and it was for a song of grief.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 1
text: Now it came about in the seventh year, in the fifth month, on the tenth day of the month, that certain of the responsible men of Israel came to get directions from the Lord and were seated before me.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 2
text: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 3
text: Son of man, say to the responsible men of Israel, This is what the Lord has said: Have you come to get directions from me? By my life, says the Lord, you will get no directions from me.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 4
text: Will you be their judge, O son of man, will you be their judge? make clear to them the disgusting ways of their fathers,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 5
text: And say to them, This is what the Lord has said: In the day when I took Israel for myself, when I made an oath to the seed of the family of Jacob, and I gave them knowledge of myself in the land of Egypt, saying to them with an oath, I am the Lord your God;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 6
text: In that day I gave my oath to take them out of the land of Egypt into a land which I had been searching out for them, a land flowing with milk and honey, the glory of all lands:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 7
text: And I said to them, Let every man among you put away the disgusting things to which his eyes are turned, and do not make yourselves unclean with the images of Egypt; I am the Lord your God.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 8
text: But they would not be controlled by me, and did not give ear to me; they did not put away the disgusting things to which their eyes were turned, or give up the images of Egypt: then I said I would let loose my passion on them to give full effect to my wrath against them in the land of Egypt.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 9
text: And I was acting for the honour of my name, so that it might not be made unclean before the eyes of the nations among whom they were, and before whose eyes I gave them knowledge of myself, by taking them out of the land of Egypt.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 10
text: So I made them go out of the land of Egypt and took them into the waste land.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 11
text: And I gave them my rules and made clear to them my orders, which, if a man keeps them, will be life to him.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 12
text: And further, I gave them my Sabbaths, to be a sign between me and them, so that it might be clear that I, who make them holy, am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 13
text: But the children of Israel would not be controlled by me in the waste land: they were not guided by my rules, and they were turned away from my orders, which, if a man does them, will be life to him; and they had no respect for my Sabbaths: then I said that I would let loose my passion on them in the waste land, and put an end to them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 14
text: And I was acting for the honour of my name, so that it might not be made unclean in the eyes of the nations, before whose eyes I had taken them out.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 15
text: And further, I gave my oath to them in the waste land, that I would not take them into the land which I had given them, a land flowing with milk and honey, the glory of all lands;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 16
text: Because they were turned away from my orders, and were not guided by my rules, and had no respect for my Sabbaths: for their hearts went after their images.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 17
text: But still my eye had pity on them and I kept them from destruction and did not put an end to them completely in the waste land.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 18
text: And I said to their children in the waste land, Do not be guided by the rules of your fathers or keep their orders or make yourselves unclean with their images:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 19
text: I am the Lord your God; be guided by my rules and keep my orders and do them:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 20
text: And keep my Sabbaths holy; and they will be a sign between me and you so that it may be clear to you that I am the Lord your God.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 21
text: But the children would not be controlled by me; they were not guided by my rules, and they did not keep and do my orders, which, if a man does them, will be life to him; and they had no respect for my Sabbaths: then I said I would let loose my passion on them to give full effect to my wrath against them in the waste land.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 22
text: And I was acting for the honour of my name, so that it might not be made unclean in the eyes of the nations, before whose eyes I had taken them out.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 23
text: Further, I gave my oath to them in the waste land that I would send them wandering among the nations, driving them out among the countries;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 24
text: Because they had not done my orders, but had been turned away from my rules, and had not given respect to my Sabbaths, and their eyes were turned to the images of their fathers.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 25
text: And further, I gave them rules which were not good and orders in which there was no life for them;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 26
text: I made them unclean in the offerings they gave, causing them to make every first child go through the fire, so that I might put an end to them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 27
text: For this cause, son of man, say to the children of Israel, This is what the Lord has said: In this your fathers have further put shame on my name by doing wrong against me.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 28
text: For when I had taken them into the land which I made an oath to give to them, then they saw every high hill and every branching tree and made their offerings there, moving me to wrath by their offerings; and there the sweet smell of their offerings went up and their drink offerings were drained out.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 29
text: Then I said to them, What is this high place where you go to no purpose? And it is named Bamah to this day.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 30
text: For this cause say to the children of Israel, This is what the Lord has said: Are you making yourselves unclean as your fathers did? are you being untrue to me by going after their disgusting works?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 31
text: And when you give your offerings, causing your sons to go through the fire, you make yourselves unclean with all your images to this day; and will you come to me for directions, O children of Israel? By my life, says the Lord, you will get no direction from me.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 32
text: And that which comes into your minds will never take place; when you say, We will be like the nations, like the families of the countries, servants of wood and stone;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 33
text: By my life, says the Lord, truly, with a strong hand and with an outstretched arm and with burning wrath let loose, I will be King over you:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 34
text: And I will take you out from the peoples and get you together out of the countries where you are wandering, with a strong hand and with an outstretched arm and with burning wrath let loose:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 35
text: And I will take you into the waste land of the peoples, and there I will take up the cause with you face to face.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 36
text: As I took up the cause with your fathers in the waste land of the land of Egypt, so will I take up the cause with you says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 37
text: And I will make you go under the rod and will make you small in number:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 38
text: Clearing out from among you all those who are uncontrolled and who are sinning against me; I will take them out of the land where they are living, but they will not come into the land of Israel: and you will be certain that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 39
text: As for you, O children of Israel, the Lord has said: Let every man completely put away his images and give ear to me: and let my holy name no longer be shamed by your offerings and your images.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 40
text: For in my holy mountain, in the high mountain of Israel, says the Lord, there all the children of Israel, all of them, will be my servants in the land; there I will take pleasure in them, and there I will be worshipped with your offerings and the first-fruits of the things you give, and with all your holy things.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 41
text: I will take pleasure in you as in a sweet smell, when I take you out from the peoples and get you together from the countries where you have been sent in flight; and I will make myself holy in you before the eyes of the nations.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 42
text: And you will be certain that I am the Lord, when I take you into the land of Israel, into the country which I made an oath to give to your fathers.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 43
text: And there, at the memory of your ways and of all the things you did to make yourselves unclean, you will have bitter hate for yourselves because of all the evil things you have done.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 44
text: And you will be certain that I am the Lord, when I take you in hand for the honour of my name, and not for your evil ways or your unclean doings, O children of Israel, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 45
text: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 46
text: Son of man, let your face be turned to the south, let your words be dropped to the south, and be a prophet against the woodland of the South;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 47
text: And say to the woodland of the South, Give ear to the words of the Lord: this is what the Lord has said: See, I will have a fire lighted in you, for the destruction of every green tree in you and every dry tree: the flaming flame will not be put out, and all faces from the south to the north will be burned by it.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 48
text: And all flesh will see that I the Lord have had it lighted: it will not be put out.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 20 Verse 49
text: Then I said, Ah, Lord! they say of me, Is he not a maker of stories?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 21 Verse 1
text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 21 Verse 2
text: Son of man, let your face be turned to Jerusalem, let your words be dropped in the direction of her holy place, and be a prophet against the land of Israel;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 21 Verse 3
text: And say to the land of Israel, These are the words of the Lord: See, I am against you, and I will take my sword out of its cover, cutting off from you the upright and the evil.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 21 Verse 4
text: Because I am going to have the upright and the evil cut off from you, for this cause my sword will go out from its cover against all flesh from the south to the north:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 21 Verse 5
text: And all flesh will see that I the Lord have taken my sword out of its cover: and it will never go back.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 21 Verse 6
text: Make sounds of grief, son of man; with body bent and a bitter heart make sounds of grief before their eyes.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 21 Verse 7
text: And when they say to you, Why are you making sounds of grief? then say, Because of the news, for it is coming: and every heart will become soft, and all hands will be feeble, and every spirit will be burning low, and all knees will be turned to water: see, it is coming and it will be done, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 21 Verse 8
text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 21 Verse 9
text: Son of man, say as a prophet, These are the words of the Lord: Say, A sword, a sword which has been made sharp and polished:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 21 Verse 10
text: It has been made sharp to give death; it is polished so that it may be like a thunder-flame: ...

title: Ezekiel Chapter 21 Verse 11
text: And I have given it to the polisher so that it may be taken in the hand: he has made the sword sharp, he has had it polished, to put it into the hand of him who gives death.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 21 Verse 12
text: Give loud cries and make sounds of grief, O son of man: for it has come on my people, it has come on all the rulers of Israel: fear of the sword has come on my people: for this cause give signs of grief.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 21 Verse 14
text: So then, son of man, be a prophet, and put your hands together with a loud sound, and give two blows with the sword, and even three; it is the sword of those who are wounded, even the sword of the wounded; the great sword which goes round about them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 21 Verse 15
text: In order that hearts may become soft, and the number of those who are falling may be increased, I have sent death by the sword against all their doors: you are made like a flame, you are polished for death.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 21 Verse 16
text: Be pointed to the right, to the left, wherever your edge is ordered.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 21 Verse 17
text: And I will put my hands together with a loud sound, and I will let my wrath have rest: I the Lord have said it.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 21 Verse 18
text: And the word of the Lord came to me again, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 21 Verse 19
text: And you, son of man, have two ways marked out, so that the sword of the king of Babylon may come; let the two of them come out of one land: and let there be a pillar at the top of the road:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 21 Verse 20
text: Put a pillar at the top of the road for the sword to come to Rabbah in the land of the children of Ammon, and to Judah and to Jerusalem in the middle of her.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 21 Verse 21
text: For the king of Babylon took his place at the parting of the ways, at the top of the two roads, to make use of secret arts: shaking the arrows this way and that, he put questions to the images of his gods, he took note of the inner parts of dead beasts.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 21 Verse 22
text: At his right hand was the fate of Jerusalem, to give orders for destruction, to send up the war-cry, to put engines of war against the doors, lifting up earthworks, building walls.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 21 Verse 23
text: And this answer given by secret arts will seem false to those who have given their oaths and have let them be broken: but he will keep the memory of evil-doing so that they may be taken.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 21 Verse 24
text: For this cause the Lord has said: Because you have made your evil-doing come to mind by the uncovering of your wrongdoing, causing your sins to be seen in all your evil-doings; because you have come to mind, you will be taken in them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 21 Verse 25
text: And you, O evil one, wounded to death, O ruler of Israel, whose day has come in the time of the last punishment;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 21 Verse 26
text: This is what the Lord has said: Take away the holy head-dress, take off the crown: this will not be again: let that which is low be lifted up, and that which is high be made low.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 21 Verse 27
text: I will let it be overturned, overturned, overturned: this will not be again till he comes whose right it is; and I will give it to him.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 21 Verse 28
text: And you, son of man, say as a prophet, This is what the Lord has said about the children of Ammon and about their shame: Say, A sword, even a sword let loose, polished for death, to make it shining so that it may be like a flame:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 21 Verse 29
text: Your vision is to no purpose, your use of secret arts gives a false answer, to put it on the necks of evil-doers who are wounded to death, whose day has come, in the time of the last punishment.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 21 Verse 30
text: Go back into your cover. In the place where you were made, in the land from which you were taken, I will be your judge.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 21 Verse 31
text: And I will let loose my burning passion on you, breathing out on you the fire of my wrath: and I will give you up into the hands of men like beasts, trained to destruction.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 21 Verse 32
text: You will be food for the fire; your blood will be drained out in the land; there will be no more memory of you: for I the Lord have said it.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 22 Verse 1
text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 22 Verse 2
text: And you, son of man, will you be a judge, will you be a judge of the town of blood? then make clear to her all her disgusting ways.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 22 Verse 3
text: And you are to say, This is what the Lord has said: A town causing blood to be drained out in her streets so that her time may come, and making images in her to make her unclean!

title: Ezekiel Chapter 22 Verse 4
text: You are responsible for the blood drained out by you, and you are unclean through the images which you have made; and you have made your day come near, and the time of your judging has come; for this cause I have made you a name of shame to the nations and a cause of laughing to all countries.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 22 Verse 5
text: Those who are near and those who are far from you will make sport of you; your name is unclean, you are full of sounds of fear.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 22 Verse 6
text: See, the rulers of Israel, every one in his family, have been causing death in you.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 22 Verse 7
text: In you they have had no respect for father and mother; in you they have been cruel to the man from a strange land; in you they have done wrong to the child without a father and to the widow.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 22 Verse 8
text: You have made little of my holy things, and have made my Sabbaths unclean.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 22 Verse 9
text: In you there are men who say evil of others, causing death; in you they have taken the flesh with the blood for food; in your streets they have put evil designs into effect.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 22 Verse 10
text: In you they have let the shame of their fathers be seen; in you they have done wrong to a woman at the time when she was unclean.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 22 Verse 11
text: And in you one man has done what was disgusting with his neighbour's wife; and another has made his daughter-in-law unclean; and another has done wrong to his sister, his father's daughter.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 22 Verse 12
text: In you they have taken rewards as the price of blood; you have taken interest and great profits, and you have taken away your neighbours' goods by force, and have not kept me in mind, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 22 Verse 13
text: See, then, I have made my hands come together in wrath against your taking of goods by force and against the blood which has been flowing in you.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 22 Verse 14
text: Will your heart be high or your hands strong in the days when I take you in hand? I the Lord have said it and will do it.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 22 Verse 15
text: And I will send you in flight among the nations and wandering among the countries; and I will completely take away out of you everything which is unclean.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 22 Verse 16
text: And you will be made low before the eyes of the nations; and it will be clear to you that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 22 Verse 17
text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 22 Verse 18
text: Son of man, the children of Israel have become like the poorest sort of waste metal to me: they are all silver and brass and tin and iron and lead mixed with waste.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 22 Verse 19
text: For this cause the Lord has said: Because you have all become waste metal, see, I will get you together inside Jerusalem.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 22 Verse 20
text: As they put silver and brass and iron and lead and tin together inside the oven, heating up the fire on it to make it soft; so will I get you together in my wrath and in my passion, and, heating the fire with my breath, will make you soft.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 22 Verse 21
text: Yes, I will take you, breathing on you the fire of my wrath, and you will become soft in it.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 22 Verse 22
text: As silver becomes soft in the oven, so you will become soft in it; and you will be certain that I the Lord have let loose my passion on you.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 22 Verse 23
text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 22 Verse 24
text: Son of man, say to her, You are a land on which no rain or thunderstorm has come in the day of wrath.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 22 Verse 25
text: Her rulers in her are like a loud-voiced lion violently taking his food; they have made a meal of souls; they have taken wealth and valued property; they have made great the number of widows in her.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 22 Verse 26
text: Her priests have been acting violently against my law; they have made my holy things unclean: they have made no division between what is holy and what is common, and they have not made it clear that the unclean is different from the clean, and their eyes have been shut to my Sabbaths, and I am not honoured among them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 22 Verse 27
text: Her rulers in her are like wolves violently taking their food; putting men to death and causing the destruction of souls, so that they may get their profit.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 22 Verse 28
text: And her prophets have been using whitewash, seeing foolish visions and making false use of secret arts, saying, This is what the Lord has said, when the Lord has said nothing.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 22 Verse 29
text: The people of the land have been acting cruelly, taking men's goods by force; they have been hard on the poor and those in need, and have done wrong to the man from a strange land.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 22 Verse 30
text: And I was looking for a man among them who would make up the wall and take his station in the broken place before me for the land, so that I might not send destruction on it: but there was no one.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 22 Verse 31
text: And I let loose my passion on them, and have put an end to them in the fire of my wrath: I have made the punishment of their ways come on their heads, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 1
text: The word of the Lord came to me again, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 2
text: Son of man, there were two women, daughters of one mother:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 3
text: They were acting like loose women in Egypt; when they were young their behaviour was loose: there their breasts were crushed, even the points of their young breasts were crushed.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 4
text: Their names were Oholah, the older, and Oholibah, her sister: and they became mine, and gave birth to sons and daughters. As for their names, Samaria is Oholah, and Jerusalem, Oholibah.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 5
text: And Oholah was untrue to me when she was mine; she was full of desire for her lovers, even for the Assyrians, her neighbours,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 6
text: Who were clothed in blue, captains and rulers, all of them young men to be desired, horsemen seated on horses.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 7
text: And she gave her unclean love to them, all of them the noblest men of Assyria: and she made herself unclean with the images of all who were desired by her.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 8
text: And she has not given up her loose ways from the time when she was in Egypt; for when she was young they were her lovers, and by them her young breasts were crushed, and they let loose on her their unclean desire.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 9
text: For this cause I gave her up into the hands of her lovers, into the hands of the Assyrians on whom her desire was fixed.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 10
text: By these her shame was uncovered: they took her sons and daughters and put her to death with the sword: and she became a cause of wonder to women; for they gave her the punishment which was right.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 11
text: And her sister Oholibah saw this, but her desire was even more unmeasured, and her loose behaviour was worse than that of her sister.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 12
text: She was full of desire for the Assyrians, captains and rulers, her neighbours, clothed in blue, horsemen going on horses, all of them young men to be desired.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 13
text: And I saw that she had become unclean; the two of them went the same way.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 14
text: And her loose behaviour became worse; for she saw men pictured on a wall, pictures of the Chaldaeans painted in bright red,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 15
text: With bands round their bodies and with head-dresses hanging round their heads, all of them looking like rulers, like the Babylonians, the land of whose birth is Chaldaea.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 16
text: And when she saw them she was full of desire for them, and sent servants to them in Chaldaea.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 17
text: And the Babylonians came to her, into the bed of love, and made her unclean with their loose desire, and she became unclean with them, and her soul was turned from them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 18
text: So her loose behaviour was clearly seen and her shame uncovered: then my soul was turned from her as it had been turned from her sister.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 19
text: But still she went on the more with her loose behaviour, keeping in mind the early days when she had been a loose woman in the land of Egypt.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 20
text: And she was full of desire for her lovers, whose flesh is like the flesh of asses and whose seed is like the seed of horses.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 21
text: And she made the memory of the loose ways of her early years come back to mind, when her young breasts were crushed by the Egyptians.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 22
text: For this cause, O Oholibah, this is what the Lord has said: See, I will make your lovers come up against you, even those from whom your soul is turned away in disgust; and I will make them come up against you on every side;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 23
text: The Babylonians and all the Chaldaeans, Pekod and Shoa and Koa, and all the Assyrians with them: young men to be desired, captains and rulers all of them, and chiefs, her neighbours, all of them on horseback.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 24
text: And they will come against you from the north on horseback, with war-carriages and a great band of peoples; they will put themselves in order against you with breastplate and body-cover and metal head-dress round about you: and I will make them your judges, and they will give their decision against you as seems right to them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 25
text: And my bitter feeling will be working against you, and they will take you in hand with passion; they will take away your nose and your ears, and the rest of you will be put to the sword: they will take your sons and daughters, and the rest of you will be burned up in the fire.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 26
text: And they will take all your clothing off you and take away your ornaments.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 27
text: So I will put an end to your evil ways and your loose behaviour which came from the land of Egypt: and your eyes will never be lifted up to them again, and you will have no more memory of Egypt.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 28
text: For this is what the Lord has said: See, I will give you up into the hands of those who are hated by you, into the hands of those from whom your soul is turned away in disgust:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 29
text: And they will take you in hand with hate, and take away all the fruit of your work, and let you be unveiled and without clothing: and the shame of your loose behaviour will be uncovered, your evil designs and your loose ways.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 30
text: They will do these things to you because you have been untrue to me, and have gone after the nations, and have become unclean with their images.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 31
text: You have gone in the way of your sister; and I will give her cup into your hand.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 32
text: This is what the Lord has said: You will take a drink from your sister's cup, which is deep and wide: you will be laughed at and looked down on, more than you are able to undergo.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 33
text: You will be broken and full of sorrow, with the cup of wonder and destruction, with the cup of your sister Samaria.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 34
text: And after drinking it and draining it out, you will take the last drops of it to the end, pulling off your breasts: for I have said it, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 35
text: So this is what the Lord has said: Because you have not kept me in your memory, and because your back has been turned to me, you will even undergo the punishment of your evil designs and your loose ways.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 36
text: Then the Lord said to me: Son of man, will you be the judge of Oholibah? then make clear to her the disgusting things she has done.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 37
text: For she has been false to me, and blood is on her hands, and with her images she has been untrue; and more than this, she made her sons, whom she had by me, go through the fire to them to be burned up.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 38
text: Further, this is what she has done to me: she has made my holy place unclean and has made my Sabbaths unclean.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 39
text: For when she had made an offering of her children to her images, she came into my holy place to make it unclean; see, this is what she has done inside my house.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 40
text: And she even sent for men to come from far away, to whom a servant was sent, and they came: for whom she was washing her body and painting her eyes and making herself fair with ornaments.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 41
text: And she took her seat on a great bed, with a table put ready before it on which she put my perfume and my oil.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 42
text: ... and they put jewels on her hands and beautiful crowns on her head.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 43
text: Then I said ... now she will go on with her loose ways.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 44
text: And they went in to her, as men go to a loose woman: so they went in to Oholibah, the loose woman.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 45
text: And upright men will be her judges, judging her as false wives and women who take lives are judged; because she has been untrue to me and blood is on her hands.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 46
text: For this is what the Lord has said: I will make a great meeting of the people come together against her, and will send on her shaking fear and take everything from her.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 47
text: And the meeting, after stoning her with stones, will put an end to her with their swords; they will put her sons and daughters to death and have her house burned up with fire.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 48
text: And I will put an end to evil in all the land, teaching all women not to do as you have done.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 23 Verse 49
text: And I will send on you the punishment of your evil ways, and you will be rewarded for your sins with your images: and you will be certain that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 24 Verse 1
text: And the word of the Lord came to me in the ninth year, in the tenth month, on the tenth day of the month, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 24 Verse 2
text: Son of man, put down in writing this very day: The king of Babylon let loose the weight of his attack against Jerusalem on this very day.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 24 Verse 3
text: And make a comparison for this uncontrolled people, and say to them, This is what the Lord has said: Put on the cooking-pot, put it on the fire and put water in it:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 24 Verse 4
text: And get the bits together, the fat tail, every good part, the leg and the top part of it: make it full of the best bones.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 24 Verse 5
text: Take the best of the flock, put much wood under it: see that its bits are boiling well; let the bones be cooked inside it.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 24 Verse 6
text: For this is what the Lord has said: A curse is on the town of blood, the cooking-pot which is unclean inside, which has never been made clean! take out its bits; its fate is still to come on it.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 24 Verse 7
text: For her blood is in her; she has put it on the open rock not draining it on to the earth so that it might be covered with dust;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 24 Verse 8
text: In order that it might make wrath come up to give punishment, she has put her blood on the open rock, so that it may not be covered.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 24 Verse 9
text: For this cause the Lord has said: A curse is on the town of blood! and I will make great the burning mass.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 24 Verse 10
text: Put on much wood, heating up the fire, boiling the flesh well, and making the soup thick, and let the bones be burned.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 24 Verse 11
text: And I will put her on the coals so that she may be heated and her brass burned, so that what is unclean in her may become soft and her waste be completely taken away.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 24 Verse 12
text: I have made myself tired to no purpose: still all the waste which is in her has not come out, it has an evil smell.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 24 Verse 13
text: As for your unclean purpose: because I have been attempting to make you clean, but you have not been made clean from it, you will not be made clean till I have let loose my passion on you in full measure.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 24 Verse 14
text: I the Lord have said the word and I will do it; I will not go back or have mercy, and my purpose will not be changed; in the measure of your ways and of your evil doings you will be judged, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 24 Verse 15
text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 24 Verse 16
text: Son of man, see, I am taking away the desire of your eyes by disease: but let there be no sorrow or weeping or drops running from your eyes.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 24 Verse 17
text: Let there be no sound of sorrow; make no weeping for your dead, put on your head-dress and your shoes on your feet, let not your lips be covered, and do not take the food of those in grief.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 24 Verse 18
text: So in the morning I was teaching the people and in the evening death took my wife; and in the morning I did what I had been ordered to do.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 24 Verse 19
text: And the people said to me, Will you not make clear to us the sense of these things; is it for us you do them?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 24 Verse 20
text: Then I said to them, The word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 24 Verse 21
text: Say to the people of Israel, The Lord has said, See, I will make my holy place unclean, the pride of your strength, the pleasure of your eyes, and the desire of your soul; and your sons and daughters, who did not come with you here, will be put to the sword.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 24 Verse 22
text: And you will do as I have done, not covering your lips or taking the food of those in grief.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 24 Verse 23
text: And your head-dresses will be on your heads and your shoes on your feet: there will be no sorrow or weeping; but you will be wasting away in the punishment of your evil-doing, and you will be looking at one another in wonder.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 24 Verse 24
text: And Ezekiel will be a sign to you; everything he has done you will do: when this takes place, you will be certain that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 24 Verse 25
text: And as for you, son of man, your mouth will be shut in the day when I take from them their strength, the joy of their glory, the desire of their eyes, and that on which their hearts are fixed, and their sons and daughters.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 24 Verse 26
text: In that day, one who has got away safe will come to you to give you news of it.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 24 Verse 27
text: In that day your mouth will be open to him who has got away safe, and you will say words to him and your lips will no longer be shut: so you will be a sign to them and they will be certain that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 25 Verse 1
text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 25 Verse 2
text: Son of man, let your face be turned to the children of Ammon, and be a prophet against them:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 25 Verse 3
text: And say to the children of Ammon, Give ear to the word of the Lord; this is what the Lord has said: Because you said, Aha! against my holy place when it was made unclean, and against the land of Israel when it was made waste, and against the people of Judah when they were taken away as prisoners;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 25 Verse 4
text: For this cause I will give you up to the children of the east for their heritage, and they will put their tent-circles in you and make their houses in you; they will take your fruit for their food and your milk for their drink.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 25 Verse 5
text: And I will make Rabbah a place for housing camels, and the children of Ammon a resting-place for flocks: and you will be certain that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 25 Verse 6
text: For the Lord has said, Because you have made sounds of joy with your hands, stamping your feet, and have been glad, putting shame with all your soul on the land of Israel;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 25 Verse 7
text: For this cause my hand has been stretched out against you, and I will give up your goods to be taken by the nations; I will have you cut off from the peoples and will put an end to you among the countries: I will give you up to destruction; and you will be certain that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 25 Verse 8
text: This is what the Lord has said: Because Moab and Seir are saying, See, the people of Judah are like all the nations;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 25 Verse 9
text: For this cause, I will let the side of Moab be uncovered, and his towns on every side, the glory of the land, Beth-jeshimoth, Baal-meon and as far as Kiriathaim.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 25 Verse 10
text: To the children of the east I have given her for a heritage, as well as the children of Ammon, so that there may be no memory of her among the nations:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 25 Verse 11
text: And I will be the judge of Moab; and they will see that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 25 Verse 12
text: This is what the Lord has said: Because Edom has taken his payment from the people of Judah, and has done great wrong in taking payment from them;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 25 Verse 13
text: The Lord has said, My hand will be stretched out against Edom, cutting off from it man and beast: and I will make it waste, from Teman even as far as Dedan they will be put to the sword.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 25 Verse 14
text: I will take payment from Edom because of my people Israel; and I will take Edom in hand in my wrath and in my passion: and they will have experience of my reward, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 25 Verse 15
text: This is what the Lord has said: Because the Philistines have taken payment, with the purpose of causing shame and destruction with unending hate;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 25 Verse 16
text: The Lord has said, See, my hand will be stretched out against the Philistines, cutting off the Cherethites and sending destruction on the rest of the sea-land.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 25 Verse 17
text: And I will take great payment from them with acts of wrath; and they will be certain that I am the Lord when I send my punishment on them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 26 Verse 1
text: Now in the eleventh year, on the first day of the month, the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 26 Verse 2
text: Son of man, because Tyre has said against Jerusalem, Aha, she who was the doorway of the peoples is broken; she is turned over to them; she who was full is made waste;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 26 Verse 3
text: For this cause the Lord has said, See, I am against you, O Tyre, and will send up a number of nations against you as the sea sends up its waves.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 26 Verse 4
text: And they will give the walls of Tyre to destruction and have its towers broken: and I will take even her dust away from her, and make her an uncovered rock

title: Ezekiel Chapter 26 Verse 5
text: She will be a place for the stretching out of nets in the middle of the sea; for I have said it, says the Lord: and her goods will be given over to the nations.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 26 Verse 6
text: And her daughters in the open country will be put to the sword: and they will be certain that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 26 Verse 7
text: For this is what the Lord has said: See, I will send up from the north Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon, king of kings, against Tyre, with horses and war-carriages and with an army and great numbers of people.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 26 Verse 8
text: He will put to the sword your daughters in the open country: he will make strong walls against you and put up an earthwork against you, arming himself for war against you.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 26 Verse 9
text: He will put up his engines of war against your walls, and your towers will be broken down by his axes.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 26 Verse 10
text: Because of the number of his horses you will be covered with their dust: your walls will be shaking at the noise of the horsemen and of the wheels and of the war-carriages, when he comes through your doorways, as into a town which has been broken open.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 26 Verse 11
text: Your streets will be stamped down by the feet of his horses: he will put your people to the sword, and will send down the pillars of your strength to the earth.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 26 Verse 12
text: They will take by force all your wealth and go off with the goods with which you do trade: they will have your walls broken down and all the houses of your desire given up to destruction: they will put your stones and your wood and your dust deep in the water.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 26 Verse 13
text: I will put an end to the noise of your songs, and the sound of your instruments of music will be gone for ever.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 26 Verse 14
text: I will make you an uncovered rock: you will be a place for the stretching out of nets; there will be no building you up again: for I the Lord have said it, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 26 Verse 15
text: This is what the Lord has said to Tyre: Will not the sea-lands be shaking at the sound of your fall, when the wounded give cries of pain, when men are put to the sword in you?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 26 Verse 16
text: Then all the rulers of the sea will come down from their high seats, and put away their robes and take off their clothing of needlework: they will put on the clothing of grief, they will take their seats on the earth, shaking with fear every minute and overcome with wonder at you.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 26 Verse 17
text: And they will send up a song of grief for you, and say to you, What destruction has come on you, how are you cut off from the sea, the noted town, which was strong in the sea, she and her people, causing the fear of them to come on all the dry land!

title: Ezekiel Chapter 26 Verse 18
text: Now the sea-lands will be shaking in the day of your fall; and all the ships on the sea will be overcome with fear at your going.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 26 Verse 19
text: For this is what the Lord has said: I will make you a waste town, like the towns which are unpeopled; when I make the deep come upon you, covering you with great waters.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 26 Verse 20
text: Then I will make you go down with those who go down into the underworld, to the people of the past, causing your living-place to be in the deepest parts of the earth, in places long unpeopled, with those who go down into the deep, so that there will be no one living in you; and you will have no glory in the land of the living.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 26 Verse 21
text: I will make you a thing of fear, and you will come to an end: even if you are looked for, you will not be seen again for ever, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 1
text: The word of the Lord came to me again, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 2
text: And you, son of man, make a song of grief for Tyre;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 3
text: And say to Tyre, O you who are seated at the doorway of the sea, trading for the peoples with the great sea-lands, these are the words of the Lord: You, O Tyre, have said, I am a ship completely beautiful.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 4
text: Your builders have made your outlines in the heart of the seas, they have made you completely beautiful.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 5
text: They have made all your boards of fir-trees from Senir: they have taken cedars from Lebanon to make the supports for your sails.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 6
text: Of oak-trees from Bashan they have made your driving blades; they have made your floors of ivory and boxwood from the sea-lands of Kittim.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 7
text: The best linen with needlework from Egypt was your sail, stretched out to be a flag for you; blue and purple from the sea-lands of Elishah gave you shade.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 8
text: The people of Zidon and Arvad were your boatmen; the wise men of Zemer were in you; they were guiding your ships;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 9
text: The responsible men of Gebal and its wise men were in you, making your boards watertight: all the ships of the sea with their seamen were in you trading in your goods.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 10
text: Cush and Lud and Put were in your army, your men of war, hanging up their body-covers and head-dresses of war in you: they gave you your glory.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 11
text: The men of Arvad in your army were on your walls, and were watchmen in your towers, hanging up their arms on your walls round about; they made you completely beautiful.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 12
text: Tarshish did business with you because of the great amount of your wealth; they gave silver, iron, tin, and lead for your goods.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 13
text: Javan, Tubal, and Meshech were your traders; they gave living men and brass vessels for your goods.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 14
text: The people of Togarmah gave horses and war-horses and transport beasts for your goods.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 15
text: The men of Rodan were your traders: a great number of sea-lands did business with you: they gave you horns of ivory and ebony as an offering.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 16
text: Edom did business with you because of the great number of things which you made; they gave emeralds, purple, and needlework, and the best linen and coral and rubies for your goods.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 17
text: Judah and the land of Israel were your traders; they gave grain of Minnith and sweet cakes and honey and oil and perfume for your goods.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 18
text: Damascus did business with you because of the great amount of your wealth, with wine of Helbon and white wool.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 19
text: ... for your goods: they gave polished iron and spices for your goods.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 20
text: Dedan did trade with you in cloths for the backs of horses.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 21
text: Arabia and all the rulers of Kedar did business with you; in lambs and sheep and goats, in these they did business with you.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 22
text: The traders of Sheba and Raamah did trade with you; they gave the best of all sorts of spices and all sorts of stones of great price and gold for your goods.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 23
text: Haran and Canneh and Eden, the traders of Asshur and all the Medes:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 24
text: These were your traders in beautiful robes, in rolls of blue and needlework, and in chests of coloured cloth, corded with cords and made of cedar-wood, in them they did trade with you.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 25
text: Tarshish ships did business for you in your goods: and you were made full, and great was your glory in the heart of the seas.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 26
text: Your boatmen have taken you into great waters: you have been broken by the east wind in the heart of the seas.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 27
text: Your wealth and your goods, the things in which you do trade, your seamen and those guiding your ships, those who make your boards watertight, and those who do business with your goods, and all your men of war who are in you, with all who have come together in you, will go down into the heart of the seas in the day of your downfall.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 28
text: At the sound of the cry of your ships' guides, the boards of the ship will be shaking.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 29
text: And all the boatmen, the seamen and those who are expert at guiding a ship through the sea, will come down from their ships and take their places on the land;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 30
text: And their voices will be sounding over you, and crying bitterly they will put dust on their heads, rolling themselves in the dust:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 31
text: And they will have the hair of their heads cut off because of you, and will put haircloth on their bodies, weeping for you with bitter grief in their souls, even with bitter sorrow.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 32
text: And in their weeping they will make a song of grief for you, sorrowing over you and saying, Who is like Tyre, who has come to an end in the deep sea?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 33
text: When your goods went out over the seas, you made numbers of peoples full; the wealth of the kings of the earth was increased with your great wealth and all your goods.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 34
text: Now that you are broken by the seas in the deep waters, your goods and all your people will go down with you.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 35
text: All the people of the sea-lands are overcome with wonder at you, and their kings are full of fear, their faces are troubled.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 27 Verse 36
text: Those who do business among the peoples make sounds of surprise at you; you have become a thing of fear, you have come to an end for ever.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 28 Verse 1
text: The word of the Lord came to me again, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 28 Verse 2
text: Son of man, say to the ruler of Tyre, This is what the Lord has said: Because your heart has been lifted up, and you have said, I am a god, I am seated on the seat of God in the heart of the seas; but you are man and not God, though you have made your heart as the heart of God:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 28 Verse 3
text: See, you are wiser than Daniel; there is no secret which is deeper than your knowledge:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 28 Verse 4
text: By your wisdom and deep knowledge you have got power for yourself, and put silver and gold in your store-houses:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 28 Verse 5
text: By your great wisdom and by your trade your power is increased, and your heart is lifted up because of your power:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 28 Verse 6
text: For this cause the Lord has said: Because you have made your heart as the heart of God,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 28 Verse 7
text: See, I am sending against you strange men, feared among the nations: they will let loose their swords against your bright wisdom, they will make your glory a common thing.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 28 Verse 8
text: They will send you down to the underworld, and your death will be the death of those who are put to the sword in the heart of the seas.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 28 Verse 9
text: Will you say, in the face of those who are taking your life, I am God? but you are man and not God in the hands of those who are wounding you.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 28 Verse 10
text: Your death will be the death of those who are without circumcision, by the hands of men from strange lands: for I have said it, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 28 Verse 11
text: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 28 Verse 12
text: Son of man, make a song of grief for the king of Tyre, and say to him, This is what the Lord has said: You are all-wise and completely beautiful;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 28 Verse 13
text: You were in Eden, the garden of God; every stone of great price was your clothing, the sardius, the topaz, and the diamond, the beryl, the onyx, and the jasper, the emerald and the carbuncle: your store-houses were full of gold, and things of great price were in you; in the day when you were made they were got ready.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 28 Verse 14
text: I gave you your place with the winged one; I put you on the mountain of God; you went up and down among the stones of fire.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 28 Verse 15
text: There has been no evil in your ways from the day when you were made, till sin was seen in you.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 28 Verse 16
text: Through all your trading you have become full of violent ways, and have done evil: so I sent you out shamed from the mountain of God; the winged one put an end to you from among the stones of fire.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 28 Verse 17
text: Your heart was lifted up because you were beautiful, you made your wisdom evil through your sin: I have sent you down, even to the earth; I have made you low before kings, so that they may see you.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 28 Verse 18
text: By all your sin, even by your evil trading, you have made your holy places unclean; so I will make a fire come out from you, it will make a meal of you, and I will make you as dust on the earth before the eyes of all who see you.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 28 Verse 19
text: All who have knowledge of you among the peoples will be overcome with wonder at you: you have become a thing of fear, and you will never be seen again.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 28 Verse 20
text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 28 Verse 21
text: Son of man, let your face be turned to Zidon, and be a prophet against it, and say,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 28 Verse 22
text: These are the words of the Lord: See, I am against you, O Zidon; and I will get glory for myself in you: and they will be certain that I am the Lord, when I send my punishments on her, and I will be seen to be holy in her.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 28 Verse 23
text: And I will send on her disease and blood in her streets; and the wounded will be falling in the middle of her, and the sword will be against her on every side; and they will be certain that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 28 Verse 24
text: And there will no longer be a plant with sharp points wounding the children of Israel, or a thorn troubling them among any who are round about them, who put shame on them; and they will be certain that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 28 Verse 25
text: This is what the Lord has said: When I have got together the children of Israel from the peoples among whom they are wandering, and have been made holy among them before the eyes of the nations, then they will have rest in the land which is theirs, which I gave to my servant Jacob

title: Ezekiel Chapter 28 Verse 26
text: And they will be safe there, building houses and planting vine-gardens and living without fear; when I have sent my punishments on all those who put shame on them round about them; and they will be certain that I am the Lord their God.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 29 Verse 1
text: In the tenth year, in the tenth month, on the twelfth day of the month, the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 29 Verse 2
text: Son of man, let your face be turned against Pharaoh, king of Egypt, and be a prophet against him and against all Egypt:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 29 Verse 3
text: Say to them, These are the words of the Lord: See, I am against you, Pharaoh, king of Egypt, the great river-beast stretched out among his Nile streams, who has said, The Nile is mine, and I have made it for myself.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 29 Verse 4
text: And I will put hooks in your mouth, and the fish of your streams will be hanging from your skin; and I will make you come up out of your streams, with all the fish of your streams hanging from your skin.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 29 Verse 5
text: And I will let you be in the waste land, you and all the fish of your streams: you will go down on the face of the land; you will not be taken up or put to rest in the earth; I have given you for food to the beasts of the field and the birds of the heaven.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 29 Verse 6
text: And it will be clear to all the people of Egypt that I am the Lord, because you have been a false support to the children of Israel.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 29 Verse 7
text: When they took a grip of you in their hands, you were crushed so that their arms were broken: and when they put their weight on you for support, you were broken and all their muscles gave way.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 29 Verse 8
text: For this cause the Lord has said: See, I am sending a sword on you, cutting off from you man and beast.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 29 Verse 9
text: And the land of Egypt will be an unpeopled waste; and they will be certain that I am the Lord: because he has said, The Nile is mine, and I made it.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 29 Verse 10
text: See, then, I am against you and against your streams, and I will make the land of Egypt an unpeopled waste, from Migdol to Syene, even as far as the edge of Ethiopia.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 29 Verse 11
text: No foot of man will go through it and no foot of beast, and it will be unpeopled for forty years.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 29 Verse 12
text: I will make the land of Egypt a waste among the countries which are made waste, and her towns will be unpeopled among the towns which have been made waste, for forty years: and I will send the Egyptians in flight among the nations and wandering through the countries.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 29 Verse 13
text: For this is what the Lord has said: At the end of forty years I will get the Egyptians together from the peoples where they have gone in flight:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 29 Verse 14
text: I will let the fate of Egypt be changed, and will make them come back into the land of Pathros, into the land from which they came; and there they will be an unimportant kingdom.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 29 Verse 15
text: It will be the lowest of the kingdoms, and never again will it be lifted up over the nations: I will make them small, so that they may not have rule over the nations.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 29 Verse 16
text: And Egypt will no longer be the hope of the children of Israel, causing sin to come to mind when their eyes are turned to them: and they will be certain that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 29 Verse 17
text: Now in the twenty-seventh year, in the first month, on the first day of the month, the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 29 Verse 18
text: Son of man, Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon, made his army do hard work against Tyre, and the hair came off every head and every arm was rubbed smooth: but he and his army got no payment out of Tyre for the hard work which he had done against it.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 29 Verse 19
text: For this cause the Lord has said: See, I am giving the land of Egypt to Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon: he will take away her wealth, and take her goods by force and everything which is there; and this will be the payment for his army.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 29 Verse 20
text: I have given him the land of Egypt as the reward for his hard work, because they were working for me, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 29 Verse 21
text: In that day I will make a horn put out buds for the children of Israel, and I will let your words come freely among them, and they will be certain that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 30 Verse 1
text: The word of the Lord came to me again, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 30 Verse 2
text: Son of man, be a prophet, and say, These are the words of the Lord: Give a cry, Aha, for the day!

title: Ezekiel Chapter 30 Verse 3
text: For the day is near, the day of the Lord is near, a day of cloud; it will be the time of the nations.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 30 Verse 4
text: And a sword will come on Egypt, and cruel pain will be in Ethiopia, when they are falling by the sword in Egypt; and they will take away her wealth and her bases will be broken down.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 30 Verse 5
text: Ethiopia and Put and Lud and all the mixed people and Libya and the children of the land of the Cherethites will all be put to death with them by the sword.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 30 Verse 6
text: This is what the Lord has said: The supporters of Egypt will have a fall, and the pride of her power will come down: from Migdol to Syene they will be put to the sword in it, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 30 Verse 7
text: And she will be made waste among the countries which have been made waste, and her towns will be among the towns which are unpeopled.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 30 Verse 8
text: And they will be certain that I am the Lord, when I have put a fire in Egypt and all her helpers are broken.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 30 Verse 9
text: In that day men will go out quickly to take the news, causing fear in untroubled Ethiopia; and bitter pain will come on them as in the day of Egypt; for see, it is coming.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 30 Verse 10
text: This is what the Lord has said: I will put an end to great numbers of the people of Egypt by the hand of Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 30 Verse 11
text: He and the people with him, causing fear among the nations, will be sent for the destruction of the land; their swords will be let loose against Egypt and the land will be full of dead.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 30 Verse 12
text: And I will make the Nile streams dry, and will give the land into the hands of evil men, causing the land and everything in it to be wasted by the hands of men from a strange country: I the Lord have said it.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 30 Verse 13
