text: This is what the Lord has said: In addition to this, I will give up the images to destruction and put an end to the false gods in Noph; never again will there be a ruler in the land of Egypt: and I will put a fear in the land of Egypt.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 30 Verse 14
text: And I will make Pathros a waste, and put a fire in Zoan, and send my punishments on No.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 30 Verse 15
text: I will let loose my wrath on Sin, the strong place of Egypt, cutting off the mass of the people of No.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 30 Verse 16
text: And I will put a fire in Egypt; Syene will be twisting in pain, and No will be broken into, as by the onrush of waters.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 30 Verse 17
text: The young men of On and Pi-beseth will be put to the sword: and these towns will be taken away prisoners.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 30 Verse 18
text: And at Tehaphnehes the day will become dark, when the yoke of Egypt is broken there, and the pride of her power comes to an end: as for her, she will be covered with a cloud, and her daughters will be taken away prisoners.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 30 Verse 19
text: And I will send my punishments on Egypt: and they will be certain that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 30 Verse 20
text: Now in the eleventh year, in the first month, on the seventh day of the month, the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 30 Verse 21
text: Son of man, the arm of Pharaoh, king of Egypt, has been broken by me, and no band has been put round it to make it well, no band has been twisted round it to make it strong for gripping the sword.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 30 Verse 22
text: For this cause the Lord has said: See, I am against Pharaoh, king of Egypt, and by me his strong arm will be broken; and I will make the sword go out of his hand.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 30 Verse 23
text: And I will send the Egyptians in flight among the nations and wandering through the countries.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 30 Verse 24
text: And I will make the arms of the king of Babylon strong, and will put my sword in his hand: but Pharaoh's arms will be broken, and he will give cries of pain before him like the cries of a man wounded to death.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 30 Verse 25
text: And I will make the arms of the king of Babylon strong, and the arms of Pharaoh will be hanging down; and they will be certain that I am the Lord, when I put my sword into the hand of the king of Babylon and it is stretched out against the land of Egypt.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 30 Verse 26
text: And I will send the Egyptians in flight among the nations and wandering through the countries; and they will be certain that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 31 Verse 1
text: Now in the eleventh year, in the third month, on the first day of the month, the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 31 Verse 2
text: Son of man, say to Pharaoh, king of Egypt, and to his people; Whom are you like in your great power?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 31 Verse 3
text: See, a pine-tree with beautiful branches and thick growth, giving shade and very tall; and its top was among the clouds.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 31 Verse 4
text: It got strength from the waters and the deep made it tall: its streams went round about its planted land and it sent out its waterways to all the trees of the field.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 31 Verse 5
text: In this way it became taller than all the trees of the field; and its branches were increased and its arms became long because of the great waters.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 31 Verse 6
text: In its branches all the birds of heaven came to rest, and under its arms all the beasts of the field gave birth to their young, and great nations were living in its shade.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 31 Verse 7
text: So it was beautiful, being so tall and its branches so long, for its root was by great waters.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 31 Verse 8
text: No cedars were equal to it in the garden of God; the fir-trees were not like its branches, and plane-trees were as nothing in comparison with its arms; no tree in the garden of God was so beautiful.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 31 Verse 9
text: I made it beautiful with its mass of branches: so that all the trees in the garden of God were full of envy of it.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 31 Verse 10
text: For this cause the Lord has said: Because he is tall, and has put his top among the clouds, and his heart is full of pride because he is so high,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 31 Verse 11
text: I have given him up into the hands of a strong one of the nations; he will certainly give him the reward of his sin, driving him out.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 31 Verse 12
text: And men from strange lands, who are to be feared among the nations, after cutting him off, have let him be: on the mountains and in all the valleys his branches have come down; his arms are broken by all the waterways of the land; all the peoples of the earth have gone from his shade, and have let him be.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 31 Verse 13
text: All the birds of heaven have come to rest on his broken stem where it is stretched on the earth, and all the beasts of the field will be on his branches:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 31 Verse 14
text: In order that no trees by the waters may be lifted up in their growth, putting their tops among the clouds; and that no trees which are watered may take their place on high: for they are all given up to death, to the lowest parts of the earth among the children of men, with those who go down to the underworld.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 31 Verse 15
text: This is what the Lord has said: The day when he goes down to the underworld, I will make the deep full of grief for him; I will keep back her streams and the great waters will be stopped: I will make Lebanon dark for him, and all the trees of the field will be feeble because of him.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 31 Verse 16
text: I will send shaking on the nations at the sound of his fall, when I send him down to the underworld with those who go down into the deep: and on earth they will be comforting themselves, all the trees of Eden, the best of Lebanon, even all the watered ones.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 31 Verse 17
text: And they will go down with him to the underworld, to those who have been put to the sword; even those who were his helpers, living under his shade among the nations

title: Ezekiel Chapter 31 Verse 18
text: Whom then are you like? for you will be sent down with the trees of Eden into the lowest parts of the earth: there you will be stretched out among those without circumcision, with those who were put to the sword. This is Pharaoh and all his people, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 32 Verse 1
text: And it came about in the twelfth year, in the twelfth month, on the first day of the month, that the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 32 Verse 2
text: Son of man, make a song of grief for Pharaoh, king of Egypt, and say to him, Young lion of the nations, destruction has come on you; and you were like a sea-beast in the seas, sending out bursts of water, troubling the waters with your feet, making their streams dirty.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 32 Verse 3
text: This is what the Lord has said: My net will be stretched out over you, and I will take you up in my fishing-net.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 32 Verse 4
text: And I will let you be stretched on the land; I will send you out violently into the open field; I will let all the birds of heaven come to rest on you and will make the beasts of all the earth full of you.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 32 Verse 5
text: And I will put your flesh on the mountains, and make the valleys full of your blood.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 32 Verse 6
text: And the land will be watered with your blood, and the waterways will be full of you.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 32 Verse 7
text: And when I put out your life, the heaven will be covered and its stars made dark; I will let the sun be covered with a cloud and the moon will not give her light.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 32 Verse 8
text: All the bright lights of heaven I will make dark over you, and put dark night on your land, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 32 Verse 9
text: And the hearts of numbers of peoples will be troubled, when I send your prisoners among the nations, into a country which is strange to you.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 32 Verse 10
text: And I will make a number of peoples overcome with wonder at you, and their kings will be full of fear because of you, when my sword is waved before them: they will be shaking every minute, every man fearing for his life, in the day of your fall.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 32 Verse 11
text: For this is what the Lord has said: The sword of the king of Babylon will come on you.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 32 Verse 12
text: I will let the swords of the strong be the cause of the fall of your people; all of them men to be feared among the nations: and they will make waste the pride of Egypt, and all its people will come to destruction.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 32 Verse 13
text: And I will put an end to all her beasts which are by the great waters, and they will never again be troubled by the foot of man or by the feet of beasts.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 32 Verse 14
text: Then I will make their waters clear and their rivers will be flowing like oil, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 32 Verse 15
text: When I make Egypt an unpeopled waste, cutting off from the land all the things in it; when I send punishment on all those living in it, then it will be clear to them that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 32 Verse 16
text: It is a song of grief, and people will give voice to it, the daughters of the nations will give voice to it, even for Egypt and all her people, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 32 Verse 17
text: And in the twelfth year, on the fifteenth day of the month, the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 32 Verse 18
text: Son of man, let your voice be loud in sorrow for the people of Egypt and send them down, even you and the daughters of the nations; I will send them down into the lowest parts of the earth, with those who go down into the underworld.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 32 Verse 19
text: Are you more beautiful than any? go down, and take your rest among those without circumcision,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 32 Verse 20
text: Among those who have been put to the sword: they will give a resting-place with them to all their people.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 32 Verse 21
text: The strong among the great ones will say to him from the underworld, Are you more beautiful than any? go down, you and your helpers, and take your rest among those without circumcision, and those who have been put to the sword.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 32 Verse 22
text: There is Asshur and all her army, round about her last resting-place: all of them put to death by the sword:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 32 Verse 23
text: Whose resting-places are in the inmost parts of the underworld, who were a cause of fear in the land of the living.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 32 Verse 24
text: There is Elam and all her people, round about her last resting-place: all of them put to death by the sword, who have gone down without circumcision into the lowest parts of the earth, who were a cause of fear in the land of the living, and are put to shame with those who go down to the underworld:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 32 Verse 25
text: They have made a bed for her among the dead, and all her people are round about her resting-place: all of them without circumcision, put to death with the sword; for they were a cause of fear in the land of the living, and are put to shame with those who go down to the underworld: they have been given a place among those who have been put to the sword.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 32 Verse 26
text: There is Meshech, Tubal, and all her people, round about her last resting-place: all of them without circumcision, put to death by the sword; for they were a cause of fear in the land of the living.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 32 Verse 27
text: And they have been put to rest with the fighting men who came to their end in days long past, who went down to the underworld with their instruments of war, placing their swords under their heads, and their body-covers are over their bones; for their strength was a cause of fear in the land of the living.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 32 Verse 28
text: But you will have your bed among those without circumcision, and will be put to rest with those who have been put to death with the sword.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 32 Verse 29
text: There is Edom, her kings and all her princes, who have been given a resting-place with those who were put to the sword: they will be resting among those without circumcision, even with those who go down to the underworld.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 32 Verse 30
text: There are the chiefs of the north, all of them, and all the Zidonians, who have gone down with those who have been put to the sword: they are shamed on account of all the fear caused by their strength; they are resting there without circumcision, among those who have been put to the sword, and are put to shame with those who go down to the underworld.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 32 Verse 31
text: Pharaoh will see them and be comforted on account of all his people: even Pharaoh and all his army, put to death by the sword, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 32 Verse 32
text: For he put his fear in the land of the living: and he will be put to rest among those without circumcision, with those who have been put to death with the sword, even Pharaoh and all his people, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 33 Verse 1
text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 33 Verse 2
text: Son of man, give a word to the children of your people, and say to them, When I make the sword come on a land, if the people of the land take a man from among their number and make him their watchman:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 33 Verse 3
text: If, when he sees the sword coming on the land, by sounding the horn he gives the people news of their danger;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 33 Verse 4
text: Then anyone who, hearing the sound of the horn, does not take note of it, will himself be responsible for his death, if the sword comes and takes him away.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 33 Verse 5
text: On hearing the sound of the horn, he did not take note; his blood will be on him; for if he had taken note his life would have been safe.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 33 Verse 6
text: But if the watchman sees the sword coming, and does not give a note on the horn, and the people have no word of the danger, and the sword comes and takes any person from among them; he will be taken away in his sin, but I will make the watchman responsible for his blood.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 33 Verse 7
text: So you, son of man, I have made you a watchman for the children of Israel; and you are to give ear to the word of my mouth and give them news from me of their danger.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 33 Verse 8
text: When I say to the evil-doer, Death will certainly overtake you; and you say nothing to make clear to the evil-doer the danger of his way; death will overtake that evil man in his evil-doing, but I will make you responsible for his blood.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 33 Verse 9
text: But if you make clear to the evil-doer the danger of his way for the purpose of turning him from it, and he is not turned from his way, death will overtake him in his evil-doing, but your life will be safe.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 33 Verse 10
text: And you, son of man, say to the children of Israel, You say, Our wrongdoing and our sins are on us and we are wasting away in them; how then may we have life?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 33 Verse 11
text: Say to them, By my life, says the Lord, I have no pleasure in the death of the evil-doer; it is more pleasing to me if he is turned from his way and has life: be turned, be turned from your evil ways; why are you looking for death, O children of Israel?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 33 Verse 12
text: And you, son of man, say to the children of your people, The righteousness of the upright man will not make him safe in the day when he does wrong; and the evil-doing of the evil man will not be the cause of his fall in the day when he is turned from his evil-doing; and the upright man will not have life because of his righteousness in the day when he does evil.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 33 Verse 13
text: When I say to the upright that life will certainly be his; if he puts his faith in his righteousness and does evil, not one of his upright acts will be kept in memory; but in the evil he has done, death will overtake him.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 33 Verse 14
text: And when I say to the evil-doer, Death will certainly be your fate; if he is turned from his sin and does what is ordered and right;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 33 Verse 15
text: If the evil-doer lets one who is in his debt have back what is his, and gives back what he had taken by force, and is guided by the rules of life, doing no evil; life will certainly be his, death will not overtake him.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 33 Verse 16
text: Not one of the sins which he has done will be kept in mind against him: he has done what is ordered and right, life will certainly be his.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 33 Verse 17
text: But the children of your people say, The way of the Lord is not equal: when it is they whose way is not equal.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 33 Verse 18
text: When the upright man, turning away from his righteousness, does evil, death will overtake him in it.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 33 Verse 19
text: And when the evil man, turning away from his evil-doing, does what is ordered and right, he will get life by it.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 33 Verse 20
text: And still you say, The way of the Lord is not equal. O children of Israel, I will be your judge, giving to everyone the reward of his ways.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 33 Verse 21
text: Now in the twelfth year after we had been taken away prisoners, in the tenth month, on the fifth day of the month, one who had got away in flight from Jerusalem came to me, saying, The town has been taken.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 33 Verse 22
text: Now the hand of the Lord had been on me in the evening, before the man who had got away came to me; and he made my mouth open, ready for his coming to me in the morning; and my mouth was open and I was no longer without voice.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 33 Verse 23
text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 33 Verse 24
text: Son of man, those who are living in these waste places in the land of Israel say, Abraham was but one, and he had land for his heritage: but we are a great number; the land is given to us for our heritage.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 33 Verse 25
text: For this cause say to them, This is what the Lord has said: You take your meat with the blood, your eyes are lifted up to your images, and you are takers of life: are you to have the land for your heritage?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 33 Verse 26
text: You put your faith in your swords, you do disgusting things, everyone takes his neighbour's wife: are you to have the land for your heritage?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 33 Verse 27
text: This is what you are to say to them: The Lord has said, By my life, truly, those who are in the waste places will be put to the sword, and him who is in the open field I will give to the beasts for their food, and those who are in the strong places and in holes in the rocks will come to their death by disease.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 33 Verse 28
text: And I will make the land a waste and a cause of wonder, and the pride of her strength will come to an end; and the mountains of Israel will be made waste so that no one will go through.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 33 Verse 29
text: Then they will be certain that I am the Lord, when I have made the land a waste and a cause of wonder, because of all the disgusting things which they have done,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 33 Verse 30
text: And as for you, son of man, the children of your people are talking together about you by the walls and in the doorways of the houses, saying to one another, Come now, give ear to the word which comes from the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 33 Verse 31
text: And they come to you as my people come, and are seated before you as my people, hearing your words but doing them not: for deceit is in their mouth and their heart goes after profit for themselves.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 33 Verse 32
text: And truly you are to them like a love song by one who has a very pleasing voice and is an expert player on an instrument: for they give ear to your words but do them not.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 33 Verse 33
text: And when this comes about (see, it is coming), then it will be clear to them that a prophet has been among them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 34 Verse 1
text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 34 Verse 2
text: Son of man, be a prophet against the keepers of the flock of Israel, and say to them, O keepers of the sheep! this is the word of the Lord: A curse is on the keepers of the flock of Israel who take the food for themselves! is it not right for the keepers to give the food to the sheep?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 34 Verse 3
text: You take the milk and are clothed with the wool, you put the fat beasts to death, but you give the sheep no food.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 34 Verse 4
text: You have not made the diseased ones strong or made well that which was ill; you have not put bands on the broken or got back that which had been sent away or made search for the wandering ones; and the strong you have been ruling cruelly.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 34 Verse 5
text: And they were wandering in every direction because there was no keeper: and they became food for all the beasts of the field.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 34 Verse 6
text: And my sheep went out of the way, wandering through all the mountains and on every high hill: my sheep went here and there over all the face of the earth; and no one was troubled about them or went in search of them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 34 Verse 7
text: For this cause, O keepers of the flock, give ear to the word of the Lord:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 34 Verse 8
text: By my life, says the Lord, truly, because my sheep have been taken away, and my sheep became food for all the beasts of the field, because there was no keeper, and my keepers did not go in search of the sheep, but the keepers took food for themselves and gave my sheep no food;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 34 Verse 9
text: For this reason, O you keepers of the flock, give ear to the word of the Lord;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 34 Verse 10
text: This is what the Lord has said: See I am against the keepers of the flock, and I will make search and see what they have done with my sheep, and will let them be keepers of my sheep no longer; and the keepers will no longer get food for themselves; I will take my sheep out of their mouths so that they may not be food for them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 34 Verse 11
text: For this is what the Lord has said: Truly, I, even I, will go searching and looking for my sheep.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 34 Verse 12
text: As the keeper goes looking for his flock when he is among his wandering sheep, so I will go looking for my sheep, and will get them safely out of all the places where they have been sent wandering in the day of clouds and black night.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 34 Verse 13
text: And I will take them out from among the peoples, and get them together from the countries, and will take them into their land; and I will give them food on the mountains of Israel by the water-streams and wherever men are living in the country.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 34 Verse 14
text: I will give them good grass-land for their food, and their safe place will be the mountains of the high place of Israel: there they will take their rest in a good place, and on fat grass-land they will take their food on the mountains of Israel.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 34 Verse 15
text: I myself will give food to my flock, and I will give them rest, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 34 Verse 16
text: I will go in search of that which had gone wandering from the way, and will get back that which had been sent in flight, and will put bands on that which was broken, and give strength to that which was ill: but the fat and the strong I will give up to destruction; I will give them for their food the punishment which is theirs by right.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 34 Verse 17
text: And as for you, O my flock, says the Lord, truly, I will be judge between sheep and sheep, the he-sheep and the he-goats.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 34 Verse 18
text: Does it seem a small thing to you to have taken your food on good grass-land while the rest of your grass-land is stamped down under your feet? and that after drinking from clear waters you make the rest of the waters dirty with your feet?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 34 Verse 19
text: And as for my sheep, their food is the grass which has been stamped on by your feet, and their drink the water which has been made dirty by your feet.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 34 Verse 20
text: For this reason the Lord has said to them, Truly, I, even I, will be judge between the fat sheep and the thin sheep.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 34 Verse 21
text: Because you have been pushing with side and leg, pushing the diseased with your horns till they were sent away in every direction;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 34 Verse 22
text: I will make my flock safe, and they will no longer be taken away, and I will be judge between sheep and sheep.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 34 Verse 23
text: And I will put over them one keeper, and he will give them food, even my servant David; he will give them food and be their keeper.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 34 Verse 24
text: And I the Lord will be their God and my servant David their ruler; I the Lord have said it.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 34 Verse 25
text: And I will make with them an agreement of peace, and will put an end to evil beasts through all the land: and they will be living safely in the waste land, sleeping in the woods.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 34 Verse 26
text: And I will give the rain at the right time, and I will make the shower come down at the right time; there will be showers of blessing.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 34 Verse 27
text: And the tree of the field will give its fruit and the earth will give its increase, and they will be safe in their land; and they will be certain that I am the Lord, when I have had their yoke broken and have given them salvation from the hands of those who made them servants.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 34 Verse 28
text: And their goods will no longer be taken by the nations, and they will not again be food for the beasts of the earth; but they will be living safely and no one will be a cause of fear to them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 34 Verse 29
text: And I will give them planting-places of peace, and they will no longer be wasted from need of food or put to shame by the nations.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 34 Verse 30
text: And they will be certain that I the Lord their God am with them, and that they, the children of Israel, are my people, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 34 Verse 31
text: And you are my sheep, the sheep of my grass-lands, and I am your God, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 35 Verse 1
text: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 35 Verse 2
text: Son of man, let your face be turned to Mount Seir, and be a prophet against it,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 35 Verse 3
text: And say to it, This is what the Lord has said: See, I am against you, O Mount Seir, and my hand will be stretched out against you, and I will make you a waste and a cause for wonder.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 35 Verse 4
text: I will make your towns unpeopled and you will be a waste; and you will be certain that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 35 Verse 5
text: Because yours has been a hate without end, and you have given up the children of Israel to the power of the sword in the time of their trouble, in the time of the punishment of the end:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 35 Verse 6
text: For this cause, by my life, says the Lord, because you have been sinning through blood, blood will come after you.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 35 Verse 7
text: And I will make Mount Seir a cause for wonder and a waste, cutting off from it all comings and goings.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 35 Verse 8
text: I will make his mountains full of those who have been put to death; in your valleys and in all your water-streams men will be falling by the sword.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 35 Verse 9
text: I will make you waste for ever, and your towns will be unpeopled: and you will be certain that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 35 Verse 10
text: Because you have said, The two nations and the two countries are to be mine, and we will take them for our heritage; though the Lord was there:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 35 Verse 11
text: For this cause, by my life, says the Lord, I will do to you as you have done in your wrath and in your envy, which you have made clear in your hate for them; and I will make clear to you who I am when you are judged by me.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 35 Verse 12
text: And you will see that I the Lord have had knowledge of all the bitter things which you have said against the mountains of Israel, saying, They have been made waste, they are given to us to take for our heritage.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 35 Verse 13
text: And you have made yourselves great against me with your mouths, increasing your words against me; and it has come to my ears.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 35 Verse 14
text: This is what the Lord has said: Because you were glad over my land when it was a waste, so will I do to you:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 35 Verse 15
text: You will become a waste, O Mount Seir, and all Edom, even all of it: and you will be certain that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 1
text: And you, son of man, be a prophet about the mountains of Israel, and say, You mountains of Israel, give ear to the word of the Lord:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 2
text: This is what the Lord has said: Because your hater has said against you, Aha! and, The old waste places are our heritage, we have taken them:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 3
text: For this cause be a prophet, and say, This is what the Lord has said: Because, even because they have been glad over you and put you to shame on every side, because you have become a heritage for the rest of the nations, and you are taken up on the lips of talkers and in the evil talk of the people:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 4
text: For this reason, you mountains of Israel, give ear to the word of the Lord; this is what the Lord has said to the mountains and to the hills, to the streams and to the valleys, to the unpeopled wastes and to the towns where no one is living, from which the goods have been taken and which have been put to shame by the rest of the nations who are round about:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 5
text: For this cause the Lord has said: Truly, in the heat of my bitter feeling I have said things against the rest of the nations and against all Edom, who have taken my land as a heritage for themselves with the joy of all their heart, and with bitter envy of soul have made attacks on it:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 6
text: For this cause be a prophet about the land of Israel, and say to the mountains and to the hills, to the streams and to the valleys, This is what the Lord has said: Truly, in my bitter feeling and in my wrath I have said these things, because you have undergone the shame of the nations:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 7
text: For this cause the Lord has said, See, I have taken an oath that the nations which are round about you are themselves to undergo the shame which they have put on you.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 8
text: But you, O mountains of Israel, will put out your branches and give your fruit to my people Israel; for they are ready to come.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 9
text: For truly I am for you, and I will be turned to you, and you will be ploughed and planted:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 10
text: And I will let your numbers be increased, all the children of Israel, even all of them: and the towns will be peopled and the waste places will have buildings;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 11
text: Man and beast will be increased in you, and they will have offspring and be fertile: I will make you thickly peopled as you were before, and will do more for you than at the first: and you will be certain that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 12
text: Yes, I will have you walked on by the feet of men, even my people Israel; they will have you for a heritage and you will be theirs, and never again will you take their children from them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 13
text: This is what the Lord has said: Because they say to you, You, O land, are the destruction of men, causing loss of children to your nation;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 14
text: For this reason you will no longer take the lives of men and will never again be the cause of loss of children to your nation, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 15
text: And I will not let the shaming of the nations come to your ears, and no longer will you be looked down on by the peoples, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 16
text: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 17
text: Son of man, when the children of Israel were living in their land, they made it unclean by their way and their acts: their way before me was as when a woman is unclean at the time when she is kept separate.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 18
text: So I let loose my wrath on them because of those whom they had violently put to death in the land, and because they had made it unclean with their images:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 19
text: And I sent them in flight among the nations and wandering through the countries: I was their judge, rewarding them for their way and their acts.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 20
text: And when they came among the nations, wherever they went, they made my holy name unclean, when it was said of them, These are the people of the Lord who have gone out from his land.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 21
text: But I had pity for my holy name which the children of Israel had made unclean wherever they went.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 22
text: For this cause say to the children of Israel, This is what the Lord has said: I am doing this, not because of you, O children of Israel, but because of my holy name, which you have made unclean among the nations wherever you went.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 23
text: And I will make holy my great name which has been made unclean among the nations, which you have made unclean among them; and it will be clear to the nations that I am the Lord, says the Lord, when I make myself holy in you before their eyes.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 24
text: For I will take you out from among the nations, and get you together from all the countries, and take you into your land.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 25
text: And I will put clean water on you so that you may be clean: from all your unclean ways and from all your images I will make you clean.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 26
text: And I will give you a new heart and put a new spirit in you: I will take away the heart of stone from your flesh, and give you a heart of flesh.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 27
text: And I will put my spirit in you, causing you to be guided by my rules, and you will keep my orders and do them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 28
text: So that you may go on living in the land which I gave to your fathers; and you will be to me a people, and I will be to you a God.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 29
text: And I will make you free from all your unclean ways: and at my voice the grain will come up and be increased, and I will not let you be short of food.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 30
text: And I will make the tree give more fruit and the field fuller produce, and no longer will you be shamed among the nations for need of food.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 31
text: And at the memory of your evil ways and your wrongdoings, you will have bitter hate for yourselves because of your evil-doings and your disgusting ways, O children of Israel.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 32
text: Not because of you am I doing it, says the Lord; let it be clear to you, and be shamed and made low because of your ways, O children of Israel.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 33
text: This is what the Lord has said: In the day when I make you clean from all your evil-doings I will let the towns be peopled and there will be building on the waste places.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 34
text: And the land which was waste will be farmed, in place of being a waste in the eyes of everyone who went by.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 35
text: And they will say, This land which was waste has become like the garden of Eden; and the towns which were unpeopled and wasted and pulled down are walled and peopled.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 36
text: Then the rest of the nations round about you will be certain that I the Lord am the builder of the places which were pulled down and the planter of that which was waste: I the Lord have said it, and I will do it.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 37
text: This is what the Lord has said: The children of Israel will again make prayer to me for this, that I may do it for them; I will make them increased with men like a flock.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 36 Verse 38
text: Like sheep for the offerings, like the sheep of Jerusalem at her fixed feasts, so the unpeopled towns will be made full of men: and they will be certain that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 37 Verse 1
text: The hand of the Lord had been on me, and he took me out in the spirit of the Lord and put me down in the middle of the valley; and it was full of bones;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 37 Verse 2
text: And he made me go past them round about: and I saw that there was a very great number of them on the face of the wide valley, and they were very dry.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 37 Verse 3
text: And he said to me, Son of man, is it possible for these bones to come to life? And I made answer, and said, It is for you to say, O Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 37 Verse 4
text: And again he said to me, Be a prophet to these bones, and say to them, O you dry bones, give ear to the word of the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 37 Verse 5
text: This is what the Lord has said to these bones: See, I will make breath come into you so that you may come to life;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 37 Verse 6
text: And I will put muscles on you and make flesh come on you, and put skin over you, and breath into you, so that you may have life; and you will be certain that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 37 Verse 7
text: So I gave the word as I was ordered: and at my words there was a shaking of the earth, and the bones came together, bone to bone.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 37 Verse 8
text: And looking I saw that there were muscles on them and flesh came up, and they were covered with skin: but there was no breath in them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 37 Verse 9
text: And he said to me, Be a prophet to the wind, be a prophet, son of man, and say to the wind, The Lord has said: Come from the four winds, O wind, breathing on these dead so that they may come to life.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 37 Verse 10
text: And I gave the word at his orders, and breath came into them, and they came to life and got up on their feet, a very great army.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 37 Verse 11
text: Then he said to me, Son of man, these bones are all the children of Israel: and see, they are saying, Our bones have become dry our hope is gone, we are cut off completely.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 37 Verse 12
text: For this cause be a prophet to them, and say, This is what the Lord has said: See, I am opening the resting-places of your dead, and I will make you come up out of your resting-places, O my people; and I will take you into the land of Israel.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 37 Verse 13
text: And you will be certain that I am the Lord by my opening the resting-places of your dead and making you come up out of your resting-places, O my people.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 37 Verse 14
text: And I will put my spirit in you, so that you may come to life, and I will give you a rest in your land: and you will be certain that I the Lord have said it and have done it, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 37 Verse 15
text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 37 Verse 16
text: And you, son of man, take one stick, writing on it, For Judah and for the children of Israel who are in his company: then take another stick, writing on it, For Joseph, the stick of Ephraim, and all the children of Israel who are in his company:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 37 Verse 17
text: Then, joining them one to another, make them one stick, so that they may be one in your hand.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 37 Verse 18
text: And when the children of your people say to you, Will you not make clear to us what these things have to do with us?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 37 Verse 19
text: Then say to them, This is what the Lord has said: See, I am taking the stick of Joseph, which is in the hand of Ephraim, and the tribes of Israel who are in his company; and I will put it on the stick of Judah and make them one stick, and they will be one in my hand.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 37 Verse 20
text: And the sticks with your writing on them will be in your hand before their eyes.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 37 Verse 21
text: And say to them, These are the words of the Lord: See, I am taking the children of Israel from among the nations where they have gone, and will get them together on every side, and take them into their land:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 37 Verse 22
text: And I will make them one nation in the land, on the mountains of Israel; and one king will be king over them all: and they will no longer be two nations, and will no longer be parted into two kingdoms:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 37 Verse 23
text: And they will no longer make themselves unclean with their images or with their hated things or with any of their sins: but I will give them salvation from all their turning away in which they have done evil, and will make them clean; and they will be to me a people, and I will be to them a God.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 37 Verse 24
text: And my servant David will be king over them; and they will all have one keeper: and they will be guided by my orders and will keep my rules and do them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 37 Verse 25
text: And they will be living in the land which I gave to Jacob, my servant, in which your fathers were living; and they will go on living there, they and their children and their children's children, for ever: and David, my servant, will be their ruler for ever.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 37 Verse 26
text: And I will make an agreement of peace with them: it will be an eternal agreement with them: and I will have mercy on them and make their numbers great, and will put my holy place among them for ever.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 37 Verse 27
text: And my House will be over them; and I will be to them a God, and they will be to me a people.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 37 Verse 28
text: And the nations will be certain that I who make Israel holy am the Lord, when my holy place is among them for ever.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 38 Verse 1
text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 38 Verse 2
text: Son of man, let your face be turned against Gog, of the land of Magog, the ruler of Rosh, Meshech, and Tubal, and be a prophet against him,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 38 Verse 3
text: And say, This is what the Lord has said: See, I am against you, O Gog, ruler of Rosh, Meshech, and Tubal:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 38 Verse 4
text: And turning you round, I will put hooks in your mouth and make you come out with all your army, horses and horsemen, all of them in full war-dress, a great force with breastplate and body-cover, all of them armed with swords:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 38 Verse 5
text: Persia, Cush, and Put with them; all of them with body-cover and metal head-dress:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 38 Verse 6
text: Gomer and all her forces; the people of Togarmah in the inmost parts of the north, with all his forces: a great number of peoples with you.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 38 Verse 7
text: Be ready, make yourself ready, you and all the forces who are with you, and be ready for my orders.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 38 Verse 8
text: After a long time you will get your orders: in the last years you will come into the land which has been given back from the sword, which has been got together out of a great number of peoples, on the mountains of Israel which have ever been a waste: but it has been taken out from the peoples and they will be living, all of them, without fear of danger.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 38 Verse 9
text: And you will go up, you will come like a storm, you will be like a cloud covering the land, you and all your forces, and a great number of peoples with you.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 38 Verse 10
text: This is what the Lord has said: In that day it will come about that things will come into your mind, and you will have thoughts of an evil design:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 38 Verse 11
text: And you will say, I will go up to the land of small unwalled towns; I will go to those who are quiet, living, all of them, without fear of danger, without walls or locks or doors:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 38 Verse 12
text: To take their property by force and go off with their goods; turning your hand against the waste places which now are peopled, and against the people who have been got together out of the nations, who have got cattle and goods for themselves, who are living in the middle of the earth.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 38 Verse 13
text: Sheba, and Dedan and her traders, Tarshish with all her traders, will say to you, Have you come to take our goods? have you got your armies together to take away our property by force? to take away silver and gold, cattle and goods, to go off with great wealth?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 38 Verse 14
text: For this cause, son of man, be a prophet and say to Gog, These are the words of the Lord: In that day, when my people Israel are living without fear of danger, will you not be moved against them?

title: Ezekiel Chapter 38 Verse 15
text: And you will come from your place in the inmost parts of the north, you and a great number of peoples with you, all of them on horseback, a great force and a strong army:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 38 Verse 16
text: And you will come up against my people Israel, like a cloud covering the land; and it will come about, in the last days, that I will make you come against my land, so that the nations may have knowledge of me when I make myself holy in you, O Gog, before their eyes.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 38 Verse 17
text: This is what the Lord has said: You are he of whom I gave them word in earlier times by my servants, the prophets of Israel, who in those days went on saying, year after year, that I would make you come up against them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 38 Verse 18
text: And it will come about in that day, when Gog comes up against the land of Israel, says the Lord, that my wrath will come up, and my passion and my bitter feeling.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 38 Verse 19
text: For in the fire of my wrath I have said, Truly, in that day there will be a great shaking in the land of Israel;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 38 Verse 20
text: So that the fish of the sea and the birds of heaven and the beasts of the field and everything moving on the earth, and all the men who are on the face of the earth, will be shaking before me, and the mountains will be overturned and the high places will come down, and every wall will come falling down to the earth.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 38 Verse 21
text: And I will send to all my mountains for a sword against him, says the Lord: every man's sword will be against his brother.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 38 Verse 22
text: And I will take up my cause against him with disease and with blood; and I will send down on him and on his forces and on the peoples who are with him, an overflowing shower and great ice-drops, fire, and burning.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 38 Verse 23
text: And I will make my name great and make myself holy, and I will make myself clear to a number of nations; and they will be certain that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 39 Verse 1
text: And you, son of man, be a prophet against Gog, and say, These are the words of the Lord: See, I am against you, O Gog, ruler of Rosh, Meshech, and Tubal:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 39 Verse 2
text: And turning you round, I will be your guide, and make you come up from the inmost parts of the north; I will make you come on to the mountains of Israel:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 39 Verse 3
text: And with a blow I will send your bow out of your left hand and your arrows falling from your right hand.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 39 Verse 4
text: On the mountains of Israel you will come down, you and all your forces and the peoples who are with you: I will give you to cruel birds of every sort and to the beasts of the field to be their food.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 39 Verse 5
text: You will come down in the open field: for I have said it, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 39 Verse 6
text: And I will send a fire on Magog, and on those who are living in the sea-lands without fear: and they will be certain that I am the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 39 Verse 7
text: And I will make clear my holy name among my people Israel; I will no longer let my holy name be made unclean: and the nations will be certain that I am the Lord, the Holy One in Israel.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 39 Verse 8
text: See, it is coming and it will be done, says the Lord; this is the day of which I have given word.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 39 Verse 9
text: And those who are living in the towns of Israel will go out and make fires of the instruments of war, burning the body-covers and the breastplates, the bows and the arrows and the sticks and the spears, and for seven years they will make fires of them:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 39 Verse 10
text: And they will take no wood out of the field or have any cut down in the woods; for they will make their fires of the instruments of war: and they will take by force the property of those who took their property, and go off with the goods of those who took their goods, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 39 Verse 11
text: And it will come about in those days, that I will give to Gog a last resting-place there in Israel, in the valley of Abarim on the east of the sea: and those who go through will be stopped: and there Gog and all his people will be put to rest, and the place will be named, The valley of Hamon-gog.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 39 Verse 12
text: And the children of Israel will be seven months putting them in the earth, so as to make the land clean.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 39 Verse 13
text: And all the people of the land will put them in the earth; and it will be to their honour in the day when I let my glory be seen, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 39 Verse 14
text: And they will put on one side men to do no other work but to go through the land and put in the earth the rest of those who are still on the face of the land, to make it clean: after seven months are ended they are to make a search.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 39 Verse 15
text: And while they go through the land, if anyone sees a man's bone, he is to put up a sign by the place till those who are doing the work have put it in the earth in the valley of Hamon-gog.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 39 Verse 16
text: And there they will put all the army of Gog in the earth. So they will make the land clean.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 39 Verse 17
text: And you, son of man, this is what the Lord has said: Say to the birds of every sort and to all the beasts of the field, Get together and come; come together on every side to the offering which I am putting to death for you, a great offering on the mountains of Israel, so that you may have flesh for your food and blood for your drink.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 39 Verse 18
text: The flesh of the men of war will be your food, and your drink the blood of the princes of the earth, of sheep and lambs, of he-goats, of oxen, all of them fat beasts of Bashan.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 39 Verse 19
text: You will go on feasting on the fat till you are full, and drinking the blood till you are overcome with it, of my offering which I have put to death for you.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 39 Verse 20
text: At my table you will have food in full measure, horses and war-carriages, great men and all the men of war, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 39 Verse 21
text: And I will put my glory among the nations, and all the nations will see my punishments which I have put into effect, and my hand which I have put on them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 39 Verse 22
text: So the children of Israel will be certain that I am the Lord their God, from that day and for the future.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 39 Verse 23
text: And it will be clear to the nations that the children of Israel were taken away prisoners for their evil-doing; because they did wrong against me, and my face was covered from them: so I gave them up into the hands of their attackers, and they all came to their end by the sword.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 39 Verse 24
text: In the measure of their unclean ways and their sins, so I did to them; and I kept my face covered from them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 39 Verse 25
text: For this cause the Lord has said, Now I will let the fate of Jacob be changed, and I will have mercy on all the children of Israel, and will take care of the honour of my holy name.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 39 Verse 26
text: And they will be conscious of their shame and of all the wrong which they have done against me, when they are living in their land with no sense of danger and with no one to be a cause of fear to them;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 39 Verse 27
text: When I have taken them back from among the peoples and got them together out of the lands of their haters, and have made myself holy in them before the eyes of a great number of nations.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 39 Verse 28
text: And they will be certain that I am the Lord their God, because I sent them away as prisoners among the nations, and have taken them together back to their land; and I have not let one of them be there any longer.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 39 Verse 29
text: And my face will no longer be covered from them: for I have sent the out-flowing of my spirit on the children of Israel, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 1
text: In the twenty-fifth year after we had been taken away prisoners, in the first month of the year, on the tenth day of the month, in the fourteenth year after the town was taken, on the very same day, the hand of the Lord was on me, and he took me there.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 2
text: In the visions of God he took me into the land of Israel, and put me down on a very high mountain, on which there was, as it seemed, a building like a town opposite me.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 3
text: He took me there, and I saw a man, looking like brass, with a linen cord in his hand and a measuring rod: and he was stationed in the doorway.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 4
text: And the man said to me, Son of man, see with your eyes and give hearing with your ears, and take to heart everything I am going to let you see; for in order that I might let you see them, you have come here: and give an account of all you see to the children of Israel.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 5
text: And there was a wall on the outside of the house all round, and in the man's hand there was a measuring rod six cubits long by a cubit and a hand's measure: so he took the measure of the building from side to side, one rod; and from base to top, one rod.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 6
text: Then he came to the doorway looking to the east, and went up by its steps; and he took the measure of the doorstep, one rod wide.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 7
text: And the watchmen's rooms were one rod long and one rod wide; and the space between the rooms was five cubits; the doorstep of the doorway, by the covered way of the doorway inside, was one rod.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 8
text: And he took the measure of the covered way of the doorway inside,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 9
text: Eight cubits; and its uprights, two cubits; the covered way of the doorway was inside.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 10
text: And the rooms of the doorway on the east were three on this side and three on that; all three were of the same size; and the uprights on this side and on that were of the same size.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 11
text: And he took the measure of the opening of the doorway, ten cubits wide; and the way down the doorway was thirteen cubits;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 12
text: And the space in front of the rooms, a cubit on this side and a cubit on that side; and the rooms six cubits on this side and six cubits on that.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 13
text: And he took the measure of the doorway from the back of one room to the back of the other, twenty-five cubits across, from door to door.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 14
text: And he took the measure of the covered way, twenty cubits; and opening from the covered way of the doorway was the open square round about.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 15
text: And from before the opening of the doorway to before the inner covered way of the doorway was fifty cubits.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 16
text: And the rooms and their uprights had sloping windows inside the doorway all round, and in the same way the covered way had windows all round on the inside: and on every upright there were palm-trees.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 17
text: Then he took me into the outer square, and there were rooms and a stone floor made for the open square all round: there were thirty rooms on the stone floor.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 18
text: And the stone floor was by the side of the doorways, and was as wide as the doorways were long, even the lower floor.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 19
text: Then he took the measure of the square across, from before the lower doorway inside to before the inner doorway outside, one hundred cubits. And he took me in the direction of the north,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 20
text: And there was a doorway to the outer square, looking to the north; and he took the measure of it to see how wide and how long it was.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 21
text: And it had three rooms on this side of it and three on that; its uprights and its covered ways were the same size as those of the first doorway: it was fifty cubits long and twenty-five cubits wide.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 22
text: And its windows, and the windows of its covered ways, and its palm-trees, were the same as those of the doorway looking to the east; and there were seven steps up to it; and the covered way went inside.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 23
text: And there was a doorway to the inner square opposite the doorway on the north, like the doorway on the east; and he took the measure from doorway to doorway, a hundred cubits.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 24
text: And he took me to the south, and I saw a doorway looking to the south: and he took the measure of its rooms and its uprights and its covered ways by these measures.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 25
text: And there were windows in it and in the covered way all round, like the other windows: it was fifty cubits long and twenty-five cubits wide.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 26
text: And there were seven steps up to it, and its covered way went inside: and it had palm-trees, one on this side and one on that, on its uprights.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 27
text: And there was a doorway to the inner square looking to the south: he took the measure from doorway to doorway to the south, a hundred cubits.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 28
text: Then he took me to the inner square by the south doorway: and he took the measure of the south doorway by these measures;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 29
text: And the rooms in it and the uprights and the covered ways, by these measures:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 30
text: And there were windows in it and in the covered way all round: it was fifty cubits long and twenty-five cubits wide.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 31
text: The covered way was on the side nearest the outer square; and there were palm-trees on the uprights: and there were eight steps going up to it.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 32
text: And he took me into the inner square facing the east: and he took the measure of the doorway by these measures;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 33
text: And of the rooms in it and its uprights and its covered ways, by these measures: and there were windows in it and in the covered way round about: it was fifty cubits long and twenty-five cubits wide.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 34
text: And the covered way was on the side nearest the outer square; there were palm-trees on the uprights, on this side and on that: and there were eight steps going up to it.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 35
text: And he took me to the north doorway: and he took the measure of it by these measures;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 36
text: Its rooms, its uprights, and its covered way had the same measures, and its covered way had windows all round: it was fifty cubits long and twenty-five cubits wide.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 37
text: Its uprights were on the side nearest to the outer square; there were palm-trees on the uprights, on this side and on that: and there were eight steps going up to it.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 38
text: And there was a room with a door in the covered way of the doorway, where the burned offering was washed.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 39
text: And in the covered way of the doorway there were two tables on this side and two tables on that side, on which the burned offering and the sin-offering and the offering for error were put to death:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 40
text: On the outer side, to the north, as one goes up to the opening of the doorway, were two tables.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 41
text: There were four tables on one side and four tables on the other, by the side of the doorway; eight tables, on which they put to death the beasts for the offerings.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 42
text: And there were four tables for the burned offering, made of cut stone, one and a half cubits long, one and a half cubits wide and a cubit high, where the instruments were placed which were used for putting to death the burned offering and the beasts for the offerings.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 43
text: And they had edges all round as wide as a man's hand: and on the tables was the flesh of the offerings.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 44
text: And he took me into the inner square, and there were two rooms in the inner square, one at the side of the north doorway, facing south; and one at the side of the south doorway, facing north.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 45
text: And he said to me, This room, facing south, is for the priests who have the care of the house.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 46
text: And the room facing north is for the priests who have the care of the altar: these are the sons of Zadok, who, from among the sons of Levi, come near to the Lord to do the work of his house.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 47
text: And he took the measure of the open square, a hundred cubits long and a hundred cubits wide, being square; and the altar was in front of the house.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 48
text: Then he took me to the covered way before the house, and took the measure of its uprights, five cubits on one side and five cubits on the other: and the doorway was fourteen cubits wide; and the side-walls of the doorway were three cubits on one side and three cubits on the other.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 40 Verse 49
text: The covered way was twenty cubits long and twelve cubits wide, and they went up to it by ten steps; and there were pillars by the uprights, one on one side and one on the other.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 41 Verse 1
text: And he took me to the Temple, and took the measure of the uprights, six cubits wide on one side and six cubits wide on the other.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 41 Verse 2
text: And the door-opening was ten cubits wide; and the side walls of the door-opening were five cubits on one side and five cubits on the other: and it was forty cubits long and twenty cubits wide.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 41 Verse 3
text: And he went inside and took the measure of the uprights of the door-opening, two cubits: and the door-opening, six cubits; and the side-walls of the door-opening were seven cubits on one side and seven cubits on the other.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 41 Verse 4
text: And by his measure it was twenty cubits long and twenty cubits wide in front of the Temple: and he said to me, This is the most holy place.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 41 Verse 5
text: Then he took the measure of the wall of the house, which was six cubits; and of the side-rooms round the house, which were four cubits wide.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 41 Verse 6
text: And the side-rooms, room over room, were three times thirty; there were inlets in the wall of the house for the side-rooms round about, for supports in the wall of the house.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 41 Verse 7
text: The side-rooms became wider as they went higher up the house, by the amount of the space let into the wall up round about the house, because of the inlets in the house; and one went up from the lowest floor by steps to the middle, and from the middle to the upper floor.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 41 Verse 8
text: And I saw that the house had a stone floor all round; the bases of the side-rooms were a full rod of six great cubits high.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 41 Verse 9
text: The wall supporting the side-rooms on the outside was five cubits thick: and there was a free space of five cubits between the side-rooms of the house.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 41 Verse 10
text: And between the rooms was a space twenty cubits wide all round the house.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 41 Verse 11
text: And the free space had doors opening from the side-rooms, one door on the north and one door on the south: and the free space was five cubits wide all round.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 41 Verse 12
text: And the building which was in front of the separate place at the side to the west was seventy cubits wide; the wall of the building was five cubits thick all round and ninety cubits long.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 41 Verse 13
text: And he took the measure of the house; it was a hundred cubits long; and the separate place and the building with its walls was a hundred cubits long;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 41 Verse 14
text: And the east front of the house and of the separate place was a hundred cubits wide.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 41 Verse 15
text: And he took the measure of the building in front of the separate place which was at the back of it, and the pillared walks on one side and on the other side; they were a hundred cubits long; and the Temple and the inner part and its outer covered way were covered in;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 41 Verse 16
text: And the sloping windows and the covered ways round all three of them were of shakiph-wood all round from the level of the earth up to the windows;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 41 Verse 17
text: And there was a roof over the doorway and as far as the inner house, and to the outside and on the wall all round, inside and outside.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 41 Verse 18
text: And it had pictured forms of winged beings and palm-trees; a palm-tree between two winged ones, and every winged one had two faces;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 41 Verse 19
text: So that there was the face of a man turned to the palm-tree on one side, and the face of a young lion on the other side: so it was made all round the house.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 41 Verse 20
text: From earth level up to the windows there were winged ones and palm-trees pictured on the wall.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 41 Verse 22
text: The altar was made of wood, and was three cubits high and two cubits long; it had angles, and its base and sides were of wood; and he said to me, This is the table which is before the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 41 Verse 23
text: The Temple had two doors.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 41 Verse 24
text: And the holy place had two doors, and the doors had two turning leaves, two for one and two for the other.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 41 Verse 25
text: And on them were pictured winged ones and palm-trees, as on the walls; and a ... of wood was on the front of the covered way outside.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 41 Verse 26
text: And there were sloping windows and palm-trees on one side and on the other, on the sides of the covered way: and the side-rooms of the house and the ...

title: Ezekiel Chapter 42 Verse 1
text: And he took me out into the inner square in the direction of the north: and he took me into the rooms which were opposite the separate place and opposite the building to the north.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 42 Verse 2
text: On the north side it was a hundred cubits long and fifty cubits wide,

title: Ezekiel Chapter 42 Verse 3
text: Opposite the space of twenty cubits which was part of the inner square, and opposite the stone floor of the outer square. There were covered ways facing one another on the third floor.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 42 Verse 4
text: And in front of the rooms was a walk, ten cubits wide and a hundred cubits long; and their doors were facing north.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 42 Verse 5
text: And the higher rooms were shorter: for the covered ways took up more space from these than from the lower and middle rooms.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 42 Verse 6
text: For they were on three floors, and they had no pillars like the pillars of the outer square; so the highest was narrower than the lowest and middle floors from the earth level.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 42 Verse 7
text: And the wall which went outside by the side of the rooms, in the direction of the outer square in front of the rooms, was fifty cubits long.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 42 Verse 8
text: For the rooms in the outer square were fifty cubits long: and in front of the Temple was a space of a hundred cubits.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 42 Verse 9
text: And under these rooms was the way in from the east side, as one goes into them from the outer square at the head of the outer wall.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 42 Verse 10
text: (And he took me) to the south, and in front of the separate place and in front of the building there were rooms.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 42 Verse 11
text: And there was a walk in front of them like that by the rooms on the north; they were equally long and wide; and the ways out of them were the same in design and had the same sort of doors.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 42 Verse 12
text: And under the rooms on the south was a door at the head of the outer wall in the direction of the east as one goes in.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 42 Verse 13
text: And he said to me, The north rooms and the south rooms in front of the separate place are the holy rooms, where the priests who come near the Lord take the most holy things for their food: there the most holy things are placed, with the meal offering and the sin-offering and the offering for error; for the place is holy.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 42 Verse 14
text: When the priests go in, they may not go out of the holy place into the outer square, and there they are to put the robes in which they do the work of the Lord's house, for they are holy: and they have to put on other clothing before they come near that which has to do with the people.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 42 Verse 15
text: And when he had come to the end of measuring the inner house, he took me out to the doorway looking to the east, and took its measure all round.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 42 Verse 16
text: He went round and took the measure of it on the east side with the measuring rod, five hundred, measured with the rod all round.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 42 Verse 17
text: And he went round and took the measure of it on the north side with the measuring rod, five hundred, measured with the rod all round.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 42 Verse 18
text: And he went round and took the measure of it on the south side with the measuring rod, five hundred, measured with the rod all round.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 42 Verse 19
text: And he went round and took the measure of it on the west side with the measuring rod, five hundred, measured with the rod all round.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 42 Verse 20
text: He took its measure on the four sides: and it had a wall all round, five hundred long and five hundred wide, separating what was holy from what was common.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 43 Verse 1
text: And he took me to the doorway looking to the east:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 43 Verse 2
text: And there was the glory of the God of Israel coming from the way of the east: and his voice was like the sound of great waters, and the earth was shining with his glory.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 43 Verse 3
text: And the vision which I saw was like the vision I had seen when he came for the destruction of the town: and like the vision which I saw by the river Chebar; and I went down on my face.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 43 Verse 4
text: And the glory of the Lord came into the house by the way of the doorway looking to the east.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 43 Verse 5
text: And the spirit, lifting me up, took me into the inner square; and I saw that the house was full of the glory of the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 43 Verse 6
text: And the voice of one talking to me came to my ears from inside the house; and the man was by my side.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 43 Verse 7
text: And he said to me, Son of man, this is the place where the seat of my power is and the resting-place of my feet, where I will be among the children of Israel for ever: and no longer will the people of Israel make my holy name unclean, they or their kings, by their loose ways and by the dead bodies of their kings;

title: Ezekiel Chapter 43 Verse 8
text: By putting their doorstep by my doorstep, and the pillar of their door by the pillar of my door, with only a wall between me and them; and they have made my holy name unclean by the disgusting things which they have done: so in my wrath I sent destruction on them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 43 Verse 9
text: Now let them put their loose ways and the dead bodies of their kings far from me, and I will be among them for ever.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 43 Verse 10
text: You, son of man, give the children of Israel an account of this house, so that they may be shamed because of their evil-doing: and let them see the vision of it and its image.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 43 Verse 11
text: And they will be shamed by what they have done; so give them the knowledge of the form of the house and its structure, and the ways out of it and into it, and all its laws and its rules, writing it down for them: so that they may keep all its laws and do them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 43 Verse 12
text: This is the law of the house: On the top of the mountain all the space round it on every side will be most holy. See, this is the law of the house.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 43 Verse 13
text: And these are the measures of the altar in cubits: (the cubit being a cubit and a hand's measure;) its hollow base is a cubit high and a cubit wide, and it has an overhanging edge as wide as a hand-stretch all round it:

title: Ezekiel Chapter 43 Verse 14
text: And from the base on the earth level to the lower shelf, the altar is two cubits high and a cubit wide; and from the smaller shelf to the greater shelf it is four cubits high and a cubit wide.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 43 Verse 15
text: And the fireplace is four cubits high: and coming up from the fireplace are the horns, a cubit high.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 43 Verse 16
text: And the fireplace is twelve cubits long and twelve cubits wide, square on its four sides.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 43 Verse 17
text: And the shelf is fourteen cubits long and fourteen cubits wide, on its four sides; the edge round it is half a cubit; the base of it is a cubit all round, and its steps are facing the east.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 43 Verse 18
text: And he said to me, Son of man, the Lord God has said, These are the rules for the altar, when they make it, for the offering of burned offerings on it and the draining out of the blood.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 43 Verse 19
text: You are to give to the priests, the Levites of the seed of Zadok, who come near to me, says the Lord God, to do my work, a young ox for a sin-offering.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 43 Verse 20
text: You are to take some of its blood and put it on the four horns and on the four angles of the shelf and on the edge all round: and you are to make it clean and free from sin.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 43 Verse 21
text: And you are to take the ox of the sin-offering, and have it burned in the special place ordered for it in the house, outside the holy place.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 43 Verse 22
text: And on the second day you are to have a he-goat without any mark on it offered for a sin-offering; and they are to make the altar clean as they did with the young ox.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 43 Verse 23
text: And after you have made it clean, let a young ox without a mark be offered, and a male sheep from the flock without a mark.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 43 Verse 24
text: And you are to take them before the Lord, and the priests will put salt on them, offering them up for a burned offering to the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 43 Verse 25
text: Every day for seven days you are to give a goat for a sin-offering: and let them give in addition a young ox and a male sheep from the flock without any mark on them.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 43 Verse 26
text: For seven days they are to make offerings to take away sin from the altar and to make it clean; so they are to make it holy.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 43 Verse 27
text: And when these days have come to an end, then on the eighth day and after, the priests will make your burned offerings on the altar and your peace-offerings; and I will take pleasure in you, says the Lord.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 44 Verse 1
text: And he took me back to the outer doorway of the holy place, looking to the east; and it was shut.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 44 Verse 2
text: And the Lord said to me, This doorway is to be shut, it is not to be open, and no man is to go in by it, because the Lord, the God of Israel, has gone in by it; and it is to be shut.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 44 Verse 3
text: But the ruler will be seated there to take his food before the Lord; he will go in by the covered way to the door, and will come out by the same way.

title: Ezekiel Chapter 44 Verse 4
