text: Then there came to my ears the voice of a holy one talking; and another holy one said to that certain one who was talking, How long will the vision be while the regular burned offering is taken away, and the unclean thing causing fear is put up, and the holy place crushed under foot?

title: Daniel Chapter 8 Verse 14
text: And he said to him, For two thousand, three hundred evenings and mornings; then the holy place will be made clean.

title: Daniel Chapter 8 Verse 15
text: And it came about that when I, Daniel, had seen this vision, I had a desire for the sense of it to be unfolded; and I saw one before me in the form of a man.

title: Daniel Chapter 8 Verse 16
text: And the voice of a man came to my ears between the sides of the Ulai, crying out and saying, Gabriel, make the vision clear to this man.

title: Daniel Chapter 8 Verse 17
text: So he came and took his place near where I was; and when he came, I was full of fear and went down on my face: but he said to me, Let it be clear to you, O son of man; for the vision has to do with the time of the end.

title: Daniel Chapter 8 Verse 18
text: Now while he was talking to me, I went into a deep sleep with my face to the earth: but touching me, he put me on my feet where I had been.

title: Daniel Chapter 8 Verse 19
text: And he said, See, I will make clear to you what is to come in the later time of the wrath: for it has to do with the fixed time of the end.

title: Daniel Chapter 8 Verse 20
text: The sheep which you saw with two horns, they are the kings of Media and Persia.

title: Daniel Chapter 8 Verse 21
text: And the he-goat is the king of Greece: and the great horn between his eyes is the first king.

title: Daniel Chapter 8 Verse 22
text: And as for that which was broken, in place of which four came up, four kingdoms will come up from his nation, but not with his power.

title: Daniel Chapter 8 Verse 23
text: And in the later years of their kingdom, when their evil doings have become complete, there will come up a king full of pride and expert in dark sayings.

title: Daniel Chapter 8 Verse 24
text: And his power will be great, and he will be purposing strange things. And all will go well for him and he will do his pleasure; and he will send destruction on the strong ones.

title: Daniel Chapter 8 Verse 25
text: And his designs will be turned against the holy people, causing deceit to do well in his hand; in his heart he will make himself great, and send destruction on numbers who are living unconscious of their danger; and he will put himself up against the prince of princes; but he will be broken, though not by men's hands.

title: Daniel Chapter 8 Verse 26
text: And the vision of evenings and mornings which has been talked of is true: and keep the vision secret; for it has to do with the far-off future.

title: Daniel Chapter 8 Verse 27
text: And I, Daniel, was ill for some days; then I got up and did the king's business: and I was full of wonder at the vision, but no one was able to give the sense of it.

title: Daniel Chapter 9 Verse 1
text: In the first year of Darius, the son of Ahasuerus, of the seed of the Medes, who was made king over the kingdom of the Chaldaeans;

title: Daniel Chapter 9 Verse 2
text: In the first year of his rule, I, Daniel, saw clearly from the books the number of years given by the word of the Lord to the prophet Jeremiah, in which the making waste of Jerusalem was to be complete, that is, seventy years.

title: Daniel Chapter 9 Verse 3
text: And turning my face to the Lord God, I gave myself up to prayer, requesting his grace, going without food, in haircloth and dust.

title: Daniel Chapter 9 Verse 4
text: And I made prayer to the Lord my God, putting our sins before him, and said, O Lord, the great God, greatly to be feared. keeping your agreement and mercy with those who have love for you and do your orders;

title: Daniel Chapter 9 Verse 5
text: We are sinners, acting wrongly and doing evil; we have gone against you, turning away from your orders and from your laws:

title: Daniel Chapter 9 Verse 6
text: We have not given ear to your servants the prophets, who said words in your name to our kings and our rulers and our fathers and all the people of the land.

title: Daniel Chapter 9 Verse 7
text: O Lord, righteousness is yours, but shame is on us, even to this day; and on the men of Judah and the people of Jerusalem, and on all Israel, those who are near and those who are far off, in all the countries where you have sent them because of the sin which they have done against you.

title: Daniel Chapter 9 Verse 8
text: O Lord, shame is on us, on our kings and our rulers and our fathers, because of our sin against you.

title: Daniel Chapter 9 Verse 9
text: With the Lord our God are mercies and forgiveness, for we have gone against him;

title: Daniel Chapter 9 Verse 10
text: And have not given ear to the voice of the Lord our God to go in the way of his laws which he put before us by the mouth of his servants the prophets.

title: Daniel Chapter 9 Verse 11
text: And all Israel have been sinners against your law, turning away so as not to give ear to your voice: and the curse has been let loose on us, and the oath recorded in the law of Moses, the servant of God, for we have done evil against him.

title: Daniel Chapter 9 Verse 12
text: And he has given effect to his words which he said against us and against those who were our judges, by sending a great evil on us: for under all heaven there has not been done what has been done to Jerusalem.

title: Daniel Chapter 9 Verse 13
text: As it was recorded in the law of Moses, all this evil has come on us: but we have made no prayer for grace from the Lord our God that we might be turned from our evil doings and come to true wisdom.

title: Daniel Chapter 9 Verse 14
text: So the Lord has been watching over this evil and has made it come on us: for the Lord our God is upright in all his acts which he has done, and we have not given ear to his voice.

title: Daniel Chapter 9 Verse 15
text: And now, O Lord our God, who took your people out of the land of Egypt with a strong hand and made a great name for yourself even to this day; we are sinners, we have done evil.

title: Daniel Chapter 9 Verse 16
text: O Lord, because of your righteousness, let your wrath and your passion be turned away from your town Jerusalem, your holy mountain: because, through our sins and the evil-doing of our fathers, Jerusalem and your people have become a cause of shame to all who are round about us.

title: Daniel Chapter 9 Verse 17
text: And now, give ear, O our God, to the prayer of your servant and to his request for grace, and let your face be shining on your holy place which is made waste, because of your servants, O Lord.

title: Daniel Chapter 9 Verse 18
text: O my God, let your ear be turned and give hearing; let your eyes be open and see how we have been made waste and the town which is named by your name: for we are not offering our prayers before you because of our righteousness, but because of your great mercies.

title: Daniel Chapter 9 Verse 19
text: O Lord, give ear; O Lord, have forgiveness; O Lord, take note and do; let there be no more waiting; for the honour of your name, O my God, because your town and your people are named by your name.

title: Daniel Chapter 9 Verse 20
text: And while I was still saying these words in prayer, and putting my sins and the sins of my people Israel before the Lord, and requesting grace from the Lord my God for the holy mountain of my God;

title: Daniel Chapter 9 Verse 21
text: Even while I was still in prayer, the man Gabriel, whom I had seen in the vision at first when my weariness was great, put his hand on me about the time of the evening offering.

title: Daniel Chapter 9 Verse 22
text: And teaching me and talking to me he said, O Daniel, I have come now to give you wisdom.

title: Daniel Chapter 9 Verse 23
text: At the first word of your prayer a word went out, and I have come to give you knowledge; for you are a man dearly loved: so give thought to the word and let the vision be clear to you.

title: Daniel Chapter 9 Verse 24
text: Seventy weeks have been fixed for your people and your holy town, to let wrongdoing be complete and sin come to its full limit, and for the clearing away of evil-doing and the coming in of eternal righteousness: so that the vision and the word of the prophet may be stamped as true, and to put the holy oil on a most holy place.

title: Daniel Chapter 9 Verse 25
text: Have then the certain knowledge that from the going out of the word for the building again of Jerusalem till the coming of a prince, on whom the holy oil has been put, will be seven weeks: in sixty-two weeks its building will be complete, with square and earthwork.

title: Daniel Chapter 9 Verse 26
text: And at the end of the times, even after the sixty-two weeks, one on whom the holy oil has been put will be cut off and have no ...; and the town and the holy place will be made waste together with a prince; and the end will come with an overflowing of waters, and even to the end there will be war; the making waste which has been fixed.

title: Daniel Chapter 9 Verse 27
text: And a strong order will be sent out against the great number for one week; and so for half of the week the offering and the meal offering will come to an end; and in its place will be an unclean thing causing fear; till the destruction which has been fixed is let loose on him who has made waste.

title: Daniel Chapter 10 Verse 1
text: In the third year of Cyrus, king of Persia, a secret was unfolded to Daniel, whose name was Belteshazzar; and the thing was true, even a hard work: and he had knowledge of it, and the vision was clear to him.

title: Daniel Chapter 10 Verse 2
text: In those days I, Daniel, gave myself up to grief for three full weeks.

title: Daniel Chapter 10 Verse 3
text: I had no pleasing food, no meat or wine came into my mouth, and I put no oil on my body till three full weeks were ended.

title: Daniel Chapter 10 Verse 4
text: And on the twenty-fourth day of the first month I was by the side of the great river;

title: Daniel Chapter 10 Verse 5
text: And lifting up my eyes I saw the form of a man clothed in a linen robe, and round him there was a band of gold, of the best gold:

title: Daniel Chapter 10 Verse 6
text: And his body was like the beryl, and his face had the look of a thunder-flame, and his eyes were like burning lights, and his arms and feet like the colour of polished brass, and the sound of his voice was like the sound of an army.

title: Daniel Chapter 10 Verse 7
text: And I, Daniel, was the only one who saw the vision, for the men who were with me did not see it; but a great shaking came on them and they went in flight to take cover.

title: Daniel Chapter 10 Verse 8
text: So I was by myself, and I saw this great vision, and all my strength went from me; and the colour went from my face.

title: Daniel Chapter 10 Verse 9
text: But the sound of his words came to my ears, and on hearing his voice I went into a deep sleep with my face to the earth.

title: Daniel Chapter 10 Verse 10
text: Then a hand gave me a touch, awaking me, and putting me on my knees and my hands.

title: Daniel Chapter 10 Verse 11
text: And he said to me, O Daniel, you man dearly loved, take in the sense of the words I say to you and get up on to your feet: for to you I am now sent; and when he had said this to me I got on to my feet, shaking with fear.

title: Daniel Chapter 10 Verse 12
text: Then he said to me, Have no fear, Daniel; for from the first day when you gave your heart to getting wisdom and making yourself poor in spirit before your God, your words have come to his ears: and I have come because of your words.

title: Daniel Chapter 10 Verse 13
text: But the angel of the kingdom of Persia put himself against me for twenty-one days; but Michael, one of the chief angels, came to my help; and when I came he was still there with the angel of the kings of Persia.

title: Daniel Chapter 10 Verse 14
text: Now I have come to give you knowledge of the fate of your people in the later days; for there is still a vision for the days.

title: Daniel Chapter 10 Verse 15
text: And after he had said these words to me, I kept my face turned to the earth and was unable to say anything.

title: Daniel Chapter 10 Verse 16
text: Then one whose form was like the sons of men put his finger on my lips; and opening my mouth, I said to him who was before me, O my lord, because of the vision my pains have come on me, and I have no more strength.

title: Daniel Chapter 10 Verse 17
text: For how may this servant of my lord have talk with my lord? for, as for me, straight away my strength went from me and there was no breath in my body.

title: Daniel Chapter 10 Verse 18
text: Then again one having the form of a man put his hand on me and gave me strength.

title: Daniel Chapter 10 Verse 19
text: And he said to me, O man greatly loved, have no fear: peace be with you, be strong and let your heart be lifted up. And at his words I became strong, and said, Let my lord say on, for you have given me strength.

title: Daniel Chapter 10 Verse 20
text: Then he said, It is clear to you why I have come to you. And now I will give you an account of what is recorded in the true writings:

title: Daniel Chapter 10 Verse 21
text: But I am going back to make war with the angel of Persia, and when I am gone, the angel of Greece will come. And there is no one on my side against these, but Michael, your angel.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 1
text: And as for me, in the first year of Darius the Mede I was on his side to make his position safe and make him strong.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 2
text: And now I will make clear to you what is true. There are still three kings to come in Persia, and the fourth will have much greater wealth than all of them: and when he has become strong through his wealth, he will put his forces in motion against all the kingdoms of Greece.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 3
text: And a strong king will come to power, ruling with great authority and doing whatever is his pleasure.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 4
text: And when he has become strong, his kingdom will be broken and parted to the four winds of heaven; but not to his offspring, for it will be uprooted; and his kingdom will be for the others and not for these: but not with the same authority as his.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 5
text: And the king of the south will be strong, but one of his captains will be stronger than he and will be ruler; and his rule will be a great rule.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 6
text: And at the end of years they will be joined together; and the daughter of the king of the south will come to the king of the north to make an agreement: but she will not keep the strength of her arm; and his offspring will not keep their place; but she will be uprooted, with those who were the cause of her coming, and her son, and he who took her in those times.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 7
text: But out of a branch from her roots one will come up to take his place, who will come against the army, forcing his way into the strong place of the king of the north, and he will take them in hand and overcome them:

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 8
text: And their gods and their metal images and their fair vessels of silver and gold he will take away into the south; and for some years he will keep away from the king of the north.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 9
text: And he will come into the kingdom of the king of the south, but he will go back to his land.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 10
text: And his son will make war, and will get together an army of great forces, and he will make an attack on him, overflowing and going past: and he will again take the war even to his strong place.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 11
text: And the king of the south will be moved with wrath, and will come out and make war on him, on this same king of the north: and he will get together a great army, but the army will be given into his hand.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 12
text: And the army will be taken away, and his heart will be uplifted: he will be the cause of the downfall of tens of thousands, but he will not be strong.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 13
text: And again the king of the north will get together an army greater than the first; and he will make an attack on him at the end of years, with a great army and much wealth.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 14
text: In those times, a number will take up arms against the king of the south: and the children of the violent among your people will be lifting themselves up to make the vision come true; but it will be their downfall.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 15
text: So the king of the north will come, and put up earthworks and take a well-armed town: and the forces of the king of the south will make an attempt to keep their position, even the best of his army, but they will not have strength to do so.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 16
text: And he who comes against him will do his pleasure, and no one will be able to keep his place before him: he will take up his position in the beautiful land and in his hand there will be destruction.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 17
text: And it will be his purpose to come with the strength of all his kingdom, but in place of this he will make an agreement with him; and he will give him the daughter of women to send destruction on it; but this will not take place or come about.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 18
text: After this, his face will be turned to the islands, and he will take a number of them: but a chief, by his destruction, will put an end to the shame offered by him; and more than this, he will make his shame come back on him.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 19
text: Then his face will be turned to the strong places of his land: but his way will be stopped, causing his downfall, and he will not be seen again.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 20
text: Then his place will be taken by one who will send out a man with the glory of a king to get wealth together; but after a short time destruction will overtake him, but not in wrath or in the fight.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 21
text: And his place will be taken by a low person, to whom the honour of the kingdom had not been given: but he will come in time of peace and will get the kingdom by fair words.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 22
text: And his forces will be completely taken away from before him and broken; and even the ruler of the agreement will have the same fate.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 23
text: And from the time when they make an agreement with him, he will be working falsely: for he will take up arms suddenly with a small force,

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 24
text: Against fertile places, and will make waste a part of the country; and he will do what his fathers have not done, or his fathers' fathers; he will make distribution among them of goods taken in war and by force, and of property: he will even make designs against the strong places for a time.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 25
text: And he will put in motion his power and his strength against the king of the south with a great army; and the king of the south will go to war with a very great and strong army: but he will be forced to give way, because of their designs against him;

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 26
text: And his fears will overcome him and be the cause of his downfall, and his army will come to complete destruction, and a great number will be put to the sword.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 27
text: And as for these two kings, their hearts will be fixed on doing evil and they will say false words at one table; but it will come to nothing: for the end will be at the time fixed.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 28
text: And he will go back to his land with great wealth; and his heart will be against the holy agreement; and he will do his pleasure and go back to his land.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 29
text: At the time fixed he will come back and come into the south; but in the later time it will not be as it was before.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 30
text: For those who go out from the west will come against him, and he will be in fear and will go back, full of wrath against the holy agreement; and he will do his pleasure: and he will go back and be united with those who have given up the holy agreement.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 31
text: And armies sent by him will take up their position and they will make unclean the holy place, even the strong place, and take away the regular burned offering and put in its place an unclean thing causing fear.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 32
text: And those who do evil against the agreement will be turned to sin by his fair words: but the people who have knowledge of their God will be strong and do well.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 33
text: And those who are wise among the people will be the teachers of the mass of the people: but they will come to their downfall by the sword and by the flame, being made prisoners and undergoing loss for a long time.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 34
text: Now at the time of their downfall they will have a little help, but numbers will be joined to them in the town, and in their separate heritages.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 35
text: And some of those who are wise will have wisdom in testing themselves and making themselves clean, till the time of the end: for it is still for the fixed time.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 36
text: And the king will do his pleasure; he will put himself on high, lifting himself over every god, and saying things to be wondered at against the God of gods; and all will be well for him till the wrath is complete; for what has been purposed will be done.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 37
text: He will have no respect for the gods of his fathers or for the god desired by women; he will have no respect for any god: for he will put himself on high over all.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 38
text: But in place of this he will give honour to the god of armed places, and to a god of whom his fathers had no knowledge he will give honour with gold and silver and jewels and things to be desired.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 39
text: And he will make use of the people of a strange god to keep his strongest places; to those whom he takes note of he will give high honour: and he will make them rulers over the mass of the people, and will make division of the land for a price.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 40
text: And at the time of the end, the king of the south will make an attack on him: and the king of the north will come against him like a storm-wind, with war-carriages and horsemen and numbers of ships; and he will go through many lands like overflowing waters.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 41
text: And he will come into the beautiful land, and tens of thousands will be overcome: but these will be kept from falling into his hands: Edom and Moab and the chief of the children of Ammon.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 42
text: And his hand will be stretched out on the countries: and the land of the south will not be safe from him.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 43
text: But he will have power over the stores of gold and silver, and over all the valued things of the south: and the Libyans and the Ethiopians will be at his steps.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 44
text: But he will be troubled by news from the east and from the north; and he will go out in great wrath, to send destruction on, and put an end to, great numbers.

title: Daniel Chapter 11 Verse 45
text: He will put the tents of his great house between the sea and the beautiful holy mountain: but he will come to his end with no helper.

title: Daniel Chapter 12 Verse 1
text: And at that time Michael will take up his place, the great angel, who is the supporter of the children of your people: and there will be a time of trouble, such as there never was from the time there was a nation even till that same time: and at that time your people will be kept safe, everyone who is recorded in the book.

title: Daniel Chapter 12 Verse 2
text: And a number of those who are sleeping in the dust of the earth will come out of their sleep, some to eternal life and some to eternal shame.

title: Daniel Chapter 12 Verse 3
text: And those who are wise will be shining like the light of the outstretched sky; and those by whom numbers have been turned to righteousness will be like the stars for ever and ever.

title: Daniel Chapter 12 Verse 4
text: But as for you, O Daniel, let the words be kept secret and the book rolled up and kept shut till the time of the end: numbers will be going out of the way and troubles will be increased.

title: Daniel Chapter 12 Verse 5
text: Then I, Daniel, looking, saw two others, one at the edge of the river on this side and one at the edge of the river on that side.

title: Daniel Chapter 12 Verse 6
text: And I said to the man clothed in linen, who was over the waters of the river, How long will it be to the end of these wonders?

title: Daniel Chapter 12 Verse 7
text: Then in my hearing the man clothed in linen, who was over the river, lifting up his right hand and his left hand to heaven, took an oath by him who is living for ever that it would be a time, times, and a half; and when the power of the crusher of the holy people comes to an end, all these things will be ended.

title: Daniel Chapter 12 Verse 8
text: And the words came to my ears, but the sense of them was not clear to me: then I said, O my lord, what is the sense of these things?

title: Daniel Chapter 12 Verse 9
text: And he said, Go on your way, Daniel: for the words are secret and shut up till the time of the end;

title: Daniel Chapter 12 Verse 10
text: Till a number are tested and make themselves clean; and the evil-doers will do evil; for not one of the evil-doers will have knowledge; but all will be made clear to those who are wise.

title: Daniel Chapter 12 Verse 11
text: And from the time when the regular burned offering is taken away, and an unclean thing causing fear is put up, there will be a thousand, two hundred and ninety days.

title: Daniel Chapter 12 Verse 12
text: A blessing will be on the man who goes on waiting, and comes to the thousand, three hundred and thirty-five days.

title: Daniel Chapter 12 Verse 13
text: But you, go on your way and take your rest: for you will be in your place at the end of the days.

title: Hosea Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: The word of the Lord which came to Hosea, the son of Beeri, in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam, the son of Joash, king of Israel.

title: Hosea Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: The start of the word of the Lord by Hosea: And the Lord said to Hosea, Go, take for yourself a wife of loose ways, and children of the same, for the land has been untrue to the Lord.

title: Hosea Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: So he took as his wife Gomer, the daughter of Diblaim, and she gave birth to a son.

title: Hosea Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: And the Lord said to him, Give him the name of Jezreel, for after a little time I will send punishment for the blood of Jezreel on the line of Jehu, and put an end to the kingdom of Israel.

title: Hosea Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: And in that day I will let the bow of Israel be broken in the valley of Jezreel.

title: Hosea Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: And after that she gave birth to a daughter. And the Lord said, Give her the name Lo-ruhamah; for I will not again have mercy on Israel, to give them forgiveness.

title: Hosea Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: But I will have mercy on Judah and will give them salvation by the Lord their God, but not by the bow or the sword or by fighting or by horses or horsemen.

title: Hosea Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: Now when Lo-ruhamah had been taken from the breast, the woman gave birth to a son.

title: Hosea Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: And the Lord said, Give him the name Lo-ammi; for you are not my people, and I will not be your God.

title: Hosea Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: But still the number of the children of Israel will be like the sand of the sea, which may not be measured or numbered; and in place of its being said to them, You are not my people, it will be said to them, You are the sons of the living God

title: Hosea Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: And the children of Israel and the children of Judah will come together and take for themselves one head, and will go up from the land, for great will be the day of Jezreel.

title: Hosea Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: Say to your brothers, Ammi; and to your sisters, Ruhamah.

title: Hosea Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: Take up the cause against your mother, take it up, for she is not my wife, and I am not her husband; let her put away her loose ways from her face, and her false ways from between her breasts;

title: Hosea Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: For fear that I may take away her robe from her, making her uncovered as in the day of her birth; making her like a waste place and a dry land, causing her death through need of water.

title: Hosea Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: And I will have no mercy on her children, for they are the children of her loose ways.

title: Hosea Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: For their mother has been untrue; she who gave them birth has done things of shame, for she said, I will go after my lovers, who give me my bread and my water, my wool and my linen, my oil and my wine.

title: Hosea Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: For this cause I will put thorns in her road, building up a wall round her so that she may not go on her way.

title: Hosea Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: And if she goes after her lovers she will not overtake them; if she makes search for them she will not see them; then will she say, I will go back to my first husband, for then it was better for me than now.

title: Hosea Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: For she had no knowledge that it was I who gave her the grain and the wine and the oil, increasing her silver and gold which they gave to the Baal.

title: Hosea Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: So I will take away again my grain in its time and my wine, and I will take away my wool and my linen with which her body might have been covered.

title: Hosea Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: And now I will make her shame clear before the eyes of her lovers, and no one will take her out of my hand.

title: Hosea Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: And I will put an end to all her joy, her feasts, her new moons, and her Sabbaths, and all her regular meetings.

title: Hosea Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: And I will make waste her vines and her fig-trees, of which she has said, These are the payments which my lovers have made to me; and I will make them a waste of trees, and the beasts of the field will take them for food.

title: Hosea Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: And I will give her punishment for the days of the Baals, to whom she has been burning perfumes, when she made herself fair with her nose-rings and her jewels, and went after her lovers, giving no thought to me, says the Lord.

title: Hosea Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: For this cause I will make her come into the waste land and will say words of comfort to her.

title: Hosea Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: And I will give her vine-gardens from there, and the valley of Achor for a door of hope; and she will give her answer there as in the days when she was young, and as in the time when she came up out of the land of Egypt.

title: Hosea Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: And in that day, says the Lord, you will say to me, Ishi; and you will never again give me the name of Baali;

title: Hosea Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: For I will take away the names of the Baals out of her mouth, and never again will she say their names.

title: Hosea Chapter 2 Verse 18
text: And in that day I will make an agreement for them with the beasts of the field and the birds of heaven and the things which go low on the earth; I will put an end to the bow and the sword and war in all the land, and will make them take their rest in peace.

title: Hosea Chapter 2 Verse 19
text: And I will take you as my bride for ever; truly, I will take you as my bride in righteousness and in right judging, in love and in mercies.

title: Hosea Chapter 2 Verse 20
text: I will take you as my bride in good faith, and you will have knowledge of the Lord.

title: Hosea Chapter 2 Verse 21
text: And it will be, in that day, says the Lord, that I will give an answer to the heavens, and the heavens to the earth;

title: Hosea Chapter 2 Verse 22
text: And the earth will give its answer to the grain and the wine and the oil, and they will give an answer to Jezreel;

title: Hosea Chapter 2 Verse 23
text: And I will put her as seed in the earth, and I will have mercy on her to whom no mercy was given; and I will say to those who were not my people, You are my people, and they will say, My God.

title: Hosea Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to me, Give your love again to a woman who has a lover and is false to her husband, even as the Lord has love for the children of Israel, though they are turned to other gods and are lovers of grape-cakes.

title: Hosea Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: So I got her for myself for fifteen shekels of silver and a homer and a half of barley;

title: Hosea Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: And I said to her, You are to be mine for a long space of time; you are not to be false to me, and no other man is to have you for his wife; and so will I be to you.

title: Hosea Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: For the children of Israel will for a long time be without king and without ruler, without offerings and without pillars, and without ephod or images.

title: Hosea Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: And after that, the children of Israel will come back and go in search of the Lord their God and David their king; and they will come in fear to the Lord and to his mercies in the days to come.

title: Hosea Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: Give ear to the word of the Lord, O children of Israel; for the Lord has a cause against the people of this land, because there is no good faith in it, and no mercy and no knowledge of God in the land.

title: Hosea Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: There is cursing and broken faith, violent death and attacks on property, men are untrue in married life, houses are broken into, and there is blood touching blood.

title: Hosea Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: Because of this the land will be dry, and everyone living in it will be wasted away, with the beasts of the field and the birds of heaven; even the fishes of the sea will be taken away.

title: Hosea Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: Let no man go to law or make protests, for your people are like those who go to law with a priest.

title: Hosea Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: You will not be able to keep on your feet by day, and by night the prophet will be falling down with you, and I will give your mother to destruction.

title: Hosea Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: Destruction has overtaken my people because they have no knowledge; because you have given up knowledge, I will give you up, so that you will be no priest to me, because you have not kept in mind the law of your God, I will not keep your children in my memory.

title: Hosea Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: Even while they were increasing in number they were sinning against me; I will let their glory be changed into shame.

title: Hosea Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: The sin of my people is like food to them; and their desire is for their wrongdoing.

title: Hosea Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: And the priest will be like the people; I will give them punishment for their evil ways, and the reward of their acts.

title: Hosea Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: They will have food, but they will not be full; they will be false to me, but they will not be increased, because they no longer give thought to the Lord.

title: Hosea Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: Loose ways and new wine take away wisdom.

title: Hosea Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: My people get knowledge from their tree, and their rod gives them news; for a false spirit is the cause of their wandering, and they have been false to their God.

title: Hosea Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: They make offerings on the tops of mountains, burning perfumes in high places, under trees of every sort, because their shade is good: and so your daughters are given up to loose ways and your brides are false to their husbands.

title: Hosea Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: I will not give punishment to your daughters or your brides for their evil behaviour; for they make themselves separate with loose women, and make offerings with those who are used for sex purposes in the worship of the gods: the people who have no wisdom will be sent away.

title: Hosea Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: Do not you, O Israel, come into error; do not you, O Judah, come to Gilgal, or go up to Beth-aven, or take an oath, By the living Lord.

title: Hosea Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: For Israel is uncontrolled, like a cow which may not be controlled; now will the Lord give them food like a lamb in a wide place.

title: Hosea Chapter 4 Verse 17
text: Ephraim is joined to false gods; let him be.

title: Hosea Chapter 4 Verse 18
text: Their drink has become bitter; they are completely false; her rulers take pleasure in shame.

title: Hosea Chapter 4 Verse 19
text: They are folded in the skirts of the wind; they will be shamed because of their offerings.

title: Hosea Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: Give ear to this, O priests; give attention, O Israel, and you, family of the king; for you are to be judged; you have been a deceit at Mizpah and a net stretched out on Tabor.

title: Hosea Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: They have gone deep in the evil ways of Shittim, but I am the judge of all.

title: Hosea Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: I have knowledge of Ephraim, and Israel is not secret from me; for now, O Ephraim, you have been false to me, Israel has become unclean.

title: Hosea Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: Their works will not let them come back to their God, for a false spirit is in them and they have no knowledge of the Lord.

title: Hosea Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: And the pride of Israel gives an answer to his face; and Ephraim will have a fall through his sins, and the fall of Judah will be the same as theirs.

title: Hosea Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: They will go, with their flocks and their herds, in search of the Lord, but they will not see him; he has taken himself out of their view.

title: Hosea Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: They have been false to the Lord; they have given birth to strange children; now the new moon will make them waste with their fields.

title: Hosea Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: Let the horn be sounded in Gibeah and in Ramah; give a loud cry in Beth-aven, They are after you, O Benjamin.

title: Hosea Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: Ephraim will become a waste in the day of punishment; I have given knowledge among the tribes of Israel of what is certain.

title: Hosea Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: The rulers of Judah are like those who take away a landmark; I will let loose my wrath on them like flowing water.

title: Hosea Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: Ephraim is troubled; he is crushed by his judges, because he took pleasure in walking after deceit.

title: Hosea Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: And so to Ephraim I am like a wasting insect, and a destruction to the children of Judah.

title: Hosea Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: When Ephraim saw his disease and Judah his wound, then Ephraim went to Assyria and sent to the great king; but he is not able to make you well or give you help for your wound.

title: Hosea Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: For I will be to Ephraim as a lion, and as a young lion to the children of Judah; I, even I, will give him wounds and go away; I will take him away, and there will be no helper.

title: Hosea Chapter 5 Verse 15
text: I will go back to my place till they are made waste; in their trouble they will go after me early and will make search for me.

title: Hosea Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: Come, let us go back to the Lord; for he has given us wounds and he will make us well; he has given blows and he will give help.

title: Hosea Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: After two days he will give us life, and on the third day he will make us get up, and we will be living before him.

title: Hosea Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: And let us have knowledge, let us go after the knowledge of the Lord; his going out is certain as the dawn, his decisions go out like the light; he will come to us like the rain, like the spring rain watering the earth.

title: Hosea Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: O Ephraim, what am I to do to you? O Judah, what am I to do to you? For your love is like a morning cloud, and like the dew which goes early away.

title: Hosea Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: So I have had it cut in stones; I gave them teaching by the words of my mouth;

title: Hosea Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: Because my desire is for mercy and not offerings; for the knowledge of God more than for burned offerings.

title: Hosea Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: But like a man, they have gone against the agreement; there they were false to me.

title: Hosea Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: Gilead is a town of evil-doers, marked with blood.

title: Hosea Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: And like a band of thieves waiting for a man, so are the priests watching secretly the way of those going quickly to Shechem, for they are working with an evil design.

title: Hosea Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: In Israel I have seen a very evil thing; there false ways are seen in Ephraim, Israel is unclean;

title: Hosea Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: And Judah has put up disgusting images for himself.

title: Hosea Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: When my desire was for the fate of my people to be changed and to make Israel well, then the sin of Ephraim was made clear, and the evil-doing of Samaria; for their ways are false, and the thief comes into the house, while the band of outlaws takes property by force in the streets.

title: Hosea Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: And they do not say to themselves that I keep in mind all their sin; now their evil acts come round them on every side; they are before my face.

title: Hosea Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: In their sin they make a king for themselves, and rulers in their deceit.

title: Hosea Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: They are all untrue; they are like a burning oven; the bread-maker does not make up the fire from the time when the paste is mixed till it is leavened.

title: Hosea Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: On the day of our king, the rulers made him ill with the heat of wine; his hand was stretched out with the men of pride.

title: Hosea Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: For they have made their hearts ready like an oven, while they are waiting secretly; their wrath is sleeping all night; in the morning it is burning like a flaming fire.

title: Hosea Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: They are all heated like an oven, and they put an end to their judges; all their kings have been made low; not one among them makes prayer to me.

title: Hosea Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: Ephraim is mixed with the peoples; Ephraim is a cake not turned.

title: Hosea Chapter 7 Verse 9
text: Men from other lands have made waste his strength, and he is not conscious of it; grey hairs have come on him here and there, and he has no knowledge of it.

title: Hosea Chapter 7 Verse 10
text: And the pride of Israel gives an answer to his face; but for all this, they have not gone back to the Lord their God, or made search for him.

title: Hosea Chapter 7 Verse 11
text: And Ephraim is like a foolish dove, without wisdom; they send out their cry to Egypt, they go to Assyria.

title: Hosea Chapter 7 Verse 12
text: When they go, my net will be stretched out over them; I will take them like the birds of heaven, I will give them punishment, I will take them away in the net for their sin.

title: Hosea Chapter 7 Verse 13
text: May trouble be theirs! for they have gone far away from me; and destruction, for they have been sinning against me; I was ready to be their saviour, but they said false words against me.

title: Hosea Chapter 7 Verse 14
text: And they have not made prayer to me in their hearts, but they make loud cries on their beds; they are cutting themselves for food and wine, they are turned against me.

title: Hosea Chapter 7 Verse 15
text: Though I have given training and strength to their arms, they have evil designs against me.

title: Hosea Chapter 7 Verse 16
text: They have gone to what is of no value; they are like a false bow; their captains will come to destruction by the sword, and their ruler by my wrath; for this, the land of Egypt will make sport of them.

title: Hosea Chapter 8 Verse 1
text: Put the horn to your mouth. He comes like an eagle against the house of the Lord; because they have gone against my agreement, they have not kept my law.

title: Hosea Chapter 8 Verse 2
text: They will send up to me a cry for help: We, Israel, have knowledge of you, O God of Israel.

title: Hosea Chapter 8 Verse 3
text: Israel has given up what is good; his haters will go after him.

title: Hosea Chapter 8 Verse 4
text: They have put up kings, but not by me; they have made princes, but I had no knowledge of it; they have made images of silver and gold, so that they may be cut off.

title: Hosea Chapter 8 Verse 5
text: I will have nothing to do with your young ox, O Samaria; my wrath is burning against them; how long will it be before the children of Israel make themselves clean?

title: Hosea Chapter 8 Verse 6
text: The workman made it, it is no god; the ox of Samaria will be broken into bits.

title: Hosea Chapter 8 Verse 7
text: For they have been planting the wind, and their fruit will be the storm; his grain has no stem, it will give no meal, and if it does, a strange nation will take it.

title: Hosea Chapter 8 Verse 8
text: Israel has come to destruction; now they are among the nations like a cup in which there is no pleasure.

title: Hosea Chapter 8 Verse 9
text: For they have gone up to Assyria like an ass going by himself; Ephraim has given money to get lovers.

title: Hosea Chapter 8 Verse 10
text: But though they give money to the nations for help, still I will send them in all directions; and in a short time they will be without a king and rulers.

title: Hosea Chapter 8 Verse 11
text: Because Ephraim has been increasing altars for sin, altars have become a cause of sin to him.

title: Hosea Chapter 8 Verse 12
text: Though I put my law in writing for him in ten thousand rules, they are to him as a strange thing.

title: Hosea Chapter 8 Verse 13
text: He gives the offerings of his lovers, and takes the flesh for food; but the Lord has no pleasure in them; now he will keep in mind their evil-doing and give them the punishment of their sins; they will go back to Egypt.

title: Hosea Chapter 8 Verse 14
text: For Israel has no memory of his Maker, and has put up the houses of kings; and Judah has made great the number of his walled towns. But I will send a fire on his towns and put an end to his great houses.

title: Hosea Chapter 9 Verse 1
text: Have no joy, O Israel, and do not be glad like the nations; for you have been untrue to your God; your desire has been for the loose woman's reward on every grain-floor.

title: Hosea Chapter 9 Verse 2
text: The grain-floor and the place where the grapes are crushed will not give them food; there will be no new wine for them.

title: Hosea Chapter 9 Verse 3
text: They will have no resting-place in the Lord's land, but Ephraim will go back to Egypt, and they will take unclean food in Assyria.

title: Hosea Chapter 9 Verse 4
text: They will give no wine offering to the Lord, they will not make offerings ready for him; their bread will be like the bread of those in sorrow; all who take it will be unclean, because their bread will be only for their desire, it will not come into the house of the Lord.

title: Hosea Chapter 9 Verse 5
text: What will you do on the day of worship, and on the day of the feast of the Lord?

title: Hosea Chapter 9 Verse 6
text: For see, they are going away into Assyria; Egypt will get them together, Memphis will be their last resting-place; their fair silver vessels will be covered over with field plants, and thorns will come up in their tents.

title: Hosea Chapter 9 Verse 7
text: The days of punishment, the days of reward are come; Israel will be put to shame; the prophet is foolish, the man who has the spirit is off his head, because of your great sin.

title: Hosea Chapter 9 Verse 8
text: There is great hate against the watchman of Ephraim, the people of my God; as for the prophet, there is a net in all his ways, and hate in the house of his God.

title: Hosea Chapter 9 Verse 9
text: They have gone deep in evil as in the days of Gibeah; he will keep in mind their wrongdoing, he will give them punishment for their sins.

title: Hosea Chapter 9 Verse 10
text: I made discovery of Israel as of grapes in the waste land; I saw your fathers as the first-fruits of the fig-tree in her early fruit time; but they came to Baal-peor, and made themselves holy to the thing of shame, and became disgusting like that to which they gave their love.

title: Hosea Chapter 9 Verse 11
text: As for Ephraim, their glory will go in flight like a bird: there will be no birth and no one with child and no giving of life.

title: Hosea Chapter 9 Verse 12
text: Even though their children have come to growth I will take them away, so that not a man will be there; for their evil-doing will be complete and they will be put to shame because of it.

title: Hosea Chapter 9 Verse 13
text: As I have seen a beast whose young have been taken from her, so Ephraim will give birth to children only for them to be put to death.

title: Hosea Chapter 9 Verse 14
text: O Lord, what will you give them? Give them bodies which may not give birth and breasts without milk.

title: Hosea Chapter 9 Verse 15
text: All their evil-doing is in Gilgal; there I had hate for them; because of their evil-doing I will send them out of my house; they will no longer be dear to me; all their rulers are uncontrolled.

title: Hosea Chapter 9 Verse 16
text: The rod has come on Ephraim, their root is dry, let them have no fruit; even though they give birth, I will put to death the dearest fruit of their bodies.

title: Hosea Chapter 9 Verse 17
text: My God will give them up because they did not give ear to him; they will be wandering among the nations.

title: Hosea Chapter 10 Verse 1
text: Israel is a branching vine, full of fruit; as his fruit is increased, so the number of his altars is increased; as the land is fair, so they have made fair pillars.

title: Hosea Chapter 10 Verse 2
text: Their mind is taken away; now they will be made waste: he will have their altars broken down, he will give their pillars to destruction.

title: Hosea Chapter 10 Verse 3
text: Now, truly, they will say, We have no king, we have no fear of the Lord; and the king, what is he able to do for us?

title: Hosea Chapter 10 Verse 4
text: Their words are foolish; they make agreements with false oaths, so punishment will come up like a poison-plant in a ploughed field.

title: Hosea Chapter 10 Verse 5
text: The people of Samaria will be full of fear because of the ox of Beth-aven; its people will have sorrow for it, and its priests will give cries of grief for its glory, for the glory has gone in flight.

title: Hosea Chapter 10 Verse 6
text: And they will take it to Assyria and give it to the great king; shame will come on Ephraim, and Israel will be shamed because of its image.

title: Hosea Chapter 10 Verse 7
text: As for Samaria, her king is cut off, like mist on the water.

title: Hosea Chapter 10 Verse 8
text: And the high places of Aven, the sin of Israel, will come to destruction; thorns and waste plants will come up on their altars; they will say to the mountains, Be a cover over us; and to the hills, Come down on us.

title: Hosea Chapter 10 Verse 9
text: O Israel, you have done evil from the days of Gibeah; there they took up their position, so that the fighting against the children of evil might not overtake them in Gibeah.

title: Hosea Chapter 10 Verse 10
text: I will come and give them punishment; and the peoples will come together against them when I give them the reward of their two sins.

title: Hosea Chapter 10 Verse 11
text: And Ephraim is a trained cow, taking pleasure in crushing the grain; but I have put a yoke on her fair neck; I will put a horseman on the back of Ephraim; Judah will be working the plough, Jacob will be turning up the earth.

title: Hosea Chapter 10 Verse 12
text: Put in the seed of righteousness, get in your grain in mercy, let your unploughed earth be turned up: for it is time to make search for the Lord, till he comes and sends righteousness on you like rain.

title: Hosea Chapter 10 Verse 13
text: You have been ploughing sin, you have got in a store of evil, the fruit of deceit has been your food: for you put faith in your way, in the number of your men of war.

title: Hosea Chapter 10 Verse 14
text: So a great outcry will go up from among your people, and all your strong places will be broken, as Beth-arbel was broken by Shalman in the day of war, as the mother was broken on the rocks with her children.

title: Hosea Chapter 10 Verse 15
text: So will Beth-el do to you because of your evil-doing; at dawn will the king of Israel be cut off completely.

title: Hosea Chapter 11 Verse 1
text: When Israel was a child he was dear to me; and I took my son out of Egypt.

title: Hosea Chapter 11 Verse 2
text: When I sent for them, then they went away from me; they made offerings to the Baals, burning perfumes to images.

title: Hosea Chapter 11 Verse 3
text: But I was guiding Ephraim's footsteps; I took them up in my arms, but they were not conscious that I was ready to make them well.

title: Hosea Chapter 11 Verse 4
text: I made them come after me with the cords of a man, with the bands of love; I was to them as one who took the yoke from off their mouths, putting meat before them.

title: Hosea Chapter 11 Verse 5
text: He will go back to the land of Egypt and the Assyrian will be his king, because they would not come back to me.

title: Hosea Chapter 11 Verse 6
text: And the sword will go through his towns, wasting his children and causing destruction because of their evil designs.

title: Hosea Chapter 11 Verse 7
text: My people are given up to sinning against me; though their voice goes up on high, no one will be lifting them up.

title: Hosea Chapter 11 Verse 8
text: How may I give you up, O Ephraim? how may I be your saviour, O Israel? how may I make you like Admah? how may I do to you as I did to Zeboim? My heart is turned in me, it is soft with pity.

title: Hosea Chapter 11 Verse 9
text: I will not put into effect the heat of my wrath; I will not again send destruction on Ephraim; for I am God and not man, the Holy One among you; I will not put an end to you.

title: Hosea Chapter 11 Verse 10
text: They will go after the Lord; his cry will be like that of a lion; his cry will be loud, and the children will come from the west, shaking with fear;

title: Hosea Chapter 11 Verse 11
text: Shaking with fear like a bird, they will come out of Egypt, like a dove out of the land of Assyria: and I will give them rest in their houses, says the Lord.

title: Hosea Chapter 11 Verse 12
text: The deceit of Ephraim and the false words of Israel are about me on every side. ...

title: Hosea Chapter 12 Verse 1
text: Ephraim's food is the wind, and he goes after the east wind: deceit and destruction are increasing day by day; they make an agreement with Assyria, and take oil into Egypt.

title: Hosea Chapter 12 Verse 2
text: The Lord has a cause against Judah, and will give punishment to Jacob for his ways; he will give him the reward of his acts.

title: Hosea Chapter 12 Verse 3
text: In the body of his mother he took his brother by the foot, and in his strength he was fighting with God;

title: Hosea Chapter 12 Verse 4
text: He had a fight with the angel and overcame him; he made request for grace to him with weeping; he came face to face with him in Beth-el and there his words came to him;

title: Hosea Chapter 12 Verse 5
text: Even the Lord, the God of armies; the Lord is his name.

title: Hosea Chapter 12 Verse 6
text: So then, come back to your God; keep mercy and right, and be waiting at all times on your God.

title: Hosea Chapter 12 Verse 7
text: As for Canaan, the scales of deceit are in his hands; he takes pleasure in twisted ways.

title: Hosea Chapter 12 Verse 8
text: And Ephraim said, Now I have got wealth and much property; in all my works no sin may be seen in me.

title: Hosea Chapter 12 Verse 9
text: But I am the Lord your God from the land of Egypt; I will give you tents for your living-places again as in the days of the holy meeting.

title: Hosea Chapter 12 Verse 10
text: My word came to the ears of the prophets and I gave them visions in great number, and by the mouths of the prophets I made use of comparisons.

title: Hosea Chapter 12 Verse 11
text: In Gilead there is evil. They are quite without value; in Gilgal they make offerings of oxen; truly their altars are like masses of stones in the hollows of a ploughed field.

title: Hosea Chapter 12 Verse 12
text: And Jacob went in flight into the field of Aram, and Israel became a servant for a wife, and for a wife he kept sheep.

title: Hosea Chapter 12 Verse 13
text: And by a prophet the Lord made Israel come up out of Egypt, and by a prophet he was kept safe.

title: Hosea Chapter 12 Verse 14
text: I have been bitterly moved to wrath by Ephraim; so that his blood will be on him, and the Lord will make his shame come back on him.

title: Hosea Chapter 13 Verse 1
text: When the words of my law came from Ephraim, he was lifted up in Israel; but when he did evil through the Baal, death overtook him.

title: Hosea Chapter 13 Verse 2
text: And now their sins are increased; they have made themselves a metal image, false gods from their silver, after their designs, all of them the work of the metal-workers; they say of them, Let them give offerings, let men give kisses to the oxen.

title: Hosea Chapter 13 Verse 3
text: So they will be like the morning cloud, like the dew which goes early away, like the dust of the grain which the wind is driving out of the crushing-floor, like smoke going up from the fireplace.

title: Hosea Chapter 13 Verse 4
text: But I am the Lord your God, from the land of Egypt; you have knowledge of no other God and there is no saviour but me.

title: Hosea Chapter 13 Verse 5
text: I had knowledge of you in the waste land where no water was.

title: Hosea Chapter 13 Verse 6
text: When I gave them food they were full, and their hearts were full of pride, and they did not keep me in mind.

title: Hosea Chapter 13 Verse 7
text: So I will be like a lion to them; as a cruel beast I will keep watch by the road;

title: Hosea Chapter 13 Verse 8
text: I will come face to face with them like a bear whose young ones have been taken from her, and their inmost hearts will be broken; there the dogs will make a meal of them; they will be wounded by the beasts of the field.

title: Hosea Chapter 13 Verse 9
text: I have sent destruction on you, O Israel; who will be your helper?

title: Hosea Chapter 13 Verse 10
text: Where is your king, that he may be your saviour? and all your rulers, that they may take up your cause? of whom you said, Give me a king and rulers.

title: Hosea Chapter 13 Verse 11
text: I have given you a king, because I was angry, and have taken him away in my wrath.

title: Hosea Chapter 13 Verse 12
text: The wrongdoing of Ephraim is shut up; his sin is put away in secret.

title: Hosea Chapter 13 Verse 13
text: The pains of a woman in childbirth will come on him: he is an unwise son, for at this time it is not right for him to keep his place when children come to birth.

title: Hosea Chapter 13 Verse 14
text: I will give the price to make them free from the power of the underworld, I will be their saviour from death: O death! where are your pains? O underworld! where is your destruction? my eyes will have no pity.

title: Hosea Chapter 13 Verse 15
text: Though he gives fruit among his brothers, an east wind will come, the wind of the Lord coming up from the waste land, and his spring will become dry, his fountain will be without water: it will make waste the store of all the vessels of his desire.

title: Hosea Chapter 13 Verse 16
text: Samaria will be made waste, for she has gone against her God: they will be cut down by the sword, their little children will be broken on the rocks, their women who are with child will be cut open.

title: Hosea Chapter 14 Verse 1
text: O Israel, come back to the Lord your God; for your evil-doing has been the cause of your fall.

title: Hosea Chapter 14 Verse 2
text: Take with you words, and come back to the Lord; say to him, Let there be forgiveness for all wrongdoing, so that we may take what is good, and give in payment the fruit of our lips.

title: Hosea Chapter 14 Verse 3
text: Assyria will not be our salvation; we will not go on horses; we will not again say to the work of our hands, You are our gods; for in you there is mercy for the child who has no father.

title: Hosea Chapter 14 Verse 4
text: I will put right their errors; freely will my love be given to them, for my wrath is turned away from him.

title: Hosea Chapter 14 Verse 5
text: I will be as the dew to Israel; he will put out flowers like a lily, and send out his roots like Lebanon.

title: Hosea Chapter 14 Verse 6
text: His branches will be stretched out, he will be beautiful as the olive-tree and sweet-smelling as Lebanon.

title: Hosea Chapter 14 Verse 7
text: They will come back and have rest in his shade; their life will be made new like the grain, and they will put out flowers like the vine; his name will be like the wine of Lebanon.

title: Hosea Chapter 14 Verse 8
text: As for Ephraim, what has he to do with false gods any longer? I have given an answer and I will keep watch over him; I am like a branching fir-tree, from me comes your fruit.

title: Hosea Chapter 14 Verse 9
text: He who is wise will see these things; he who has good sense will have knowledge of them. For the ways of the Lord are straight, and the upright will go in them, but sinners will be falling in them.

title: Joel Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: The word of the Lord which came to Joel, the son of Pethuel.

title: Joel Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: Give ear to this, you old men, and take note, you people of the land. Has this ever been in your days, or in the days of your fathers?

title: Joel Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: Give the story of it to your children, and let them give it to their children, and their children to another generation.

title: Joel Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: What the worm did not make a meal of, has been taken by the locust; and what the locust did not take, has been food for the plant-worm; and what the plant-worm did not take, has been food for the field-fly.

title: Joel Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: Come out of your sleep, you who are overcome with wine, and give yourselves to weeping; give cries of sorrow, all you drinkers of wine, because of the sweet wine; for it has been cut off from your mouths.

title: Joel Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: For a nation has come up over my land, strong and without number; his teeth are the teeth of a lion, and he has the back teeth of a great lion.

title: Joel Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: By him my vine is made waste and my fig-tree broken: he has taken all its fruit and sent it down to the earth; its branches are made white.

title: Joel Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: Make sounds of grief like a virgin dressed in haircloth for the husband of her early years.

title: Joel Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: The meal offering and the drink offering have been cut off from the house of the Lord; the priests, the Lord's servants, are sorrowing.

title: Joel Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: The fields are wasted, the land has become dry; for the grain is wasted, the new wine is kept back, the oil is poor.

title: Joel Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: The farmers are shamed, the workers in the vine-gardens give cries of grief, for the wheat and the barley; for the produce of the fields has come to destruction.

title: Joel Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: The vine has become dry and the fig-tree is feeble; the pomegranate and the palm-tree and the apple-tree, even all the trees of the field, are dry: because joy has gone from the sons of men.

title: Joel Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: Put haircloth round you and give yourselves to sorrow, you priests; give cries of grief, you servants of the altar: come in, and, clothed in haircloth, let the night go past, you servants of my God: for the meal offering and the drink offering have been kept back from the house of your God.

title: Joel Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: Let a time be fixed for going without food, have a holy meeting, let the old men, even all the people of the land, come together to the house of the Lord your God, crying out to the Lord.

title: Joel Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: Sorrow for the day! for the day of the Lord is near, and as destruction from the Ruler of all it will come.

title: Joel Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: Is not food cut off before our eyes? joy and delight from the house of our God?

title: Joel Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: The grains have become small and dry under the spade; the store-houses are made waste, the grain-stores are broken down; for the grain is dry and dead.

title: Joel Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: What sounds of pain come from the beasts! the herds of cattle are at a loss because there is no grass for them; even the flocks of sheep are no longer to be seen.

title: Joel Chapter 1 Verse 19
text: O Lord, my cry goes up to you: for fire has put an end to the grass-lands of the waste, and all the trees of the field are burned with its flame.

title: Joel Chapter 1 Verse 20
text: The beasts of the field are turning to you with desire: for the water-streams are dry and fire has put an end to the grass-lands of the waste.

title: Joel Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: Let the horn be sounded in Zion, and a war-cry in my holy mountain; let all the people of the land be troubled: for the day of the Lord is coming;

title: Joel Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: For a day of dark and deep shade is near, a day of cloud and black night: like a black cloud a great and strong people is covering the mountains; there has never been any like them and will not be after them again, from generation to generation.

title: Joel Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: Before them fire sends destruction, and after them flame is burning: the land is like the garden of Eden before them, and after them an unpeopled waste; truly, nothing has been kept safe from them.

title: Joel Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: Their form is like the form of horses, and they are running like war-horses.

title: Joel Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: Like the sound of war-carriages they go jumping on the tops of the mountains; like the noise of a flame of fire burning up the grain-stems, like a strong people lined up for the fight.

title: Joel Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: At their coming the people are bent with pain: all faces become red together.

title: Joel Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: They are running like strong men, they go over the wall like men of war; every man goes straight on his way, their lines are not broken.

title: Joel Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: No one is pushing against another; everyone goes straight on his way: bursting through the sword points, their order is not broken.

title: Joel Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: They make a rush on the town, running on the wall; they go up into the houses and in through the windows like a thief.

title: Joel Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: The earth is troubled before them and the heavens are shaking: the sun and the moon have become dark, and the stars keep back their shining:

title: Joel Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: And the Lord is thundering before his forces; for very great is his army; for he is strong who gives effect to his word: for the day of the Lord is great and greatly to be feared, and who has strength against it?

title: Joel Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: But even now, says the Lord, come back to me with all your heart, keeping from food, with weeping and with sorrow:

title: Joel Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: Let your hearts be broken, and not your clothing, and come back to the Lord your God: for he is full of grace and pity, slow to be angry and great in mercy, ready to be turned from his purpose of punishment.

title: Joel Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: May it not be that he will again let his purpose be changed and let a blessing come after him, even a meal offering and a drink offering for the Lord your God?

title: Joel Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: Let a horn be sounded in Zion, let a time be fixed for going without food, have a holy meeting:

title: Joel Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: Get the people together, make the mass of the people holy, send for the old men, get together the children and babies at the breast: let the newly married man come out of his room and the bride from her tent.

title: Joel Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: Let the priests, the servants of the Lord, be weeping between the covered way and the altar, and let them say, Have mercy on your people, O Lord, do not give up your heritage to shame, so that the nations become their rulers: why let them say among the peoples, Where is their God?

title: Joel Chapter 2 Verse 18
text: Then the Lord had a care for the honour of his land and had pity on his people.

title: Joel Chapter 2 Verse 19
text: And the Lord made answer and said to his people, See, I will send you grain and wine and oil in full measure: and I will no longer let you be shamed among the nations:

title: Joel Chapter 2 Verse 20
text: I will send the one from the north far away from you, driving him into a dry and waste land, with his front to the sea of the east and his back to the sea of the west, and the smell of him will go up, even his evil smell will go up.

title: Joel Chapter 2 Verse 21
text: Have no fear, O land; be glad with great joy; for the Lord has done great things.

title: Joel Chapter 2 Verse 22
text: Have no fear, you beasts of the field, for the grass-lands of the waste are becoming green, for the trees are producing fruit, the fig-tree and the vine give out their strength.

title: Joel Chapter 2 Verse 23
text: Be glad, then, you children of Zion, and have joy in the Lord your God: for he gives you food in full measure, making the rain come down for you, the early and the late rain as at the first.

title: Joel Chapter 2 Verse 24
text: And the floors will be full of grain, and the crushing-places overflowing with wine and oil.

title: Joel Chapter 2 Verse 25
text: I will give back to you the years which were food for the locust, the plant-worm, the field-fly, and the worm, my great army which I sent among you.

title: Joel Chapter 2 Verse 26
text: You will have food in full measure, and give praise to the name of the Lord your God, who has done wonders for you:

title: Joel Chapter 2 Verse 27
text: And you will be certain that I am in Israel, and that I am the Lord your God, and there is no other: and my people will never be shamed.

title: Joel Chapter 2 Verse 28
text: And after that, it will come about, says the Lord, that I will send my spirit on all flesh; and your sons and your daughters will be prophets, your old men will have dreams, your young men will see visions:

title: Joel Chapter 2 Verse 29
text: And on the servants and the servant-girls in those days I will send my spirit.

title: Joel Chapter 2 Verse 30
text: And I will let wonders be seen in the heavens and on the earth, blood and fire and pillars of smoke.

title: Joel Chapter 2 Verse 31
text: The sun will be made dark and the moon turned to blood, before the great day of the Lord comes, a day to be feared.

title: Joel Chapter 2 Verse 32
text: And it will be that whoever makes his prayer to the name of the Lord will be kept safe: for in Mount Zion and in Jerusalem some will be kept safe, as the Lord has said, and will be among the small band marked out by the Lord.

title: Joel Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: For in those days and in that time, when I let the fate of Judah and Jerusalem be changed,

title: Joel Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: I will get together all the nations, and make them come down into the valley of Jehoshaphat; and there I will take up with them the cause of my people and of my heritage Israel, whom they have sent wandering among the nations, and of my land which has been parted by them.

title: Joel Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: And they have put the fate of my people to the decision of chance: giving a boy for the price of a loose woman and a girl for a drink of wine.

title: Joel Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: And further, what are you to me, O Tyre and Zidon and all the circle of Philistia? will you give me back any payment? and if you do, quickly and suddenly I will send it back on your head,

title: Joel Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: For you have taken my silver and my gold, putting in the houses of your gods my beautiful and pleasing things.

title: Joel Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: And the children of Judah and the children of Jerusalem you have given for a price to the sons of the Greeks, to send them far away from their land:

title: Joel Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: See, I will have them moved from the place where you have sent them, and will let what you have done come back on your head;

title: Joel Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: I will give your sons and your daughters into the hands of the children of Judah for a price, and they will give them for a price to the men of Sheba, a nation far off: for the Lord has said it.

title: Joel Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: Give this out among the nations; make ready for war: get the strong men awake; let all the men of war come near, let them come up.

title: Joel Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: Get your plough-blades hammered into swords, and your vine-knives into spears: let the feeble say, I am strong.

title: Joel Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: Come quickly, all you nations round about, and get yourselves together there: make your strong ones come down, O Lord.

title: Joel Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: Let the nations be awake, and come to the valley of Jehoshaphat: for there I will be seated as judge of all the nations round about.

title: Joel Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: Put in the blade, for the grain is ready: come, get you down, for the wine-crusher is full, the vessels are overflowing; for great is their evil-doing.

title: Joel Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: Masses on masses in the valley of decision! for the day of the Lord is near in the valley of decision.

title: Joel Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: The sun and the moon have become dark, and the stars keep back their shining.

title: Joel Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: And the Lord will be thundering from Zion, and his voice will be sounding from Jerusalem; and the heavens and the earth will be shaking: but the Lord will be a breastplate for his people and a strong place for the children of Israel.

title: Joel Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: And you will be certain that I am the Lord your God, living in Zion, my holy mountain: and Jerusalem will be holy, and no strange person will ever again go through her.

title: Joel Chapter 3 Verse 18
text: And it will come about in that day that the mountains will be dropping sweet wine, and the hills will be flowing with milk, and all the streams of Judah will be flowing with water; and a fountain will come out from the house of the Lord, watering the valley of acacia-trees.

title: Joel Chapter 3 Verse 19
text: Egypt will be a waste and Edom a land of destruction, because of the evil done to the children of Judah, because they have let blood be drained out in their land without cause.

title: Joel Chapter 3 Verse 20
text: But Judah will be peopled for ever, and Jerusalem from generation to generation.

title: Joel Chapter 3 Verse 21
text: And I will send punishment for their blood, for which punishment has not been sent, for the Lord is living in Zion.

title: Amos Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: The words of Amos, who was among the herdsmen of Tekoa; what he saw about Israel in the days of Uzziah, king of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam, the son of Joash, king of Israel, two years before the earth-shock.

title: Amos Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: And he said, The Lord will give a lion's cry from Zion, his voice will be sounding from Jerusalem; and the fields of the keepers of sheep will become dry, and the top of Carmel will be wasted away.

title: Amos Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: These are the words of the Lord: For three crimes of Damascus, and for four, I will not let its fate be changed; because they have been crushing Gilead with iron grain-crushing instruments.

title: Amos Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: And I will send a fire into the house of Hazael, burning up the great houses of Ben-hadad.

title: Amos Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: And I will have the locks of the door of Damascus broken, and him who is seated in power cut off from the valley of Aven, and him in whose hand is the rod from the house of Eden; and the people of Aram will go away as prisoners into Kir, says the Lord.

title: Amos Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: These are the words of the Lord: For three crimes of Gaza, and for four, I will not let its fate be changed; because they took all the people away prisoners, to give them up to Edom.

title: Amos Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: And I will send a fire on the wall of Gaza, burning up its great houses:

title: Amos Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: Him who is seated in power I will have cut off from Ashdod, and him in whose hand is the rod from Ashkelon; and my hand will be turned against Ekron, and the rest of the Philistines will come to destruction, says the Lord God.

title: Amos Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: These are the words of the Lord: For three crimes of Tyre, and for four, I will not let its fate be changed; because they gave up all the people prisoners to Edom, without giving a thought to the brothers' agreement between them.

title: Amos Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: And I will send a fire on the wall of Tyre, burning up its great houses.

title: Amos Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: These are the words of the Lord: For three crimes of Edom, and for four, I will not let its fate be changed; because his sword was turned against his brother, without pity, and his wrath was burning at all times, and he was angry for ever.

title: Amos Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: And I will send a fire on Teman, burning up the great houses of Bozrah.

title: Amos Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: These are the words of the Lord: For three crimes of the children of Ammon, and for four, I will not let its fate be changed; because in Gilead they had women with child cut open, so that they might make wider the limits of their land.

title: Amos Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: And I will make a fire in the wall of Rabbah, burning up its great houses, with loud cries in the days of war, with a storm in the day of the great wind:

title: Amos Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: And their king will be made prisoner, he and his captains together, says the Lord.

title: Amos Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: These are the words of the Lord: For three crimes of Moab, and for four, I will not let its fate be changed; because he had the bones of the king of Edom burned to dust.

title: Amos Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: And I will send a fire on Moab, burning up the great houses of Kerioth: and death will come on Moab with noise and outcries and the sound of the horn:

title: Amos Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: And I will have the judge cut off from among them, and all their captains I will put to death with him, says the Lord.

title: Amos Chapter 2 Verse 4
