text: These are the words of the Lord: For three crimes of Judah, and for four, I will not let its fate be changed; because they have given up the law of the Lord, and have not kept his rules; and their false ways, in which their fathers went, have made them go out of the right way.

title: Amos Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: And I will send a fire on Judah, burning up the great houses of Jerusalem.

title: Amos Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: These are the words of the Lord: For three crimes of Israel, and for four, I will not let its fate be changed; because they have given the upright man for silver, and the poor for the price of two shoes;

title: Amos Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: Crushing the head of the poor, and turning the steps of the gentle out of the way: and a man and his father go in to the same young woman, putting shame on my holy name:

title: Amos Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: By every altar they are stretched on clothing taken from those who are in their debt, drinking in the house of their god the wine of those who have made payment for wrongdoing.

title: Amos Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: Though I sent destruction on the Amorite before them, who was tall as the cedar and strong as the oak-tree, cutting off his fruit from on high and his roots from under the earth.

title: Amos Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: And I took you up out of the land of Egypt, guiding you for forty years in the waste land, so that you might take for your heritage the land of the Amorite.

title: Amos Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: And some of your sons I made prophets, and some of your young men I made separate for myself. Is it not even so, O children of Israel? says the Lord.

title: Amos Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: But to those who were separate you gave wine for drink; and to the prophets you said, Be prophets no longer.

title: Amos Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: See, I am crushing you down, as one is crushed under a cart full of grain.

title: Amos Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: And flight will be impossible for the quick-footed, and the force of the strong will become feeble, and the man of war will not get away safely:

title: Amos Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: And the bowman will not keep his place; he who is quick-footed will not get away safely: and the horseman will not keep his life.

title: Amos Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: And he who is without fear among the fighting men will go in flight without his clothing in that day, says the Lord.

title: Amos Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: Give ear to this word which the Lord has said against you, O children of Israel, against all the family which I took up out of the land of Egypt, saying,

title: Amos Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: You only of all the families of the earth have I taken care of: for this reason I will send punishment on you for all your sins.

title: Amos Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: Is it possible for two to go walking together, if not by agreement?

title: Amos Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: Will a lion give his loud cry in the woodland when no food is there? will the voice of the young lion be sounding from his hole if he has taken nothing?

title: Amos Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: Is it possible for a bird to be taken in a net on the earth where no net has been put for him? will the net come up from the earth if it has taken nothing at all?

title: Amos Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: If the horn is sounded in the town will the people not be full of fear? will evil come on a town if the Lord has not done it?

title: Amos Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: Certainly the Lord will do nothing without making clear his secret to his servants, the prophets.

title: Amos Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: The cry of the lion is sounding; who will not have fear? The Lord God has said the word; is it possible for the prophet to keep quiet?

title: Amos Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: Give out the news in the great houses of Assyria and in the land of Egypt, and say, Come together on the mountains of Samaria, and see what great outcries are there, and what cruel acts are done in it.

title: Amos Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: For they have no knowledge of how to do what is right, says the Lord, who are storing up violent acts and destruction in their great houses.

title: Amos Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: For this reason, says the Lord, an attacker will come, shutting in the land on every side; and your strength will come down and your great houses will be made waste.

title: Amos Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: These are the words of the Lord: As the keeper of sheep takes out of the mouth of the lion two legs or part of an ear; so will the children of Israel be made safe, who are resting in Samaria on seats of honour or on the silk cushions of a bed.

title: Amos Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: Give ear now, and give witness against the family of Jacob, says the Lord God, the God of armies;

title: Amos Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: For in the day when I give Israel punishment for his sins, I will send punishment on the altars of Beth-el, and the horns of the altar will be cut off and come down to the earth.

title: Amos Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: And I will send destruction on the winter house with the summer house; the ivory houses will be falling down and the great houses will come to an end, says the Lord.

title: Amos Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: Give ear to this word, you cows of Bashan, who are in the hill of Samaria, by whom the poor are kept down, and those in need are crushed; who say to their lords, Get out the wine and give us drink.

title: Amos Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: The Lord God has taken an oath by his holy name, that the days are coming when they will take you away with hooks, and the rest of you with fish-hooks.

title: Amos Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: And you will go out through the broken places, every one going straight before her, and you will be sent into Harmon, says the Lord.

title: Amos Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: Come to Beth-el and do evil; to Gilgal, increasing the number of your sins; come with your offerings every morning and your tenths every three days:

title: Amos Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: Let that which is leavened be burned as a praise-offering, let the news of your free offerings be given out publicly; for this is pleasing to you, O children of Israel, says the Lord.

title: Amos Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: But in all your towns I have kept food from your teeth, and in all your places there has been need of bread: and still you have not come back to me, says the Lord.

title: Amos Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: And I have kept back the rain from you, when it was still three months before the grain-cutting: I sent rain on one town and kept it back from another: one part was rained on, and the part where there was no rain became a waste.

title: Amos Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: So two or three towns went wandering to one town looking for water, and did not get enough: and still you have not come back to me, says the Lord.

title: Amos Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: I have sent destruction on your fields by burning and disease: the increase of your gardens and your vine-gardens, your fig-trees and your olive-trees, has been food for worms: and still you have not come back to me, says the Lord.

title: Amos Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: I have sent disease among you, as it was in Egypt: I have put your young men to the sword, and have taken away your horses; I have made the evil smell from your tents come up to your noses: and still you have not come back to me, says the Lord.

title: Amos Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: And I have sent destruction among you, as when God sent destruction on Sodom and Gomorrah, and you were like a burning stick pulled out of the fire: and still you have not come back to me, says the Lord.

title: Amos Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: So this is what I will do to you, O Israel: and because I will do this to you, be ready for a meeting with your God, O Israel.

title: Amos Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: For see, he who gave form to the mountains and made the wind, giving knowledge of his purpose to man, who makes the morning dark, and is walking on the high places of the earth: the Lord, the God of armies, is his name.

title: Amos Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: Give ear to this word, my song of sorrow over you, O children of Israel.

title: Amos Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: The virgin of Israel has been made low, never again to be lifted up: she is stretched out by herself on her land; there is no one to put her on her feet again.

title: Amos Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: For these are the words of the Lord God: The town which was able to send out a thousand, will have only a hundred; and that which sent out a hundred, will have only ten, in Israel.

title: Amos Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: For these are the words of the Lord to the children of Israel: Let your hearts be turned to me, so that you may have life:

title: Amos Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: Do not be looking for help to Beth-el, and do not go to Gilgal, or make your way to Beer-sheba: for Gilgal will certainly be taken prisoner, and Beth-el will come to nothing.

title: Amos Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: Go to the Lord for help so that you may have life; for fear that he may come like fire bursting out in the family of Joseph, causing destruction, and there will be no one to put it out in Beth-el.

title: Amos Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: You who make the work of judging a bitter thing, crushing down righteousness to the earth;

title: Amos Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: Go for help to him who makes Orion and the Pleiades, by whom the deep dark is turned into morning, who makes the day black with night; whose voice goes out to the waters of the sea, sending them out over the face of the earth: the Lord is his name;

title: Amos Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: Who sends sudden destruction on the strong, so that destruction comes on the walled town.

title: Amos Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: They have hate for him who makes protest against evil in the public place, and he whose words are upright is disgusting to them.

title: Amos Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: So because the poor man is crushed under your feet, and you take taxes from him of grain: you have made for yourselves houses of cut stone, but you will not take your rest in them; the fair vine-gardens planted by your hands will not give you wine.

title: Amos Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: For I have seen how your evil-doing is increased and how strong are your sins, you troublers of the upright, who take rewards and do wrong to the cause of the poor in the public place.

title: Amos Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: So the wise will say nothing in that time; for it is an evil time.

title: Amos Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: Go after good and not evil, so that life may be yours: and so the Lord, the God of armies, will be with you, as you say.

title: Amos Chapter 5 Verse 15
text: Be haters of evil and lovers of good, and let right be done in the public place: it may be that the Lord, the God of armies, will have mercy on the rest of Joseph.

title: Amos Chapter 5 Verse 16
text: So these are the words of the Lord, the God of armies, the Lord: There will be weeping in all the open spaces; and in all the streets they will say, Sorrow! sorrow! and they will get in the farmer to the weeping, and the makers of sad songs to give cries of grief.

title: Amos Chapter 5 Verse 17
text: In all the vine-gardens there will be cries of grief: for I will go through among you, says the Lord.

title: Amos Chapter 5 Verse 18
text: Sorrow to you who are looking for the day of the Lord! what is the day of the Lord to you? it is dark and not light.

title: Amos Chapter 5 Verse 19
text: As if a man, running away from a lion, came face to face with a bear; or went into the house and put his hand on the wall and got a bite from a snake.

title: Amos Chapter 5 Verse 20
text: Will not the day of the Lord be dark and not light? even very dark, with no light shining in it?

title: Amos Chapter 5 Verse 21
text: Your feasts are disgusting to me, I will have nothing to do with them; I will take no delight in your holy meetings.

title: Amos Chapter 5 Verse 22
text: Even if you give me your burned offerings and your meal offerings, I will not take pleasure in them: I will have nothing to do with the peace-offerings of your fat beasts.

title: Amos Chapter 5 Verse 23
text: Take away from me the noise of your songs; my ears are shut to the melody of your instruments.

title: Amos Chapter 5 Verse 24
text: But let the right go rolling on like waters, and righteousness like an ever-flowing stream.

title: Amos Chapter 5 Verse 25
text: Did you come to me with offerings of beasts and meal offerings in the waste land for forty years, O Israel?

title: Amos Chapter 5 Verse 26
text: Truly, you will take up Saccuth your king and Kaiwan your images, the star of your god, which you made for yourselves.

title: Amos Chapter 5 Verse 27
text: And I will send you away as prisoners farther than Damascus, says the Lord, whose name is the God of armies.

title: Amos Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: Sorrow to those who are resting in comfort in Zion, and to those who have no fear of danger in the mountain of Samaria, the noted men of the chief of the nations, to whom the people of Israel come!

title: Amos Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: Go on to Calneh and see; and from there go to Hamath the great; then go down to Gath of the Philistines: are you better than these kingdoms? or is your land wider than theirs?

title: Amos Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: You who put far away the evil day, causing the rule of the violent to come near;

title: Amos Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: Who are resting on beds of ivory, stretched out on soft seats, feasting on lambs from the flock and young oxen from the cattle-house;

title: Amos Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: Making foolish songs to the sound of corded instruments, and designing for themselves instruments of music, like David;

title: Amos Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: Drinking wine in basins, rubbing themselves with the best oils; but they have no grief for the destruction of Joseph.

title: Amos Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: So now they will go away prisoners with the first of those who are made prisoners, and the loud cry of those who were stretched out will come to an end.

title: Amos Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: The Lord God has taken an oath by himself, says the Lord, the God of armies: the pride of Jacob is disgusting to me, and I have hate for his great houses: so I will give up the town with everything in it.

title: Amos Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: Then it will come about that if there are still ten men in a house, death will overtake them.

title: Amos Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: And when a man's relation, even the one who is responsible for burning his body, lifting him up to take his bones out of the house, says to him who is in the inmost part of the house, Is there still anyone with you? and he says, No; then he will say, Keep quiet, for the name of the Lord may not be named.

title: Amos Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: For see, at the order of the Lord the great house will be full of cracks and the little house will be broken.

title: Amos Chapter 6 Verse 12
text: Is it possible for horses to go running on the rock? may the sea be ploughed with oxen? for the right to be turned by you into poison, and the fruit of righteousness into a bitter plant?

title: Amos Chapter 6 Verse 13
text: You whose joy is in a thing of no value, who say, Have we not taken for ourselves horns by the strength which is ours?

title: Amos Chapter 6 Verse 14
text: For see, I will send against you a nation, O Israel, says the Lord, the God of armies, ruling you cruelly from the way into Hamath as far as the stream of the Arabah.

title: Amos Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: This is what the Lord God let me see: and I saw that, when the growth of the late grass was starting, he made locusts; it was the late growth after the king's cutting was done.

title: Amos Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: And it came about that after they had taken all the grass of the land, I said, O Lord God, have mercy: how will Jacob be able to keep his place? for he is small.

title: Amos Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: The Lord, changing his purpose about this, said, It will not be.

title: Amos Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: This is what the Lord let me see: and I saw that the Lord God sent for a great fire to be the instrument of his punishment; and, after burning up the great deep, it was about to put an end to the Lord's heritage.

title: Amos Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: Then said I, O Lord God, let there be an end: how will Jacob be able to keep his place? for he is small.

title: Amos Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: The Lord, changing his purpose about this, said, And this will not be.

title: Amos Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: This is what he let me see: and I saw the Lord stationed by a wall made straight by a weighted line, and he had a weighted line in his hand.

title: Amos Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: And the Lord said to me, Amos, what do you see? And I said, A weighted line. Then the Lord said, See, I will let down a weighted line among my people Israel; never again will my eyes be shut to their sin:

title: Amos Chapter 7 Verse 9
text: And the high places of Isaac will be unpeopled, and the holy places of Israel will be made waste; and I will come up against the family of Jeroboam with the sword.

title: Amos Chapter 7 Verse 10
text: Then Amaziah, the priest of Beth-el, sent to Jeroboam, king of Israel, saying, Amos has made designs against you among the people of Israel: the land is troubled by his words.

title: Amos Chapter 7 Verse 11
text: For Amos has said, Jeroboam will be put to the sword, and Israel will certainly be taken away as a prisoner out of his land.

title: Amos Chapter 7 Verse 12
text: And Amaziah said to Amos, O seer, go in flight into the land of Judah, and there get your living by working as a prophet:

title: Amos Chapter 7 Verse 13
text: But be a prophet no longer at Beth-el: for it is the holy place of the king, and the king's house.

title: Amos Chapter 7 Verse 14
text: Then Amos in answer said to Amaziah, I am no prophet, or one of the sons of the prophets; I am a herdman and one who takes care of sycamore-trees:

title: Amos Chapter 7 Verse 15
text: And the Lord took me from the flock, and the Lord said to me, Go, be a prophet to my people Israel.

title: Amos Chapter 7 Verse 16
text: Now then, give ear to the word of the Lord: You say, Be no prophet to Israel, and say not a word against the people of Isaac.

title: Amos Chapter 7 Verse 17
text: So this is what the Lord has said: Your wife will be a loose woman in the town, and your sons and your daughters will be put to the sword, and your land will be cut up into parts by a line; and you yourself will come to your end in an unclean land, and Israel will certainly be taken away a prisoner out of his land.

title: Amos Chapter 8 Verse 1
text: This is what the Lord God let me see: and I saw a basket of summer fruit.

title: Amos Chapter 8 Verse 2
text: And he said, Amos, what do you see? And I said, A basket of summer fruit. Then the Lord said to me, The end has come to my people Israel; never again will my eyes be shut to their sin.

title: Amos Chapter 8 Verse 3
text: And the songs of the king's house will be cries of pain in that day, says the Lord God: great will be the number of the dead bodies, and everywhere they will put them out without a word.

title: Amos Chapter 8 Verse 4
text: Give ear to this, you who are crushing the poor, and whose purpose is to put an end to those who are in need in the land,

title: Amos Chapter 8 Verse 5
text: Saying, When will the new moon be gone, so that we may do trade in grain? and the Sabbath, so that we may put out in the market the produce of our fields? making the measure small and the price great, and trading falsely with scales of deceit;

title: Amos Chapter 8 Verse 6
text: Getting the poor for silver, and him who is in need for the price of two shoes, and taking a price for the waste parts of the grain.

title: Amos Chapter 8 Verse 7
text: The Lord has taken an oath by the pride of Jacob, Truly I will ever keep in mind all their works.

title: Amos Chapter 8 Verse 8
text: Will not the land be shaking with fear because of this, and everyone in it have sorrow? and all of it will be overflowing like the River; and it will be troubled and go down again like the River of Egypt.

title: Amos Chapter 8 Verse 9
text: And it will come about in that day, says the Lord God, that I will make the sun go down in the middle of the day, and I will make the earth dark in daylight:

title: Amos Chapter 8 Verse 10
text: Your feasts will be turned into sorrow and all your melody into songs of grief; everyone will be clothed with haircloth, and the hair of every head will be cut; I will make the weeping like that for an only son, and the end of it like a bitter day.

title: Amos Chapter 8 Verse 11
text: See, the days are coming, says the Lord God, when I will send times of great need on the land, not need of food or desire for water, but for hearing the words of the Lord.

title: Amos Chapter 8 Verse 12
text: And they will go wandering from sea to sea, and from the north even to the east, running here and there in search of the word of the Lord, and they will not get it.

title: Amos Chapter 8 Verse 13
text: In that day the fair virgins and the young men will be feeble from need of water.

title: Amos Chapter 8 Verse 14
text: Those who make their oaths by the sin of Samaria and say, By the life of your God, O Dan; and, By the living way of Beer-sheba; even they will go down, never again to be lifted up.

title: Amos Chapter 9 Verse 1
text: I saw the Lord stationed by the side of the altar, giving blows to the tops of the pillars so that the doorsteps were shaking: and he said, I will let all of them be broken with earth-shocks; I will put the last of them to the sword: if any one of them goes in flight he will not get away, not one of them will be safe.

title: Amos Chapter 9 Verse 2
text: Even if they go deep into the underworld, my hand will take them up from there; if they go up to heaven, I will get them down:

title: Amos Chapter 9 Verse 3
text: Though they take cover on the top of Carmel, I will go in search of them and get them out; though they keep themselves from my eyes in the bed of the sea, I will give orders to the great snake there and he will give them a bite:

title: Amos Chapter 9 Verse 4
text: And though they are taken away as prisoners by their attackers, even there will I give orders to the sword to put them to death: my eyes will be fixed on them for evil and not for good.

title: Amos Chapter 9 Verse 5
text: For the Lord, the God of armies, is he at whose touch the land is turned to water, and everyone in it will be given up to sorrow; all of it will be overflowing like the River, and will go down again like the River of Egypt;

title: Amos Chapter 9 Verse 6
text: It is he who makes his rooms in the heaven, basing his arch on the earth; whose voice goes out to the waters of the sea, and sends them flowing over the face of the earth; the Lord is his name.

title: Amos Chapter 9 Verse 7
text: Are you not as the children of the Ethiopians to me, O children of Israel? says the Lord. Have I not taken Israel up out of the land of Egypt, and the Philistines from Caphtor, and the Aramaeans from Kir?

title: Amos Chapter 9 Verse 8
text: See, the eyes of the Lord are on the evil kingdom, and I will put an end to it in all the earth; but I will not send complete destruction on Jacob, says the Lord.

title: Amos Chapter 9 Verse 9
text: For see, I will give orders, and I will have Israel moved about among all the nations, as grain is moved about by the shaking of the tray, but not the smallest seed will be dropped on the earth.

title: Amos Chapter 9 Verse 10
text: All those sinners among my people will be put to the sword who say, Evil will not overtake us or come face to face with us.

title: Amos Chapter 9 Verse 11
text: In that day I will put up the tent of David which has come down, and make good its broken places; and I will put up again his damaged walls, building it up as in the past;

title: Amos Chapter 9 Verse 12
text: So that the rest of Edom may be their heritage, and all the nations who have been named by my name, says the Lord, who is doing this.

title: Amos Chapter 9 Verse 13
text: See, the days will come, says the Lord, when the ploughman will overtake him who is cutting the grain, and the crusher of the grapes him who is planting seed; and sweet wine will be dropping from the mountains, and the hills will be turned into streams of wine.

title: Amos Chapter 9 Verse 14
text: And I will let the fate of my people Israel be changed, and they will be building up again the waste towns and living in them; they will again be planting vine-gardens and taking the wine for their drink; and they will make gardens and get the fruit of them.

title: Amos Chapter 9 Verse 15
text: And I will have them planted in their land, and never again will they be uprooted from their land which I have given them, says the Lord your God.

title: Obadiah Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: The vision of Obadiah. This is what the Lord has said about Edom: We have had word from the Lord, and a representative has been sent among the nations, saying, Up! and let us make war against her.

title: Obadiah Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: See, I have made you small among the nations: you are much looked down on.

title: Obadiah Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: You have been tricked by the pride of your heart, O you whose living-place is in the cracks of the rock, whose house is high up; who has said in his heart, Who will make me come down to earth?

title: Obadiah Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: Though you go up on high like an eagle, though your house is placed among the stars, I will make you come down from there, says the Lord.

title: Obadiah Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: If thieves came, attacking you by night, (how are you cut off!) would they not go on taking till they had enough? if men came cutting your grapes would they take them all?

title: Obadiah Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: How are the things of Esau searched out! how are his secret stores looked for!

title: Obadiah Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: All the men who were united with you have been false to you, driving you out to the edge of the land: the men who were at peace with you have overcome you; they have taken their heritage in your place.

title: Obadiah Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: Will I not, in that day, says the Lord, take away the wise men out of Edom, and wisdom out of the mountain of Esau?

title: Obadiah Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: And your men of war, O Teman, will be overcome with fear, so that every one of them may be cut off from the mountain of Esau.

title: Obadiah Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: Because you were the cause of violent death and because of your cruel behaviour to your brother Jacob, you will be covered with shame and will be cut off for ever.

title: Obadiah Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: Because you were there watching when men from other lands took away his goods, and strange men came into his doors, and put the fate of Jerusalem to the decision of chance; you were like one of them.

title: Obadiah Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: Do not see with pleasure your brother's evil day, the day of his fate, and do not be glad over the children of Judah on the day of their destruction, or make wide your mouth on the day of trouble.

title: Obadiah Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: Do not go into the doors of my people on the day of their downfall; do not be looking on their trouble with pleasure on the day of their downfall, or put your hands on their goods on the day of their downfall.

title: Obadiah Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: And do not take your place at the cross-roads, cutting off those of his people who get away; and do not give up to their haters those who are still there in the day of trouble.

title: Obadiah Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: For the day of the Lord is coming quickly on all nations: as you have done it will be done to you; the reward of your acts will come on your head.

title: Obadiah Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: For as you have been drinking on my holy mountain, so will all the nations go on drinking without end; they will go on drinking and the wine will go down their throats, and they will be as if they had never been.

title: Obadiah Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: But in Mount Zion some will be kept safe, and it will be holy; and the children of Jacob will take their heritage.

title: Obadiah Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: And the children of Jacob will be a fire and those of Joseph a flame, and the children of Esau dry stems of grass, burned up by them till all is gone: and there will be no people living in Esau; for the Lord has said it.

title: Obadiah Chapter 1 Verse 19
text: And they will take the South, and the lowland, and the country of Ephraim, and Gilead, as their heritage.

title: Obadiah Chapter 1 Verse 20
text: And those of the children of Israel who were the first to be taken away as prisoners, will have their heritage among the Canaanites as far as Zarephath; and those who were taken away from Jerusalem, who are in Sepharad, will have the towns of the South.

title: Obadiah Chapter 1 Verse 21
text: And those who have been kept safe will come up from Mount Zion to be judges of the mountain of Esau; and the kingdom will be the Lord's.

title: Jonah Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: And the word of the Lord came to Jonah, the son of Amittai, saying,

title: Jonah Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: Up! go to Nineveh, that great town, and let your voice come to it; for their evil-doing has come up before me.

title: Jonah Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: And Jonah got up to go in flight to Tarshish, away from the Lord; and he went down to Joppa, and saw there a ship going to Tarshish: so he gave them the price of the journey and went down into it to go with them to Tarshish, away from the Lord.

title: Jonah Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: And the Lord sent out a great wind on to the sea and there was a violent storm in the sea, so that the ship seemed in danger of being broken.

title: Jonah Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: Then the sailors were full of fear, every man crying to his god; and the goods in the ship were dropped out into the sea to make the weight less. But Jonah had gone down into the inmost part of the ship where he was stretched out in a deep sleep.

title: Jonah Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: And the ship's captain came to him and said to him, What are you doing sleeping? Up! say a prayer to your God, if by chance God will give a thought to us, so that we may not come to destruction.

title: Jonah Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: And they said to one another, Come, let us put this to the decision of chance and see on whose account this evil has come on us. So they did so, and Jonah was seen to be the man.

title: Jonah Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: Then they said to him, Now make clear to us what is your work, and where you come from? what is your country, and who are your people?

title: Jonah Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: And he said to them, I am a Hebrew, a worshipper of the Lord, the God of heaven, who made the sea and the dry land.

title: Jonah Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: And the men were in great fear, and they said to him, What is this you have done? For the men had knowledge of his flight from the Lord because he had not kept it from them.

title: Jonah Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: And they said to him, What are we to do to you so that the sea may become calm for us? For the sea was getting rougher and rougher.

title: Jonah Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: And he said to them, Take me up and put me into the sea, and the sea will become calm for you: for I am certain that because of me this great storm has come on you.

title: Jonah Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: And the men were working hard to get back to the land, but they were not able to do so: for the sea got rougher and rougher against them.

title: Jonah Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: So, crying to the Lord, they said, Give ear to our prayer, O Lord, give ear, and do not let destruction overtake us because of this man's life; do not put on us the sin of taking life without cause: for you, O Lord, have done what seemed good to you.

title: Jonah Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: So they took Jonah up and put him into the sea: and the sea was no longer angry.

title: Jonah Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: Then great was the men's fear of the Lord; and they made an offering to the Lord and took oaths to him.

title: Jonah Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: And the Lord made ready a great fish to take Jonah into its mouth; and Jonah was inside the fish for three days and three nights.

title: Jonah Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: Then Jonah made prayer to the Lord his God from the inside of the fish, and said,

title: Jonah Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: In my trouble I was crying to the Lord, and he gave me an answer; out of the deepest underworld I sent up a cry, and you gave ear to my voice.

title: Jonah Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: For you have put me down into the deep, into the heart of the sea; and the river was round about me; all your waves and your rolling waters went over me.

title: Jonah Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: And I said, I have been sent away from before your eyes; how may I ever again see your holy Temple?

title: Jonah Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: The waters were circling round me, even to the neck; the deep was about me; the sea-grass was twisted round my head.

title: Jonah Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: I went down to the bases of the mountains; as for the earth, her walls were about me for ever: but you have taken up my life from the underworld, O Lord my God.

title: Jonah Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: When my soul in me was overcome, I kept the memory of the Lord: and my prayer came in to you, into your holy Temple.

title: Jonah Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: The worshippers of false gods have given up their only hope.

title: Jonah Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: But I will make an offering to you with the voice of praise; I will give effect to my oaths. Salvation is the Lord's.

title: Jonah Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: And at the Lord's order, the fish sent Jonah out of its mouth on to the dry land.

title: Jonah Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: And the word of the Lord came to Jonah a second time, saying,

title: Jonah Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: Up! go to Nineveh, that great town, and give it the word which I have given you.

title: Jonah Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: So Jonah got up and went to Nineveh as the Lord had said. Now Nineveh was a very great town, three days' journey from end to end.

title: Jonah Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: And Jonah first of all went a day's journey into the town, and crying out said, In forty days destruction will overtake Nineveh.

title: Jonah Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: And the people of Nineveh had belief in God; and a time was fixed for going without food, and they put on haircloth, from the greatest to the least.

title: Jonah Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: And the word came to the king of Nineveh, and he got up from his seat of authority, and took off his robe, and covering himself with haircloth, took his seat in the dust.

title: Jonah Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: And he had it given out in Nineveh, By the order of the king and his great men, no man or beast, herd or flock, is to have a taste of anything; let them have no food or water:

title: Jonah Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: And let man and beast be covered with haircloth, and let them make strong prayers to God: and let everyone be turned from his evil way and the violent acts of their hands.

title: Jonah Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: Who may say that God will not be turned, changing his purpose and turning away from his burning wrath, so that destruction may not overtake us?

title: Jonah Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: And God saw what they did, how they were turned from their evil way; and God's purpose was changed as to the evil which he said he would do to them, and he did it not.

title: Jonah Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: But this seemed very wrong to Jonah, and he was angry.

title: Jonah Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: And he made prayer to the Lord and said, O Lord, is this not what I said when I was still in my country? This is why I took care to go in flight to Tarshish: for I was certain that you were a loving God, full of pity, slow to be angry and great in mercy, and ready to be turned from your purpose of evil.

title: Jonah Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: So now, O Lord, give ear to my prayer and take my life from me; for death is better for me than life.

title: Jonah Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: And the Lord said, Have you any right to be angry?

title: Jonah Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: Then Jonah went out of the town, and took his seat on the east side of the town and made himself a roof of branches and took his seat under its shade till he saw what would become of the town.

title: Jonah Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: And the Lord God made a vine come up over Jonah to give him shade over his head. And Jonah was very glad because of the vine.

title: Jonah Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: But early on the morning after, God made ready a worm for the destruction of the vine, and it became dry and dead.

title: Jonah Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: Then when the sun came up, God sent a burning east wind: and so great was the heat of the sun on his head that Jonah was overcome, and, requesting death for himself, said, Death is better for me than life.

title: Jonah Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: And the Lord said to Jonah, Have you any right to be angry about the vine? And he said, I have a right to be truly angry.

title: Jonah Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: And the Lord said, You had pity on the vine, for which you did no work and for the growth of which you were not responsible; which came up in a night and came to an end in a night;

title: Jonah Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: And am I not to have mercy on Nineveh, that great town, in which there are more than a hundred and twenty thousand persons without the power of judging between right and left, as well as much cattle?

title: Micah Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: The word of the Lord which came to Micah the Morashtite, in the days of Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah: his vision about Samaria and Jerusalem.

title: Micah Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: Give ear, you peoples, all of you; give attention, O earth and everything in it: let the Lord God be witness against you, the Lord from his holy Temple.

title: Micah Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: For see, the Lord is coming out from his place, and will come down, stepping on the high places of the earth.

title: Micah Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: And the mountains will be turned to water under him, and the deep valleys will be broken open, like wax before the fire, like waters flowing down a slope.

title: Micah Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: All this is because of the wrongdoing of Jacob and the sins of the children of Israel. What is the wrongdoing of Jacob? is it not Samaria? and what are the high places of Judah? are they not Jerusalem?

title: Micah Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: So I will make Samaria into a field and the plantings of a vine-garden: I will send its stones falling down into the valley, uncovering its bases.

title: Micah Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: And all her pictured images will be hammered into bits, and all the payments for her loose ways will be burned with fire, and all the images of her gods I will make waste: for with the price of a loose woman she got them together, and as the price of a loose woman will they be given back.

title: Micah Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: For this I will be full of sorrow and give cries of grief; I will go uncovered and unclothed: I will give cries of grief like the jackals and will be in sorrow like the ostriches.

title: Micah Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: For her wounds may not be made well: for it has come even to Judah, stretching up to the doorway of my people, even to Jerusalem.

title: Micah Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: Give no word of it in Gath, let there be no weeping at all: at Beth-le-aphrah be rolling in the dust.

title: Micah Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: Be uncovered and go away, you who are living in Shaphir: the one living in Zaanan has not come out of her town; Beth-ezel is taken away from its base, even from its resting-place.

title: Micah Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: For the one living in Maroth is waiting for good: for evil has come down from the Lord to the doorways of Jerusalem.

title: Micah Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: Let the war-carriage be yoked to the quick-running horse, you who are living in Lachish: she was the first cause of sin to the daughter of Zion; for the wrongdoings of Israel were seen in you.

title: Micah Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: For this cause give a parting offering to Moresheth-gath: the daughter of Achzib will be a deceit to the king of Israel.

title: Micah Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: Even now will the taker of your heritage come to you, you who are living in Mareshah: the glory of Israel will come to destruction for ever.

title: Micah Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: Let your head be uncovered and your hair cut off in sorrow for the children of your delight: let the hair be pulled from your head like an eagle's; for they have been taken away from you as prisoners.

title: Micah Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: A curse on the designers of evil, working on their beds! in the morning light they do it, because it is in their power.

title: Micah Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: They have a desire for fields and take them by force; and for houses and take them away: they are cruel to a man and his family, even to a man and his heritage.

title: Micah Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: For this cause the Lord has said, See, against this family I am purposing an evil from which you will not be able to take your necks away, and you will be weighted down by it; for it is an evil time.

title: Micah Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: In that day this saying will be said about you, and this song of grief will be made: The heritage of my people is measured out, and there is no one to give it back; those who have made us prisoners have taken our fields from us, and complete destruction has come to us.

title: Micah Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: For this cause you will have no one to make the decision by the measuring line in the meeting of the Lord.

title: Micah Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: Let not words like these be dropped, they say: Shame and the curse will not come to the family of Jacob!

title: Micah Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: Is the Lord quickly made angry? are these his doings? do not his words do good to his people Israel?

title: Micah Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: As for you, you have become haters of those who were at peace with you: you take the clothing of those who go by without fear, and make them prisoners of war.

title: Micah Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: The women of my people you have been driving away from their dearly loved children; from their young ones you are taking my glory for ever.

title: Micah Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: Up! and go; for this is not your rest: because it has been made unclean, the destruction ordered will come on you.

title: Micah Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: If a man came with a false spirit of deceit, saying, I will be a prophet to you of wine and strong drink: he would be the sort of prophet for this people.

title: Micah Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: I will certainly make all of you, O Jacob, come together; I will get together the rest of Israel; I will put them together like the sheep in their circle: like a flock in their green field; they will be full of the noise of men.

title: Micah Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: The opener of the way will go up before them: forcing their way out they will go on to the doorway and out through it: their king will go on before them, and the Lord at their head.

title: Micah Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: And I said, Give ear, now, you heads of Jacob and rulers of the people of Israel: is it not for you to have knowledge of what is right?

title: Micah Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: You who are haters of good and lovers of evil, pulling off their skin from them and their flesh from their bones;

title: Micah Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: Like meat they take the flesh of my people for their food, skinning them and crushing their bones, yes, cutting them up as if for the pot, like flesh inside the cooking-pot.

title: Micah Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: Then they will be crying to the Lord for help, but he will not give them an answer: yes, he will keep his face veiled from them at that time, because their acts have been evil.

title: Micah Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: This is what the Lord has said about the prophets by whom my people have been turned from the right way; who, biting with their teeth, say, Peace; and if anyone puts nothing in their mouths they make ready for war against him.

title: Micah Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: For this cause it will be night for you, without a vision; and it will be dark for you, without knowledge of the future; the sun will go down over the prophets, and the day will be black over them.

title: Micah Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: And the seers will be shamed, and the readers of the future will be at a loss, all of them covering their lips; for there is no answer from God.

title: Micah Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: But I truly am full of the spirit of the Lord, with power of judging and with strength to make clear to Jacob his wrongdoing and to Israel his sin.

title: Micah Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: Then give ear to this, you heads of the children of Jacob, you rulers of the children of Israel, hating what is right, twisting what is straight.

title: Micah Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: They are building up Zion with blood, and Jerusalem with evil-doing.

title: Micah Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: Its heads take rewards for judging, and the priests take payment for teaching, and the prophets get silver for reading the future: but still, supporting themselves on the Lord, they say, Is not the Lord among us? no evil will overtake us.

title: Micah Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: For this reason, Zion will be ploughed like a field because of you, and Jerusalem will become a mass of broken walls, and the mountain of the house like a high place in the woods.

title: Micah Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: But in the last days it will come about that the mountain of the Lord's house will be placed on the top of the mountains, and be lifted up over the hills; and peoples will be flowing to it.

title: Micah Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: And a number of nations will go and say, Come, and let us go up to the mountain of the Lord, and to the house of the God of Jacob; and he will give us knowledge of his ways and we will be guided by his word: for from Zion the law will go out, and the word of the Lord from Jerusalem.

title: Micah Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: And he will be judge between great peoples, and strong nations far away will be ruled by his decisions; their swords will be hammered into plough-blades and their spears into vine-knives: nations will no longer be lifting up their swords against one another, and knowledge of war will have gone for ever.

title: Micah Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: But every man will be seated under his vine and under his fig-tree, and no one will be a cause of fear to them: for the mouth of the Lord of armies has said it.

title: Micah Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: For all the peoples will be walking, every one in the name of his god, and we will be walking in the name of the Lord our God for ever and ever.

title: Micah Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: In that day, says the Lord, I will get together her who goes with uncertain steps, I will get together her who has been sent away, and her on whom I have sent evil;

title: Micah Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: And I will make her whose steps were uncertain a small band, and her who was feeble a strong nation: and the Lord will be their King in Mount Zion from now and for ever.

title: Micah Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: And you, O tower of the flock, Ophel of the daughter of Zion, to you it will come, even the earlier authority, the kingdom of the daughter of Jerusalem.

title: Micah Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: Now why are you crying so loudly? is there no king in you? has destruction come on your wise helper? so that pains have taken you like the pains of a woman in childbirth:

title: Micah Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: Be in pain, make sounds of grief, O daughter of Zion, like a woman in childbirth: for now you will go out of the town, living in the open country, and will come even to Babylon; there you will have salvation; there the Lord will make you free from the hands of your haters.

title: Micah Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: And now a number of nations have come together against you, and they say, Let her be made unclean and let our eyes see the fate of Zion.

title: Micah Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: But they have no knowledge of the thoughts of the Lord, their minds are not able to see his purpose: for he has got them together like stems of grain to the crushing-floor.

title: Micah Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: Up! and let the grain be crushed, O daughter of Zion, for I will make your horn iron and your feet brass, and a number of peoples will be broken by you, and you will give up their increase to the Lord and their wealth to the Lord of all the earth.

title: Micah Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: Now you will give yourselves deep wounds for grief; they will put up a wall round us: they will give the judge of Israel a blow on the face with a rod.

title: Micah Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: And you, Beth-lehem Ephrathah, the least among the families of Judah, out of you one will come to me who is to be ruler in Israel; whose going out has been purposed from time past, from the eternal days.

title: Micah Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: For this cause he will give them up till the time when she who is with child has given birth: then the rest of his brothers will come back to the children of Israel.

title: Micah Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: And he will take his place and give food to his flock in the strength of the Lord, in the glory of the name of the Lord his God; and their resting-place will be safe: for now he will be great to the ends of the earth.

title: Micah Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: And this will be our peace: when the Assyrian comes into our country and his feet are in our land, then we will put up against him seven keepers of the flocks and eight chiefs among men.

title: Micah Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: And they will make waste the land of Assyria with the sword, and the land of Nimrod with the edge of the sword: he will give us salvation from the Assyrian when he comes into our country, when his feet come inside the limit of our land.

title: Micah Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: And the rest of Jacob will be among the mass of peoples like dew from the Lord, like showers on the grass, which may not be kept back by man, or be waiting for the sons of men.

title: Micah Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: And the rest of Jacob will be among the nations, in the middle of the mass of peoples, like a lion among the beasts of the woods, like a young lion among the flocks of sheep: if he goes through, they will be crushed under foot and pulled to bits, and there will be no saviour.

title: Micah Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: Your hand is lifted up against those who are against you, and all your haters will be cut off.

title: Micah Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: And it will come about in that day, says the Lord, that I will take away your horses from you, and will give your war-carriages to destruction:

title: Micah Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: I will have the towns of your land cut off and all your strong places pulled down:

title: Micah Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: I will put an end to your use of secret arts, and you will have no more readers of signs:

title: Micah Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: And I will have your images and your pillars cut off from you; and you will no longer give worship to the work of your hands.

title: Micah Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: I will have your Asherahs pulled up from among you: and I will send destruction on your images.

title: Micah Chapter 5 Verse 15
text: And my punishment will be effected on the nations with such burning wrath as they have not had word of.

title: Micah Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: Give ear now to the words of the Lord: Up! put forward your cause before the mountains, let your voice be sounding among the hills.

title: Micah Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: Give ear, O you mountains, to the Lord's cause, and take note, you bases of the earth: for the Lord has a cause against his people, and he will take it up with Israel.

title: Micah Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: O my people, what have I done to you? how have I been a weariness to you? give answer against me.

title: Micah Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: For I took you up out of the land of Egypt and made you free from the prison-house; I sent before you Moses, Aaron, and Miriam.

title: Micah Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: O my people, keep in mind now what was designed by Balak, king of Moab, and the answer which Balaam, son of Beor, gave him; the events, from Shittim to Gilgal, so that you may be certain of the upright acts of the Lord.

title: Micah Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: With what am I to come before the Lord and go with bent head before the high God? am I to come before him with burned offerings, with young oxen a year old?

title: Micah Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: Will the Lord be pleased with thousands of sheep or with ten thousand rivers of oil? am I to give my first child for my wrongdoing, the fruit of my body for the sin of my soul?

title: Micah Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: He has made clear to you, O man, what is good; and what is desired from you by the Lord; only doing what is right, and loving mercy, and walking without pride before your God.

title: Micah Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: The voice of the Lord is crying out to the town: Give ear, you tribes and the meeting of the town.

title: Micah Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: Am I to let the stores of the evil-doer go out of my memory, and the short measure, which is cursed?

title: Micah Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: Is it possible for me to let wrong scales and the bag of false weights go without punishment?

title: Micah Chapter 6 Verse 12
text: For its men of wealth are cruel, and its people have said what is not true, and their tongue is false in their mouth.

title: Micah Chapter 6 Verse 13
text: So I have made a start with your punishment; I have made you waste because of your sins.

title: Micah Chapter 6 Verse 14
text: You will have food, but not enough; your shame will be ever with you: you will get your goods moved, but you will not take them away safely; and what you do take away I will give to the sword.

title: Micah Chapter 6 Verse 15
text: You will put in seed, but you will not get in the grain; you will be crushing olives, but your bodies will not be rubbed with the oil; and you will get in the grapes, but you will have no wine.

title: Micah Chapter 6 Verse 16
text: For you have kept the laws of Omri and all the works of the family of Ahab, and you have been guided by their designs: so that I might make you a cause of wonder and your people a cause of hisses; and the shame of my people will be on you.

title: Micah Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: Sorrow is mine! for I am as when they have got in the summer fruits, like the last of the grapes: there is nothing for food, not even an early fig for my desire.

title: Micah Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: The good man is gone from the earth, there is no one upright among men: they are all waiting secretly for blood, every man is going after his brother with a net.

title: Micah Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: Their hands are made ready to do evil; the ruler makes requests for money, and the judge is looking for a reward; and the great man gives decisions at his pleasure, and the right is twisted.

title: Micah Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: The best of them is like a waste plant, and their upright ones are like a wall of thorns. Sorrow! the day of their fate has come; now will trouble come on them.

title: Micah Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: Put no faith in a friend, do not let your hope be placed in a relation: keep watch on the doors of your mouth against her who is resting on your breast.

title: Micah Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: For the son puts shame on his father, the daughter goes against her mother and the daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law; and a man's haters are those of his family.

title: Micah Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: But as for me, I am looking to the Lord; I am waiting for the God of my salvation: the ears of my God will be open to me.

title: Micah Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: Do not be glad because of my sorrow, O my hater: after my fall I will be lifted up; when I am seated in the dark, the Lord will be a light to me.

title: Micah Chapter 7 Verse 9
text: I will undergo the wrath of the Lord, because of my sin against him; till he takes up my cause and does what is right for me: when he makes me come out into the light, I will see his righteousness;

title: Micah Chapter 7 Verse 10
text: And my hater will see it and be covered with shame; she who said to me, Where is the Lord your God? my eyes will see their desire effected on her, now she will be crushed under foot like the dust of the streets.

title: Micah Chapter 7 Verse 11
text: A day for building your walls! in that day will your limits be stretched far and wide.

title: Micah Chapter 7 Verse 12
text: In that day they will come to you from Assyria and the towns of Egypt, and from Egypt even to the River, and from sea to sea and from mountain to mountain.

title: Micah Chapter 7 Verse 13
text: But the land will become a waste because of its people, as the fruit of their works.

title: Micah Chapter 7 Verse 14
text: Keep your people safe with your rod, the flock of your heritage, living by themselves in the woods in the middle of Carmel: let them get their food in Bashan and Gilead as in the past.

title: Micah Chapter 7 Verse 15
text: As in the days when you came out from the land of Egypt, let us see things of wonder.

title: Micah Chapter 7 Verse 16
text: The nations will see and be shamed because of all their strength; they will put their hands on their mouths, their ears will be stopped.

title: Micah Chapter 7 Verse 17
text: They will take dust as their food like a snake, like the things which go flat on the earth; they will come shaking with fear out of their secret places: they will come with fear to the Lord our God, full of fear because of you.

title: Micah Chapter 7 Verse 18
text: Who is a God like you, offering forgiveness for evil-doing and overlooking the sins of the rest of his heritage? he does not keep his wrath for ever, because his delight is in mercy.

title: Micah Chapter 7 Verse 19
text: He will again have pity on us; he will put our sins under his feet: and you will send all our sins down into the heart of the sea.

title: Micah Chapter 7 Verse 20
text: You will make clear your good faith to Jacob and your mercy to Abraham, as you gave your oath to our fathers from times long past.

title: Nahum Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: The word about Nineveh. The book of the vision of Nahum the Elkoshite.

title: Nahum Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: The Lord is a God who takes care of his honour and gives punishment for wrong; the Lord gives punishment and is angry; the Lord sends punishment on those who are against him, being angry with his haters.

title: Nahum Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: The Lord is slow to get angry and great in power, and will not let the sinner go without punishment: the way of the Lord is in the wind and the storm, and the clouds are the dust of his feet.

title: Nahum Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: He says sharp words to the sea and makes it dry, drying up all the rivers: Bashan is feeble, and Carmel, and the flower of Lebanon is without strength.

title: Nahum Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: The mountains are shaking because of him, and the hills flowing away; the earth is falling to bits before him, the world and all who are in it.

title: Nahum Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: Who may keep his place before his wrath? and who may undergo the heat of his passion? his wrath is let loose like fire and the rocks are broken open by him.

title: Nahum Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: The Lord is good, a strong place in the day of trouble; and he has knowledge of those who take him for their safe cover.

title: Nahum Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: But like water overflowing he will take them away; he will put an end to those who come up against him, driving his haters into the dark.

title: Nahum Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: What are you designing against the Lord? he will put an end to it: his haters will not come up again a second time.

title: Nahum Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: For though they are like twisted thorns, and are overcome as with drink, they will come to destruction like stems of grass fully dry.

title: Nahum Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: One has gone out from you who is designing evil against the Lord, whose purposes are of no value.

title: Nahum Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: This is what the Lord has said: The days of my cause against you are ended; they are cut off and past. Though I have sent trouble on you, you will no longer be troubled.

title: Nahum Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: And now I will let his yoke be broken off you, and your chains be parted.

title: Nahum Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: The Lord has given an order about you, that no more of your name are to be planted: from the house of your gods I will have the pictured and metal images cut off; I will make your last resting-place a place of shame; for you are completely evil.

title: Nahum Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: See on the mountains the feet of him who comes with good news, giving word of peace! Keep your feasts, O Judah, give effect to your oaths: for the good-for-nothing man will never again go through you; he is completely cut off.

title: Nahum Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: A crusher has come up before your face: keep a good look-out, let the way be watched, make yourself strong, let your power be greatly increased.

title: Nahum Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: For the Lord will make good the vine of Jacob, as well as the vine of Israel: for the wasters have made them waste and sent destruction on the branches of their vine.

title: Nahum Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: The body-covers of his fighting men have been made red, the men of war are clothed in bright red: the war-carriages are like flames of fire in the day when he gets ready, the horses are shaking.

title: Nahum Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: The war-carriages are rushing through the streets, pushing against one another in the wide ways, looking like burning lights, running like thunder-flames.

title: Nahum Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: He takes the record of his great men: they go falling on their way; they go quickly to the wall, the cover is made ready.

title: Nahum Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: The river doorways are forced open, and the king's house is flowing away.

title: Nahum Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: And the queen is uncovered, she is taken away and her servant-girls are weeping like the sound of doves, hammering on their breasts.

title: Nahum Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: But Nineveh is like a pool of water whose waters are flowing away; Keep your place, they say; but no one is turning back.

title: Nahum Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: Take silver, take gold; for there is no end to the store; take for yourselves a weight of things to be desired.

title: Nahum Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: Everything has been taken from her, all is gone, she has nothing more: the heart is turned to water, the knees are shaking, all are twisted in pain, and colour has gone from all faces.

title: Nahum Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: Where is the lions' hole, the place where the young lions got their food, where the lion and the she-lion were walking with their young, without cause for fear?

title: Nahum Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: Food enough for his young and for his she-lions was pulled down by the lion; his hole was full of flesh and his resting-place stored with meat.

title: Nahum Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: See, I am against you, says the Lord of armies, and I will have your war-carriages burned in the smoke, and your young lions will be food for the sword: you will no longer get your food by force on the earth, and the voice of your she-lions will be stopped for ever.

title: Nahum Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: A curse is on the town of blood; it is full of deceit and violent acts; and there is no end to the taking of life.

title: Nahum Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: The noise of the whip, and the noise of thundering wheels; horses rushing and war-carriages jumping,

title: Nahum Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: Horsemen driving forward, and the shining sword and the bright spear: and a great number of wounded, and masses of dead bodies; they are falling over the bodies of the dead:

title: Nahum Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: Because of all the false ways of the loose woman, expert in attraction and wise in secret arts, who takes nations in the net of her false ways, and families through her secret arts.

title: Nahum Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: See, I am against you, says the Lord of armies, and I will have your skirts pulled over your face, and let the nations see you unclothed, and the kingdoms your shame.

title: Nahum Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: I will make you completely disgusting and full of shame, and will put you up to be looked at by all.

title: Nahum Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: And it will come about that all who see you will go in flight from you and say, Nineveh is made waste: who will be weeping for her? where am I to get comforters for her?

title: Nahum Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: Are you better than No-amon, seated on the Nile streams, with waters all round her; whose wall was the sea and her earthwork the waters?

title: Nahum Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: Ethiopia was her strength and Egyptians without number; Put and Lubim were her helpers.

title: Nahum Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: But even she has been taken away, she has gone away as a prisoner: even her young children are smashed to bits at the top of all the streets: the fate of her honoured men is put to the decision of chance, and all her great men are put in chains.

title: Nahum Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: And you will be overcome with wine, you will become feeble; you will be looking for a safe place from those who are fighting against you.

title: Nahum Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: All your walled places will be like fig-trees and your people like the first figs, falling at a shake into the mouth which is open for them.

title: Nahum Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: See, the people who are in you are women; the doorways of your land are wide open to your attackers: the locks of your doors have been burned away in the fire.

title: Nahum Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: Get water for the time when you are shut in, make strong your towns: go into the potter's earth, stamping it down with your feet, make strong the brickworks.

title: Nahum Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: There the fire will make you waste; you will be cut off by the sword: make yourself as great in number as the worms, as great in number as the locusts.

title: Nahum Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: Let your traders be increased more than the stars of heaven:

title: Nahum Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: Your crowned ones are like the locusts, and your scribes like the clouds of insects which take cover in the walls on a cold day, but when the sun comes up they go in flight, and are seen no longer in their place.

title: Nahum Chapter 3 Verse 18
text: Sorrow! how are the keepers of your flock sleeping, O king of Assyria! your strong men are at rest; your people are wandering on the mountains, and there is no one to get them together.

title: Nahum Chapter 3 Verse 19
text: Your pain may not be made better; you are wounded to death: all those hearing the news about you will be waving their hands in joy over you: for who has not undergone the weight of your evil-doing again and again?

title: Habakkuk Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: The word which Habakkuk the prophet saw.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: How long, O Lord, will your ears be shut to my voice? I make an outcry to you about violent behaviour, but you do not send salvation.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: Why do you make me see evil-doing, and why are my eyes fixed on wrong? for wasting and violent acts are before me: and there is fighting and bitter argument.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: For this reason the law is feeble and decisions are not effected: for the upright man is circled round by evil-doers; because of which right is twisted.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: See among the nations, and take note, and be full of wonder: for in your days I am doing a work in which you will have no belief, even if news of it is given to you.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: For see, I am sending the Chaldaeans, that bitter and quick-moving nation; who go through the wide spaces of the earth to get for themselves living-places which are not theirs.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: They are greatly to be feared: their right comes from themselves.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: And their horses are quicker than leopards and their horsemen more cruel than evening wolves; they come from far away, like an eagle in flight rushing on its food.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: They are coming all of them with force; the direction of their faces is forward, the number of their prisoners is like the sands of the sea.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: He makes little of kings, rulers are a sport to him; all the strong places are to be laughed at; for he makes earthworks and takes them.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: Then his purpose will be changed, over-stepping the limit; he will make his strength his god.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: Are you not eternal, O Lord my God, my Holy One? for you there is no death. O Lord, he has been ordered by you for our punishment; and by you, O Rock, he has been marked out to put us right.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: Before your holy eyes sin may not be seen, and you are unable to put up with wrong; why, then, are your eyes on the false? why do you say nothing when the evil-doer puts an end to one who is more upright than himself?

title: Habakkuk Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: He has made men like the fishes of the sea, like the worms which have no ruler over them.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: He takes them all up with his hook, he takes them in his net, getting them together in his fishing-net: for which cause he is glad and full of joy.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: For this reason he makes an offering to his net, burning perfume to his fishing-net; because by them he gets much food and his meat is fat.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: For this cause his net is ever open, and there is no end to his destruction of the nations.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: I will take my position and be on watch, placing myself on my tower, looking out to see what he will say to me, and what answer he will give to my protest.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: And the Lord gave me an answer, and said, Put the vision in writing and make it clear on stones, so that the reader may go quickly.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: For the vision is still for the fixed time, and it is moving quickly to the end, and it will not be false: even if it is slow in coming, go on waiting for it; because it will certainly come, it will not be kept back.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: As for the man of pride, my soul has no pleasure in him; but the upright man will have life through his good faith.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: A curse on the cruel and false one! the man full of pride, who never has enough; who makes his desires wide as the underworld! he is like death; he is never full, but he makes all nations come to him, getting all peoples together to himself.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: Will not all these take up a word of shame against him and a bitter saying against him, and say, A curse on him who goes on taking what is not his and is weighted down with the property of debtors!

title: Habakkuk Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: Will not your creditors suddenly be moved against you, and your troublers get up from their sleep, and you will be to them like goods taken in war?

title: Habakkuk Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: Because you have taken their goods from great nations, all the rest of the peoples will take your goods from you; because of men's blood and violent acts against the land and the town and all who are living in it.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: A curse on him who gets evil profits for his family, so that he may put his resting-place on high and be safe from the hand of the wrongdoer!

title: Habakkuk Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: You have been a cause of shame to your house by cutting off a number of peoples, and sinning against your soul.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: For the stone will give a cry out of the wall, and it will be answered by the board out of the woodwork.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: A curse on him who is building a place with blood, and basing a town on evil-doing!

title: Habakkuk Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: See, is it not the pleasure of the Lord of armies that the peoples are working for the fire and using themselves up for nothing?

title: Habakkuk Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: For the earth will be full of the knowledge of the glory of the Lord as the sea is covered by the waters.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: A curse on him who gives his neighbour the wine of his wrath, making him overcome with strong drink from the cup of his passion, so that you may be a witness of their shame!

title: Habakkuk Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: You are full of shame in place of glory: take your part in the drinking, and let your shame be uncovered: the cup of the Lord's right hand will come round to you and your glory will be covered with shame.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: For the violent acts against Lebanon will come on you, and the destruction of the cattle will be a cause of fear to you, because of men's blood and the violent acts against the land and the town and all who are living in it.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 2 Verse 18
text: What profit is the pictured image to its maker? and as for the metal image, the false teacher, why does its maker put his faith in it, making false gods without a voice?

title: Habakkuk Chapter 2 Verse 19
text: A curse on him who says to the wood, Awake! to the unbreathing stone, Up! let it be a teacher! See, it is plated with gold and silver, and there is no breath at all inside it.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 2 Verse 20
text: But the Lord is in his holy Temple: let all the earth be quiet before him.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: A prayer of Habakkuk the prophet, put to Shigionoth.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: O Lord, word of you has come to my ears; I have seen your work, O Lord; when the years come near make it clear; in wrath keep mercy in mind.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: God came from Teman, and the Holy One from Mount Paran. Selah. The heavens were covered with his glory, and the earth was full of his praise.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: He was shining like the light; he had rays coming out from his hand: there his power was kept secret.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: Before him went disease, and flames went out at his feet.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: From his high place he sent shaking on the earth; he saw and nations were suddenly moved: and the eternal mountains were broken, the unchanging hills were bent down; his ways are eternal.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: The curtains of Cushan were troubled, and the tents of Midian were shaking.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: Was your wrath burning against the rivers? were you angry with the sea, that you went on your horses, on your war-carriages of salvation?

title: Habakkuk Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: Your bow was quite uncovered. Selah. By you the earth was cut through with rivers.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: The mountains saw you and were moved with fear; the clouds were streaming with water: the voice of the deep was sounding; the sun did not come up, and the moon kept still in her place.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: At the light of your arrows they went away, at the shining of your polished spear.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: You went stepping through the land in wrath, crushing the nations in your passion.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: You went out for the salvation of your people, for the salvation of the one on whom your holy oil was put; wounding the head of the family of the evil-doer, uncovering the base even to the neck. Selah.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: You have put your spears through his head, his horsemen were sent in flight like dry stems; they had joy in driving away the poor, in making a meal of them secretly.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: The feet of your horses were on the sea, on the mass of great waters.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: Hearing it, my inner parts were moved, and my lips were shaking at the sound; my bones became feeble, and my steps were uncertain under me: I gave sounds of grief in the day of trouble, when his forces came up against the people in bands.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: For though the fig-tree has no flowers, and there is no fruit on the vine, and work on the olive comes to nothing, and the fields give no food; and the flock is cut off from its resting-place, and there is no herd in the cattle-house:

title: Habakkuk Chapter 3 Verse 18
text: Still, I will be glad in the Lord, my joy will be in the God of my salvation.

title: Habakkuk Chapter 3 Verse 19
text: The Lord God is my strength, and he makes my feet like roes' feet, guiding me on my high places. For the chief music-maker on corded instruments.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: The word of the Lord which came to Zephaniah, the son of Cushi, the son of Gedaliah, the son of Amariah, the son of Hezekiah, in the days of Josiah, the son of Amon, king of Judah.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: I will take away everything from the face of the earth, says the Lord.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: I will take away man and beast; I will take away the birds of the heaven and the fishes of the sea; causing the downfall of the evil-doers, and cutting man off from the face of the earth, says the Lord.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: And my hand will be stretched out on Judah and on all the people of Jerusalem, cutting off the name of the Baal from this place, and the name of the false priests,

title: Zephaniah Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: And the worshippers of the army of heaven on the house-tops, and the Lord's worshippers who take oaths by Milcom,

title: Zephaniah Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: And those who are turned back from going after the Lord, and those who have not made prayer to the Lord or got directions from him.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: Let there be no sound before the Lord God: for the day of the Lord is near: for the Lord has made ready an offering, he has made his guests holy.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: And it will come about in the day of the Lord's offering, that I will send punishment on the rulers and the king's sons and all who are clothed in robes from strange lands.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: And in that day I will send punishment on all those who come jumping over the doorstep and make their master's house full of violent behaviour and deceit.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 1 Verse 10
