text: And in that day, says the Lord, there will be the sound of a cry from the fish doorway, and an outcry from the new town, and a great thundering from the hills, and cries of grief from the people of the Hollow;

title: Zephaniah Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: Because of the downfall of all the people of Canaan: all those who were weighted down with silver have been cut off.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: And it will come about at that time, that I will go searching through Jerusalem with lights; and I will send punishment on the men who have become like wine stored over-long, who say to themselves, The Lord will not do good and will not do evil.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: And their wealth will be violently taken away, and their houses will be made waste: they will go on building houses and never living in them, and planting vine-gardens but not drinking the wine from them.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: The great day of the Lord is near, it is near and coming very quickly; the bitter day of the Lord is near, coming on more quickly than a man of war.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: That day is a day of wrath, a day of trouble and sorrow, a day of wasting and destruction, a day of dark night and deep shade, a day of cloud and thick dark.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: A day of sounding the horn and the war-cry against the walled towns and the high towers.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: And I will send trouble on men so that they will go about like the blind, because they have done evil against the Lord: and their blood will be drained out like dust, and their strength like waste.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: Even their silver and their gold will not be able to keep them safe in the day of the Lord's wrath; but all the land will be burned up in the fire of his bitter wrath: for he will put an end, even suddenly, to all who are living in the land.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: Come together, make everyone come together, O nation without shame;

title: Zephaniah Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: Before the Lord sends you violently away in flight like the waste from the grain; before the burning wrath of the Lord comes on you, before the day of the Lord's wrath comes on you.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: Make search for the Lord, all you quiet ones of the earth, who have done what is right in his eyes; make search for righteousness and a quiet heart: it may be that you will be safely covered in the day of the Lord's wrath.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: For Gaza will be given up and Ashkelon will become waste: they will send Ashdod out in the middle of the day, and Ekron will be uprooted.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: Sorrow to the people living by the sea, the nation of the Cherethites! The word of the Lord is against you, O Canaan, the land of the Philistines; I will send destruction on you till there is no one living in you.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: And the land by the sea will be grass-land, with houses for keepers of sheep and walled places for flocks.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: The land by the sea will be for the rest of the children of Judah; by the sea they will give their flocks food: in the houses of Ashkelon they will take their rest in the evening; for the Lord their God will take them in hand and their fate will be changed.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: My ears have been open to the bitter words of Moab and the words of shame of the children of Ammon, which they have said against my people, lifting themselves up against the limit of their land.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: For this cause, by my life, says the Lord of armies, the God of Israel, truly Moab will become like Sodom and the children of Ammon like Gomorrah, given up to waste plants and salt pools and unpeopled for ever: the rest of my people will take their property, the overflow of my nation will take their heritage.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: This will be their fate because of their pride, because they have said evil, lifting themselves up against the people of the Lord of armies.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: The Lord will let himself be seen by them: for he will make all the gods of the earth feeble; and men will go down before him in worship, everyone from his place, even all the sea-lands of the nations.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: And you Ethiopians will be put to death by my sword.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: And his hand will be stretched out against the north, for the destruction of Assyria; and he will make Nineveh unpeopled and dry like the waste land.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: And herds will take their rest in the middle of her, all the beasts of the valley: the pelican and the porcupine will make their living-places on the tops of its pillars; the owl will be crying in the window; the raven will be seen on the doorstep.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: This is the town which was full of joy, living without fear of danger, saying in her heart, I am, and there is no other: how has she been made waste, a place for beasts to take their rest in! everyone who goes by her will make hisses, waving his hand.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: Sorrow to her who is uncontrolled and unclean, the cruel town!

title: Zephaniah Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: She gave no attention to the voice, she had no use for teaching, she put no faith in the Lord, she did not come near to her God.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: Her rulers are like loud-voiced lions in her; her judges are wolves of the evening, crushing up the bones before the morning.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: Her prophets are good-for-nothing persons, full of deceit: her priests have made the holy place unclean and have gone violently against the law.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: The Lord in her is upright; he will not do evil; every morning he lets his righteousness be seen, he is unchanging; but the evil-doer has no sense of shame.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: I have had the nations cut off, their towers are broken down; I have made their streets a waste so that no one goes through them: destruction has overtaken their towns, so that there is no man living in them.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: I said, Certainly you will go in fear of me, and come under my training, so that whatever I may send on her may not be cut off before her eyes: but they got up early and made all their works evil.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: For this reason, go on waiting for me, says the Lord, till the day when I come up as a witness: for my purpose is to send for the nations and to get the kingdoms together, so that I may let loose on them my passion, even all my burning wrath: for all the earth will be burned up in the fire of my bitter passion.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: For then I will give the people a clean language, so that they may all make prayer to the Lord and be his servants with one mind.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: From over the rivers of Ethiopia, and from the sides of the north, they will come to me with an offering.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: In that day you will have no shame on account of all the things in which you did evil against me: for then I will take away from among you those who were lifted up in pride, and you will no longer be lifted up with pride in my holy mountain.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: But I will still have among you a quiet and poor people, and they will put their faith in the name of the Lord.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: The rest of Israel will do no evil and say no false words; the tongue of deceit will not be seen in their mouth: for they will take their food and their rest, and no one will be a cause of fear to them.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: Make melody, O daughter of Zion; give a loud cry, O Israel; be glad and let your heart be full of joy, O daughter of Jerusalem.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: The Lord has taken away those who were judging you, he has sent your haters far away: the King of Israel, even the Lord, is among you: you will have no more fear of evil.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: In that day it will be said to Jerusalem, Have no fear: O Zion, let not your hands be feeble.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: The Lord your God is among you, as a strong saviour: he will be glad over you with joy, he will make his love new again, he will make a song of joy over you as in the time of a holy feast.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 3 Verse 18
text: I will take away your troubles, lifting up your shame from off you.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 3 Verse 19
text: See, at that time I will put an end to all who have been troubling you: I will give salvation to her whose steps are uncertain, and get together her who has been sent in flight; and I will make them a cause of praise and an honoured name in all the earth, when I let their fate be changed.

title: Zephaniah Chapter 3 Verse 20
text: At that time I will make you come in, at that time I will get you together: for I will make you a name and a praise among all the peoples of the earth when I let your fate be changed before your eyes, says the Lord.

title: Haggai Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: In the second year of Darius the king, in the sixth month, on the first day of the month, came the word of the Lord by Haggai the prophet to Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, ruler of Judah, and to Joshua, the son of Jehozadak, the high priest, saying,

title: Haggai Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: These are the words of the Lord of armies: These people say, The time has not come for building the Lord's house.

title: Haggai Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: Then the word of the Lord came by Haggai the prophet, saying,

title: Haggai Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: Is it a time for you to be living in roofed houses while this house is a waste?

title: Haggai Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: For this cause the Lord of armies has said, Give thought to your ways.

title: Haggai Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: Much has been planted, but little got in; you take food, but have not enough; you take drink, but are not full; you are clothed, but no one is warm; and he who gets payment for his work, gets it to put it into a bag full of holes.

title: Haggai Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: This is what the Lord of armies has said: Give thought to your ways.

title: Haggai Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: Go up to the hills and get wood and put up the house; and I will take pleasure in it and be honoured, says the Lord.

title: Haggai Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: You were looking for much, and it came to little; and when you got it into your house, I took it away with a breath. Why? says the Lord of armies. Because of my house which is a waste, while every man takes care of the house which is his.

title: Haggai Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: For this cause the heaven over you is kept from giving dew, and the earth from giving her fruit.

title: Haggai Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: And by my order no rain came on the land or on the mountains or the grain or the wine or the oil or the produce of the earth or on men or cattle or on any work of man's hands.

title: Haggai Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: Then Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, and Joshua, the son of Jehozadak, the high priest, and all the rest of the people, gave ear to the voice of the Lord their God and to the words of Haggai the prophet, because the Lord their God had sent him, and the people were in fear before the Lord.

title: Haggai Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: Then Haggai, whom the Lord had sent to give his words to the people, said, I am with you, says the Lord.

title: Haggai Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: And the spirit of Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, ruler of Judah, was moved by the Lord, as was the spirit of Joshua, the son of Jehozadak, the high priest, and the spirit of all the rest of the people; and they came and did work in the house of the Lord of armies, their God.

title: Haggai Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: On the twenty-fourth day of the month, in the sixth month, in the second year of Darius the king.

title: Haggai Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: In the seventh month, on the twenty-first day of the month, the word of the Lord came by Haggai the prophet, saying,

title: Haggai Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: Say now to Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, ruler of Judah, and to Joshua, the son of Jehozadak, the high priest, and to the rest of the people,

title: Haggai Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: Who is there still among you who saw this house in its first glory? and how do you see it now? is it not in your eyes as nothing?

title: Haggai Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: But now be strong, O Zerubbabel, says the Lord; and be strong, O Joshua, son of Jehozadak, the high priest; and be strong, all you people of the land, says the Lord, and get to work: for I am with you, says the Lord of armies:

title: Haggai Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: The agreement which I made with you when you came out of Egypt, and my spirit, are with you still; have no fear.

title: Haggai Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: For this is what the Lord of armies has said: In a short time I will make a shaking of the heavens and the earth and the sea and the dry land;

title: Haggai Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: And I will make a shaking of all the nations, and the desired things of all nations will come: and I will make this house full of my glory, says the Lord of armies.

title: Haggai Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: The silver is mine and the gold is mine, says the Lord of armies.

title: Haggai Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: The second glory of this house will be greater than the first, says the Lord of armies: and in this place I will give peace, says the Lord of armies.

title: Haggai Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: On the twenty-fourth day of the ninth month, in the second year of Darius, the word of the Lord came by Haggai the prophet, saying,

title: Haggai Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: These are the words of the Lord of armies: Put now a point of law to the priests, saying,

title: Haggai Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: If anyone has some holy flesh folded in the skirt of his robe, will bread or soup or wine or oil or any other food be made holy if touched by his skirt? And the priests answering said, No.

title: Haggai Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: Then Haggai said, Will any of these be made unclean by the touch of one who is unclean through touching a dead body? And the priests answering said, It will be made unclean.

title: Haggai Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: Then Haggai said, So is this people and so is this nation before me, says the Lord; and so is every work of their hands; and the offering they give there is unclean.

title: Haggai Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: And now, give thought, looking back from this day to the time before one stone was put on another in the Temple of the Lord:

title: Haggai Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: How, when anyone came to a store of twenty measures, there were only ten: when anyone went to the wine-store to get fifty vessels full, there were only twenty.

title: Haggai Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: And I sent burning and wasting and a rain of ice-drops on all the works of your hands; but still you were not turned to me, says the Lord.

title: Haggai Chapter 2 Verse 18
text: And now, give thought; looking on from this day, from the twenty-fourth day of the ninth month, from the time when the base of the Lord's house was put in its place, give thought to it.

title: Haggai Chapter 2 Verse 19
text: Is the seed still in the store-house? have the vine and the fig-tree, the pomegranate and the olive-tree, still not given their fruit? from this day I will send my blessing on you.

title: Haggai Chapter 2 Verse 20
text: And the word of the Lord came a second time to Haggai, on the twenty-fourth day of the month, saying,

title: Haggai Chapter 2 Verse 21
text: Say to Zerubbabel, ruler of Judah, I will make a shaking of the heavens and the earth,

title: Haggai Chapter 2 Verse 22
text: Overturning the power of kingdoms; and I will send destruction on the strength of the kingdoms of the nations; by me war-carriages will be overturned with those who are in them; and the horses and the horsemen will come down, everyone by the sword of his brother.

title: Haggai Chapter 2 Verse 23
text: In that day, says the Lord of armies, I will take you, O Zerubbabel, my servant, the son of Shealtiel, says the Lord, and will make you as a jewelled ring: for I have taken you to be mine, says the Lord of armies.

title: Zechariah Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: In the eighth month, in the second year of Darius, the word of the Lord came to Zechariah, the son of Berechiah, the son of Iddo the prophet, saying,

title: Zechariah Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: The Lord has been very angry with your fathers:

title: Zechariah Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: And you are to say to them, These are the words of the Lord of armies: Come back to me, says the Lord of armies, and I will come back to you.

title: Zechariah Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: Be not like your fathers, to whom the voice of the earlier prophets came, saying, Be turned now from your evil ways and from your evil doings: but they did not give ear to me or take note, says the Lord.

title: Zechariah Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: Your fathers, where are they? and the prophets, do they go on living for ever?

title: Zechariah Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: But my words and my orders, which I gave to my servants the prophets, have they not overtaken your fathers? and turning back they said, As it was the purpose of the Lord of armies to do to us, in reward for our ways and our doings, so has he done.

title: Zechariah Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: On the twenty-fourth day of the eleventh month, the month Shebat, in the second year of Darius, the word of the Lord came to Zechariah, the son of Berechiah, the son of Iddo the prophet, saying,

title: Zechariah Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: I saw in the night a man on a red horse, between the mountains in the valley, and at his back were horses, red, black, white, and of mixed colours.

title: Zechariah Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: Then I said, O my lord, what are these? And the angel who was talking to me said to me, I will make clear to you what they are.

title: Zechariah Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: And the man who was between the mountains, answering me, said, These are those whom the Lord has sent to go up and down through the earth.

title: Zechariah Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: And the man who was between the mountains, answering, said to the angel of the Lord, We have gone up and down through the earth, and all the earth is quiet and at rest.

title: Zechariah Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: Then the angel of the Lord, answering, said, O Lord of armies, how long will it be before you have mercy on Jerusalem and on the towns of Judah against which your wrath has been burning for seventy years?

title: Zechariah Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: And the Lord gave an answer in good and comforting words to the angel who was talking to me.

title: Zechariah Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: And the angel who was talking to me said to me, Let your voice be loud and say, These are the words of the Lord of armies: I am greatly moved about the fate of Jerusalem and of Zion.

title: Zechariah Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: And I am very angry with the nations who are living untroubled: for when I was only a little angry, they made the evil worse.

title: Zechariah Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: So this is what the Lord has said: I have come back to Jerusalem with mercies; my house is to be put up in her, says the Lord of armies, and a line is to be stretched out over Jerusalem.

title: Zechariah Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: And again let your voice be loud and say, This is what the Lord of armies has said: My towns will again be overflowing with good things, and again the Lord will give comfort to Zion and take Jerusalem for himself.

title: Zechariah Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: And lifting up my eyes I saw four horns.

title: Zechariah Chapter 1 Verse 19
text: And I said to the angel who was talking to me, What are these? And he said to me, These are the horns which have sent Judah, Israel, and Jerusalem in flight.

title: Zechariah Chapter 1 Verse 20
text: And the Lord gave me a vision of four metal-workers.

title: Zechariah Chapter 1 Verse 21
text: Then I said, What have these come to do? And he said, These are the horns which sent Judah in flight, and kept him from lifting up his head: but these men have come to send fear on them and to put down the nations who are lifting up their horns against the land of Judah to send it in flight.

title: Zechariah Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: And lifting up my eyes, I saw a man with a measuring-line in his hand.

title: Zechariah Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: And I said to him, Where are you going? And he said to me, To take the measure of Jerusalem, to see how wide and how long it is.

title: Zechariah Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: And the angel who was talking to me went out, and another angel went out, and, meeting him,

title: Zechariah Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: Said to him, Go quickly and say to this young man, Jerusalem will be an unwalled town, because of the great number of men and cattle in her.

title: Zechariah Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: For I, says the Lord, will be a wall of fire round about her, and I will be the glory inside her.

title: Zechariah Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: Ho, ho! go in flight from the land of the north, says the Lord: for I have sent you far and wide to the four winds of heaven, says the Lord.

title: Zechariah Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: Ho! Zion, go in flight from danger, you who are living with the daughter of Babylon.

title: Zechariah Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: For this is what the Lord of armies has said: In the way of glory he has sent me to the nations which have taken your goods: for anyone touching you is touching what is most dear to him.

title: Zechariah Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: For at the shaking of my hand over them, their goods will be taken by those who were their servants: and you will see that the Lord of armies has sent me.

title: Zechariah Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: Give songs of joy, O daughter of Zion: for I come, and I will make my resting-place among you, says the Lord.

title: Zechariah Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: And a number of nations will be joined to the Lord in that day, and will become my people; and I will be living among you, and you will see that the Lord of armies has sent me to you.

title: Zechariah Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: And Judah will be the Lord's heritage in the holy land, and Jerusalem will again be his.

title: Zechariah Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: Let all flesh be quiet and make no sound before the Lord: for he is awake and has come from his holy resting-place.

title: Zechariah Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: And he let me see Joshua, the high priest, in his place before the angel of the Lord, and the Satan at his right hand ready to take up a cause against him.

title: Zechariah Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: And the Lord said to the Satan, May the Lord's word be sharp against you, O Satan, the word of the Lord who has taken Jerusalem for himself: is this not a burning branch pulled out of the fire?

title: Zechariah Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: Now Joshua was clothed in unclean robes, and he was in his place before the angel.

title: Zechariah Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: And he made answer and said to those who were there before him, Take the unclean robes off him, and let him be clothed in clean robes;

title: Zechariah Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: And let them put a clean head-dress on his head. So they put a clean head-dress on his head, clothing him with clean robes: and to him he said, See, I have taken your sin away from you.

title: Zechariah Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: And the angel of the Lord made a statement to Joshua, and said,

title: Zechariah Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: These are the words of the Lord of armies: If you will go in my ways and keep what I have put in your care, then you will be judge over my Temple and have the care of my house, and I will give you the right to come in among those who are there.

title: Zechariah Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: Give ear now, O Joshua, the high priest, you and your friends who are seated before you; for these are men who are a sign: for see, I will let my servant the Branch be seen.

title: Zechariah Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: For see, the stone which I have put before Joshua; on one stone are seven eyes: see, the design cut on it will be my work, says the Lord of armies, and I will take away the sin of that land in one day.

title: Zechariah Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: In that day, says the Lord of armies, you will be one another's guests under the vine and under the fig-tree.

title: Zechariah Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: And the angel who was talking to me came again, awaking me as a man out of his sleep.

title: Zechariah Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: And he said to me, What do you see? And I said, I see a light-support, made all of gold, with its cup on the top of it and seven lights on it; and there are seven pipes to every one of the lights which are on the top of it;

title: Zechariah Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: And two olive-trees by it, one on the right side of the cup and one on the left.

title: Zechariah Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: And I made answer and said to the angel who was talking to me, What are these, my lord?

title: Zechariah Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: Then the angel who was talking to me, answering me, said, Have you no knowledge of what these are? And I said, No, my lord.

title: Zechariah Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: This is the word of the Lord to Zerubbabel, saying, Not by force or by power, but by my spirit, says the Lord of armies.

title: Zechariah Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: Who are you, O great mountain? before Zerubbabel you will become level: and he will let all see the headstone, with cries of Grace, grace, to it.

title: Zechariah Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Zechariah Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: The hands of Zerubbabel have put the base of this house in place, and his hands will make it complete; and it will be clear to you that the Lord of armies has sent me to you.

title: Zechariah Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: For who has had a poor opinion of the day of small things? for they will be glad when they see the weighted measuring-line in the hand of Zerubbabel. Then he said in answer to me, These seven lights are the eyes of the Lord which go quickly up and down through all the earth.

title: Zechariah Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: And I made answer and said to him, What are these two olive-trees on the right side of the light-support and on the left?

title: Zechariah Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: And answering a second time, I said to him, What are these two olive branches, through whose gold pipes the oil is drained out?

title: Zechariah Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: And he said in answer to me, Have you no knowledge what these are? And I said, No, my lord.

title: Zechariah Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: And he said, These are the two sons of oil, whose place is by the Lord of all the earth.

title: Zechariah Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: Then again lifting up my eyes I saw a roll in flight through the air.

title: Zechariah Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: And he said to me, What do you see? And I said, A roll going through the air; it is twenty cubits long and ten cubits wide.

title: Zechariah Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: Then he said to me, This is the curse which goes out over the face of all the land: for long enough has every thief gone without punishment, and long enough has every taker of false oaths gone without punishment.

title: Zechariah Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: And I will send it out, says the Lord of armies, and it will go into the house of the thief and into the house of him who takes a false oath by my name: and it will be in his house, causing its complete destruction, with its woodwork and its stones.

title: Zechariah Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: And the angel who was talking to me went out and said to me, Let your eyes be lifted up now, and see the ephah which is going out.

title: Zechariah Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: And I said, What is it? And he said, This is an ephah which is going out. And he said further, This is their evil-doing in all the land.

title: Zechariah Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: And I saw a round cover of lead lifted up; and a woman was seated in the middle of the ephah.

title: Zechariah Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: And he said, This is Sin; and pushing her down into the ephah, he put the weight of lead on the mouth of it.

title: Zechariah Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: And lifting up my eyes I saw two women coming out, and the wind was in their wings; and they had wings like the wings of a stork: and they took the ephah, lifting it up between earth and heaven.

title: Zechariah Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: And I said to the angel who was talking to me, Where are they taking the ephah?

title: Zechariah Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: And he said to me, To make a house for her in the land of Shinar: and they will make a place ready, and put her there in the place which is hers.

title: Zechariah Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: And again lifting up my eyes I saw four war-carriages coming out from between the two mountains; and the mountains were mountains of brass.

title: Zechariah Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: In the first war-carriage were red horses; and in the second, black horses;

title: Zechariah Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: And in the third, white horses; and in the fourth, horses of mixed colour.

title: Zechariah Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: And I made answer and said to the angel who was talking to me, What are these, my lord?

title: Zechariah Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: And the angel, answering, said to me, These go out to the four winds of heaven from their place before the Lord of all the earth.

title: Zechariah Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: The carriage in which are the black horses goes in the direction of the north country; the white go to the west; and those of mixed colour go in the direction of the south country.

title: Zechariah Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: And the red ones go to the east; and they made request that they might go up and down through the earth: and he said, Go up and down through the earth. So they went up and down through the earth.

title: Zechariah Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: Then crying out to me, he said, See, those who are going to the north country have given rest to the spirit of the Lord in the north country.

title: Zechariah Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Zechariah Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: Take the offerings of those who went away as prisoners, from Heldai, Tobijah, and Jedaiah, and from the family of Josiah, the son of Zephaniah, who have come from Babylon;

title: Zechariah Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: And take silver and gold and make a crown and put it on the head of Zerubbabel;

title: Zechariah Chapter 6 Verse 12
text: And say to him, These are the words of the Lord of armies: See, the man whose name is the Branch, under whom there will be fertile growth.

title: Zechariah Chapter 6 Verse 13
text: And he will be the builder of the Temple of the Lord; and the glory will be his, and he will take his place as ruler on the seat of power; and Joshua will be a priest at his right hand, and between them there will be a design of peace.

title: Zechariah Chapter 6 Verse 14
text: And the crown will be for grace to Heldai and Tobijah and Jedaiah and the son of Zephaniah, to keep their memory living in the house of the Lord.

title: Zechariah Chapter 6 Verse 15
text: And those who are far away will come and be builders in the Temple of the Lord, and it will be clear to you that the Lord of armies has sent me to you.

title: Zechariah Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: And it came about in the fourth year of King Darius, that the word of the Lord came to Zechariah on the fourth day of the ninth month, the month Chislev.

title: Zechariah Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: Now they of Beth-el had sent Sharezer and Regem-melech to make a request for grace from the Lord,

title: Zechariah Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: And to say to the priests of the house of the Lord of armies and to the prophets, Am I to go on weeping in the fifth month, separating myself as I have done in past years?

title: Zechariah Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: Then the word of the Lord of armies came to me, saying

title: Zechariah Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: Say to all the people of the land and to the priests, When you went without food and gave yourselves to grief in the fifth and the seventh months for these seventy years, did you ever do it because of me?

title: Zechariah Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: And when you are feasting and drinking, are you not doing it only for yourselves?

title: Zechariah Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: Are not these the words which the Lord said to you by the earlier prophets, when Jerusalem was full of people and wealth, and the towns round about her and the South and the Lowland were peopled?

title: Zechariah Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: And the word of the Lord came to Zechariah, saying,

title: Zechariah Chapter 7 Verse 9
text: This is what the Lord of armies has said: Let your judging be upright and done in good faith, let every man have mercy and pity for his brother:

title: Zechariah Chapter 7 Verse 10
text: Do not be hard on the widow, or the child without a father, on the man from a strange country, or on the poor; let there be no evil thought in your heart against your brother.

title: Zechariah Chapter 7 Verse 11
text: But they would not give attention, turning their backs and stopping their ears from hearing;

title: Zechariah Chapter 7 Verse 12
text: And they made their hearts like the hardest stone, so that they might not give ear to the law and the words which the Lord of armies had said by the earlier prophets: and there came great wrath from the Lord of armies.

title: Zechariah Chapter 7 Verse 13
text: And it came about that as they would not give ear to his voice, so I would not give ear to their voice, says the Lord of armies:

title: Zechariah Chapter 7 Verse 14
text: But with a storm-wind I sent them in flight among all the nations of whom they had no knowledge. So the land was waste after them, so that no man went through or came back: for they had made waste the desired land.

title: Zechariah Chapter 8 Verse 1
text: And the word of the Lord of armies came to me, saying,

title: Zechariah Chapter 8 Verse 2
text: These are the words of the Lord of armies: I am angry about the fate of Zion, I am angry about her with great wrath.

title: Zechariah Chapter 8 Verse 3
text: This is what the Lord has said: I have come back to Zion, and will make my living-place in Jerusalem: and Jerusalem will be named The town of good faith; and the mountain of the Lord of armies The holy mountain.

title: Zechariah Chapter 8 Verse 4
text: This is what the Lord of armies has said: There will again be old men and old women seated in the open spaces of Jerusalem, every man with his stick in his hand because he is so old.

title: Zechariah Chapter 8 Verse 5
text: And the open spaces of the town will be full of boys and girls playing in its open spaces.

title: Zechariah Chapter 8 Verse 6
text: This is what the Lord of armies has said: If this is a wonder to the rest of this people, is it a wonder to me? says the Lord of armies.

title: Zechariah Chapter 8 Verse 7
text: This is what the Lord of armies has said: See, I will be the saviour of my people from the east country, and from the west country;

title: Zechariah Chapter 8 Verse 8
text: And I will make them come and be living in Jerusalem and they will be to me a people and I will be to them a God, in good faith and in righteousness.

title: Zechariah Chapter 8 Verse 9
text: This is what the Lord of armies has said: Let your hands be strong, you who are now hearing these words from the mouths of the prophets, that is to say, in the days when the base of the house of the Lord of armies has been put in place for the building of the house, that is the Temple.

title: Zechariah Chapter 8 Verse 10
text: For before those days there was no payment for a man's work, or for the use of a beast, and there was no peace for him who went out or him who came in, because of the attacker: for I had every man turned against his neighbour.

title: Zechariah Chapter 8 Verse 11
text: But now I will not be to the rest of this people as I was in the past, says the Lord of armies.

title: Zechariah Chapter 8 Verse 12
text: For I will let the seed of peace be planted; the vine will give her fruit and the land will give her increase and the heavens will give their dew; and I will give to the rest of this people all these things for their heritage.

title: Zechariah Chapter 8 Verse 13
text: And it will come about that, as you were a curse among the nations, O children of Judah and children of Israel, so I will give you salvation and you will be a blessing: have no fear and let your hands be strong.

title: Zechariah Chapter 8 Verse 14
text: For this is what the Lord of armies has said: As it was my purpose to do evil to you when your fathers made me angry, says the Lord of armies, and my purpose was not changed:

title: Zechariah Chapter 8 Verse 15
text: So in these days it is again my purpose to do good to Jerusalem and to the children of Judah: have no fear.

title: Zechariah Chapter 8 Verse 16
text: These are the things which you are to do: Let every man say what is true to his neighbour; and let your judging give peace in your towns.

title: Zechariah Chapter 8 Verse 17
text: Let no one have any evil thought in his heart against his neighbour; and have no love for false oaths: for all these things are hated by me, says the Lord.

title: Zechariah Chapter 8 Verse 18
text: And the word of the Lord of armies came to me, saying,

title: Zechariah Chapter 8 Verse 19
text: This is what the Lord of armies has said: The times of going without food in the fourth month and in the fifth and the seventh and the tenth months, will be for the people of Judah times of joy and happy meetings; so be lovers of good faith and of peace.

title: Zechariah Chapter 8 Verse 20
text: This is what the Lord of armies has said: It will again come about that when peoples and those living in great towns come,

title: Zechariah Chapter 8 Verse 21
text: And the people of one town go to another and say, Let us certainly go with a request for grace from the Lord, and to give worship to the Lord of armies, then I will go with you.

title: Zechariah Chapter 8 Verse 22
text: And great peoples and strong nations will come to give worship to the Lord of armies in Jerusalem and to make requests for grace from the Lord.

title: Zechariah Chapter 8 Verse 23
text: This is what the Lord of armies has said: In those days, ten men from all the languages of the nations will put out their hands and take a grip of the skirt of him who is a Jew, saying, We will go with you, for it has come to our ears that God is with you.

title: Zechariah Chapter 9 Verse 1
text: A word of the Lord: The Lord has come to the land of Hadrach, and Damascus is his resting-place: for the towns of Aram are the Lord's,

title: Zechariah Chapter 9 Verse 2
text: As well as Hamath, which is by its limit, and Tyre and Zidon, because they are very wise.

title: Zechariah Chapter 9 Verse 3
text: And Tyre made for herself a strong place, and got together silver like dust and the best gold like the earth of the streets.

title: Zechariah Chapter 9 Verse 4
text: See, the Lord will take away her heritage, overturning her power in the sea; and she will be burned up with fire.

title: Zechariah Chapter 9 Verse 5
text: Ashkelon will see it with fear, and Gaza, bent with pain; and Ekron, for her hope will be shamed: and the king will be cut off from Gaza, and Ashkelon will be unpeopled.

title: Zechariah Chapter 9 Verse 6
text: And a mixed people will be living in Ashdod, and I will have the pride of the Philistines cut off.

title: Zechariah Chapter 9 Verse 7
text: And I will take away his blood from his mouth, and his disgusting things from between his teeth; and some of his people will be kept for our God: and he will be as a family in Judah, and Ekron as one living in Jerusalem.

title: Zechariah Chapter 9 Verse 8
text: And I will put my forces in position round my house, so that there may be no coming and going: and no cruel master will again go through them: for now I have seen his trouble.

title: Zechariah Chapter 9 Verse 9
text: Be full of joy, O daughter of Zion; give a glad cry, O daughter of Jerusalem: see, your king comes to you: he is upright and has overcome; gentle and seated on an ass, on a young ass.

title: Zechariah Chapter 9 Verse 10
text: And he will have the war-carriage cut off from Ephraim, and the horse from Jerusalem, and the bow of war will be cut off: and he will say words of peace to the nations: and his rule will be from sea to sea, and from the River to the ends of the earth.

title: Zechariah Chapter 9 Verse 11
text: And as for you, because of the blood of your agreement, I have sent out your prisoners from the deep hole in which there is no water.

title: Zechariah Chapter 9 Verse 12
text: And they will come back to you, O daughter of Zion, as prisoners of hope: today I say to you that I will give you back twice as much;

title: Zechariah Chapter 9 Verse 13
text: For I have made Judah a bow bent for my use, I have made Ephraim the arrows of the bow; I will make your sons, O Zion, take up arms against your sons, O Greece, and will make you like the sword of a man of war.

title: Zechariah Chapter 9 Verse 14
text: And the Lord will be seen over them, and his arrow will go out like the thunder-flame: and the Lord God, sounding the war-horn, will go in the storm-winds of the South.

title: Zechariah Chapter 9 Verse 15
text: The Lord of armies will be a cover for them; and they will overcome, crushing under foot the armed men; they will take their blood for drink like wine: they will be full like the sides of the altar.

title: Zechariah Chapter 9 Verse 16
text: And the Lord their God will be their saviour in that day, giving them food like the flock of his people: for they will be like the jewels of a crown shining over his land.

title: Zechariah Chapter 9 Verse 17
text: For how good it is and how beautiful! grain will make the young men strong and new wine the virgins.

title: Zechariah Chapter 10 Verse 1
text: Make your request to the Lord for rain in the time of the spring rains, even to the Lord who makes the thunder-flames; and he will give them showers of rain, to every man grass in the field.

title: Zechariah Chapter 10 Verse 2
text: For the images have said what is not true, and the readers of signs have seen deceit; they have given accounts of false dreams, they give comfort to no purpose: so they go out of the way like sheep, they are troubled because they have no keeper.

title: Zechariah Chapter 10 Verse 3
text: My wrath is burning against the keepers of the flock, and I will send punishment on the he-goats: for the Lord of armies takes care of his flock, the people of Judah, and will make them like the horse of his pride in the fight.

title: Zechariah Chapter 10 Verse 4
text: From him will come the keystone, from him the nail, from him the bow of war, from him will come every ruler;

title: Zechariah Chapter 10 Verse 5
text: Together they will be like men of war, crushing down their haters into the earth of the streets in the fight; they will make war because the Lord is with them: and the horsemen will be shamed.

title: Zechariah Chapter 10 Verse 6
text: And I will make the children of Judah strong, and I will be the saviour of the children of Joseph, and I will make them come back again, for I have had mercy on them: they will be as if I had not given them up: for I am the Lord their God and I will give them an answer.

title: Zechariah Chapter 10 Verse 7
text: And Ephraim will be like a man of war, and their hearts will be glad as with wine; and their children will see it with joy; their hearts will be glad in the Lord.

title: Zechariah Chapter 10 Verse 8
text: With the sound of the pipe I will get them together; for I have given the price to make them free: and they will be increased as they were increased.

title: Zechariah Chapter 10 Verse 9
text: Though I had them planted among the peoples, they will keep me in mind in far countries: and they will take care of their children and will come back.

title: Zechariah Chapter 10 Verse 10
text: And I will make them come back out of the land of Egypt, and will get them together out of Assyria; and I will take them into the land of Gilead, and it will not be wide enough for them.

title: Zechariah Chapter 10 Verse 11
text: And they will go through the sea of Egypt, and all the deep waters of the Nile will become dry: and the pride of Assyria will be made low, and the power of Egypt will be taken away.

title: Zechariah Chapter 10 Verse 12
text: And their strength will be in the Lord; and their pride will be in his name, says the Lord.

title: Zechariah Chapter 11 Verse 1
text: Let your doors be open, O Lebanon, so that fire may be burning among your cedars.

title: Zechariah Chapter 11 Verse 2
text: Give a cry of grief, O fir-tree, for the fall of the cedar, because the great ones have been made low: give cries of grief, O you oaks of Bashan, for the strong trees of the wood have come down.

title: Zechariah Chapter 11 Verse 3
text: The sound of the crying of the keepers of the flock! for their glory is made waste: the sound of the loud crying of the young lions! for the pride of Jordan is made waste.

title: Zechariah Chapter 11 Verse 4
text: This is what the Lord my God has said: Take care of the flock of death;

title: Zechariah Chapter 11 Verse 5
text: Whose owners put them to death and have no sense of sin; and those who get a price for them say, May the Lord be praised for I have much wealth: and the keepers of the flock have no pity for them.

title: Zechariah Chapter 11 Verse 6
text: For I will have no more pity for the people of the land, says the Lord; but I will give up everyone into his neighbour's hand and into the hand of his king: and they will make the land waste, and I will not keep them safe from their hands.

title: Zechariah Chapter 11 Verse 7
text: So I took care of the flock of death, for those who made profit out of the flock; and I took for myself two rods, naming one Beautiful, and the other Bands; and I took care of the flock.

title: Zechariah Chapter 11 Verse 8
text: And in one month I put an end to the three keepers of the flock; for my soul was tired of them, and their souls were disgusted with me.

title: Zechariah Chapter 11 Verse 9
text: And I said, I will not take care of you: If death comes to any, let death be its fate; if any is cut off, let it be cut off; and let the rest take one another's flesh for food.

title: Zechariah Chapter 11 Verse 10
text: And I took my rod Beautiful, cutting it in two, so that the Lord's agreement, which he had made with all the peoples, might be broken.

title: Zechariah Chapter 11 Verse 11
text: And it was broken on that day: and the sheep-traders, who were watching me, were certain that it was the word of the Lord.

title: Zechariah Chapter 11 Verse 12
text: And I said to them, If it seems good to you, give me my payment; and if not, do not give it. So they gave me my payment by weight, thirty shekels of silver.

title: Zechariah Chapter 11 Verse 13
text: And the Lord said to me, Put it into the store-house, the price at which I was valued by them. And I took the thirty shekels of silver and put them into the store-house in the house of the Lord.

title: Zechariah Chapter 11 Verse 14
text: Then I took my other rod, the one named Bands, cutting it in two, so that the relation of brothers between Judah and Israel might be broken.

title: Zechariah Chapter 11 Verse 15
text: And the Lord said to me, Take again the instruments of a foolish keeper of sheep.

title: Zechariah Chapter 11 Verse 16
text: For see, I will put a sheep-keeper over the land, who will have no care for that which is cut off, and will not go in search of the wanderers, or make well what is broken, and he will not give food to that which is ill, but he will take for his food the flesh of the fat, and let their feet be broken.

title: Zechariah Chapter 11 Verse 17
text: A curse on the foolish keeper who goes away from the flock! the sword will be on his arm and on his right eye: his arm will become quite dry and his eye will be made completely dark.

title: Zechariah Chapter 12 Verse 1
text: The word of the Lord about Israel. The Lord by whom the heavens are stretched out and the bases of the earth put in place, and the spirit of man formed inside him, has said:

title: Zechariah Chapter 12 Verse 2
text: See, I will make Jerusalem a cup of shaking fear to all the peoples round about, when Jerusalem is shut in.

title: Zechariah Chapter 12 Verse 3
text: And it will come about in that day that I will make Jerusalem a stone of great weight for all the peoples; all those who take it up will be badly wounded; and all the nations of the earth will come together against it.

title: Zechariah Chapter 12 Verse 4
text: In that day, says the Lord, I will put fear into every horse and make every horseman go off his head: and my eyes will be open on the people of Judah, and I will make every horse of the peoples blind.

title: Zechariah Chapter 12 Verse 5
text: And the families of Judah will say in their hearts, The people of Jerusalem have their strength in the Lord of armies, their God.

title: Zechariah Chapter 12 Verse 6
text: In that day I will make the families of Judah like a pot with fire in it among trees, and like a flaming stick among cut grain; they will send destruction on all the peoples round about, on the right hand and on the left: and Jerusalem will be living again in the place which is hers, that is, in Jerusalem.

title: Zechariah Chapter 12 Verse 7
text: And the Lord will give salvation to the tents of Judah first, so that the glory of the family of David and the glory of the people of Jerusalem may not be greater than that of Judah.

title: Zechariah Chapter 12 Verse 8
text: In that day the Lord will be a cover over the people of Jerusalem; and he who is feeble among them in that day will be as strong as David, and the family of David will be as God, as the angel of the Lord before them.

title: Zechariah Chapter 12 Verse 9
text: And it will come about on that day that I will take in hand the destruction of all the nations who come against Jerusalem.

title: Zechariah Chapter 12 Verse 10
text: And I will send down on the family of David and on the people of Jerusalem the spirit of grace and of prayer; and their eyes will be turned to the one who was wounded by their hands: and they will be weeping for him as for an only son, and their grief for him will be bitter, like the grief of one sorrowing for his oldest son.

title: Zechariah Chapter 12 Verse 11
text: In that day there will be a great weeping in Jerusalem, like the weeping of Hadad-rimmon in the valley of Megiddon.

title: Zechariah Chapter 12 Verse 12
text: And the land will give itself to weeping, every family separately; the family of David by themselves, and their wives by themselves; the family of Nathan by themselves, and their wives by themselves;

title: Zechariah Chapter 12 Verse 13
text: The family of Levi by themselves, and their wives by themselves; the family of Shimei by themselves, and their wives by themselves;

title: Zechariah Chapter 12 Verse 14
text: And all the other families by themselves, and their wives by themselves.

title: Zechariah Chapter 13 Verse 1
text: In that day there will be a fountain open to the family of David and to the people of Jerusalem, for sin and for that which is unclean.

title: Zechariah Chapter 13 Verse 2
text: And it will come about on that day, says the Lord of armies, that I will have the names of the images cut off out of the land, and there will be no more memory of them: and I will send all the prophets and the unclean spirit away from the land.

title: Zechariah Chapter 13 Verse 3
text: And if anyone goes on acting as a prophet, then his father and his mother who gave him life will say to him, You may not go on living, for you are saying what is false in the name of the Lord; and his father and his mother will put a sword through him when he does so.

title: Zechariah Chapter 13 Verse 4
text: And it will come about in that day that the prophets will be shamed, every man on account of his vision, when he is talking as a prophet; and they will not put on a robe of hair for purposes of deceit:

title: Zechariah Chapter 13 Verse 5
text: But he will say, I am no prophet, but a worker on the land; for I have been an owner of land from the time when I was young.

title: Zechariah Chapter 13 Verse 6
text: And if anyone says to him, What are these wounds between your hands? then he will say, Those with which I was wounded in the house of my friends.

title: Zechariah Chapter 13 Verse 7
text: Awake! O sword, against the keeper of my flock, and against him who is with me, says the Lord of armies: put to death the keeper of the sheep, and the sheep will go in flight: and my hand will be turned against the little ones.

title: Zechariah Chapter 13 Verse 8
text: And it will come about that in all the land, says the Lord, two parts of it will be cut off and come to an end; but the third will be still living there.

title: Zechariah Chapter 13 Verse 9
text: And I will make the third part go through the fire, cleaning them as silver is made clean, and testing them as gold is tested: and they will make their prayer to me and I will give them an answer: I will say, It is my people; and they will say, The Lord is my God.

title: Zechariah Chapter 14 Verse 1
text: See, a day of the Lord is coming when they will make division of your goods taken by force before your eyes.

title: Zechariah Chapter 14 Verse 2
text: For I will get all the nations together to make war against Jerusalem; and the town will be overcome, and the goods taken from the houses, and the women taken by force: and half the town will go away as prisoners, and the rest of the people will not be cut off from the town.

title: Zechariah Chapter 14 Verse 3
text: Then the Lord will go out and make war against those nations, as he did in the day of the fight.

title: Zechariah Chapter 14 Verse 4
text: And in that day his feet will be on the Mount of Olives, which is opposite Jerusalem on the east, and the Mount of Olives will be parted in the middle to the east and to the west, forming a very great valley; and half the mountain will be moved to the north and half of it to the south.

title: Zechariah Chapter 14 Verse 5
text: And the valley will be stopped ... and you will go in flight as you went in flight from the earth-shock in the days of Uzziah, king of Judah: and the Lord my God will come, and all his holy ones with him.

title: Zechariah Chapter 14 Verse 6
text: And in that day there will be no heat or cold or ice;

title: Zechariah Chapter 14 Verse 7
text: And it will be unbroken day, such as the Lord has knowledge of, without change of day and night, and even at nightfall it will be light.

title: Zechariah Chapter 14 Verse 8
text: And on that day living waters will go out from Jerusalem; half of them flowing to the sea on the east and half to the sea on the west: in summer and in winter it will be so.

title: Zechariah Chapter 14 Verse 9
text: And the Lord will be King over all the earth: in that day there will be one Lord and his name one.

title: Zechariah Chapter 14 Verse 10
text: And all the land will become like the Arabah, from Geba to Rimmon south of Jerusalem; and she will be lifted up and be living in her place; from the doorway of Benjamin to the place of the first doorway, to the doorway of the angle, and from the tower of Hananel to the king's wine-crushing places, men will be living in her.

title: Zechariah Chapter 14 Verse 11
text: And there will be no more curse; but Jerusalem will be living without fear of danger.

title: Zechariah Chapter 14 Verse 12
text: And this will be the disease which the Lord will send on all the peoples which have been warring against Jerusalem: their flesh will be wasted away while they are on their feet, their eyes will be wasted in their heads and their tongues in their mouths.

title: Zechariah Chapter 14 Verse 13
text: And it will be on that day that a great fear will be sent among them from the Lord; and everyone will take his neighbour's hand, and every man's hand will be lifted against his neighbour's.

title: Zechariah Chapter 14 Verse 14
text: And even Judah will be fighting against Jerusalem; and the wealth of all the nations round about will be massed together, a great store of gold and silver and clothing.

title: Zechariah Chapter 14 Verse 15
text: And the horses and the transport beasts, the camels and the asses and all the beasts in those tents will be attacked by the same disease.

title: Zechariah Chapter 14 Verse 16
text: And it will come about that everyone who is still living, of all those nations who came against Jerusalem, will go up from year to year to give worship to the King, the Lord of armies, and to keep the feast of tents.

title: Zechariah Chapter 14 Verse 17
text: And it will be that if any one of all the families of the earth does not go up to Jerusalem to give worship to the King, the Lord of armies, on them there will be no rain.

title: Zechariah Chapter 14 Verse 18
text: And if the family of Egypt does not go up or come there, they will be attacked by the disease which the Lord will send on the nations:

title: Zechariah Chapter 14 Verse 19
text: This will be the punishment of Egypt, and the punishment of all the nations who do not go up to keep the feast of tents.

title: Zechariah Chapter 14 Verse 20
text: On that day all the bells of the horses will be holy to the Lord, and the pots in the Lord's house will be like the basins before the altar.

title: Zechariah Chapter 14 Verse 21
text: And every pot in Jerusalem and in Judah will be holy to the Lord of armies: and all those who make offerings will come and take them for boiling their offerings: in that day there will be no more traders in the house of the Lord of armies.

title: Malachi Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: The word of the Lord to Israel by Malachi.

title: Malachi Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: You have been loved by me, says the Lord. But you say, Where was your love for us? Was not Esau Jacob's brother? says the Lord: but Jacob was loved by me,

title: Malachi Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: And Esau was hated, and I sent destruction on his mountains, and gave his heritage to the beasts of the waste land.

title: Malachi Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: Though Edom says, We are crushed down but we will come back, building up the waste places; this is what the Lord of armies has said: They may put up buildings, but I will have them pulled down; and they will be named The land of evil-doing, and The people against whom the Lord keeps his wrath for ever.

title: Malachi Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: And your eyes will see it; and you will say, The Lord is great even outside the limits of Israel.

title: Malachi Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: A son gives honour to his father, and a servant has fear of his master: if then I am a father, where is my honour? and if I am a master, where is the fear of me? says the Lord of armies to you, O priests, who give no value to my name. And you say, How have we not given value to your name?

title: Malachi Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: You put unclean bread on my altar. And you say, How have we made it unclean? By your saying, The table of the Lord is of no value.

title: Malachi Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: And when you give what is blind for an offering, it is no evil! and when you give what is damaged and ill, it is no evil! Give it now to your ruler; will he be pleased with you, or will you have his approval? says the Lord of armies.

title: Malachi Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: And now, make request for the grace of God so that he may have mercy on us: this has been your doing: will he give his approval to any of you? says the Lord of armies.

title: Malachi Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: If only there was one among you who would see that the doors were shut, so that you might not put a light to the fire on my altar for nothing! I have no pleasure in you, says the Lord of armies, and I will not take an offering from your hands.

title: Malachi Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: For, from the coming up of the sun till its going down, my name is great among the Gentiles; and in every place the smell of burning flesh is offered to my name, and a clean offering: for my name is great among the Gentiles, says the Lord of armies.

title: Malachi Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: But you make it unholy by saying, The Lord's table has become unclean, and his food is of no value.

title: Malachi Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: And you say, See, what a weariness it is! and you let out your breath at it, says the Lord of armies; and you have given what has been cut about by beasts, and what is damaged in its feet and ill; this is the offering you give: will this be pleasing to me from your hands? says the Lord.

title: Malachi Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: A curse on the false man who has a male in his flock, and takes his oath, and gives to the Lord a damaged thing: for I am a great King, says the Lord of armies, and my name is to be feared among the Gentiles.

title: Malachi Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: And now, O you priests, this order is for you.

title: Malachi Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: If you will not give ear and take it to heart, to give glory to my name, says the Lord of armies, then I will send the curse on you and will put a curse on your blessing: truly, even now I have put a curse on it, because you do not take it to heart.

title: Malachi Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: See, I will have your arm cut off, and will put waste on your faces, even the waste from your feasts; and you will be taken away with it.

title: Malachi Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: And you will be certain that I have sent this order to you, so that it might be my agreement with Levi, says the Lord of armies.

title: Malachi Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: My agreement with him was on my side life and peace, and I gave them to him; on his side fear, and he had fear of me and gave honour to my name.

title: Malachi Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: True teaching was in his mouth, and no evil was seen on his lips: he was walking with me in peace and righteousness, turning numbers of people away from evil-doing.

title: Malachi Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: For it is right for the priest's lips to keep knowledge, and for men to be waiting for the law from his mouth: for he is the servant sent from the Lord of armies.

title: Malachi Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: But you are turned out of the way; you have made the law hard for numbers of people; you have made the agreement of Levi of no value, says the Lord of armies.

title: Malachi Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: And so I have taken away your honour and made you low before all the people, even as you have not kept my ways, and have given no thought to me in using the law.

title: Malachi Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: Have we not all one father? has not one God made us? why are we, every one of us, acting falsely to his brother, putting shame on the agreement of our fathers?

title: Malachi Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: Judah has been acting falsely, and a disgusting thing has been done in Jerusalem; for Judah has made unclean the holy place of the Lord which is dear to him, and has taken as his wife the daughter of a strange god.

title: Malachi Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: The Lord will have the man who does this cut off root and branch out of the tents of Jacob, and him who makes an offering to the Lord of armies.

title: Malachi Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: And this again you do: covering the altar of the Lord with weeping and with grief, so that he gives no more thought to the offering, and does not take it with pleasure from your hand.

title: Malachi Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: But you say, For what reason? Because the Lord has been a witness between you and the wife of your early years, to whom you have been untrue, though she is your friend and the wife to whom you have given your word.

title: Malachi Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: ... So give thought to your spirit, and let no one be false to the wife of his early years.

title: Malachi Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: For I am against the putting away of a wife, says the Lord, the God of Israel, and against him who is clothed with violent acts, says the Lord of armies: so give thought to your spirit and do not be false in your acts.

title: Malachi Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: You have made the Lord tired with your words. And still you say, How have we made him tired? By your saying, Everyone who does evil is good in the eyes of the Lord, and he has delight in them; or, Where is God the judge?

title: Malachi Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: See, I am sending my servant, and he will make ready the way before me; and the Lord, whom you are looking for, will suddenly come to his Temple; and the angel of the agreement, in whom you have delight, see, he is coming, says the Lord of armies.

title: Malachi Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: But by whom may the day of his coming be faced? and who may keep his place when he is seen? for he is like the metal-tester's fire and the cleaner's soap.

title: Malachi Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: He will take his seat, testing and cleaning the sons of Levi, burning away the evil from them as from gold and silver; so that they may make offerings to the Lord in righteousness.

title: Malachi Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: Then the offering of Judah and Jerusalem will be pleasing to the Lord, as in days gone by, and as in past years.

title: Malachi Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: And I will come near to you for judging; I will quickly be a witness against the wonder-workers, against those who have been untrue in married life, against those who take false oaths; against those who keep back from the servant his payment, and who are hard on the widow and the child without a father, who do not give his rights to the man from a strange country, and have no fear of me, says the Lord of armies.

title: Malachi Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: For I am the Lord, I am unchanged; and so you, O sons of Jacob, have not been cut off.

title: Malachi Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: From the days of your fathers you have been turned away from my rules and have not kept them. Come back to me, and I will come back to you, says the Lord of armies. But you say, How are we to come back?

title: Malachi Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: Will a man keep back from God what is right? But you have kept back what is mine. But you say, What have we kept back from you? Tenths and offerings.

title: Malachi Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: You are cursed with a curse; for you have kept back from me what is mine, even all this nation.

title: Malachi Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: Let your tenths come into the store-house so that there may be food in my house, and put me to the test by doing so, says the Lord of armies, and see if I do not make the windows of heaven open and send down such a blessing on you that there is no room for it.

title: Malachi Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: And on your account I will keep back the locusts from wasting the fruits of your land; and the fruit of your vine will not be dropped on the field before its time, says the Lord of armies

title: Malachi Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: And you will be named happy by all nations: for you will be a land of delight, says the Lord of armies.

title: Malachi Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: Your words have been strong against me, says the Lord. And still you say, What have we said against you?

title: Malachi Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: You have said, It is no use worshipping God: what profit have we had from keeping his orders, and going in clothing of sorrow before the Lord of armies?

title: Malachi Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: And now to us the men of pride seem happy; yes, the evil-doers are doing well; they put God to the test and are safe.

title: Malachi Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: Then those in whom was the fear of the Lord had talk together: and the Lord gave ear, and it was recorded in a book to be kept in mind before him, for those who had the fear of the Lord and gave thought to his name.

title: Malachi Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: And they will be mine, says the Lord, in the day when I make them my special property; and I will have mercy on them as a man has mercy on his son who is his servant.

title: Malachi Chapter 3 Verse 18
text: Then you will again see how the upright man is different from the sinner, and the servant of God from him who is not.

title: Malachi Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: For see, the day is coming, it is burning like an oven; all the men of pride and all who do evil will be dry stems of grass: and in the day which is coming they will be burned up, says the Lord of armies, till they have not a root or a branch.

title: Malachi Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: But to you who give worship to my name, the sun of righteousness will come up with new life in its wings; and you will go out, playing like young oxen full of food.

title: Malachi Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: And the evil-doers will be crushed under you, they will be dust under your feet, in the day when I do my work, says the Lord of armies.

title: Malachi Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: Keep in mind the law of Moses, my servant, which I gave him in Horeb for all Israel, even the rules and the decisions.

title: Malachi Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: See, I am sending you Elijah the prophet before the day of the Lord comes, that great day, greatly to be feared.

title: Malachi Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: And by him the hearts of fathers will be turned to their children, and the hearts of children to their fathers; for fear that I may come and put the earth under a curse.

title: Matthew Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: The book of the generations of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham.

title: Matthew Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: The son of Abraham was Isaac; and the son of Isaac was Jacob; and the sons of Jacob were Judah and his brothers;

title: Matthew Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: And the sons of Judah were Perez and Zerah by Tamar; and the son of Perez was Hezron; and the son of Hezron was Ram;

title: Matthew Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: And the son of Ram was Amminadab; and the son of Amminadab was Nahshon; and the son of Nahshon was Salmon;

title: Matthew Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: And the son of Salmon by Rahab was Boaz; and the son of Boaz by Ruth was Obed; and the son of Obed was Jesse;

title: Matthew Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: And the son of Jesse was David the king; and the son of David was Solomon by her who had been the wife of Uriah;

title: Matthew Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: And the son of Solomon was Rehoboam; and the son of Rehoboam was Abijah; and the son of Abijah was Asa;

title: Matthew Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: And the son of Asa was Jehoshaphat; and the son of Jehoshaphat was Joram; and the son of Joram was Uzziah;

title: Matthew Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: And the son of Uzziah was Jotham; and the son of Jotham was Ahaz; and the son of Ahaz was Hezekiah;

title: Matthew Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: And the son of Hezekiah was Manasseh; and the son of Manasseh was Amon; and the son of Amon was Josiah;

title: Matthew Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: And the sons of Josiah were Jechoniah and his brothers, at the time of the taking away to Babylon.

title: Matthew Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: And after the taking away to Babylon, Jechoniah had a son Shealtiel; and Shealtiel had Zerubbabel;

title: Matthew Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: And Zerubbabel had Abiud; and Abiud had Eliakim; and Eliakim had Azor;

title: Matthew Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: And Azor had Zadok; and Zadok had Achim; and Achim had Eliud;

title: Matthew Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: And Eliud had Eleazar; and Eleazar had Matthan; and Matthan had Jacob;

title: Matthew Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: And the son of Jacob was Joseph the husband of Mary, who gave birth to Jesus, whose name is Christ.

title: Matthew Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: So all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations; and from David to the taking away to Babylon, fourteen generations; and from the taking away to Babylon to the coming of Christ, fourteen generations.

title: Matthew Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: Now the birth of Jesus Christ was in this way: when his mother Mary was going to be married to Joseph, before they came together the discovery was made that she was with child by the Holy Spirit.

title: Matthew Chapter 1 Verse 19
text: And Joseph, her husband, being an upright man, and not desiring to make her a public example, had a mind to put her away privately.

title: Matthew Chapter 1 Verse 20
text: But when he was giving thought to these things, an angel of the Lord came to him in a dream, saying, Joseph, son of David, have no fear of taking Mary as your wife; because that which is in her body is of the Holy Spirit.

title: Matthew Chapter 1 Verse 21
text: And she will give birth to a son; and you will give him the name Jesus; for he will give his people salvation from their sins.

title: Matthew Chapter 1 Verse 22
text: Now all this took place so that the word of the Lord by the prophet might come true,

title: Matthew Chapter 1 Verse 23
text: See, the virgin will be with child, and will give birth to a son, and they will give him the name Immanuel, that is, God with us.

title: Matthew Chapter 1 Verse 24
text: And Joseph did as the angel of the Lord had said to him, and took her as his wife;

title: Matthew Chapter 1 Verse 25
text: And he had no connection with her till she had given birth to a son; and he gave him the name Jesus.

title: Matthew Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: Now when the birth of Jesus took place in Beth-lehem of Judaea, in the days of Herod the king, there came wise men from the east to Jerusalem,

title: Matthew Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: Saying, Where is the King of the Jews whose birth has now taken place? We have seen his star in the east and have come to give him worship.

title: Matthew Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: And when it came to the ears of Herod the king, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.

title: Matthew Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: And he got together all the chief priests and scribes of the people, questioning them as to where the birth-place of the Christ would be.

title: Matthew Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: And they said to him, In Beth-lehem of Judaea; for so it is said in the writings of the prophet,

title: Matthew Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: You Beth-lehem, in the land of Judah, are not the least among the chiefs of Judah: out of you will come a ruler, who will be the keeper of my people Israel.

title: Matthew Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: Then Herod sent for the wise men privately, and put questions to them about what time the star had been seen.

title: Matthew Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: And he sent them to Beth-lehem and said, Go and make certain where the young child is; and when you have seen him, let me have news of it, so that I may come and give him worship.

title: Matthew Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: And after hearing the king, they went on their way; and the star which they saw in the east went before them, till it came to rest over the place where the young child was.

title: Matthew Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: And when they saw the star they were full of joy.

title: Matthew Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: And they came into the house, and saw the young child with Mary, his mother; and falling down on their faces they gave him worship; and from their store they gave him offerings of gold, perfume, and spices.

title: Matthew Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: And it was made clear to them by God in a dream that they were not to go back to Herod; so they went into their country by another way.

title: Matthew Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: And when they had gone, an angel of the Lord came to Joseph in a dream, saying, Get up and take the young child and his mother, and go into Egypt, and do not go from there till I give you word; for Herod will be searching for the young child to put him to death.

title: Matthew Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: So he took the young child and his mother by night, and went into Egypt;

title: Matthew Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: And was there till the death of Herod; so that the word of the Lord through the prophet might come true, Out of Egypt have I sent for my son.

title: Matthew Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: Then Herod, when he saw that he had been tricked by the wise men, was very angry; and he sent out, and put to death all the male children in Beth-lehem and in all the parts round about it, from two years old and under, acting on the knowledge which he had got with care from the wise men.

title: Matthew Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: Then the word of Jeremiah the prophet came true,

title: Matthew Chapter 2 Verse 18
text: In Ramah there was a sound of weeping and great sorrow, Rachel weeping for her children, and she would not be comforted for their loss.

title: Matthew Chapter 2 Verse 19
text: But when Herod was dead, an angel of the Lord came in a dream to Joseph in Egypt,

title: Matthew Chapter 2 Verse 20
text: Saying, Get up and take the young child and his mother, and go into the land of Israel: because they who were attempting to take the young child's life are dead.

title: Matthew Chapter 2 Verse 21
text: And he got up, and took the young child and his mother, and came into the land of Israel.

title: Matthew Chapter 2 Verse 22
text: But when it came to his ears that Archelaus was ruling over Judaea in the place of his father Herod, he was in fear of going there; and God having given him news of the danger in a dream, he went out of the way into the country parts of Galilee.

title: Matthew Chapter 2 Verse 23
text: And he came and was living in a town named Nazareth: so that the word of the prophets might come true, He will be named a Nazarene.

title: Matthew Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: And in those days John the Baptist came preaching in the waste land of Judaea,

title: Matthew Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: Saying, Let your hearts be turned from sin; for the kingdom of heaven is near.

title: Matthew Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: For this is he of whom Isaiah the prophet said, The voice of one crying in the waste land, Make ready the way of the Lord, make his roads straight.

title: Matthew Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: Now John was clothed in camel's hair, with a leather band about him; and his food was locusts and honey.

title: Matthew Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: Then Jerusalem and all Judaea went out to him, and all the people from near Jordan;

title: Matthew Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: And they were given baptism by him in the river Jordan, saying openly that they had done wrong.

title: Matthew Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: But when he saw a number of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming to his baptism, he said to them, Offspring of snakes, at whose word are you going in flight from the wrath to come?

title: Matthew Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: Let your change of heart be seen in your works:

title: Matthew Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: And say not to yourselves, We have Abraham for our father; because I say to you that God is able from these stones to make children for Abraham.

title: Matthew Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: And even now the axe is put to the root of the trees; every tree then which does not give good fruit is cut down, and put into the fire.
