title: Matthew Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: Truly, I give baptism with water to those of you whose hearts are changed; but he who comes after me is greater than I, whose shoes I am not good enough to take up: he will give you baptism with the Holy Spirit and with fire:

title: Matthew Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: In whose hand is the instrument with which he will make clean his grain; he will put the good grain in his store, but the waste will be burned up in the fire which will never be put out.

title: Matthew Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: Then Jesus came from Galilee to John at the Jordan, to be given baptism by him.

title: Matthew Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: But John would have kept him back, saying, It is I who have need of baptism from you, and do you come to me?

title: Matthew Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: But Jesus made answer, saying to him, Let it be so now: because so it is right for us to make righteousness complete. Then he gave him baptism.

title: Matthew Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: And Jesus, having been given baptism, straight away went up from the water; and, the heavens opening, he saw the Spirit of God coming down on him as a dove;

title: Matthew Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: And a voice came out of heaven, saying, This is my dearly loved Son, with whom I am well pleased.

title: Matthew Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: Then Jesus was sent by the Spirit into the waste land to be tested by the Evil One.

title: Matthew Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: And after going without food for forty days and forty nights, he was in need of it.

title: Matthew Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: And the Evil One came and said to him, If you are the Son of God, give the word for these stones to become bread.

title: Matthew Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: But he made answer and said, It is in the Writings, Bread is not man's only need, but every word which comes out of the mouth of God.

title: Matthew Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: Then the Evil One took him to the holy town; and he put him on the highest point of the Temple and said to him,

title: Matthew Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: If you are the Son of God, let yourself go down; for it is in the Writings, He will give his angels care over you; and, In their hands they will keep you up, so that your foot may not be crushed against a stone.

title: Matthew Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: Jesus said to him, Again it is in the Writings, You may not put the Lord your God to the test.

title: Matthew Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: Again, the Evil One took him up to a very high mountain, and let him see all the kingdoms of the world and the glory of them;

title: Matthew Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: And he said to him, All these things will I give you, if you will go down on your face and give me worship.

title: Matthew Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: Then said Jesus to him, Away, Satan: for it is in the Writings, Give worship to the Lord your God and be his servant only.

title: Matthew Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: Then the Evil One went away from him, and angels came and took care of him.

title: Matthew Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: Now when it came to his ears that John had been put in prison, he went away to Galilee;

title: Matthew Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: And going away from Nazareth, he came and made his living-place in Capernaum, which is by the sea, in the country of Zebulun and Naphtali:

title: Matthew Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: So that the word of the prophet Isaiah might come true,

title: Matthew Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, by the way of the sea, the other side of Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles,

title: Matthew Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: The people who were in the dark saw a great light, and to those in the land of the shade of death did the dawn come up.

title: Matthew Chapter 4 Verse 17
text: From that time Jesus went about preaching and saying, Let your hearts be turned from sin, for the kingdom of heaven is near.

title: Matthew Chapter 4 Verse 18
text: And when he was walking by the sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers, Simon, whose other name was Peter, and Andrew, his brother, who were putting a net into the sea; for they were fishermen.

title: Matthew Chapter 4 Verse 19
text: And he said to them, Come after me, and I will make you fishers of men.

title: Matthew Chapter 4 Verse 20
text: And straight away they let go the nets and went after him.

title: Matthew Chapter 4 Verse 21
text: And going on from there he saw two other brothers, James, the son of Zebedee, and John, his brother, in the boat with their father, stitching up their nets; and he said, Come.

title: Matthew Chapter 4 Verse 22
text: And they went straight from the boat and their father and came after him.

title: Matthew Chapter 4 Verse 23
text: And Jesus went about in all Galilee, teaching in their Synagogues and preaching the good news of the kingdom, and making well those who were ill with any disease among the people.

title: Matthew Chapter 4 Verse 24
text: And news of him went out through all Syria; and they took to him all who were ill with different diseases and pains, those having evil spirits and those who were off their heads, and those who had no power of moving. And he made them well.

title: Matthew Chapter 4 Verse 25
text: And there went after him great numbers from Galilee and Decapolis and Jerusalem and Judaea and from the other side of Jordan.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: And seeing great masses of people he went up into the mountain; and when he was seated his disciples came to him.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: And with these words he gave them teaching, saying,

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: Happy are the poor in spirit: for the kingdom of heaven is theirs.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: Happy are those who are sad: for they will be comforted.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: Happy are the gentle: for the earth will be their heritage.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: Happy are those whose heart's desire is for righteousness: for they will have their desire.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: Happy are those who have mercy: for they will be given mercy.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: Happy are the clean in heart: for they will see God.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: Happy are the peacemakers: for they will be named sons of God.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: Happy are those who are attacked on account of righteousness: for the kingdom of heaven will be theirs.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: Happy are you when men give you a bad name, and are cruel to you, and say all evil things against you falsely, because of me.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: Be glad and full of joy; for great is your reward in heaven: for so were the prophets attacked who were before you.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: You are the salt of the earth; but if its taste goes from the salt, how will you make it salt again? it is then good for nothing but to be put out and crushed under foot by men.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: You are the light of the world. A town put on a hill may be seen by all.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 15
text: And a burning light is not put under a vessel, but on its table; so that its rays may be shining on all who are in the house.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 16
text: Even so let your light be shining before men, so that they may see your good works and give glory to your Father in heaven.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 17
text: Let there be no thought that I have come to put an end to the law or the prophets. I have not come for destruction, but to make complete.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 18
text: Truly I say to you, Till heaven and earth come to an end, not the smallest letter or part of a letter will in any way be taken from the law, till all things are done.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 19
text: Whoever then goes against the smallest of these laws, teaching men to do the same, will be named least in the kingdom of heaven; but he who keeps the laws, teaching others to keep them, will be named great in the kingdom of heaven.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 20
text: For I say to you, If your righteousness is not greater than the righteousness of the scribes and Pharisees, you will never go into the kingdom of heaven.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 21
text: You have knowledge that it was said in old times, You may not put to death; and, Whoever puts to death will be in danger of being judged:

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 22
text: But I say to you that everyone who is angry with his brother will be in danger of being judged; and he who says to his brother, Raca, will be in danger from the Sanhedrin; and whoever says, You foolish one, will be in danger of the hell of fire.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 23
text: If then you are making an offering at the altar and there it comes to your mind that your brother has something against you,

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 24
text: While your offering is still before the altar, first go and make peace with your brother, then come and make your offering.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 25
text: Come to an agreement quickly with him who has a cause against you at law, while you are with him on the way, for fear that he may give you up to the judge and the judge may give you to the police and you may be put into prison.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 26
text: Truly I say to you, You will not come out from there till you have made payment of the very last farthing.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 27
text: You have knowledge that it was said, You may not have connection with another man's wife:

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 28
text: But I say to you that everyone whose eyes are turned on a woman with desire has had connection with her in his heart.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 29
text: And if your right eye is a cause of trouble to you, take it out and put it away from you; because it is better to undergo the loss of one part, than for all your body to go into hell.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 30
text: And if your right hand is a cause of trouble to you, let it be cut off and put it away from you; because it is better to undergo the loss of one part, than for all your body to go into hell.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 31
text: Again, it was said, Whoever puts away his wife has to give her a statement in writing for this purpose:

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 32
text: But I say to you that everyone who puts away his wife for any other cause but the loss of her virtue, makes her false to her husband; and whoever takes her as his wife after she is put away, is no true husband to her.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 33
text: Again, you have knowledge that it was said in old times, Do not take false oaths, but give effect to your oaths to the Lord:

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 34
text: But I say to you, Take no oaths at all: not by the heaven, because it is the seat of God;

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 35
text: Or by the earth, because it is the resting-place for his foot; or by Jerusalem, because it is the town of the great King.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 36
text: You may not take an oath by your head, because you are not able to make one hair white or black.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 37
text: But let your words be simply, Yes or No: and whatever is more than these is of the Evil One.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 38
text: You have knowledge that it was said, An eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth:

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 39
text: But I say to you, Do not make use of force against an evil man; but to him who gives you a blow on the right side of your face let the left be turned.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 40
text: And if any man goes to law with you and takes away your coat, do not keep back your robe from him.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 41
text: And whoever makes you go one mile, go with him two.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 42
text: Give to him who comes with a request, and keep not your property from him who would for a time make use of it.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 43
text: You have knowledge that it was said, Have love for your neighbour, and hate for him who is against you:

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 44
text: But I say to you, Have love for those who are against you, and make prayer for those who are cruel to you;

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 45
text: So that you may be the sons of your Father in heaven; for his sun gives light to the evil and to the good, and he sends rain on the upright man and on the sinner.

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 46
text: For if you have love for those who have love for you, what credit is it to you? do not the tax-farmers the same?

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 47
text: And if you say, Good day, to your brothers only, what do you do more than others? do not even the Gentiles the same?

title: Matthew Chapter 5 Verse 48
text: Be then complete in righteousness, even as your Father in heaven is complete.

title: Matthew Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: Take care not to do your good works before men, to be seen by them; or you will have no reward from your Father in heaven.

title: Matthew Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: When then you give money to the poor, do not make a noise about it, as the false-hearted men do in the Synagogues and in the streets, so that they may have glory from men. Truly, I say to you, They have their reward.

title: Matthew Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: But when you give money, let not your left hand see what your right hand does:

title: Matthew Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: So that your giving may be in secret; and your Father, who sees in secret, will give you your reward.

title: Matthew Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: And when you make your prayers, be not like the false-hearted men, who take pleasure in getting up and saying their prayers in the Synagogues and at the street turnings so that they may be seen by men. Truly I say to you, They have their reward.

title: Matthew Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: But when you make your prayer, go into your private room, and, shutting the door, say a prayer to your Father in secret, and your Father, who sees in secret, will give you your reward.

title: Matthew Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: And in your prayer do not make use of the same words again and again, as the Gentiles do: for they have the idea that God will give attention to them because of the number of their words.

title: Matthew Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: So be not like them; because your Father has knowledge of your needs even before you make your requests to him.

title: Matthew Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: Let this then be your prayer: Our Father in heaven, may your name be kept holy.

title: Matthew Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: Let your kingdom come. Let your pleasure be done, as in heaven, so on earth.

title: Matthew Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: Give us this day bread for our needs.

title: Matthew Chapter 6 Verse 12
text: And make us free of our debts, as we have made those free who are in debt to us.

title: Matthew Chapter 6 Verse 13
text: And let us not be put to the test, but keep us safe from the Evil One.

title: Matthew Chapter 6 Verse 14
text: For if you let men have forgiveness for their sins, you will have forgiveness from your Father in heaven.

title: Matthew Chapter 6 Verse 15
text: But if you do not let men have forgiveness for their sins, you will not have forgiveness from your Father for your sins.

title: Matthew Chapter 6 Verse 16
text: And when you go without food, be not sad-faced as the false-hearted are. For they go about with changed looks, so that men may see that they are going without food. Truly I say to you, They have their reward.

title: Matthew Chapter 6 Verse 17
text: But when you go without food, put oil on your head and make your face clean;

title: Matthew Chapter 6 Verse 18
text: So that no one may see that you are going without food, but your Father in secret; and your Father, who sees in secret, will give you your reward.

title: Matthew Chapter 6 Verse 19
text: Make no store of wealth for yourselves on earth, where it may be turned to dust by worms and weather, and where thieves may come in by force and take it away.

title: Matthew Chapter 6 Verse 20
text: But make a store for yourselves in heaven, where it will not be turned to dust and where thieves do not come in to take it away:

title: Matthew Chapter 6 Verse 21
text: For where your wealth is, there will your heart be.

title: Matthew Chapter 6 Verse 22
text: The light of the body is the eye; if then your eye is true, all your body will be full of light.

title: Matthew Chapter 6 Verse 23
text: But if your eye is evil, all your body will be dark. If then the light which is in you is dark, how dark it will be!

title: Matthew Chapter 6 Verse 24
text: No man is able to be a servant to two masters: for he will have hate for the one and love for the other, or he will keep to one and have no respect for the other. You may not be servants of God and of wealth.

title: Matthew Chapter 6 Verse 25
text: So I say to you, Take no thought for your life, about food or drink, or about clothing for your body. Is not life more than food, and the body more than its clothing?

title: Matthew Chapter 6 Verse 26
text: See the birds of heaven; they do not put seeds in the earth, they do not get in grain, or put it in store-houses; and your Father in heaven gives them food. Are you not of much more value than they?

title: Matthew Chapter 6 Verse 27
text: And which of you by taking thought is able to make himself a cubit taller?

title: Matthew Chapter 6 Verse 28
text: And why are you troubled about clothing? See the flowers of the field, how they come up; they do no work, they make no thread:

title: Matthew Chapter 6 Verse 29
text: But I say to you that even Solomon in all his glory was not clothed like one of these.

title: Matthew Chapter 6 Verse 30
text: But if God gives such clothing to the grass of the field, which is here today and tomorrow is put into the oven, will he not much more give you clothing, O you of little faith?

title: Matthew Chapter 6 Verse 31
text: Then do not be full of care, saying, What are we to have for food or drink? or, With what may we be clothed?

title: Matthew Chapter 6 Verse 32
text: Because the Gentiles go in search of all these things: for your Father in heaven has knowledge that you have need of all these things:

title: Matthew Chapter 6 Verse 33
text: But let your first care be for his kingdom and his righteousness; and all these other things will be given to you in addition.

title: Matthew Chapter 6 Verse 34
text: Then have no care for tomorrow: tomorrow will take care of itself. Take the trouble of the day as it comes.

title: Matthew Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: Be not judges of others, and you will not be judged.

title: Matthew Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: For as you have been judging, so you will be judged, and with your measure will it be measured to you.

title: Matthew Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: And why do you take note of the grain of dust in your brother's eye, but take no note of the bit of wood which is in your eye?

title: Matthew Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: Or how will you say to your brother, Let me take out the grain of dust from your eye, when you yourself have a bit of wood in your eye?

title: Matthew Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: You false one, first take out the bit of wood from your eye, then will you see clearly to take out the grain of dust from your brother's eye.

title: Matthew Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: Do not give that which is holy to the dogs, or put your jewels before pigs, for fear that they will be crushed under foot by the pigs whose attack will then be made against you.

title: Matthew Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: Make a request, and it will be answered; what you are searching for you will get; give the sign, and the door will be open to you:

title: Matthew Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: Because to everyone who makes a request, it will be given; and he who is searching will get his desire, and to him who gives the sign, the door will be open.

title: Matthew Chapter 7 Verse 9
text: Or which of you, if his son makes a request for bread, will give him a stone?

title: Matthew Chapter 7 Verse 10
text: Or if he makes a request for a fish, will give him a snake?

title: Matthew Chapter 7 Verse 11
text: If you, then, being evil, are able to give good things to your children, how much more will your Father in heaven give good things to those who make requests to him?

title: Matthew Chapter 7 Verse 12
text: All those things, then, which you would have men do to you, even so do you to them: because this is the law and the prophets.

title: Matthew Chapter 7 Verse 13
text: Go in by the narrow door; for wide is the door and open is the way which goes to destruction, and great numbers go in by it.

title: Matthew Chapter 7 Verse 14
text: For narrow is the door and hard the road to life, and only a small number make discovery of it.

title: Matthew Chapter 7 Verse 15
text: Be on the watch for false prophets, who come to you in sheep's clothing, but inside they are cruel wolves.

title: Matthew Chapter 7 Verse 16
text: By their fruits you will get knowledge of them. Do men get grapes from thorns or figs from thistles?

title: Matthew Chapter 7 Verse 17
text: Even so, every good tree gives good fruit; but the bad tree gives evil fruit.

title: Matthew Chapter 7 Verse 18
text: It is not possible for a good tree to give bad fruit, and a bad tree will not give good fruit.

title: Matthew Chapter 7 Verse 19
text: Every tree which does not give good fruit is cut down and put in the fire.

title: Matthew Chapter 7 Verse 20
text: So by their fruits you will get knowledge of them.

title: Matthew Chapter 7 Verse 21
text: Not everyone who says to me, Lord, Lord, will go into the kingdom of heaven; but he who does the pleasure of my Father in heaven.

title: Matthew Chapter 7 Verse 22
text: A great number will say to me on that day, Lord, Lord, were we not prophets in your name, and did we not by your name send out evil spirits, and by your name do works of power?

title: Matthew Chapter 7 Verse 23
text: And then will I say to them, I never had knowledge of you: go from me, you workers of evil.

title: Matthew Chapter 7 Verse 24
text: Everyone, then, to whom my words come and who does them, will be like a wise man who made his house on a rock;

title: Matthew Chapter 7 Verse 25
text: And the rain came down and there was a rush of waters and the winds were driving against that house, but it was not moved; because it was based on the rock.

title: Matthew Chapter 7 Verse 26
text: And everyone to whom my words come and who does them not, will be like a foolish man who made his house on sand;

title: Matthew Chapter 7 Verse 27
text: And the rain came down and there was a rush of waters and the winds were driving against that house; and it came down and great was its fall.

title: Matthew Chapter 7 Verse 28
text: And it came about, when Jesus had come to the end of these words, that the people were surprised at his teaching,

title: Matthew Chapter 7 Verse 29
text: for he was teaching as one having authority, and not as their scribes.

title: Matthew Chapter 8 Verse 1
text: And when he had come down from the mountain, great numbers of people came after him.

title: Matthew Chapter 8 Verse 2
text: And a leper came and gave him worship, saying, Lord, if it is your pleasure, you have power to make me clean.

title: Matthew Chapter 8 Verse 3
text: And he put his hand on him, saying, It is my pleasure; be clean. And straight away he was made clean.

title: Matthew Chapter 8 Verse 4
text: And Jesus said to him, See that you say nothing about this to anyone; but go and let the priest see you and make the offering which was ordered by Moses, for a witness to them.

title: Matthew Chapter 8 Verse 5
text: And when Jesus was come into Capernaum, a certain captain came to him with a request,

title: Matthew Chapter 8 Verse 6
text: Saying, Lord, my servant is ill in bed at the house, with no power in his body, and in great pain.

title: Matthew Chapter 8 Verse 7
text: And he said to him, I will come and make him well.

title: Matthew Chapter 8 Verse 8
text: And the captain in answer said, Lord, I am not good enough for you to come under my roof; but only say the word, and my servant will be made well.

title: Matthew Chapter 8 Verse 9
text: Because I myself am a man under authority, having under me fighting men; and I say to this one, Go, and he goes; and to another, Come, and he comes; and to my servant, Do this, and he does it.

title: Matthew Chapter 8 Verse 10
text: And when these words came to the ears of Jesus he was surprised, and said to those who came after him, Truly I say to you, I have not seen such great faith, no, not in Israel.

title: Matthew Chapter 8 Verse 11
text: And I say to you that numbers will come from the east and the west, and will take their seats with Abraham and Isaac and Jacob, in the kingdom of heaven:

title: Matthew Chapter 8 Verse 12
text: But the sons of the kingdom will be put out into the dark, and there will be weeping and cries of pain.

title: Matthew Chapter 8 Verse 13
text: And Jesus said to the captain, Go in peace; as your faith is, so let it be done to you. And the servant was made well in that hour.

title: Matthew Chapter 8 Verse 14
text: And when Jesus had come into Peter's house, he saw his wife's mother in bed, very ill.

title: Matthew Chapter 8 Verse 15
text: And he put his hand on hers and the disease went from her, and she got up and took care of his needs.

title: Matthew Chapter 8 Verse 16
text: And in the evening, they took to him a number of people who had evil spirits; and he sent the spirits out of them with a word, and made well all who were ill;

title: Matthew Chapter 8 Verse 17
text: So that the word of Isaiah the prophet might come true: He himself took our pains and our diseases.

title: Matthew Chapter 8 Verse 18
text: Now when Jesus saw a great mass of people about him, he gave an order to go to the other side.

title: Matthew Chapter 8 Verse 19
text: And there came a scribe and said to him, Master, I will come after you wherever you go.

title: Matthew Chapter 8 Verse 20
text: And Jesus said to him, The foxes have holes, and the birds of heaven have a resting-place; but the Son of man has nowhere to put his head.

title: Matthew Chapter 8 Verse 21
text: And another of the disciples said to him, Lord, let me first go and give the last honours to my father.

title: Matthew Chapter 8 Verse 22
text: But Jesus said to him, Come after me; and let the dead take care of their dead.

title: Matthew Chapter 8 Verse 23
text: And when he had got into a boat, his disciples went after him.

title: Matthew Chapter 8 Verse 24
text: And there came up a great storm in the sea, so that the boat was covered with the waves: but he was sleeping.

title: Matthew Chapter 8 Verse 25
text: And they came to him, and, awaking him, said, Help, Lord; destruction is near.

title: Matthew Chapter 8 Verse 26
text: And he said to them, Why are you full of fear, O you of little faith? Then he got up and gave orders to the winds and the sea; and there was a great calm.

title: Matthew Chapter 8 Verse 27
text: And the men were full of wonder, saying, What sort of man is this, that even the winds and the sea do his orders?

title: Matthew Chapter 8 Verse 28
text: And when he had come to the other side, to the country of the Gadarenes, there came out to him from the place of the dead, two who had evil spirits, so violent that no man was able to go that way.

title: Matthew Chapter 8 Verse 29
text: And they gave a loud cry, saying, What have we to do with you, you Son of God? Have you come here to give us punishment before the time?

title: Matthew Chapter 8 Verse 30
text: Now there was, some distance away, a great herd of pigs taking their food.

title: Matthew Chapter 8 Verse 31
text: And the evil spirits made strong prayers to him, saying, If you send us out, let us go into the herd of pigs.

title: Matthew Chapter 8 Verse 32
text: And he said to them, Go. And they came out, and went into the pigs; and the herd went rushing down a sharp slope into the sea and came to their end in the water.

title: Matthew Chapter 8 Verse 33
text: And their keepers went in flight to the town and gave an account of everything, and of the men who had the evil spirits.

title: Matthew Chapter 8 Verse 34
text: And all the town came out to Jesus; and seeing him they made request that he would go away from their part of the country.

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 1
text: And he got into a boat and went across and came to his town.

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 2
text: And they took to him a man stretched on a bed who had no power of moving; and Jesus, seeing their faith, said to the man who was ill, Son, take heart; you have forgiveness for your sins.

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 3
text: And some of the scribes said among themselves, This man has no respect for God.

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 4
text: And Jesus, having knowledge of what was in their minds, said, Why are your thoughts evil?

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 5
text: For which is the simpler, to say, You have forgiveness for your sins; or to say, Get up and go?

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 6
text: But so that you may see that on earth the Son of man has authority for the forgiveness of sins, (then said he to the man who was ill,) Get up, and take up your bed, and go to your house.

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 7
text: And he got up and went away to his house.

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 8
text: But when the people saw it they were full of fear, and gave glory to God who had given such authority to men.

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 9
text: And when Jesus was going from there, he saw a man whose name was Matthew, seated at the place where taxes were taken; and he said to him, Come after me. And he got up and went after him.

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 10
text: And it came about, when he was in the house taking food, that a number of tax-farmers and sinners came and took their places with Jesus and his disciples.

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 11
text: And when the Pharisees saw it, they said to his disciples, Why does your Master take food with tax-farmers and sinners?

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 12
text: But on hearing this he said, Those who are well have no need of a medical man, but those who are ill.

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 13
text: But go and take to heart the sense of these words, My desire is for mercy, not offerings: for I have come not to get the upright, but sinners.

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 14
text: Then the disciples of John came to him, saying, Why do we and the Pharisees frequently go without food, but your disciples do not?

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 15
text: And Jesus said to them, Will the friends of the newly-married man be sad as long as he is with them? But the days will come when he will be taken away from them, and then will they go without food.

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 16
text: And no man puts a bit of new cloth on an old coat, for by pulling away from the old, it makes a worse hole.

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 17
text: And men do not put new wine into old wine-skins; or the skins will be burst and the wine will come out, and the skins are of no more use: but they put new wine into new wine-skins, and so the two will be safe.

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 18
text: While he was saying these things to them, there came a ruler and gave him worship, saying, My daughter is even now dead; but come and put your hand on her, and she will come back to life.

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 19
text: And Jesus got up and went after him, and so did his disciples.

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 20
text: And a woman, who for twelve years had had a flow of blood, came after him, and put her hand on the edge of his robe:

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 21
text: Because, she said to herself, if I may but put my hand on his robe, I will be made well.

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 22
text: But Jesus, turning and seeing her, said, Daughter, take heart; your faith has made you well. And the woman was made well from that hour.

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 23
text: And when Jesus came into the ruler's house and saw the players with their instruments and the people making a noise,

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 24
text: He said, Make room; for the girl is not dead, but sleeping. And they were laughing at him.

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 25
text: But when the people were sent out, he went in and took her by the hand; and the girl got up.

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 26
text: And the news of it went out into all that land.

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 27
text: And when Jesus went on from there, two blind men came after him, crying out, Have mercy on us, you Son of David.

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 28
text: And when he had come into the house, the blind men came to him; and Jesus said to them, Have you faith that I am able to do this? They said to him, Yes, Lord.

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 29
text: Then he put his hand on their eyes, saying, As your faith is, let it be done to you.

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 30
text: And their eyes were made open. And Jesus said to them sharply, Let no man have knowledge of it.

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 31
text: But they went out and gave news of him in all that land.

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 32
text: And while they were going away, there came to him a man without the power of talking, and with an evil spirit.

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 33
text: And when the evil spirit had been sent out, the man had the power of talking: and they were all surprised, saying, Such a thing has never been seen in Israel.

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 34
text: But the Pharisees said, By the ruler of evil spirits, he sends evil spirits out of men.

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 35
text: And Jesus went about all the towns and small places, teaching in their Synagogues and preaching the good news of the kingdom and making well all sorts of disease and pain.

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 36
text: But when he saw all the people he was moved with pity for them, because they were troubled and wandering like sheep without a keeper.

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 37
text: Then he said to his disciples, There is much grain but not enough men to get it in.

title: Matthew Chapter 9 Verse 38
text: Make prayer, then, to the Lord of the grain-fields, that he may send out workers to get in his grain.

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 1
text: And he got together his twelve disciples and gave them the power of driving out unclean spirits, and of making well all sorts of disease and pain.

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 2
text: Now the names of the twelve are these: The first, Simon, who is named Peter, and Andrew, his brother; James, the son of Zebedee, and John, his brother;

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 3
text: Philip and Bartholomew; Thomas and Matthew, the tax-farmer; James, the son of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus;

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 4
text: Simon the Zealot, and Judas Iscariot, who was false to him.

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 5
text: These twelve Jesus sent out and gave them orders, saying, Do not go among the Gentiles, or into any town of Samaria,

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 6
text: But go to the wandering sheep of the house of Israel,

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 7
text: And, on your way, say, The kingdom of heaven is near.

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 8
text: Make well those who are ill, give life to the dead, make lepers clean, send evil spirits out of men; freely it has been given to you, freely give.

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 9
text: Take no gold or silver or copper in your pockets;

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 10
text: Take no bag for your journey and do not take two coats or shoes or a stick: for the workman has a right to his food.

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 11
text: And into whatever town or small place you go, make search there for someone who is respected, and make his house your resting-place till you go away.

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 12
text: And when you go in, say, May peace be on this house.

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 13
text: And if the house is good enough, let your peace come on it: but if not, let your peace come back to you.

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 14
text: And whoever will not take you in, or give ear to your words, when you go out from that house or that town, put off its dust from your feet.

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 15
text: Truly I say to you, It will be better for the land of Sodom and Gomorrah in the day of God's judging than for that town.

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 16
text: See, I send you out as sheep among wolves. Be then as wise as snakes, and as gentle as doves.

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 17
text: But be on the watch against men: for they will give you up to the Sanhedrins, and in their Synagogues they will give you blows;

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 18
text: And you will come before rulers and kings because of me, for a witness to them and to the Gentiles.

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 19
text: But when you are given up into their hands, do not be troubled about what to say or how to say it: for in that hour what you are to say will be given to you;

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 20
text: Because it is not you who say the words, but the Spirit of your Father in you.

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 21
text: And brother will give up brother to death, and the father his child: and children will go against their fathers and mothers, and put them to death.

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 22
text: And you will be hated by all men because of my name: but he who is strong to the end will have salvation.

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 23
text: But when they are cruel to you in one town, go in flight to another: for truly, I say to you, You will not have gone through the towns of Israel before the Son of man comes.

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 24
text: A disciple is not greater than his master, or a servant than his lord.

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 25
text: It is enough for the disciple that he may be as his master, and the servant as his lord. If they have given the name Beelzebub to the master of the house, how much more to those of his house!

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 26
text: Have, then, no fear of them: because nothing is covered which will not come to light, or secret which will not be made clear.

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 27
text: What I say to you in the dark, say in the light: and what comes to your ear secretly, say publicly from the house-tops.

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 28
text: And have no fear of those who put to death the body, but are not able to put to death the soul. But have fear of him who has power to give soul and body to destruction in hell.

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 29
text: Are not sparrows two a farthing? and not one of them comes to an end without your Father:

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 30
text: But the hairs of your head are all numbered.

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 31
text: Then have no fear; you are of more value than a flock of sparrows.

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 32
text: To everyone, then, who gives witness to me before men, I will give witness before my Father in heaven.

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 33
text: But if anyone says before men that he has no knowledge of me, I will say that I have no knowledge of him before my Father in heaven.

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 34
text: Do not have the thought that I have come to send peace on the earth; I came not to send peace but a sword.

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 35
text: For I have come to put a man against his father, and the daughter against her mother, and the daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law:

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 36
text: And a man will be hated by those of his house.

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 37
text: He who has more love for his father or mother than for me is not good enough for me; he who has more love for son or daughter than for me is not good enough for me.

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 38
text: And he who does not take his cross and come after me is not good enough for me.

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 39
text: He who has the desire to keep his life will have it taken from him, and he who gives up his life because of me will have it given back to him.

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 40
text: He who gives honour to you gives honour to me; and he who gives honour to me gives honour to him who sent me.

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 41
text: He who gives honour to a prophet, in the name of a prophet, will be given a prophet's reward; and he who gives honour to an upright man, in the name of an upright man, will be given an upright man's reward.

title: Matthew Chapter 10 Verse 42
text: And whoever gives to one of these little ones a cup of cold water only, in the name of a disciple, truly I say to you, he will not go without his reward.

title: Matthew Chapter 11 Verse 1
text: And it came about that when Jesus had come to the end of giving these orders to his twelve disciples, he went away from there, teaching and preaching in their towns.

title: Matthew Chapter 11 Verse 2
text: Now when John had news in prison of the works of the Christ, he sent his disciples

title: Matthew Chapter 11 Verse 3
text: To say to him, Are you he who is to come, or are we waiting for another?

title: Matthew Chapter 11 Verse 4
text: And Jesus, answering, said to them, Go and give news to John of the things which you are seeing and hearing:

title: Matthew Chapter 11 Verse 5
text: The blind see; those who were not able to, are walking; lepers are made clean; those who were without hearing, now have their ears open; the dead come to life again, and the poor have the good news given to them.

title: Matthew Chapter 11 Verse 6
text: And a blessing will be on him who has no doubts about me.

title: Matthew Chapter 11 Verse 7
text: And when they were going away, Jesus, talking of John, said to all the people, What went you out into the waste land to see? a tall stem moving in the wind?

title: Matthew Chapter 11 Verse 8
text: But what went you out to see? a man delicately clothed? Those who have fair robes are in kings' houses.

title: Matthew Chapter 11 Verse 9
text: But why did you go out? to see a prophet? Yes, I say to you, and more than a prophet.

title: Matthew Chapter 11 Verse 10
text: This is he of whom it has been said, See, I send my servant before your face, who will make ready your way before you.

title: Matthew Chapter 11 Verse 11
text: Truly I say to you, Among the sons of women there has not been a greater than John the Baptist: but he who is least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he.

title: Matthew Chapter 11 Verse 12
text: And from the days of John the Baptist till now, the kingdom of heaven is forcing its way in, and men of force take it.

title: Matthew Chapter 11 Verse 13
text: For all the prophets and the law were in force till John.

title: Matthew Chapter 11 Verse 14
text: And if you are able to see it, this is Elijah who was to come.

title: Matthew Chapter 11 Verse 15
text: He who has ears, let him give ear.

title: Matthew Chapter 11 Verse 16
text: But what comparison may I make of this generation? It is like children seated in the market-places, crying out to one another,

title: Matthew Chapter 11 Verse 17
text: We made music for you and you did not take part in the dance; we gave cries of sorrow and you made no signs of grief.

title: Matthew Chapter 11 Verse 18
text: For John came, taking no food or drink, and they say, He has an evil spirit.

title: Matthew Chapter 11 Verse 19
text: The Son of man has come feasting, and they say, See, a lover of food and wine, a friend of tax-farmers and sinners! And wisdom is judged to be right by her works.

title: Matthew Chapter 11 Verse 20
text: Then he went on to say hard things to the towns where most of his works of power were done, because they had not been turned from their sins.

title: Matthew Chapter 11 Verse 21
text: Unhappy are you, Chorazin! Unhappy are you, Beth-saida! For if the works of power which were done in you had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have been turned from their sins in days gone by, clothing themselves in haircloth and putting dust on their heads.

title: Matthew Chapter 11 Verse 22
text: But I say to you, It will be better for Tyre and Sidon in the day of judging, than for you.

title: Matthew Chapter 11 Verse 23
text: And you, Capernaum, were you not to be lifted up to heaven? you will go down into hell: for if the works of power which were done in you had been done in Sodom, it would have been here to this day.

title: Matthew Chapter 11 Verse 24
text: But I say to you that it will be better for the land of Sodom in the day of judging, than for you.

title: Matthew Chapter 11 Verse 25
text: At that time Jesus made answer and said, I give praise to you, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because you have kept these things secret from the wise and the men of learning, and have made them clear to little children.

title: Matthew Chapter 11 Verse 26
text: Yes, Father, for so it was pleasing in your eyes.

title: Matthew Chapter 11 Verse 27
text: All things have been given to me by my Father; and no one has knowledge of the Son, but the Father; and no one has knowledge of the Father, but the Son, and he to whom the Son will make it clear.

title: Matthew Chapter 11 Verse 28
text: Come to me, all you who are troubled and weighted down with care, and I will give you rest.

title: Matthew Chapter 11 Verse 29
text: Take my yoke on you and become like me, for I am gentle and without pride, and you will have rest for your souls;

title: Matthew Chapter 11 Verse 30
text: For my yoke is good, and the weight I take up is not hard.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 1
text: At that time Jesus went through the fields on the Sabbath day; and his disciples, being in need of food, were taking the heads of grain.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 2
text: But the Pharisees, when they saw it, said to him, See, your disciples do that which it is not right to do on the Sabbath.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 3
text: But he said to them, Have you no knowledge of what David did when he had need of food, and those who were with him?

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 4
text: How he went into the house of God and took for food the holy bread which it was not right for him or for those who were with him to take, but only for the priests?

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 5
text: Or is it not said in the law, how the Sabbath is broken by the priests in the Temple and they do no wrong?

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 6
text: But I say to you that a greater thing than the Temple is here.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 7
text: But if these words had been in your minds, My desire is for mercy and not for offerings, you would not have been judging those who have done no wrong.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 8
text: For the Son of man is lord of the Sabbath.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 9
text: And he went from there into their Synagogue:

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 10
text: And there was a man with a dead hand. And they put a question to him, saying, Is it right to make a man well on the Sabbath day? so that they might have something against him.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 11
text: And he said to them, Which of you, having a sheep, if it gets into a hole on the Sabbath day, will not put out a helping hand and get it back?

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 12
text: Of how much more value is a man than a sheep! For this reason it is right to do good on the Sabbath day.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 13
text: Then said he to the man, Put out your hand. And he put it out, and it was made as well as the other.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 14
text: But the Pharisees went out and made designs against him, how they might put him to death.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 15
text: And Jesus, having knowledge of this, went away from there, and a great number went after him; and he made them all well,

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 16
text: Ordering them not to give people word of him:

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 17
text: So that what was said by Isaiah the prophet might come true,

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 18
text: See my servant, the man of my selection, my loved one in whom my soul is well pleased: I will put my Spirit on him, and he will make my decision clear to the Gentiles.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 19
text: His coming will not be with fighting or loud cries; and his voice will not be lifted up in the streets.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 20
text: The crushed stem will not be broken by him; and the feebly burning light will he not put out, till he has made righteousness overcome all.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 21
text: And in his name will the Gentiles put their hope.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 22
text: Then they took to him one with an evil spirit, who was blind and had no power of talking: and he made him well so that he had the power of talking and seeing.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 23
text: And all the people were surprised and said, Is not this the Son of David?

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 24
text: But the Pharisees, hearing of it, said, This man only sends evil spirits out of men by Beelzebub, the ruler of evil spirits.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 25
text: And having knowledge of their thoughts he said to them, Every kingdom having division in itself is made waste, and every town or house having division in itself will come to destruction.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 26
text: And if Satan sends out Satan, he makes war against himself; how then will he keep his kingdom?

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 27
text: And if I by Beelzebub send evil spirits out of men, by whom do your sons send them out? So let them be your judges.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 28
text: But if I by the Spirit of God send out evil spirits, then is the kingdom of God come on you.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 29
text: Or how may one go into a strong man's house and take his goods, if he does not first put cords round the strong man? and then he may take his goods.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 30
text: Whoever is not with me is against me; and he who does not take part with me in getting people together, is driving them away.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 31
text: So I say to you, Every sin and every evil word against God will have forgiveness; but for evil words against the Spirit there will be no forgiveness.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 32
text: And whoever says a word against the Son of man, will have forgiveness; but whoever says a word against the Holy Spirit, will not have forgiveness in this life or in that which is to come.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 33
text: Make the tree good, and its fruit good; or make the tree bad, and its fruit bad; for by its fruit you will get knowledge of the tree.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 34
text: You offspring of snakes, how are you, being evil, able to say good things? because out of the heart's store come the words of the mouth.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 35
text: The good man out of his good store gives good things; and the evil man out of his evil store gives evil things.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 36
text: And I say to you that in the day when they are judged, men will have to give an account of every foolish word they have said.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 37
text: For by your words will your righteousness be seen, and by your words you will be judged.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 38
text: Then some of the scribes and Pharisees, hearing this, said to him, Master, we are looking for a sign from you.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 39
text: But he, answering, said to them, An evil and false generation is looking for a sign; and no sign will be given to it but the sign of the prophet Jonah:

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 40
text: For as Jonah was three days and three nights in the stomach of the great fish, so will the Son of man be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 41
text: The men of Nineveh will come up in the day of judging and give their decision against this generation: because they were turned from their sins at the preaching of Jonah; and now a greater than Jonah is here.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 42
text: The queen of the South will come up in the day of judging and give her decision against this generation: for she came from the ends of the earth to give ear to the wisdom of Solomon; and now a greater than Solomon is here.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 43
text: But the unclean spirit, when he is gone out of a man, goes through dry places looking for rest, and getting it not.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 44
text: Then he says, I will go back into my house from which I came out; and when he comes, he sees that there is no one in it, but that it has been made fair and clean.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 45
text: Then he goes and takes with him seven other spirits worse than himself, and they go in and make it their living-place: and the last condition of that man is worse than the first. Even so will it be with this evil generation.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 46
text: While he was still talking to the people, his mother and his brothers came, desiring to have talk with him.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 47
text: And one said to him, See, your mother and your brothers are outside, desiring to have talk with you.

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 48
text: But he in answer said to him who gave the news, Who is my mother and who are my brothers?

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 49
text: And he put out his hand to his disciples and said, See, my mother and my brothers!

title: Matthew Chapter 12 Verse 50
text: For whoever does the pleasure of my Father in heaven, he is my brother, and sister, and mother.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 1
text: On that day Jesus went out of the house and was seated by the seaside.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 2
text: And great numbers of people came together to him, so that he got into a boat; and the people took up their position by the sea.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 3
text: And he gave them teaching in the form of a story, saying, A man went out to put seed in the earth;

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 4
text: And while he did so, some seeds were dropped by the wayside, and the birds came and took them for food:

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 5
text: And some of the seed went among the stones, where it had not much earth, and straight away it came up because the earth was not deep:

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 6
text: And when the sun was high, it was burned; and because it had no root it became dry and dead.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 7
text: And some seeds went among thorns, and the thorns came up and they had no room for growth:

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 8
text: And some, falling on good earth, gave fruit, some a hundred, some sixty, some thirty times as much.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 9
text: He who has ears, let him give ear.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 10
text: And the disciples came and said to him, Why do you say things to them in the form of stories?

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 11
text: And he said to them in answer, To you is given the knowledge of the secrets of the kingdom of heaven, but to them it is not given.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 12
text: Because whoever has, to him will be given, and he will have more; but from him who has not, even what he has will be taken away.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 13
text: For this reason I put things into the form of stories; because they see without seeing, and give ear without hearing, and the sense is not clear to them.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 14
text: And for them the words of Isaiah have come true, Though you give ear, you will not get knowledge; and seeing, you will see, but the sense will not be clear to you:

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 15
text: For the heart of this people has become fat and their ears are slow in hearing and their eyes are shut; for fear that they might see with their eyes and give hearing with their ears and become wise in their hearts and be turned again to me, so that I might make them well.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 16
text: But a blessing be on your eyes, because they see; and on your ears, because they are open.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 17
text: For truly, I say to you that prophets and upright men had a desire to see the things which you see, and saw them not; and to have knowledge of the words which have come to your ears, and they had it not.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 18
text: Give ear, then, to the story of the man who put the seed in the earth.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 19
text: When the word of the kingdom comes to anyone, and the sense of it is not clear to him, then the Evil One comes, and quickly takes away that which was put in his heart. He is the seed dropped by the wayside.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 20
text: And that which went on the stones, this is he who, hearing the word, straight away takes it with joy;

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 21
text: But having no root in himself, he goes on for a time; and when trouble comes or pain, because of the word, he quickly becomes full of doubts.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 22
text: And that which was dropped among the thorns, this is he who has the word; and the cares of this life, and the deceits of wealth, put a stop to the growth of the word and it gives no fruit.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 23
text: And the seed which was put in good earth, this is he who gives ear to the word, and gets the sense of it; who gives fruit, some a hundred, some sixty, some thirty times as much.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 24
text: And he gave them another story, saying, The kingdom of heaven is like a man who put good seed in his field:

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 25
text: But while men were sleeping, one who had hate for him came and put evil seeds among the grain, and went away.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 26
text: But when the green stem came up and gave fruit, the evil plants were seen at the same time.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 27
text: And the servants of the master of the house came and said to him, Sir, did you not put good seed in your field? how then has it evil plants?

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 28
text: And he said, Someone has done this in hate. And the servants say to him, Is it your pleasure that we go and take them up?

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 29
text: But he says, No, for fear that by chance while you take up the evil plants, you may be rooting up the grain with them.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 30
text: Let them come up together till the getting in of the grain; and then I will say to the workers, Take up first the evil plants, and put them together for burning: but put the grain into my store-house.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 31
text: He put another story before them, saying, The kingdom of heaven is like a grain of mustard seed which a man took and put in his field:

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 32
text: Which is smaller than all seeds; but when it has come up it is greater than the plants, and becomes a tree, so that the birds of heaven come and make their resting-places in its branches.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 33
text: Another story he gave to them: The kingdom of heaven is like leaven, which a woman took, and put in three measures of meal, till it was all leavened.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 34
text: All these things Jesus said to the people in the form of stories; and without a story he said nothing to them:

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 35
text: That it might come true which was said by the prophet, Opening my mouth, I will give out stories; I will give knowledge of things kept secret from before all time.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 36
text: Then he went away from the people, and went into the house; and his disciples came to him, saying, Make clear to us the story of the evil plants in the field.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 37
text: And he made answer and said, He who puts the good seed in the earth is the Son of man;

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 38
text: And the field is the world; and the good seed is the sons of the kingdom; and the evil seeds are the sons of the Evil One;

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 39
text: And he who put them in the earth is Satan; and the getting in of the grain is the end of the world; and those who get it in are the angels.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 40
text: As then the evil plants are got together and burned with fire, so will it be in the end of the world.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 41
text: The Son of man will send out his angels, and they will take out of his kingdom everything which is a cause of error, and all those who do wrong,

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 42
text: And will put them into the fire; there will be weeping and cries of sorrow.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 43
text: Then will the upright be shining as the sun in the kingdom of their Father. He who has ears, let him give ear.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 44
text: The kingdom of heaven is like a secret store of wealth in a field, which a man came across and put back again; and in his joy he goes and gives all he has, to get that field.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 45
text: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a trader searching for beautiful jewels.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 46
text: And having come across one jewel of great price, he went and gave all he had in exchange for it.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 47
text: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a net, which was put into the sea and took in every sort of fish:

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 48
text: When it was full, they took it up on the sands; and seated there they put the good into vessels, but the bad they put away.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 49
text: So will it be in the end of the world: the angels will come and take out the bad from the good,

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 50
text: And will put them into the fire: there will be weeping and cries of sorrow.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 51
text: Are all these things now clear to you? They say to him, Yes.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 52
text: And he said to them, For this reason every scribe who has become a disciple of the kingdom of heaven is like the owner of a house, who gives out from his store things new and old.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 53
text: And when Jesus had come to the end of these stories he went away from there.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 54
text: And coming into his country, he gave them teaching in their Synagogue, so that they were greatly surprised and said, Where did this man get this wisdom and these works of power?

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 55
text: Is not this the woodworker's son? is not his mother named Mary? and his brothers James and Joseph and Simon and Judas?

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 56
text: And his sisters, are they not all with us? from where, then, has he all these things?

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 57
text: And they were bitter against him. But Jesus said to them, A prophet is nowhere without honour but in his country and among his family.

title: Matthew Chapter 13 Verse 58
text: And the works of power which he did there were small in number because they had no faith.

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 1
text: At that time news of Jesus came to Herod the king;

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 2
text: And he said to his servants, This is John the Baptist; he has come back from the dead, and so these powers are working in him.

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 3
text: For Herod had taken John and put him in prison because of Herodias, his brother Philip's wife.

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 4
text: Because John had said to him, It is not right for you to have her.

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 5
text: And he would have put him to death, but for his fear of the people, because in their eyes John was a prophet.

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 6
text: But when Herod's birthday came, the daughter of Herodias was dancing before them, and Herod was pleased with her.

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 7
text: So he gave her his word with an oath to let her have whatever she might make request for.

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 8
text: And she, at her mother's suggestion, said, Give me here on a plate the head of John the Baptist.

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 9
text: And the king was sad; but because of his oaths and because of his guests, he gave the order for it to be given to her;

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 10
text: And he sent and had John's head cut off in the prison.

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 11
text: And his head was put on a plate and given to the girl; and she took it to her mother.

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 12
text: And his disciples came, and took up his body and put it in the earth; and they went and gave Jesus news of what had taken place.

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 13
text: Now when it came to the ears of Jesus, he went away from there in a boat, to a waste place by himself: and the people hearing of it, went after him on foot from the towns.

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 14
text: And he came out and saw a great number of people and he had pity on them, and made well those of them who were ill.

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 15
text: And when evening had come, the disciples came to him, saying, This place is waste land, and the time is now past; send the people away so that they may go into the towns and get themselves food.

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 16
text: But Jesus said to them, There is no need for them to go away; give them food yourselves.

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 17
text: And they say to him, We have here but five cakes of bread and two fishes.

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 18
text: And he said, Give them to me.

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 19
text: And he gave orders for the people to be seated on the grass; and he took the five cakes of bread and the two fishes and, looking up to heaven, he said words of blessing, and made division of the food, and gave it to the disciples, and the disciples gave it to the people.

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 20
text: And they all took of the food and had enough: and they took up twelve baskets full of broken bits which were not used.

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 21
text: And those who had food were about five thousand men, in addition to women and children.

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 22
text: And straight away he made the disciples get into the boat and go before him to the other side, till he had sent the people away.

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 23
text: And after he had sent the people away, he went up into the mountain by himself for prayer: and when evening was come, he was there by himself.

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 24
text: But the boat was now in the middle of the sea, and was troubled by the waves: for the wind was against them.

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 25
text: And in the fourth watch of the night he came to them, walking on the sea.

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 26
text: And when they saw him walking on the sea, they were troubled, saying, It is a spirit; and they gave cries of fear.

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 27
text: But straight away Jesus said to them, Take heart; it is I, have no fear.

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 28
text: And Peter, answering, said to him, Lord, if it is you, give me the order to come to you on the water.

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 29
text: And he said, Come. And Peter got out of the boat, and walking on the water, went to Jesus.

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 30
text: But when he saw the wind he was in fear and, starting to go down, he gave a cry, saying, Help, Lord.

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 31
text: And straight away Jesus put out his hand and took a grip of him, and said to him, O man of little faith, why were you in doubt?

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 32
text: And when they had got into the boat, the wind went down.

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 33
text: And those who were in the boat gave him worship, saying, Truly you are the Son of God.

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 34
text: And when they had gone across, they came to land at Gennesaret.

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 35
text: And when the men of that place had news of him, they sent into all the country round about, and took to him all who were ill,

title: Matthew Chapter 14 Verse 36
text: With the request that they might only put their hands on the edge of his robe: and all those who did so were made well.

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 1
text: Then there came to Jesus from Jerusalem Pharisees and scribes, saying,

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 2
text: Why do your disciples go against the teaching of the fathers? for they take food with unwashed hands.

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 3
text: And in answer he said to them, Why do you, yourselves, go against the word of God on account of the teaching which has been handed down to you?

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 4
text: For God said, Give honour to your father and mother: and, He who says evil of father or mother will be put to death.

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 5
text: But you say, If a man says to his father or his mother, That by which you might have had profit from me is given to God;

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 6
text: There is no need for him to give honour to his father. And you have made the word of God without effect because of your teaching.

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 7
text: You false ones, well did Isaiah say of you,

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 8
text: These people give me honour with their lips, but their heart is far from me.

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 9
text: But their worship is to no purpose, while they give as their teaching the rules of men.

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 10
text: And he got the people together and said to them, Give ear, and let my words be clear to you:

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 11
text: Not that which goes into the mouth makes a man unclean, but that which comes out of the mouth.

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 12
text: Then the disciples came and said to him, Did you see that the Pharisees were troubled when these words came to their ears?

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 13
text: But he said in answer, Every plant which my Father in heaven has not put in the earth, will be taken up by the roots.

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 14
text: Let them be: they are blind guides. And if a blind man is guiding a blind man, the two will go falling into a hole together.

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 15
text: Then Peter said to him, Make the story clear to us.

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 16
text: And he said, Are you, like them, still without wisdom?

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 17
text: Do you not see that whatever goes into the mouth goes on into the stomach, and is sent out as waste?

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 18
text: But the things which come out of the mouth come from the heart; and they make a man unclean.

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 19
text: For out of the heart come evil thoughts, the taking of life, broken faith between the married, unclean desires of the flesh, taking of property, false witness, bitter words:

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 20
text: These are the things which make a man unclean; but to take food with unwashed hands does not make a man unclean.

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 21
text: And Jesus went away from there into the country of Tyre and Sidon.

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 22
text: And a woman of Canaan came out from those parts, crying and saying, Have pity on me, O Lord, Son of David; my daughter is greatly troubled with an unclean spirit.

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 23
text: But he gave her no answer. And his disciples came and said to him, Send her away, for she is crying after us.

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 24
text: But he made answer and said, I was sent only to the wandering sheep of the house of Israel.

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 25
text: But she came and gave him worship, saying, Help, Lord.

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 26
text: And he made answer and said, It is not right to take the children's bread and give it to the dogs.

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 27
text: But she said, Yes, Lord: but even the dogs take the bits from under their masters' table.

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 28
text: Then Jesus, answering, said to her, O woman, great is your faith: let your desire be done. And her daughter was made well from that hour.

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 29
text: And Jesus went from there and came to the sea of Galilee; and he went up into the mountain, and took his seat there.

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 30
text: And there came to him great numbers of people having with them those who were broken in body, or blind, or without voice, or wounded, or ill in any way, and a number of others; they put them down at his feet and he made them well:

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 31
text: So that the people were full of wonder when they saw that those who had no voice were talking, the feeble were made strong, those whose bodies were broken had the power of walking, and the blind were able to see: and they gave glory to the God of Israel.

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 32
text: And Jesus got his disciples together and said, I have pity for the people, because they have now been with me three days and have no food: and I will not send them away without food, or they will have no strength for the journey.

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 33
text: And the disciples say to him, How may we get enough bread in a waste place, to give food to such a number of people?

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 34
text: And Jesus says to them, How much bread have you? And they said, Seven cakes, and some small fishes.

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 35
text: Then he gave an order to the people to be seated on the earth,

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 36
text: And he took the seven cakes of bread and the fishes; and having given praise, he gave the broken bread to the disciples, and the disciples gave it to the people.

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 37
text: And they all took food, and had enough; and they took up of the broken bits, seven baskets full.

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 38
text: And there were four thousand men who took food, together with women and children.

title: Matthew Chapter 15 Verse 39
text: And when he had sent the people away, he got into the boat, and came into the country of Magadan.

title: Matthew Chapter 16 Verse 1
text: And the Pharisees and Sadducees came and, testing him, made a request to him to give them a sign from heaven.

title: Matthew Chapter 16 Verse 2
text: But in answer he said to them, At nightfall you say, The weather will be good, for the sky is red.

title: Matthew Chapter 16 Verse 3
text: And in the morning, The weather will be bad today, for the sky is red and angry. You are able to see the face of heaven, but not the signs of the times.

title: Matthew Chapter 16 Verse 4
text: An evil and false generation is searching after a sign; and no sign will be given to it but the sign of Jonah. And he went away from them.

title: Matthew Chapter 16 Verse 5
text: And when the disciples came to the other side they had not taken thought to get bread.

title: Matthew Chapter 16 Verse 6
text: And Jesus said to them, Take care to have nothing to do with the leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees.

title: Matthew Chapter 16 Verse 7
text: And they were reasoning among themselves, saying, We took no bread.

title: Matthew Chapter 16 Verse 8
text: And Jesus, seeing it, said, O you of little faith, why are you reasoning among yourselves, because you have no bread?

title: Matthew Chapter 16 Verse 9
text: Do you still not see, or keep in mind the five cakes of bread of the five thousand, and the number of baskets you took up?

title: Matthew Chapter 16 Verse 10
text: Or the seven cakes of bread of the four thousand, and the number of baskets you took up?

title: Matthew Chapter 16 Verse 11
text: How is it that you do not see that I was not talking to you about bread, but about keeping away from the leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees?

title: Matthew Chapter 16 Verse 12
text: Then they saw that it was not the leaven of bread which he had in mind, but the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees.

title: Matthew Chapter 16 Verse 13
text: Now when Jesus had come into the parts of Caesarea Philippi, he said, questioning his disciples, Who do men say that the Son of man is?

title: Matthew Chapter 16 Verse 14
text: And they said, Some say, John the Baptist; some, Elijah; and others, Jeremiah, or one of the prophets.

title: Matthew Chapter 16 Verse 15
text: He says to them, But who do you say that I am?

title: Matthew Chapter 16 Verse 16
text: And Simon Peter made answer and said, You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.

title: Matthew Chapter 16 Verse 17
text: And Jesus made answer and said to him, A blessing on you, Simon Bar-jonah: because this knowledge has not come to you from flesh and blood, but from my Father in heaven.

title: Matthew Chapter 16 Verse 18
text: And I say to you that you are Peter, and on this rock will my church be based, and the doors of hell will not overcome it.

title: Matthew Chapter 16 Verse 19
text: I will give to you the keys of the kingdom of heaven: and whatever is fixed by you on earth will be fixed in heaven: and whatever you make free on earth will be made free in heaven.

title: Matthew Chapter 16 Verse 20
text: Then he gave orders to the disciples to give no man word that he was the Christ.

title: Matthew Chapter 16 Verse 21
text: From that time Jesus went on to make clear to his disciples how he would have to go up to Jerusalem, and undergo much at the hands of those in authority and the chief priests and scribes, and be put to death, and the third day come again from the dead.

title: Matthew Chapter 16 Verse 22
text: And Peter, protesting, said to him, Be it far from you, Lord; it is impossible that this will come about.

title: Matthew Chapter 16 Verse 23
text: But he, turning to Peter, said, Get out of my way, Satan: you are a danger to me because your mind is not on the things of God, but on the things of men.

title: Matthew Chapter 16 Verse 24
text: Then Jesus said to his disciples, If any man would come after me, let him give up all, and take up his cross, and come after me.

title: Matthew Chapter 16 Verse 25
text: Because whoever has a desire to keep his life safe will have it taken from him; but whoever gives up his life because of me, will have it given back to him.

title: Matthew Chapter 16 Verse 26
text: For what profit has a man, if he gets all the world with the loss of his life? or what will a man give in exchange for his life?

title: Matthew Chapter 16 Verse 27
text: For the Son of man will come in the glory of his Father with his angels; and then he will give to every man the reward of his works.

title: Matthew Chapter 16 Verse 28
