text: Truly I say to you, There are some of those here who will not have a taste of death, till they see the Son of man coming in his kingdom.

title: Matthew Chapter 17 Verse 1
text: And after six days Jesus takes with him Peter, and James, and John, his brother, and makes them go up with him into a high mountain by themselves.

title: Matthew Chapter 17 Verse 2
text: And he was changed in form before them; and his face was shining like the sun, and his clothing became white as light.

title: Matthew Chapter 17 Verse 3
text: And Moses and Elijah came before their eyes, talking with him.

title: Matthew Chapter 17 Verse 4
text: And Peter made answer and said to Jesus, Lord, it is good for us to be here: if you will let me, I will make here three tents, one for you, and one for Moses, and one for Elijah.

title: Matthew Chapter 17 Verse 5
text: While he was still talking, a bright cloud came over them: and a voice out of the cloud, saying, This is my dearly loved Son, with whom I am well pleased; give ear to him.

title: Matthew Chapter 17 Verse 6
text: And at these words the disciples went down on their faces in great fear.

title: Matthew Chapter 17 Verse 7
text: And Jesus came and put his hand on them and said, Get up and have no fear.

title: Matthew Chapter 17 Verse 8
text: And lifting up their eyes, they saw no one, but Jesus only.

title: Matthew Chapter 17 Verse 9
text: And when they were coming down from the mountain, Jesus gave them orders, saying, Let no man have word of what you have seen, till the Son of man has come again from the dead.

title: Matthew Chapter 17 Verse 10
text: And his disciples, questioning him, said, Why then do the scribes say that Elijah has to come first?

title: Matthew Chapter 17 Verse 11
text: And in answer he said, Elijah truly has to come and put all things right:

title: Matthew Chapter 17 Verse 12
text: But I say to you that Elijah has come, and they had no knowledge of him, but did to him whatever they were pleased to do; the same will the Son of man undergo at their hands.

title: Matthew Chapter 17 Verse 13
text: Then the disciples saw that he was talking to them of John the Baptist.

title: Matthew Chapter 17 Verse 14
text: And when they came to the people, a man went down on his knees to him, saying,

title: Matthew Chapter 17 Verse 15
text: Lord have mercy on my son: for he is off his head, and is in great pain; and frequently he goes falling into the fire, and frequently into the water.

title: Matthew Chapter 17 Verse 16
text: And I took him to your disciples, and they were not able to make him well.

title: Matthew Chapter 17 Verse 17
text: And Jesus, answering, said, O false and foolish generation, how long will I be with you? how long will I put up with you? let him come here to me.

title: Matthew Chapter 17 Verse 18
text: And Jesus gave orders to the unclean spirit, and it went out of him: and the boy was made well from that hour.

title: Matthew Chapter 17 Verse 19
text: Then the disciples came to Jesus privately, and said, Why were we not able to send it out?

title: Matthew Chapter 17 Verse 20
text: And he says to them, Because of your little faith: for truly I say to you, If you have faith as a grain of mustard seed, you will say to this mountain, Be moved from this place to that; and it will be moved; and nothing will be impossible to you.

title: Matthew Chapter 17 Verse 22
text: And while they were going about in Galilee, Jesus said to them, The Son of man will be given up into the hands of men;

title: Matthew Chapter 17 Verse 23
text: And they will put him to death, and the third day he will come again from the dead. And they were very sad.

title: Matthew Chapter 17 Verse 24
text: And when they had come to Capernaum, those who took the Temple tax came to Peter and said, Does not your master make payment of the Temple tax?

title: Matthew Chapter 17 Verse 25
text: He says, Yes. And when he came into the house, Jesus said to him, What is your opinion, Simon? from whom do the kings of the earth get payment or tax? from their sons or from other people?

title: Matthew Chapter 17 Verse 26
text: And when he said, From other people, Jesus said to him, Then are the sons free.

title: Matthew Chapter 17 Verse 27
text: But, so that we may not be a cause of trouble to them, go to the sea, and let down a hook, and take the first fish which comes up; and in his mouth you will see a bit of money: take that, and give it to them for me and you.

title: Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 1
text: In that hour the disciples came to Jesus, saying, Who is greatest in the kingdom of heaven?

title: Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 2
text: And he took a little child, and put him in the middle of them,

title: Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 3
text: And said, Truly, I say to you, If you do not have a change of heart and become like little children, you will not go into the kingdom of heaven.

title: Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 4
text: Whoever, then, will make himself as low as this little child, the same is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven.

title: Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 5
text: And whoever gives honour to one such little child in my name, gives honour to me:

title: Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 6
text: But whoever is a cause of trouble to one of these little ones who have faith in me, it would be better for him to have a great stone fixed to his neck, and to come to his end in the deep sea.

title: Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 7
text: A curse is on the earth because of trouble! for it is necessary for trouble to come; but unhappy is that man through whom the trouble comes.

title: Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 8
text: And if your hand or your foot is a cause of trouble, let it be cut off and put it away from you: it is better for you to go into life with the loss of a hand or a foot than, having two hands or two feet, to go into the eternal fire.

title: Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 9
text: And if your eye is a cause of trouble to you, take it out, and put it away from you: it is better for you to go into life with one eye than, having two eyes, to go into the hell of fire.

title: Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 10
text: Let it not seem to you that one of these little ones is of no value; for I say to you that in heaven their angels see at all times the face of my Father in heaven.

title: Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 12
text: What would you say now? if a man has a hundred sheep, and one of them has gone wandering away, will he not let the ninety-nine be, and go to the mountains in search of the wandering one?

title: Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 13
text: And if he comes across it, truly I say to you, he has more joy over it than over the ninety-nine which have not gone out of the way.

title: Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 14
text: Even so it is not the pleasure of your Father in heaven for one of these little ones to come to destruction.

title: Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 15
text: And if your brother does wrong to you, go, make clear to him his error between you and him in private: if he gives ear to you, you have got your brother back again.

title: Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 16
text: But if he will not give ear to you, take with you one or two more, that by the lips of two or three witnesses every word may be made certain.

title: Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 17
text: And if he will not give ear to them, let it come to the hearing of the church: and if he will not give ear to the church, let him be to you as a Gentile and a tax-farmer.

title: Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 18
text: Truly I say to you, Whatever things are fixed by you on earth will be fixed in heaven: and whatever you make free on earth will be made free in heaven.

title: Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 19
text: Again, I say to you, that if two of you are in agreement on earth about anything for which they will make a request, it will be done for them by my Father in heaven.

title: Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 20
text: For where two or three are come together in my name, there am I among them.

title: Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 21
text: Then Peter came and said to him, Lord, what number of times may my brother do wrong against me, and I give him forgiveness? till seven times?

title: Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 22
text: Jesus says to him, I say not to you, Till seven times; but, Till seventy times seven.

title: Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 23
text: For this reason the kingdom of heaven is like a king, who went over his accounts with his servants.

title: Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 24
text: And at the start, one came to him who was in his debt for ten thousand talents.

title: Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 25
text: And because he was not able to make payment, his lord gave orders for him, and his wife, and his sons and daughters, and all he had, to be given for money, and payment to be made.

title: Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 26
text: So the servant went down on his face and gave him worship, saying, Lord, give me time to make payment and I will give you all.

title: Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 27
text: And the lord of that servant, being moved with pity, let him go, and made him free of the debt.

title: Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 28
text: But that servant went out, and meeting one of the other servants, who was in debt to him for one hundred pence, he took him by the throat, saying, Make payment of your debt.

title: Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 29
text: So that servant went down on his face, requesting him and saying, Give me time and I will make payment to you.

title: Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 30
text: And he would not: but went and put him into prison till he had made payment of the debt.

title: Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 31
text: So when the other servants saw what was done they were very sad, and came and gave word to their lord of what had been done.

title: Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 32
text: Then his lord sent for him and said, You evil servant; I made you free of all that debt, because of your request to me:

title: Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 33
text: Was it not right for you to have mercy on the other servant, even as I had mercy on you?

title: Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 34
text: And his lord was very angry, and put him in the hands of those who would give him punishment till he made payment of all the debt.

title: Matthew Chapter 18 Verse 35
text: So will my Father in heaven do to you, if you do not everyone, from your hearts, give forgiveness to his brother.

title: Matthew Chapter 19 Verse 1
text: And it came about that after saying these words, Jesus went away from Galilee, and came into the parts of Judaea on the other side of Jordan.

title: Matthew Chapter 19 Verse 2
text: And a great number went after him; and he made them well there.

title: Matthew Chapter 19 Verse 3
text: And certain Pharisees came to him, testing him, and saying, Is it right for a man to put away his wife for every cause?

title: Matthew Chapter 19 Verse 4
text: And he said in answer, Have you not seen in the Writings, that he who made them at the first made them male and female, and said,

title: Matthew Chapter 19 Verse 5
text: For this cause will a man go away from his father and mother, and be joined to his wife; and the two will become one flesh?

title: Matthew Chapter 19 Verse 6
text: So that they are no longer two, but one flesh. Then let not that which has been joined by God be parted by man.

title: Matthew Chapter 19 Verse 7
text: They say to him, Why then did Moses give orders that a husband might give her a statement in writing and be free from her?

title: Matthew Chapter 19 Verse 8
text: He says to them, Moses, because of your hard hearts, let you put away your wives: but it has not been so from the first.

title: Matthew Chapter 19 Verse 9
text: And I say to you, Whoever puts away his wife for any other cause than the loss of her virtue, and takes another, is a false husband: and he who takes her as his wife when she is put away, is no true husband to her.

title: Matthew Chapter 19 Verse 10
text: The disciples say to him, If this is the position of a man in relation to his wife, it is better not to be married.

title: Matthew Chapter 19 Verse 11
text: But he said to them, Not all men are able to take in this saying, but only those to whom it is given.

title: Matthew Chapter 19 Verse 12
text: For there are men who, from birth, were without sex: and there are some who were made so by men: and there are others who have made themselves so for the kingdom of heaven. He who is able to take it, let him take it.

title: Matthew Chapter 19 Verse 13
text: Then some people took little children to him, so that he might put his hands on them in blessing: and the disciples said sharp words to them.

title: Matthew Chapter 19 Verse 14
text: But Jesus said, Let the little ones come to me, and do not keep them away: for of such is the kingdom of heaven.

title: Matthew Chapter 19 Verse 15
text: And he put his hands on them, and went away.

title: Matthew Chapter 19 Verse 16
text: And one came to him and said, Master, what good thing have I to do, so that I may have eternal life?

title: Matthew Chapter 19 Verse 17
text: And he said to him, Why are you questioning me about what is good? One there is who is good: but if you have a desire to go into life, keep the rules of the law.

title: Matthew Chapter 19 Verse 18
text: He says to him, Which? And Jesus said, Do not put anyone to death, Do not be untrue in married life, Do not take what is not yours, Do not give false witness,

title: Matthew Chapter 19 Verse 19
text: Give honour to your father and your mother: and, Have love for your neighbour as for yourself.

title: Matthew Chapter 19 Verse 20
text: The young man says to him, All these things have I done: what more is there?

title: Matthew Chapter 19 Verse 21
text: Jesus said to him, If you have a desire to be complete, go, get money for your property, and give it to the poor, and you will have wealth in heaven: and come after me.

title: Matthew Chapter 19 Verse 22
text: But hearing these words the young man went away sorrowing: for he had much property.

title: Matthew Chapter 19 Verse 23
text: And Jesus said to his disciples, Truly I say to you, It is hard for a man with much money to go into the kingdom of heaven.

title: Matthew Chapter 19 Verse 24
text: And again I say to you, It is simpler for a camel to go through a needle's eye, than for a man with much money to go into the kingdom of God.

title: Matthew Chapter 19 Verse 25
text: And the disciples, hearing this, were greatly surprised, saying, Who then may have salvation?

title: Matthew Chapter 19 Verse 26
text: And Jesus, looking at them, said, With men this is not possible; but with God all things are possible.

title: Matthew Chapter 19 Verse 27
text: Then Peter said to him, See, we have given up everything and have come after you; what then will we have?

title: Matthew Chapter 19 Verse 28
text: And Jesus said to them, Truly I say to you that in the time when all things are made new, and the Son of man is seated in his glory, you who have come after me will be seated on twelve seats, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.

title: Matthew Chapter 19 Verse 29
text: And everyone who has given up houses, or brothers, or sisters, or father, or mother, or child, or land, for my name, will be given a hundred times as much, and have eternal life.

title: Matthew Chapter 19 Verse 30
text: But a great number who are first will be last, and some who are last will be first.

title: Matthew Chapter 20 Verse 1
text: For the kingdom of heaven is like the master of a house, who went out early in the morning to get workers into his vine-garden.

title: Matthew Chapter 20 Verse 2
text: And when he had made an agreement with the workmen for a penny a day, he sent them into his vine-garden.

title: Matthew Chapter 20 Verse 3
text: And he went out about the third hour, and saw others in the market-place doing nothing;

title: Matthew Chapter 20 Verse 4
text: And he said to them, Go into the vine-garden with the others, and whatever is right I will give you. And they went to work.

title: Matthew Chapter 20 Verse 5
text: Again he went out about the sixth and the ninth hour, and did the same.

title: Matthew Chapter 20 Verse 6
text: And about the eleventh hour he went out and saw others doing nothing; and he says to them, Why are you here all the day doing nothing?

title: Matthew Chapter 20 Verse 7
text: They say to him, Because no man has given us work. He says to them, Go in with the rest, into the vine-garden.

title: Matthew Chapter 20 Verse 8
text: And when evening came, the lord of the vine-garden said to his manager, Let the workers come, and give them their payment, from the last to the first.

title: Matthew Chapter 20 Verse 9
text: And when those men came who had gone to work at the eleventh hour, they were given every man a penny.

title: Matthew Chapter 20 Verse 10
text: Then those who came first had the idea that they would get more; and they, like the rest, were given a penny.

title: Matthew Chapter 20 Verse 11
text: And when they got it, they made a protest against the master of the house,

title: Matthew Chapter 20 Verse 12
text: Saying, These last have done only one hour's work, and you have made them equal to us, who have undergone the hard work of the day and the burning heat.

title: Matthew Chapter 20 Verse 13
text: But he in answer said to one of them, Friend, I do you no wrong: did you not make an agreement with me for a penny?

title: Matthew Chapter 20 Verse 14
text: Take what is yours, and go away; it is my pleasure to give to this last, even as to you.

title: Matthew Chapter 20 Verse 15
text: Have I not the right to do as seems good to me in my house? or is your eye evil, because I am good?

title: Matthew Chapter 20 Verse 16
text: So the last will be first, and the first last.

title: Matthew Chapter 20 Verse 17
text: And when Jesus was going up to Jerusalem, he took the twelve disciples on one side, and said to them,

title: Matthew Chapter 20 Verse 18
text: See, we go up to Jerusalem; and the Son of man will be given into the hands of the chief priests and scribes; and they will give orders for him to be put to death,

title: Matthew Chapter 20 Verse 19
text: And will give him up to the Gentiles to be made sport of and to be whipped and to be put to death on the cross: and the third day he will come back again from the dead.

title: Matthew Chapter 20 Verse 20
text: Then the mother of the sons of Zebedee came to him with her sons, giving him worship and making a request of him.

title: Matthew Chapter 20 Verse 21
text: And he said to her, What is your desire? She says to him, Let my two sons be seated, the one at your right hand, and the other at your left, in your kingdom.

title: Matthew Chapter 20 Verse 22
text: But Jesus made answer and said, You have no idea what you are requesting. Are you able to take of the cup which I am about to take?

title: Matthew Chapter 20 Verse 23
text: They say to him, We are able. He says to them, Truly, you will take of my cup: but to be seated at my right hand and at my left is not for me to give, but it is for those for whom my Father has made it ready.

title: Matthew Chapter 20 Verse 24
text: And when it came to the ears of the ten, they were angry with the two brothers.

title: Matthew Chapter 20 Verse 25
text: But Jesus said to them, You see that the rulers of the Gentiles are lords over them, and their great ones have authority over them.

title: Matthew Chapter 20 Verse 26
text: Let it not be so among you: but if anyone has a desire to become great among you, let him be your servant;

title: Matthew Chapter 20 Verse 27
text: And whoever has a desire to be first among you, let him take the lowest place:

title: Matthew Chapter 20 Verse 28
text: Even as the Son of man did not come to have servants, but to be a servant, and to give his life for the salvation of men.

title: Matthew Chapter 20 Verse 29
text: And when they were going out from Jericho, a great number went after him.

title: Matthew Chapter 20 Verse 30
text: And two blind men seated by the wayside, when they had the news that Jesus was going by, gave a loud cry, saying, Lord, Son of David, have mercy on us.

title: Matthew Chapter 20 Verse 31
text: And the people gave them orders to be quiet; but they went on crying even louder, Lord, Son of David, have mercy on us.

title: Matthew Chapter 20 Verse 32
text: And Jesus, stopping, sent for them, and said, What would you have me do to you?

title: Matthew Chapter 20 Verse 33
text: They say to him, Lord, that our eyes may be open.

title: Matthew Chapter 20 Verse 34
text: And Jesus, being moved with pity, put his fingers on their eyes: and straight away they were able to see, and went after him.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 1
text: And when they were near Jerusalem, and had come to Beth-phage, to the Mountain of Olives, Jesus sent two disciples,

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 2
text: Saying to them, Go into the little town in front of you, and straight away you will see an ass with a cord round her neck, and a young one with her; let them loose and come with them to me.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 3
text: And if anyone says anything to you, you will say, The Lord has need of them; and straight away he will send them.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 4
text: Now this took place so that these words of the prophet might come true,

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 5
text: Say to the daughter of Zion, See, your King comes to you, gentle and seated on an ass, and on a young ass.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 6
text: And the disciples went and did as Jesus had given them orders,

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 7
text: And got the ass and the young one, and put their clothing on them, and he took his seat on it.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 8
text: And all the people put their clothing down in the way; and others got branches from the trees, and put them down in the way.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 9
text: And those who went before him, and those who came after, gave loud cries, saying, Glory to the Son of David: A blessing on him who comes in the name of the Lord: Glory in the highest.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 10
text: And when he came into Jerusalem, all the town was moved, saying, Who is this?

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 11
text: And the people said, This is the prophet Jesus, from Nazareth of Galilee.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 12
text: And Jesus went into the Temple and sent out all who were trading there, overturning the tables of the money-changers and the seats of those trading in doves.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 13
text: And he said to them, It is in the Writings, My house is to be named a house of prayer, but you are making it a hole of thieves.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 14
text: And the blind and the broken in body came to him in the Temple, and he made them well.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 15
text: But when the chief priests and the scribes saw the works of power which he did, and the children crying out in the Temple, Glory to the son of David, they were angry and said to him,

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 16
text: Have you any idea what these are saying? And Jesus said to them, Yes: have you not seen in the Writings, From the lips of children and babies at the breast you have made your praise complete?

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 17
text: And he went away from them, and went out of the town to Bethany, and was there for the night.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 18
text: Now in the morning when he was coming back to the town, he had a desire for food.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 19
text: And seeing a fig-tree by the wayside, he came to it, and saw nothing on it but leaves only; and he said to it, Let there be no fruit from you from this time forward for ever. And straight away the fig-tree became dry and dead.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 20
text: And when the disciples saw it they were surprised, saying, How did the fig-tree become dry in so short a time?

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 21
text: And Jesus in answer said to them, Truly I say to you, If you have faith, without doubting, not only may you do what has been done to the fig-tree, but even if you say to this mountain, Be taken up and put into the sea, it will be done.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 22
text: And all things, whatever you make request for in prayer, having faith, you will get.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 23
text: And when he had come into the Temple, the chief priests and those in authority over the people came to him while he was teaching, and said, By what authority do you do these things? and who gave you this authority?

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 24
text: And Jesus said to them in answer, I will put one question to you, and if you give me the answer, I will say by what authority I do these things.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 25
text: The baptism of John, where did it come from? from heaven or from men? And they were reasoning among themselves, saying, If we say, From heaven; he will say to us, Why then did you not have faith in him?

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 26
text: But if we say, From men; we are in fear of the people, because all take John to be a prophet.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 27
text: And they made answer and said, We have no idea. Then he said to them, And I will not say to you by what authority I do these things.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 28
text: But how does it seem to you? A man had two sons; and he came to the first, and said, Son, go and do work today in the vine-garden.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 29
text: And he said in answer, I will not: but later, changing his decision, he went.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 30
text: And he came to the second and said the same. And he made answer and said, I go, sir: and went not.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 31
text: Which of the two did his father's pleasure? They say, The first. Jesus said to them, Truly I say to you, that tax-farmers and loose women are going into the kingdom of God before you.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 32
text: For John came to you in the way of righteousness, and you had no faith in him, but the tax-farmers and the loose women had faith in him: and you, when you saw it, did not even have regret for your sins, so as to have faith in him.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 33
text: Give ear to another story. A master of a house made a vine garden, and put a wall round it, and made a place for crushing out the wine, and made a tower, and let it out to field-workers, and went into another country.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 34
text: And when the time for the fruit came near, he sent his servants to the workmen, to get the fruit.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 35
text: And the workmen made an attack on his servants, giving blows to one, putting another to death, and stoning another.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 36
text: Again, he sent other servants more in number than the first: and they did the same to them.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 37
text: But after that he sent his son to them, saying, They will have respect for my son.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 38
text: But when the workmen saw the son, they said among themselves, This is he who will one day be the owner of the property; come, let us put him to death and take his heritage.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 39
text: And they took him and, driving him out of the vine-garden, put him to death.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 40
text: When, then, the lord of the vine-garden comes, what will he do to those workmen?

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 41
text: They say to him, He will put those cruel men to a cruel death, and will let out the vine-garden to other workmen, who will give him the fruit when it is ready.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 42
text: Jesus says to them, Did you never see in the Writings, The stone which the builders put on one side, the same has been made the chief stone of the building: this was the Lord's doing, and it is a wonder in our eyes?

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 43
text: For this reason I say to you, The kingdom of God will be taken away from you, and will be given to a nation producing the fruits of it.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 44
text: Any man falling on this stone will be broken, but he on whom it comes down will be crushed to dust.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 45
text: And when his stories came to the ears of the chief priests and the Pharisees, they saw that he was talking of them.

title: Matthew Chapter 21 Verse 46
text: And though they had a desire to take him, they were in fear of the people, because in their eyes he was a prophet.

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 1
text: And Jesus, talking to them again in stories, said:

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 2
text: The kingdom of heaven is like a certain king, who made a feast when his son was married,

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 3
text: And sent out his servants to get in the guests to the feast: and they would not come.

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 4
text: Again he sent out other servants, with orders to say to the guests, See, I have made ready my feast: my oxen and my fat beasts have been put to death, and all things are ready: come to the feast.

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 5
text: But they gave no attention, and went about their business, one to his farm, another to his trade:

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 6
text: And the rest put violent hands on his servants, and did evil to them, and put them to death.

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 7
text: But the king was angry; and he sent his armies, and those who had put his servants to death he gave to destruction, burning down their town with fire.

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 8
text: Then he said to his servants, The feast is ready but the guests were not good enough.

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 9
text: Go then to the cross-roads, and get all those whom you see to come to the bride-feast.

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 10
text: And those servants went out into the streets, and got together all those whom they came across, bad and good: and the feast was full of guests.

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 11
text: But when the king came in to see the guests, he saw there a man who had not on a guest's robe;

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 12
text: And he says to him, Friend, how came you in here not having a guest's robe? And he had nothing to say.

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 13
text: Then the king said to the servants, Put cords round his hands and feet and put him out into the dark; there will be weeping and cries of sorrow.

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 14
text: For out of all to whom the good news has come, only a small number will get salvation.

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 15
text: Then the Pharisees went and had a meeting to see how they might make use of his words to take him.

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 16
text: And they sent to him their disciples, with the Herodians, saying, Master, we see that you are true, and that you are teaching the true way of God, and have no fear of anyone, because you have no respect for a man's position.

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 17
text: Give us, then, your opinion of this: Is it right to give tax to Caesar, or not?

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 18
text: But Jesus saw their trick and said, Oh false ones, why are you attempting to put me in the wrong?

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 19
text: Let me see the tax money. And they gave him a penny.

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 20
text: And he said to them, Whose is this image and name on it?

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 21
text: They say to him, Caesar's. Then he said to them, Give to Caesar the things which are Caesar's, and to God the things which are God's.

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 22
text: And hearing it, they were full of wonder, and went away from him.

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 23
text: On the same day there came to him the Sadducees, who say that there is no coming back from the dead: and they put a question to him, saying,

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 24
text: Master, Moses said, If a man, at the time of his death, has no children, let his brother take his wife, and get a family for his brother;

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 25
text: Now there were among us seven brothers; and the first was married and at his death, having no seed, gave his wife to his brother;

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 26
text: In the same way the second and the third, up to the seventh.

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 27
text: And last of all the woman came to her end.

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 28
text: When they come back from the dead, then, whose wife will she be of the seven? because they all had her.

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 29
text: But Jesus said to them in answer, You are in error, not having knowledge of the Writings, or of the power of God.

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 30
text: For when they come back from the dead there are no husbands and wives, but they are as the angels in heaven.

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 31
text: But about the dead coming back to life, have you no knowledge of what was said to you by God in the Writings:

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 32
text: I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob? God is not the God of the dead but of the living.

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 33
text: And the people hearing it were surprised at his teaching.

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 34
text: But the Pharisees, hearing how the mouths of the Sadducees had been stopped, came together;

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 35
text: And one of them, a teacher of the law, put a question to him, testing him, and saying,

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 36
text: Master, which is the chief rule in the law?

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 37
text: And he said to him, Have love for the Lord your God with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your mind.

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 38
text: This is the first and greatest rule.

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 39
text: And a second like it is this, Have love for your neighbour as for yourself.

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 40
text: On these two rules all the law and the prophets are based.

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 41
text: Now while the Pharisees were together, Jesus put a question to them, saying,

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 42
text: What is your opinion of the Christ? whose son is he? They say to him, The Son of David.

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 43
text: He says to them, How then does David in the Spirit give him the name of Lord, saying,

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 44
text: The Lord said to my Lord, Be seated at my right hand, till I put under your feet all those who are against you?

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 45
text: If David then gives him the name of Lord, how is he his son?

title: Matthew Chapter 22 Verse 46
text: And no one was able to give him an answer, and so great was their fear of him, that from that day no one put any more questions to him.

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 1
text: Then Jesus said to the people and to his disciples:

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 2
text: The scribes and the Pharisees have the authority of Moses;

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 3
text: All things, then, which they give you orders to do, these do and keep: but do not take their works as your example, for they say and do not.

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 4
text: They make hard laws and put great weights on men's backs; but they themselves will not put a finger to them.

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 5
text: But all their works they do so as to be seen by men: for they make wide their phylacteries, and the edges of their robes,

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 6
text: And the things desired by them are the first places at feasts, and the chief seats in the Synagogues,

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 7
text: And words of respect in the market-places, and to be named by men, Teacher.

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 8
text: But you may not be named Teacher: for one is your teacher, and you are all brothers.

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 9
text: And give no man the name of father on earth: because one is your Father, who is in heaven.

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 10
text: And you may not be named guides: because one is your Guide, even Christ.

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 11
text: But let the greatest among you be your servant.

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 12
text: And whoever makes himself high will be made low, and whoever makes himself low will be made high.

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 13
text: But a curse is on you, scribes and Pharisees, false ones! because you are shutting the kingdom of heaven against men: for you do not go in yourselves, and those who are going in, you keep back.

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 15
text: A curse is on you, scribes and Pharisees, false ones! for you go about land and sea to get one disciple and, having him, you make him twice as much a son of hell as yourselves.

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 16
text: A curse is on you, blind guides, who say, Whoever takes an oath by the Temple, it is nothing; but whoever takes an oath by the gold of the Temple, he is responsible.

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 17
text: You foolish ones and blind: which is greater, the gold, or the Temple which makes the gold holy?

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 18
text: And, Whoever takes an oath by the altar, it is nothing; but whoever takes an oath by the offering which is on it, he is responsible.

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 19
text: You blind ones: which is greater, the offering, or the altar which makes the offering holy?

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 20
text: He, then, who takes an oath by the altar, takes it by the altar and by all things on it.

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 21
text: And he who takes an oath by the Temple, takes it by the Temple and by him whose house it is.

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 22
text: And he who takes an oath by heaven, takes it by the seat of God, and by him who is seated on it.

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 23
text: A curse is on you, scribes and Pharisees, false ones! for you make men give a tenth of all sorts of sweet-smelling plants, but you give no thought to the more important things of the law, righteousness, and mercy, and faith; but it is right for you to do these, and not to let the others be undone.

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 24
text: You blind guides, who take out a fly from your drink, but make no trouble over a camel.

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 25
text: A curse is on you, scribes and Pharisees, false ones! for you make clean the outside of the cup and of the plate, but inside they are full of violent behaviour and uncontrolled desire.

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 26
text: You blind Pharisee, first make clean the inside of the cup and of the plate, so that the outside may become equally clean.

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 27
text: A curse is on you, scribes and Pharisees, false ones! for you are like the resting-places of the dead, which are made white, and seem beautiful on the outside, but inside are full of dead men's bones and of all unclean things.

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 28
text: Even so you seem to men to be full of righteousness, but inside you are all false and full of wrongdoing.

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 29
text: A curse is on you, scribes and Pharisees, false ones! because you put up buildings for housing the dead bodies of the prophets, and make fair the last resting-places of good men, and say,

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 30
text: If we had been living in the days of our fathers, we would not have taken part with them in the blood of the prophets.

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 31
text: So that you are witnesses against yourselves that you are the sons of those who put the prophets to death.

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 32
text: Make full, then, the measure of your fathers.

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 33
text: You snakes, offspring of snakes, how will you be kept from the punishment of hell?

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 34
text: For this reason, I send you prophets, and wise men, and scribes: some of them you will put to death and put on the cross, and to some of them you will give blows in your Synagogues, driving them from town to town;

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 35
text: So that on you may come all the blood of the upright on the earth, from the blood of upright Abel to the blood of Zachariah, son of Barachiah, whom you put to death between the Temple and the altar.

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 36
text: Truly I say to you, All these things will come on this generation.

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 37
text: O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, putting to death the prophets, and stoning those who are sent to her! Again and again would I have taken your children to myself as a bird takes her young ones under her wings, and you would not!

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 38
text: See, your house is made waste.

title: Matthew Chapter 23 Verse 39
text: For I say to you, You will not see me from this time till you say, A blessing on him who comes in the name of the Lord.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 1
text: And Jesus went out of the Temple, and on the way his disciples came to him, pointing out the buildings of the Temple.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 2
text: But he, answering, said to them, See you not all these things? truly I say to you that here there will not be one stone resting on another, which will not be pulled down.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 3
text: And while he was seated on the Mountain of Olives, the disciples came to him privately, saying, Make clear to us, when will these things be? and what will be the sign of your coming and of the end of the world?

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 4
text: And Jesus said to them in answer, Take care that you are not tricked.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 5
text: For people will come in my name, saying, I am the Christ; and a number will be turned from the true way through them.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 6
text: And news will come to you of wars and talk of wars: do not be troubled, for these things have to be; but it is still not the end.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 7
text: For nation will be moved against nation, and kingdom against kingdom, and men will be without food, and the earth will be shaking in different places;

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 8
text: But all these things are the first of the troubles.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 9
text: Then they will be cruel to you, and will put you to death: and you will be hated by all nations because of my name.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 10
text: And numbers of people will be turned from the right way, and will give one another up and have hate for one another.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 11
text: And a number of false prophets will come, causing error.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 12
text: And because wrongdoing will be increased, the love of most people will become cold.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 13
text: But he who goes through to the end will get salvation.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 14
text: And this good news of the kingdom will be given through all the world for a witness to all nations; and then the end will come.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 15
text: When, then, you see in the holy place the unclean thing which makes destruction, of which word was given by Daniel the prophet (let this be clear to the reader),

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 16
text: Then let those who are in Judaea go in flight to the mountains:

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 17
text: Let not him who is on the house-top go down to take anything out of his house:

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 18
text: And let not him who is in the field go back to get his coat.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 19
text: But it will be hard for women who are with child and for those with babies at the breast in those days.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 20
text: And say a prayer that your flight may not be in the winter, or on a Sabbath.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 21
text: Because in those days there will be great sorrow, such as there has not been from the start of the world till now, or ever will be.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 22
text: And if those days had not been made short there would have been no salvation for any, but because of the saints those days will be made short.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 23
text: Then if any man says to you, See, here is the Christ, or, Here; do not put faith in him;

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 24
text: For there will come up false Christs, and false prophets, who will do great signs and wonders; so that if possible even the saints might be tricked.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 25
text: See, I have made it clear to you before it comes about.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 26
text: If, then, they say to you, See, he is in the waste land; go not out: See, he is in the inner rooms; put no faith in it.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 27
text: Because as in a thunderstorm the bright light coming from the east is seen even in the west; so will be the coming of the Son of man.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 28
text: Wherever the dead body is, there will the eagles come together.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 29
text: But straight away, after the trouble of those days, the sun will be made dark and the moon will not give her light and the stars will come down from heaven and the powers of heaven will be moved:

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 30
text: And then the sign of the Son of man will be seen in heaven: and then all the nations of the earth will have sorrow, and they will see the Son of man coming on the clouds of heaven with power and great glory.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 31
text: And he will send out his angels with a great sound of a horn, and they will get his saints together from the four winds, from one end of heaven to the other.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 32
text: Now take an example from the fig-tree: when her branch has become soft and puts out its leaves, you are certain that the summer is near;

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 33
text: Even so, when you see all these things, you may be certain that he is near, even at the doors.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 34
text: Truly I say to you, This generation will not come to an end till all these things are complete.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 35
text: Heaven and earth will come to an end, but my words will not come to an end.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 36
text: But of that day and hour no one has knowledge, not even the angels in heaven, or the Son, but the Father only.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 37
text: And as were the days of Noah, so will be the coming of the Son of man.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 38
text: Because as in those days before the overflowing of the waters, they were feasting and taking wives and getting married, till the day when Noah went into the ark,

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 39
text: And they had no care till the waters came and took them all away; so will be the coming of the Son of man.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 40
text: Then two men will be in the field; one is taken, and one let go;

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 41
text: Two women will be crushing grain; one is taken, and one let go.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 42
text: Be watching, then! for you have no knowledge on what day your Lord will come.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 43
text: But be certain of this, that if the master of the house had had knowledge of the time when the thief was coming, he would have been watching, and would not have let his house be broken into.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 44
text: Be ready then; for at a time which you have no thought of the Son of man will come.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 45
text: Who is the true and wise servant, whom his lord has put over those in his house, to give them their food at the right time?

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 46
text: A blessing on that servant, who will be doing so when his lord comes.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 47
text: Truly, I say to you, he will put him over all he has.

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 48
text: But if that evil servant says in his heart, My lord is a long time in coming;

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 49
text: And is cruel to the other servants, taking his pleasure with those who are overcome with wine;

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 50
text: The lord of that servant will come in a day when he is not looking for him, and in an hour of which he has no knowledge,

title: Matthew Chapter 24 Verse 51
text: And will have him cut in two, and will give him a part in the fate of the false ones: there will be weeping and cries of sorrow.

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 1
text: Then the kingdom of heaven will be like ten virgins, the friends of the bride, who took their lights, and went out with the purpose of meeting the husband.

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 2
text: And five of them were foolish, and five were wise.

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 3
text: For the foolish, when they took their lights, took no oil with them.

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 4
text: But the wise took oil in their vessels with their lights.

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 5
text: Now the husband was a long time in coming, and they all went to sleep.

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 6
text: But in the middle of the night there is a cry, The husband comes! Go out to him.

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 7
text: Then all those virgins got up, and made ready their lights.

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 8
text: And the foolish said to the wise, Give us of your oil; for our lights are going out.

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 9
text: But the wise made answer, saying, There may not be enough for us and you; it would be better for you to go to the traders and get oil for yourselves.

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 10
text: And while they went to get oil, the master came; and those who were ready went in with him to the feast: and the door was shut.

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 11
text: After that the other virgins came, saying, Lord, Lord, let us in.

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 12
text: But he made answer and said, Truly I say to you, I have no knowledge of you.

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 13
text: Keep watch, then, because you are not certain of the day or of the hour.

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 14
text: For it is as when a man, about to take a journey, got his servants together, and gave them his property.

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 15
text: And to one he gave five talents, to another two, to another one; to everyone as he was able; and he went on his journey.

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 16
text: Straight away he who had been given the five talents went and did trade with them, and made five more.

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 17
text: In the same way he who had been given the two got two more.

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 18
text: But he who was given the one went away and put it in a hole in the earth, and kept his lord's money in a secret place.

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 19
text: Now after a long time the lord of those servants comes, and makes up his account with them.

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 20
text: And he who had the five talents came with his other five talents, saying, Lord, you gave into my care five talents: see, I have got five more.

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 21
text: His lord said to him, Well done, good and true servant: you have been true in a small thing, I will give you control over great things: take your part in the joy of your lord.

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 22
text: And he who had the two talents came and said, Lord, you gave into my care two talents: see, I have got two more.

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 23
text: His lord said to him, Well done, good and true servant: you have been true in a small thing, I will give you control over great things: take your part in the joy of your lord.

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 24
text: And he who had had the one talent came and said, Lord, I had knowledge that you are a hard man, getting in grain where you have not put seed, and making profits for which you have done no work:

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 25
text: And I was in fear, and went away, and put your talent in the earth: here is what is yours.

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 26
text: But his lord in answer said to him, You are a bad and unready servant; if you had knowledge that I get in grain where I did not put seed, and make profits for which I have done no work,

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 27
text: Why, then, did you not put my money in the bank, and at my coming I would have got back what is mine with interest?

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 28
text: Take away, then, his talent and give it to him who has the ten talents.

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 29
text: For to everyone who has will be given, and he will have more: but from him who has not, even what he has will be taken away.

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 30
text: And put out the servant who is of no profit into the outer dark: there will be weeping and cries of sorrow.

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 31
text: But when the Son of man comes in his glory, and all the angels with him, then will he be seated in his glory:

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 32
text: And before him all the nations will come together; and they will be parted one from another, as the sheep are parted from the goats by the keeper.

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 33
text: And he will put the sheep on his right, but the goats on the left.

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 34
text: Then will the King say to those on his right, Come, you who have the blessing of my Father, into the kingdom made ready for you before the world was:

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 35
text: For I was in need of food, and you gave it to me: I was in need of drink, and you gave it to me: I was wandering, and you took me in;

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 36
text: I had no clothing, and you gave it to me: when I was ill, or in prison, you came to me.

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 37
text: Then will the upright make answer to him, saying, Lord, when did we see you in need of food, and give it to you? or in need of drink, and give it to you?

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 38
text: And when did we see you wandering, and take you in? or without clothing, and give it to you?

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 39
text: And when did we see you ill, or in prison, and come to you?

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 40
text: And the King will make answer and say to them, Truly I say to you, Because you did it to the least of these my brothers, you did it to me.

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 41
text: Then will he say to those on the left, Go from me, you cursed ones, into the eternal fire which is ready for the Evil One and his angels:

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 42
text: For I was in need of food, and you gave it not to me; I was in need of drink, and you gave it not to me:

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 43
text: I was wandering, and you took me not in; without clothing, and you gave me no clothing; ill, and in prison, and you came not to me.

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 44
text: Then will they make answer, saying, Lord, when did we see you in need of food or drink, or wandering, or without clothing, or ill, or in prison, and did not take care of you?

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 45
text: Then will he make answer to them, saying, Truly I say to you, Because you did it not to the least of these, you did it not to me.

title: Matthew Chapter 25 Verse 46
text: And these will go away into eternal punishment; but the upright into eternal life.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 1
text: And when Jesus had come to the end of all these words, he said to his disciples,

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 2
text: After two days is the Passover, and the Son of man will be given up to the death of the cross.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 3
text: Then the chief priests and the rulers of the people came together in the house of the high priest, who was named Caiaphas.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 4
text: And they made designs together to take Jesus by some trick, and put him to death.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 5
text: But they said, Not while the feast is going on, for fear of trouble among the people.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 6
text: Now when Jesus was in Bethany in the house of Simon the leper,

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 7
text: There came to him a woman having a bottle of perfume of great price, and she put the perfume on his head when he was seated at table.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 8
text: But when the disciples saw it they were angry, saying, To what purpose is this waste?

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 9
text: For we might have got much money for this and given it to the poor.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 10
text: But Jesus, seeing it, said to them, Why are you troubling the woman? she has done a kind act to me.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 11
text: For the poor you have ever with you, but me you have not for ever.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 12
text: For in putting this perfume on my body, she did it to make me ready for my last resting-place.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 13
text: Truly I say to you, Wherever this good news goes out in all the world, what this woman has done will be talked of in memory of her.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 14
text: Then one of the twelve, who was named Judas Iscariot, went to the chief priests and said,

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 15
text: What will you give me, if I give him up to you? And the price was fixed at thirty bits of silver.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 16
text: And from that time he was watching for a chance to give him into their hands.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 17
text: Now on the first day of unleavened bread the disciples came to Jesus, saying, Where are we to make ready for you to take the Passover meal?

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 18
text: And he said to them, Go into the town to such a man, and say to him, The Master says, My time is near: I will keep the Passover at your house with my disciples.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 19
text: And the disciples did as Jesus had said to them; and they made ready the Passover.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 20
text: Now when evening was come, he was seated at table with the twelve disciples;

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 21
text: And while they were taking food, he said, Truly I say to you that one of you will be false to me.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 22
text: And they were very said, and said to him, one by one, Is it I, Lord?

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 23
text: And he made answer and said, He who puts his hand into the plate with me, the same will be false to me.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 24
text: The Son of man goes, even as the Writings say of him: but a curse is on that man through whom the Son of man is given up; it would have been well for that man if he had never come into the world.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 25
text: And Judas, who was false to him, made answer and said, Is it I, Master? He says to him, Yes.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 26
text: And when they were taking food, Jesus took bread and, after blessing it, he gave the broken bread to the disciples and said, Take it; this is my body.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 27
text: And he took a cup and, having given praise, he gave it to them, saying,

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 28
text: Take of it, all of you, for this is my blood of the testament, which is given for men for the forgiveness of sins.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 29
text: But I say to you that from now I will not take of this fruit of the vine, till that day when I take it new with you in my Father's kingdom.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 30
text: And after a song of praise to God, they went out to the Mountain of Olives.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 31
text: Then said Jesus to them, All of you will be turned away from me this night: for it is said in the Writings, I will put to death the keeper of the sheep, and the sheep of the flock will be put to flight.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 32
text: But after I am come back from the dead, I will go before you into Galilee.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 33
text: But Peter made answer and said to him, Though all may be turned away from you, I will never be turned away.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 34
text: Jesus said to him, Truly I say to you that this night, before the hour of the cock's cry, you will say three times that you have no knowledge of me.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 35
text: Peter says to him, Even if I am put to death with you, I will not be false to you. So said all the disciples.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 36
text: Then comes Jesus with them to a place named Gethsemane, and says to his disciples, Be seated here, while I go over there for prayer.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 37
text: And he took with him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, and became sad and very troubled.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 38
text: Then says he to them, My soul is very sad, even to death: keep watch with me here.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 39
text: And he went forward a little, and falling down on his face in prayer, he said, O my Father, if it is possible, let this cup go from me; but let not my pleasure, but yours be done.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 40
text: And he comes to the disciples, and sees that they are sleeping, and says to Peter, What, were you not able to keep watch with me one hour?

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 41
text: Keep watch with prayer, so that you may not be put to the test: the spirit truly is ready, but the flesh is feeble.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 42
text: Again, a second time he went away, and said in prayer, O my Father, if this may not go from me without my taking it, let your pleasure be done.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 43
text: And he came again and saw them sleeping, for their eyes were tired.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 44
text: And he went away from them again, and a third time said the same prayer.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 45
text: Then he comes to the disciples; and says to them, Go on sleeping now, and take your rest: for the hour is come, and the Son of man is given into the hands of evil men.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 46
text: Up, let us be going: see, he who gives me up is near.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 47
text: And while he was still talking, Judas, one of the twelve, came, and with him a band armed with swords and sticks, from the chief priests and those in authority over the people.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 48
text: Now the false one had given them a sign saying, The one to whom I give a kiss, that is he: take him.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 49
text: And straight away he came to Jesus and said, Master! and gave him a kiss.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 50
text: And Jesus said to him, Friend, do that for which you have come. Then they came and put hands on Jesus, and took him.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 51
text: And one of those who were with Jesus put out his hand, and took out his sword and gave the servant of the high priest a blow, cutting off his ear.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 52
text: Then says Jesus to him, Put up your sword again into its place: for all those who take the sword will come to death by the sword.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 53
text: Does it not seem possible to you that if I make request to my Father he will even now send me an army of angels?

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 54
text: But how then would the Writings come true, which say that so it has to be?

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 55
text: In that hour Jesus said to the people, Have you come out as against a thief with swords and sticks to take me? I was teaching every day in the Temple and you took me not.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 56
text: But all this has taken place so that the writings of the prophets might come true. Then all his disciples went from him in flight.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 57
text: And those who had made Jesus prisoner took him away to the house of Caiaphas, the high priest, where the scribes and those in authority over the people had come together.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 58
text: But Peter went after him at a distance, to the house of the high priest, and went in and took his seat with the servants, to see the end.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 59
text: Now the chief priests and all the Sanhedrin were looking for false witness against Jesus, so that they might put him to death;

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 60
text: And they were not able to get it, though a number of false witnesses came.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 61
text: But later there came two who said, This man said, I am able to give the Temple of God to destruction, and to put it up again in three days.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 62
text: And the high priest got up and said to him, Have you no answer? what is it which these say against you?

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 63
text: But Jesus said not a word. And the high priest said to him, I put you on oath, by the living God, that you will say to us if you are the Christ, the Son of God.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 64
text: Jesus says to him, You say so: but I say to you, From now you will see the Son of man seated at the right hand of power, and coming on the clouds of heaven.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 65
text: Then the high priest, violently parting his robes, said, He has said evil against God: what more need have we of witnesses? for now his words against God have come to your ears:

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 66
text: What is your opinion? They made answer and said, It is right for him to be put to death.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 67
text: Then they put shame on him, and were cruel to him: and some gave him blows, saying,

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 68
text: Be a prophet, O Christ, and say who gave you a blow!

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 69
text: Now Peter was seated in the open square outside the house: and a servant-girl came to him, saying, You were with Jesus the Galilaean.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 70
text: But he said before them all that it was false, saying, I have no knowledge of what you say.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 71
text: And when he had gone out into the doorway, another saw him and says to those who were there, This man was with Jesus the Nazarene.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 72
text: And again he said with an oath, I have no knowledge of the man.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 73
text: And after a little time those who were near came and said to Peter, Truly you are one of them; because your talk is witness against you.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 74
text: Then with curses and oaths he said, I have no knowledge of the man. And straight away there came the cry of a cock.

title: Matthew Chapter 26 Verse 75
text: And the word of Jesus came back to Peter, when he said, Before the hour of the cock's cry, you will say three times that you have no knowledge of me. And he went out, weeping bitterly.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 1
text: Now when it was morning, all the chief priests and those in authority took thought together with the purpose of putting Jesus to death.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 2
text: And they put cords on him and took him away, and gave him up to Pilate, the ruler.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 3
text: Then Judas, who was false to him, seeing that he was to be put to death, in his regret took back the thirty bits of silver to the chief priests and those in authority,

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 4
text: Saying, I have done wrong in giving into your hands an upright man. But they said, What is that to us? it is your business.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 5
text: And he put down the silver in the Temple and went out, and put himself to death by hanging.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 6
text: And the chief priests took the silver and said, It is not right to put it in the Temple store for it is the price of blood.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 7
text: And they made a decision to get with the silver the potter's field, as a place for the dead of other countries.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 8
text: For this cause that field was named, The field of blood, to this day.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 9
text: Then came true that which was said by Jeremiah the prophet, And they took the thirty bits of silver, the price of him who was valued by the children of Israel;

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 10
text: And they gave them for the potter's field, as I had word from the Lord.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 11
text: And Jesus was before the ruler, who put a question to him, Are you the King of the Jews? And Jesus said to him, You say so.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 12
text: But when the chief priests and those in authority made statements against him, he gave no answer.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 13
text: Then says Pilate to him, Do you give no attention to what their witnesses say against you?

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 14
text: And he gave him no answer, not even a word: so that the ruler was greatly surprised.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 15
text: Now at the feast it was the way for the ruler to let free to the people one prisoner, at their selection.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 16
text: And they had then an important prisoner, whose name was Barabbas.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 17
text: So when they came together, Pilate said to them, Whom will you have? Barabbas, or Jesus, who is named Christ?

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 18
text: For he saw that for envy they had given him up.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 19
text: And while he was on the judge's seat, his wife sent to him, saying, Have nothing to do with that upright man, for I have had much trouble this day in a dream because of him.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 20
text: Now the chief priests and those in authority got the people to make request for Barabbas, and for Jesus to be put to death.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 21
text: But the ruler made answer and said to them, Which of the two is it your pleasure that I let go free? And they said, Barabbas.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 22
text: Pilate says to them, What, then, am I to do with Jesus, who is named Christ? They all say, Let him be put to death on the cross.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 23
text: And he said, Why, what evil has he done? But they gave loud cries, saying, To the cross with him!

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 24
text: So when Pilate saw that he was able to do nothing, but that trouble was working up, he took water and, washing his hands before the people, said, The blood of this upright man is not on my hands: you are responsible.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 25
text: And all the people made answer and said, Let his blood be on us, and on our children.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 26
text: Then he let Barabbas go free: but after having Jesus whipped, he gave him up to be put to death on the cross.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 27
text: Then the ruler's armed men took Jesus into the open square, and got all their band together.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 28
text: And they took off his clothing, and put on him a red robe.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 29
text: And they made a crown of thorns and put it on his head, and put a rod in his right hand, and they went down on their knees before him, and made sport of him, saying, Long life to the King of the Jews.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 30
text: And they put shame on him, and gave him blows on the head with the rod.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 31
text: And when they had made sport of him, they took the robe off him, and put his clothing on him, and took him away to put him on the cross.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 32
text: And while they were coming out, they saw a man of Cyrene, Simon by name, and they made him go with them, so that he might take up his cross.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 33
text: And when they came to the place named Golgotha, that is to say, Dead Man's Head,

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 34
text: They gave him wine mixed with bitter drink: and after tasting it, he took no more.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 35
text: And when they had put him on the cross, they made division of his clothing among them by the decision of chance.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 36
text: And they were seated there watching him.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 37
text: And they put up over his head the statement of his crime in writing, THIS IS JESUS THE KING OF THE JEWS.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 38
text: Then two thieves were put on crosses with him, one on the right and one on the left.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 39
text: And those who went by said bitter words to him, shaking their heads and saying,

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 40
text: You who would give the Temple to destruction and put it up again in three days, get yourself free: if you are the Son of God, come down from the cross.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 41
text: In the same way, the chief priests, making sport of him, with the scribes and those in authority, said,

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 42
text: A saviour of others, he has no salvation for himself. If he is the King of Israel, let him now come down from the cross, and we will have faith in him.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 43
text: He put his faith in God; let God be his saviour now, if he will have him; for he said, I am the Son of God.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 44
text: And the thieves who were on the crosses said evil words to him.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 45
text: Now from the sixth hour it was dark over all the land till the ninth hour.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 46
text: And about the ninth hour Jesus gave a loud cry, saying, Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani? that is, My God, my God, why are you turned away from me?

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 47
text: And some of those who were near by, hearing it, said, This man is crying to Elijah.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 48
text: And straight away one of them went quickly, and took a sponge, and made it full of bitter wine, and put it on a rod and gave him drink.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 49
text: And the rest said, Let him be; let us see if Elijah will come to his help.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 50
text: And Jesus gave another loud cry, and gave up his spirit.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 51
text: And the curtain of the Temple was parted in two from end to end; and there was an earth-shock; and the rocks were broken;

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 52
text: And the resting-places of the dead came open; and the bodies of a number of sleeping saints came to life;

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 53
text: And coming out of their resting-places, after he had come again from the dead, they went into the holy town and were seen by a number of people.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 54
text: Now the captain and those who were with him watching Jesus, when they saw the earth-shock and the things which were done, were in great fear and said, Truly this was a son of God.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 55
text: And a number of women were there, watching from a distance, who had come with Jesus from Galilee, waiting on his needs.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 56
text: Among whom was Mary Magdalene, and Mary, the mother of James and Joses, and the mother of the sons of Zebedee.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 57
text: And in the evening, there came a man of wealth from Arimathaea, Joseph by name, who was a disciple of Jesus:

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 58
text: This man went in to Pilate, and made a request for the body of Jesus. Then Pilate gave orders for it to be given to him.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 59
text: And Joseph took the body, folding it in clean linen,

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 60
text: And put it in the resting-place which had been cut out of the rock for himself; and after rolling a great stone to the door of it he went away.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 61
text: And Mary Magdalene was there, and the other Mary, seated by the place of the dead.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 62
text: Now on the day after the getting ready of the Passover, the chief priests and Pharisees came together to Pilate,

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 63
text: Saying, Sir, we have in mind how that false man said, while he was still living, After three days I will come again from the dead.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 64
text: Give orders, then, that the place where his body is may be made safe till the third day, for fear that his disciples come and take him away secretly and say to the people, He has come back from the dead: and the last error will be worse than the first.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 65
text: Pilate said to them, You have watchmen; go and make it as safe as you are able.

title: Matthew Chapter 27 Verse 66
text: So they went, and made safe the place where his body was, putting a stamp on the stone, and the watchmen were with them.

title: Matthew Chapter 28 Verse 1
text: Now late on the Sabbath, when the dawn of the first day of the week was near, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary came to see the place where his body was.

title: Matthew Chapter 28 Verse 2
text: And there was a great earth-shock; for an angel of the Lord came down from heaven and, rolling back the stone, took his seat on it.

title: Matthew Chapter 28 Verse 3
text: His form was shining like the light, and his clothing was white as snow:

title: Matthew Chapter 28 Verse 4
text: And for fear of him the watchmen were shaking, and became as dead men.

title: Matthew Chapter 28 Verse 5
text: And the angel said to the women, Have no fear: for I see that you are searching for Jesus, who was put to death on the cross.

title: Matthew Chapter 28 Verse 6
text: He is not here, for he has come to life again, even as he said. Come, see the Lord's resting-place.

title: Matthew Chapter 28 Verse 7
text: And go quickly and give his disciples the news that he has come back from the dead, and is going before you into Galilee; there you will see him, as I have said to you.

title: Matthew Chapter 28 Verse 8
text: And they went away quickly, with fear and great joy, to give his disciples the news.

title: Matthew Chapter 28 Verse 9
text: And on the way, Jesus came to them, saying, Be glad. And they came and put their hands on his feet, and gave him worship.

title: Matthew Chapter 28 Verse 10
text: Then said Jesus to them, Have no fear: go and give word to my brothers to go into Galilee, and there they will see me.

title: Matthew Chapter 28 Verse 11
text: Now, while they were going, some of the watchmen came into the town and gave news to the chief priests of all the things which had taken place.

title: Matthew Chapter 28 Verse 12
text: And when they had come together with those in authority, and had made their decision, they gave much money to the watchmen, saying,

title: Matthew Chapter 28 Verse 13
text: Say, His disciples came by night and took him away secretly while we were sleeping.
