title: Matthew Chapter 28 Verse 14
text: And if this comes to the ruler's ears, we will see that he does not make you responsible.

title: Matthew Chapter 28 Verse 15
text: So they took the money, and did as they had been ordered: and this account has been current among the Jews till the present time.

title: Matthew Chapter 28 Verse 16
text: But the eleven disciples went into Galilee, to the mountain where Jesus had given them orders to go.

title: Matthew Chapter 28 Verse 17
text: And when they saw him they gave him worship: but some were in doubt.

title: Matthew Chapter 28 Verse 18
text: And Jesus came to them and said, All authority has been given to me in heaven and on earth.

title: Matthew Chapter 28 Verse 19
text: Go then, and make disciples of all the nations, giving them baptism in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit:

title: Matthew Chapter 28 Verse 20
text: Teaching them to keep all the rules which I have given you: and see, I am ever with you, even to the end of the world.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: The first words of the good news of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: Even as it is said in the book of Isaiah the prophet, See, I send my servant before your face, who will make ready your way;

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: The voice of one crying in the waste land, Make ready the way of the Lord, make his roads straight;

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: John came, and gave baptism in the waste land, preaching baptism as a sign of forgiveness of sin for those whose hearts were changed.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: And there went out to him all the people of Judaea, and all those of Jerusalem, and they were given baptism by him in the river Jordan, saying that they were sinners.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: And John was clothed in camel's hair, with a leather band about him; and his food was locusts and honey.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: And he said to them all, There is one coming after me who is greater than I, whose shoes I am not good enough to undo.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: I have given you baptism with water, but he will give you baptism with the Holy Spirit.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: And it came about in those days, that Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee, and was given baptism by John in the Jordan.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: And straight away, coming up out of the water, he saw the heavens broken open and the Spirit coming down on him as a dove:

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: And a voice came out of heaven, You are my dearly loved Son, with whom I am well pleased.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: And straight away the Spirit sent him out into the waste land.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: And he was in the waste land for forty days, being tested by Satan; and he was with the beasts; and the angels took care of him.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: Now after John had been put in prison, Jesus came into Galilee, preaching the good news of God,

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: And saying, The time has come, and the kingdom of God is near: let your hearts be turned from sin and have faith in the good news.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: And going by the sea of Galilee, he saw Simon, and Andrew, the brother of Simon, putting a net into the sea: for they were fishermen.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: And Jesus said to them, Come after me, and I will make you fishers of men.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: And they went straight from their nets, and came after him.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 19
text: And going on a little farther, he saw James, the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, who were in their boat stitching up their nets.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 20
text: And he said, Come after me: and they went away from their father Zebedee, who was in the boat with the servants, and came after him.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 21
text: And they came to Capernaum; and on the Sabbath he went into the Synagogue and gave teaching.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 22
text: And they were full of wonder at his teaching, because he gave it as one having authority, and not like the scribes.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 23
text: And there was in their Synagogue a man with an unclean spirit; and he gave a cry,

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 24
text: Saying, What have we to do with you, Jesus of Nazareth? have you come to put an end to us? I see well who you are, the Holy One of God.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 25
text: And Jesus said to him sharply, Be quiet, and come out of him.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 26
text: And the unclean spirit, shaking him violently, and crying with a loud voice, came out of him.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 27
text: And they were all greatly surprised, so that they put questions to one another, saying, What is this? a new teaching! with authority he gives orders even to the unclean spirits, and they do what he says.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 28
text: And news of him went out quickly everywhere into all parts of Galilee round about.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 29
text: And when they came out of the Synagogue, they went into the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 30
text: Now Simon's wife's mother was ill, with a burning heat; and they gave him word of her:

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 31
text: And he came and took her by the hand, lifting her up; and she became well, and took care of their needs.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 32
text: And in the evening, at sundown, they took to him all who were diseased, and those who had evil spirits.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 33
text: And all the town had come together at the door.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 34
text: And a number, who were ill with different diseases, he made well, and sent out evil spirits; but he did not let the evil spirits say anything, because they had knowledge of him.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 35
text: And in the morning, a long time before daylight, he got up and went out to a quiet place, and there he gave himself up to prayer.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 36
text: And Simon and those who were with him came after him.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 37
text: And when they came up with him, they said to him, Everyone is looking for you.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 38
text: And he said to them, Let us go to other parts into the nearest towns, so that I may give teaching there, because for this purpose I came.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 39
text: And he went into their Synagogues in every part of Galilee, preaching and driving out evil spirits.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 40
text: And a leper came to him and, going down on his knees before him, made a request, saying, If it is your pleasure, you have the power to make me clean.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 41
text: And being moved with pity, he put out his hand, and touching him said to him, It is my pleasure; be made clean.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 42
text: And straight away the disease went from him, and he was made clean.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 43
text: And he sent him away, saying to him very sharply,

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 44
text: See that you say nothing to any man: but go and let the priest see you, and make yourself clean by an offering of the things ordered by Moses, for a witness to them.

title: Mark Chapter 1 Verse 45
text: But he went out, and made it public, giving an account of it everywhere, so that Jesus was no longer able to go openly into a town, but was outside in the waste land; and they came to him from every part.

title: Mark Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: And when he came into Capernaum again after some days, the news went about that he was in the house.

title: Mark Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: And a great number had come together, so that there was no longer room for them, no, not even about the door: and he gave them teaching.

title: Mark Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: And four men came to him with one on a bed who had no power of moving.

title: Mark Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: And when they were unable to get near him because of all the people, they got the roof uncovered where he was: and when it was broken up, they let down the bed on which the man was.

title: Mark Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: And Jesus, seeing their faith, said to him, Son, you have forgiveness for your sins.

title: Mark Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: But there were certain of the scribes seated there, and reasoning in their hearts,

title: Mark Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: Why does this man say such things? he has no respect for God: from whom does forgiveness come but from God only?

title: Mark Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: And Jesus, having knowledge in his spirit of their thoughts, said to them, Why are you reasoning about these things in your hearts?

title: Mark Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: Which is the simpler, to say to a man who is ill, You have forgiveness for your sins, or, Get up, take up your bed, and go?

title: Mark Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: But so that you may see that the Son of man has authority for the forgiveness of sins on earth, (he said to the man,)

title: Mark Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: I say to you, Get up, take up your bed, and go to your house.

title: Mark Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: And he got up, and straight away took up the bed and went out before them all, so that they were all full of wonder, and gave glory to God, saying, We have never seen anything like this.

title: Mark Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: And he went out again by the seaside; and all the people came to him, and he gave them teaching.

title: Mark Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: And when he went by, he saw Levi, the son of Alphaeus, seated at the place where taxes were taken, and he said to him, Come with me. And he got up, and went with him.

title: Mark Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: And it came about that he was seated at meat in his house, and a number of tax-farmers and sinners were at table with Jesus and his disciples: for there were a great number of them, and they came after him.

title: Mark Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: And the scribes of the Pharisees, when they saw that he was taking food with the tax-farmers and sinners, said to his disciples, Why does he take food and drink with such men?

title: Mark Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: And Jesus, hearing it, said to them, Those who are well have no need of a medical man, but those who are ill: I have come not to get the upright but sinners.

title: Mark Chapter 2 Verse 18
text: And John's disciples and the Pharisees were taking no food: and they came and said to him, Why do John's disciples and the disciples of the Pharisees go without food, but your disciples do not?

title: Mark Chapter 2 Verse 19
text: And Jesus said to them, Will the friends of a newly-married man go without food while he is with them? as long as they have him with them they will not go without food.

title: Mark Chapter 2 Verse 20
text: But the days will come when the husband will be taken away from them, and then they will go without food.

title: Mark Chapter 2 Verse 21
text: No man puts a bit of new cloth on an old coat: or the new, by pulling away from the old, makes a worse hole.

title: Mark Chapter 2 Verse 22
text: And no man puts new wine into old wine-skins: or the skins will be burst by the wine, and the wine and the skins will be wasted: but new wine has to be put into new wine-skins.

title: Mark Chapter 2 Verse 23
text: And it came about that on the Sabbath day he was going through the grain-fields; and while they were walking, his disciples took the heads of grain.

title: Mark Chapter 2 Verse 24
text: And the Pharisees said to him, Why are they doing what it is not right to do on the Sabbath?

title: Mark Chapter 2 Verse 25
text: And he said to them, Have you no knowledge of what David did, when he had need and was without food, he, and those who were with him?

title: Mark Chapter 2 Verse 26
text: How he went into the house of God when Abiathar was high priest, and took for food the holy bread, which only the priests may take, and gave it to those who were with him?

title: Mark Chapter 2 Verse 27
text: And he said to them, The Sabbath was made for man, and not man for the Sabbath;

title: Mark Chapter 2 Verse 28
text: So that the Son of man is lord even of the Sabbath.

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: And he went again into the Synagogue; and there was a man there whose hand was dead.

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: And they were watching him to see if he would make him well on the Sabbath day, so that they might have something against him.

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: And he said to the man, Get up and come forward.

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: And he said to them, Is it right to do good on the Sabbath or to do evil? to give life or to put to death? But they said nothing.

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: And looking round on them he was angry, being sad because of their hard hearts; and he said to the man, Put out your hand. And he put it out, and his hand was made well.

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: And the Pharisees went out, and straight away made designs with the Herodians about how they might put him to death.

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: And Jesus went away with his disciples to the sea, and a great number from Galilee came after him: and from Judaea,

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: And from Jerusalem, and from Idumaea, and the other side of Jordan, and the country about Tyre and Sidon, a great number, hearing what great things he did, came to him.

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: And he made a request to his disciples to have a little boat ready for him, so that he might not be crushed by the people;

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: For he had made such a great number well that all those who were diseased were falling down before him for the purpose of touching him.

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: And the unclean spirits, whenever they saw him, went down before him, crying out, and saying, You are the Son of God.

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: And he gave them special orders not to say who he was.

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: And he went up into the mountain, and sent for those whom it was his pleasure to have with him: and they went to him.

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: And he took twelve to be with him, so that he might send them out as preachers,

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: And give them the power of driving out evil spirits:

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: To Simon he gave the second name of Peter;

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: And to James, the son of Zebedee, and John, the brother of James, he gave the second name of Boanerges, which is, Sons of thunder:

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 18
text: And Andrew, and Philip, and Bartholomew, and Matthew, and Thomas, and James, the son of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus, and Simon the Zealot;

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 19
text: And Judas Iscariot, who was false to him.

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 20
text: And he went into a house. And the people came together again, so that they were not even able to take bread.

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 21
text: And when his friends had news of it, they went out to get him, saying, He is off his head.

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 22
text: And the scribes who came down from Jerusalem, said, He has Beelzebub, and, By the ruler of evil spirits he sends evil spirits out of men.

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 23
text: And turning to them, he said to them in the form of a story, How is it possible for Satan to put out Satan?

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 24
text: If there is division in a kingdom, that kingdom will come to destruction;

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 25
text: And if there is division in a house, that house will come to destruction;

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 26
text: And if Satan is at war with himself, and there is division in him, he will not keep his place but will come to an end.

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 27
text: But no one is able to go into the house of the strong man and take his goods, without first putting cords round the strong man, and then he will take his goods.

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 28
text: Truly, I say to you, The sons of men will have forgiveness for all their sins and for all the evil words they say:

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 29
text: But whoever says evil things against the Holy Spirit will never have forgiveness, but the evil he has done will be with him for ever:

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 30
text: Because they said, He has an unclean spirit.

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 31
text: And his mother and brothers came and were outside, and sent for him, requesting to see him.

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 32
text: And a great number were seated round him; and they said to him, See, your mother and your brothers are outside looking for you.

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 33
text: And he said in answer, Who are my mother and my brothers?

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 34
text: And looking round at those who were seated about him, he said, See, my mother and my brothers!

title: Mark Chapter 3 Verse 35
text: Whoever does God's pleasure, the same is my brother, and sister, and mother.

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: And again he was teaching by the seaside. And a very great number of people had come to him, so that he got into a boat on the sea and took his seat; and all the people were on the land by the seaside.

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: And he gave them teaching about a number of things in the form of stories, and said to them in his teaching, Give ear:

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: A man went out to put seed in the earth:

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: And while he was doing it, some was dropped by the wayside, and the birds came and took it for food.

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: And some went on the stones, where it had not much earth; and it came up straight away, because the earth was not deep:

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: And when the sun was high, it was burned; and because it had no root, it became dry and dead.

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: And some went among the thorns, and the thorns came up, and it had no room for growth and gave no fruit.

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: And some, falling on good earth, gave fruit, coming up and increasing, and giving thirty, sixty, and a hundred times as much.

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: And he said to them, Whoever has ears, let him give ear.

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: And when he was by himself, those who were round him with the twelve put questions to him about the purpose of the stories.

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: And he said to them, To you is given the secret of the kingdom of God, but to those who are outside, all things are given in the form of stories;

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: So that seeing they may see, and it will not be clear to them; and hearing it, they will not get the sense; for fear that they may be turned again to me and have forgiveness.

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: And he said to them, If you are not clear about this story, how will you be clear about the others?

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: The seed is the word.

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: And these are they by the wayside, where the word is planted; and when they have given ear, the Evil One comes straight away and takes away the word which has been planted in them.

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: And in the same way, these are they who are planted on the stones, who, when the word has come to their ears, straight away take it with joy;

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 17
text: And they have no root in themselves, but go on for a time; then, when trouble comes or pain, because of the word, they quickly become full of doubts.

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 18
text: And others are those planted among the thorns; these are they who have given ear to the word,

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 19
text: And the cares of this life, and the deceits of wealth, and the desire for other things coming in, put a stop to the growth of the word, and it gives no fruit.

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 20
text: And these are they who were planted on the good earth; such as give ear to the word, and take it into their hearts, and give fruit, thirty and sixty and a hundred times as much.

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 21
text: And he said to them, When the light comes in, do people put it under a vessel, or under the bed, and not on its table?

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 22
text: There is nothing covered which will not be seen openly, and nothing has been made secret which will not come to light.

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 23
text: If any man has ears, let him give ear.

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 24
text: And he said to them, Take care what you give ear to: in the same measure as you give you will get, and more will be given to you.

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 25
text: He who has, to him will be given: and he who has not, from him will be taken even that which he has.

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 26
text: And he said, Such is the kingdom of God, as if a man put seed in the earth,

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 27
text: And went to sleep and got up, night and day, and the seed came to growth, though he had no idea how.

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 28
text: The earth gives fruit by herself; first the leaf, then the head, then the full grain.

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 29
text: But when the grain is ready, he quickly sends men to get it cut, because the time for cutting has come.

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 30
text: And he said, What picture may we give of the kingdom of God, or with what story may we make it clear?

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 31
text: It is like a grain of mustard seed, which, when it is put in the earth, is smaller than all the seeds on the earth,

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 32
text: But when it is planted, it comes up, and becomes taller than all the plants, and puts out great branches, so that the birds of heaven are able to take rest in its shade.

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 33
text: And with a number of such stories he gave them his teaching, as they were able to take it:

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 34
text: And without a story he said nothing to them: but privately to his disciples he made all things clear.

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 35
text: And on that day, when the evening had come, he said to them, Let us go over to the other side.

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 36
text: And going away from the people, they took him with them, as he was, in the boat. And other boats were with him.

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 37
text: And a great storm of wind came up, and the waves came into the boat, so that the boat was now becoming full.

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 38
text: And he himself was in the back of the boat, sleeping on the cushion: and they, awaking him, said, Master, is it nothing to you that we are in danger of destruction?

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 39
text: And he came out of his sleep, and gave strong orders to the wind, and said to the sea, Peace, be at rest. And the wind went down, and there was a great calm.

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 40
text: And he said to them, Why are you full of fear? have you still no faith?

title: Mark Chapter 4 Verse 41
text: And their fear was great, and they said one to another, Who then is this, that even the wind and the sea do his orders?

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: And they came to the other side of the sea, into the country of the Gerasenes.

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: And when he had got out of the boat, straight away there came to him from the place of the dead a man with an unclean spirit.

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: He was living in the place of the dead: and no man was able to keep him down, no, not with a chain;

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: Because he had frequently been prisoned in chains and iron bands, and the chains had been parted and the bands broken by him: and no man was strong enough to make him quiet.

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: And all the time, by day and by night, in the place of the dead, and in the mountains, he was crying out and cutting himself with stones.

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: And when he saw Jesus from far off, he went quickly to him and gave him worship;

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: And crying out with a loud voice he said, What have I to do with you, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? In God's name, do not be cruel to me.

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: For Jesus had said to him, Come out of the man, you unclean spirit.

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: And Jesus said, What is your name? And he made answer, My name is Legion, because there are a great number of us.

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: And he made strong prayers to him not to send them away out of the country.

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: Now on the mountain side there was a great herd of pigs getting their food.

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: And they said to him, Send us into the pigs, so that we may go into them.

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: And he let them do it. And the unclean spirits came out and went into the pigs; and the herd went rushing down a sharp slope into the sea, about two thousand of them; and they came to their death in the sea.

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: And their keepers went running and gave an account of it in the town and in the country. And people came to see what had taken place.

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 15
text: And they came to Jesus, and saw the man in whom had been the evil spirits seated, clothed and with full use of his senses, and they were full of fear.

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 16
text: And those who had seen it gave them an account of what had been done to him who had the evil spirits, and of the fate of the pigs.

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 17
text: And they made a request to him to go out of their country.

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 18
text: And when he was getting into the boat, the man in whom had been the evil spirits had a great desire to come with him.

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 19
text: And he would not let him, but said to him, Go to your house, to your friends, and give them news of the great things the Lord has done for you, and how he had mercy on you.

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 20
text: And he went on his way, and made public in the country of Decapolis what great things Jesus had done for him: and all men were full of wonder.

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 21
text: And when Jesus had gone over again in the boat to the other side, a great number of people came to him: and he was by the sea.

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 22
text: And one of the rulers of the Synagogue, Jairus by name, came, and seeing him, went down at his feet,

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 23
text: And made strong prayers to him, saying, My little daughter is near to death: it is my prayer that you will come and put your hands on her, so that she may be made well, and have life.

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 24
text: And he went with him; and a great number of people went after him, and came round him.

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 25
text: And a woman, who had had a flow of blood for twelve years,

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 26
text: And had undergone much at the hands of a number of medical men, and had given all she had, and was no better, but even worse,

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 27
text: When she had news of the things which Jesus did, went among the people coming after him, and put her hand on his robe.

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 28
text: For she said, If I may only put my hand on his robe, I will be made well.

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 29
text: And straight away the fountain of her blood was stopped, and she had a feeling in her body that her disease had gone and she was well.

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 30
text: And straight away Jesus was conscious that power had gone out of him; and, turning to the people, he said, Who was touching my robe?

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 31
text: And his disciples said to him, You see the people round you on every side, and you say, Who was touching me?

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 32
text: And on his looking round to see her who had done this thing,

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 33
text: The woman, shaking with fear, conscious of what had been done to her, came and, falling on her face before him, gave him a true account of everything.

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 34
text: And he said to her, Daughter, your faith has made you well; go in peace, and be free from your disease.

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 35
text: And while he was still talking, they came from the ruler of the Synagogue's house, saying, Your daughter is dead: why are you still troubling the Master?

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 36
text: But Jesus, giving no attention to their words, said to the ruler of the Synagogue, Have no fear, only have faith.

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 37
text: And he did not let anyone come with him, but Peter and James and John, the brother of James.

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 38
text: And they came to the house of the ruler of the Synagogue; and he saw people running this way and that, and weeping and crying loudly.

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 39
text: And when he had gone in, he said to them, Why are you making such a noise and weeping? The child is not dead, but sleeping.

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 40
text: And they were laughing at him. But he, having sent them all out, took the father of the child and her mother and those who were with him, and went in where the child was.

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 41
text: And taking her by the hand, he said to her, Talitha cumi, which is, My child, I say to you, Get up.

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 42
text: And the young girl got up straight away, and was walking about; she being twelve years old. And they were overcome with wonder.

title: Mark Chapter 5 Verse 43
text: And he gave them special orders that they were not to say anything of this; and he said that some food was to be given to her.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: And he went away from there, and came into his country; and his disciples went with him.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: And when the Sabbath day had come, he was teaching in the Synagogue; and a number of people hearing him were surprised, saying, From where did this man get these things? and, What is the wisdom given to this man, and what are these works of power done by his hands?

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: Is not this the woodworker, the son of Mary, and brother of James and Joses and Judas and Simon? and are not his sisters here with us? And they were bitter against him.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: And Jesus said to them, A prophet is nowhere without honour, but in his country, and among his relations, and in his family.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: And he was unable to do any work of power there, but only to put his hands on one or two persons who were ill, and make them well.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: And he was greatly surprised because they had no faith. And he went about the country places teaching.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: And he gave orders to the twelve, and sent them out two by two; and he gave them authority over the unclean spirits;

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: And he said that they were to take nothing for their journey, but a stick only; no bread, no bag, no money in their pockets;

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: They were to go with common shoes on their feet, and not to take two coats.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: And he said to them, Wherever you go into a house, make that your resting-place till you go away.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: And whatever place will not take you in and will not give ear to you, when you go away, put off the dust from your feet as a witness against them.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 12
text: And they went out, preaching the need for a change of heart in men.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 13
text: And they sent out a number of evil spirits, and put oil on a great number who were ill, and made them well.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 14
text: And king Herod had news of him, because his name was on the lips of all; and he said, John the Baptist has come back from the dead, and for this reason these powers are working in him.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 15
text: But others said, It is Elijah. And others said, It is a prophet, even like one of the prophets.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 16
text: But Herod, when he had news of it, said, John, whom I put to death, has come back from the dead.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 17
text: For Herod himself had sent men out to take John and put him in prison, because of Herodias, his brother Philip's wife, whom he had taken for himself.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 18
text: For John said to Herod, It is wrong for you to have your brother's wife.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 19
text: And Herodias was bitter against him, desiring to put him to death; but she was not able;

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 20
text: For Herod was in fear of John, being conscious that he was an upright and holy man, and kept him safe. And hearing him, he was much troubled; and he gave ear to him gladly.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 21
text: And the chance came when Herod on his birthday gave a feast to his lords, and the high captains, and the chief men of Galilee;

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 22
text: And when the daughter of Herodias herself came in and did a dance, Herod and those who were at table with him were pleased with her; and the king said to the girl, Make a request for anything and I will give it you.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 23
text: And he took an oath, saying to her, Whatever is your desire I will give it to you, even half of my kingdom.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 24
text: And she went out and said to her mother, What is my request to be? And she said, The head of John the Baptist.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 25
text: And she came in quickly to the king, and said, My desire is that you give me straight away on a plate the head of John the Baptist.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 26
text: And the king was very sad; but because of his oaths, and those who were with him at table, he would not say 'No' to her.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 27
text: And straight away the king sent out one of his armed men, and gave him an order to come back with the head: and he went and took off John's head in prison,

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 28
text: And came back with the head on a plate, and gave it to the girl; and the girl gave it to her mother.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 29
text: And when his disciples had news of it, they came and took up his body, and put it in its last resting-place.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 30
text: And the twelve came together to Jesus; and they gave him an account of all the things they had done, and all they had been teaching.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 31
text: And he said to them, Come away by yourselves to a quiet place, and take a rest for a time. Because there were a great number coming and going, and they had no time even for food.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 32
text: And they went away in the boat to a waste place by themselves.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 33
text: And the people saw them going, and a number of them, having knowledge who they were, went running there together on foot from all the towns, and got there before them.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 34
text: And he got out, and saw a great mass of people, and he had pity on them, because they were like sheep without a keeper: and he gave them teaching about a number of things.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 35
text: And at the end of the day, his disciples came to him and said, This place is waste land, and it is late:

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 36
text: Send them away, so that they may go into the country and small towns round about, and get some food for themselves.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 37
text: But he said to them in answer, Give them food yourselves. And they said to him, Are we to go and get bread for two hundred pence, and give it to them?

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 38
text: And he said to them, How much bread have you? go and see. And when they had seen, they said, Five cakes of bread and two fishes.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 39
text: And he made them all be seated in groups on the green grass.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 40
text: And they were placed in groups, by hundreds and by fifties.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 41
text: And he took the five cakes of bread and the two fishes and, looking up to heaven, he said words of blessing over them; and when the cakes were broken, he gave them to the disciples to put before the people; and he made division of the two fishes among them all.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 42
text: And they all took of the food and had enough.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 43
text: And they took up twelve baskets full of the broken bits and of the fishes.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 44
text: And those who took of the bread were five thousand men.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 45
text: And straight away he made his disciples get into the boat, and go before him to the other side to Beth-saida, while he himself sent the people away.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 46
text: And after he had sent them away, he went up into a mountain for prayer.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 47
text: And by evening, the boat was in the middle of the sea, and he by himself on the land.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 48
text: And seeing that they had trouble in getting their boat through the water, because the wind was against them, about the fourth watch of the night he came to them, walking on the sea; and he would have gone past them;

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 49
text: But they, when they saw him walking on the sea, took him for a spirit, and gave a loud cry:

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 50
text: For they all saw him, and were troubled. But straight away he said to them, Take heart, it is I, have no fear.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 51
text: And he went to them into the boat, and the wind went down, and they were full of wonder in themselves;

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 52
text: For it was not clear to them about the bread; but their hearts were hard.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 53
text: And when they had gone across, they came to Gennesaret, and got their boat to land.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 54
text: And when they had got out of the boat, the people quickly had news of him,

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 55
text: And went running through all the country round about, and took on their beds those who were ill, to where it was said that he was.

title: Mark Chapter 6 Verse 56
text: And wherever he went, into small towns, or great towns, or into the country, they took those who were ill into the market-places, requesting him that they might put their hands even on the edge of his robe: and all those who did so were made well.

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: And there came together to him the Pharisees and certain of the scribes who had come from Jerusalem,

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: And had seen that some of his disciples took their bread with unclean, that is, unwashed, hands.

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: Now the Pharisees, and all the Jews, do not take food without washing their hands with care, keeping the old rule which has been handed down to them:

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: And when they come from the market-place, they take no food till their hands are washed; and a number of other orders there are, which have been handed down to them to keep--washings of cups and pots and brass vessels.

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: And the Pharisees and the scribes put the question to him, Why do your disciples not keep the rules of the fathers, but take their bread with unwashed hands?

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: And he said, Well did Isaiah say of you, you false ones: These people give me honour with their lips, but their heart is far from me.

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: But their worship is to no purpose, while they give as their teaching the rules of men.

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: For, turning away from the law of God, you keep the rules of men.

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 9
text: And he said to them, Truly you put on one side the law of God, so that you may keep the rules which have been handed down to you.

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 10
text: For Moses said, Give honour to your father and mother, and, He who says evil of father or mother, let him have the punishment of death:

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 11
text: But you say, If a man says to his father or his mother, That by which you might have had profit from me is Corban, that is to say, Given to God,

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 12
text: You no longer let him do anything for his father or his mother;

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 13
text: Making the word of God of no effect by your rule, which you have given: and a number of other such things you do.

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 14
text: And turning to the people again, he said to them, Give ear to me all of you, and let my words be clear to you:

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 15
text: There is nothing outside the man which, going into him, is able to make him unclean: but the things which come out of the man are those which make the man unclean.

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 17
text: And when he had gone into the house away from all the people, his disciples put questions to him about the saying.

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 18
text: And he said to them, Have even you so little wisdom? Do you not see that whatever goes into a man from outside is not able to make him unclean,

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 19
text: Because it goes not into the heart but into the stomach, and goes out with the waste? He said this, making all food clean.

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 20
text: And he said, That which comes out of the man, that makes the man unclean.

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 21
text: Because from inside, from the heart of men, come evil thoughts and unclean pleasures,

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 22
text: The taking of goods and of life, broken faith between husband and wife, the desire of wealth, wrongdoing, deceit, sins of the flesh, an evil eye, angry words, pride, foolish acts:

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 23
text: All these evil things come from inside, and make the man unclean.

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 24
text: And he went away from there to the country of Tyre and Sidon. And he went into a house, desiring that no man might have knowledge of it: and he was not able to keep it secret.

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 25
text: But a woman, whose little daughter had an unclean spirit, having had news of him, came straight away and went down at his feet.

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 26
text: Now the woman was a Greek, a Syro-phoenician by birth: and she made a request to him that he would send the evil spirit out of her daughter.

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 27
text: And he said to her, Let the children first have their food: for it is not right to take the children's bread and give it to the dogs.

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 28
text: But she said to him in answer, Yes, Lord: even the dogs under the table take the bits dropped by the children.

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 29
text: And he said to her, For this saying go your way; the evil spirit has gone out of your daughter.

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 30
text: And she went away to her house, and saw the child on the bed, and the evil spirit gone out.

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 31
text: And again he went out from Tyre, and came through Sidon to the sea of Galilee, through the country of Decapolis.

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 32
text: And they came to him with one who had no power of hearing and had trouble in talking; and they made a request to him to put his hands on him.

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 33
text: And he took him on one side from the people privately, and put his fingers into his ears, and he put water from his mouth on the man's tongue with his finger;

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 34
text: And looking up to heaven, he took a deep breath, and said to him, Ephphatha, that is, Be open.

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 35
text: And his ears became open, and the band of his tongue was made loose, and his words became clear.

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 36
text: And he gave them orders not to give news of it to anyone; but the more he made this request, so much the more they made it public.

title: Mark Chapter 7 Verse 37
text: And they were overcome with wonder, saying, He has done all things well: he even gives back the power of hearing and the power of talking to those who have been without them.

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 1
text: In those days again, when there was a great mass of people and they had no food, he made his disciples come to him and said to them,

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 2
text: I have pity for these people because they have been with me now three days, and have no food;

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 3
text: If I send them away to their houses with no food, they will be overcome by weariness on the way; and some of them have come from far.

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 4
text: And his disciples said in answer, How will it be possible to get enough bread for these men here in a waste place?

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 5
text: And he put the question, How much bread have you? And they said, Seven cakes.

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 6
text: And he made the people be seated on the earth: and he took the seven cakes and, having given praise, he gave the broken bread to his disciples to put before them; and they put it before the people.

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 7
text: And they had some small fishes; and blessing them he had them put before the people in the same way.

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 8
text: And they took the food, and had enough; and they took up seven baskets full of the broken bits.

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 9
text: And there were about four thousand people: and he sent them away.

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 10
text: And he got into the boat with his disciples straight away, and came into the country of Dalmanutha.

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 11
text: And the Pharisees came out and put questions to him, requesting from him a sign from heaven, testing him.

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 12
text: And he was very sad in spirit, and said, Why is this generation looking for a sign? truly, I say to you, No sign will be given to this generation.

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 13
text: And he went away from them, and again got into the boat and went across to the other side.

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 14
text: And they had taken no thought to get bread; and they had only one cake of bread with them in the boat.

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 15
text: And he said to them, Take care to be on the watch against the leaven of the Pharisees and the leaven of Herod.

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 16
text: And they said to one another, We have no bread.

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 17
text: And Jesus, hearing it, said to them, Why are you reasoning among yourselves because you have no bread? do you still not see, and is it still not clear to you? are your hearts so hard?

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 18
text: Having eyes, do you not see? and having ears, have you no hearing? and have you no memory?

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 19
text: When I made a division of the five cakes of bread among the five thousand, what number of baskets full of broken bits did you take up? They said to him, Twelve.

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 20
text: And when the seven among the four thousand, what number of baskets full of broken bits did you take up? And they said to him, Seven.

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 21
text: And he said to them, Is it still not clear to you?

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 22
text: And they came to Beth-saida. And they took a blind man to him, requesting him to put his hands on him.

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 23
text: And he took the blind man by the hand, and went with him out of the town; and when he had put water from his mouth on his eyes, and put his hands on him, he said, Do you see anything?

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 24
text: And looking up, he said, I see men; I see them like trees, walking.

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 25
text: Then again he put his hands on his eyes; and looking hard, he was able to see, and saw all things clearly.

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 26
text: And he sent him away to his house, saying, Do not even go into the town.

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 27
text: And Jesus went out, with his disciples, into the little towns round Caesarea Philippi; and on the way he put a question to his disciples, saying, Who do men say that I am?

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 28
text: And they made answer, John the Baptist; and others, Elijah; but others, One of the prophets.

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 29
text: And he said to them, But who do you say I am? Peter said in answer, You are the Christ.

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 30
text: And he put them under orders not to say this of him to anyone.

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 31
text: And teaching them, he said that the Son of man would have to undergo much, and be hated by those in authority, and the chief priests, and the scribes, and be put to death, and after three days come back from the dead.

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 32
text: And he said this openly. And Peter took him, and was protesting.

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 33
text: But he, turning about, and seeing his disciples, said sharply to Peter, Get out of my way, Satan: for your mind is not on the things of God, but on the things of men.

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 34
text: And turning to the mass of people with his disciples, he said to them, If any man has the desire to come after me, let him give up all other desires, and take up his cross and come after me.

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 35
text: Whoever has a desire to keep his life, will have it taken from him; and whoever gives up his life because of me and the good news, will keep it.

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 36
text: What profit has a man if he gets all the world with the loss of his life?

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 37
text: And what would a man give in exchange for his life?

title: Mark Chapter 8 Verse 38
text: Whoever has a feeling of shame because of me and my words in this false and evil generation, the Son of man will have a feeling of shame because of him, when he comes in the glory of his Father with the holy angels.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 1
text: And he said to them, Truly I say to you, There are some here who will have no taste of death till they see the kingdom of God come with power.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 2
text: And after six days Jesus took with him Peter and James and John, and made them go up with him into a high mountain by themselves: and he was changed in form before them:

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 3
text: And his clothing became shining, very white, as no cleaner on earth would make it.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 4
text: And there came before them Elijah with Moses, and they were talking with Jesus.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 5
text: And Peter said to Jesus, Master, it is good for us to be here: and let us make three tents; one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 6
text: Because he was not certain what to say, for they were in great fear.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 7
text: And a cloud came over them; and a voice came out of the cloud, saying, This is my dearly loved Son, give ear to him.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 8
text: And suddenly looking round about, they saw no one any longer, but Jesus only with themselves.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 9
text: And while they were coming down from the mountain, he gave them orders not to give word to any man of the things they had seen, till the Son of man had come back from the dead.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 10
text: And they kept the saying, questioning among themselves what the coming back from the dead might be.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 11
text: And they put a question to him, saying, Why do the scribes say that Elijah has to come first?

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 12
text: And he said to them, Truly, Elijah does come first, and puts all things in order; and how is it said in the Writings that the Son of man will go through much sorrow and be made as nothing?

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 13
text: But I say to you that Elijah has come, and they have done to him whatever they were pleased to do, even as the Writings say about him.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 14
text: And when they came to the disciples, they saw a great mass of people about them, and scribes questioning them.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 15
text: And straight away all the people, when they saw him, were full of wonder, and running to him, gave him worship.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 16
text: And he said, What are you questioning them about?

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 17
text: And one of the number said to him in answer, Master, I came to you with my son, who has in him a spirit which takes away his power of talking;

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 18
text: And wherever it takes him, it puts him down violently, streaming at the lips and twisted with pain; and his strength goes from him; and I made a request to your disciples to send it out, and they were not able.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 19
text: And he said to them in answer, O generation without faith, how long will I have to be with you? how long will I put up with you? let him come to me.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 20
text: And they took him to him: and when he saw him, the spirit in him straight away became violent; and he went down on the earth, rolling about and streaming at the lips.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 21
text: And Jesus questioning the father said, How long has he been like this? And he said, From a child.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 22
text: And frequently it has sent him into the fire and into the water, for his destruction; but if you are able to do anything, have pity on us, and give us help.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 23
text: And Jesus said to him, If you are able! All things are possible to him who has faith.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 24
text: Straight away the father of the child gave a cry, saying, I have faith; make my feeble faith stronger.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 25
text: And when Jesus saw that the people came running together, he gave orders to the unclean spirit, saying to him, You, spirit, who are the cause of his loss of voice and hearing, I say to you, come out of him, and never again go into him.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 26
text: And after crying out and shaking him violently, it came out: and the child became like one dead; so that most of them said, He is dead.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 27
text: But Jesus took him by the hand, lifting him up; and he got up.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 28
text: And when he had gone into the house, his disciples said to him privately, Why were we unable to send it out?

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 29
text: And he said to them, Nothing will make this sort come out but prayer.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 30
text: And they went out from there, through Galilee; and it was his desire that no man might have knowledge of it;

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 31
text: For he was giving his disciples teaching, and saying to them, The Son of man is given up into the hands of men, and they will put him to death; and when he is dead, after three days he will come back from the dead.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 32
text: But the saying was not clear to them, and they were in fear of questioning him about it.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 33
text: And they came to Capernaum: and when he was in the house, he put the question to them, What were you talking about on the way?

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 34
text: But they said nothing: because they had had an argument between themselves on the way, about who was the greatest.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 35
text: And seating himself, he made the twelve come to him; and he said to them, If any man has the desire to be first, he will be last of all and servant of all.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 36
text: And he took a little child, and put him in the middle of them; and taking him in his arms, he said to them,

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 37
text: Whoever will give honour to one such little child in my name, gives honour to me: and whoever gives honour to me, gives honour not to me, but to him who sent me.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 38
text: John said to him, Master, we saw one driving out evil spirits in your name: and we said that he might not, because he is not one of us.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 39
text: But Jesus said, Say not so: for there is no man who will do a great work in my name, and be able at the same time to say evil of me.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 40
text: He who is not against us is for us.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 41
text: Whoever gives you a cup of water, because you are Christ's, truly I say to you, he will in no way be without his reward.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 42
text: And whoever is a cause of trouble to one of these little ones who have faith in me, it would be better for him if a great stone was put round his neck and he was dropped into the sea.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 43
text: And if your hand is a cause of trouble to you, let it be cut off; it is better for you to go into life with one hand than to have two hands and go into hell, into the eternal fire.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 45
text: And if your foot is a cause of trouble to you, let it be cut off: it is better for you to go into life with one foot than to have two feet and go into hell.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 47
text: And if your eye is a cause of trouble to you, take it out: it is better for you to go into the kingdom of God with one eye than, having two eyes, to go into hell,

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 48
text: Where their worm is ever living and the fire is not put out.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 49
text: Everyone will be salted with fire.

title: Mark Chapter 9 Verse 50
text: Salt is good; but if the taste goes from it, how will you make it salt again? Have salt in yourselves, and be at peace one with another.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 1
text: And he got up, and went into the country of Judaea on the other side of Jordan: and great numbers of people came together to him again; and, as was his way, he gave them teaching.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 2
text: And Pharisees came to him, testing him with the question, Is it right for a man to put away his wife?

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 3
text: And he said to them in answer, What did Moses say you were to do?

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 4
text: And they said to him, Moses let us give her a statement in writing, and be free from her.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 5
text: But Jesus said to them, Because of your hard hearts he gave you this law.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 6
text: But from the first, male and female made he them.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 7
text: For this cause will a man go away from his father and mother, and be joined to his wife;

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 8
text: And the two will become one flesh; so that they are no longer two, but one flesh.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 9
text: Let not that which has been joined together by God be parted by man.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 10
text: And in the house the disciples put questions to him again about this thing.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 11
text: And he said to them, Whoever puts away his wife and takes another, is false to his wife;

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 12
text: And if she herself puts away her husband and takes another, she is false to her husband.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 13
text: And they took to him little children, so that he might put his hands on them: and the disciples said sharp words to them.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 14
text: And when Jesus saw it, he was angry, and said to them, Let the little children come to me, and do not keep them away; for of such is the kingdom of God.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 15
text: Truly I say to you, Whoever does not put himself under the kingdom of God like a little child, will not come into it at all.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 16
text: And he took them in his arms, and gave them a blessing, putting his hands on them.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 17
text: And while he was going out into the way, a man came running to him, and went down on his knees, saying, Good Master, what have I to do so that I may have eternal life?

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 18
text: And Jesus said to him, Why do you say I am good? no one is good but one, and that is God.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 19
text: You have knowledge of what is said in the law, Do not put any one to death, Do not be untrue in married life, Do not take what is not yours, Do not give false witness, Do not get money by deceit, Give honour to your father and mother.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 20
text: And he said to him, Master, all these laws I have kept from the time when I was young.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 21
text: And Jesus, looking on him and loving him, said, There is one thing needed: go, get money for your goods, and give it to the poor, and you will have wealth in heaven: and come with me.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 22
text: But his face became sad at the saying, and he went away sorrowing: for he was one who had much property.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 23
text: And Jesus, looking round about, said to his disciples, How hard it is for those who have wealth to come into the kingdom of God!

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 24
text: And the disciples were full of wonder at his words. But Jesus said to them again, Children, how hard it is for those who put faith in wealth to come into the kingdom of God!

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 25
text: It is simpler for a camel to go through a needle's eye, than for a man of wealth to come into the kingdom of God.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 26
text: And they were greatly surprised, saying to him, Who then may have salvation?

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 27
text: Jesus, looking on them, said, With men it is impossible, but not with God: for all things are possible with God.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 28
text: Peter said to him, See, we have given up everything, and come after you.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 29
text: Jesus said, Truly I say to you, There is no man who has given up house, or brothers, or sisters, or mother, or father, or children, or land, because of me and the good news,

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 30
text: Who will not get a hundred times as much now in this time, houses, and brothers, and sisters, and mothers, and children, and land--though with great troubles; and, in the world to come, eternal life.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 31
text: But a great number who are first will be last: and those who are last will be first.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 32
text: And they were on the way, going up to Jerusalem; and Jesus was going before them: and they were full of wonder; but those who came after him were in fear. And again he took the twelve, and gave them word of the things which were to come on him,

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 33
text: Saying, See, we go up to Jerusalem; and the Son of man will be given up to the chief priests and the scribes; and they will give an order for his death, and will give him up to the Gentiles:

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 34
text: And they will make sport of him, and put shame on him, and give him cruel blows, and will put him to death; and after three days he will come back from the dead.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 35
text: And there came to him James and John, the sons of Zebedee, saying to him, Master, will you give us whatever may be our request?

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 36
text: And he said to them, What would you have me do for you?

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 37
text: And they said to him, Let us be seated, one at your right hand and one at your left, in your glory.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 38
text: But Jesus said to them, You have no knowledge of what you are saying. Are you able to take of my cup? or to undergo the baptism which I am to undergo?

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 39
text: And they said to him, We are able. And Jesus said to them, You will take of the cup from which I take; and the baptism which I am about to undergo you will undergo:

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 40
text: But to be seated at my right hand or at my left is not for me to give: but it is for those for whom it has been made ready.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 41
text: And hearing this, the ten became very angry with James and John.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 42
text: And Jesus made them come to him, and said to them, You see that those who are made rulers over the Gentiles are lords over them, and their great ones have authority over them.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 43
text: But it is not so among you: but whoever has a desire to become great among you, let him be your servant:

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 44
text: And whoever has a desire to be first among you, let him be servant of all.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 45
text: For truly the Son of man did not come to have servants, but to be a servant, and to give his life for the salvation of men.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 46
text: And they came to Jericho: and when he was going out of Jericho, with his disciples and a great number of people, the son of Timaeus, Bartimaeus, a blind man, was seated by the wayside, with his hand out for money.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 47
text: And when it came to his ears that it was Jesus of Nazareth, he gave a cry, and said, Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 48
text: And some of them, turning in protest, gave him an order to be quiet: but he went on crying out all the more, Son of David, have mercy on me.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 49
text: And Jesus came to a stop and said, Let him come. And crying out to the blind man, they said to him, Be comforted: come, he has sent for you.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 50
text: And he, putting off his coat, got up quickly, and came to Jesus.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 51
text: And Jesus said to him, What would you have me do to you? And the blind man said, Master, make me able to see.

title: Mark Chapter 10 Verse 52
text: And Jesus said to him, Go on your way; your faith has made you well. And straight away he was able to see, and went after him in the way.

title: Mark Chapter 11 Verse 1
text: And when they came near to Jerusalem, to Beth-phage and Bethany, at the Mountain of Olives, he sent two of his disciples,

title: Mark Chapter 11 Verse 2
text: And said to them, Go into the little town opposite: and when you come to it, you will see a young ass with a cord round his neck, on which no man has ever been seated; let him loose, and come back with him.

title: Mark Chapter 11 Verse 3
text: And if anyone says to you, Why are you doing this? say, The Lord has need of him and will send him back straight away.

title: Mark Chapter 11 Verse 4
text: And they went away and saw a young ass by the door outside in the open street; and they were getting him loose.

title: Mark Chapter 11 Verse 5
text: And some of those who were there said to them, What are you doing, taking the ass?

title: Mark Chapter 11 Verse 6
text: And they said to them the words which Jesus had said; and they let them go.

title: Mark Chapter 11 Verse 7
text: And they took the young ass to Jesus, and put their clothing on him, and he got on his back.

title: Mark Chapter 11 Verse 8
text: And a great number put down their clothing in the way; and others put down branches which they had taken from the fields.

title: Mark Chapter 11 Verse 9
text: And those who went in front, and those who came after, were crying, Glory: A blessing on him who comes in the name of the Lord:

title: Mark Chapter 11 Verse 10
text: A blessing on the coming kingdom of our father David: Glory in the highest.

title: Mark Chapter 11 Verse 11
text: And he went into Jerusalem into the Temple; and after looking round about on all things, it being now evening, he went out to Bethany with the twelve.

title: Mark Chapter 11 Verse 12
text: And on the day after, when they had come out from Bethany, he was in need of food.

title: Mark Chapter 11 Verse 13
text: And seeing a fig-tree in the distance with leaves, he went to see if by chance it had anything on it: and when he came to it, he saw nothing but leaves, for it was not the time for the fruit.

title: Mark Chapter 11 Verse 14
text: And he said to it, Let no man take fruit from you for ever. And his disciples took note of his words.

title: Mark Chapter 11 Verse 15
text: And they came to Jerusalem; and he went into the Temple, and sent out those who were trading there, overturning the tables of the money-changers and the seats of those who were offering doves for money;

title: Mark Chapter 11 Verse 16
text: And he would not let any man take a vessel through the Temple.

title: Mark Chapter 11 Verse 17
text: And he gave them teaching, and said to them, Is it not in the Writings, My house is to be named a house of prayer for all the nations? but you have made it a hole of thieves.

title: Mark Chapter 11 Verse 18
text: And it came to the ears of the chief priests and scribes, and they took thought how they might put him to death; being in fear of him, because all the people were full of wonder at his teaching.

title: Mark Chapter 11 Verse 19
text: And every evening he went out of the town.

title: Mark Chapter 11 Verse 20
text: And when they were going by in the morning, they saw the fig-tree dead from the roots.

title: Mark Chapter 11 Verse 21
text: And Peter, having a memory of it, said to him, Master, see, the tree which was cursed by you is dead.

title: Mark Chapter 11 Verse 22
text: And Jesus, answering, said to them, Have God's faith.

title: Mark Chapter 11 Verse 23
text: Truly I say to you, Whoever says to this mountain, Be taken up and be put into the sea; and has no doubt in his heart, but has faith that what he says will come about, he will have his desire.

title: Mark Chapter 11 Verse 24
text: For this reason I say to you, Whatever you make a request for in prayer, have faith that it has been given to you, and you will have it.

title: Mark Chapter 11 Verse 25
text: And whenever you make a prayer, let there be forgiveness in your hearts, if you have anything against anyone; so that you may have forgiveness for your sins from your Father who is in heaven.

title: Mark Chapter 11 Verse 27
text: And they came again to Jerusalem: and while he was walking in the Temple, there came to him the chief priests and the scribes and those in authority:

title: Mark Chapter 11 Verse 28
text: And they said to him, By what authority do you do these things? or who gave you authority to do these things?

title: Mark Chapter 11 Verse 29
text: And Jesus said to them, I will put to you one question; give me an answer, and I will say by what authority I do these things.

title: Mark Chapter 11 Verse 30
text: The baptism of John, was it from heaven or from men? give me an answer.

title: Mark Chapter 11 Verse 31
text: And they gave thought to it among themselves, saying, If we say, From heaven; he will say, Why then did you not have faith in him?

title: Mark Chapter 11 Verse 32
text: But if we say, From men--they were in fear of the people, because all took John to be truly a prophet.

title: Mark Chapter 11 Verse 33
text: And they said in answer to Jesus, We have no idea. And Jesus said to them, And I will not say to you by what authority I do these things.

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 1
text: And he gave them teaching in the form of stories. A man had a vine-garden planted, and put a wall about it, and made a place for crushing out the wine, and put up a tower, and let it out to field-workers, and went into another country.

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 2
text: And when the time came, he sent a servant to get from the workmen some of the fruit of the garden.

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 3
text: And they took him, and gave him blows, and sent him away with nothing.

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 4
text: And again he sent to them another servant; and they gave him wounds on the head, and were very cruel to him.

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 5
text: And he sent another; and they put him to death: and a number of others, whipping some, and putting some to death.

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 6
text: He still had one, a dearly loved son: he sent him last to them, saying, They will have respect for my son.

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 7
text: But those workmen said among themselves, This is he who will one day be the owner of the property; come, let us put him to death, and the heritage will be ours.

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 8
text: And they took him and put him to death, pushing his body out of the garden.

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 9
text: What then will the master of the garden do? He will come and put the workmen to death, and will give the garden into the hands of others.

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 10
text: Have you not seen this which is in the Writings: The stone which the builders put on one side, the same was made the chief stone of the building:

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 11
text: This was the Lord's doing, and it is a wonder in our eyes?

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 12
text: And they made attempts to take him; but they were in fear of the people, because they saw that the story was against them; and they went away from him.

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 13
text: Then they sent to him certain of the Pharisees and the Herodians, so that they might make use of his words to take him by a trick.

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 14
text: And when they had come, they said to him, Master, we are certain that you are true, and have no fear of anyone: you have no respect for a man's position, but you are teaching the true way of God: Is it right to give taxes to Caesar or not?

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 15
text: Are we to give or not to give? But he, conscious of their false hearts, said to them, Why do you put me to the test? give me a penny, so that I may see it.

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 16
text: And they gave him one. And he said to them, Whose is this image and name on it? And they said to him, Caesar's.

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 17
text: And Jesus said to them, Give to Caesar the things which are Caesar's, and to God the things which are God's. And they were full of wonder at him.

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 18
text: And there came to him Sadducees, who say there is no coming back from the dead; and they put a question to him, saying,

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 19
text: Master, in the law Moses says, If a man's brother comes to his end, and has a wife still living and no child, it is right for his brother to take his wife, and get a family for his brother.

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 20
text: There were seven brothers: and the first took a wife, and at his death there were no offspring;

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 21
text: And the second took her, and at his death there were no offspring; and the third the same:

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 22
text: And all the seven had no seed. Last of all the woman herself came to her death.

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 23
text: In the future life, when they come back from the dead, whose wife will she be? for the seven had her for a wife.

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 24
text: Jesus said to them, Is not this the reason for your error, that you have no knowledge of the holy Writings or of the power of God?

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 25
text: When they come back from the dead, they do not get married, but are like the angels in heaven.

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 26
text: But as to the dead coming back to life; have you not seen in the book of Moses, about the burning thorn-tree, how God said to him, I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob?

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 27
text: He is not the God of the dead, but of the living: you are greatly in error.

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 28
text: And one of the scribes came, and hearing their argument together, and seeing that he had given them a good answer, put the question to him, Which law is the first of all?

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 29
text: Jesus said in answer, The first is, Give ear, O Israel: The Lord our God is one Lord;

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 30
text: And you are to have love for the Lord your God with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your mind, and with all your strength.

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 31
text: The second is this, Have love for your neighbour as for yourself. There is no other law greater than these.

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 32
text: And the scribe said to him, Truly, Master, you have well said that he is one, and there is no other but he:

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 33
text: And to have love for him with all the heart, and with all the mind, and with all the strength, and to have the same love for his neighbour as for himself, is much more than all forms of offerings.

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 34
text: And when Jesus saw that he gave a wise answer, he said to him, You are not far from the kingdom of God. And every man after that was in fear of questioning him any more.

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 35
text: And Jesus, when he was teaching in the Temple, said, How do the scribes say that the Christ is the Son of David?

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 36
text: David himself said in the Holy Spirit, The Lord said to my Lord, Be seated at my right hand, till I put those who are against you under your feet.

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 37
text: David himself gives him the name of Lord; and how then is he his son? And the common people gave ear to him gladly.

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 38
text: And in his teaching he said, Be on your watch against the scribes, whose pleasure it is to go about in long robes and be respected in the market-places,

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 39
text: And to have the chief seats in the Synagogues and the first places at feasts;

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 40
text: Who take away the property of widows, and before the eyes of men make long prayers; these will be judged more hardly.

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 41
text: And he took a seat by the place where the money was kept, and saw how the people put money into the boxes: and a number who had wealth put in much.

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 42
text: And there came a poor widow, and she put in two little bits of money, which make a farthing.

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 43
text: And he made his disciples come to him, and said to them, Truly I say to you, This poor widow has put in more than all those who are putting money into the box:

title: Mark Chapter 12 Verse 44
text: Because they all put in something out of what they had no need for; but she out of her need put in all she had, even all her living.

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 1
text: And when he was going out of the Temple, one of his disciples said to him, Master, see, what stones and what buildings!

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 2
