text: And Jesus said to him, Do you see these great buildings? there is not one stone here resting on another which will not be overturned.

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 3
text: And while he was seated on the Mountain of Olives opposite the Temple, Peter and James and John and Andrew said to him privately,

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 4
text: Say when these things will be, and what will be the sign when these things are all about to be done.

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 5
text: And Jesus said to them, Take care that you are not tricked by anyone.

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 6
text: People will come in my name, saying, I am he; and a number will be turned from the true way.

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 7
text: And when you have news of wars and talk of wars, do not be troubled; these things have to be, but it is still not the end.

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 8
text: Nation will go to war with nation, and kingdom with kingdom: there will be earth-shocks in different places; there will be times when there is no food; these things are the first of the troubles.

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 9
text: But take care: for they will give you up to the Sanhedrins; and in Synagogues you will be whipped; and you will be taken before rulers and kings because of me, for a sign to them.

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 10
text: And the good news has first to be given to all the nations.

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 11
text: And when you are taken and given up to be judged, do not be troubled about what to say: but whatever is given to you in that hour, say: because it is not you who say it, but the Holy Spirit.

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 12
text: And brother will give up brother to death, and the father his child; and children will go against their fathers and mothers, and put them to death.

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 13
text: And you will be hated by all men, because of my name; but he who goes through to the end will have salvation.

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 14
text: But when you see the unclean thing which makes destruction, in the place where it has no right to be (let this be clear to the reader), then let those who are in Judaea go quickly to the mountains:

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 15
text: And let him who is on the house-top not go down, or go in, to take anything out of his house:

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 16
text: And let not him who is in the field go back to take his coat.

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 17
text: And it will be hard for women who are with child and for her who has a baby at the breast in those days.

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 18
text: And say a prayer that it may not be in the winter.

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 19
text: For in those days there will be sorrow, such as there has not been from the time when God made the world till now, and will not ever be again.

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 20
text: And if the Lord had not made the time short, no flesh would have been kept from destruction; but because of the saints he has made the time short.

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 21
text: And then if any man says to you, See, here is Christ; or, See, there; have no faith in it:

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 22
text: Because there will be false Christs and false prophets, and they will give signs and wonders in the hope of turning even the saints from the true way.

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 23
text: But take care; see, I have made all things clear to you before the time.

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 24
text: But in those days, after that time of trouble, the sun will be made dark and the moon will not give her light,

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 25
text: And the stars will be falling from heaven, and the powers which are in the heavens will be moved.

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 26
text: And then they will see the Son of man coming in clouds with great power and glory.

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 27
text: And then he will send out the angels, and will get together his saints from the four winds, from the farthest part of the earth to the farthest part of heaven.

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 28
text: Take an example from the fig-tree: when its branches become soft and put out their leaves, you see that the summer is near;

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 29
text: Even so, when you see these things taking place, you may be certain that he is near, even at the doors.

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 30
text: Truly, I say to you, This generation will not come to an end till all these things are complete.

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 31
text: Heaven and earth will come to an end, but my words will not come to an end.

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 32
text: But of that day or that hour no one has knowledge, not even the angels in heaven, or the Son, but the Father.

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 33
text: Take care, keep watch with prayer: for you are not certain when the time will be.

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 34
text: It is as when a man who is in another country for a time, having gone away from his house, and given authority to his servants and to everyone his work, gives the porter an order to keep watch.

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 35
text: So you are to keep watch: because you are not certain when the master of the house is coming, in the evening, or in the middle of the night, or at the cock's cry, or in the morning;

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 36
text: For fear that, coming suddenly, he sees you sleeping.

title: Mark Chapter 13 Verse 37
text: And what I say to you, I say to all, Keep watch.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 1
text: It was now two days before the feast of the Passover and the unleavened bread: and the chief priests and the scribes made designs how they might take him by deceit and put him to death:

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 2
text: But they said, Not while the feast is going on, for fear there may be trouble among the people.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 3
text: And while he was in Bethany in the house of Simon the leper, seated at table, there came a woman with a bottle of perfumed oil of great price; and when the bottle was broken she put the perfume on his head.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 4
text: But some of them were angry among themselves, saying, For what purpose has this oil been wasted?

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 5
text: We might have got more than three hundred pence for it, and given the money to the poor. And they said things against her among themselves.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 6
text: But Jesus said, Let her be; why are you troubling her? she has done a kind act to me.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 7
text: The poor you have ever with you, and whenever you have the desire you may do them good: but me you have not for ever.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 8
text: She has done what she was able: she has put oil on my body to make it ready for its last resting-place.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 9
text: And truly I say to you, Wherever the good news goes out through all the earth, what this woman has done will be talked of in memory of her.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 10
text: And Judas Iscariot, who was one of the twelve, went away to the chief priests, so that he might give him up to them.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 11
text: And hearing what he said, they were glad, and gave him their word to make him a payment of money. And he took thought how he might best give him up to them.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 12
text: And on the first day of unleavened bread, when the Passover lamb is put to death, his disciples said to him, Where are we to go and make ready for you to take the Passover meal?

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 13
text: And he sent two of his disciples, and said to them, Go into the town, and there will come to you a man with a vessel of water: go after him;

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 14
text: And wherever he goes in, say to the owner of the house, The Master says, Where is my guest-room, where I may take the Passover with my disciples?

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 15
text: And he will take you up himself to a great room with a table and seats: there make ready for us.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 16
text: And the disciples went out and came into the town, and saw that it was as he had said: and they made ready the Passover.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 17
text: And when it was evening he came with the twelve.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 18
text: And while they were seated taking food, Jesus said, Truly I say to you, One of you will be false to me, one who is taking food with me.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 19
text: They were sad, and said to him one by one, Is it I?

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 20
text: And he said to them, It is one of the twelve, one who is putting his bread with me into the same plate.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 21
text: The Son of man goes, even as the Writings say of him: but cursed is that man through whom the Son of man is given up! It would have been well for that man if he had never been given birth.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 22
text: And while they were taking food, he took bread, and after blessing it, he gave the broken bread to them, and said, Take it: this is my body.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 23
text: And he took a cup, and when he had given praise, he gave it to them: and they all had a drink from it.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 24
text: And he said to them, This is my blood of the testament, which is given for men.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 25
text: Truly I say to you, I will take no more of the fruit of the vine till the day when I take it new in the kingdom of God.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 26
text: And after a song of praise to God they went out to the Mountain of Olives.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 27
text: And Jesus said to them, You will all be turned away from me: for it is in the Writings, I will put the keeper of the sheep to death, and the sheep will be put to flight.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 28
text: But after I have come back from the dead, I will go before you into Galilee.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 29
text: But Peter said to him, Though the others may be turned away from you, I will not.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 30
text: And Jesus said to him, Truly, I say to you that you, today, even this night, before the cock's second cry, will say three times that you have no knowledge of me.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 31
text: But he said with passion, If I have to be put to death with you, I will not be false to you. And they all said the same.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 32
text: And they came to a place which was named Gethsemane: and he said to his disciples, Be seated here while I say a prayer.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 33
text: And he took with him Peter and James and John, and grief and great trouble came on him.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 34
text: And he said to them, My soul is very sad, even to death: be here a little time, and keep watch.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 35
text: And he went forward a little, and falling down on the earth, made request that, if possible, the hour might go from him.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 36
text: And he said, Abba, Father, all things are possible to you; take away this cup from me: but even so let not my pleasure, but yours be done.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 37
text: And he came, and saw them sleeping, and said to Peter, Simon, are you sleeping? were you not able to keep watch one hour?

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 38
text: Keep watch with prayer, so that you may not be put to the test; the spirit truly is ready, but the flesh is feeble.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 39
text: And again he went away, and said a prayer, using the same words.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 40
text: And again he came and saw them sleeping, because their eyes were very tired; and they had nothing to say in answer.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 41
text: And he came the third time, and said to them, Go on sleeping now and take your rest: it is enough; the hour has come; see, the Son of man is given up into the hands of evil men.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 42
text: Get up, let us be going; see, he who gives me up is near.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 43
text: And straight away, while he was still talking, Judas, one of the twelve, came, and with him a great band with swords and sticks, from the chief priests and the scribes and those in authority.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 44
text: Now he who had been false to him had given them a sign, saying, The one to whom I give a kiss, that is he; take him, and get him away safely.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 45
text: And when he had come, he went straight to him and said, Master; and gave him a kiss.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 46
text: And they put their hands on him, and took him.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 47
text: But a certain one of those who were near took out his sword, and gave the servant of the high priest a blow, cutting off his ear.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 48
text: And Jesus said to them, Have you come out as against a thief, with swords and sticks to take me?

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 49
text: I was with you every day in the Temple teaching, and you did not take me; but this is done so that the Writings may come true.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 50
text: And they all went away from him in fear.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 51
text: And a certain young man went after him, with only a linen cloth about his body; and they put their hands on him;

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 52
text: But he got away unclothed, without the linen cloth.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 53
text: And they took Jesus away to the high priest; and there came together with him all the chief priests and those in authority and the scribes.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 54
text: And Peter had come after him at a distance, even into the house of the high priest; and he was seated with the captains, warming himself in the light of the fire.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 55
text: Now the chief priests and all the Sanhedrin were looking for witness against Jesus so that they might put him to death; and they were unable to get any.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 56
text: For a number gave false witness against him and their witness was not in agreement.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 57
text: Then some got up and gave false witness against him, saying,

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 58
text: He said in our hearing, I will put an end to this Temple which is made with hands, and in three days I will make another without hands.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 59
text: And even so their witness was not in agreement.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 60
text: And the high priest got up in the middle of them, and said to Jesus, Do you say nothing in answer? what is it which these say against you?

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 61
text: But he kept quiet and said nothing. Again the high priest questioning him said, Are you the Christ, the son of the Holy One?

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 62
text: And Jesus said, I am: and you will see the Son of man seated at the right hand of power, and coming with the clouds of heaven.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 63
text: And the high priest, violently parting his robes, said, What more need have we of witnesses?

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 64
text: His words against God have come to your ears: what is your opinion? And they all said it was right for him to be put to death.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 65
text: And some put shame on him and, covering his face, gave him blows and said to him, Now say what is to come: and the captains took him and gave him blows with their hands.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 66
text: And while Peter was down in the open square of the building, one of the servant-girls of the high priest came;

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 67
text: And seeing Peter warming himself by the fire, she gave him a look, and said, You were with this Nazarene, even Jesus.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 68
text: But he said, I have no knowledge of him, or of what you are saying: and he went out into the doorway; and there came the cry of a cock.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 69
text: And the girl saw him, and said again to those who were near, This is one of them.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 70
text: But again he said it was not so. And after a little time, again those who were near said to Peter, Truly you are one of them; for you are a Galilaean.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 71
text: But, with curses and oaths, he said, I have no knowledge of the man about whom you are talking.

title: Mark Chapter 14 Verse 72
text: And in the same minute, the cock gave a second cry. And it came to Peter's mind how Jesus had said to him, Before the cock's second cry, you will say three times that you have no knowledge of me. And at this thought he was overcome with weeping.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 1
text: And the first thing in the morning the chief priests, with those in authority and the scribes and all the Sanhedrin, had a meeting, and put cords round Jesus, and took him away, and gave him up to Pilate.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 2
text: And Pilate put a question to him, Are you the King of the Jews? And he, answering, said to him, You say so.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 3
text: And the chief priests said a number of things against him.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 4
text: And Pilate again put a question, Do you say nothing in answer? see how much evil they say you have done.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 5
text: But Jesus gave no more answers, so that Pilate was full of wonder.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 6
text: Now at the feast every year he let one prisoner go free at their request.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 7
text: And there was one named Barabbas, in prison with those who had gone against the government and in the fight had taken life.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 8
text: And the people went up, requesting him to do as he had done for them in other years.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 9
text: And Pilate said in answer to them, Is it your desire that I let the King of the Jews go free?

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 10
text: For he saw that the chief priests had given him up through envy.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 11
text: But the people were moved by the chief priests to make him let Barabbas go free.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 12
text: And Pilate again said in answer to them, What then am I to do to him to whom you give the name of the King of the Jews?

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 13
text: And they said again loudly, To the cross with him!

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 14
text: And Pilate said to them, Why, what evil has he done? But their cry was the louder, To the cross!

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 15
text: And Pilate, desiring to do what was pleasing to the people, let Barabbas go free, and gave up Jesus, when he had been whipped, to be put to death on the cross.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 16
text: And the men of the army took him away into the square in front of the building which is the Praetorium, and they got together all the band.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 17
text: And they put a purple robe on him, and twisting a crown of thorns, they put it on him;

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 18
text: And, as if honouring him, they said, Long life to the King of the Jews!

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 19
text: And they gave him blows on the head with a stick and put shame on him and, going down on their knees, gave him worship.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 20
text: And when they had made sport of him, they took the purple robe off him and put his clothing on him. And they took him out to put him to death on the cross.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 21
text: And they made one, Simon of Cyrene, the father of Alexander and Rufus, who was going by, coming from the country, go with them, so that he might take his cross.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 22
text: And they took him to the place named Golgotha, which is, Dead Man's Head.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 23
text: And they gave him wine mixed with myrrh; but he did not take it.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 24
text: And he was nailed to the cross; and they made a division of his clothing among them, putting to the decision of chance what everyone was to take.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 25
text: And it was the third hour when they put him on the cross.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 26
text: And the statement of his crime was put in writing on the cross, THE KING OF THE JEWS.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 27
text: And they put two thieves on crosses with him, one on his right side, and one on his left.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 29
text: And those who went by made sport of him, shaking their heads, and saying, Ha! you who give the Temple to destruction, and put it up again in three days,

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 30
text: Keep yourself from death, and come down from the cross.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 31
text: In the same way the chief priests, laughing at him among themselves with the scribes, said, A saviour of others, he has no salvation for himself.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 32
text: Let the Christ, the King of Israel, come down now from the cross, so that we may see and have belief. And those who were put on crosses with him said evil things against him.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 33
text: And when the sixth hour had come, it was dark over all the land till the ninth hour.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 34
text: And at the ninth hour, Jesus said in a loud voice, Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani? which is, My God, my God, why are you turned away from me?

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 35
text: And some of those who were near, hearing it, said, See, he is crying to Elijah.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 36
text: And one of them went quickly and, getting a sponge full of bitter wine, put it on a rod, and gave it to him for drink, saying, Let be; let us see if Elijah will come to take him down.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 37
text: And Jesus gave a loud cry, and gave up his spirit.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 38
text: And the curtain of the Temple was parted in two from end to end.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 39
text: And when the captain, who was near, saw how he gave up his spirit, he said, Truly this man was a son of God.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 40
text: And there were women watching from a distance: among them were Mary Magdalene, and Mary, the mother of James the less and of Joses, and Salome,

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 41
text: Who went with him when he was in Galilee and took care of him; and a number of other women who came up with him to Jerusalem.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 42
text: And when it was evening, because it was the time of getting ready, that is, the day before the Sabbath,

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 43
text: There came Joseph of Arimathaea, a responsible man in high honour, who was himself waiting for the kingdom of God; and he went in to Pilate without fear, and made a request for the body of Jesus.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 44
text: And Pilate was surprised that he was dead; and, sending for the captain, he put a question to see if he had been dead for long.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 45
text: And when he had news of it from the captain, he let Joseph have the body.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 46
text: And he got a linen cloth and, taking him down, put the linen cloth round him, and put him in a place for the dead which had been cut out of a rock; and a stone was rolled against the door.

title: Mark Chapter 15 Verse 47
text: And Mary Magdalene and Mary, the mother of Joses, saw where he was put.

title: Mark Chapter 16 Verse 1
text: And when the Sabbath was past, Mary Magdalene and Mary, the mother of James, and Salome, got spices, so that they might come and put them on him.

title: Mark Chapter 16 Verse 2
text: And very early after dawn on the first day of the week, they came at the time of the coming up of the sun to the place where the body had been put.

title: Mark Chapter 16 Verse 3
text: And they were saying among themselves, Who will get the stone rolled away from the door for us?

title: Mark Chapter 16 Verse 4
text: And looking up, they saw that the stone was rolled back; and it was of great size.

title: Mark Chapter 16 Verse 5
text: And when they went in, they saw a young man seated on the right side, dressed in a white robe; and they were full of wonder.

title: Mark Chapter 16 Verse 6
text: And he said to them, Do not be troubled: you are looking for Jesus, the Nazarene, who has been put to death on the cross; he has come back from the dead; he is not here: see, the place where they put him!

title: Mark Chapter 16 Verse 7
text: But go, say to his disciples and to Peter, He goes before you into Galilee: there you will see him, as he said to you.

title: Mark Chapter 16 Verse 8
text: And they went out quickly from the place, because fear and great wonder had come on them: and they said nothing to anyone, because they were full of fear that ...

title: Mark Chapter 16 Verse 9
text: Now when he came back from the dead early on the first day of the week, he went first to Mary Magdalene, from whom he had sent out seven evil spirits.

title: Mark Chapter 16 Verse 10
text: She went and gave news of it to those who had been with him, while they were sorrowing and weeping.

title: Mark Chapter 16 Verse 11
text: And they, when it came to their ears that he was living, and had been seen by her, had no belief in it.

title: Mark Chapter 16 Verse 12
text: And after these things he was seen in another form by two of them, while they were walking on their way into the country.

title: Mark Chapter 16 Verse 13
text: And they went away and gave news of it to the rest; and they had no belief in what was said.

title: Mark Chapter 16 Verse 14
text: And later he was seen by the eleven themselves while they were taking food; and he said sharp words to them because they had no faith and their hearts were hard, and because they had no belief in those who had seen him after he had come back from the dead.

title: Mark Chapter 16 Verse 15
text: And he said to them, Go into all the world, and give the good news to everyone.

title: Mark Chapter 16 Verse 16
text: He who has faith and is given baptism will get salvation; but he who has not faith will be judged.

title: Mark Chapter 16 Verse 17
text: And these signs will be with those who have faith: in my name they will send out evil spirits; and they will make use of new languages;

title: Mark Chapter 16 Verse 18
text: They will take up snakes, and if there is poison in their drink, it will do them no evil; they will put their hands on those who are ill, and they will get well.

title: Mark Chapter 16 Verse 19
text: So then the Lord Jesus, after he had said these words to them, was taken up into heaven and took his seat at the right hand of God.

title: Mark Chapter 16 Verse 20
text: And they went out, preaching everywhere, the Lord working with them, and giving witness to the word by the signs which came after. So be it.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: As a number of attempts have been made to put together in order an account of those events which took place among us,

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: As they were handed down to us by those who saw them from the first and were preachers of the word,

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: It seemed good to me, having made observation, with great care, of the direction of events in their order, to put the facts in writing for you, most noble Theophilus;

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: So that you might have certain knowledge of those things about which you were given teaching.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: In the days of Herod, king of Judaea, there was a certain priest, by name Zacharias, of the order of Abijah; and he had a wife of the family of Aaron, and her name was Elisabeth.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: They were upright in the eyes of God, keeping all the rules and orders of God, and doing no wrong.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: And they were without children, because Elisabeth had never given birth, and they were at that time very old.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: Now it came about that in his turn he was acting as priest before God,

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: And as was the way of the priests, he had to go into the Temple to see to the burning of perfumes.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: And all the people were offering prayers outside, at the time of the burning of perfumes.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: And he saw an angel of the Lord in his place on the right side of the altar.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: And Zacharias was troubled when he saw him, and fear came on him.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: But the angel said, Have no fear, Zacharias, for your prayer has come to the ears of God, and your wife Elisabeth will have a son, and his name will be John.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: And you will be glad and have great delight; and numbers of people will have joy at his birth.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: For he will be great in the eyes of the Lord; he will not take wine or strong drink; and he will be full of the Spirit of God from his birth.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: And through him great numbers of the children of Israel will be turned to the Lord their God.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: And he will go before his face in the spirit and power of Elijah, turning the hearts of fathers to their children, and wrongdoers to the way of righteousness; to make ready a people whose hearts have been turned to the Lord.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: And Zacharias said to the angel, How may I be certain of this? For I am an old man, and my wife is far on in years.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 19
text: And the angel, answering, said, I am Gabriel, whose place is before God; I have been sent to say these words to you and to give you this good news.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 20
text: Now, see, you will be without voice or language till the day when these things come about, because you had not faith in my words, which will have effect at the right time.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 21
text: And the people were waiting for Zacharias and were surprised because he was in the Temple for such a long time.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 22
text: And when he came out he was not able to say anything, and they saw that he had seen a vision in the Temple; and he was making signs to them without words.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 23
text: And when the days of his work in the Temple were ended, he went back to his house.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 24
text: After that time, Elisabeth, being certain that she was to become a mother, kept herself from men's eyes for five months, saying,

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 25
text: The Lord has done this to me, for his eyes were on me, to take away my shame in the eyes of men.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 26
text: Now in the sixth month the angel Gabriel was sent from God to a town in Galilee, named Nazareth,

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 27
text: To a virgin who was to be married to a man named Joseph, of the family of David; and the name of the virgin was Mary.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 28
text: And the angel came in to her and said, Peace be with you, to whom special grace has been given; the Lord is with you.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 29
text: But she was greatly troubled at his words, and said to herself, What may be the purpose of these words?

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 30
text: And the angel said to her, Have no fear, Mary, for you have God's approval.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 31
text: And see, you will give birth to a son, and his name will be Jesus.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 32
text: He will be great, and will be named the Son of the Most High: and the Lord God will give him the kingdom of David, his father:

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 33
text: He will have rule over the house of Jacob for ever, and of his kingdom there will be no end.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 34
text: And Mary said to the angel, How may this be, because I have had no knowledge of a man?

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 35
text: And the angel in answer said to her, The Holy Spirit will come on you, and the power of the Most High will come to rest on you, and so that which will come to birth will be named holy, Son of God.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 36
text: Even now Elisabeth, who is of your family, is to be a mother, though she is old: and this is the sixth month with her who was without children.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 37
text: For there is nothing which God is not able to do.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 38
text: And Mary said: I am the servant of the Lord; may it be to me as you say. And the angel went away.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 39
text: Then Mary got up and went quickly into the high lands, to a town of Judah;

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 40
text: And went into the house of Zacharias and took Elisabeth in her arms.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 41
text: And when the voice of Mary came to the ears of Elisabeth, the baby made a sudden move inside her; then Elisabeth was full of the Holy Spirit,

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 42
text: And she said with a loud voice: May blessing be on you among women, and a blessing on the child of your body.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 43
text: How is it that the mother of my Lord comes to me?

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 44
text: For, truly, when the sound of your voice came to my ears, the baby in my body made a sudden move for joy.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 45
text: Happy will she be who had faith that the things which the Lord has said to her will be done.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 46
text: And Mary said: My soul gives glory to God;

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 47
text: My spirit is glad in God my Saviour.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 48
text: For he has had pity on his servant, though she is poor and lowly placed: and from this hour will all generations give witness to the blessing which has come to me.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 49
text: For he who is strong has done great things for me; and holy is his name.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 50
text: His mercy is for all generations in whom is the fear of him.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 51
text: With his arm he has done acts of power; he has put to flight those who have pride in their hearts.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 52
text: He has put down kings from their seats, lifting up on high the men of low degree.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 53
text: Those who had no food he made full of good things; the men of wealth he sent away with nothing in their hands;

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 54
text: His help he has given to Israel, his servant, so that he might keep in mind his mercy to Abraham and his seed for ever,

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 55
text: As he gave his word to our fathers.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 56
text: And Mary was with her for about three months and then went back to her house.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 57
text: Now it was time for Elisabeth to give birth, and she had a son.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 58
text: And it came to the ears of her neighbours and relations that the Lord had been very good to her, and they took part in her joy.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 59
text: And on the eighth day they came to see to the circumcision of the child, and they would have given him the name of Zacharias, his father's name;

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 60
text: But his mother made answer and said, No, his name is John.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 61
text: And they said, Not one of your relations has that name.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 62
text: And they made signs to his father, to say what name was to be given to him.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 63
text: And he sent for writing materials and put down: His name is John; and they were all surprised.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 64
text: And straight away his mouth was open and his tongue was free and he gave praise to God.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 65
text: And fear came on all those who were living round about them: and there was much talk about all these things in all the hill-country of Judaea.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 66
text: And all who had word of them kept them in their minds and said, What will this child be? For the hand of the Lord was with him.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 67
text: And his father, Zacharias, was full of the Holy Spirit, and with the voice of a prophet said these words:

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 68
text: Praise be to the Lord, the God of Israel, for he has come to his people and made them free,

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 69
text: Lifting up a horn of salvation for us in the house of his servant David,

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 70
text: (As he said, by the mouth of his holy prophets, from the earliest times,)

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 71
text: Salvation from those who are against us, and from the hands of those who have hate for us;

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 72
text: To do acts of mercy to our fathers and to keep in mind his holy word,

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 73
text: The oath which he made to Abraham, our father,

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 74
text: That we, being made free from the fear of those who are against us, might give him worship,

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 75
text: In righteousness and holy living before him all our days.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 76
text: And you, child, will be named the prophet of the Most High: you will go before the face of the Lord, to make ready his ways;

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 77
text: To give knowledge of salvation to his people, through the forgiveness of sins,

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 78
text: Because of the loving mercies of our God, by which the dawn from heaven has come to us,

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 79
text: To give light to those in dark places, and in the shade of death, so that our feet may be guided into the way of peace.

title: Luke Chapter 1 Verse 80
text: And the child became tall, and strong in spirit; and he was living in the waste land till the day when he came before the eyes of Israel.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: Now it came about in those days that an order went out from Caesar Augustus that there was to be a numbering of all the world.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: This was the first numbering, which was made when Quirinius was ruler of Syria.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: And all men went to be numbered, everyone to his town.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: And Joseph went up from Galilee, out of the town of Nazareth, into Judaea, to Beth-lehem, the town of David, because he was of the house and family of David,

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: To be put on the list with Mary, his future wife, who was about to become a mother.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: And while they were there, the time came for her to give birth.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: And she had her first son; and folding him in linen, she put him to rest in the place where the cattle had their food, because there was no room for them in the house.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: And in the same country there were keepers of sheep in the fields, watching over their flock by night.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: And an angel of the Lord came to them, and the glory of the Lord was shining round about them: and fear came on them.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: And the angel said, Have no fear; for truly, I give you good news of great joy which will be for all the people:

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: For on this day, in the town of David, a Saviour has come to birth, who is Christ the Lord.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: And this is the sign to you: you will see a young child folded in linen, in the place where the cattle have their food.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: And suddenly there was with the angel a great band of spirits from heaven, giving praise to God, and saying,

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: Glory to God in the highest, and on the earth peace among men with whom he is well pleased.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: And when the angels had gone away from them into heaven, the keepers of the sheep said to one another, Let us go now to Beth-lehem, and see this thing which has come about, which the Lord has made clear to us.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: And they came quickly, and saw Mary and Joseph, and the child in the place where the cattle had their food.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: And when they saw it, they gave them an account of the things which had been said to them about the child.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 18
text: And all those to whose ears it came were full of wonder at the things said by the keepers of the sheep.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 19
text: But Mary kept all these words in her heart, and gave much thought to them.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 20
text: Then the keepers of the sheep went back, giving glory and praise to God for all the things which had come to their ears and which they had seen, as it had been said to them.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 21
text: And when, after eight days, the time came for his circumcision, he was named Jesus, the name which the angel had given to him before his birth.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 22
text: And when the necessary days for making them clean by the law of Moses had come to an end, they took him to Jerusalem to give him to the Lord

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 23
text: (As it says in the law of the Lord, Every mother's first male child is to be holy to the Lord),

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 24
text: And to make an offering, as it is ordered in the law of the Lord, of two doves or other young birds.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 25
text: And there was then in Jerusalem a man whose name was Simeon; and he was an upright man, fearing God and waiting for the comfort of Israel: and the Holy Spirit was on him.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 26
text: And he had knowledge, through the Holy Spirit, that he would not see death till he had seen the Lord's Christ.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 27
text: And full of the Spirit he came into the Temple; and when the father and mother came in with the child Jesus, to do with him what was ordered by the law,

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 28
text: Then he took him in his arms and gave praise to God and said,

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 29
text: Now you are letting your servant go in peace, O Lord, as you have said;

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 30
text: For my eyes have seen your salvation,

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 31
text: Which you have made ready before the face of all nations;

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 32
text: A light of revelation to the Gentiles, and the glory of your people Israel.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 33
text: And his father and mother were full of wonder at the things which were said about him.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 34
text: And Simeon gave them his blessing and said to Mary, his mother, See, this child will be the cause of the downfall and the lifting up of great numbers of people in Israel, and he will be a sign against which hard words will be said;

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 35
text: (And a sword will go through your heart;) so that the secret thoughts of men may come to light.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 36
text: And there was one, Anna, a woman prophet, the daughter of Phanuel, of the family of Asher (she was very old, and after seven years of married life

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 37
text: She had been a widow for eighty-four years); she was in the Temple at all times, worshipping with prayers and going without food, night and day.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 38
text: And coming up at that time, she gave praise to God, talking of him to all those who were waiting for the freeing of Jerusalem.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 39
text: And when they had done all the things which were ordered by the law of the Lord, they went back to Galilee, to Nazareth, the town where they were living.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 40
text: And the child became tall and strong and full of wisdom, and the grace of God was on him.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 41
text: And every year his father and mother went to Jerusalem at the feast of the Passover.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 42
text: And when he was twelve years old, they went up, as their way was, to the feast;

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 43
text: And when the days of the feast came to an end and they were going back, the boy Jesus was still in Jerusalem, but they had no knowledge of it:

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 44
text: And in the belief that he was with some of their number, they went a day's journey; and after looking for him among their relations and friends,

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 45
text: And seeing that he was not there, they went back to Jerusalem, to make search for him.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 46
text: And after three days they came across him in the Temple, seated among the wise men, giving ear to their words and putting questions to them.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 47
text: And all to whose ears it came were full of wonder at his knowledge and the answers which he gave.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 48
text: And when they saw him they were surprised, and his mother said to him, Son, why have you done this to us? see, your father and I have been looking for you with sorrow.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 49
text: And he said to them, Why were you looking for me? was it not clear to you that my right place was in my Father's house?

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 50
text: And his words seemed strange to them.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 51
text: And he went down with them and came to Nazareth; and did as he was ordered: and his mother kept all these words in her heart.

title: Luke Chapter 2 Verse 52
text: And Jesus was increasing in wisdom and in years, and in grace before God and men.

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: Now in the fifteenth year of the rule of Tiberius Caesar, Pontius Pilate being ruler of Judaea, and Herod being king of Galilee, his brother Philip king of the country of Ituraea and Trachonitis, and Lysanias king of Abilene,

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: When Annas and Caiaphas were high priests, the word of the Lord came to John, the son of Zacharias, in the waste land.

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: And he came into all the country round about Jordan, preaching baptism as a sign of forgiveness of sin for those whose hearts were changed.

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: As it says in the book of the words of Isaiah the prophet, The voice of one crying in the waste land, Make ready the way of the Lord, make his roads straight.

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: Every valley will be lifted up, and all the mountains and hills made low, and the twisted will be made straight, and the rough ways smooth;

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: And all flesh will see the salvation of God.

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: So he said to the people who went out to him for baptism: You offspring of snakes, at whose word are you going in flight from the wrath to come?

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: Make clear by your acts that your hearts have been changed; and do not say to yourselves, We have Abraham for our father: for I say to you that God is able from these stones to make children of Abraham.

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: And even now the axe is put to the root of the trees; and every tree which does not have good fruit will be cut down and put into the fire.

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: And the people put questions to him, saying, What have we to do?

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: And he made answer and said to them, He who has two coats, let him give to him who has not even one; and he who has food, let him do the same.

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: Then tax-farmers came to him for baptism and said to him, Master, what have we to do?

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: And he said to them, Do not make an attempt to get more money than the right amount.

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: And men of the army put questions to him, saying, And what have we to do? And he said to them, Do no violent acts to any man, and do not take anything without right, and let your payment be enough for you.

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: And while the people were waiting, and all men were questioning in their hearts about John, if he was the Christ or not,

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: John made answer, saying to them all, Truly, I give you baptism with water, but one is coming who is greater than I, whose shoes I am not good enough to undo: he will give you baptism with the Holy Spirit, and with fire:

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: In whose hand is the instrument with which he will make clean his grain; he will put the good grain in his store, but the waste will be burned in the fire which will never be put out.

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 18
text: And so comforting them with these and other words, he gave the good news to the people;

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 19
text: But Herod the king, because John had made a protest on account of Herodias, his brother's wife, and other evil things which Herod had done,

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 20
text: Did this most evil thing of all, and had John shut up in prison.

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 21
text: Now it came about that when all the people had been given baptism, Jesus, having had baptism with them, was in prayer, when, the heaven being open,

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 22
text: The Holy Spirit came down in the form of a dove, and a voice came from heaven, saying, You are my dearly loved Son, with whom I am well pleased.

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 23
text: And Jesus at this time was about thirty years old, being the son (as it seemed) of Joseph, the son of Heli,

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 24
text: The son of Matthat, the son of Levi, the son of Melchi, the son of Jannai, the son of Joseph,

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 25
text: The son of Mattathias, the son of Amos, the son of Nahum, the son of Esli, the son of Naggai,

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 26
text: The son of Maath, the son of Mattathias, the son of Semein, the son of Josech, the son of Joda,

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 27
text: The son of Joanan, the son of Rhesa, the son of Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, the son of Neri,

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 28
text: The son of Melchi, the son of Addi, the son of Cosam, the son of Elmadam, the son of Er,

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 29
text: The son of Jesus, the son of Eliezer, the son of Jorim, the son of Matthat, the son of Levi,

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 30
text: The son of Symeon, the son of Judas, the son of Joseph, the son of Jonam, the son of Eliakim,

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 31
text: The son of Melea, the son of Menna, the son of Mattatha, the son of Nathan, the son of David,

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 32
text: The son of Jesse, the son of Obed, the son of Boaz, the son of Salmon, the son of Nahshon,

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 33
text: The son of Amminadab, the son of Arni, the son of Hezron, the son of Perez, the son of Judah,

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 34
text: The son of Jacob, the son of Isaac, the son of Abraham, the son of Terah, the son of Nahor,

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 35
text: The son of Serug, the son of Reu, the son of Peleg, the son of Eber, the son of Shelah,

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 36
text: The son of Cainan, the son of Arphaxad, the son of Shem, the son of Noah, the son of Lamech,

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 37
text: The son of Methuselah, the son of Enoch, the son of Jared, the son of Mahalaleel, the son of Cainan,

title: Luke Chapter 3 Verse 38
text: The son of Enos, the son of Seth, the son of Adam, the son of God.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: And Jesus, full of the Holy Spirit, came back from the Jordan, and was guided by the Spirit in the waste land

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: For forty days, being tested by the Evil One. And he had no food in those days; and when they came to an end, he was in need of food.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: And the Evil One said to him, If you are the Son of God, give orders to this stone to become bread.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: And Jesus made answer to him, It has been said in the Writings, Bread is not man's only need.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: And he took him up and let him see all the kingdoms of the earth in a minute of time.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: And the Evil One said, I will give you authority over all these, and the glory of them, for it has been given to me, and I give it to anyone at my pleasure.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: If then you will give worship to me, it will all be yours.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: And Jesus in answer said to him, It has been said in the Writings, Give worship to the Lord your God, and be his servant only.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: And he took him to Jerusalem and put him on the highest point of the Temple and said to him, If you are the Son of God, let yourself go down from here; for it is said in the Writings,

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: He will give his angels orders to take care of you:

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: And, In their hands they will keep you up, so that your foot may not be crushed against a stone.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: And Jesus made answer and said to him, It is said in the Writings, You may not put the Lord your God to the test.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: And when all these tests were ended the Evil One went away from him for a time.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: And Jesus came back to Galilee in the power of the Spirit, and the news of him went through all the country round about.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: And he was teaching in their Synagogues and all men gave him praise.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: And he came to Nazareth, where he had been as a child, and he went, as his way was, into the Synagogue on the Sabbath, and got up to give a reading.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 17
text: And the book of the prophet Isaiah was given to him and, opening the book, he came on the place where it is said,

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 18
text: The Spirit of the Lord is on me, because I am marked out by him to give good news to the poor; he has sent me to make well those who are broken-hearted; to say that the prisoners will be let go, and the blind will see, and to make the wounded free from their chains,

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 19
text: To give knowledge that the year of the Lord's good pleasure is come.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 20
text: And shutting the book he gave it back to the servant and took his seat: and the eyes of all in the Synagogue were fixed on him.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 21
text: Then he said to them, Today this word has come true in your hearing.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 22
text: And they were all giving witness, with wonder, to the words of grace which came from his mouth: and they said, Is not this the son of Joseph?

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 23
text: And he said to them, Without doubt you will say to me, Let the medical man make himself well: the things which to our knowledge were done at Capernaum, do them here in your country.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 24
text: And he said to them, Truly I say to you, No prophet is honoured in his country.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 25
text: Truly I say to you, There were a number of widows in Israel in the days of Elijah, when the heaven was shut up for three years and six months and there was no food in the land;

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 26
text: But Elijah was not sent to one of them, but only to Zarephath, in the land of Sidon, to a woman who was a widow.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 27
text: And there were a number of lepers in Israel in the time of Elisha the prophet, and not one of them was made clean, but only Naaman the Syrian.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 28
text: And all who were in the Synagogue were very angry when these things were said to them.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 29
text: And they got up and took him out of the town to the edge of the mountain on which their town was, so that they might send him down to his death.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 30
text: But he came through them and went on his way.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 31
text: And he came down to Capernaum, a town of Galilee; and he was giving them teaching on the Sabbath.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 32
text: And they were surprised at his teaching, for his word was with authority.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 33
text: And there was a man in the Synagogue who had an unclean spirit; and he gave a loud cry and said,

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 34
text: Let us be! what have we to do with you, Jesus of Nazareth? have you come to put an end to us? I have knowledge who you are, the Holy One of God.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 35
text: And Jesus said to him, Be quiet, and come out of him. And when the evil spirit had put him down on the earth in the middle of them, he came out of him, having done him no damage.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 36
text: And wonder came on them all and they said to one another, What are these words? for with authority and power he gives orders to the evil spirits and they come out.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 37
text: And there was much talk about him in all the places round about.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 38
text: And he got up and went out of the Synagogue and went into the house of Simon. And Simon's wife's mother was very ill with a burning heat; and in answer to their prayers for her

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 39
text: He went near her, and with a sharp word he gave orders to the disease and it went away from her; and straight away she got up and took care of their needs.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 40
text: And at sundown all those who had anyone ill with any sort of disease, took them to him, and he put his hands on every one of them and made them well.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 41
text: And evil spirits came out of a number of them, crying out and saying, You are the Son of God. But he gave them sharp orders not to say a word, because they had knowledge that he was the Christ.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 42
text: And when it was day, he came out and went to a waste place; and great numbers of people came looking for him, and they came to him and would have kept him from going away.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 43
text: But he said to them, I have to give the good news of the kingdom of God in other towns, because that is why I was sent.

title: Luke Chapter 4 Verse 44
text: And he was teaching in the Synagogues of Galilee.

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: Now it came about that while the people came pushing to be near him, and to have knowledge of the word of God, he was by a wide stretch of water named Gennesaret;

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: And he saw two boats by the edge of the water, but the fishermen had gone out of them and were washing their nets.

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: And he got into one of the boats, the property of Simon, and made a request to him to go a little way out from the land. And being seated he gave the people teaching from the boat.

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: And when his talk was ended, he said to Simon, Go out into deep water, and let down your nets for fish.

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: And Simon, answering, said, Master, we were working all night and we took nothing: but at your word I will let down the nets.

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: And when they had done this, they got such a great number of fish that it seemed as if their nets would be broken;

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: And they made signs to their friends in the other boat to come to their help. And they came, and the two boats were so full that they were going down.

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: But Simon, when he saw it, went down at the knees of Jesus and said, Go away from me, O Lord, for I am a sinner.

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: For he was full of wonder and so were all those who were with him, at the number of fish which they had taken;

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: And so were James and John, the sons of Zebedee, who were working with Simon. And Jesus said to Simon, Have no fear; from this time forward you will be a fisher of men.

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: And when they had got their boats to the land, they gave up everything and went after him.

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: And it came about that while he was in one of the towns, there was a leper there: and when he saw Jesus he went down on his face in prayer to him, saying, Lord, if it is your pleasure, you have power to make me clean.

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: And he put out his hand to him and said, It is my pleasure; be clean. And straight away his disease went from him.

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: And he gave him orders: Say nothing to any man, but let the priest see you and give an offering so that you may be made clean, as the law of Moses says, and for a witness to them.

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 15
text: But news of him went out all the more, in every direction, and great numbers of people came together to give hearing to his words and to be made well from their diseases.

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 16
text: But he went away by himself to a waste place for prayer.

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 17
text: And it came about that on one of these days he was teaching; and some Pharisees and teachers of the law were seated there, who had come from every town of Galilee and Judaea and from Jerusalem; and the power of the Lord was with him, to make those who were ill free from their diseases.

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 18
text: And some men had with them, on a bed, a man who was ill, without power of moving; and they made attempts to get him in and put him before Jesus.

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 19
text: And because of the mass of people, there was no way to get him in; so they went up on the top of the house and let him down through the roof, on his bed, into the middle in front of Jesus.

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 20
text: And seeing their faith he said, Man, you have forgiveness for your sins.

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 21
text: And the scribes and Pharisees were having an argument, saying, Who is this, who has no respect for God? who is able to give forgiveness for sins, but God only?

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 22
text: But Jesus, who had knowledge of their thoughts, said to them, Why are you reasoning in your hearts?

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 23
text: Which is the simpler: to say, You have forgiveness for your sins; or to say, Get up and go?

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 24
text: But so that you may see that on earth the Son of man has authority for the forgiveness of sins, (he said to the man who was ill,) I say to you, Get up, and take up your bed, and go into your house.

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 25
text: And straight away he got up before them, and took up his bed and went away to his house giving praise to God.

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 26
text: And wonder overcame them all, and they gave glory to God; and they were full of fear, saying, We have seen strange things today.

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 27
text: And after these things he went out, and saw Levi, a tax-farmer, seated at the place where taxes were taken, and said to him, Come after me.

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 28
text: And giving up his business, he got up and went after him.

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 29
text: And Levi made a great feast for him in his house: and a great number of tax-farmers and others were seated at table with them.

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 30
text: And the Pharisees and their scribes made protests against his disciples, saying, Why do you take food and drink with tax-farmers and sinners?

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 31
text: And Jesus, answering, said to them, Those who are well have no need of a medical man, but those who are ill.

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 32
text: I have come, not to get the upright, but sinners, so that they may be turned from their sins.

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 33
text: And they said to him, The disciples of John frequently go without food, and make prayers, and so do the disciples of the Pharisees; but your disciples take food and drink.

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 34
text: And Jesus said, Are you able to make the friends of the newly-married man go without food when he is with them?

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 35
text: But the days will come when he will be taken away from them, and then they will go without food.

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 36
text: And he said to them, in a story, No man takes a bit of cloth from a new coat and puts it on to an old coat, for so the new coat would be damaged and the bit from the new would not go well with the old.

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 37
text: And no man puts new wine into old wine-skins, for fear that the skins will be burst by the new wine, and the wine be let out, and the skins come to destruction.

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 38
text: But new wine has to be put into new wine-skins.

title: Luke Chapter 5 Verse 39
text: And no man, having had old wine, has any desire for new, for he says, The old is better.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: Now it came about that on the Sabbath he was going through the fields of grain, and his disciples took the heads of the grain for food, crushing them in their hands.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: But some of the Pharisees said, Why do you do what it is not right to do on the Sabbath?

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: And Jesus said, Have you not seen in the Writings what David did when he was in need of food, he, and those who were with him;

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: How he went into the house of God and took for food the holy bread, which only the priests may take, and gave it to those who were with him?

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: And he said, The Son of man is lord even of the Sabbath.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: And it came about, on another Sabbath, that he went into the Synagogue and was teaching there. And a man was there whose right hand was dead.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: And the scribes and Pharisees were watching him to see if he would make him well on the Sabbath, so that they might be able to say something against him.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: But he had knowledge of their thoughts; and he said to the man whose hand was dead, Get up and come into the middle. And he got up and came forward.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: And Jesus said, I put the question to you, Is it right to do good on the Sabbath or to do evil? to give life or to take it away?

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: And looking round on all of them, he said to him, Put out your hand. And he did so: and his hand was made well.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: But they were full of wrath, and were talking together about what they might do to Jesus.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 12
text: And it came about in those days that he went out to the mountain for prayer; and he was all night in prayer to God.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 13
text: And the day came and, turning to his disciples, he made a selection from among them of twelve, to whom he gave the name of Apostles;

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 14
text: Simon, to whom he gave the name of Peter, and Andrew, his brother, and James and John and Philip and Bartholomew

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 15
text: And Matthew and Thomas and James, the son of Alphaeus, and Simon, who was named the Zealot,

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 16
text: And Judas, the son of James, and Judas Iscariot, he who was false to him.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 17
text: And he came down with them to a level place, and a great band of his disciples, and a very great number of people from all Judaea and Jerusalem and from the parts of Tyre and Sidon by the sea, came to give hearing to him, and to be made well from their diseases;

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 18
text: And those who were troubled with unclean spirits were made well.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 19
text: And all the people were desiring to be touched by him, for power came from him and made them all well.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 20
text: And turning his eyes to his disciples he said, Happy are you who are poor: for the kingdom of God is yours.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 21
text: Happy are you who are in need of food now: for you will be made full. Happy are you who are weeping now; for you will be glad.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 22
text: Happy are you, when men have hate for you, and put you away from among them and say angry words to you, turning away in disgust at your name, because of the Son of man.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 23
text: Be glad in that day, and be lifted up for joy, for your reward in heaven will be great: for their fathers did these same things to the prophets.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 24
text: But unhappy are you who have wealth: for you have been comforted now.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 25
text: Unhappy are you who are full of food now: for you will be in need. Unhappy are you who are laughing now: for you will be crying in sorrow.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 26
text: Unhappy are you when all men give you their approval: for so their fathers did to the false prophets.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 27
text: But I say to you who give ear to me, Have love for those who are against you, do good to those who have hate for you,

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 28
text: Give blessing to those who give you curses, say prayers for those who are cruel to you.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 29
text: If a man gives you a blow on one side of your face, then let the other side be turned to him; from him who takes away your coat, do not keep back your robe.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 30
text: Give to everyone who comes with a request, and if a man takes away your property, make no attempt to get it back again.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 31
text: Do to others as you would have them do to you.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 32
text: If you have love for those who have love for you, what credit is it to you? for even sinners have love for those who have love for them.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 33
text: And if you do good to those who do good to you, what credit is it to you? for even sinners do the same.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 34
text: And if you let those have the use of your money, from whom you are hoping to get it back, what credit is it to you? even sinners do so to sinners, hoping to get back as much as they gave.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 35
text: But be loving to those who are against you and do them good, and give them your money, not giving up hope, and your reward will be great and you will be the sons of the Most High: for he is kind to evil men, and to those who have hard hearts.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 36
text: Be full of pity, even as your Father is full of pity.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 37
text: Be not judges of others, and you will not be judged: do not give punishment to others, and you will not get punishment yourselves: make others free, and you will be made free:

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 38
text: Give, and it will be given to you; good measure, crushed down, full and running over, they will give to you. For in the same measure as you give, it will be given to you again.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 39
text: And he gave them teaching in the form of a story, saying, Is it possible for one blind man to be guide to another? will they not go falling together into a hole?

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 40
text: The disciple is not greater than his master, but everyone whose learning is complete will be like his master.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 41
text: And why do you take note of the grain of dust in your brother's eye, but take no note of the bit of wood which is in your eye?

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 42
text: How will you say to your brother, Brother, let me take the grain of dust out of your eye, when you yourself do not see the bit of wood in your eye? O false one! first take the wood out of your eye and then you will see clearly to take the dust out of your brother's eye.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 43
text: For no good tree gives bad fruit, and no bad tree gives good fruit.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 44
text: For every tree is judged by its fruit. Men do not get figs from thorns, or grapes from blackberry plants.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 45
text: The good man, out of the good store of his heart, gives good things; and the evil man, out of his evil store, gives evil: for out of the full store of the heart come the words of the mouth.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 46
text: Why do you say to me, Lord, Lord, and do not the things which I say?

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 47
text: Everyone who comes to me and gives ear to my words and does them, I will make clear to you what he is like:

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 48
text: He is like a man building a house, who went deep and put the base of it on a rock; and when the water came up and the river was driving against that house, it was not moved, because the building was good.

title: Luke Chapter 6 Verse 49
text: But he who gives hearing, without doing, is like a man building a house on the earth without a base for it; and when the force of the river came against it, straight away it came down; and the destruction of that house was great.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: After he had come to the end of all his words in the hearing of the people, he went into Capernaum.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: And a certain captain had a servant who was very dear to him; this servant was ill and near to death.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: And when news of Jesus came to his ears, he sent to him rulers of the Jews, requesting that he would come and make his servant well.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: And they, when they came to Jesus, made their request warmly, saying,

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: It is right for you to do this for him, because he is a friend to our nation, and himself has put up a Synagogue for us.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: And Jesus went with them. And when he was not far from the house, the man sent friends to him, saying, Lord, do not give yourself trouble: for I am not important enough for you to come into my house:

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: And I had the feeling that I was not even good enough to come to you: but say the word only, and my servant will be well.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: For I, myself, am a man under authority, having men under me; and I say to this one, Go, and he goes; and to another, Come, and he comes; and to my servant, Do this, and he does it.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 9
text: And when these things were said to Jesus, he was surprised, and, turning to the mass of people coming after him, said, I have not seen such great faith, no, not in Israel.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 10
text: And when those who were sent came back to the house they saw that the servant was well.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 11
text: And it came about, after a little time, that he went to a town named Nain; and his disciples went with him, and a great number of people.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 12
text: Now when he came near the door of the town, a dead man was being taken out, the only son of his mother, who was a widow: and a great number of people from the town were with her.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 13
text: And when the Lord saw her, he had pity on her and said to her, Be not sad.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 14
text: And he came near, and put his hand on the stretcher where the dead man was: and those who were moving it came to a stop. And he said, Young man, I say to you, Get up.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 15
text: And the dead man got up, and words came from his lips. And he gave him to his mother.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 16
text: And fear came on all, and they gave praise to God, saying, A great prophet is among us: and, God has given thought to his people.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 17
text: And this story about him went through all Judaea and the places round about.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 18
text: And the disciples of John gave him an account of all these things.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 19
text: Then John sent two of his disciples to the Lord, saying, Are you he who is to come, or are we waiting for another?

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 20
text: And when the men came to him they said, John the Baptist has sent us to you, saying, Are you he who is to come, or are we waiting for another?

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 21
text: At that time, he made a number of people free from their diseases and their pains, and from evil spirits; and to others who were blind he gave back the use of their eyes.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 22
text: And answering them he said, Go back and give news to John of what you have seen, and the things which have come to your ears; the blind now see, those who had no power in their legs are walking, lepers are made clean, those who had no hearing now have their ears open, dead men come to life again, and the poor have the good news given to them.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 23
text: And a blessing will be on him who has no doubts about me.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 24
text: And when the men who were sent by John had gone away, he said to the people, about John, What did you go out into the waste land to see? a tall stem moving in the wind?

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 25
text: But what did you go out to see? a man in soft clothing? See now, those who have beautiful clothing and delicate food are in kings' houses.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 26
text: But what did you go out to see? a prophet? Yes, I say to you, and more than a prophet.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 27
text: This is he of whom it has been said, See, I send my servant before your face, who will make ready your way before you.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 28
text: I say to you, Among all the sons of women, not one is greater than John: but he who is least in the kingdom of God is greater than he.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 29
text: (And all the people, and the tax-farmers, to whom John had given baptism, when they had knowledge of these things, gave glory to God.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 30
text: But the Pharisees and the teachers of the law were against the purpose of God for themselves, not having had his baptism.)

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 31
text: What comparison am I to make of the men of this generation? what are they like?

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 32
text: They are like children who are seated in the market-place, crying out to one another, and saying, We made music for you, but you did not take part in the dance; we gave cries of sorrow, but you were not sad.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 33
text: For John the Baptist came, taking no food or drink, and you say, He has an evil spirit.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 34
text: The Son of man came feasting, and you say, Here is a lover of food and wine, a friend of tax-farmers and sinners.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 35
text: But wisdom is judged to be right by all her children.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 36
