text: And one of the Pharisees made a request that he would take a meal with him. And he went into the Pharisee's house and took his seat at the table.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 37
text: And there was a woman in the town who was a sinner; and when she had news that he was a guest in the Pharisee's house, she took a bottle of perfume,

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 38
text: And went in and took her place at the back of him, near his feet, weeping, so that his feet were washed with the drops from her eyes, and with her hair she made them dry, and kissing his feet she put the perfume on them.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 39
text: Now when the Pharisee in whose house he was saw it, he said to himself, This man, if he was a prophet, would be conscious what sort of woman this is who has put her hands on him, that she is a sinner.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 40
text: And Jesus, answering, said, Simon, I have something to say to you. And he said, Master, say on.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 41
text: And he said, Two men were in debt to a certain man of business: one had a debt of five hundred pence, and the other of fifty.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 42
text: When they were unable to make payment, he made the two of them free of their debts. Which of them, now, will have the greater love for him?

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 43
text: Simon, in answer, said, It seems he whose debt was greater. And he said, Your decision is right.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 44
text: And turning to the woman he said to Simon, You see this woman? I came into your house; you did not give me water for my feet: but she has been washing my feet with the drops from her eyes, and drying them with her hair.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 45
text: You did not give me a kiss: but she, from the time when I came in, has gone on kissing my feet.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 46
text: You put no oil on my head: but she has put perfume on my feet.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 47
text: And so I say to you, She will have forgiveness for her sins which are great in number, because of her great love: but he who has small need of forgiveness gives little love.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 48
text: And he said to her, You have forgiveness for your sins.

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 49
text: And those who were seated at table with him said to themselves, Who is this who even gives forgiveness of sins?

title: Luke Chapter 7 Verse 50
text: And he said to the woman, By your faith you have salvation; go in peace.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 1
text: And it came about, after a short time, that he went through town and country giving the good news of the kingdom of God, and with him were the twelve,

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 2
text: And certain women who had been made free from evil spirits and diseases, Mary named Magdalene, from whom seven evil spirits had gone out,

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 3
text: And Joanna, the wife of Chuza, Herod's chief house-servant, and Susanna and a number of others, who gave him of their wealth for his needs.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 4
text: And when a great number of people came together, and men from every town went out to him, he gave them teaching in the form of a story:

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 5
text: A man went out to put in seed, and while he was doing it, some was dropped by the wayside and it was crushed under foot, and was taken by the birds of heaven.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 6
text: And some went on the rock, and when it came up it became dry and dead because it had no water.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 7
text: And some went among thorns, and the thorns came up with it and it had no room for growth.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 8
text: And some falling on good earth, came up and gave fruit a hundred times as much. And with these words he said in a loud voice, He who has ears, let him give ear.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 9
text: And his disciples put questions to him about the point of the story.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 10
text: And he said, To you is given knowledge of the secrets of the kingdom of God; but to the others, they are given in stories, so that seeing, they may not see, and though they give hearing, the sense will not be clear to them.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 11
text: Now this is the point of the story: The seed is the word of God.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 12
text: Those by the side of the road are those who have given hearing; then the Evil One comes and takes away the word from their hearts, so that they may not have faith and get salvation.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 13
text: And those on the rock are those who with joy give hearing to the word; but having no root, they have faith for a time, and when the test comes they give up.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 14
text: And those which went among thorns are those who have given hearing, and go on their way, but they are overcome by cares and wealth and the pleasures of life, and they give no fruit.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 15
text: And those in the good earth are those who, having given ear to the word, keep it with a good and true heart, and in quiet strength give fruit.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 16
text: No man, when the light is lighted, puts a cover over it, or puts it under a bed, but he puts it on its table, so that those who come in may see the light.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 17
text: For nothing is put out of view which will not be made clear, and nothing is secret of which the knowledge will not come to light.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 18
text: So take care how you give hearing, for to him who has will be given, and from him who has not will be taken even what he seems to have.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 19
text: And his mother and his brothers came to him, and they were not able to get near him because of the great number of people.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 20
text: And someone said to him, Your mother and your brothers are outside desiring to see you.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 21
text: But he said to them in answer, My mother and my brothers are those who have knowledge of the word of God and do it.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 22
text: Now it came about on one of those days that he got into a boat with his disciples; and he said to them, Let us go over to the other side of the water: and they put out the boat.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 23
text: But while they were sailing he went to sleep: and a storm of wind came down on the sea, and the boat became full of water and they were in danger.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 24
text: Then they came to him and, awaking him out of his sleep, said, Master, Master, destruction is near. And he, when he was awake, gave orders to the wind and the rolling waves, and the storm came to an end, and all was calm.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 25
text: And he said to them, Where is your faith? And fear and wonder overcame them, and they said to one another, Who then is this, who gives orders even to the winds and the water and they do what he says?

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 26
text: And they came to the country of the Gerasenes, which is opposite Galilee.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 27
text: And when he had come to the land, there came to him a certain man from the town who had evil spirits; and for a long time he had had no clothing on, and was not living in a house but in the place of the dead.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 28
text: And when he saw Jesus, he gave a loud cry and went down on the earth before him and in a loud voice said, What have I to do with you, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? Do not be cruel to me.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 29
text: For he gave an order to the evil spirit to come out of the man. For frequently it would take a grip of him: and he was kept under control, and prisoned with chains; but parting the chains in two, he would be sent by the driving of the evil spirit into waste places.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 30
text: And Jesus said to him, What is your name? And he said, Legion; for a number of spirits had gone into him.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 31
text: And they made a request to him that he would not give them an order to go away into the deep.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 32
text: Now there was a great herd of pigs in that place, getting food on the mountain: and the evil spirits made a request to him that he would let them go into the pigs, and he let them.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 33
text: And the evil spirits came out of the man and went into the pigs: and the herd went rushing down a sharp slope into the water and came to destruction.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 34
text: And when the men who took care of them saw what had come about, they went quickly and gave news of it in the town and the country.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 35
text: And they went out to see what had taken place, and they came to Jesus and saw the man out of whom the evil spirits had gone, seated, clothed and with full use of his senses, at the feet of Jesus; and fear came on them.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 36
text: And those who had seen it gave them an account of how the man who had the evil spirits was made well.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 37
text: And all the people of the country of the Gerasenes made a request to him to go away from them; for they were in great fear: and he got into a boat and went back.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 38
text: But the man from whom the evil spirits had gone out had a great desire to be with him, but he sent him away, saying,

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 39
text: Go back to your house and let them have news of all the great things which God has done for you. And he went away, giving word through all the town of the great things which Jesus had done for him.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 40
text: And when Jesus went back, the people were glad to see him, for they were all waiting for him.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 41
text: Then there came a man named Jairus, who was a ruler in the Synagogue: and he went down at the feet of Jesus, desiring him to come to his house;

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 42
text: For he had an only daughter, about twelve years old, and she was near to death. But while he was on his way, the people were pushing to be near him.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 43
text: And a woman, who had had a flow of blood for twelve years, and had given all her money to medical men, and not one of them was able to make her well,

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 44
text: Came after him and put her hand on the edge of his robe, and straight away the flowing of her blood was stopped.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 45
text: And Jesus said, Who was touching me? And when they all said, It is not I, Peter and those who were with him said, Master, the people are pushing round you on every side.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 46
text: But Jesus said, Someone was touching me, for I had the feeling that power had gone out from me.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 47
text: And when the woman saw that she was not able to keep it secret, she came, shaking with fear, and falling down before him she made clear before all the people the reason for her touching him, and how she was made well straight away.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 48
text: And he said to her, Daughter, your faith has made you well; go in peace.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 49
text: While he was still talking, someone came from the house of the ruler of the Synagogue, saying, Your daughter is dead; do not go on troubling the Master.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 50
text: But Jesus at these words said to him, Have no fear, only have faith, and she will be made well.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 51
text: And when he came to the house he did not let any man go in with him, but only Peter and John and James, and the father of the girl and her mother.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 52
text: And all the people were weeping and crying for her; but he said, Do not be sad, for she is not dead, but sleeping.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 53
text: And they were laughing at him, being certain that she was dead.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 54
text: But he, taking her hand, said to her, My child, get up.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 55
text: And her spirit came back to her and she got up straight away: and he gave orders that food was to be given to her.

title: Luke Chapter 8 Verse 56
text: And her father and mother were full of wonder, but he gave orders to them to say nothing about it to anyone.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 1
text: And getting the twelve together, he gave them power and authority over all evil spirits and over diseases, to make them well.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 2
text: And he sent them out to be preachers of the kingdom of God, and to make well those who were ill.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 3
text: And he said to them, Take nothing for your journey, no stick or bag or bread or money, and do not take two coats.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 4
text: And if you go into a house, let that house be your resting-place till you go away.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 5
text: And if any people will not take you in, when you go away from that town, put off its dust from your feet for a witness against them.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 6
text: And they went away, journeying through all the towns, preaching the good news and making people free from diseases in all places.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 7
text: Now Herod the king had news of all these things: and he was in doubt, because it was said by some people that John had come back from the dead;

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 8
text: And by some, that Elijah had come; and by others, that one of the old prophets had come back to life.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 9
text: And Herod said, I put John to death: but who is this, of whom such stories are given to me? And he had a desire to see him.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 10
text: And the twelve, when they came back, gave him an account of what they had done. And he took them with him and went away from the people to a town named Beth-saida.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 11
text: But the people, getting news of it, went after him: and he was pleased to see them, and gave them teaching about the kingdom of God, and made those well who were in need of it.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 12
text: And the day went on; and the twelve came to him and said, Send these people away so that they may go into the towns and the country round about and get resting-places and food for themselves, for we are in a waste place.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 13
text: But he said, Give them food yourselves. And they said, We have only five cakes of bread and two fishes, if we do not go and get food for all these people.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 14
text: For there were about five thousand men. And he said to his disciples, Make them be seated in groups, about fifty to a group.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 15
text: And they did so, and made them all be seated.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 16
text: And he took the five cakes of bread and the two fishes and, looking up to heaven, he said words of blessing over them, and when they had been broken, he gave them to the disciples to give to the people.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 17
text: And they all took the food and had enough; and they took up of the broken bits which were over, twelve baskets full.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 18
text: And it came about that when he was in prayer, by himself, and the disciples were with him, he put a question to them, saying, Who do the people say I am?

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 19
text: And they, answering, said, John the Baptist; but others say Elijah; and others, that one of the old prophets has come back.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 20
text: And he said, But who do you say that I am? And Peter, answering, said, The Christ of God.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 21
text: But he gave them special orders, not to say this to any man;

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 22
text: Saying, The Son of man will undergo much and be put on one side by the rulers and the chief priests and the teachers of the law, and be put to death, and on the third day he will come back to life.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 23
text: And he said to them all, If any man has a desire to come after me, let him give up all, and take up his cross every day, and come after me.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 24
text: For whoever has a desire to keep his life will have it taken from him, but whoever gives up his life because of me, will keep it.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 25
text: For what profit will a man have if he gets all the world, but undergoes loss or destruction himself?

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 26
text: For if any man has a feeling of shame because of me or of my words, the Son of man will have shame because of him when he comes in his glory and the glory of the Father and of the holy angels.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 27
text: But truly I say to you, Some of those who are here now will have no taste of death till they see the kingdom of God.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 28
text: And about eight days after he had said these things, he took Peter and John and James with him and went up into the mountain for prayer.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 29
text: And while he was in prayer, his face was changed and his clothing became white and shining.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 30
text: And two men, Moses and Elijah, were talking with him;

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 31
text: Who were seen in glory and were talking of his death which was about to take place in Jerusalem.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 32
text: Now Peter and those who were with him were overcome with sleep: but when they were fully awake, they saw his glory and the two men who were with him.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 33
text: And when they were about to go away from him, Peter said to Jesus, Master, it is good for us to be here; let us make three tents, one for you and one for Moses and one for Elijah: having no knowledge of what he was saying.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 34
text: And while he said these things, the shade of a cloud came over them, and they were full of fear when they went into the cloud.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 35
text: And there was a voice from the cloud saying, This is my Son, the man of my selection; give ear to him.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 36
text: And after the voice was gone they saw that Jesus was by himself. And they kept quiet, and said nothing at that time to anyone of the things which they had seen.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 37
text: And on the day after, when they came down from the mountain, a great band of people came to him.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 38
text: And a man from among them, crying out, said, Master, I make a request to you, give a thought to my son, for he is my only child:

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 39
text: And see, a spirit takes him, and suddenly he gives a cry, twisted in pain and streaming at the lips, and when it goes away from him at last, he is marked as from blows.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 40
text: And I made a request to your disciples to send it out of him, but they were not able to do it.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 41
text: And Jesus said, O generation without faith and false in heart, how long will I have to be with you and put up with you? let your son come here.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 42
text: And while he was coming, he was pushed violently down and twisted by the evil spirit. But Jesus gave sharp orders to the unclean spirit, and made the boy well, and gave him back to his father.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 43
text: And they were full of wonder at the great power of God. But while they were all wondering at all the things which he did, he said to his disciples,

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 44
text: Let these words go deep into your ears, for the Son of man will be given up into the hands of men.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 45
text: But this saying was not clear to them and its sense was kept secret from them so that they were not able to see it: and they had fear of questioning him about it.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 46
text: Now there was a discussion among them about which of them would be the greatest.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 47
text: But when Jesus saw the reasoning of their hearts, he took a small child and put him by his side,

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 48
text: And said to them, Whoever gives honour to this child in my name, gives honour to me: and whoever gives honour to me, gives honour to him who sent me: for whoever is least among you all, that man is great.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 49
text: And John, answering, said, Master, we saw a man driving out evil spirits in your name, and we did not let him do it, because he was not one of us.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 50
text: But Jesus said to him, Let him do it, for he who is not against you is for you.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 51
text: And it came about that when the days were near for him to be taken up, his face was turned to go to Jerusalem,

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 52
text: And he sent men before: and they came to a small town of Samaria to make ready for him.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 53
text: But they would not have him there, because he was clearly going to Jerusalem.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 54
text: And when his disciples, James and John, saw this, they said, Lord, may we send fire from heaven and put an end to them?

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 55
text: But turning round he said sharp words to them.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 56
text: And they went to another small town.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 57
text: And when they were on the way, a certain man said to him, I will come after you wherever you go.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 58
text: And Jesus said to him, Foxes have holes and the birds of the air have resting-places, but the Son of man has nowhere to put his head.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 59
text: And he said to another, Come after me. But he said, Lord, let me first go and give the last honours to my father.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 60
text: But he said to him, Let the dead take care of their dead; it is for you to go and give news of the kingdom of God.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 61
text: And another man said, I will come with you, Lord, but first let me say a last good-day to those who are at my house.

title: Luke Chapter 9 Verse 62
text: But Jesus said, No man, having put his hand to the plough and looking back, is good enough for the kingdom of God.

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 1
text: Now after these things, the Lord made selection of seventy others and sent them before him, two together, into every town and place where he himself was about to come.

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 2
text: And he said to them, There is much grain ready to be cut, but not enough workers: so make prayer to the Lord of the grain-fields that he will send workers to get in the grain.

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 3
text: Go on your way: see, I send you out like lambs among wolves.

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 4
text: Take no bag for money or for food, and no shoes; say no word to any man on the way.

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 5
text: And whenever you go into a house, first say, Peace be to this house.

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 6
text: And if a son of peace is there, your peace will be with him: but if not, it will come back to you again.

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 7
text: And keep in that same house, taking what food and drink they give you: for the worker has a right to his reward. Do not go from house to house.

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 8
text: And into whatever town you go, if they take you in, take whatever food is given to you:

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 9
text: And make well those in it who are ill and say to them, The kingdom of God is near to you.

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 10
text: But if you go into a town where they will not have you, go out into the streets of it and say,

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 11
text: Even the dust of your town, which is on our feet, we put off as a witness against you; but be certain of this, that the kingdom of God is near.

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 12
text: I say to you, It will be better in that day for Sodom than for that town.

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 13
text: A curse is on you, Chorazin! A curse is on you, Beth-saida! For if such works of power had been done in Tyre and Sidon as have been done in you, they would have been turned from their sins, in days gone by, seated in the dust.

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 14
text: But it will be better for Tyre and Sidon, in the day of judging, than for you.

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 15
text: And you, Capernaum, were you not lifted up to heaven? you will go down to hell.

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 16
text: Whoever gives ear to you, gives ear to me; and whoever is against you, is against me; and whoever is against me, is against him who sent me.

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 17
text: And the seventy came back with joy, saying, Lord, even the evil spirits are under our power in your name.

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 18
text: And he said, I was watching for Satan, falling from heaven like a star.

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 19
text: See, I have given you power to put your feet on snakes and evil beasts, and over all the strength of him who is against you: and nothing will do you damage.

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 20
text: Do not be glad, however, because you have power over spirits, but because your names are recorded in heaven.

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 21
text: In that same hour he was full of joy in the Holy Spirit and said, I give praise to you, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because you have kept these things secret from the wise and the men of learning, and have made them clear to little children: for so, O Father, it was pleasing in your eyes.

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 22
text: All things have been given to me by my Father: and no one has knowledge of the Son, but only the Father: and of the Father, but only the Son, and he to whom the Son will make it clear.

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 23
text: And, turning to the disciples, he said privately, Happy are the eyes which see the things you see:

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 24
text: For I say to you that numbers of prophets and kings have had a desire to see the things which you see, and have not seen them, and to have knowledge of the things which have come to your ears, and they had it not.

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 25
text: And a certain teacher of the law got up and put him to the test, saying, Master, what have I to do so that I may have eternal life?

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 26
text: And he said to him, What does the law say, in your reading of it?

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 27
text: And he, answering, said, Have love for the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your strength and with all your mind; and for your neighbour as for yourself.

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 28
text: And he said, You have given the right answer: do this and you will have life.

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 29
text: But he, desiring to put himself in the right, said to Jesus, And who is my neighbour?

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 30
text: And Jesus, answering him, said, A certain man was going down from Jerusalem to Jericho, and he got into the hands of thieves, who took his clothing and gave him cruel blows, and when they went away, he was half dead.

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 31
text: And by chance a certain priest was going down that way: and when he saw him, he went by on the other side.

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 32
text: And in the same way, a Levite, when he came to the place and saw him, went by on the other side.

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 33
text: But a certain man of Samaria, journeying that way, came where he was, and when he saw him, he was moved with pity for him,

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 34
text: And came to him and put clean linen round his wounds, with oil and wine; and he put him on his beast and took him to a house and took care of him.

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 35
text: And the day after he took two pennies and gave them to the owner of the house and said, Take care of him; and if this money is not enough, when I come again I will give you whatever more is needed.

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 36
text: Which of these three men, in your opinion, was neighbour to the man who came into the hands of thieves?

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 37
text: And he said, The one who had mercy on him. And Jesus said, Go and do the same.

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 38
text: Now, while they were on their way, he came to a certain town; and a woman named Martha took him into her house.

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 39
text: And she had a sister, by name Mary, who took her seat at the Lord's feet and gave attention to his words.

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 40
text: But Martha had her hands full of the work of the house, and she came to him and said, Lord, is it nothing to you that my sister has let me do all the work? Say to her that she is to give me some help.

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 41
text: But the Lord, answering, said to her, Martha, Martha, you are full of care and troubled about such a number of things:

title: Luke Chapter 10 Verse 42
text: Little is needed, or even one thing only: for Mary has taken that good part, which will not be taken away from her.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 1
text: And it came about that he was in prayer in a certain place, and when he came to an end, one of his disciples said to him, Lord, will you give us teaching about prayer, as John did to his disciples?

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 2
text: And he said to them, When you say your prayers, say, Father, may your name be kept holy and your kingdom come.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 3
text: Give us every day bread for our needs.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 4
text: May we have forgiveness for our sins, as we make free all those who are in debt to us. And let us not be put to the test.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 5
text: And he said to them, Which of you, having a friend, would go to him in the middle of the night and say to him, Friend, let me have three cakes of bread;

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 6
text: Because a friend of mine has come to me on a journey, and I have nothing to put before him;

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 7
text: And he, from inside the house, would say in answer, Do not be a trouble to me; the door is now shut, and my children are with me in bed; it is not possible for me to get up and give to you?

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 8
text: I say to you, Though he will not get up and give to him, because he is his friend, still, if he keeps on making his request, he will get up and give him as much as he has need of.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 9
text: And I say to you, Make requests, and they will be answered; what you are searching for, you will get; when you give the sign, the door will be open to you.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 10
text: For to everyone who makes a request, it will be given; and he who is searching will get his desire; and to him who gives the sign, the door will be open.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 11
text: And which of you, being a father, will give a stone to his son, who makes request for bread? or for a fish, will give him a snake?

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 12
text: Or for an egg, will give him a scorpion?

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 13
text: If, then, you who are evil are able to give good things to your children, how much more will your Father in heaven give the Holy Spirit to those who make request to him?

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 14
text: And he was sending an evil spirit out of a man who was without the power of talking. And it came about that when the spirit had gone the man had the power of talking; and the people were full of wonder.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 15
text: But some of them said, He sends out evil spirits by Beelzebul, the ruler of evil spirits.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 16
text: And others, testing him, were looking for a sign from heaven from him.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 17
text: But he, having knowledge of their thoughts, said to them, Every kingdom in which there is division is made waste; and a house in which there is division comes to destruction.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 18
text: If, then, Satan is at war with himself, how will he keep his kingdom? because you say that I send evil spirits out of men by the help of Beelzebul.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 19
text: And if I, by Beelzebul, send out evil spirits, by whose help do your sons send them out? so let them be your judges.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 20
text: But if I, by the finger of God, send out evil spirits, then the kingdom of God has overtaken you.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 21
text: When the strong man armed keeps watch over his house, then his goods are safe:

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 22
text: But when one who is stronger makes an attack on him and overcomes him, he takes away his instruments of war, in which he had put his faith, and makes division of his goods.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 23
text: He who is not with me is against me, and he who will not give me help in getting people together is driving them away.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 24
text: The unclean spirit, when he has gone out of a man, goes through dry places, looking for rest; and when he does not get it, he says, I will go back to my house from which I came.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 25
text: And when he comes, he sees that it has been made fair and clean.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 26
text: Then he goes and gets seven other spirits more evil than himself, and they go in, and take their places there: and the last condition of that man is worse than the first.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 27
text: And it came about that when he said these things, a certain woman among the people said in a loud voice, Happy is the body which gave you birth, and the breasts from which you took milk.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 28
text: But he said, More happy are they who give hearing to the word of God and keep it.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 29
text: And when a great number of people came together to him, he said, This generation is an evil generation: it is looking for a sign and no sign will be given to it but the sign of Jonah.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 30
text: For even as Jonah became a sign to the Ninevites, so will the Son of man be to this generation.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 31
text: The queen of the South will come up on the day of judging and give her decision against the men of this generation: for she came from the ends of the earth to give ear to the wisdom of Solomon; and now something greater than Solomon is here.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 32
text: The men of Nineveh will come up in the day of judging and give their decision against this generation: for they were turned away from their sins at the preaching of Jonah; but now something greater than Jonah is here.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 33
text: No man, when the light has been lighted, puts it in a secret place, or under a vessel, but on its table, so that those who come in may see the light.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 34
text: The light of the body is the eye: when your eye is true, all your body is full of light; but when it is evil, your body is dark.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 35
text: So take care that the light which is in you is not dark.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 36
text: If, then, all your body is light, with no part of it dark, it will be completely full of light, as when a flame with its bright shining gives you light.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 37
text: Now, while he was talking, a Pharisee made a request that he would come to a meal with him; and he went in and took his seat at the meal.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 38
text: And when the Pharisee saw it, he was surprised because he came to the meal without first washing himself.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 39
text: And the Lord said to him, You Pharisees make the outside of the cup and the plate clean; but inside you are thieves and full of evil.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 40
text: O you foolish ones! did not he who made the outside in the same way make the inside?

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 41
text: But if you give to the poor such things as you are able, then all things are clean to you.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 42
text: But a curse is on you, Pharisees! for you make men give a tenth of every sort of plant, and give no thought to right and the love of God; but it is right for you to do these things, and not let the others be undone.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 43
text: A curse is on you, Pharisees! for your desires are for the most important seats in the Synagogues and for words of respect said to you in the market-place.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 44
text: A curse is on you! for you are like the resting-places of dead men, which are not seen, and men go walking over them without knowledge of it.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 45
text: And one of the teachers of the law, answering, said to him, Master, in saying this, you give a bad name to us as to them.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 46
text: And he said, A curse is on you, teachers of the law! for while other men are crushed under the weight of the rules you make for them, you yourselves do not put so much as one finger to them.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 47
text: A curse is on you! for you make resting-places for the bodies of the prophets, but your fathers put them to death.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 48
text: So you are witnesses and give approval to the work of your fathers; for they put them to death and you make their last resting-places.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 49
text: For this reason the wisdom of God has said, I will send them prophets and teachers, and to some of them they will give death and cruel pains;

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 50
text: So that punishment may come on this generation for the blood of all the prophets which was given from the earliest days;

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 51
text: From the blood of Abel to the blood of Zachariah, who was put to death between the altar and the Temple. Yes, I say to you, It will come on this generation.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 52
text: A curse is on you, teachers of the law! for you have taken away the key of knowledge: you did not go in yourselves, and you got in the way of those who were going in.

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 53
text: And when he had come out of that place, the scribes and the Pharisees came round him angrily, questioning him about more things;

title: Luke Chapter 11 Verse 54
text: And watching him, for a chance to get something from his words which might be used against him.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 1
text: At that time, when thousands of the people had come together, in such numbers that they were crushing one another, he said first to his disciples, Have nothing to do with the leaven of the Pharisees, which is deceit.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 2
text: But nothing is covered up, which will not come to light, or secret, which will not be made clear.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 3
text: So, whatever you have said in the dark, will come to men's hearing in the light, and what you have said secretly inside the house, will be made public from the house-tops.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 4
text: And I say to you, my friends, Have no fear of those who may put the body to death, and are able to do no more than that.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 5
text: But I will make clear to you of whom you are to be in fear: of him who after death has power to send you to hell; yes, truly I say, Have fear of him.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 6
text: Are not five sparrows given in exchange for two farthings? and God has every one of them in mind.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 7
text: But even the hairs of your head are numbered. Have no fear: you are of more value than a flock of sparrows.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 8
text: And I say to you that to everyone who gives witness to me before men, the Son of man will give witness before the angels of God.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 9
text: But if anyone says before men that he has no knowledge of me, I will say that I have no knowledge of him before the angels of God.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 10
text: And if anyone says a word against the Son of man, he will have forgiveness: but for him who says evil words against the Holy Spirit, there will be no forgiveness.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 11
text: And when they take you before the Synagogues and the authorities and the rulers, take no thought about what answers you will give, or what you will say:

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 12
text: For the Holy Spirit will make clear to you in that very hour what to say.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 13
text: And one of the people said to him, Master, give an order to my brother to make division of the heritage with me.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 14
text: But he said, Man, who made me a judge or a maker of decisions for you?

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 15
text: And he said to them, Take care to keep yourselves free from the desire for property; for a man's life is not made up of the number of things which he has.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 16
text: And he said to them, in a story, The land of a certain man of great wealth was very fertile:

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 17
text: And he said to himself, What is to be done? for I have no place in which to put all my fruit.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 18
text: And he said, This I will do: I will take down my store-houses and make greater ones, and there I will put all my grain and my goods.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 19
text: And I will say to my soul, Soul, you have a great amount of goods in store, enough for a number of years; be at rest, take food and wine and be happy.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 20
text: But God said to him, You foolish one, tonight I will take your soul from you, and who then will be the owner of all the things which you have got together?

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 21
text: So that is what comes to the man who gets wealth for himself, and has not wealth in the eyes of God.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 22
text: And he said to his disciples, For this reason I say to you, Take no thought for your life, about what food you will take, or for your body, how it may be clothed.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 23
text: Is not life more than food, and the body than its clothing?

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 24
text: Give thought to the ravens; they do not put seeds into the earth, or get together grain; they have no store-houses or buildings; and God gives them their food: of how much greater value are you than the birds!

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 25
text: And which of you by taking thought is able to make himself any taller?

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 26
text: If, then, you are not able to do even that which is least, why are you troubled about the rest?

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 27
text: Give thought to the flowers: they do no work, they make no thread; and still I say to you, Even Solomon, in all his glory, was not clothed like one of these.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 28
text: But if God gives such clothing to the grass in the field, which today is living, and tomorrow will be burned in the oven, how much more will he give clothing to you, O men of little faith?

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 29
text: And do not give overmuch thought to your food and drink, and let not your mind be full of doubts.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 30
text: For the nations of the world go in search of all these things: but your Father has knowledge that you have need of them.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 31
text: But let your chief care be for his kingdom, and these other things will be given to you in addition.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 32
text: Have no fear, little flock, for it is your Father's good pleasure to give you the kingdom.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 33
text: Give what property you have in exchange for money, and give the money to the poor; make for yourselves money-bags which will not get old, wealth stored up in heaven which will be yours for ever, where thieves will not come nor worms put it to destruction.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 34
text: For where your wealth is, there will your heart be.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 35
text: Be ready, dressed as for a journey, with your lights burning.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 36
text: And be like men who are looking for their lord, when he comes back from the bride-feast; so that when he comes to the door, it will be open to him quickly.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 37
text: Happy are those servants who are watching when the lord comes; truly I say to you, he will make himself their servant and, placing them at the table, he will come out and give them food.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 38
text: And if he comes in the second division of the night or in the third, and they are watching for him, happy are those servants.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 39
text: But be certain of this, that if the master of the house had had knowledge of the time when the thief was coming, he would have been watching, and would not have let his house be broken into.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 40
text: So be ready: for the Son of man is coming at a time when you are not looking for him.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 41
text: And Peter said to him, Lord, are these words said to us only, or to all men?

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 42
text: And the Lord said, Who then is the wise and responsible servant whom his lord will put in control of his family, to give them their food at the right time?

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 43
text: Happy is that servant who, when his lord comes, is doing so.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 44
text: Truly I say to you, he will put him in control of all his goods.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 45
text: But if that servant says to himself, My lord is a long time coming; and goes about giving blows to the men-servants and the women-servants, feasting and taking overmuch wine;

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 46
text: The lord of that servant will come at a time when he is not looking for him, and at an hour when he is not ready for him, and he will have him cut in two and will give him his part in the fate of those who have no faith;

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 47
text: And the servant who had knowledge of his lord's desires and was not ready for him and did not do as he was ordered, will be given a great number of blows;

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 48
text: But he who, without knowledge, did things for which punishment is given, will get only a small number of blows. The man to whom much is given, will have to give much; if much is given into his care, of him more will be requested.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 49
text: I came to send a fire on the earth, and it may even now have been lighted.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 50
text: But there is a baptism which I have to undergo; and how am I kept back till it is complete!

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 51
text: Is it your opinion that I have come to give peace on earth? I say to you, No, but division:

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 52
text: For from this time, a family of five in one house will be on opposite sides, three against two and two against three.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 53
text: They will be at war, the father against his son, and the son against his father; mother against daughter, and daughter against mother; mother-in-law against daughter-in-law, and daughter-in-law against mother-in-law.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 54
text: Then he said to the people, When you see a cloud coming up in the west, straight away you say, There will be rain; and so it is.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 55
text: And when you see a south wind blowing, you say, There will be heat; and so it is.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 56
text: O false ones! the face of the earth and the heaven is clear to you; how is it that the signs of these times are not as clear to you?

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 57
text: And why are you, in your hearts, unable to be judges of what is right?

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 58
text: For if anyone has a cause at law against you, and you are going with him before the ruler, make an attempt, on the way, to come to an agreement with him, for if you do not, he may take you before the judge and the judge will give you up to the police, and they will put you in prison.

title: Luke Chapter 12 Verse 59
text: I say to you, You will not come out of it till you have made payment to the very last farthing.

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 1
text: Now some people who were there at that time, gave him an account of how the blood of some Galilaeans had been mixed by Pilate with their offerings.

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 2
text: And he, in answer, said to them, Are you of the opinion that these Galilaeans were worse than all other Galilaeans, because these things were done to them?

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 3
text: I say to you, It is not so: but if your hearts are not changed, you will all come to the same end.

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 4
text: Or those eighteen men who were crushed by the fall of the tower of Siloam, were they worse than all the other men living in Jerusalem?

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 5
text: I say to you, It is not so: but if your hearts are not changed, you will all come to an end in the same way.

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 6
text: And he made up this story for them: A certain man had a fig-tree in his garden, and he came to get fruit from it, and there was no fruit.

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 7
text: And he said to the gardener, See, for three years I have been looking for fruit from this tree, and I have not had any: let it be cut down; why is it taking up space?

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 8
text: And he said, Lord, let it be for this year, and I will have the earth turned up round it, and put animal waste on it, to make it fertile:

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 9
text: And if, after that, it has fruit, it is well; if not, let it be cut down.

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 10
text: And he was teaching in one of the Synagogues on the Sabbath.

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 11
text: And there was a woman who had had a disease for eighteen years; she was bent, and was not able to make herself straight.

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 12
text: And when Jesus saw her, he said to her, Woman, you are made free from your disease.

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 13
text: And he put his hands on her, and she was made straight, and gave praise to God.

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 14
text: And the ruler of the Synagogue was angry because Jesus had made her well on the Sabbath, and he said to the people, There are six days in which men may do work: so come on those days to be made well, and not on the Sabbath.

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 15
text: But the Lord gave him an answer and said, O you false men! do you not, every one of you, on the Sabbath, let loose his ox and his ass and take it to the water?

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 16
text: And is it not right for this daughter of Abraham, who has been in the power of Satan for eighteen years, to be made free on the Sabbath?

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 17
text: And when he said these things, those who were against him were shamed, and all the people were full of joy because of the great things which were done by him.

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 18
text: Then he said, What is the kingdom of God like? what comparison may I make of it?

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 19
text: It is like a grain of mustard seed which a man took and put in his garden, and it became a tree, and the birds of heaven made their resting-places in its branches.

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 20
text: And again he said, What is the kingdom of God like?

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 21
text: It is like leaven, which a woman put into three measures of meal, and it was all leavened.

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 22
text: And he went on his way, through towns and country places, teaching and journeying to Jerusalem.

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 23
text: And someone said to him, Lord, will only a small number have salvation? And he said to them,

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 24
text: Do your best to go in by the narrow door, for I say to you, A number will make the attempt to go in, but will not be able to do so.

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 25
text: When the master of the house has got up, and the door has been shut, and you, still outside, give blows on the door, saying, Lord, let us in; he will make answer and say, I have no knowledge of where you come from.

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 26
text: Then you will say, We have taken food and drink with you, and you were teaching in our streets.

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 27
text: But he will say, Truly, I have no knowledge of you or where you come from; go away from me, you workers of evil.

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 28
text: There will be weeping and cries of sorrow when you see Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, and all the prophets, in the kingdom of God, but you yourselves are shut outside.

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 29
text: And they will come from the east and from the west, from the north and from the south, and take their places in the kingdom of God.

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 30
text: And the last will be first, and the first will be last.

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 31
text: At that time, certain Pharisees came to him and said, Go away from this place, because Herod's purpose is to put you to death.

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 32
text: And he said, Go and say to that fox, I send out evil spirits and do works of mercy today and tomorrow, and on the third day my work will be complete.

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 33
text: But I have to go on my way today and tomorrow and the third day, for it is not right for a prophet to come to his death outside Jerusalem.

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 34
text: O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, putting to death the prophets, and stoning those who were sent to her! again and again would I have taken your children to myself, as a bird takes her young ones under her wings, but you would not!

title: Luke Chapter 13 Verse 35
text: Now see, your house is waste, and I say to you, You will not see me again till you say, A blessing on him who comes in the name of the Lord.

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 1
text: And it came about that when he went into the house of one of the chief Pharisees on the Sabbath, to have a meal, they were watching him.

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 2
text: And a certain man was there who had a disease.

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 3
text: And Jesus, answering, said to the scribes and Pharisees, Is it right to make people well on the Sabbath or not?

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 4
text: But they said nothing. And he made him well and sent him away.

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 5
text: And he said to them, Which of you, whose ox or ass has got into a water-hole, will not straight away get him out on the Sabbath?

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 6
text: And they had no answer to that question.

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 7
text: And he gave teaching in the form of a story to the guests who came to the feast, when he saw how they took the best seats; saying to them,

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 8
text: When you get a request to come to a feast, do not take the best seat, for a more important man than you may be coming,

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 9
text: And then the giver of the feast will come to you and say, Give your place to this man; and you, with shame, will have to take the lowest seat.

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 10
text: But when you come, go and take the lowest seat, so that when the giver of the feast comes, he may say to you, Friend, come up higher; and then you will have honour in the eyes of all the others who are there.

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 11
text: For every man who gives himself a high place will be put down, but he who takes a low place will be lifted up.

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 12
text: And he said to the master of the house, When you give a feast, do not send for your friends and your brothers and your family or your neighbours who have wealth, for they may give a feast for you, and so you will get a reward.

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 13
text: But when you give a feast, send for the poor and the blind and those who are broken in body:

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 14
text: And you will have a blessing, because they will not be able to give you any payment, and you will get your reward when the upright come back from the dead.

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 15
text: And, hearing these words, one of those who were at table with him said to him, Happy is the man who will be a guest in the kingdom of God.

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 16
text: And he said to them, A certain man gave a great feast, and sent word of it to a number of people.

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 17
text: And when the time had come, he sent his servants to say to them, Come, for all things are now ready.

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 18
text: And they all gave reasons why they were not able to come. The first said to him, I have got a new field, and it is necessary for me to go and see it: I am full of regret that I am unable to come.

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 19
text: And another said, I have got some cattle, and I am going to make a test of them: I am full of regret that I am unable to come.

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 20
text: And another said, I have been married, and so I am not able to come.

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 21
text: And the servant came back and gave his master an account of these things. Then the master of the house was angry and said to the servant, Go out quickly into the streets of the town and get the poor, the blind, and those who are broken in body.

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 22
text: And the servant said, Lord, your orders have been done, and still there is room.

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 23
text: And the lord said to the servant, Go out into the roads and the fields, and make them come in, so that my house may be full.

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 24
text: For I say to you that not one of those who were requested to come will have a taste of my feast.

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 25
text: Now a great number of people went with him.

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 26
text: And turning round, he said to them, If any man comes to me, and has not hate for his father and mother and wife and children and brothers and sisters, and even for his life, he may not be my disciple.

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 27
text: Whoever does not take up his cross and come after me may not be my disciple.

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 28
text: For which of you, desiring to put up a tower, does not first give much thought to the price, if he will have enough to make it complete?

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 29
text: For fear that if he makes a start and is not able to go on with it to the end, all who see it will be laughing at him,

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 30
text: And saying, This man made a start at building and is not able to make it complete.

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 31
text: Or what king, going to war with another king, will not first take thought if he will be strong enough, with ten thousand men, to keep off him who comes against him with twenty thousand?

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 32
text: Or while the other is still a great distance away, he sends representatives requesting conditions of peace.

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 33
text: And so whoever is not ready to give up all he has may not be my disciple.

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 34
text: For salt is good, but if the taste goes from it, of what use is it?

title: Luke Chapter 14 Verse 35
text: It is no good for the land or for the place of waste; no one has a use for it. He who has ears, let him give ear.

title: Luke Chapter 15 Verse 1
text: Now all the tax-farmers and sinners came near to give ear to him.

title: Luke Chapter 15 Verse 2
text: And the Pharisees and scribes were angry, saying, This man gives approval to sinners, and takes food with them.

title: Luke Chapter 15 Verse 3
text: And he made a story for them, saying,

title: Luke Chapter 15 Verse 4
text: What man of you, having a hundred sheep, if one of them gets loose and goes away, will not let the ninety-nine be in the waste land by themselves, and go after the wandering one, till he sees where it is?

title: Luke Chapter 15 Verse 5
text: And when he has got it again, he takes it in his arms with joy.

title: Luke Chapter 15 Verse 6
text: And when he gets back to his house, he sends for his neighbours and friends, saying to them, Be glad with me, for I have got back my sheep which had gone away.

title: Luke Chapter 15 Verse 7
text: I say to you that even so there will be more joy in heaven when one sinner is turned away from his wrongdoing, than for ninety-nine good men, who have no need of a change of heart.

title: Luke Chapter 15 Verse 8
text: Or what woman, having ten bits of silver, if one bit has gone from her hands, will not get a light, and go through her house, searching with care till she sees it?

title: Luke Chapter 15 Verse 9
text: And when she has it again, she gets her friends and neighbours together, saying, Be glad with me, for I have got back the bit of silver which had gone from me.

title: Luke Chapter 15 Verse 10
text: Even so, I say to you, There is joy among the angels of God, when one sinner is turned away from his wrongdoing.

title: Luke Chapter 15 Verse 11
text: And he said, A certain man had two sons:

title: Luke Chapter 15 Verse 12
text: And the younger of them said to his father, Father, give me that part of your property which will be mine. And he made division of his goods between them.

title: Luke Chapter 15 Verse 13
text: And not long after, the younger son got together everything which was his and took a journey into a far-away country, and there all his money went in foolish living.

title: Luke Chapter 15 Verse 14
text: And when everything was gone, there was no food to be had in that country, and he was in need.

title: Luke Chapter 15 Verse 15
text: And he went and put himself into the hands of one of the people of that country, and he sent him into his fields to give the pigs their food.

title: Luke Chapter 15 Verse 16
text: And so great was his need that he would have been glad to take the pigs' food, and no one gave him anything.

title: Luke Chapter 15 Verse 17
text: But when he came to his senses, he said, What numbers of my father's servants have bread enough, and more, while I am near to death here through need of food!

title: Luke Chapter 15 Verse 18
text: I will get up and go to my father, and will say to him, Father, I have done wrong, against heaven and in your eyes:

title: Luke Chapter 15 Verse 19
text: I am no longer good enough to be named your son: make me like one of your servants.

title: Luke Chapter 15 Verse 20
text: And he got up and went to his father. But while he was still far away, his father saw him and was moved with pity for him and went quickly and took him in his arms and gave him a kiss.

title: Luke Chapter 15 Verse 21
text: And his son said to him, Father, I have done wrong, against heaven and in your eyes: I am no longer good enough to be named your son.

title: Luke Chapter 15 Verse 22
text: But the father said to his servants, Get out the first robe quickly, and put it on him, and put a ring on his hand and shoes on his feet:

title: Luke Chapter 15 Verse 23
text: And get the fat young ox and put it to death, and let us have a feast, and be glad.

title: Luke Chapter 15 Verse 24
text: For this, my son, who was dead, is living again; he had gone away from me, and has come back. And they were full of joy.

title: Luke Chapter 15 Verse 25
text: Now the older son was in the field: and when he came near the house, the sounds of music and dancing came to his ears.

title: Luke Chapter 15 Verse 26
text: And he sent for one of the servants, questioning him about what it might be.

title: Luke Chapter 15 Verse 27
text: And he said to him, Your brother has come; and your father has had the young ox put to death because he has come back safely.

title: Luke Chapter 15 Verse 28
text: But he was angry and would not go in; and his father came out and made a request to him to come in.

title: Luke Chapter 15 Verse 29
text: But he made answer and said to his father, See, all these years I have been your servant, doing your orders in everything: and you never gave me even a young goat so that I might have a feast with my friends:

title: Luke Chapter 15 Verse 30
text: But when this your son came, who has been wasting your property with bad women, you put to death the fat young ox for him.

title: Luke Chapter 15 Verse 31
text: And he said to him, Son, you are with me at all times, and all I have is yours.

title: Luke Chapter 15 Verse 32
text: But it was right to be glad and to have a feast; for this your brother, who was dead, is living again; he had gone away and has come back.

title: Luke Chapter 16 Verse 1
text: And another time he said to the disciples, There was a certain man of great wealth who had a servant; and it was said to him that this servant was wasting his goods.

title: Luke Chapter 16 Verse 2
text: And he sent for him and said, What is this which is said about you? give me an account of all you have done, for you will no longer be the manager of my property.

title: Luke Chapter 16 Verse 3
text: And the servant said to himself, What am I to do now that my lord takes away my position? I have not enough strength for working in the fields, and I would be shamed if I made requests for money from people in the streets.

title: Luke Chapter 16 Verse 4
text: I have come to a decision what to do, so that when I am put out of my position they will take me into their houses.

title: Luke Chapter 16 Verse 5
text: And sending for every one who was in debt to his lord he said to the first, What is the amount of your debt to my lord?

title: Luke Chapter 16 Verse 6
text: And he said, A hundred measures of oil. And he said, Take your account straight away and put down fifty.

title: Luke Chapter 16 Verse 7
text: Then he said to another, What is the amount of your debt? And he said, A hundred measures of grain. And he said to him, Take your account and put down eighty.

title: Luke Chapter 16 Verse 8
text: And his lord was pleased with the false servant, because he had been wise; for the sons of this world are wiser in relation to their generation than the sons of light.

title: Luke Chapter 16 Verse 9
text: And I say to you, Make friends for yourselves through the wealth of this life, so that when it comes to an end, you may be taken into the eternal resting-places.

title: Luke Chapter 16 Verse 10
text: He who is true in a little, is true in much; he who is false in small things, is false in great.

title: Luke Chapter 16 Verse 11
text: If, then, you have not been true in your use of the wealth of this life, who will give into your care the true wealth?

title: Luke Chapter 16 Verse 12
text: And if you have not been true in your care of the property of other people, who will give you that which is yours?

title: Luke Chapter 16 Verse 13
text: No man may be a servant to two masters: for he will have hate for the one and love for the other; or he will keep to the one and have no respect for the other. You may not be servants of God and of wealth.

title: Luke Chapter 16 Verse 14
text: And the Pharisees, who had a great love of money, hearing these things, were making sport of him.

title: Luke Chapter 16 Verse 15
text: And he said, You take care to seem right in the eyes of men, but God sees your hearts: and those things which are important in the opinion of men, are evil in the eyes of God.

title: Luke Chapter 16 Verse 16
text: The law and the prophets were till John: but then came the preaching of the kingdom of God, and everyone makes his way into it by force.

title: Luke Chapter 16 Verse 17
text: But heaven and earth will come to an end before the smallest letter of the law may be dropped out.

title: Luke Chapter 16 Verse 18
text: Everyone who puts away his wife and takes another, is a false husband: and he who is married to a woman whose husband has put her away, is no true husband to her.

title: Luke Chapter 16 Verse 19
text: Now there was a certain man of great wealth, who was dressed in fair clothing of purple and delicate linen, and was shining and glad every day.

title: Luke Chapter 16 Verse 20
text: And a certain poor man, named Lazarus, was stretched out at his door, full of wounds,

title: Luke Chapter 16 Verse 21
text: Desiring the broken bits of food which came from the table of the man of wealth; and even the dogs came and put their tongues on his wounds.

title: Luke Chapter 16 Verse 22
text: And in time the poor man came to his end, and angels took him to Abraham's breast. And the man of wealth came to his end, and was put in the earth.

title: Luke Chapter 16 Verse 23
text: And in hell, being in great pain, lifting up his eyes he saw Abraham, far away, and Lazarus on his breast.

title: Luke Chapter 16 Verse 24
text: And he gave a cry and said, Father Abraham, have mercy on me and send Lazarus, so that he may put the end of his finger in water and put it on my tongue, for I am cruelly burning in this flame.

title: Luke Chapter 16 Verse 25
text: But Abraham said, Keep in mind, my son, that when you were living, you had your good things, while Lazarus had evil things: but now, he is comforted and you are in pain.

title: Luke Chapter 16 Verse 26
text: And in addition, there is a deep division fixed between us and you, so that those who might go from here to you are not able to do so, and no one may come from you to us.

title: Luke Chapter 16 Verse 27
text: And he said, Father, it is my request that you will send him to my father's house;

title: Luke Chapter 16 Verse 28
text: For I have five brothers; and let him give them an account of these things, so that they may not come to this place of pain.

title: Luke Chapter 16 Verse 29
text: But Abraham said, They have Moses and the prophets; let them give ear to what they say.

title: Luke Chapter 16 Verse 30
text: And he said, No, father Abraham, but if someone went to them from the dead, their hearts would be changed.

title: Luke Chapter 16 Verse 31
text: And he said to him, If they will not give attention to Moses and the prophets, they will not be moved even if someone comes back from the dead.

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 1
text: And he said to his disciples, It is necessary for causes of trouble to come about, but unhappy is he by whom they come.

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 2
text: It would be well for him if a great stone was put round his neck and he was dropped into the sea, before he made trouble for any of these little ones.

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 3
text: Give attention to yourselves: if your brother does wrong, say a sharp word to him; and if he has sorrow for his sin, let him have forgiveness.

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 4
text: And if he does you wrong seven times in a day, and seven times comes to you and says, I have regret for what I have done; let him have forgiveness.

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 5
text: And the twelve said to the Lord, Make our faith greater.

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 6
text: And the Lord said, If your faith was only as great as a grain of mustard seed, you might say to this tree, Be rooted up and planted in the sea; and it would be done.

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 7
text: But which of you, having a servant who is ploughing or keeping sheep, will say to him, when he comes in from the field, Come now and be seated and have a meal,

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 8
text: Will he not say, Get a meal for me, and make yourself ready and see to my needs till I have had my food and drink; and after that you may have yours?

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 9
text: Does he give praise to the servant because he did what was ordered?

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 10
text: In the same way, when you have done all the things which are given you to do, say, There is no profit in us, for we have only done what we were ordered to do.

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 11
text: And it came about that when they were on the way to Jerusalem he went through Samaria and Galilee.

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 12
text: And when he went into a certain small town he came across ten men who were lepers, and they, keeping themselves at a distance,

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 13
text: Said, in loud voices, Jesus, Master, have mercy on us.

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 14
text: And when he saw them he said, Go, and let the priests see you. And, while they were going, they were made clean.

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 15
text: And one of them, when he saw that he was clean, turning back, gave praise to God in a loud voice;

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 16
text: And, falling down on his face at the feet of Jesus, he gave the credit to him; and he was a man of Samaria.

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 17
text: And Jesus said, Were there not ten men who were made clean? where are the nine?

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 18
text: Have not any of them come back to give glory to God, but only this one from a strange land?

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 19
text: And he said to him, Get up, and go on your way; your faith has made you well.

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 20
text: And when the Pharisees put questions to him about when the kingdom of God would come, he gave them an answer and said, The kingdom of God will not come through observation:

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 21
text: And men will not say, See, it is here! or, There! for the kingdom of God is among you.

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 22
text: And he said to his disciples, The time will come when you will have a great desire to see one of the days of the Son of man, but you will not see it.

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 23
text: And if they say to you, See, it is there! or, It is here! do not go away, or go after them.

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 24
text: For as in a thunderstorm the bright light is seen from one end of the sky to the other, so will the Son of man be when his time comes.

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 25
text: But first, he will have to undergo much and be put on one side by this generation.

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 26
text: And as it was in the days of Noah, so will it be in the day of the Son of man.

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 27
text: They were feasting and taking wives and getting married, till the day of the overflowing of the waters, when Noah went into the ark, and they all came to destruction.

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 28
text: In the same way, in the days of Lot; they were feasting and trading, they were planting and building;

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 29
text: But on the day when Lot went out of Sodom, fire came down from heaven and destruction came on them all.

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 30
text: So will it be in the day of the revelation of the Son of man.

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 31
text: On that day, if anyone is on the roof of the house, and his goods are in the house, let him not go down to take them away; and let him who is in the field not go back to his house.

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 32
text: Keep in mind Lot's wife.

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 33
text: If anyone makes an attempt to keep his life, it will be taken from him, but if anyone gives up his life, he will keep it.

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 34
text: I say to you, In that night there will be two men sleeping in one bed, and one will be taken away and the other let go.

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 35
text: Two women will be crushing grain together; one will be taken away and the other let go.

title: Luke Chapter 17 Verse 37
text: And they, answering him, said, Where, Lord? And he said to them, Where the body is, there will the eagles come together.

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 1
text: And he made a story for them, the point of which was that men were to go on making prayer and not get tired;

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 2
text: Saying, There was a judge in a certain town, who had no fear of God or respect for man:

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 3
text: And there was a widow in that town, and she kept on coming to him and saying, Give me my right against the man who has done me wrong.

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 4
text: And for a time he would not: but later, he said to himself, Though I have no fear of God or respect for man,

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 5
text: Because this widow is a trouble to me, I will give her her right; for if not, I will be completely tired out by her frequent coming.

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 6
text: And the Lord said, Give ear to the words of the evil judge.

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 7
text: And will not God do right in the cause of his saints, whose cries come day and night to his ears, though he is long in doing it?

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 8
text: I say to you that he will quickly do right in their cause. But when the Son of man comes, will there be any faith on earth?

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 9
text: And he made this story for some people who were certain that they were good, and had a low opinion of others:

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 10
text: Two men went up to the Temple for prayer; one a Pharisee, and the other a tax-farmer.

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 11
text: The Pharisee, taking up his position, said to himself these words: God, I give you praise because I am not like other men, who take more than their right, who are evil-doers, who are untrue to their wives, or even like this tax-farmer.

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 12
text: Twice in the week I go without food; I give a tenth of all I have.

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 13
text: The tax-farmer, on the other hand, keeping far away, and not lifting up even his eyes to heaven, made signs of grief and said, God, have mercy on me, a sinner.

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 14
text: I say to you, This man went back to his house with God's approval, and not the other: for everyone who makes himself high will be made low and whoever makes himself low will be made high.

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 15
text: And they took their children to him, so that he might put his hands on them: but when the disciples saw it, they said sharp words to them

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 16
text: But Jesus sent for them, saying, Let the children come to me, and do not keep them away, for of such is the kingdom of heaven.

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 17
text: Truly I say to you, Whoever does not put himself under the kingdom of God like a little child, will not come into it at all.

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 18
text: And a certain ruler put a question to him, saying, Good Master, what have I to do so that I may have eternal life?

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 19
text: And Jesus said to him, Why do you say that I am good? No one is good, but only God.

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 20
text: You have knowledge of what the law says: Do not be untrue to your wife, Do not put anyone to death, Do not take what is not yours, Do not give false witness, Give honour to your father and mother.

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 21
text: And he said, All these things I have done from the time when I was a boy.

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 22
