text: And Jesus, hearing it, said to him, One thing you still have need of; get money for your goods, and give it away to the poor, and you will have wealth in heaven; and come after me.

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 23
text: But at these words he became very sad, for he had great wealth.

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 24
text: And Jesus, looking at him, said, How hard it is for those who have wealth to get into the kingdom of God!

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 25
text: It is simpler for a camel to go through the eye of a needle, than for a man who has much money to come into the kingdom of God.

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 26
text: And those who were present said, Then who may have salvation?

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 27
text: But he said, Things which are not possible with man are possible with God.

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 28
text: And Peter said, See, we have given up what is ours to come after you.

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 29
text: And he said to them, Truly I say to you, There is no man who has given up house or wife or brothers or father or mother or children, because of the kingdom of God,

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 30
text: Who will not get much more in this time, and in the world to come, eternal life.

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 31
text: And he took with him the twelve and said to them, Now we are going up to Jerusalem, and all the things which were said by the prophets will be done to the Son of man.

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 32
text: For he will be given up to the Gentiles, and will be made sport of and put to shame:

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 33
text: And he will be given cruel blows and put to death, and on the third day he will come back to life.

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 34
text: But they did not take in the sense of any of these words, and what he said was not clear to them, and their minds were not able to see it.

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 35
text: And it came about that when he got near Jericho, a certain blind man was seated by the side of the road, making requests for money from those who went by.

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 36
text: And hearing the sound of a great number of people going by, he said, What is this?

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 37
text: And they said to him, Jesus of Nazareth is going by.

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 38
text: And he said in a loud voice, Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me.

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 39
text: And those who were in front made protests and said to him, Be quiet: but he said all the more, O Son of David, have mercy on me.

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 40
text: And Jesus, stopping, gave orders that he was to come to him, and when he came near, he said to him,

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 41
text: What would you have me do for you? And he said, Lord, that I may be able to see again.

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 42
text: And Jesus said, See again: your faith has made you well.

title: Luke Chapter 18 Verse 43
text: And straight away he was able to see, and he went after him, giving glory to God; and all the people when they saw it gave praise to God.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 1
text: And he went into Jericho, and when he was going through it,

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 2
text: A man, named Zacchaeus, who was the chief tax-farmer, and a man of wealth,

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 3
text: Made an attempt to get a view of Jesus, and was not able to do so, because of the people, for he was a small man.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 4
text: And he went quickly in front of them and got up into a tree to see him, for he was going that way.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 5
text: And when Jesus came to the place, looking up, he said to him, Zacchaeus, be quick and come down, for I am coming to your house today.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 6
text: And he came down quickly, and took him into his house with joy.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 7
text: And when they saw it, they were all angry, saying, He has gone into the house of a sinner.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 8
text: And Zacchaeus, waiting before him, said to the Lord, See, Lord, half of my goods I give to the poor, and if I have taken anything from anyone wrongly, I give him back four times as much.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 9
text: And Jesus said to him, Today salvation has come to this house, for even he is a son of Abraham.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 10
text: For the Son of man came to make search for those who are wandering from the way, and to be their Saviour.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 11
text: And while they were giving ear to these words, he made another story for them, because he was near Jerusalem, and because they were of the opinion that the kingdom of God was coming straight away.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 12
text: So he said, A certain man of high birth went into a far-away country to get a kingdom for himself, and to come back.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 13
text: And he sent for ten of his servants and gave them ten pounds and said to them, Do business with this till I come.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 14
text: But his people had no love for him, and sent representatives after him, saying, We will not have this man for our ruler.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 15
text: And when he came back again, having got his kingdom, he gave orders for those servants to whom he had given the money to come to him, so that he might have an account of what business they had done.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 16
text: And the first came before him, saying, Lord, your pound has made ten pounds.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 17
text: And he said to him, You have done well, O good servant: because you have done well in a small thing you will have authority over ten towns.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 18
text: And another came, saying, Your pound has made five pounds.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 19
text: And he said, You will be ruler over five towns.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 20
text: And another came, saying, Lord, here is your pound, which I put away in a cloth;

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 21
text: Because I was in fear of you, for you are a hard man: you take up what you have not put down, and get in grain where you have not put seed.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 22
text: He said to him, By the words of your mouth you will be judged, you bad servant. You had knowledge that I am a hard man, taking up what I have not put down and getting in grain where I have not put seed;

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 23
text: Why then did you not put my money in a bank, so that when I came I would get it back with interest?

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 24
text: And he said to the others who were near, Take the pound away from him, and give it to the man who has ten.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 25
text: And they say to him, Lord, he has ten pounds.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 26
text: And I say to you that to everyone who has, more will be given, but from him who has not, even what he has will be taken away.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 27
text: And as for those who were against me, who would not have me for their ruler, let them come here, and be put to death before me.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 28
text: And when he had said this, he went on in front of them, going up to Jerusalem.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 29
text: And it came about that when he got near Beth-phage and Bethany by the mountain which is named the Mountain of Olives, he sent two of the disciples,

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 30
text: Saying, Go into the little town in front of you, and on going in you will see a young ass fixed with a cord, on which no man has ever been seated; let him loose and take him.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 31
text: And if anyone says to you, Why are you taking him? say, The Lord has need of him.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 32
text: And those whom he sent went away, and it was as he said.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 33
text: And when they were getting the young ass, the owners of it said to them, Why are you taking the young ass?

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 34
text: And they said, The Lord has need of him.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 35
text: And they took him to Jesus, and they put their clothing on the ass, and Jesus got on to him.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 36
text: And while he went on his way they put their clothing down on the road in front of him.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 37
text: And when he came near the foot of the Mountain of Olives, all the disciples with loud voices gave praise to God with joy, because of all the great works which they had seen;

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 38
text: Saying, A blessing on the King who comes in the name of the Lord; peace in heaven and glory in the highest.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 39
text: And some of the Pharisees among the people said to him, Master, make your disciples be quiet.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 40
text: And he said in answer, I say to you, if these men keep quiet, the very stones will be crying out.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 41
text: And when he got near and saw the town, he was overcome with weeping for it,

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 42
text: Saying, If you, even you, had knowledge today, of the things which give peace! but you are not able to see them.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 43
text: For the time will come when your attackers will put a wall round you, and come all round you and keep you in on every side,

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 44
text: And will make you level with the earth, and your children with you; and there will not be one stone resting on another in you, because you did not see that it was your day of mercy.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 45
text: And he went into the Temple and put out those who were trading there,

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 46
text: Saying to them, It has been said, My house is to be a house of prayer, but you have made it a hole of thieves.

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 47
text: And every day he was teaching in the Temple. But the chief priests and the scribes and the rulers of the people were attempting to put him to death;

title: Luke Chapter 19 Verse 48
text: But they were not able to do anything, because the people all kept near him, being greatly interested in his words.

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 1
text: And it came about on one of those days, when he was teaching the people in the Temple and preaching the good news,

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 2
text: That the chief priests and the scribes and the rulers of the people came to him and said, Make clear to us by what authority you do these things and who gave you this authority.

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 3
text: And in answer he said to them, I will put a question to you, and do you give me an answer:

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 4
text: The baptism of John, was it from heaven or of men?

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 5
text: And they said among themselves, If we say, From heaven; he will say, Why did you not have faith in him?

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 6
text: But if we say, Of men; we will be stoned by the people, for they are certain that John was a prophet.

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 7
text: And they made answer that they had no idea where it came from.

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 8
text: And Jesus said, And I will not make clear to you by what authority I do these things.

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 9
text: And he gave the people this story: A man made a vine-garden and gave the use of it to some field-workers and went into another country for a long time.

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 10
text: And at the right time he sent a servant to the workers to get part of the fruit from the vines; but the workmen gave him blows and sent him away with nothing.

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 11
text: And he sent another servant, and they gave blows to him in the same way, and put shame on him, and sent him away with nothing.

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 12
text: And he sent a third, and they gave him wounds and put him out.

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 13
text: And the lord of the garden said, What am I to do? I will send my dearly loved son; they may give respect to him.

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 14
text: But when the workmen saw him, they said to one another, This is he who will one day be the owner of the property: let us put him to death and the heritage will be ours.

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 15
text: And driving him out of the garden they put him to death. Now what will the lord do to these workmen?

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 16
text: He will come and put them to destruction and give the garden to others. And when he said this, they said, May it not be so.

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 17
text: But he, looking on them, said, Is it not in the Writings, The stone which the builders put on one side, the same has become the chief stone of the building?

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 18
text: Everyone falling on that stone will be broken, but the man on whom the stone comes down will be crushed to dust.

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 19
text: And the chief priests and the scribes made attempts to get their hands on him in that very hour; and they were in fear of the people, for they saw that he had made up this story against them.

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 20
text: And they kept watch on him, and sent out secret representatives, who were acting the part of good men, in order that they might get something from his words, on account of which they might give him up to the government and into the power of the ruler.

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 21
text: And they put a question to him, saying, Master, we are certain that your teaching and your words are right, and that you have no respect for a man's position, but you are teaching the true way of God:

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 22
text: Is it right for us to make payment of taxes to Caesar or not?

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 23
text: But he saw through their trick and said to them,

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 24
text: Let me see a penny. Whose image and name are on it? And they said, Caesar's.

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 25
text: And he said, Then give to Caesar the things which are Caesar's, and to God the things which are God's.

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 26
text: And they were not able to get anything from these words before the people: but they were full of wonder at his answer, and said nothing.

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 27
text: And some of the Sadducees came to him, who say that there is no coming back from the dead; and they said to him,

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 28
text: Master, Moses said that if a man's brother comes to his end, having a wife, but no children, his brother is to take the wife, and get a family for his brother.

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 29
text: Now there were seven brothers, and the first had a wife and came to his end, having no children;

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 30
text: And the second;

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 31
text: And the third took her; and in the same way, all the seven, without having any children, came to their end.

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 32
text: And last of all, the woman came to her end.

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 33
text: When they come back from the dead, whose wife will she be? for all the seven had her.

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 34
text: And Jesus said to them, The sons of this world are married and have wives;

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 35
text: But those to whom is given the reward of the world to come, and to come back from the dead, have no wives, and are not married;

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 36
text: And death has no more power over them, for they are equal to the angels, and are sons of God, being of those who will come back from the dead.

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 37
text: But even Moses made it clear that the dead come back to life, saying, in the story of the burning thorn-tree, The Lord, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 38
text: Now he is not the God of the dead but of the living: for all men are living to him.

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 39
text: And some of the scribes, in answer to this, said, Master, you have said well.

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 40
text: And they had fear of putting any more questions to him.

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 41
text: And he said to them, Why do they say that the Christ is the son of David?

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 42
text: For David himself says in the book of Psalms, The Lord said to my Lord, Take your seat at my right hand,

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 43
text: Till I put under your feet all those who are against you.

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 44
text: David then gives him the name of Lord, so how is it possible for him to be his son?

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 45
text: And in the hearing of all the people he said to his disciples,

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 46
text: Keep away from the scribes, whose pleasure it is to go about in long robes, and to have words of respect said to them in the market-places, and to take the chief seats in the Synagogues and the first places at feasts;

title: Luke Chapter 20 Verse 47
text: Who take the property of widows and before the eyes of men make long prayers; they will get a greater punishment.

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 1
text: And looking up, he saw the men of wealth putting their offerings in the money-box.

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 2
text: And he saw a certain poor widow putting in a farthing.

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 3
text: And he said, Truly I say to you, This poor widow has given more than all of them:

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 4
text: For they gave out of their wealth, having more than enough for themselves: but she, even out of her need, has put in all her living.

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 5
text: And some were talking about the Temple, how it was made fair with beautiful stones and with offerings, but he said,

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 6
text: As for these things which you see, the days will come when not one stone will be resting on another, but all will be broken down.

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 7
text: And they said to him, Master, when will these things be? and what sign will there be when these events are to take place?

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 8
text: And he said, Take care that you are not tricked: for a number of people will come in my name, saying, I am he; and, The time is near: do not go after them.

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 9
text: And when news of wars and troubled times comes to your ears, have no fear; for these things have to be, but the end will not be now.

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 10
text: Then he said to them, Nation will be moved against nation and kingdom against kingdom:

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 11
text: There will be great earth-shocks and outbursts of disease in a number of places, and men will be without food; and there will be wonders and great signs from heaven.

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 12
text: But before all this, they will take you and be very cruel to you, giving you up to the Synagogues and to prisons, taking you before kings and rulers, because of my name.

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 13
text: And it will be turned to a witness for you.

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 14
text: So take care not to be troubled before the time comes, about what answers you will give:

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 15
text: For I will give you words and wisdom, so that not one of those who are against you will be able to get the better of you, or to put you in the wrong.

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 16
text: But you will be given up even by your fathers and mothers, your brothers and relations and friends; and some of you will be put to death.

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 17
text: And you will be hated by all men, because of me.

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 18
text: But not a hair of your head will come to destruction.

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 19
text: By going through all these things, you will keep your lives.

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 20
text: But when you see armies all round about Jerusalem, then be certain that her destruction is near.

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 21
text: Then let those who are in Judaea go in flight to the mountains; and those who are in the middle of the town go out; and let not those who are in the country come in.

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 22
text: For these are the days of punishment, in which all the things in the Writings will be put into effect.

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 23
text: It will be hard for women who are with child, and for her with a baby at the breast, in those days. For great trouble will come on the land, and wrath on this people.

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 24
text: And they will be put to death with the sword, and will be taken as prisoners into all the nations; and Jerusalem will be crushed under the feet of the Gentiles, till the times of the Gentiles are complete.

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 25
text: And there will be signs in the sun and moon and stars; and on the earth, fear among the nations and doubt because of the loud noise of the sea and the waves;

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 26
text: Men's strength will go from them in fear and in waiting for the things which are coming on the earth; for the powers of the heavens will be moved.

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 27
text: And then they will see the Son of man coming in a cloud, with power and great glory.

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 28
text: But when these things come about, let your heads be lifted up, because your salvation is near.

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 29
text: And he made a story for them: See the fig-tree, and all the trees;

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 30
text: When they put out their young leaves, you take note of it, and it is clear to you that summer is coming.

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 31
text: In the same way, when you see these things taking place you may be certain that the kingdom of God is near.

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 32
text: Truly I say to you, This generation will not come to an end till all things are complete.

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 33
text: Heaven and earth will come to an end, but my words will not come to an end.

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 34
text: But give attention to yourselves, for fear that your hearts become over-full of the pleasures of food and wine, and the cares of this life, and that day may come on you suddenly, and take you as in a net:

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 35
text: For so it will come on all those who are living on the face of all the earth.

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 36
text: But keep watch at all times with prayer, that you may be strong enough to come through all these things and take your place before the Son of man.

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 37
text: And every day he was teaching in the Temple and every night he went out to the mountain which is named the Mountain of Olives to take his rest.

title: Luke Chapter 21 Verse 38
text: And all the people came early in the morning to give ear to his words in the Temple.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 1
text: Now the feast of unleavened bread was near, which is called the Passover.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 2
text: And the chief priests and the scribes were looking for a chance to put him to death, but they went in fear of the people.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 3
text: And Satan came into Judas Iscariot, who was one of the twelve.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 4
text: And he went away and had a discussion with the chief priests and the rulers, about how he might give him up to them.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 5
text: And they were glad, and undertook to give him money.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 6
text: And he made an agreement with them to give him up to them, if he got a chance, when the people were not present.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 7
text: And the day of unleavened bread came, when the Passover lamb is put to death.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 8
text: And Jesus sent Peter and John, saying, Go and make the Passover ready for us, so that we may take it.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 9
text: And they said to him, Where are we to get it ready?

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 10
text: And he said to them, When you go into the town you will see a man coming to you with a vessel of water; go after him into the house into which he goes.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 11
text: And say to the master of the house, The Master says, Where is the guest-room, where I may take the Passover with my disciples?

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 12
text: And he will take you up to a great room with a table and seats: there make ready.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 13
text: And they went, and it was as he had said: and they made the Passover ready.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 14
text: And when the time had come, he took his seat, and the Apostles with him.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 15
text: And he said, I have had a great desire to keep this Passover with you before I come to my death;

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 16
text: For I say to you, I will not take it till it is made complete in the kingdom of God.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 17
text: And he took a cup and, having given praise, he said, Make division of this among yourselves;

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 18
text: For I say to you, I will not take of the fruit of the vine till the kingdom of God has come.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 19
text: And he took bread and, having given praise, he gave it to them when it had been broken, saying, This is my body, which is given for you: do this in memory of me.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 20
text: And in the same way, after the meal, he took the cup, saying, This cup is the new testament, made with my blood which is given for you.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 21
text: But the hand of him who is false to me is with me at the table.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 22
text: For it will be done to the Son of man after the purpose of God, but unhappy is that man by whom he is given up.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 23
text: And they were wondering among themselves which of them it was who would do this thing.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 24
text: And there was an argument among them about which of them was the greatest.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 25
text: And he said, The kings of the Gentiles are lords over them, and those who have authority are given names of honour.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 26
text: But let it not be so with you; but he who is greater, let him become like the younger; and he who is chief, like a servant.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 27
text: For which is greater, the guest who is seated at a meal or the servant who is waiting on him? is it not the guest? but I am among you as a servant.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 28
text: But you are those who have kept with me through my troubles;

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 29
text: And I will give you a kingdom as my Father has given one to me,

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 30
text: So that you may take food and drink at my table in my kingdom, and be seated like kings, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 31
text: Simon, Simon, Satan has made a request to have you, so that he may put you to the test as grain is tested:

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 32
text: But I have made prayer for you, that your faith may not go from you: and when you are turned again, make your brothers strong.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 33
text: And he said to him, Lord, I am ready to go with you to prison and to death.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 34
text: And he said, I say to you, Peter, before the cock's second cry today, you will say three times that you have no knowledge of me.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 35
text: And he said to them, When I sent you out without money or bag or shoes, were you in need of anything? And they said, Nothing.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 36
text: And he said to them, But now, he who has a money-bag, or a bag for food, let him take it: and he who has not, let him give his coat for money and get a sword.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 37
text: For I say to you that these words will be put into effect in me, And he was numbered among the evil-doers: for what has been said in the Writings about me has an end.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 38
text: And they said, Lord, here are two swords. And he said, It is enough.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 39
text: And he came out, and went, as his way was, to the Mountain of Olives, and the disciples went with him.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 40
text: And when he came to the place, he said to them, Make a prayer that you may not be put to the test.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 41
text: And he went a little distance away from them and, falling on his knees in prayer, he said,

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 42
text: Father, if it is your pleasure, take this cup from me: but still, let your pleasure, not mine, be done.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 43
text: And an angel from heaven came to him, to give him strength.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 44
text: And being in great trouble of soul, the force of his prayer became stronger, and great drops, like blood, came from him, falling to the earth.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 45
text: And, getting up from prayer, he came to the disciples, and saw that they were sleeping for sorrow.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 46
text: And he said, Why are you sleeping? Get up, and give yourselves to prayer, so that you may not be put to the test.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 47
text: And while he was saying these words, there came a band of people, and Judas, one of the twelve, was in front of them, and he came near to Jesus to give him a kiss.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 48
text: But Jesus said to him, Judas, will you be false to the Son of man with a kiss?

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 49
text: And when those who were with him saw what was coming, they said, Lord, may we not make use of our swords?

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 50
text: And one of them gave a blow to the servant of the high priest, cutting off his right ear.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 51
text: But Jesus, answering, said, Put up with this, at least. And touching his ear, he made it well.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 52
text: And Jesus said to the chief priests and the captains of the Temple and the rulers, who had come against him, Have you come out as against a thief, with swords and sticks?

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 53
text: When I was in the Temple with you every day, your hands were not stretched out against me: but this is your hour, and the authority of the dark power.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 54
text: And they made him a prisoner and took him away to the house of the high priest. But Peter went after them at a distance.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 55
text: And a fire was lighted in the middle of the open square, and they were seated together, and Peter was among them.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 56
text: And a certain woman-servant, seeing him in the light of the fire, and looking at him with attention, said, This man was with him.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 57
text: But he said, Woman, it is not true; I have no knowledge of him.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 58
text: And after a little time, another saw him and said, You are one of them; and he said, Man, I am not.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 59
text: And after about an hour, another man said, with decision, Certainly this man was with him, for he is a Galilaean.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 60
text: And Peter said, Man, I have no knowledge of these things of which you are talking. And straight away, while he was saying these words, there came the cry of a cock.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 61
text: And the Lord, turning, gave Peter a look. And the words of the Lord came to Peter's mind, how he had said, This night, before the hour of the cock's cry, you will be false to me three times.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 62
text: And he went out, weeping bitterly.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 63
text: And the men in whose hands Jesus was, made sport of him and gave him blows.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 64
text: And, covering his eyes, they said to him, Are you prophet enough to say who gave you that blow?

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 65
text: And they said a number of other evil things against him.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 66
text: And when it was day, the rulers of the people came together, with the chief priests and the scribes, and they took him before their Sanhedrin, saying,

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 67
text: If you are the Christ, say so. But he said, If I say so you will not have belief;

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 68
text: And if I put a question to you, you will not give an answer.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 69
text: But in the future the Son of man will be seated at the right hand of the power of God.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 70
text: And they all said, Are you then the Son of God? and he said, You say that I am.

title: Luke Chapter 22 Verse 71
text: And they said, What more need have we of witness? we have the very words of his mouth.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 1
text: And they all went and took him before Pilate.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 2
text: And they made statements against him, saying, This man has to our knowledge been teaching our nation to do wrong, and not to make payment of taxes to Caesar, even saying that he himself is Christ, a king.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 3
text: And Pilate said to him, Are you the King of the Jews? And he said in answer, You say so.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 4
text: And Pilate said to the chief priests and the people, In my opinion this man has done no wrong.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 5
text: But they became more violent than before, saying, He has made trouble among the people, teaching through all Judaea from Galilee to this place.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 6
text: But at these words Pilate said, Is the man a Galilaean?

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 7
text: And when he saw that he was under the authority of Herod, he sent him to Herod, who was in Jerusalem himself at that time.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 8
text: Now when Herod saw Jesus he was very glad, having for a long time had a desire to see him, for he had had accounts of him, and was hoping to see some wonders done by him.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 9
text: And he put a great number of questions to him, but he said nothing.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 10
text: And the chief priests and the scribes were there, making statements against him violently.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 11
text: And Herod, with the men of his army, put shame on him and made sport of him, and dressing him in shining robes, he sent him back to Pilate.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 12
text: And that day Herod and Pilate became friends with one another, for before they had been against one another.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 13
text: And Pilate sent for the chief priests and the rulers and the people, and said to them,

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 14
text: You say that this man has been teaching the people evil things: now I, after going into the question before you, see nothing wrong in this man in connection with the things which you have said against him:

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 15
text: And Herod is of the same opinion, for he has sent him back to us; for, you see, he has done nothing for which I might put him to death.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 16
text: And so I will give him punishment and let him go.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 18
text: But with loud voices they said all together, Put this man to death, and make Barabbas free.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 19
text: Now this man was in prison because of an attack against the government in the town, in which there had been loss of life.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 20
text: And Pilate again said to them that it was his desire to let Jesus go free.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 21
text: But crying out they said, To the cross with him!

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 22
text: And he said to them a third time, Why, what evil has he done? I see no reason for putting him to death: I will give him punishment and let him go.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 23
text: But they went on crying out loudly, Let him be put to death on the cross. And they had their way.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 24
text: And Pilate gave his decision for their desire to be put into effect.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 25
text: And in answer to their request, he let that man go free who had been in prison for acting against the government and causing death, and Jesus he gave up to their pleasure.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 26
text: And while they were taking him away, they put their hands on Simon of Cyrene, who was coming from the country, and made him take the cross after Jesus.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 27
text: And a great band of people went after him, and of women making signs of grief and weeping for him.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 28
text: But Jesus, turning to them, said, Daughters of Jerusalem, let not your weeping be for me, but for yourselves and for your children.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 29
text: For the days are coming in which they will say, Happy are those who have had no children, whose bodies have never given birth, whose breasts have never given milk.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 30
text: And they will say to the mountains, Come down on us, and to the hills, Be a cover over us.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 31
text: For if they do these things when the tree is green, what will they do when it is dry?

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 32
text: And two others, evil-doers, were taken with him to be put to death.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 33
text: And when they came to the place which is named Golgotha, they put him on the cross, and the evil-doers, one on the right side, and the other on the left.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 34
text: And Jesus said, Father, let them have forgiveness, for they have no knowledge of what they are doing. And they made division of his clothing among them by the decision of chance.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 35
text: And the people were looking on. And the rulers made sport of him, saying, He was a saviour of others; let him do something for himself, if he is the Christ, the man of God's selection.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 36
text: And the men of the army made sport of him, coming to him and giving him bitter wine,

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 37
text: And saying, If you are the King of the Jews, get yourself free.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 38
text: And these words were put in writing over him, THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 39
text: And one of the evil-doers on the cross, with bitter feeling, said to him, Are you not the Christ? Get yourself and us out of this.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 40
text: But the other, protesting, said, Have you no fear of God? for you have a part in the same punishment,

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 41
text: And with reason; for we have the right reward of our acts, but this man has done nothing wrong.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 42
text: And he said, Jesus, keep me in mind when you come in your kingdom.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 43
text: And he said to him, Truly I say to you, Today you will be with me in Paradise.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 44
text: And it was now about the sixth hour; and all the land was dark till the ninth hour;

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 45
text: The light of the sun went out, and the curtain in the Temple was parted in two.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 46
text: And Jesus gave a loud cry and said, Father, into your hands I give my spirit: and when he had said this, he gave up his spirit.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 47
text: And when the captain saw what was done, he gave praise to God, saying, Without doubt this was an upright man.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 48
text: And all the people who had come together to see it, when they saw the things which were done, went back again making signs of grief.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 49
text: And all his friends and the women who came with him from Galilee, were waiting at a distance, watching these things.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 50
text: Now there was a man named Joseph, a man of authority and a good and upright man

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 51
text: (He had not given his approval to their decision or their acts), of Arimathaea, a town of the Jews, who was waiting for the kingdom of God:

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 52
text: This man went to Pilate and made a request for the body of Jesus.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 53
text: And he took it down, and folding it in a linen cloth, he put it in a place cut in the rock for a dead body; and no one had ever been put in it.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 54
text: Now it was the day of making ready and the Sabbath was coming on.

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 55
text: And the women who had come with him from Galilee went after him and saw the place and how his body had been put to rest;

title: Luke Chapter 23 Verse 56
text: And they went back and got ready spices and perfumes; and on the Sabbath they took their rest, in agreement with the law.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 1
text: But on the first day of the week, at dawn, they came to the place where his body had been put, taking the spices which they had got ready.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 2
text: And they saw that the stone had been rolled away.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 3
text: And they went in, but the body of the Lord Jesus was not there.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 4
text: And while they were in doubt about it, they saw two men in shining clothing by them:

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 5
text: And while their faces were bent down to the earth in fear, these said to them, Why are you looking for the living among the dead?

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 6
text: He is not here, he has come back to life: have in mind what he said to you when he was still in Galilee, saying,

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 7
text: The Son of man will be given up into the hands of evil-doers, and be put to death on the cross, and on the third day he will come back to life.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 8
text: And his words came back into their minds,

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 9
text: And they went away from that place and gave an account of all these things to the eleven disciples and all the others.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 10
text: Now they were Mary Magdalene, and Joanna, and Mary, the mother of James: and the other women with them said these things to the Apostles.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 11
text: But these words seemed foolish to them, and they had no belief in them.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 12
text: But Peter got up and went to the place where the body had been put, and looking in he saw nothing but the linen cloths, and he went to his house full of wonder at what had taken place.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 13
text: And then, two of them, on that very day, were going to a little town named Emmaus, which was about seven miles from Jerusalem.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 14
text: And they were talking together about all those things which had taken place.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 15
text: And while they were talking and questioning together, Jesus himself came near and went with them.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 16
text: But their eyes were not open that they might have knowledge of him.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 17
text: And he said to them, What are you talking about together while you go?

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 18
text: Then stopping, and looking sadly at him, one of them, named Cleopas, said to him, Are you the only man living in Jerusalem who has not had news of the things which have taken place there at this time?

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 19
text: And he said to them, What things? And they said, The things to do with Jesus of Nazareth, who was a prophet, great in his acts and his words, before God and all the people:

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 20
text: And how the chief priests and our rulers gave him up to be put to death on the cross.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 21
text: But we were hoping that he would be the Saviour of Israel. In addition to all this he has now let three days go by from the time when these things took place;

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 22
text: And certain women among us gave us cause for wonder, for they went early to the place where his body had been put,

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 23
text: And it was not there; then they came saying that they had seen a vision of angels who said that he was living.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 24
text: And some of those who were with us went to the place, and saw that it was as the women had said, but him they did not see.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 25
text: And he said, O foolish men! how slow you are to give belief to what the prophets have said.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 26
text: Was it not necessary for the Christ to go through these things, and to come into his glory?

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 27
text: And he made clear to them all the things in the Writings, from Moses and from all the prophets, which had to do with himself.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 28
text: And they came near the town to which they were going, and he seemed as if he was going on;

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 29
text: But they kept him back, saying, Do not go, for evening is near, the day is almost gone. And he went in with them.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 30
text: And when he was seated with them at table, he took the bread, and said words of blessing and, making division of it, he gave it to them.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 31
text: And then their eyes were open, and they had knowledge of him, but he went from their view.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 32
text: And they said to one another, Were not our hearts burning in us while he was talking to us on the way, making clear to us the holy Writings?

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 33
text: And that very hour they got up and went back to Jerusalem, where the eleven and the others had come together.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 34
text: And they said to them, The Lord has truly come back to life again, and Simon has seen him.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 35
text: And they gave an account of the things which had taken place on the way, and how, when he gave them bread, they had knowledge of him.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 36
text: And while they were saying these things, he himself was among them, and said to them, Peace be with you!

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 37
text: But they were full of fear, being of the opinion that they were seeing a spirit.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 38
text: And he said to them, Why are you troubled, and why are your hearts full of doubt?

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 39
text: See; my hands and my feet: it is I myself; put your hands on me and make certain; for a spirit has not flesh and bones as you see that I have.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 40
text: And when he had said this, he let them see his hands and his feet.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 41
text: And because, for joy and wonder, they were still in doubt, he said to them, Have you any food here?

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 42
text: And they gave him a bit of cooked fish.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 43
text: And before their eyes he took a meal.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 44
text: And he said to them, These are the words which I said to you when I was still with you, how it was necessary for all the things which are in the writings of Moses and the prophets and in the Psalms about me, to be put into effect.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 45
text: Then he made the holy Writings clear to their minds.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 46
text: And he said to them, So it is in the Writings that the Christ would undergo death, and come back to life again on the third day;

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 47
text: And that teaching about a change of heart and forgiveness of sins is to be given to Jerusalem first and to all nations in his name.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 48
text: You are witnesses of these things.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 49
text: And now I will send to you what my father has undertaken to give you, but do not go from the town, till the power from heaven comes to you.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 50
text: And he took them out till they were near Bethany, and lifting up his hands, he gave them a blessing.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 51
text: And while he was doing so, he went from them and was taken up into heaven.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 52
text: And they gave him worship and went back to Jerusalem with great joy.

title: Luke Chapter 24 Verse 53
text: And they were in the Temple at all times, giving praise to God.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: From the first he was the Word, and the Word was in relation with God and was God.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: This Word was from the first in relation with God.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: All things came into existence through him, and without him nothing was.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: What came into existence in him was life, and the life was the light of men.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: And the light goes on shining in the dark; it is not overcome by the dark.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: There was a man sent from God, whose name was John.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: He came for witness, to give witness about the light, so that all men might have faith through him.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: He himself was not the light: he was sent to give witness about the light.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: The true light, which gives light to every man, was then coming into the world.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: He was in the world, the world which came into being through him, but the world had no knowledge of him.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: He came to the things which were his and his people did not take him to their hearts.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: To all those who did so take him, however, he gave the right of becoming children of God--that is, to those who had faith in his name:

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: Whose birth was from God and not from blood, or from an impulse of the flesh and man's desire.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: And so the Word became flesh and took a place among us for a time; and we saw his glory--such glory as is given to an only son by his father--saw it to be true and full of grace.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: John gave witness about him, crying, This is he of whom I said, He who is coming after me is put over me because he was in existence before me.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: From his full measure we have all been given grace on grace.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: For the law was given through Moses; grace and the true way of life are ours through Jesus Christ.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: No man has seen God at any time; the only Son, who is on the breast of the Father, he has made clear what God is.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 19
text: And this is the witness of John when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to him with the question, Who are you?

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 20
text: He said quite openly and straightforwardly, I am not the Christ.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 21
text: And they said to him, What then? Are you Elijah? And he said, I am not. Are you the prophet? And his answer was, I am not.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 22
text: So they said to him, Who are you then? We have to give some answer to those who sent us. What have you to say about yourself?

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 23
text: He said, I am the voice of one crying in the waste land, Make straight the way of the Lord, as said Isaiah the prophet.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 24
text: Those who had been sent came from the Pharisees.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 25
text: And they put this question to him, saying, Why then are you giving baptism if you are not the Christ, or Elijah, or the prophet?

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 26
text: John's answer was: I give baptism with water; but there is one among you of whom you have no knowledge;

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 27
text: It is he who is coming after me; I am not good enough to undo his shoes.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 28
text: These things took place at Bethany on the other side of the Jordan, where John was giving baptism.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 29
text: The day after, John sees Jesus coming to him and says, See, here is the Lamb of God who takes away the sin of the world!

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 30
text: This is he of whom I said, One is coming after me who is put over me because he was in existence before me.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 31
text: I myself had no knowledge of him, but I came giving baptism with water so that he might be seen openly by Israel.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 32
text: And John gave this witness, saying, I saw the Spirit coming down from heaven like a dove and resting on him.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 33
text: I had no knowledge who he was, but he who sent me to give baptism with water said to me, The one on whom you see the Spirit coming down and resting, it is he who gives baptism with the Holy Spirit.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 34
text: This I saw myself and my witness is that he is the Son of God.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 35
text: The day after, John was there again with two of his disciples;

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 36
text: And looking at Jesus while he was walking he said, See, there is the Lamb of God!

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 37
text: Hearing what he said, the two disciples went after Jesus.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 38
text: And Jesus, turning round, saw them coming after him and said to them, What are you looking for? They said to him, Rabbi (which is to say, Master), where are you living?

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 39
text: He said to them, Come and see. They went with him then and saw where he was living; and they were with him all that day: it was then about the tenth hour of the day.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 40
text: Andrew, Simon Peter's brother, was one of the two men who, hearing what John said, went after Jesus.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 41
text: Early in the morning he came across his brother and said to him, We have made discovery! It is the Messiah! (which is to say, the Christ).

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 42
text: And he took him to Jesus. Looking at him fixedly Jesus said, You are Simon, the son of John; your name will be Cephas (which is to say, Peter).

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 43
text: The day after this, Jesus had a desire to go into Galilee. He came across Philip and said to him, Come and be my disciple.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 44
text: Now Philip's town was Beth-saida, where Andrew and Peter came from.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 45
text: Philip came across Nathanael and said to him, We have made a discovery! It is he of whom Moses, in the law, and the prophets were writing, Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 46
text: Nazareth! said Nathanael, Is it possible for any good to come out of Nazareth? Philip said to him, Come and see.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 47
text: Jesus saw Nathanael coming to him and said of him, See, here is a true son of Israel in whom there is nothing false.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 48
text: Nathanael said to him, Where did you get knowledge of me? In answer Jesus said, Before Philip was talking with you, while you were still under the fig-tree, I saw you.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 49
text: Nathanael said to him, Rabbi, you are the Son of God, you are King of Israel!

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 50
text: In answer Jesus said to him, You have faith because I said to you, I saw you under the fig-tree. You will see greater things than these.

title: John Chapter 1 Verse 51
text: And he said to him, Truly I say to you all, You will see heaven opening and God's angels going up and coming down on the Son of man.

title: John Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: On the third day two people were going to be married at Cana in Galilee. The mother of Jesus was there:

title: John Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: And Jesus with his disciples came as guests.

title: John Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: When they had not enough wine, the mother of Jesus said to him, They have no wine.

title: John Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: Jesus said to her, Woman, this is not your business; my time is still to come.

title: John Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: His mother said to the servants, Whatever he says to you, do it.

title: John Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: Now six pots of stone, every one taking two or three firkins of water, were placed there for the purpose of washing, as is the way of the Jews.

title: John Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: Jesus said to the servants, Make the pots full of water. And they made them full to the top.

title: John Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: Then he said to them, Now take some, and give it to the master of the feast. So they took it to him.

title: John Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: After tasting the water which had now become wine, the master of the feast (having no idea where it came from, though it was clear to the servants who took the water out) sent for the newly-married man,

title: John Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: And said to him, Every man first puts out his best wine and when all have had enough he puts out what is not so good; but you have kept the good wine till now.

title: John Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: This, the first of his signs, Jesus did at Cana in Galilee and let his glory be seen openly; and his disciples put their faith in him.

title: John Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: After this he went down to Capernaum, with his mother, his brothers, and his disciples, and they were there not more than two or three days.

title: John Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: The time of the Passover of the Jews was near and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.

title: John Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: And there in the Temple he saw men trading in oxen and sheep and doves, and he saw the changers of money in their seats:

title: John Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: And he made a whip of small cords and put them all out of the Temple, with the sheep and the oxen, sending in all directions the small money of the changers and overturning their tables;

title: John Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: And to those who were trading in doves he said, Take these things away; do not make my Father's house a market.

title: John Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: And it came to the minds of the disciples that the Writings say, I am on fire with passion for your house.

title: John Chapter 2 Verse 18
text: Then the Jews put this question to him: What sign of authority have you to give us, seeing that you do these things?

title: John Chapter 2 Verse 19
text: And Jesus said to them, Send destruction on this Temple and I will put it up again in three days.

title: John Chapter 2 Verse 20
text: The Jews said, The building of this Temple took forty-six years; and you will put it up in three days!

title: John Chapter 2 Verse 21
text: But his words were about that holy building which was his body.

title: John Chapter 2 Verse 22
text: So when he had come back again from the dead, the memory of these words came back to the disciples, and they had faith in the holy Writings and in the word which Jesus had said.

title: John Chapter 2 Verse 23
text: Now while he was in Jerusalem at the feast of the Passover, a great number of people came to have faith in his name, after seeing the signs which he did.

title: John Chapter 2 Verse 24
text: But Jesus did not have faith in them, because he had knowledge of them all.

title: John Chapter 2 Verse 25
text: He had no need for any witness about man; for he himself had knowledge of what was in man.

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: Now there was among the Pharisees a man named Nicodemus, who was one of the rulers of the Jews.

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: He came to Jesus by night and said to him, Rabbi, we are certain that you have come from God as a teacher, because no man would be able to do these signs which you do if God was not with him.

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: Jesus said to him, Truly, I say to you, Without a new birth no man is able to see the kingdom of God.

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: Nicodemus said to him, How is it possible for a man to be given birth when he is old? Is he able to go into his mother's body a second time and come to birth again?

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: Jesus said in answer, Truly, I say to you, If a man's birth is not from water and from the Spirit, it is not possible for him to go into the kingdom of God.

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: That which has birth from the flesh is flesh, and that which has birth from the Spirit is spirit.

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: Do not be surprised that I say to you, It is necessary for you to have a second birth.

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: The wind goes where its pleasure takes it, and the sound of it comes to your ears, but you are unable to say where it comes from and where it goes: so it is with everyone whose birth is from the Spirit.

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: And Nicodemus said to him, How is it possible for these things to be?

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: And Jesus, answering, said, Are you the teacher of Israel and have no knowledge of these things?

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: Truly, I say to you, We say that of which we have knowledge; we give witness of what we have seen; and you do not take our witness to be true.

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: If you have no belief when my words are about the things of earth, how will you have belief if my words are about the things of heaven?

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: And no one has ever gone up to heaven but he who came down from heaven, the Son of man.

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: As the snake was lifted up by Moses in the waste land, even so it is necessary for the Son of man to be lifted up:

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: So that whoever has faith may have in him eternal life.

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: For God had such love for the world that he gave his only Son, so that whoever has faith in him may not come to destruction but have eternal life.

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: God did not send his Son into the world to be judge of the world; he sent him so that the world might have salvation through him.

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 18
text: The man who has faith in him does not come up to be judged; but he who has no faith in him has been judged even now, because he has no faith in the name of the only Son of God.

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 19
text: And this is the test by which men are judged: the light has come into the world and men have more love for the dark than for the light, because their acts are evil.

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 20
text: The light is hated by everyone whose acts are evil and he does not come to the light for fear that his acts will be seen.

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 21
text: But he whose life is true comes to the light, so that it may be clearly seen that his acts have been done by the help of God.

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 22
text: After these things Jesus and his disciples went into the land of Judaea, and there he was with them for some time, giving baptism.

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 23
text: Now John was then giving baptism at Aenon near Salim, because there was much water there; and people came and were given baptism.

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 24
text: For at this time John had not been put into prison.

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 25
text: Then a question came up between John's disciples and a Jew about washing.

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 26
text: And they went to John and said to him, Rabbi, the man who was with you on the other side of the Jordan, the man to whom you gave witness, is now giving baptism, and everyone is going to him.

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 27
text: And this was John's answer: A man is unable to have anything if it is not given to him from heaven.

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 28
text: You yourselves give witness that I said, I am not the Christ. What I said was, I am sent before the Christ.

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 29
text: He who has the bride is the husband: but the husband's friend, whose place is by his side and whose ears are open to him, is full of joy because of the husband's voice: such is my joy, and it is complete.

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 30
text: He has to become greater while I become less.

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 31
text: He who comes from heaven is greater than all others: he who comes from earth is of the earth, and of the earth are his words: he who comes from heaven is over all.

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 32
text: He gives witness of what he has seen and of what has come to his ears; and no man takes his witness as true.

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 33
text: He who so takes his witness has made clear his faith that God is true.

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 34
text: For he whom God has sent says God's words; and God does not give him the Spirit by measure.

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 35
text: The Father has love for the Son and has put all things into his hands.

title: John Chapter 3 Verse 36
text: He who has faith in the Son has eternal life; but he who has not faith in the Son will not see life; God's wrath is resting on him.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: Now when it was clear to the Lord that word had come to the ears of the Pharisees that Jesus was making more disciples than John and was giving them baptism

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: (Though, in fact, it was his disciples who gave baptism, not Jesus himself),

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: He went out of Judaea into Galilee again.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: And it was necessary for him to go through Samaria.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: So he came to a town of Samaria which was named Sychar, near to the bit of land which Jacob gave to his son Joseph:

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: Now Jacob's fountain was there. Jesus, being tired after his journey, was resting by the fountain. It was about the sixth hour.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: A woman of Samaria came to get water, and Jesus said to her, Give me some water.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: For his disciples had gone to the town to get food.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: The woman of Samaria said to him, Why do you, a Jew, make a request for water to me, a woman of Samaria? She said this because Jews have nothing to do with the people of Samaria.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: In answer Jesus said, If you had knowledge of what God gives freely and who it is who says to you, Give me water, you would make your prayer to him, and he would give you living water.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: The woman said to him, Sir, you have no vessel and the fountain is deep; from where will you get the living water?

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: Are you greater than our father Jacob who gave us the fountain and took the water of it himself, with his children and his cattle?

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: Jesus said to her, Everyone who takes this water will be in need of it again:

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: But whoever takes the water I give him will never be in need of drink again; for the water I give him will become in him a fountain of eternal life.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: The woman said to him, Sir, give me this water, so that I may not be in need again of drink and will not have to come all this way for it.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: Jesus said to her, Go, get your husband and come back here with him.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 17
text: In answer, the woman said, I have no husband. Jesus said to her, You have said rightly, I have no husband:

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 18
text: You have had five husbands, and the man you have now is not your husband: that was truly said.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 19
text: The woman said to him, Sir, I see that you are a prophet.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 20
text: Our fathers gave worship on this mountain, but you Jews say that the right place for worship is in Jerusalem.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 21
text: Jesus said to her, Woman, take my word for this; the time is coming when you will not give worship to the Father on this mountain or in Jerusalem.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 22
text: You give worship, but without knowledge of what you are worshipping: we give worship to what we have knowledge of: for salvation comes from the Jews.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 23
text: But the time is coming, and is even now here, when the true worshippers will give worship to the Father in the true way of the spirit, for these are the worshippers desired by the Father.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 24
text: God is Spirit: then let his worshippers give him worship in the true way of the spirit.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 25
text: The woman said to him, I am certain that the Messiah, who is named Christ, is coming; when he comes he will make all things clear to us.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 26
text: Jesus said to her, I, who am talking to you, am he.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 27
text: At that point the disciples came back, and they were surprised to see him talking to a woman; but not one of them said to him, What is your purpose? or, Why are you talking to her?

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 28
text: Then the woman put down her water-pot and went into the town, and said to the people,

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 29
text: Come and see a man who has been talking to me of everything I ever did! Is it possible that this is the Christ?

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 30
text: So they went out of the town and came to him.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 31
text: While this was taking place, the disciples were saying to Jesus, Master, take some food.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 32
text: But he said to them, I have food of which you have no knowledge.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 33
text: So the disciples said one to another, Did anyone give him food?

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 34
text: Jesus said, My food is to do the pleasure of him who sent me and to make his work complete.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 35
text: You would say, Four months from now is the time of the grain-cutting. Take a look, I say to you, at the fields; they are even now white for cutting.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 36
text: He who does the cutting now has his reward; he is getting together fruit for eternal life, so that he who did the planting and he who gets in the grain may have joy together.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 37
text: In this the saying is a true one, One does the planting, and another gets in the grain.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 38
text: I sent you to get in grain which you had no hand in planting: other men did that work, and you take the reward.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 39
text: Now a number of the people of that town had faith in him because of the woman's witness: He has been talking to me of everything I ever did.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 40
text: So when the people came to him they made request to him to be among them for a time, and he was there two days.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 41
text: And a great number more of them came to have faith in him because of what he himself said.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 42
text: And they said to the woman, Now we have faith, but not because of your story: we ourselves have given ear to his words, and we are certain that he is truly the Saviour of the world.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 43
text: And after the two days he went on from there into Galilee.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 44
text: For Jesus himself said that a prophet has no honour in the country of his birth.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 45
text: So when he came into Galilee, the Galilaeans took him to their hearts because of the things which they had seen him do in Jerusalem at the feast--they themselves having been there at the feast.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 46
text: So he came to Cana in Galilee, where he had made the water wine. And there was a certain man of high position whose son was ill at Capernaum.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 47
text: When it came to his ears that Jesus had come from Judaea into Galilee, he went to him and made a request that he would come down to his son, who was near to death, and make him well.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 48
text: Then Jesus said to him, You will not have faith if you do not see signs and wonders.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 49
text: The man said, Sir, come down before my boy is dead.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 50
text: And Jesus said, Go in peace; your son is living. The man had faith in the word which Jesus said to him and went away.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 51
text: And while he was going down, his servants came to him and said, Your boy is living.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 52
text: So he put a question to them as to the hour when he became better; and they said to him, The disease went from him yesterday at the seventh hour.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 53
text: It was clear then to the father that this was the very time at which Jesus said to him, Your son is living. And he had faith in Jesus, he and all his family.

title: John Chapter 4 Verse 54
text: Now this is the second sign which Jesus did after he had come out of Judaea into Galilee.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: After these things there was a feast of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: Now in Jerusalem near the sheep-market there is a public bath which in Hebrew is named Beth-zatha. It has five doorways.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: In these doorways there were a great number of people with different diseases: some unable to see, some without the power of walking, some with wasted bodies.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: One man was there who had been ill for thirty-eight years.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: When Jesus saw him there on the floor it was clear to him that he had been now a long time in that condition, and so he said to the man, Is it your desire to get well?

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: The ill man said in answer, Sir, I have nobody to put me into the bath when the water is moving; and while I am on the way down some other person gets in before me.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: Jesus said to him, Get up, take your bed and go.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: And the man became well straight away, and took up his bed and went. Now that day was the Sabbath.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: So the Jews said to the man who had been made well, It is the Sabbath; and it is against the law for you to take up your bed.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: He said to them, But he who made me well, said to me, Take up your bed and go.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: Then they put to him the question: Who is the man who said to you, Take it up and go?

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: Now he who had been made well had no knowledge who it was, Jesus having gone away because of the number of people who were in that place.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: After a time Jesus came across him in the Temple and said to him, See, you are well and strong; do no more sin for fear a worse thing comes to you.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 15
text: The man went away and said to the Jews that it was Jesus who had made him well.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 16
text: And for this reason the Jews were turned against Jesus, because he was doing these things on the Sabbath.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 17
text: But his answer was: My Father is still working even now, and so I am working.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 18
text: For this cause the Jews had an even greater desire to put Jesus to death, because not only did he not keep the Sabbath but he said God was his Father, so making himself equal with God.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 19
text: So Jesus made answer and said, Truly I say to you, The Son is not able to do anything himself; he is able to do only what he sees the Father doing; whatever the Father does the Son does it in the same way.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 20
text: For the Father has love for the Son and lets him see everything which he does: and he will let him see greater works than these so that you may be full of wonder.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 21
text: In the same way, as the Father gives life to the dead, even so the Son gives life to those to whom he is pleased to give it.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 22
text: The Father is not the judge of men, but he has given all decisions into the hands of the Son;

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 23
text: So that all men may give honour to the Son even as they give honour to the Father. He who gives no honour to the Son gives no honour to the Father who sent him.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 24
text: Truly I say to you, The man whose ears are open to my word and who has faith in him who sent me, has eternal life; he will not be judged, but has come from death into life.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 25
text: Truly I say to you, The time is coming, it has even now come, when the voice of the Son of God will come to the ears of the dead, and those hearing it will have life.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 26
text: For even as the Father has life in himself, so he has given to the Son to have life in himself.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 27
text: And he has given him authority to be judge because he is the Son of man.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 28
text: Do not be surprised at this: for the time is coming when his voice will come to all who are in the place of the dead,

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 29
text: And they will come out; those who have done good, into the new life; and those who have done evil, to be judged.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 30
text: Of myself I am unable to do anything: as the voice comes to me so I give a decision: and my decision is right because I have no desire to do what is pleasing to myself, but only what is pleasing to him who sent me.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 31
text: If I gave witness about myself, my witness would not be true.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 32
text: There is another who gives witness about me and I am certain that the witness he gives about me is true.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 33
text: You sent to John and he gave true witness.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 34
text: But I have no need of a man's witness: I only say these things so that you may have salvation.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 35
text: He was a burning and shining light, and for a time you were ready to be happy in his light.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 36
text: But the witness which I have is greater than that of John: the work which the Father has given me to do, the very work which I am now doing, is a witness that the Father has sent me.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 37
text: And the Father himself who sent me has given witness about me. Not one of you has ever given ear to his voice; his form you have not seen.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 38
text: And you have not kept his word in your hearts, because you have not faith in him whom he has sent.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 39
