text: You make search in the holy Writings, in the belief that through them you get eternal life; and it is those Writings which give witness about me.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 40
text: And still you have no desire to come to me so that you may have life.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 41
text: I do not take honour from men;

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 42
text: But I have knowledge of you that you have no love for God in your hearts.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 43
text: I have come in my Father's name, and your hearts are not open to me. If another comes with no other authority but himself, you will give him your approval.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 44
text: How is it possible for you to have faith while you take honour one from another and have no desire for the honour which comes from the only God?

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 45
text: Put out of your minds the thought that I will say things against you to the Father: the one who says things against you is Moses, on whom you put your hopes.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 46
text: If you had belief in Moses you would have belief in me; for his writings are about me.

title: John Chapter 5 Verse 47
text: If you have no belief in his writings, how will you have belief in my words?

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: After these things Jesus went away to the other side of the sea of Galilee--that is, the sea of Tiberias.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: And a great number of people went after him because they saw the signs which he did on those who were ill.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: Then Jesus went up the mountain and was seated there with his disciples.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: Now the Passover, a feast of the Jews, was near.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: Lifting up his eyes, Jesus saw a great number of people coming to where he was, and he said to Philip, Where may we get bread for all these people?

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: This he said, testing him: for he had no doubt what he himself would do.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: Philip made answer, Bread to the value of two hundred pence would not be enough even to give everyone a little.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: One of his disciples, Andrew, the brother of Simon Peter, said to Jesus,

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: There is a boy here with five barley cakes and two fishes: but what is that among such a number?

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: Jesus said, Let the people be seated. Now there was much grass in that place. And those seated on the grass were about five thousand.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: Then Jesus took the cakes and having given praise to God, he gave them to the people who were seated, and the fishes in the same way, as much as they had need of.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 12
text: And when they had had enough, Jesus said to his disciples, Take up the broken bits which are over, so that nothing may be wasted.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 13
text: So they took them up: twelve baskets full of broken bits of the five cakes which were over after the people had had enough.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 14
text: And when the people saw the sign which he had done, they said, Truly, this is the prophet who is to come into the world.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 15
text: Now when Jesus saw that the people were about to come and take him by force to make him a king, he went away again up the mountain by himself.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 16
text: When evening came the disciples went down to the sea;

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 17
text: And they took a boat and went across the sea in the direction of Capernaum. By then it was dark and still Jesus had not come to them.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 18
text: The sea was getting rough because of a strong wind which was blowing.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 19
text: After they had gone three or four miles they saw Jesus walking on the sea and coming near to the boat; and they had great fear.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 20
text: But he said to them, It is I, have no fear.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 21
text: Then they readily took him into the boat: and straight away the boat was at the land to which they were going.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 22
text: The day after, the people who were on the other side of the sea saw that only one small boat had been there, that Jesus had not gone in that boat with the disciples, but that the disciples had gone away by themselves.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 23
text: Some other boats, however, came from Tiberias near to the place where they had taken the bread after the Lord had given praise.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 24
text: So when the people saw that Jesus was not there, or his disciples, they got into those boats and went over to Capernaum looking for Jesus.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 25
text: And when they came across him on the other side of the sea they said, Rabbi, when did you come here?

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 26
text: Jesus, answering them, said, Truly I say to you, You come after me, not because you saw signs, but because you were given the bread and had enough.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 27
text: Let your work not be for the food which comes to an end, but for the food which goes on for eternal life, which the Son of man will give to you, for on him has God the Father put his mark.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 28
text: Then they said to him, How may we do the works of God?

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 29
text: Jesus, answering, said to them, This is to do the work of God: to have faith in him whom God has sent.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 30
text: So they said, What sign do you give us, so that we may see and have faith in you? What do you do?

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 31
text: Our fathers had the manna in the waste land, as the Writings say, He gave them bread from heaven.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 32
text: Jesus then said to them, Truly I say to you, What Moses gave you was not the bread from heaven; it is my Father who gives you the true bread from heaven.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 33
text: The bread of God is the bread which comes down out of heaven and gives life to the world.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 34
text: Ah, Lord, they said, give us that bread for ever!

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 35
text: And this was the answer of Jesus: I am the bread of life. He who comes to me will never be in need of food, and he who has faith in me will never be in need of drink.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 36
text: But it is as I said to you: you have seen me, and still you have no faith.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 37
text: Whatever the Father gives to me will come to me; and I will not send away anyone who comes to me.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 38
text: For I have come down from heaven, not to do my pleasure, but the pleasure of him who sent me.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 39
text: And this is the pleasure of him who sent me, that I am not to let out of my hands anything which he has given me, but I am to give it new life on the last day.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 40
text: This, I say, is my Father's pleasure, that everyone who sees the Son and has faith in him may have eternal life: and I will take him up on the last day.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 41
text: Now the Jews said bitter things about Jesus because of his words, I am the bread which came down from heaven.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 42
text: And they said, Is not this Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we have seen? How is it then that he now says, I have come down from heaven?

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 43
text: Jesus made answer and said, Do not say things against me, one to another.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 44
text: No man is able to come to me if the Father who sent me does not give him the desire to come: and I will take him up from the dead on the last day.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 45
text: The writings of the prophets say, And they will all have teaching from God. Everyone whose ears have been open to the teaching of the Father comes to me.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 46
text: Not that anyone has ever seen the Father; only he who is from God, he has seen the Father.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 47
text: Truly I say to you, He who has faith in me has eternal life.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 48
text: I am the bread of life.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 49
text: Your fathers took the manna in the waste land--and they are dead.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 50
text: The bread which comes from heaven is such bread that a man may take it for food and never see death.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 51
text: I am the living bread which has come from heaven: if any man takes this bread for food he will have life for ever: and more than this, the bread which I will give is my flesh which I will give for the life of the world.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 52
text: Then the Jews had an angry discussion among themselves, saying, How is it possible for this man to give us his flesh for food?

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 53
text: Then Jesus said to them, Truly I say to you, If you do not take the flesh of the Son of man for food, and if you do not take his blood for drink, you have no life in you.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 54
text: He who takes my flesh for food and my blood for drink has eternal life: and I will take him up from the dead at the last day.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 55
text: My flesh is true food and my blood is true drink.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 56
text: He who takes my flesh for food and my blood for drink is in me and I in him.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 57
text: As the living Father has sent me, and I have life because of the Father, even so he who takes me for his food will have life because of me.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 58
text: This is the bread which has come down from heaven. It is not like the food which your fathers had: they took of the manna, and are dead; but he who takes this bread for food will have life for ever.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 59
text: Jesus said these things in the Synagogue while he was teaching at Capernaum.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 60
text: Then, hearing this, a number of his disciples said, This is a hard saying; who is able to take in such teaching?

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 61
text: When Jesus became conscious that his disciples were protesting about what he said, he said to them, Does this give you trouble?

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 62
text: What then will you say if you see the Son of man going up to where he was before?

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 63
text: The spirit is the life giver; the flesh is of no value: the words which I have said to you are spirit and they are life.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 64
text: But still some of you have no faith. For it was clear to Jesus from the first who they were who had no faith, and who it was who would be false to him.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 65
text: And he said, This is why I said to you, No man is able to come to me if he is not given the power to do so by the Father.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 66
text: Because of what he said, a number of the disciples went back and would no longer go with him.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 67
text: So Jesus said to the twelve, Have you a desire to go away?

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 68
text: Then Simon Peter gave this answer: Lord, to whom are we to go? you have the words of eternal life;

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 69
text: And we have faith and are certain that you are the Holy One of God.

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 70
text: Then Jesus said, Did I not make a selection of you, the twelve, and one of you is a son of the Evil One?

title: John Chapter 6 Verse 71
text: He was talking of Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot. It was he who was to be false to Jesus--one of the twelve.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: After this, Jesus went from place to place in Galilee. He did not go about in Judaea, because the Jews were looking for a chance to put him to death.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: But the feast of the Jews, the feast of tents, was near.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: So his brothers said to him, Go away from here into Judaea so that your disciples may see the works which you do.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: Because no man does things secretly if he has a desire that men may have knowledge of him. If you do these things, let yourself be seen by all men.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: For even his brothers had no belief in him.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: Jesus said to them, My time is still to come, but any time is good for you.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: It is not possible for you to be hated by the world; but I am hated by it, because I give witness that what it does is evil.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: Go you up to the feast: I am not going up now to the feast because my time has not fully come.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 9
text: Having said these things to them, he still kept in Galilee.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 10
text: But after his brothers had gone up to the feast, then he went up, not publicly, but in secret.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 11
text: At the feast the Jews were looking for him and saying, Where is he?

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 12
text: And there was much discussion about him among the mass of the people. Some said, He is a good man; but others said, No, he is giving people false ideas.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 13
text: But no man said anything about him openly for fear of the Jews.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 14
text: Now in the middle of the feast Jesus went up to the Temple and was teaching.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 15
text: Then the Jews were surprised and said, How has this man got knowledge of books? He has never been to school.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 16
text: Jesus gave them this answer: It is not my teaching, but his who sent me.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 17
text: If any man is ready to do God's pleasure he will have knowledge of the teaching and of where it comes from--from God or from myself.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 18
text: The man whose words come from himself is looking for glory for himself, but he who is looking for the glory of him who sent him--that man is true and there is no evil in him.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 19
text: Did not Moses give you the law? Even so, not one of you keeps the law. Why have you a desire to put me to death?

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 20
text: The people said in answer, You have an evil spirit: who has any desire to put you to death?

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 21
text: This was the answer of Jesus: I have done one work and you are all surprised at it.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 22
text: Moses gave you circumcision--not that it comes from Moses, but from the fathers--and even on the Sabbath you give a child circumcision.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 23
text: If a child is given circumcision on the Sabbath so that the law of Moses may not be broken, why are you angry with me because I made a man completely well on the Sabbath?

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 24
text: Let not your decisions be based on what you see, but on righteousness.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 25
text: Then some of the people of Jerusalem said, Is not this the man whose death is desired?

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 26
text: And here he is talking openly and they say nothing to him! Is it possible that the rulers have knowledge that this is truly the Christ?

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 27
text: However, it is clear to us where this man comes from: but when the Christ comes no one will have knowledge where he comes from.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 28
text: Then, when he was teaching in the Temple, Jesus said with a loud voice, You have knowledge of me and you have knowledge of where I come from; and I have not come of myself; but there is One who has sent me; he is true, but you have no knowledge of him.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 29
text: I have knowledge of him because I came from him and he sent me.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 30
text: Then they had a desire to take him: but no man put hands on him because his hour was still to come.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 31
text: And numbers of the people had belief in him, and they said, When the Christ comes will he do more signs than this man has done?

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 32
text: This discussion of the people came to the ears of the Pharisees; and the chief priests and the Pharisees sent servants to take him.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 33
text: Then Jesus said, I will be with you a little longer and then I go to him who sent me.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 34
text: You will be looking for me, and you will not see me: and where I am you may not come.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 35
text: So the Jews said among themselves, To what place is he going where we will not see him? will he go to the Jews living among the Greeks and become the teacher of the Greeks?

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 36
text: What is this saying of his, You will be looking for me and will not see me, and where I am you may not come?

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 37
text: On the last day, the great day of the feast, Jesus got up and said in a loud voice, If any man is in need of drink let him come to me and I will give it to him.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 38
text: He who has faith in me, out of his body, as the Writings have said, will come rivers of living water.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 39
text: This he said of the Spirit which would be given to those who had faith in him: the Spirit had not been given then, because the glory of Jesus was still to come.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 40
text: When these words came to their ears, some of the people said, This is certainly the prophet.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 41
text: Others said, This is the Christ. But others said, Not so; will the Christ come from Galilee?

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 42
text: Do not the Writings say that the Christ comes of the seed of David and from Beth-lehem, the little town where David was?

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 43
text: So there was a division among the people because of him.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 44
text: And some of them had a desire to take him; but no man put hands on him.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 45
text: Then the servants went back to the chief priests and Pharisees, who said to them, Why have you not got him with you?

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 46
text: The servants made answer, No man ever said things like this man.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 47
text: Then the Pharisees said to them, Have you, like the others, been given false ideas?

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 48
text: Have any of the rulers belief in him, or any one of the Pharisees?

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 49
text: But these people who have no knowledge of the law are cursed.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 50
text: Nicodemus--he who had come to Jesus before, being himself one of them--said to them,

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 51
text: Is a man judged by our law before it has given him a hearing and has knowledge of what he has done?

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 52
text: This was their answer: And do you come from Galilee? Make search and you will see that no prophet comes out of Galilee.

title: John Chapter 7 Verse 53
text: [And every man went to his house;

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 1
text: But Jesus went to the Mountain of Olives.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 2
text: And early in the morning he came again into the Temple and all the people came to him and he was seated teaching them.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 3
text: Now the scribes and Pharisees came, with a woman who had been taken in the act of sinning against the married relation;

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 4
text: And putting her forward, they said to him, Master, this woman has been taken in the very act of sinning against the married relation.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 5
text: Now in the law Moses gave directions that such women were to be stoned; what do you say about it?

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 6
text: They said this, testing him, so that they might have something against him. But Jesus, with his head bent down, made letters on the floor with his finger.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 7
text: But when they went on with their questions, he got up and said to them, Let him among you who is without sin be the first to send a stone at her.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 8
text: And again, with bent head, he made letters on the floor.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 9
text: And when his words came to their ears, they went out one by one, starting with the oldest even to the last, because they were conscious of what was in their hearts: and Jesus was there by himself with the woman before him.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 10
text: Then Jesus got up, and seeing nobody but the woman, he said to her, Where are the men who said things against you? did no one give a decision against you?

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 11
text: And she said, No man, Lord. And Jesus said, And I do not give a decision against you: go, and never do wrong again.]

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 12
text: Then again Jesus said to them, I am the light of the world; he who comes with me will not be walking in the dark but will have the light of life.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 13
text: So the Pharisees said to him, The witness you give is about yourself: your witness is not true.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 14
text: Jesus said in answer, Even if I give witness about myself, my witness is true, because I have knowledge of where I came from and where I am going; but you have no knowledge of where I come from or of where I am going.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 15
text: You are judging from what you see; I am judging no man.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 16
text: Even if I am judging, my decision is right, because I am not by myself--with me is the Father who sent me.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 17
text: Even in your law it is said that the witness of two men is true.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 18
text: I give witness about myself and the Father who sent me gives witness about me.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 19
text: Then they said to him, Where is your Father? Jesus said in answer, You have no knowledge of me or of my Father: if you had knowledge of me you would have knowledge of my Father.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 20
text: Jesus said these words in the place where the offerings were stored, while he was teaching in the Temple: but no man took him because his time was still to come.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 21
text: Then he said to them again, I am going away and you will be looking for me, but death will overtake you in your sins. It is not possible for you to come where I am going.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 22
text: So the Jews said, Will he take his life? Is that why he says, Where I go it is not possible for you to come?

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 23
text: And he said to them, You are of the earth; I am from heaven: you are of this world; I am not of this world.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 24
text: For this reason I said to you that death will overtake you in your sins: for if you have not faith that I am he, death will come to you while you are in your sins.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 25
text: Then they said to him, Who are you? Jesus said, What I said to you from the first.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 26
text: I have much to say about you and against you: but he who sent me is true and what he has said to me I say to the world.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 27
text: They did not see that his words were about the Father.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 28
text: So Jesus said, When the Son of man has been lifted up by you, then it will be clear to you who I am, and that I do nothing of myself, but say as the Father gave me teaching.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 29
text: He who sent me is with me; he has not gone from me, because at all times I do the things which are pleasing to him.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 30
text: When he said this a number came to have faith in him.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 31
text: Then Jesus said to the Jews who had faith in him, If you keep my word, then you are truly my disciples;

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 32
text: And you will have knowledge of what is true, and that will make you free.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 33
text: They said to him in answer, We are Abraham's seed and have never been any man's servant: why do you say, You will become free?

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 34
text: And this was the answer Jesus gave them: Truly I say to you, Everyone who does evil is the servant of sin.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 35
text: Now the servant does not go on living in the house for ever, but the son does.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 36
text: If then the son makes you free, you will be truly free.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 37
text: I am conscious that you are Abraham's seed; but you have a desire to put me to death because my word has no place in you.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 38
text: I say the things which I have seen in my Father's house: and you do the things which come to you from your father's house.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 39
text: In answer they said to him, Our father is Abraham. Jesus said to them, If you were Abraham's children you would do what Abraham did.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 40
text: But now you have a desire to put me to death, a man who has said to you what is true, as I had it from God: Abraham did not do that.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 41
text: You are doing the works of your father. They said to him, We are true sons of Abraham; we have one Father, who is God.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 42
text: Jesus said to them, If God was your Father you would have love for me, because it was from God I came and am here. I did not come of myself, but he sent me.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 43
text: Why are my words not clear to you? It is because your ears are shut to my teaching.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 44
text: You are the children of your father the Evil One and it is your pleasure to do his desires. From the first he was a taker of life; and he did not go in the true way because there is no true thing in him. When he says what is false, it is natural to him, for he is false and the father of what is false.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 45
text: But because I say what is true, you have no belief in me.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 46
text: Which of you is able truly to say that I am a sinner? If I say what is true, why have you no belief in me?

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 47
text: He who is a child of God gives ear to the words of God: your ears are not open to them because you are not from God.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 48
text: The Jews said to him in answer, Are we not right in saying that you are of Samaria and have an evil spirit?

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 49
text: And this was the answer of Jesus: I have not an evil spirit; but I give honour to my Father and you do not give honour to me.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 50
text: I, however, am not in search of glory for myself: there is One who is searching for it and he is judge.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 51
text: Truly I say to you, If a man keeps my word he will never see death.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 52
text: The Jews said to him, Now we are certain that you have an evil spirit. Abraham is dead, and the prophets are dead; and you say, If a man keeps my word he will never see death.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 53
text: Are you greater than our father Abraham, who is dead? and the prophets are dead: who do you say that you are?

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 54
text: Jesus said in answer, If I take glory for myself, my glory is nothing: it is my Father who gives me glory, of whom you say that he is your God.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 55
text: You have no knowledge of him, but I have knowledge of him; and if I said I have no knowledge of him I would be talking falsely like you: but I have full knowledge of him, and I keep his word.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 56
text: Your father Abraham was full of joy at the hope of seeing my day: he saw it and was glad.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 57
text: Then the Jews said to him, You are not fifty years old; have you seen Abraham?

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 58
text: Jesus said to them, Truly I say to you, Before Abraham came into being, I am.

title: John Chapter 8 Verse 59
text: So they took up stones to send at him: but Jesus got secretly out of their way and went out of the Temple.

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 1
text: And when he went on his way, he saw a man blind from birth.

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 2
text: And his disciples put a question to him, saying, Master, was it because of this man's sin, or the sin of his father and mother, that he has been blind from birth?

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 3
text: Jesus said in answer, It was not because of his sin, or because of his father's or mother's; it was so that the works of God might be seen openly in him.

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 4
text: While it is day we have to do the works of him who sent me: the night comes when no work may be done.

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 5
text: As long as I am in the world, I am the light of the world.

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 6
text: Having said these words, he put earth, mixed with water from his mouth, on the man's eyes,

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 7
text: And said to him, Go and make yourself clean in the bath of Siloam (the sense of the name is, Sent). So he went away and, after washing, came back able to see.

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 8
text: Then the neighbours and others who had seen him before in the street, with his hand out for money, said, Is not this the man who got money from people?

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 9
text: Some said, It is he: others said, No, but he is like him. He said, I am he.

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 10
text: So they said to him, How then were your eyes made open?

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 11
text: His answer was: The man who is named Jesus put earth mixed with water on my eyes, and said to me, Go and make yourself clean in Siloam: so I went away and, after washing, am now able to see.

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 12
text: And they said to him, Where is he? His answer was: I have no knowledge.

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 13
text: They took him before the Pharisees--this man who had been blind.

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 14
text: Now the day on which the earth was mixed by Jesus and the man's eyes were made open was the Sabbath.

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 15
text: So the Pharisees put more questions to him about how his eyes had been made open. And he said to them, He put earth on my eyes, and I had a wash and am able to see.

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 16
text: Then some of the Pharisees said, That man has not come from God, for he does not keep the Sabbath. Others said, How is it possible for a sinner to do such signs? So there was a division among them.

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 17
text: Again they said to the blind man, What have you to say about him for opening your eyes? And he said, He is a prophet.

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 18
text: Now the Jews had no belief in the statement that he had been blind and was now able to see, till they sent for the father and mother of the man whose eyes had been made open,

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 19
text: And put the question to them, saying, Is this your son, of whom you say that he was blind at birth? how is it then that he is now able to see?

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 20
text: In answer his father and mother said, We are certain that this is our son and that he was blind at birth:

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 21
text: But how it is he is now able to see, or who made his eyes open, we are not able to say: put the question to him; he is old enough to give an answer for himself.

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 22
text: They said this because of their fear of the Jews: for the Jews had come to an agreement that if any man said that Jesus was the Christ he would be put out of the Synagogue.

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 23
text: That was the reason why they said, He is old enough; put the question to him.

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 24
text: So they sent a second time for the man who had been blind and they said to him, Give glory to God: it is clear to us that this man is a sinner.

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 25
text: He said in answer, I have no knowledge if he is a sinner or not, but one thing I am certain about; I was blind, and now I see.

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 26
text: Then they said to him, What did he do to you? how did he give you the use of your eyes?

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 27
text: His answer was: I have said it before, but your ears were shut: why would you have me say it again? is it your desire to become his disciples?

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 28
text: And they were angry with him and said, You are his disciple, but we are disciples of Moses.

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 29
text: We are certain that God gave his word to Moses: but as for this man, we have no knowledge where he comes from.

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 30
text: The man said in answer, Why, here is a strange thing! You have no knowledge where he comes from though he gave me the use of my eyes.

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 31
text: We have knowledge that God does not give ear to sinners, but if any man is a worshipper of God and does his pleasure, to him God's ears are open.

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 32
text: In all the years nobody has ever before seen the eyes of a man blind from birth made open.

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 33
text: If this man did not come from God he would be unable to do anything.

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 34
text: Their answer was: You came to birth through sin; do you make yourself our teacher? And they put him out of the Synagogue.

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 35
text: It came to the ears of Jesus that they had put him out, and meeting him he said, Have you faith in the Son of man?

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 36
text: He said in answer, And who is he, Lord? Say, so that I may have faith in him.

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 37
text: Jesus said to him, You have seen him; it is he who is talking to you.

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 38
text: And he said, Lord, I have faith. And he gave him worship.

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 39
text: And Jesus said, I came into this world to be a judge, so that those who do not see may see, and those who see may become blind.

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 40
text: These words came to the ears of the Pharisees who were with him and they said to him, Are we, then, blind?

title: John Chapter 9 Verse 41
text: Jesus said to them, If you were blind you would have no sin: but now that you say, We see; your sin is there still.

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 1
text: Truly I say to you, He who does not go through the door into the place where the sheep are kept, but gets in by some other way, is a thief and an outlaw.

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 2
text: He who goes in by the door is the keeper of the sheep.

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 3
text: The porter lets him in; and the sheep give ear to his voice; he says over the names of the sheep, and takes them out.

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 4
text: When he has got them all out, he goes before them, and the sheep go after him, for they have knowledge of his voice.

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 5
text: They will not go after another who is not their keeper, but will go from him in flight, because his voice is strange to them.

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 6
text: In this Jesus was teaching them in the form of a story: but what he said was not clear to them.

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 7
text: So Jesus said again, Truly I say to you, I am the door of the sheep.

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 8
text: All who came before me are thieves and outlaws: but the sheep did not give ear to them.

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 9
text: I am the door: if any man goes in through me he will have salvation, and will go in and go out, and will get food.

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 10
text: The thief comes only to take the sheep and to put them to death: he comes for their destruction: I have come so that they may have life and have it in greater measure.

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 11
text: I am the good keeper of sheep: the good keeper gives his life for the sheep.

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 12
text: He who is a servant, and not the keeper or the owner of the sheep, sees the wolf coming and goes in flight, away from the sheep; and the wolf comes down on them and sends them in all directions:

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 13
text: Because he is a servant he has no interest in the sheep.

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 14
text: I am the good keeper; I have knowledge of my sheep, and they have knowledge of me,

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 15
text: Even as the Father has knowledge of me and I of the Father; and I am giving my life for the sheep.

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 16
text: And I have other sheep which are not of this field: I will be their guide in the same way, and they will give ear to my voice, so there will be one flock and one keeper.

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 17
text: For this reason am I loved by the Father, because I give up my life so that I may take it again.

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 18
text: No one takes it away from me; I give it up of myself. I have power to give it up, and I have power to take it again. These orders I have from my Father.

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 19
text: There was a division again among the Jews because of these words.

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 20
text: And a number of them said, He has an evil spirit and is out of his mind; why do you give ear to him?

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 21
text: Others said, These are not the words of one who has an evil spirit. Is it possible for an evil spirit to make blind people see?

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 22
text: Then came the feast of the opening of the Temple in Jerusalem: it was winter;

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 23
text: And Jesus was walking in the Temple, in Solomon's covered way.

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 24
text: Then the Jews came round him, saying, how long are you going to keep us in doubt? If you are the Christ, say so clearly.

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 25
text: Jesus said in answer, I have said it and you have no belief: the works which I do in my Father's name, these give witness about me.

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 26
text: But you have no belief because you are not of my sheep.

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 27
text: My sheep give ear to my voice, and I have knowledge of them, and they come after me:

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 28
text: And I give them eternal life; they will never come to destruction, and no one will ever take them out of my hand.

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 29
text: That which my Father has given to me has more value than all; and no one is able to take anything out of the Father's hand.

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 30
text: I and my Father are one.

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 31
text: Then the Jews took up stones again to send at him.

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 32
text: Jesus said to them in answer, I have let you see a number of good works from the Father; for which of those works are you stoning me?

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 33
text: This was their answer: We are not stoning you for a good work but for evil words; because being a man you make yourself God.

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 34
text: In answer, Jesus said, Is there not a saying in your law, I said, You are gods?

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 35
text: If he said they were gods, to whom the word of God came (and the Writings may not be broken),

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 36
text: Do you say of him whom the Father made holy and sent into the world, Your words are evil; because I said, I am God's Son?

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 37
text: If I am not doing the works of my Father, do not have belief in me;

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 38
text: But if I am doing them, then have belief in the works even if you have no belief in me; so that you may see clearly and be certain that the Father is in me and I am in the Father.

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 39
text: Then again they made an attempt to take him; but he got away from them.

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 40
text: And he went again to the other side of the Jordan, to the place where John first gave baptism; and he was there for a time.

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 41
text: And a great number of people came to him, saying, John did no sign: but everything John said of this man was true.

title: John Chapter 10 Verse 42
text: And a number came to have faith in him there.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 1
text: Now a certain man named Lazarus was ill; he was of Bethany, the town of Mary and her sister Martha.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 2
text: (The Mary whose brother Lazarus was ill, was the Mary who put perfumed oil on the Lord and made his feet dry with her hair.)

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 3
text: So the sisters sent to him, saying, Lord, your dear friend is ill.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 4
text: When this came to his ears, Jesus said, The end of this disease is not death, but the glory of God, so that the Son of God may have glory because of it.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 5
text: Now Jesus had love in his heart for Martha and her sister and Lazarus.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 6
text: So when the news came to him that Lazarus was ill, he did not go from the place where he was for two days.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 7
text: Then after that time he said to his disciples, Let us go into Judaea again.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 8
text: The disciples said to him, Master, the Jews were attempting only the other day to have you stoned, and are you going back there again?

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 9
text: Then Jesus said in answer, Are there not twelve hours in the day? A man may go about in the day without falling, because he sees the light of this world.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 10
text: But if a man goes about in the night, he may have a fall because the light is not in him.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 11
text: These things said he: and after that he said to them, Lazarus our friend is at rest; but I go so that I may make him come out of his sleep.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 12
text: Then his disciples said to him, Lord, if he is resting he will get well.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 13
text: Jesus, however, was talking of his death: but they had the idea that he was talking about taking rest in sleep.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 14
text: Then Jesus said to them clearly, Lazarus is dead.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 15
text: And because of you I am glad I was not there, so that you may have faith; but let us go to him.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 16
text: Then Thomas, who was named Didymus, said to the other disciples, Let us go so that we may be with him in death.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 17
text: Now when Jesus came, he made the discovery that Lazarus had been put into the earth four days before.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 18
text: Now Bethany was near to Jerusalem, about two miles away;

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 19
text: And a number of Jews had come to Martha and Mary to give them comfort about their brother.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 20
text: When Martha had the news that Jesus was on the way, she went out to him, but Mary did not go from the house.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 21
text: Then Martha said to Jesus, Lord, if you had been here my brother would not be dead.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 22
text: But I am certain that, even now, whatever request you make to God, God will give it to you.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 23
text: Jesus said to her, Your brother will come to life again.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 24
text: Martha said to him, I am certain that he will come to life again when all come back from the dead at the last day.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 25
text: Jesus said to her, I am myself that day and that life; he who has faith in me will have life even if he is dead;

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 26
text: And no one who is living and has faith in me will ever see death. Is this your faith?

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 27
text: She said to him, Yes, Lord: my faith is that you are the Christ, the Son of God, who was to come into the world.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 28
text: And having said this, she went away and said secretly to her sister Mary, The Master is here and has sent for you.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 29
text: And Mary, hearing this, got up quickly and went to him.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 30
text: Now Jesus had not at this time come into the town, but was still in the place where Martha had seen him.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 31
text: Then the Jews who were with her in the house, comforting her, when they saw Mary get up quickly and go out, went after her in the belief that she was going to the place of the dead and would be weeping there.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 32
text: When Mary came to where Jesus was and saw him, she went down at his feet, saying, Lord, if you had been here my brother would not be dead.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 33
text: And when Jesus saw her weeping, and saw the Jews weeping who came with her, his spirit was moved and he was troubled,

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 34
text: And said, Where have you put him? They said, Come and see, Lord.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 35
text: And Jesus himself was weeping.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 36
text: So the Jews said, See how dear he was to him!

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 37
text: But some of them said, This man, who made open the eyes of the blind man, was he not able to keep his friend from death?

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 38
text: So Jesus, deeply troubled in heart, came to the place of the dead. It was a hole in the rock, and a stone was over the opening.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 39
text: Jesus said, Take away the stone. Martha, the sister of him who was dead, said, Lord, by this time the body will be smelling, for he has been dead four days.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 40
text: Jesus said to her, Did I not say to you that if you had faith you would see the glory of God?

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 41
text: So they took away the stone. And Jesus, looking up to heaven, said, Father, I give praise to you for hearing me.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 42
text: I was certain that your ears are at all times open to me, but I said it because of these who are here, so that they may see that you sent me.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 43
text: Then he said in a loud voice, Lazarus, come out!

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 44
text: And he who was dead came out, with linen bands folded tightly about his hands and feet, and a cloth about his face. Jesus said to them, Make him free and let him go.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 45
text: Then a number of the Jews who had come to Mary and had seen the things which Jesus did had belief in him.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 46
text: But some of them went to the Pharisees with the news of what Jesus had done.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 47
text: Then the high priests and the Pharisees had a meeting and said, What are we doing? This man is doing a number of signs.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 48
text: If we let him go on in this way, everybody will have belief in him and the Romans will come and take away our place and our nation.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 49
text: But one of them, Caiaphas, who was high priest that year, said to them, You have no knowledge of anything;

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 50
text: You do not see that it is in your interest for one man to be put to death for the people, so that all the nation may not come to destruction.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 51
text: He did not say this of himself, but being the high priest that year he said, as a prophet, that Jesus would be put to death for the nation;

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 52
text: And not for that nation only, but for the purpose of uniting in one body the children of God all over the world.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 53
text: And from that day they took thought together how to put him to death.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 54
text: So Jesus no longer went about publicly among the Jews, but went from there into the country near to the waste land, to a town named Ephraim, where he was for some time with the disciples.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 55
text: Now the Passover of the Jews was near, and numbers of people went up from the country to Jerusalem to make themselves clean before the Passover.

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 56
text: They were looking for Jesus and saying to one another while they were in the Temple, What is your opinion? Will he not come to the feast?

title: John Chapter 11 Verse 57
text: Now the chief priests and the Pharisees had given orders that if anyone had knowledge where he was, he was to give them word, so that they might take him.

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 1
text: Then, six days before the Passover, Jesus came to Bethany where Lazarus was, whom Jesus had made to come back from the dead.

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 2
text: So they made him a meal there, and he was waited on by Martha, and Lazarus was among those who were seated with him at table.

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 3
text: Then Mary, taking a pound of perfumed oil of great value, put it on the feet of Jesus and made them dry with her hair: and the house became full of the smell of the perfume.

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 4
text: But one of his disciples, Judas Iscariot (who was to give him up), said,

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 5
text: Why was not this perfume traded for three hundred pence, and the money given to the poor?

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 6
text: (He said this, not because he had any love for the poor; but because he was a thief, and, having the money-bag, took for himself what was put into it.)

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 7
text: Then Jesus said, Let her be. Let her keep what she has for the day of my death.

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 8
text: The poor you have ever with you, but me you have not for ever.

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 9
text: Then a great number of the Jews had news that he was there: and they came, not only because of Jesus, but so that they might see Lazarus who had been dead and to whom he had given life.

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 10
text: Now there was talk among the chief priests of putting Lazarus to death;

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 11
text: For because of him a great number of the Jews went away and had belief in Jesus.

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 12
text: The day after, a great number of people who were there for the feast, when they had the news that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem,

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 13
text: Took branches of palm-trees and went out to him, crying, A blessing on him who comes in the name of the Lord, the King of Israel!

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 14
text: And Jesus saw a young ass and took his seat on it; as the Writings say,

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 15
text: Have no fear, daughter of Zion: see your King is coming, seated on a young ass.

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 16
text: (These things were not clear to his disciples at first: but when Jesus had been lifted up into his glory, then it came to their minds that these things in the Writings were about him and that they had been done to him.)

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 17
text: Now the people who were with him when his voice came to Lazarus in the place of the dead, and gave him life again, had been talking about it.

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 18
text: And that was the reason the people went out to him, because it had come to their ears that he had done this sign.

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 19
text: Then the Pharisees said one to another, You see, you are unable to do anything: the world has gone after him.

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 20
text: Now there were some Greeks among the people who had come up to give worship at the feast:

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 21
text: They came to Philip, who was of Beth-saida in Galilee, and made a request, saying, Sir, we have a desire to see Jesus.

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 22
text: Philip went and gave word of it to Andrew; and Andrew went with Philip to Jesus.

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 23
text: And Jesus said to them in answer, The hour of the glory of the Son of man has come.

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 24
text: Truly I say to you, If a seed of grain does not go into the earth and come to an end, it is still a seed and no more; but through its death it gives much fruit.

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 25
text: He who is in love with life will have it taken from him; and he who has no care for his life in this world will keep it for ever and ever.

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 26
text: If any man is my servant, let him come after me; and where I am, there will my servant be. If any man becomes my servant, my Father will give him honour.

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 27
text: Now is my soul troubled; and what am I to say? Father, keep me from this hour. No: for this purpose have I come to this hour.

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 28
text: Father, give glory to your name. Then there came a voice out of heaven, saying, I have given it glory, and I will give it glory again.

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 29
text: Hearing the sound, a number of people who were there said that it was thunder: others said, An angel was talking to him.

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 30
text: Jesus said in answer, This voice came not for me but for you.

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 31
text: Now is this world to be judged: now will the ruler of this world be sent out.

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 32
text: And I, if I am lifted up from the earth, will make all men come to me.

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 33
text: (This he said, pointing to the sort of death he would have.)

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 34
text: Then the people in answer said to him, The law says that the Christ will have life without end: how say you then that it is necessary for the Son of man to be lifted up? Who is this Son of man?

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 35
text: Jesus said to them, For a little time longer the light will be among you; while you have the light go on walking in it, so that the dark may not overtake you: one walking in the dark has no knowledge of where he is going.

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 36
text: In so far as you have the light, put your faith in the light so that you may become sons of light. With these words Jesus went away and for a time was not seen again by them.

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 37
text: But though he had done such a number of signs before them, they still had no belief in him:

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 38
text: So that the words of the prophet Isaiah might come true, when he said, Lord, who has any belief in our preaching? and the arm of the Lord, to whom has it been unveiled?

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 39
text: For this reason they were unable to have belief, because Isaiah said again,

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 40
text: He has made their eyes blind, and their hearts hard; for fear that they might see with their eyes and get knowledge with their hearts, and be changed, and I might make them well.

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 41
text: (Isaiah said these words because he saw his glory. His words were about him.)

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 42
text: However, a number even of the rulers had belief in him, but because of the Pharisees they did not say so openly for fear that they might be shut out from the Synagogue:

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 43
text: For the praise of men was dearer to them than the approval of God.

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 44
text: Then Jesus said with a loud voice, He who has faith in me, has faith not in me, but in him who sent me.

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 45
text: And he who sees me, sees him who sent me.

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 46
text: I have come as a light into the world, so that no one who has faith in me will go on living in the dark.

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 47
text: And if any man gives ear to my words and does not keep them, I am not his judge: I did not come to be judge of the world but to give salvation to the world.

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 48
text: He who puts me on one side and does not take my words to heart, is not without a judge: the word which I have said will be his judge on the last day.

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 49
text: For I have not said it on my authority, but the Father who sent me gave me orders what to say and how to say it.

title: John Chapter 12 Verse 50
text: And I have knowledge that his order is eternal life: so that the things which I say, I say them even as the Father says them to me.

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 1
text: Now before the feast of the Passover, it was clear to Jesus that the time had come for him to go away from this world to the Father. Having once had love for those in the world who were his, his love for them went on to the end.

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 2
text: So while a meal was going on, the Evil One having now put it into the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon's son, to be false to him,

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 3
text: Jesus, being conscious that the Father had put everything into his hands, and that he came from God and was going to God,

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 4
text: Got up from table, put off his robe and took a cloth and put it round him.

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 5
text: Then he put water into a basin and was washing the feet of the disciples and drying them with the cloth which was round him.

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 6
text: So he came to Simon Peter. Peter said, Lord, are my feet to be washed by you?

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 7
text: And Jesus, answering, said to him, What I do is not clear to you now, but it will be clear to you in time to come.

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 8
text: Peter said, I will never let my feet be washed by you, never. Jesus said in answer, If I do not make you clean you have no part with me.

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 9
text: Simon Peter said to him, Lord, not my feet only, but my hands and my head.

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 10
text: Jesus said to him, He who is bathed has need only to have his feet washed and then he is clean all over: and you, my disciples, are clean, but not all of you.

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 11
text: (He had knowledge who was false to him; that is why he said, You are not all clean.)

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 12
text: Then, after washing their feet and putting on his robe again, he took his seat and said to them, Do you see what I have done to you?

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 13
text: You give me the name of Master and Lord: and you are right; that is what I am.

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 14
text: If then I, the Lord and the Master, have made your feet clean, it is right for you to make one another's feet clean.

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 15
text: I have given you an example, so that you may do what I have done to you.

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 16
text: Truly I say to you, A servant is not greater than his lord; and he who is sent is not greater than the one who sent him.

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 17
text: If these things are clear to you, happy are you if you do them.

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 18
text: I am not talking of you all: I have knowledge of my true disciples, but things are as they are, so that the Writings may come true, The foot of him who takes bread with me is lifted up against me.

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 19
text: From this time forward, I give you knowledge of things before they come about, so that when they come about you may have belief that I am he.

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 20
text: Truly I say to you, He who takes to his heart anyone whom I send, takes me to his heart; and he who so takes me, takes him who sent me.

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 21
text: When Jesus had said this he was troubled in spirit, and gave witness, saying, Truly I say to you, that one of you will be false to me.

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 22
text: Then the eyes of the disciples were turned on one another, in doubt as to whom he had in mind.

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 23
text: There was at table one of his disciples, the one dear to Jesus, resting his head on Jesus' breast.

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 24
text: Making a sign to him, Simon Peter said, Who is it he is talking about?

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 25
text: He, then, resting his head on Jesus' breast, said to him, Lord, who is it?

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 26
text: This was the answer Jesus gave: It is the one to whom I will give this bit of bread after I have put it in the vessel. Then he took the bit of bread, put it into the vessel, and gave it to Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot.

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 27
text: And when Judas took the bread Satan went into him. Then Jesus said to him, Do quickly what you have to do.

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 28
text: Now it was not clear to anyone at table why he said this to him.

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 29
text: Some were of the opinion that because Judas kept the money-bag Jesus said to him, Get the things we have need of for the feast; or, that he was to give something to the poor.

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 30
text: So Judas, having taken the bit of bread, straight away went out: and it was night.

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 31
text: Then when he had gone out, Jesus said, Now is glory given to the Son of man, and God is given glory in him.

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 32
text: If God is given glory in him, God will give him glory in himself, and will give him glory even now.

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 33
text: My dear children, I am only to be with you a little longer. Then you will be looking for me: and as I said to the Jews, so now I say to you, Where I am going you may not come.

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 34
text: I give you a new law: Have love one for another; even as I have had love for you, so are you to have love one for another.

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 35
text: By this it will be clear to all men that you are my disciples, if you have love one for another.

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 36
text: Simon Peter said to him, Lord, where are you going? Jesus said in answer, Where I am going you may not come with me now, but you will come later.

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 37
text: Peter said to him, Why may I not come with you even now? I will give up my life for you.

title: John Chapter 13 Verse 38
text: Jesus said in answer, Will you give up your life for me? Truly I say to you, Before the cry of the cock you will have said three times that you are not my disciple.

title: John Chapter 14 Verse 1
text: Let not your heart be troubled: have faith in God and have faith in me.

title: John Chapter 14 Verse 2
text: In my Father's house are rooms enough; if it was not so, would I have said that I am going to make ready a place for you?

title: John Chapter 14 Verse 3
text: And if I go and make ready a place for you, I will come back again and will take you to be with me, so that you may be where I am.

title: John Chapter 14 Verse 4
text: And you all have knowledge of where I am going, and of the way to it.

title: John Chapter 14 Verse 5
text: Thomas said, Lord, we have no knowledge of where you are going; how may we have knowledge of the way?

title: John Chapter 14 Verse 6
text: Jesus said to him, I am the true and living way: no one comes to the Father but by me.

title: John Chapter 14 Verse 7
text: If you had knowledge of me, you would have knowledge of my Father: you have knowledge of him now and have seen him.

title: John Chapter 14 Verse 8
text: Philip said to him, Lord, let us see the Father, and we have need of nothing more.

title: John Chapter 14 Verse 9
text: Jesus said to him, Philip, have I been with you all this time, and still you have no knowledge of me? He who has seen me has seen the Father. Why do you say, Let us see the Father?

title: John Chapter 14 Verse 10
text: Have you not faith that I am in the Father and the Father is in me? The words which I say to you, I say not from myself: but the Father who is in me all the time does his works.

title: John Chapter 14 Verse 11
text: Have faith that I am in the Father and that the Father is in me: at least, have faith in me because of what I do.

title: John Chapter 14 Verse 12
text: Truly I say to you, He who puts his faith in me will do the very works which I do, and he will do greater things than these, because I am going to my Father.

title: John Chapter 14 Verse 13
text: And whatever request you make in my name, that I will do, so that the Father may have glory in the Son.

title: John Chapter 14 Verse 14
text: If you make any request to me in my name, I will do it.

title: John Chapter 14 Verse 15
text: If you have love for me, you will keep my laws.

title: John Chapter 14 Verse 16
text: And I will make prayer to the Father and he will give you another Helper to be with you for ever,

title: John Chapter 14 Verse 17
text: Even the Spirit of true knowledge. That Spirit the world is not able to take to its heart because it sees him not and has no knowledge of him: but you have knowledge of him, because he is ever with you and will be in you.

title: John Chapter 14 Verse 18
text: I will not let you be without a friend: I am coming to you.

title: John Chapter 14 Verse 19
text: A little time longer, and the world will see me no more; but you will see me; and you will be living because I am living.

title: John Chapter 14 Verse 20
text: At that time it will be clear to you that I am in my Father, and you are in me, and I in you.

title: John Chapter 14 Verse 21
text: He who has my laws and keeps them, he it is who has love for me: and he who has love for me will be loved by my Father, and I will have love for him and will let myself be seen clearly by him.

title: John Chapter 14 Verse 22
text: Judas (not Iscariot) said to him, How is it that you will let yourself be seen clearly by us and not by the world?

title: John Chapter 14 Verse 23
text: Jesus said to him in answer, If anyone has love for me, he will keep my words: and he will be dear to my Father; and we will come to him and make our living-place with him.

title: John Chapter 14 Verse 24
text: He who has no love for me does not keep my words; and the word which you are hearing is not my word but the Father's who sent me.

title: John Chapter 14 Verse 25
text: I have said all this to you while I am still with you.

title: John Chapter 14 Verse 26
text: But the Helper, the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in my name, will be your teacher in all things and will put you in mind of everything I have said to you.

title: John Chapter 14 Verse 27
text: May peace be with you; my peace I give to you: I give it not as the world gives. Let not your heart be troubled; let it be without fear.

title: John Chapter 14 Verse 28
text: Keep in mind how I said to you, I go away and come to you again. If you had love for me you would be glad, because I am going to the Father: for the Father is greater than I.

title: John Chapter 14 Verse 29
text: And now I have given you word of it before it comes, so that, when it comes, you may have faith.

title: John Chapter 14 Verse 30
text: After this I will not say much to you, because the ruler of this world comes: and he has no power over me;

title: John Chapter 14 Verse 31
text: But he comes so that the world may see that I have love for the Father, and that I am doing as I am ordered by the Father. Get up, and let us go.

title: John Chapter 15 Verse 1
text: I am the true vine and my Father is the gardener.

title: John Chapter 15 Verse 2
text: He takes away every branch in me which has no fruit, and every branch which has fruit he makes clean, so that it may have more fruit.

title: John Chapter 15 Verse 3
text: You are clean, even now, through the teaching which I have given you.

title: John Chapter 15 Verse 4
text: Be in me at all times as I am in you. As the branch is not able to give fruit of itself, if it is not still on the vine, so you are not able to do so if you are not in me.

title: John Chapter 15 Verse 5
text: I am the vine, you are the branches: he who is in me at all times as I am in him, gives much fruit, because without me you are able to do nothing.

title: John Chapter 15 Verse 6
text: If a man does not keep himself in me, he becomes dead and is cut off like a dry branch; such branches are taken up and put in the fire and burned.

title: John Chapter 15 Verse 7
text: If you are in me at all times, and my words are in you, then anything for which you make a request will be done for you.

title: John Chapter 15 Verse 8
text: Here is my Father's glory, in that you give much fruit and so are my true disciples.

title: John Chapter 15 Verse 9
text: Even as the Father has given me his love, so I have given my love to you: be ever in my love.

title: John Chapter 15 Verse 10
text: If you keep my laws, you will be ever in my love, even as I have kept my Father's laws, and am ever in his love.

title: John Chapter 15 Verse 11
text: I have said these things to you so that I may have joy in you and so that your joy may be complete.

title: John Chapter 15 Verse 12
text: This is the law I give you: Have love one for another, even as I have love for you.

title: John Chapter 15 Verse 13
text: Greater love has no man than this, that a man gives up his life for his friends.

title: John Chapter 15 Verse 14
text: You are my friends, if you do what I give you orders to do.

title: John Chapter 15 Verse 15
text: No longer do I give you the name of servants; because a servant is without knowledge of what his master is doing: I give you the name of friends, because I have given you knowledge of all the things which my Father has said to me.

title: John Chapter 15 Verse 16
text: You did not take me for yourselves, but I took you for myself; and I gave you the work of going about and producing fruit which will be for ever; so that whatever request you make to the Father in my name he may give it to you.

title: John Chapter 15 Verse 17
text: So this is my law for you: Have love one for another.

title: John Chapter 15 Verse 18
text: If you are hated by the world, keep in mind that I was hated by the world before you.

title: John Chapter 15 Verse 19
text: If you were of the world, you would be loved by the world: but because you are not of the world, but I have taken you out of the world, you are hated by the world.

title: John Chapter 15 Verse 20
text: Keep in mind the words I said to you, A servant is not greater than his lord. If they were cruel to me, they will be cruel to you; if they kept my words, they will keep yours.

title: John Chapter 15 Verse 21
text: They will do all this to you because of my name--because they have no knowledge of him who sent me.

title: John Chapter 15 Verse 22
text: If I had not come and been their teacher they would have had no sin: but now they have no reason to give for their sin.

title: John Chapter 15 Verse 23
text: He who has hate for me has hate for my Father.

title: John Chapter 15 Verse 24
text: If I had not done among them the works which no other man ever did, they would have had no sin: but now they have seen, and they have had hate in their hearts for me and my Father.

title: John Chapter 15 Verse 25
text: This comes about so that the writing in their law may be made true, Their hate for me was without cause.

title: John Chapter 15 Verse 26
text: When the Helper comes, whom I will send to you from the Father even the Spirit of true knowledge who comes from the Father--he will give witness about me;

title: John Chapter 15 Verse 27
text: And you, in addition, will give witness because you have been with me from the first.

title: John Chapter 16 Verse 1
text: I have said these things to you so that you may not be in doubt.

title: John Chapter 16 Verse 2
text: They will put you out of the Synagogues: yes, the time is coming when whoever puts you to death will have the belief that he is doing God's pleasure.

title: John Chapter 16 Verse 3
text: They will do these things to you because they have not had knowledge of the Father or of me.

title: John Chapter 16 Verse 4
text: I have said these things to you so that when the time comes, what I have said may come to your mind. I did not say them to you at the first, because then I was still with you.

title: John Chapter 16 Verse 5
text: But now I am going to him who sent me; and not one of you says to me, Where are you going?

title: John Chapter 16 Verse 6
text: But your hearts are full of sorrow because I have said these things.

title: John Chapter 16 Verse 7
text: But what I am saying is true: my going is for your good: for if I do not go away, the Helper will not come to you; but if I go, I will send him to you.

title: John Chapter 16 Verse 8
text: And he, when he comes, will make the world conscious of sin, and of righteousness, and of being judged:

title: John Chapter 16 Verse 9
text: Of sin, because they have not faith in me;

title: John Chapter 16 Verse 10
text: Of righteousness, because I go to the Father and you will see me no more;

title: John Chapter 16 Verse 11
text: Of being judged, because the ruler of this world has been judged.

title: John Chapter 16 Verse 12
text: I have still much to say to you, but you are not strong enough for it now.

title: John Chapter 16 Verse 13
text: However, when he, the Spirit of true knowledge, has come, he will be your guide into all true knowledge: for his words will not come from himself, but whatever has come to his hearing, that he will say: and he will make clear to you the things to come.

title: John Chapter 16 Verse 14
text: He will give me glory, because he will take of what is mine, and make it clear to you.

title: John Chapter 16 Verse 15
text: Everything which the Father has is mine: that is why I say, He will take of what is mine and will make it clear to you.

title: John Chapter 16 Verse 16
text: After a little time you will see me no longer; and then again, after a little time, you will see me.

title: John Chapter 16 Verse 17
text: So some of the disciples said one to another, What is this he is saying, After a little time, you will see me no longer; and then again, after a little time, you will see me? and, I am going to the Father?

title: John Chapter 16 Verse 18
text: So they said again and again, What is this he is saying, A little time? His words are not clear to us.

title: John Chapter 16 Verse 19
text: Jesus saw that they had a desire to put the question to him, so he said to them, Is this what you are questioning one with another, why I said, After a little time, you will see me no longer; and then again, after a little time, you will see me?

title: John Chapter 16 Verse 20
text: Truly I say to you, You will be weeping and sorrowing, but the world will be glad: you will be sad, but your sorrow will be turned into joy.

title: John Chapter 16 Verse 21
text: When a woman is about to give birth she has sorrow, because her hour is come; but when she has given birth to the child, the pain is put out of her mind by the joy that a man has come into the world.

title: John Chapter 16 Verse 22
text: So you have sorrow now: but I will see you again, and your hearts will be glad, and no one will take away your joy.

title: John Chapter 16 Verse 23
text: And on that day you will put no questions to me. Truly I say to you, Whatever request you make to the Father, he will give it to you in my name.

title: John Chapter 16 Verse 24
text: Up to now you have made no request in my name: do so, and it will be answered, so that your hearts may be full of joy.

title: John Chapter 16 Verse 25
text: All this I have said to you in veiled language: but the time is coming when I will no longer say things in veiled language but will give you knowledge of the Father clearly.

title: John Chapter 16 Verse 26
text: In that day you will make requests in my name: and I do not say that I will make prayer to the Father for you,

title: John Chapter 16 Verse 27
text: For the Father himself gives his love to you, because you have given your love to me and have had faith that I came from God.

title: John Chapter 16 Verse 28
text: I came out from the Father and have come into the world: again, I go away from the world and go to the Father.

title: John Chapter 16 Verse 29
text: His disciples said, Now you are talking clearly and not in veiled language.

title: John Chapter 16 Verse 30
text: Now we are certain that you have knowledge of all things and have no need for anyone to put questions to you: through this we have faith that you came from God.

title: John Chapter 16 Verse 31
text: Jesus made answer, Have you faith now?

title: John Chapter 16 Verse 32
text: See, a time is coming, yes, it is now here, when you will go away in all directions, every man to his house, and I will be by myself: but I am not by myself, because the Father is with me.

title: John Chapter 16 Verse 33
text: I have said all these things to you so that in me you may have peace. In the world you have trouble: but take heart! I have overcome the world.

title: John Chapter 17 Verse 1
text: Jesus said these things; then, lifting his eyes to heaven, he said, Father, the time has now come; give glory to your Son, so that the Son may give glory to you:

title: John Chapter 17 Verse 2
text: Even as you gave him authority over all flesh, to give eternal life to all those whom you have given to him.

title: John Chapter 17 Verse 3
text: And this is eternal life: to have knowledge of you, the only true God, and of him whom you have sent, even Jesus Christ.

title: John Chapter 17 Verse 4
text: I have given you glory on the earth, having done all the work which you gave me to do.

title: John Chapter 17 Verse 5
text: And now, Father, let me have glory with you, even that glory which I had with you before the world was.

title: John Chapter 17 Verse 6
text: I have given knowledge of your name to the men whom you gave me out of the world: yours they were, and you gave them to me, and they have kept your words.

title: John Chapter 17 Verse 7
text: Now it is clear to them that whatever you have given to me comes from you:

title: John Chapter 17 Verse 8
text: Because I have given them the words which you gave to me; and they have taken them to heart, and have certain knowledge that I came from you, and they have faith that you sent me.

title: John Chapter 17 Verse 9
text: My prayer is for them: my prayer is not for the world, but for those whom you have given to me, because they are yours

title: John Chapter 17 Verse 10
text: (All mine are yours, and yours are mine) and I have glory in them.

title: John Chapter 17 Verse 11
text: And now I will be no longer in the world, but they are in the world and I come to you. Holy Father, keep them in your name which you have given to me, so that they may be one even as we are one.

title: John Chapter 17 Verse 12
text: While I was with them I kept them safe in your name which you have given to me: I took care of them and not one of them has come to destruction, but only the son of destruction, so that the Writings might come true.

title: John Chapter 17 Verse 13
text: And now I come to you; and these things I say in the world so that they may have my joy complete in them.

title: John Chapter 17 Verse 14
