text: I have given your word to them; and they are hated by the world, because they are not of the world, even as I am not of the world.

title: John Chapter 17 Verse 15
text: My prayer is not that you will take them out of the world, but that you will keep them from the Evil One.

title: John Chapter 17 Verse 16
text: They are not of the world any more than I am of the world.

title: John Chapter 17 Verse 17
text: Make them holy by the true word: your word is the true word.

title: John Chapter 17 Verse 18
text: Even as you have sent me into the world, so I have sent them into the world.

title: John Chapter 17 Verse 19
text: And for them I make myself holy, so that they may be made truly holy.

title: John Chapter 17 Verse 20
text: My prayer is not for them only, but for all who will have faith in me through their word;

title: John Chapter 17 Verse 21
text: May they all be one! Even as you, Father, are in me and I am in you, so let them be in us, so that all men may come to have faith that you sent me.

title: John Chapter 17 Verse 22
text: And the glory which you have given to me I have given to them, so that they may be one even as we are one;

title: John Chapter 17 Verse 23
text: I in them, and you in me, so that they may be made completely one, and so that it may become clear to all men that you have sent me and that they are loved by you as I am loved by you.

title: John Chapter 17 Verse 24
text: Father, it is my desire that these whom you have given to me may be by my side where I am, so that they may see my glory which you have given to me, because you had love for me before the world came into being.

title: John Chapter 17 Verse 25
text: Father of righteousness, I have knowledge of you, though the world has not; and to these it is clear that you sent me;

title: John Chapter 17 Verse 26
text: And I have given to them knowledge of your name, and will give it, so that the love which you have for me may be in them and I in them.

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 1
text: When Jesus had said these words he went out with his disciples over the stream Kedron to a garden, into which he went with his disciples.

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 2
text: And Judas, who was false to him, had knowledge of the place because Jesus went there frequently with his disciples.

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 3
text: So Judas, getting a band of armed men and police from the chief priests and Pharisees, went there with lights and with arms.

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 4
text: Then Jesus, having knowledge of everything which was coming on him, went forward and said to them, Who are you looking for?

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 5
text: Their answer was, Jesus the Nazarene. Jesus said, I am he. And Judas, who was false to him, was there at their side.

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 6
text: And when he said to them, I am he, they went back, falling to the earth.

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 7
text: So again he put the question to them, Who are you looking for? And they said, Jesus the Nazarene.

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 8
text: Jesus made answer, I have said that I am he; if you are looking for me, let these men go away.

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 9
text: (He said this so that his words might come true, I have kept safe all those whom you gave to me.)

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 10
text: Then Simon Peter, who had a sword, took it out and gave the high priest's servant a blow, cutting off his right ear. The servant's name was Malchus.

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 11
text: Then Jesus said to Peter, Put back your sword: am I not to take the cup which my Father has given to me?

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 12
text: Then the band and the chief captain and the police took Jesus and put cords round him.

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 13
text: They took him first to Annas, because Annas was the father-in-law of Caiaphas who was the high priest that year.

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 14
text: It was Caiaphas who had said to the Jews that it was in their interest for one man to be put to death for the people.

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 15
text: And Simon Peter went after Jesus with another disciple. Now that disciple was a friend of the high priest and he went in with Jesus into the house of the high priest;

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 16
text: But Peter was kept outside at the door. Then this other disciple, who was a friend of the high priest, came out and had a word with the girl who kept the door, and took Peter in.

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 17
text: Then the girl who was the door-keeper said to Peter, Are you not one of this man's disciples? In answer he said, I am not.

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 18
text: Now the servants and the police had made a fire of coals because it was cold; they were warming themselves in front of it and Peter was there with them, warming himself.

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 19
text: Then the high priest put questions to Jesus about his disciples and his teaching.

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 20
text: Jesus made answer, I said things openly to the world at all times; I have given my teaching in the Synagogues and in the Temple to which all the Jews come; and I have said nothing secretly.

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 21
text: Why are you questioning me? put questions to my hearers about what I have said to them: they have knowledge of what I said.

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 22
text: When he said this, one of the police by his side gave him a blow with his open hand, saying, Do you give such an answer to the high priest?

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 23
text: Jesus said in answer, If I have said anything evil, give witness to the evil: but if I said what is true, why do you give me blows?

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 24
text: Then Annas sent him chained to Caiaphas, the high priest.

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 25
text: But Simon Peter was still there warming himself by the fire. They said to him, Are you not one of his disciples? He said, No, I am not.

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 26
text: One of the servants of the high priest, a relation of him whose ear had been cut off by Peter, said, Did I not see you with him in the garden?

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 27
text: Then again Peter said, No. And straight away a cock gave its cry.

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 28
text: So they took Jesus from the house of Caiaphas to the Praetorium. It was early. They themselves did not go into the Praetorium, so that they might not become unclean, but might take the Passover.

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 29
text: So Pilate came out to them and put the question: What have you to say against this man?

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 30
text: They said to him in answer, If the man was not a wrongdoer we would not have given him up to you.

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 31
text: Then Pilate said to them, Take him yourselves and let him be judged by your law. But the Jews said to him, We have no right to put any man to death.

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 32
text: (That the word of Jesus might come true, pointing to the sort of death he would have.)

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 33
text: Then Pilate went back into the Praetorium and sent for Jesus and said to him, Are you the King of the Jews?

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 34
text: Jesus made answer, Do you say this of yourself, or did others say it about me?

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 35
text: Pilate said, Am I a Jew? Your nation and the chief priests have given you into my hands: what have you done?

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 36
text: Jesus said in answer, My kingdom is not of this world: if my kingdom was of this world, my disciples would have made a good fight to keep me out of the hands of the Jews: but my kingdom is not here.

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 37
text: Then Pilate said to him, Are you then a king? Jesus made answer, You say that I am a king. For this purpose was I given birth, and for this purpose I came into the world, that I might give witness to what is true. Every lover of what is true gives ear to my voice.

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 38
text: Pilate said to him, True? what is true? Having said this he went out again to the Jews and said to them, I see no wrong in him.

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 39
text: But every year you make a request to me to let a prisoner go free at the Passover. Is it your desire that I let the King of the Jews go free?

title: John Chapter 18 Verse 40
text: Then again they gave a loud cry, Not this man, but Barabbas. Now Barabbas was an outlaw.

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 1
text: Then Pilate took Jesus and had him whipped with cords.

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 2
text: And the men of the army made a crown of thorns and put it on his head, and they put a purple robe on him.

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 3
text: And they kept coming and saying, Long life to the King of the Jews! And they gave him blows with their hands.

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 4
text: And Pilate went out again and said to them, See, I let him come out to you to make it clear to you that I see no wrong in him.

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 5
text: Then Jesus came out with the crown of thorns and the purple robe. And Pilate said to them, Here is the man!

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 6
text: So when the chief priests and the police saw him they gave a loud cry, To the cross! to the cross! Pilate said to them, Take him yourselves and put him on the cross: I see no crime in him.

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 7
text: And the Jews made answer, We have a law, and by that law it is right for him to be put to death because he said he was the Son of God.

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 8
text: When this saying came to Pilate's ears his fear became greater;

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 9
text: And he went again into the Praetorium and said to Jesus, Where do you come from? But Jesus gave him no answer.

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 10
text: Then Pilate said to him, You say nothing to me? is it not clear to you that I have power to let you go free and power to put you to death on the cross?

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 11
text: Jesus gave this answer: You would have no power at all over me if it was not given to you by God; so that he who gave me up to you has the greater sin.

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 12
text: Hearing this, Pilate had a desire to let him go free, but the Jews said in a loud voice, If you let this man go, you are not Caesar's friend: everyone who makes himself a king goes against Caesar.

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 13
text: So when these words came to Pilate's ear, he took Jesus out, seating himself in the judge's seat in a place named in Hebrew, Gabbatha, or the Stone Floor.

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 14
text: (It was the day when they made ready for the Passover; and it was about the sixth hour.) And he said to the Jews, There is your King!

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 15
text: Then they gave a loud cry, Away with him! away with him! to the cross! Pilate said to them, Am I to put your King to death on the cross? The chief priests said in answer, We have no king but Caesar.

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 16
text: So then he gave him up to them to be put to death on the cross. And they took Jesus away;

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 17
text: And he went out with his cross on him to the place which is named Dead Man's Head (in Hebrew, Golgotha):

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 18
text: Where they put him on the cross with two others, one on this side and one on that, and Jesus in the middle.

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 19
text: And Pilate put on the cross a statement in writing. The writing was: JESUS THE NAZARENE, THE KING OF THE JEWS.

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 20
text: The writing was seen by a number of the Jews, for the place where Jesus was put to death on the cross was near the town; and the writing was in Hebrew and Latin and Greek.

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 21
text: Then the chief priests of the Jews said to Pilate, Do not put, The King of the Jews, but, He said, I am the King of the Jews.

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 22
text: But Pilate made answer, What I have put in writing will not be changed.

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 23
text: And when Jesus was nailed to the cross, the men of the army took his clothing, and made a division of it into four parts, to every man a part, and they took his coat: now the coat was without a join, made out of one bit of cloth.

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 24
text: So they said among themselves, Let this not be cut up, but let us put it to the decision of chance and see who gets it. (They did this so that the Writings might come true, which say, They made a distribution of my clothing among them, and my coat they put to the decision of chance.) This was what the men of the army did.

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 25
text: Now by the side of the cross of Jesus were his mother, and his mother's sister Mary, the wife of Cleopas, and Mary Magdalene.

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 26
text: So when Jesus saw his mother and the disciple who was dear to him, he said to his mother, Mother, there is your son!

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 27
text: Then he said to the disciple, There is your mother! And from that hour the disciple took her to his house.

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 28
text: After this, being conscious that all things had now been done so that the Writings might come true, Jesus said, Give me water.

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 29
text: Now there was a vessel ready, full of bitter wine, and they put a sponge full of it on a stick and put it to his mouth.

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 30
text: So when Jesus had taken the wine he said, All is done. And with his head bent he gave up his spirit.

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 31
text: Now it was the day of getting ready for the Passover, and so that the bodies might not be on the cross on the Sabbath (because the day of that Sabbath was a great day), the Jews made a request to Pilate that their legs might be broken, and that they might be taken away.

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 32
text: So the men of the army came, and the legs of the first were broken and then of the other who was put to death on the cross with Jesus:

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 33
text: But when they came to Jesus, they saw that he was dead by this time, and so his legs were not broken;

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 34
text: But one of the men made a wound in his side with a spear, and straight away there came out blood and water.

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 35
text: And he who saw it has given witness (and his witness is true; he is certain that what he says is true) so that you may have belief.

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 36
text: These things came about so that the Writings might be true, No bone of his body will be broken.

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 37
text: And again another verse says, They will see him who was wounded by their spears.

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 38
text: After these things, Joseph of Arimathaea, who was a disciple of Jesus, but secretly for fear of the Jews, made a request to Pilate to let him take away the body of Jesus: and Pilate said he might do so. So he went and took away his body.

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 39
text: And Nicodemus came (he who had first come to Jesus by night) with a roll of myrrh and aloes mixed, about a hundred pounds.

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 40
text: Then they took the body of Jesus, folding linen about it with the spices, as is the way of the Jews when they put the dead to rest.

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 41
text: Now there was a garden near the cross, and in the garden a new place for the dead in which no man had ever been put.

title: John Chapter 19 Verse 42
text: So they put Jesus there, because it was the Jews' day of getting ready for the Passover, and the place was near.

title: John Chapter 20 Verse 1
text: Now on the first day of the week, very early, while it was still dark, Mary Magdalene came to the place and saw that the stone had been taken away from it.

title: John Chapter 20 Verse 2
text: Then she went running to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple who was loved by Jesus, and said to them, They have taken away the Lord out of the place of the dead and we have no knowledge where they have put him.

title: John Chapter 20 Verse 3
text: So Peter and the other disciple went out to the place of the dead.

title: John Chapter 20 Verse 4
text: They went running together, and the other disciple got in front of Peter and came first to the hole in the rock;

title: John Chapter 20 Verse 5
text: And looking in, he saw the linen bands on the earth; but he did not go in,

title: John Chapter 20 Verse 6
text: Then Simon Peter came after him and went into the hole in the rock; and he saw the linen bands on the earth,

title: John Chapter 20 Verse 7
text: And the cloth, which had been round his head, not with the linen bands but rolled up in a place by itself.

title: John Chapter 20 Verse 8
text: Then the other disciple who came there first went in; and he saw and belief came to him.

title: John Chapter 20 Verse 9
text: For at that time they had no knowledge that the Writings said that he would have to come again from the dead.

title: John Chapter 20 Verse 10
text: So then the disciples went away again to their houses.

title: John Chapter 20 Verse 11
text: But Mary was still there outside the hole in the rock, weeping; and while she was weeping and looking into the hole,

title: John Chapter 20 Verse 12
text: She saw two angels in white seated where the body of Jesus had been, one at the head and the other at the feet.

title: John Chapter 20 Verse 13
text: They said to her, Woman, why are you weeping? She said to them, Because they have taken away my Lord, and I have no knowledge where they have put him.

title: John Chapter 20 Verse 14
text: And then looking round, she saw Jesus there, but had no idea that it was Jesus.

title: John Chapter 20 Verse 15
text: Jesus said to her, Woman, why are you weeping? who are you looking for? She, taking him for the gardener, said to him, Sir, if you have taken him away from here, say where you have put him and I will take him away.

title: John Chapter 20 Verse 16
text: Jesus said to her, Mary! Turning, she said to him in Hebrew, Rabboni! (which is to say, Master).

title: John Chapter 20 Verse 17
text: Jesus said to her, Do not put your hand on me, for I have not gone up to the Father: but go to my brothers and say to them, I go up to my Father and your Father, to my God and your God.

title: John Chapter 20 Verse 18
text: Mary Magdalene went with the news to the disciples, and said she had seen the Lord and that he had said these things to her.

title: John Chapter 20 Verse 19
text: At evening on that day, the first day of the week, when, for fear of the Jews, the doors were shut where the disciples were, Jesus came among them and said to them, May peace be with you!

title: John Chapter 20 Verse 20
text: And when he had said this, he let them see his hands and his side. Then the disciples were glad when they saw the Lord.

title: John Chapter 20 Verse 21
text: And Jesus said to them again, May peace be with you! As the Father sent me, even so I now send you.

title: John Chapter 20 Verse 22
text: And when he had said this, breathing on them, he said to them, Let the Holy Spirit come on you:

title: John Chapter 20 Verse 23
text: Any to whom you give forgiveness, will be made free from their sins; and any from whom you keep back forgiveness, will still be in their sins.

title: John Chapter 20 Verse 24
text: Now Thomas, one of the twelve, named Didymus, was not with them when Jesus came.

title: John Chapter 20 Verse 25
text: So the other disciples said to him, We have seen the Lord. But he said to them, If I do not see in his hands the print of the nails and put my finger into the print of the nails, and if I do not put my hand into his side, I will never have belief.

title: John Chapter 20 Verse 26
text: And after eight days, his disciples were again in the house and Thomas was with them. Though the doors were shut, Jesus came, and taking his place in the middle of them, he said, May peace be with you!

title: John Chapter 20 Verse 27
text: Then he said to Thomas, Put out your finger, and see my hands; and put your hand here into my side: and be no longer in doubt but have belief.

title: John Chapter 20 Verse 28
text: And Thomas said in answer, My Lord and my God!

title: John Chapter 20 Verse 29
text: Jesus said to him, Because you have seen me you have belief: a blessing will be on those who have belief though they have not seen me!

title: John Chapter 20 Verse 30
text: A number of other signs Jesus did before his disciples which are not recorded in this book:

title: John Chapter 20 Verse 31
text: But these are recorded, so that you may have faith that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and so that, having this faith you may have life in his name.

title: John Chapter 21 Verse 1
text: After these things Jesus let himself be seen again by the disciples at the sea of Tiberias; and it came about in this way.

title: John Chapter 21 Verse 2
text: Simon Peter, Thomas named Didymus, Nathanael of Cana in Galilee, the sons of Zebedee, and two others of his disciples were all together.

title: John Chapter 21 Verse 3
text: Simon Peter said to them, I am going fishing. They said to him, And we will come with you. They went out and got into the boat; but that night they took no fish.

title: John Chapter 21 Verse 4
text: Now very early in the morning Jesus was there by the edge of the sea (though the disciples were not conscious that it was Jesus).

title: John Chapter 21 Verse 5
text: So Jesus said to them, Children, have you taken any fish? They made answer, No.

title: John Chapter 21 Verse 6
text: And he said to them, Let down the net on the right side of the boat and you will get some. So they put it in the water and now they were not able to get it up again because of the great number of fish.

title: John Chapter 21 Verse 7
text: So the disciple who was dear to Jesus said to Peter, It is the Lord! Hearing that it was the Lord, Peter put his coat round him (because he was not clothed) and went into the sea.

title: John Chapter 21 Verse 8
text: And the other disciples came in the little boat (they were not far from land, only about two hundred cubits off) pulling the net full of fish.

title: John Chapter 21 Verse 9
text: When they got to land, they saw a fire of coals there, with fish cooking on it, and bread.

title: John Chapter 21 Verse 10
text: Jesus said to them, Get some of the fish which you have now taken.

title: John Chapter 21 Verse 11
text: So Peter went to the boat and came back pulling the net to land, full of great fish, a hundred and fifty-three; and though there was such a number the net was not broken.

title: John Chapter 21 Verse 12
text: Jesus said to them, Come and take some food. And all the disciples were in fear of putting the question, Who are you? being conscious that it was the Lord.

title: John Chapter 21 Verse 13
text: Then Jesus came and took the bread and gave it to them, and the fish in the same way.

title: John Chapter 21 Verse 14
text: Now this was the third time that Jesus let himself be seen by the disciples after he had come back from the dead.

title: John Chapter 21 Verse 15
text: Then when they had taken food, Jesus said to Simon Peter, Simon, son of John, is your love for me greater than the love of these others? He said to him, Yes, Lord; you are certain of my love for you. He said to him, Then give my lambs food.

title: John Chapter 21 Verse 16
text: Again, a second time, he said to him, Simon, son of John, have you any love for me? Yes, Lord, he said, you are certain of my love for you. Then take care of my sheep, said Jesus.

title: John Chapter 21 Verse 17
text: He said to him a third time, Simon, son of John, am I dear to you? Now Peter was troubled in his heart because he put the question a third time, Am I dear to you? And he said to him, Lord, you have knowledge of all things; you see that you are dear to me. Jesus said to him, Then give my sheep food.

title: John Chapter 21 Verse 18
text: Truly I say to you, When you were young, you made yourself ready and went wherever you had a desire to go: but when you are old, you will put out your hands and another will make you ready, and you will be taken where you have no desire to go.

title: John Chapter 21 Verse 19
text: Now this he said, pointing out the sort of death by which he would give God glory. And after saying this, he said to him, Come after me.

title: John Chapter 21 Verse 20
text: Then Peter, turning round, saw the disciple who was dear to Jesus coming after them--the disciple who was resting on his breast at the last meal, and said, Lord, who is it who will be false to you?

title: John Chapter 21 Verse 21
text: Seeing him, Peter said to Jesus, What about this man?

title: John Chapter 21 Verse 22
text: Jesus said to him, If it is my desire for him to be here till I come back, what is that to you? come yourself after me.

title: John Chapter 21 Verse 23
text: So this saying went about among the brothers that this disciple would not undergo death: Jesus, however, did not say that he would not undergo death, but, If it is my desire for him to be here till I come back, what is that to you?

title: John Chapter 21 Verse 24
text: This is the disciple who gives witness about these things and who put them in writing: and we have knowledge that his witness is true.

title: John Chapter 21 Verse 25
text: And Jesus did such a number of other things that, if every one was recorded, it is my opinion that even the world itself is not great enough for the books there would be.

title: Acts Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: I have given an earlier account, O Theophilus, of all the things which Jesus did, and of his teaching from the first,

title: Acts Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: Till the day when he was taken up to heaven after he had given his orders, through the Holy Spirit, to the Apostles of whom he had made selection:

title: Acts Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: And to whom he gave clear and certain signs that he was living, after his death; for he was seen by them for forty days, and gave them teaching about the kingdom of God:

title: Acts Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: And when they were all together, with him, he gave them orders not to go away from Jerusalem, but to keep there, waiting till the word of the Father was put into effect, of which, he said, I have given you knowledge:

title: Acts Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: For the baptism of John was with water, but you will have baptism with the Holy Spirit, after a little time.

title: Acts Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: So, when they were together, they said to him, Lord, will you at this time give back the kingdom to Israel?

title: Acts Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: And he said to them, It is not for you to have knowledge of the time and the order of events which the Father has kept in his control.

title: Acts Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: But you will have power, when the Holy Spirit has come on you; and you will be my witnesses in Jerusalem and all Judaea and Samaria, and to the ends of the earth.

title: Acts Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: And when he had said these things, while they were looking, he was taken up, and went from their view into a cloud.

title: Acts Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: And while they were looking up to heaven with great attention, two men came to them, in white clothing,

title: Acts Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: And said, O men of Galilee, why are you looking up into heaven? This Jesus, who was taken from you into heaven, will come again, in the same way as you saw him go into heaven.

title: Acts Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: Then they went back to Jerusalem from the mountain named Olivet, which is near Jerusalem, a Sabbath day's journey away.

title: Acts Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: And when they came in, they went up into the room where they were living; Peter and John and James and Andrew, Philip and Thomas, Bartholomew and Matthew, James, the son of Alphaeus, and Simon the Zealot, and Judas, the son of James.

title: Acts Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: And they all with one mind gave themselves up to prayer, with the women, and Mary the mother of Jesus, and his brothers.

title: Acts Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: And in those days Peter got up among the brothers (there were about one hundred and twenty of them), and said,

title: Acts Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: My brothers, the word of God had to be put into effect, which the Holy Spirit had said before, by the mouth of David, about Judas, who was guide to those who took Jesus,

title: Acts Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: For he was numbered among us, and had his part in our work.

title: Acts Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: (Now this man, with the reward of his evil-doing, got for himself a field, and falling head first, came to a sudden and violent end there.

title: Acts Chapter 1 Verse 19
text: And this came to the knowledge of all those who were living in Jerusalem, so that the field was named in their language, Akel-dama, or, The field of blood.)

title: Acts Chapter 1 Verse 20
text: For in the book of Psalms it says, Let his house be waste, and let no man be living in it: and, Let his position be taken by another.

title: Acts Chapter 1 Verse 21
text: For this reason, of the men who have been with us all the time, while the Lord Jesus went in and out among us,

title: Acts Chapter 1 Verse 22
text: Starting from the baptism of John till he went up from us, one will have to be a witness with us of his coming back from death.

title: Acts Chapter 1 Verse 23
text: And they made selection of two, Joseph, named Barsabbas, whose other name was Justus, and Matthias.

title: Acts Chapter 1 Verse 24
text: And they made prayers and said, Lord, having knowledge of the hearts of all men, make clear which of these two has been marked out by you,

title: Acts Chapter 1 Verse 25
text: To take that position as a servant and Apostle, from which Judas by his sin was shut out, so that he might go to his place.

title: Acts Chapter 1 Verse 26
text: And they put it to the decision of chance, and the decision was given for Matthias, and he was numbered with the eleven Apostles.

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: And when the day of Pentecost was come, they were all together in one place.

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: And suddenly there came from heaven a sound like the rushing of a violent wind, and all the house where they were was full of it.

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: And they saw tongues, like flames of fire, coming to rest on every one of them.

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: And they were all full of the Holy Spirit, and were talking in different languages, as the Spirit gave them power.

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: Now there were living at Jerusalem, Jews, God-fearing men, from every nation under heaven.

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: And when this sound came to their ears, they all came together, and were greatly surprised because every man was hearing the words of the disciples in his special language.

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: And they were full of wonder and said, Are not all these men Galilaeans?

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: And how is it that every one of us is hearing their words in the language which was ours from our birth?

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: Men of Parthia, Media, and Elam, and those living in Mesopotamia, in Judaea and Cappadocia, in Pontus and Asia,

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: In Phrygia and Pamphylia, in Egypt and the parts of Libya about Cyrene, and those who have come from Rome, Jews by birth and others who have become Jews,

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: Men of Crete and Arabia, to all of us they are talking in our different languages, of the great works of God.

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: And they were all surprised and in doubt saying to one another, What is the reason of this?

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: But others, making sport of them, said, They are full of new wine.

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: But Peter, getting up, with the eleven, said in a loud voice, O men of Judaea, and all you who are living in Jerusalem, take note of this and give ear to my words.

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: For these men are not overcome with wine, as it seems to you, for it is only the third hour of the day;

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: But this is the thing which was said by the prophet Joel;

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: And it will come about, in the last days, says God, that I will send out my Spirit on all flesh; and your sons and your daughters will be prophets, and your young men will see visions, and your old men will have dreams:

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 18
text: And on my men-servants and my women-servants I will send my Spirit, and they will be prophets.

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 19
text: And wonders will be seen in heaven, and signs on the earth, blood and fire and smoke:

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 20
text: The sun will become dark and the moon will be turned to blood, before that great day of the Lord comes in glory:

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 21
text: And whoever makes his prayer to the Lord will have salvation.

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 22
text: Men of Israel, give ear to these words: Jesus of Nazareth, a man who had the approval of God, as was made clear to you by the great works and signs and wonders which God did by him among you, as you yourselves have knowledge,

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 23
text: Him, when he was given up, by the decision and knowledge of God, you put to death on the cross, by the hands of evil men:

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 24
text: But God gave him back to life, having made him free from the pains of death because it was not possible for him to be overcome by it.

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 25
text: For David said of him, I saw the Lord before my face at all times, for he is at my right hand, so that I may not be moved:

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 26
text: And for this cause my heart was glad and my tongue full of joy, and my flesh will be resting in hope:

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 27
text: For you will not let my soul be in hell and you will not give up your Holy One to destruction.

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 28
text: You have made me see the ways of life; I will be full of joy when I see your face.

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 29
text: My brothers, I may say to you openly that David came to his death, and was put in the earth, and his resting-place is with us today.

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 30
text: But being a prophet, and having in mind the oath which God had given to him, that of the fruit of his body one would take his place as a king,

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 31
text: He, having knowledge of the future, was talking of the coming again of Christ from the dead, that he was not kept in hell and his body did not see destruction.

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 32
text: This Jesus God has given back to life, of which we all are witnesses.

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 33
text: And so, being lifted up to the right hand of God, and having the Father's word that the Holy Spirit would come, he has sent this thing, which now you see and have knowledge of.

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 34
text: For David has not gone up into heaven, but says, himself, The Lord said to my Lord, Be seated at my right hand,

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 35
text: Till I put all those who are against you under your feet.

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 36
text: For this reason, let all Israel be certain that this Jesus, whom you put to death on the cross, God has made Lord and Christ.

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 37
text: Now when these words came to their ears their hearts were troubled, and they said to Peter and the other Apostles, Brothers, what are we to do?

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 38
text: And Peter said, Let your hearts be changed, every one of you, and have baptism in the name of Jesus Christ, for the forgiveness of your sins; and you will have the Holy Spirit given to you.

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 39
text: For the word of God is for you and for your children and for all those who are far off, even all those who may be marked out by the Lord our God.

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 40
text: And with more such words he gave his witness, offering them salvation and saying, Come out from this evil generation.

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 41
text: Then those who gave hearing to his words had baptism: and about three thousand souls were joined to them that day.

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 42
text: And they kept their attention fixed on the Apostles' teaching and were united together in the taking of broken bread and in prayer.

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 43
text: But fear came on every soul: and all sorts of wonders and signs were done by the Apostles.

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 44
text: And all those who were of the faith kept together, and had all things in common;

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 45
text: And exchanging their goods and property for money, they made division of it among them all, as they had need.

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 46
text: And day by day, going in agreement together regularly to the Temple and, taking broken bread together in their houses, they took their food with joy and with true hearts,

title: Acts Chapter 2 Verse 47
text: Giving praise to God, and having the approval of all the people; and every day the number of those who had salvation was increased by the Lord.

title: Acts Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: Now Peter and John were going up to the Temple at the ninth hour, the hour of prayer;

title: Acts Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: And a certain man who from birth had had no power in his legs, was taken there every day, and put down at the door of the Temple which is named Beautiful, requesting money from those who went into the Temple;

title: Acts Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: He then, seeing Peter and John going into the Temple, made a request to them.

title: Acts Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: And Peter, looking at him, with John, said, Keep your eyes on us.

title: Acts Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: And he gave attention to them, hoping to get something from them.

title: Acts Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: But Peter said, I have no silver or gold, but what I have, that I give to you. In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, get up on your feet.

title: Acts Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: And he took him by his right hand, lifting him up; and straight away his feet and the bones of his legs became strong,

title: Acts Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: And, jumping up, he got on to his feet and went into the Temple with them, walking and jumping and giving praise to God.

title: Acts Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: And all the people saw him walking and praising God:

title: Acts Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: And they saw that it was the man who made requests for money at the door of the Temple, and they were full of wonder and surprise at what had taken place.

title: Acts Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: And while he kept his hands on Peter and John, all the people came running together to the covered way which is named Solomon's, full of wonder.

title: Acts Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: And when Peter saw it he said to the people, You men of Israel, why are you so greatly surprised at this man? or why are you looking at us as if by our power or virtue we had given him the use of his legs?

title: Acts Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: The God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Jacob, the God of our fathers, has given glory to his servant Jesus; whom you gave up, turning your backs on him, when Pilate had made the decision to let him go free.

title: Acts Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: But you would have nothing to do with the Holy and Upright One, and made request for a man of blood to be given to you,

title: Acts Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: And put to death the Lord of life; whom God gave back from the dead; of which fact we are witnesses.

title: Acts Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: And his name, through faith in his name, has made this man strong, whom you see and have knowledge of: yes, the faith which is through him has made him well, before you all.

title: Acts Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: And now, my brothers, I am conscious that you did this, as did your rulers, without knowledge.

title: Acts Chapter 3 Verse 18
text: But the things which God had made clear before, by the mouth of all the prophets, that the Christ would have to undergo, he has put into effect in this way.

title: Acts Chapter 3 Verse 19
text: So then, let your hearts be changed and be turned to God, so that your sins may be completely taken away, and times of blessing may come from the Lord;

title: Acts Chapter 3 Verse 20
text: And that he may send the Christ who was marked out for you from the first, even Jesus:

title: Acts Chapter 3 Verse 21
text: Who is to be kept in heaven till the time when all things are put right, of which God has given word by the mouth of his holy prophets, who have been from the earliest times.

title: Acts Chapter 3 Verse 22
text: For Moses said, The Lord will give you a prophet from among your people, like me; you will give ear to everything which he will say to you.

title: Acts Chapter 3 Verse 23
text: And every soul who does not give attention to that prophet, will be cut off from among the people.

title: Acts Chapter 3 Verse 24
text: And all the prophets from Samuel and those who came after, every one of them, gave word of these days.

title: Acts Chapter 3 Verse 25
text: You are the sons of the prophets, and of the agreement which God made with your fathers, saying to Abraham, Through your seed a blessing will come on all the families of the earth.

title: Acts Chapter 3 Verse 26
text: To you, first, God sent his servant, blessing you by turning every one of you from his sins.

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: And while they were talking to the people, the priests and the captain of the Temple and the Sadducees came up to them,

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: Being greatly troubled because they were teaching the people and preaching Jesus as an example of the coming back from the dead.

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: And they took them and put them in prison till the morning, for it was now evening.

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: But a number of those who gave hearing to the word had faith; and they were now about five thousand.

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: And on the day after, the rulers and those in authority and the scribes came together in Jerusalem;

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: And Annas, the high priest, was there, and Caiaphas and John and Alexander, and all the relations of the high priest.

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: Then sending for Peter and John, they said, By what power and in whose name have you done this?

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: Then Peter, being full of the Holy Spirit, said to them, O you rulers of the people and men of authority,

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: If we are questioned today about a good work done to a man who was ill, as to how he has been made well,

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: Take note, all of you, and all the people of Israel, that in the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, whom you put to death on the cross, whom God gave back from the dead, even through him is this man now before you completely well.

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: He is the stone which you builders had no use for, but which has been made the chief stone of the building.

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: And in no other is there salvation: for there is no other name under heaven, given among men, through which we may have salvation.

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: Now when they saw that Peter and John were without fear, though they were men of no education or learning, they were greatly surprised; and they took note of them that they had been with Jesus.

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: And, seeing that the man who had been made well was there with them, they were not able to say anything against it.

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: But when they had given them orders to go out of the Sanhedrin, they had a discussion among themselves,

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: Saying, What are we to do with these men? for certainly it is clear to all who are living in Jerusalem that a most important sign has been done by them, and it is not possible to say that it is not so.

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 17
text: But so that it may not go farther among the people, let us put them in fear of punishment if they say anything in future in this name.

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 18
text: And they sent for them, and gave them orders not to make statements or give teaching in the name of Jesus.

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 19
text: But Peter and John in answer said to them, It is for you to say if it is right in the eyes of God to give attention to you more than to God:

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 20
text: For it is not possible for us to keep from saying what we have seen and have knowledge of.

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 21
text: And when they had said more sharp words to them, they let them go, not seeing what punishment they might give them, because of the people; for all men were giving praise to God for what had taken place.

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 22
text: For the man on whom this act of power was done was more than forty years old.

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 23
text: And when they had been made free, they came back to their friends, and gave an account of all the things which the chief priests and the authorities had said to them.

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 24
text: And hearing it, they all, with one mind, made prayer to God and said, O Lord, maker of heaven and earth and the sea and all things in them:

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 25
text: Who has said, by the Holy Spirit, through the mouth of our father David your servant, Why are the nations so violently moved, and why are the thoughts of the people so foolish?

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 26
text: The kings of the earth were lifted up, the rulers came together, against the Lord, and against his Christ:

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 27
text: For, truly, in this town, against your holy servant, Jesus, who was marked out by you as Christ, Herod, and Pontius Pilate, with the Gentiles and the people of Israel, came together,

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 28
text: To do that which had been fixed before by your hand and your purpose.

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 29
text: And now, Lord, take note of their cruel words, and give your servants power to be preachers of your word without fear,

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 30
text: While your hand is stretched out to do works of mercy; so that signs and wonders may be done through the name of your holy servant Jesus.

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 31
text: And when their prayer was ended, the place where they were was violently moved, and they all became full of the Holy Spirit, preaching the word of God without fear.

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 32
text: And all those who were of the faith were one in heart and soul: and not one of them said that any of the things which he had was his property only; but they had all things in common.

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 33
text: And with great power the Apostles gave witness of the coming back of the Lord Jesus from the dead; and grace was on them all.

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 34
text: And no one among them was in need; for everyone who had land or houses, exchanging them for money, took the price of them,

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 35
text: And put it at the feet of the Apostles for distribution to everyone as he had need.

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 36
text: And Joseph, who was given by the Apostles the name of Barnabas (the sense of which is, Son of comfort), a Levite and a man of Cyprus by birth,

title: Acts Chapter 4 Verse 37
text: Having a field, got money for it and put the money at the feet of the Apostles.

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: But a certain man named Ananias, with Sapphira his wife, got money for his property,

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: And kept back part of the price, his wife having knowledge of it, and took the rest and put it at the feet of the Apostles.

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: But Peter said, Ananias, why has the Evil One put it into your heart to be false to the Holy Spirit, and to keep back part of the price of the land?

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: While you had it, was it not your property? and after you had given it in exchange, was it not still in your power? how has this purpose come into your mind? you have been false, not to men, but to God.

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: And at these words, Ananias went down on the earth, and his life went from him: and great fear came on all who were present.

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: And the young men went and made ready his body, and took it out, and put it in the earth.

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: And about three hours after, his wife, having no knowledge of what had taken place, came in.

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: And Peter said to her, Give me an answer: was this amount of money the price of the land? And she said, Yes, it was.

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: But Peter said to her, Why have you made an agreement together to be false to the Spirit of the Lord? See, the feet of the young men who have put the body of your husband in the earth, are at the door, and they will take you out.

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: And straight away she went down at his feet, and her life went from her: and the young men came in and saw her dead, and they took her out and put her in the earth with her husband.

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: Then great fear came on all the church and on all who had knowledge of these things.

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: Now a number of signs and wonders were done among the people by the hands of the Apostles; and they were all together in Solomon's covered way.

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: The others, in fear, kept back from joining them: but the people made much of them;

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: And a great number of men and women had faith, and were joined to the Lord;

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 15
text: And they even took into the streets people who were ill, and put them on beds, so that when Peter went by, some of them might be in his shade.

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 16
text: And numbers of people came together from the towns round about Jerusalem, with those who were ill and those who were troubled with unclean spirits: and they were all made well.

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 17
text: But the high priest and those who were with him (the Sadducees) were full of envy,

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 18
text: And they took the Apostles and put them in the common prison.

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 19
text: But in the night an angel of the Lord, opening the doors of the prison, took them out and said,

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 20
text: Go, take your place in the Temple and give the people all the teaching about this Life.

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 21
text: And hearing this, they went into the Temple at dawn, and were teaching. But the high priest and those who were with him got together the Sanhedrin and the representatives of the children of Israel, and sent to the prison to get them.

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 22
text: But the men who were sent saw that they were not in the prison, and came back with the news,

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 23
text: Saying, The doors of the prison were safely shut, and the keepers were at the doors, but when they were open, there was nobody inside.

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 24
text: Now, at these words, the captain of the Temple and the chief priests were greatly troubled about what might be the end of this business.

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 25
text: And someone came and said to them, The men, whom you put in prison, are in the Temple teaching the people.

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 26
text: Then the captain and some of the police went and took them, but not violently, for fear that they might be stoned by the people.

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 27
text: And they took them into the Sanhedrin, and the high priest said to them,

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 28
text: We gave you very clear orders not to give teaching in this name: and now Jerusalem is full of your teaching, and you are attempting to make us responsible for this man's death.

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 29
text: But Peter and the Apostles, answering, said, We have to do the orders of God, not of man.

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 30
text: The God of our fathers gave Jesus back to life, whom you had put to death, hanging him on a tree.

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 31
text: Him God has put on high at his right hand, as a Ruler and a Saviour, to give to Israel a change of heart and forgiveness of sins.

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 32
text: And we are witnesses of these things, and so is the Holy Spirit, whom God has given to those who keep his laws.

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 33
text: But when these words came to their ears, they were cut to the heart, and had a mind to put them to death.

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 34
text: But one of the Sanhedrin, a Pharisee named Gamaliel, a man of learning in the law, of whom all the people had a high opinion, got up and made a suggestion for the men to be put outside for a little time.

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 35
text: And he said to them, Men of Israel, take care what you do about these men.

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 36
text: For before this there was Theudas, who said he was someone important, to whom about four hundred men gave their support: he was put to death, and his band was broken up and came to nothing.

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 37
text: After this man, there was Judas of Galilee, at the time of the numbering, and some of the people went after him: he was put to death, and all his supporters were put to flight.

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 38
text: And now I say to you, Do nothing to these men, but let them be: for if this teaching or this work is of men, it will come to nothing:

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 39
text: But if it is of God, you will not be able to overcome them, and you are in danger of fighting against God.

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 40
text: And he seemed to them to be right: and they sent for the Apostles, and, after having them whipped and giving them orders to give no teaching in the name of Jesus, they let them go.

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 41
text: So they went away from the Sanhedrin, happy to undergo shame for the Name.

title: Acts Chapter 5 Verse 42
text: And every day, in the Temple and privately, they went on teaching and preaching Jesus as the Christ.

title: Acts Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: Now in those days, when the number of the disciples was increasing, protests were made by the Greek Jews against the Hebrews, because their widows were not taken care of in the distribution of food every day.

title: Acts Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: And the Apostles sent for all the disciples and said, It is not right for us to give up preaching the word of God in order to make distribution of food.

title: Acts Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: Take then from among you seven men of good name, full of the Spirit and of wisdom, to whom we may give control of this business.

title: Acts Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: Then we will give all our time to prayer and the teaching of the word.

title: Acts Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: And this saying was pleasing to all of them: and they made selection of Stephen, a man full of faith and of the Holy Spirit, and Philip and Prochorus and Nicanor and Timon and Parmenas and Nicolas of Antioch, who had become a Jew:

title: Acts Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: These they took to the Apostles, who, after prayer, put their hands on them.

title: Acts Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: And the word of God was increasing in power; and the number of the disciples in Jerusalem became very great, and a great number of priests were in agreement with the faith.

title: Acts Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: And Stephen, full of grace and power, did great wonders and signs among the people.

title: Acts Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: But some of those who were of the Synagogue named that of the Libertines, and some of the men of Cyrene and of Alexandria and those from Cilicia and Asia, had arguments with Stephen.

title: Acts Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: But they were not able to get the better of him, for his words were full of wisdom and of the Spirit.

title: Acts Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: Then they got men to say, He has said evil against Moses and against God, in our hearing.

title: Acts Chapter 6 Verse 12
text: And the people, with the rulers and the scribes, were moved against him, and they came and took him before the Sanhedrin,

title: Acts Chapter 6 Verse 13
text: And they got false witnesses who said, This man is for ever saying things against this holy place and against the law:

title: Acts Chapter 6 Verse 14
text: For he has said in our hearing that this Jesus of Nazareth will put this place to destruction and make changes in the rules which were handed down to us by Moses.

title: Acts Chapter 6 Verse 15
text: And all those who were in the Sanhedrin, looking at him, saw that his face was like the face of an angel.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: Then the high priest said, Are these things true?

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: And he said, My brothers and fathers, give hearing. The God of glory came to our father Abraham, when he was in Mesopotamia, before he was living in Haran,

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: And said to him, Go out of your land, and away from your family, and come into the land to which I will be your guide.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: Then he came out of the land of the Chaldaeans, and went into Haran; and from there, when his father was dead, he was guided by God into this land, where you are living now:

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: And God gave him no heritage in it, not even enough to put his foot on: but he gave him an undertaking that he would give it to him and to his children after him, though he had no child at that time.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: And God said that his seed would be living in a strange land, and that they would make them servants, and be cruel to them for four hundred years.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: And I will be the judge, said God, of that nation which made them servants: and after that, they will come out and give me worship in this place.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: And he made with him the agreement of which circumcision was the sign. And so Abraham had a son, Isaac, and gave him circumcision on the eighth day; and Isaac had a son, Jacob, and Jacob was the father of the twelve heads of the families of Israel.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 9
text: And the brothers, moved with envy against Joseph, gave him to the Egyptians for money: but God was with him,

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 10
text: And made him free from all his troubles, and gave him wisdom and the approval of Pharaoh, king of Egypt, who made him ruler over Egypt and all his house.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 11
text: Now there was no food to be had in all Egypt and Canaan, and there was great trouble: and our fathers were not able to get food.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 12
text: But Jacob, hearing that there was grain in Egypt, sent out our fathers the first time.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 13
text: And the second time his brothers had a meeting with Joseph, and Pharaoh had knowledge of Joseph's family.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 14
text: Then Joseph sent for Jacob his father and all his family, seventy-five persons.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 15
text: And Jacob went down to Egypt, and came to his end there, and so did our fathers;

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 16
text: And they were taken over to Shechem, and put to rest in the place which Abraham got for a price in silver from the sons of Hamor in Shechem.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 17
text: But when the time was near for putting into effect the undertaking which God had given to Abraham, the people were increasing in Egypt,

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 18
text: Till another king came to power, who had no knowledge of Joseph.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 19
text: He, having evil designs against our nation, was cruel to our fathers, and they were forced to put out their young children, so that they might not go on living.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 20
text: At which time Moses came to birth, and he was very beautiful; and he was kept for three months in his father's house:

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 21
text: And when he was put out, Pharaoh's daughter took him and kept him as her son.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 22
text: And Moses was trained in all the wisdom of Egypt, and was great in his words and works.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 23
text: But when he was almost forty years old, it came into his heart to go and see his brothers, the children of Israel.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 24
text: And seeing one of them being attacked, he went to his help and gave the Egyptian a death-blow:

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 25
text: And he was hoping that his brothers would see that God had sent him to be their saviour; but they did not see.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 26
text: And the day after, he came to them, while they were having a fight, and would have made peace between them, saying, Sirs, you are brothers; why do you do wrong to one another?

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 27
text: But the man who was doing wrong to his neighbour, pushing him away, said, Who made you a ruler and a judge over us?

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 28
text: Will you put me to death as you did the Egyptian yesterday?

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 29
text: And at these words, Moses went in flight to the land of Midian, and was living there for a time, and had two sons.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 30
text: At the end of forty years, an angel came to him in the waste land of Sinai, in the flame of a burning thorn-tree.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 31
text: And Moses, seeing it, was full of wonder, and when he came up to have a nearer view of it, the voice of the Lord came to him, saying,

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 32
text: I am the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham and of Isaac and of Jacob. And Moses, shaking with fear, kept his eyes from looking at it.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 33
text: And the Lord said, Take off the shoes from your feet, for the place where you are is holy.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 34
text: Truly, I have seen the sorrows of my people in Egypt, and their cries have come to my ears, and I have come down to make them free: and now, come, I will send you to Egypt.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 35
text: This Moses, whom they would not have, saying, Who made you a ruler and a judge? him God sent to be a ruler and a saviour, by the hand of the angel whom he saw in the thorn-tree.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 36
text: This man took them out, having done wonders and signs in Egypt and in the Red Sea and in the waste land, for forty years.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 37
text: This is the same Moses, who said to the children of Israel, God will give you a prophet from among your brothers, like me.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 38
text: This is the man who was in the church in the waste land with the angel who was talking to him in Sinai, and with our fathers; and to him were given the living words of God, so that he might give them to you.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 39
text: By whom our fathers would not be controlled; but they put him on one side, turning back in their hearts to Egypt,

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 40
text: And saying to Aaron, Make us gods to go before us: as for this Moses, who took us out of the land of Egypt, we have no idea what has become of him.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 41
text: And they made the image of a young ox in those days, and made an offering to it, and had joy in the work of their hands.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 42
text: But God was turned from them and let them give worship to the stars of heaven, as it says in the book of the prophets, Did you make offerings to me of sheep and oxen for forty years in the waste land, O house of Israel?

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 43
text: And you took up the tent of Moloch and the star of the god Rephan, images which you made to give worship to them: and I will take you away, farther than Babylon.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 44
text: Our fathers had the Tent of witness in the waste land, as God gave orders to Moses to make it after the design which he had seen.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 45
text: Which our fathers, in their turn, took with them when, with Joshua, they came into the heritage of the nations whom God was driving out before the face of our fathers, till the time of David,

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 46
text: Who was pleasing to God; and he had a desire to make a holy tent for the God of Jacob.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 47
text: But Solomon was the builder of his house.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 48
text: But still, the Most High has not his resting-place in houses made with hands, as the prophet says,

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 49
text: Heaven is the seat of my power, and earth is a resting-place for my feet: what sort of house will you make for me, says the Lord, or what is my place of rest?

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 50
text: Did not my hand make all these things?

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 51
text: You whose hearts are hard and whose ears are shut to me; you are ever working against the Holy Spirit; as your fathers did, so do you.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 52
text: Which of the prophets was not cruelly attacked by your fathers? and they put to death those who gave them the news of the coming of the Upright One; whom you have now given up and put to death;

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 53
text: You, to whom the law was given as it was ordered by angels, and who have not kept it.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 54
text: Hearing these things, they were cut to the heart and moved with wrath against him.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 55
text: But he was full of the Holy Spirit, and looking up to heaven, he saw the glory of God and Jesus at the right hand of God.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 56
text: And he said, Now I see heaven open, and the Son of man at the right hand of God.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 57
text: But with loud cries, and stopping their ears, they made an attack on him all together,

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 58
text: Driving him out of the town and stoning him: and the witnesses put their clothing at the feet of a young man named Saul.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 59
text: And Stephen, while he was being stoned, made prayer to God, saying, Lord Jesus, take my spirit.

title: Acts Chapter 7 Verse 60
text: And going down on his knees, he said in a loud voice, Lord, do not make them responsible for this sin. And when he had said this, he went to his rest.

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 1
text: And Saul gave approval to his death. Now at that time a violent attack was started against the church in Jerusalem; and all but the Apostles went away into all parts of Judaea and Samaria.

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 2
text: And God-fearing men put Stephen's body in its last resting-place, making great weeping over him.

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 3
text: But Saul was burning with hate against the church, going into every house and taking men and women and putting them in prison.

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 4
text: But those who had gone in flight went everywhere preaching the word.

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 5
text: And Philip went down to Samaria and was teaching them about Christ.

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 6
text: And all the people gave attention to the words which Philip said, when they saw the signs which he did.

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 7
text: For unclean spirits came out from those who had them, crying with a loud voice; and a number of those who were ill and broken in body were made well.

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 8
text: And there was much joy in that town.

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 9
text: But there was a certain man named Simon, who in the past had been a wonder-worker and a cause of surprise to the people of Samaria, saying that he himself was a great man:

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 10
text: To whom they all gave attention, from the smallest to the greatest, saying, This man is that power of God which is named Great.

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 11
text: And they gave attention to him, because for a long time his wonder-working powers had kept them under his control.

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 12
text: But when they had faith in the good news given by Philip about the kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ, a number of men and women had baptism.

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 13
text: And Simon himself had faith and, having had baptism, he went with Philip and, seeing the signs and the great wonders which he did, he was full of surprise.

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 14
text: Now when the Apostles at Jerusalem had news that the people of Samaria had taken the word of God into their hearts, they sent to them Peter and John;

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 15
text: Who, when they came there, made prayer for them, that the Holy Spirit might be given to them:

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 16
text: For up to that time he had not come on any of them; only baptism had been given to them in the name of the Lord Jesus.

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 17
text: Then they put their hands on them, and the Holy Spirit came on them.

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 18
text: Now when Simon saw that the Holy Spirit was given through the touch of the Apostles' hands, he made them an offering of money, saying,

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 19
text: Give me this power, so that when I put my hands on anyone he may get the Holy Spirit.

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 20
text: But Peter said, May your money come to destruction with you, because you had the idea that what is freely given by God may be got for a price.

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 21
text: You have no part in this business, because your heart is not right before God.

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 22
text: Let your heart be changed, and make prayer to God that you may have forgiveness for your evil thoughts.

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 23
text: For I see that you are prisoned in bitter envy and the chains of sin.

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 24
text: And Simon, answering, said, Make prayer for me to the Lord, so that these things which you have said may not come on me.

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 25
text: So they, having given their witness and made clear the word of the Lord, went back to Jerusalem, giving the good news on their way in a number of the small towns of Samaria.

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 26
text: But an angel of the Lord said to Philip, Get up, and go to the south, to the road which goes from Jerusalem to Gaza, through the waste land.

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 27
text: And he went and there was a man of Ethiopia, a servant of great authority under Candace, queen of the Ethiopians, and controller of all her property, who had come up to Jerusalem for worship;

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 28
text: He was going back, seated in his carriage, and was reading the book of the prophet Isaiah.

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 29
text: And the Spirit said to Philip, Go near, and get on his carriage.

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 30
text: And Philip, running up to him, saw that he was reading Isaiah the prophet, and said to him, Is the sense of what you are reading clear to you?

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 31
text: And he said, How is that possible when I have no guide? And he made Philip get up by his side.

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 32
text: Now the place in the book where he was reading was this: He was taken, like a sheep, to be put to death; and as a lamb is quiet when its wool is being cut, so he made no sound:

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 33
text: Being of low degree, his cause was not given a hearing: who has knowledge of his family? for his life is cut off from the earth.

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 34
text: And the Ethiopian said to Philip, About whom are these words said by the prophet? about himself, or some other?

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 35
text: So Philip, starting from this writing, gave him the good news about Jesus.

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 36
text: And while they were going on their way, they came to some water, and the Ethiopian said, See, here is water; why may I not have baptism?

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 38
text: And he gave orders for the carriage to be stopped, and the two of them went down into the water, and Philip gave him baptism.

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 39
text: And when they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord took Philip away; and the Ethiopian saw him no more, for he went on his way full of joy.

title: Acts Chapter 8 Verse 40
text: But Philip came to Azotus, and went through all the towns, preaching the good news, till he came to Caesarea.

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 1
text: But Saul, still burning with desire to put to death the disciples of the Lord, went to the high priest,

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 2
text: And made a request for letters from him to the Synagogues of Damascus, so that if there were any of the Way there, men or women, he might take them as prisoners to Jerusalem.

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 3
text: And while he was journeying, he came near Damascus; and suddenly he saw a light from heaven shining round him;

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 4
text: And he went down on the earth, and a voice said to him, Saul, Saul, why are you attacking me so cruelly?

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 5
text: And he said, Who are you, Lord? And he said, I am Jesus, whom you are attacking:

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 6
text: But get up, and go into the town, and it will be made clear to you what you have to do.

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 7
text: And the men who were with him were not able to say anything; hearing the voice, but seeing no one.

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 8
text: And Saul got up from the earth, and when his eyes were open, he saw nothing; and he was guided by the hand into Damascus.

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 9
text: And for three days he was not able to see, and he took no food or drink.

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 10
text: Now there was a certain disciple at Damascus, named Ananias; and the Lord said to him in a vision, Ananias! and he said, Here I am, Lord.

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 11
text: And the Lord said to him, Get up, and go to the street which is named Straight, and make search at the house of Judas for one named Saul of Tarsus: for he is at prayer;

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 12
text: And he has seen a man named Ananias coming in and putting his hands on him, so that he may be able to see.

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 13
text: But Ananias said, Lord, I have had accounts of this man from a number of people, how much evil he has done to your saints at Jerusalem:

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 14
text: And here he has authority from the chief priests to make prisoners all who give worship to your name.

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 15
text: But the Lord said, Go without fear: for he is a special vessel for me, to give to the Gentiles and kings and to the children of Israel the knowledge of my name:

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 16
text: For I will make clear to him what troubles he will have to undergo for me.

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 17
text: And Ananias went out and came to the house, and putting his hands on him, said, Brother Saul, the Lord Jesus, whom you saw when you were on your journey, has sent me, so that you may be able to see, and be full of the Holy Spirit.

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 18
text: And straight away it seemed as if a veil was taken from his eyes, and he was able to see; and he got up, and had baptism;

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 19
text: And when he had taken food his strength came back. And for some days he kept with the disciples who were in Damascus.

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 20
text: And straight away, in the Synagogues, he was preaching Jesus as the Son of God.

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 21
text: And all those hearing him were full of wonder and said, Is not this the man who in Jerusalem was attacking all the worshippers of this name? and he had come here so that he might take them as prisoners before the chief priests.

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 22
text: But Saul went on increasing in power, and the Jews in Damascus were not able to give answers to the arguments by which he made it clear that Jesus was the Christ.

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 23
text: Then, after some days, the Jews made an agreement together to put him to death:

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 24
text: But Saul got knowledge of their design. And they kept watch day and night on the roads out of the town, so that they might put him to death:

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 25
text: But his disciples took him by night and let him down from the wall in a basket.

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 26
text: And when he came to Jerusalem, he made an attempt to be joined to the disciples, but they were all in fear of him, not taking him for a disciple.

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 27
text: But Barnabas took him to the Apostles and gave them an account of how he had seen the Lord on the road, and had given hearing to his words, and how at Damascus he had been preaching in the name of Jesus without fear.

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 28
text: And he was with them, going in and out at Jerusalem,

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 29
text: Preaching in the name of the Lord without fear; and he had discussions with the Greek Jews; but they were working for his death.

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 30
text: And when the brothers had knowledge of it, they took him to Caesarea and sent him to Tarsus.

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 31
text: And so the church through all Judaea and Galilee and Samaria had peace and was made strong; and, living in the fear of the Lord and in the comfort of the Holy Spirit, was increased greatly.

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 32
text: And it came about that while Peter was going through all parts of the country he came to the saints who were living at Lydda.

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 33
text: And there was a certain man there, named Aeneas, who for eight years had been in bed, without power of moving.

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 34
text: And Peter said to him, Aeneas, Jesus Christ makes you well: get up and make your bed. And straight away he got up.

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 35
text: And all those living in Lydda and Sharon saw him, and were turned to the Lord.

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 36
text: Now there was at Joppa a certain disciple named Tabitha, that is, Dorcas: this woman was given to good works and acts of mercy at all times.

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 37
text: And it came about, in those days, that she got ill and came to her death: and when she had been washed, they put her in a room which was high up.

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 38
text: And because Lydda was near Joppa, the disciples, having knowledge that Peter was there, sent two men to him, requesting him to come to them straight away.

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 39
