text: And Peter went with them. And when he had come, they took him into the room: and all the widows were there, weeping and putting before him the coats and clothing which Dorcas had made while she was with them.

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 40
text: But Peter made them all go outside, and went down on his knees in prayer; and turning to the body, he said, Tabitha, get up. And, opening her eyes, she saw Peter and got up.

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 41
text: And he took her hand, lifting her up; and, sending for the saints and widows, he gave her to them, living.

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 42
text: And news of it went all through Joppa, and a number of people had faith in the Lord.

title: Acts Chapter 9 Verse 43
text: And he was living in Joppa for some time with Simon, a leather-worker.

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 1
text: Now there was a certain man in Caesarea, named Cornelius, the captain of the Italian band of the army;

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 2
text: A serious-minded man, fearing God with all his family; he gave much money to the poor, and made prayer to God at all times.

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 3
text: He saw in a vision, clearly, at about the ninth hour of the day, an angel of the Lord coming to him and saying to him, Cornelius!

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 4
text: And he, looking on him in fear, said, What is it, Lord? And he said to him, Your prayers and your offerings have come up to God, and he has kept them in mind.

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 5
text: Now send men to Joppa, and get one Simon, named Peter,

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 6
text: Who is living with Simon, a leather-worker, whose house is by the sea.

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 7
text: And when the angel who said these words to him had gone away, he sent for two of his house-servants, and a God-fearing man of the army, one of those who were waiting on him at all times;

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 8
text: And having given them an account of everything, he sent them to Joppa.

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 9
text: Now the day after, when they were on their journey and were near the town, Peter went up to the top of the house for prayer, about the sixth hour:

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 10
text: And he was in need of food: but while they were getting it ready, a deep sleep came on him;

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 11
text: And he saw the heavens opening, and a vessel coming down, like a great cloth let down on the earth,

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 12
text: In which were all sorts of beasts and birds.

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 13
text: And a voice came to him, saying, Come, Peter; take them for food.

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 14
text: But Peter said, No, Lord; for I have never taken food which is common or unclean.

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 15
text: And the voice came to him a second time, What God has made clean, do not you make common.

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 16
text: And this was done three times: and then the vessel was taken back into heaven.

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 17
text: Now while Peter was in doubt as to the purpose of this vision, the men who were sent by Cornelius, having made search for Simon's house, came to the door,

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 18
text: To see if Simon, named Peter, was living there.

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 19
text: And, while Peter was turning the vision over in his mind, the Spirit said to him, See, three men are looking for you.

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 20
text: Go down, then, and go with them, doubting nothing, for I have sent them.

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 21
text: And Peter went down to the men, and said, I am the man you are looking for: why have you come?

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 22
text: And they said, Cornelius, a captain, an upright and God-fearing man, respected by all the nation of the Jews, had word from God by an angel to send for you to his house, and to give hearing to your words.

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 23
text: So he took them in for the night. And the day after, he went with them, taking some of the brothers from Joppa with him.

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 24
text: And the day after that, they came to Caesarea. And Cornelius was waiting for them, having got together his relations and his near friends.

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 25
text: And when Peter came in, Cornelius came to him and, falling down at his feet, gave him worship.

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 26
text: But Peter, lifting him up, said, Get up, for I am a man as you are.

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 27
text: And saying these words, he went in, and saw that a great number of people had come together;

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 28
text: And he said to them, You yourselves have knowledge that it is against the law for a man who is a Jew to be in the company of one who is of another nation; but God has made it clear to me that no man may be named common or unclean:

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 29
text: And so I came without question, when I was sent for. What then is your purpose in sending for me?

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 30
text: And Cornelius said, Four days from now I was in my house in prayer at the ninth hour; and I saw before me a man in shining clothing,

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 31
text: Who said, Cornelius, your prayer has come to the ears of God, and your offerings are kept in his memory.

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 32
text: Send, then, to Joppa, and get Simon, named Peter, to come to you; he is living in the house of Simon, a leather-worker, by the sea.

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 33
text: So, straight away, I sent for you; and you have done well to come. And now, we are all present before God, ready to give attention to all the things which the Lord has given you to say.

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 34
text: Then Peter said, Truly, I see clearly that God is no respecter of persons:

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 35
text: But in every nation, the man who has fear of him and does righteousness is pleasing to him.

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 36
text: The word which he sent to the children of Israel, giving the good news of peace through Jesus Christ (who is Lord of all)--

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 37
text: That word you yourselves have knowledge of, which was made public through all Judaea, starting from Galilee, after the baptism of which John was the preacher,

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 38
text: About Jesus of Nazareth, how God gave the Holy Spirit to him, with power: and how he went about doing good and making well all who were troubled by evil spirits, for God was with him.

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 39
text: And we are witnesses of all the things which he did in the country of the Jews and in Jerusalem; whom they put to death, hanging him on a tree.

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 40
text: On the third day God gave him back to life, and let him be seen,

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 41
text: Not by all the people, but by witnesses marked out before by God, even by us, who took food and drink with him after he came back from the dead.

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 42
text: And he gave us orders to give news of this to the people, and to give public witness that this is he whom God has made judge of the living and the dead.

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 43
text: To him all the prophets give witness, that through his name everyone who has faith in him will have forgiveness of sins.

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 44
text: While Peter was saying these words, the Holy Spirit came on all those who were hearing the word.

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 45
text: And the Jews of the faith, who had come with Peter, were full of wonder, because the Holy Spirit was given to the Gentiles,

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 46
text: And they were talking in tongues, and giving glory to God. Then Peter said,

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 47
text: Will any man say that these may not have baptism who have been given the Holy Spirit as we have?

title: Acts Chapter 10 Verse 48
text: And he gave orders for them to have baptism in the name of Jesus Christ. Then they kept him with them for some days.

title: Acts Chapter 11 Verse 1
text: Now the Apostles and the brothers who were in Judaea had news that the word of God had been given to the Gentiles.

title: Acts Chapter 11 Verse 2
text: And when Peter came to Jerusalem, those who kept the rule of circumcision had an argument with him,

title: Acts Chapter 11 Verse 3
text: Saying, You went to men without circumcision, and took food with them.

title: Acts Chapter 11 Verse 4
text: But Peter gave them an account of it all in order, saying to them,

title: Acts Chapter 11 Verse 5
text: I was in the town of Joppa, at prayer: and falling into a deep sleep, I saw in a vision a vessel like a great cloth let down from heaven, and it came down to me:

title: Acts Chapter 11 Verse 6
text: And looking on it with attention I saw in it all sorts of beasts and birds.

title: Acts Chapter 11 Verse 7
text: And a voice came to my ears saying, Come, Peter; take them for food.

title: Acts Chapter 11 Verse 8
text: But I said, No, Lord; for nothing common or unclean has ever come into my mouth.

title: Acts Chapter 11 Verse 9
text: But the voice, coming a second time from heaven, said, What God has made clean, do not you make common.

title: Acts Chapter 11 Verse 10
text: And this was done three times, and they were all taken up again into heaven.

title: Acts Chapter 11 Verse 11
text: And at that minute, three men, sent from Caesarea, came to the house where we were.

title: Acts Chapter 11 Verse 12
text: And the Spirit gave me orders to go with them, doubting nothing. And these six brothers came with me; and we went into that man's house:

title: Acts Chapter 11 Verse 13
text: And he gave us an account of how he had seen the angel in his house, saying, Send to Joppa, and get Simon, named Peter, to come to you;

title: Acts Chapter 11 Verse 14
text: Who will say words to you through which you and all your family may get salvation.

title: Acts Chapter 11 Verse 15
text: And, while I was talking to them, the Holy Spirit came on them, as on us at first.

title: Acts Chapter 11 Verse 16
text: And the words of the Lord came into my mind, how he said, The baptism of John was with water, but you will have baptism with the Holy Spirit.

title: Acts Chapter 11 Verse 17
text: If then God gave them, when they had faith in the Lord Jesus Christ, the same as he gave to us, who was I to go against God?

title: Acts Chapter 11 Verse 18
text: And hearing these things they said nothing more, but gave glory to God, saying, Then to the Gentiles as to us has God given a change of heart, so that they may have life.

title: Acts Chapter 11 Verse 19
text: Then those who had gone away at the time of the trouble about Stephen, went as far as Phoenicia and Cyprus, preaching to the Jews only.

title: Acts Chapter 11 Verse 20
text: But some of them, men of Cyprus and Cyrene, when they came to Antioch, gave the good news about the Lord Jesus to the Greeks.

title: Acts Chapter 11 Verse 21
text: And the power of the Lord was with them, and a great number had faith and were turned to the Lord.

title: Acts Chapter 11 Verse 22
text: And news of them came to the ears of the church at Jerusalem: and they sent Barnabas as far as Antioch:

title: Acts Chapter 11 Verse 23
text: Who, when he came and saw the grace of God, was glad; and he made clear to them the need of keeping near the Lord with all the strength of their hearts:

title: Acts Chapter 11 Verse 24
text: For he was a good man and full of the Holy Spirit and of faith: and a great number were joined to the Lord.

title: Acts Chapter 11 Verse 25
text: Then he went on to Tarsus, looking for Saul;

title: Acts Chapter 11 Verse 26
text: And when he had come across him, he took him to Antioch. And they were with the church there for a year, teaching the people; and the disciples were first given the name of Christians in Antioch.

title: Acts Chapter 11 Verse 27
text: Now in those days prophets came from Jerusalem to Antioch.

title: Acts Chapter 11 Verse 28
text: And one of them, named Agabus, said publicly through the Spirit that there would be serious need of food all over the earth: which came about in the time of Claudius.

title: Acts Chapter 11 Verse 29
text: And the disciples, everyone as he was able, made a decision to send help to the brothers living in Judaea:

title: Acts Chapter 11 Verse 30
text: Which they did, sending it to the rulers of the church by the hand of Barnabas and Saul.

title: Acts Chapter 12 Verse 1
text: Now, about that time, Herod the king made cruel attacks on the Christians.

title: Acts Chapter 12 Verse 2
text: And he put James, the brother of John, to death with the sword.

title: Acts Chapter 12 Verse 3
text: And when he saw that this was pleasing to the Jews he went on to take Peter in addition. This was at the time of the feast of unleavened bread.

title: Acts Chapter 12 Verse 4
text: And having taken him, he put him in prison, with four bands of armed men to keep watch over him; his purpose being to take him out to the people after the Passover.

title: Acts Chapter 12 Verse 5
text: So Peter was kept in prison: but the church made strong prayer to God for him.

title: Acts Chapter 12 Verse 6
text: And when Herod was about to take him out, the same night Peter was sleeping in chains between two armed men, and the watchmen were keeping watch before the door of the prison.

title: Acts Chapter 12 Verse 7
text: And a great light was seen shining in the room, and an angel of the Lord came to Peter and, touching him on his side so that he came out of his sleep, said, Get up quickly. And his chains came off his hands.

title: Acts Chapter 12 Verse 8
text: Then the angel said, Put on your shoes and get ready to go. And he did so. And he said, Put your coat round you and come with me.

title: Acts Chapter 12 Verse 9
text: And he went out after him; and he was not certain if what was done by the angel was a fact, for it seemed to him that he was seeing a vision.

title: Acts Chapter 12 Verse 10
text: And when they had gone past the first and second watchmen they came to the iron door into the town, which came open by itself: and they went out and down one street; and then the angel went away.

title: Acts Chapter 12 Verse 11
text: And when Peter came to his senses he said, Now, truly, I am certain that the Lord has sent his angel and taken me out of the hands of Herod, against all the hopes of the Jews.

title: Acts Chapter 12 Verse 12
text: And when he became clear about this, he went to the house of Mary, the mother of John named Mark, where a number of them had come together for prayer.

title: Acts Chapter 12 Verse 13
text: And he gave a blow on the door, and a young girl came to it, named Rhoda.

title: Acts Chapter 12 Verse 14
text: And hearing the voice of Peter, in her joy she went running, without opening the door, to say that Peter was outside.

title: Acts Chapter 12 Verse 15
text: And they said to her, You are off your head. But still she said, with decision, that it was so. And they said, It is his angel.

title: Acts Chapter 12 Verse 16
text: But Peter went on giving blows on the door: and when it was open and they saw him, they were full of wonder.

title: Acts Chapter 12 Verse 17
text: But he made a sign to them with his hand to be quiet, and gave them an account of how the Lord had taken him out of prison. And he said, Give the news to James and the brothers. And then he went away.

title: Acts Chapter 12 Verse 18
text: Now when it was day, the armed men were greatly troubled about what had become of Peter.

title: Acts Chapter 12 Verse 19
text: And Herod, when he sent for him, and he was not there, after questioning the watchmen, gave orders that they were to be put to death. Then he went down from Judaea to Caesarea for a time.

title: Acts Chapter 12 Verse 20
text: Now he was very angry with the people of Tyre and Sidon: and they came to him, all together, and having made friends with Blastus, the controller of the king's house, they made a request for peace, because their country was dependent on the king's country for its food.

title: Acts Chapter 12 Verse 21
text: And on the day which had been fixed, Herod, dressed in his robes and seated in his place, made a public statement to them.

title: Acts Chapter 12 Verse 22
text: And the people, with loud cries, said, It is the voice of a god, not of a man.

title: Acts Chapter 12 Verse 23
text: And straight away the angel of the Lord sent a disease on him, because he did not give the glory to God: and his flesh was wasted away by worms, and so he came to his end.

title: Acts Chapter 12 Verse 24
text: But the word of the Lord went on increasing.

title: Acts Chapter 12 Verse 25
text: And Barnabas and Saul came back from Jerusalem, when their work was ended, taking with them John named Mark.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 1
text: Now there were at Antioch, in the church there, prophets and teachers, Barnabas, and Symeon who was named Niger, and Lucius of Cyrene, and Manaen, a relation of Herod the king, and Saul.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 2
text: And while they were doing the Lord's work, and going without food, the Holy Spirit said, Let Barnabas and Saul be given to me for the special work for which they have been marked out by me.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 3
text: Then, after prayer and going without food they put their hands on them, and sent them away.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 4
text: So, being sent out by the Holy Spirit, they went down to Seleucia; and from there they went by ship to Cyprus.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 5
text: And at Salamis they were preaching the word of God in the Synagogues of the Jews: and John was with them, helping them.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 6
text: And when they had gone through all the island to Paphos, they came across a certain wonder-worker and false prophet, a Jew whose name was Bar-Jesus;

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 7
text: Who was with the ruler, Sergius Paulus, an able man. This man sent for Barnabas and Saul, desiring to have knowledge of the word of God.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 8
text: But Elymas, the wonder-worker (for that is the sense of his name), put himself against them, with the purpose of turning the ruler from the faith.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 9
text: But Saul, whose other name is Paul, being full of the Holy Spirit, looking hard at him, said,

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 10
text: O you, who are full of false tricks and evil ways, a son of the Evil One, hating all righteousness, will you for ever be turning people from the right ways of the Lord?

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 11
text: And now, see, the hand of the Lord is on you, and you will be blind and not able to see the sun for a time. And straight away a dark mist came down on him; and he went about looking for a guide.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 12
text: Then the ruler, when he saw what was done, had faith, being full of wonder at the teaching of the Lord.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 13
text: Then Paul and those who were with him went by ship from Paphos and came to Perga in Pamphylia: and there John went away from them and came back to Jerusalem.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 14
text: But they, going through from Perga, came to Antioch in Pisidia; and they went into the Synagogue on the Sabbath and were seated.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 15
text: And after the reading of the law and the prophets, the rulers of the Synagogue sent to them, saying, Brothers, if you have a word of comfort for the people, say on.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 16
text: And Paul, getting up and making a sign with his hand, said, Men of Israel, and you who have the fear of God, give ear.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 17
text: The God of this people Israel made selection of our fathers, lifting the people up from their low condition when they were living in the land of Egypt, and with a strong arm took them out of it.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 18
text: And for about forty years he put up with their ways in the waste land.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 19
text: And having put to destruction seven nations in the land of Canaan, he gave them the land for their heritage for about four hundred and fifty years.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 20
text: And after these things he gave them judges, till the time of Samuel the prophet.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 21
text: Then at their request for a king, God gave them Saul, the son of Kish, a man of the family of Benjamin, who was their king for forty years.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 22
text: And having put him on one side, he made David their king, to whom he gave witness, saying, I have taken David, the son of Jesse, a man dear to my heart, who will do all my pleasure.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 23
text: From this man's seed has God given to Israel a Saviour, even Jesus, as he gave his word;

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 24
text: For whose coming John made ready the way by preaching to all the people of Israel the baptism which goes with a change of heart.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 25
text: And when John was completing his work, he said, What do I seem to you to be? I am not he; but one is coming after me, whose shoes I am not good enough to undo.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 26
text: My brothers, children of the family of Abraham, and those among you who have the fear of God, to us the word of this salvation is sent.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 27
text: For the men of Jerusalem and their rulers, having no knowledge of him, or of the sayings of the prophets which come to their ears every Sabbath day, gave effect to them by judging him.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 28
text: And though no cause of death was seen in him, they made a request to Pilate that he might be put to death.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 29
text: And when they had done all the things said in the Writings about him, they took him down from the tree, and put him in the place of the dead.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 30
text: But God gave him back from the dead:

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 31
text: And for a number of days he was seen by those who came with him from Galilee to Jerusalem, who are now his witnesses before the people.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 32
text: And we are giving you the good news of the undertaking made to the fathers,

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 33
text: Which God has now put into effect for our children, by sending Jesus; as it says in the second Psalm, You are my Son; this day I have given you being.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 34
text: And about his coming back from the dead, never again to go to destruction, he has said these words, I will give you the holy and certain mercies of David.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 35
text: Because he says in another Psalm, You will not let your Holy One see destruction.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 36
text: Now David, having done God's work for his generation, went to sleep, and was put with his fathers, and his body came to destruction:

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 37
text: But he, who was lifted up by God, did not see destruction.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 38
text: And so, let it be clear to you, my brothers, that through this man forgiveness of sins is offered to you:

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 39
text: And through him everyone who has faith is made free from all those things, from which the law of Moses was not able to make you free.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 40
text: So take care that these words of the prophets do not come true for you;

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 41
text: See, you doubters, have wonder and come to your end; for I will do a thing in your days to which you will not give belief, even if it is made clear to you.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 42
text: And when they went out, they made a request that these words might be said to them again on the Sabbath after.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 43
text: Now when the meeting was ended, a number of the Jews and of the God-fearing Gentiles who had become Jews, went after Paul and Barnabas: who put before them how important it was to keep on in the grace of God.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 44
text: And on the Sabbath after, almost all the town came together to give hearing to the word of God.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 45
text: But when the Jews saw such a great number of people, they were full of envy and said evil words against Paul's preaching.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 46
text: Then Paul and Barnabas without fear said, It was necessary for the word of God to be given to you first; but because you will have nothing to do with it, and have no desire for eternal life, it will now be offered to the Gentiles.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 47
text: For so the Lord has given us orders, saying, I have given you for a light to the Gentiles so that you may be for salvation to the ends of the earth.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 48
text: And the Gentiles, hearing this, were glad and gave glory to the word of God: and those marked out by God for eternal life had faith.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 49
text: And the word of the Lord went through all the country.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 50
text: But the Jews, working up the feelings of the God-fearing women of high position and of the chief men of the town, got an attack started against Paul and Barnabas, driving them out of those parts.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 51
text: But they, shaking off the dust of that place from their feet, came to Iconium.

title: Acts Chapter 13 Verse 52
text: And the disciples were full of joy and of the Holy Spirit.

title: Acts Chapter 14 Verse 1
text: Now in Iconium they went together to the Synagogue of the Jews and gave such teaching that a great number of Jews and Greeks had faith.

title: Acts Chapter 14 Verse 2
text: But those Jews who had not the faith, made the minds of the Gentiles bitter against the brothers.

title: Acts Chapter 14 Verse 3
text: So they kept there for a long time, taking heart in the Lord, who gave witness to the word of his grace by causing signs and wonders to be done by their hands.

title: Acts Chapter 14 Verse 4
text: But there was a division among the people of the town; some were on the side of the Jews and some on the side of the Apostles.

title: Acts Chapter 14 Verse 5
text: And when a violent attempt was made by the Gentiles and the Jews, with their rulers, to make an attack on them and have them stoned,

title: Acts Chapter 14 Verse 6
text: Having got news of it, they went in flight to the towns of Lycaonia, Lystra, and Derbe, and the country round about:

title: Acts Chapter 14 Verse 7
text: And went on preaching the good news there.

title: Acts Chapter 14 Verse 8
text: And at Lystra there was a certain man, who from birth had been without the use of his feet, never having had the power of walking.

title: Acts Chapter 14 Verse 9
text: This man was giving ear to the preaching of Paul, who, looking at him, and seeing that he had faith to be made well,

title: Acts Chapter 14 Verse 10
text: Said in a loud voice, Get up on your feet. And, jumping up, he went walking about.

title: Acts Chapter 14 Verse 11
text: And when the people saw what Paul had done, they said in a loud voice, in the language of Lycaonia, The gods have come down to us in the form of men.

title: Acts Chapter 14 Verse 12
text: And they gave the name of Jupiter to Barnabas, and to Paul that of Mercury, because he was the chief talker.

title: Acts Chapter 14 Verse 13
text: And the priest of the image of Jupiter, which was before the town, took oxen and flowers to the doors of the town, and was about to make an offering with the people.

title: Acts Chapter 14 Verse 14
text: But when this came to the ears of the Apostles, Paul and Barnabas, they went running out among the people, parting their clothing, and crying out,

title: Acts Chapter 14 Verse 15
text: Good people, why are you doing these things? We are men with the same feelings as you, and we give you the good news so that you may be turned away from these foolish things to the living God, who made the heaven and the earth and the sea and all things in them:

title: Acts Chapter 14 Verse 16
text: Who in the past let all nations go in the ways which seemed good to them.

title: Acts Chapter 14 Verse 17
text: But he was not without witness, because he did good, and gave you rain from heaven and times of fruit, making your hearts full of food and joy.

title: Acts Chapter 14 Verse 18
text: And even with these words, it was hard for them to keep the people from making an offering to them.

title: Acts Chapter 14 Verse 19
text: But some Jews came to that place from Antioch and Iconium, and got control over the people; and after stoning Paul, they had him pulled out of the town, taking him for dead.

title: Acts Chapter 14 Verse 20
text: But when the disciples came round him, he got up and went into the town: and the day after he went away with Barnabas to Derbe.

title: Acts Chapter 14 Verse 21
text: And having made a number of disciples through the preaching of the good news in that town, they went back to Lystra and Iconium and Antioch,

title: Acts Chapter 14 Verse 22
text: Making strong the souls of the disciples, saying to them that they were to keep the faith, and that we have to go through troubles of all sorts to come into the kingdom of God.

title: Acts Chapter 14 Verse 23
text: And when they had made selection of some to be rulers in every church, and had given themselves to prayer and kept themselves from food, they put them into the care of the Lord in whom they had faith.

title: Acts Chapter 14 Verse 24
text: And they went through Pisidia and came to Pamphylia.

title: Acts Chapter 14 Verse 25
text: And, after preaching the word in Perga, they went down to Attalia;

title: Acts Chapter 14 Verse 26
text: And from there they went by ship to Antioch, where they had been handed over to the grace of God for the work which they had not done.

title: Acts Chapter 14 Verse 27
text: And when they came there, and had got the church together, they gave them an account of all the things which God had done through them, and how he had made open a door of faith to the Gentiles.

title: Acts Chapter 14 Verse 28
text: And they were with the disciples there for a long time.

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 1
text: Now certain men came down from Judaea, teaching the brothers and saying that without circumcision, after the rule of Moses, there is no salvation.

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 2
text: And after Paul and Barnabas had had no little argument and discussion with them, the brothers made a decision to send Paul and Barnabas and certain others of them to the Apostles and the rulers of the church at Jerusalem about this question.

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 3
text: So they, being sent on their way by the church, went through Phoenicia and Samaria, giving news of the salvation of the Gentiles, to the great joy of all the brothers.

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 4
text: And when they came to Jerusalem, they had a meeting with the church and the Apostles and the rulers, and they gave an account of all the things which God had done through them.

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 5
text: But some of the Pharisees, who were of the faith, got up and said, It is necessary for these to have circumcision and to keep the law of Moses.

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 6
text: And the Apostles and the rulers of the church came together and gave thought to the question.

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 7
text: And when there had been much discussion, Peter got up and said to them, My brothers, you have knowledge that some time back it was God's pleasure that by my mouth the good news might be given to the Gentiles so that they might have faith.

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 8
text: And God, the searcher of hearts, was a witness to them, giving them the Holy Spirit even as he did to us;

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 9
text: Making no division between them and us, but making clean their hearts by faith.

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 10
text: Why then are you testing God, by putting on the neck of the disciples a yoke so hard that not even our fathers or we were strong enough for it?

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 11
text: But we have faith that we will get salvation through the grace of the Lord Jesus in the same way as they.

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 12
text: And all the people were quiet while Barnabas and Paul gave an account of the signs and wonders which God had done among the Gentiles by them.

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 13
text: And when they had come to an end, James, answering, said, My brothers, give ear to me:

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 14
text: Symeon has given an account of how God was first pleased to take from among the Gentiles a people for himself.

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 15
text: And this is in agreement with the words of the prophets, as it is said,

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 16
text: After these things I will come back, and will put up the tent of David which has been broken down, building up again its broken parts and making it complete:

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 17
text: So that the rest of men may make search for the Lord, and all the Gentiles on whom my name is named,

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 18
text: Says the Lord, who has made these things clear from the earliest times.

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 19
text: For this reason my decision is, that we do not put trouble in the way of those who from among the Gentiles are turned to God;

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 20
text: But that we give them orders to keep themselves from things offered to false gods, and from the evil desires of the body, and from the flesh of animals put to death in ways against the law, and from blood.

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 21
text: For Moses, from times long past, has his preachers in every town, reading his law in the Synagogues every Sabbath.

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 22
text: Then it seemed good to the Apostles and the rulers and all the church, to send men from among them to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas; Judas, named Barsabbas, and Silas, chief men among the brothers:

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 23
text: And they sent a letter by them, saying, The Apostles and the older brothers, to the brothers who are of the Gentiles in Antioch and Syria and Cilicia, may joy be with you:

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 24
text: Because we have knowledge that some who went from us have been troubling you with their words, putting your souls in doubt; to whom we gave no such order;

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 25
text: It seemed good to us, having come to an agreement together, to send these men to you, with our well loved Barnabas and Paul,

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 26
text: Men who have given up their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 27
text: And so we have sent Judas and Silas, who will say the same things to you themselves, by word of mouth.

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 28
text: For it seemed good to the Holy Spirit and to us, to put on you nothing more than these necessary things;

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 29
text: To keep from things offered to false gods, and from blood, and from things put to death in ways which are against the law, and from the evil desires of the body; if you keep yourselves from these, you will do well. May you be happy.

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 30
text: So they, being sent away, came down to Antioch, and having got the people together, they gave them the letter.

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 31
text: And after reading it, they were glad of its comfort.

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 32
text: And Judas and Silas, who themselves were prophets, gave teaching to the brothers and made them strong in the faith.

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 33
text: And when they had been there for some time, they were sent back in peace by the brothers to those who had sent them.

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 35
text: But Paul and Barnabas kept on in Antioch, teaching and preaching the word of God, with a number of others.

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 36
text: And after some days, Paul said to Barnabas, Let us go back and see the brothers in every town where we have given the word of God, and see how they are.

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 37
text: And Barnabas had a desire to take with them John, named Mark.

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 38
text: But Paul was of the opinion that it was not right to take with them one who had gone away from them in Pamphylia, and had not gone on with the work.

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 39
text: And there was a sharp argument between them, so that they were parted from one another, and Barnabas took Mark with him and went by ship to Cyprus;

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 40
text: But Paul took Silas and went away with the blessing of the brothers.

title: Acts Chapter 15 Verse 41
text: And he went through Syria and Cilicia, making the churches stronger in the faith.

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 1
text: And he came to Derbe and Lystra: and there was a certain disciple there named Timothy, whose mother was one of the Jews of the faith, but his father was a Greek;

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 2
text: Of whom the brothers at Lystra and Iconium had a high opinion.

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 3
text: Paul had a desire for him to go with him, and he gave him circumcision because of the Jews who were in those parts: for they all had knowledge that his father was a Greek.

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 4
text: And on their way through the towns, they gave them the rules which had been made by the Apostles and the rulers of the church at Jerusalem, so that they might keep them.

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 5
text: So the churches were made strong in the faith and were increased in number every day.

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 6
text: And after they had gone through the land of Phrygia and Galatia, the Holy Spirit did not let them take the word into Asia;

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 7
text: And having come to Mysia, they made an attempt to go into Bithynia, but the Spirit of Jesus did not let them;

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 8
text: And going past Mysia, they came down to Troas.

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 9
text: And Paul had a vision in the night; a man of Macedonia came, requesting him, and saying, Come over into Macedonia and give us help.

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 10
text: And when he had seen the vision, straight away we made the decision to go into Macedonia, for it seemed certain to us that God had sent us to give the good news to them.

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 11
text: So, from Troas we went straight by ship to Samothrace and the day after to Neapolis;

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 12
text: And from there to Philippi, which is the most important town of Macedonia and a Roman colony: and we were there for some days.

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 13
text: And on the Sabbath we went outside the town, by the river, where we had an idea that there would be a place of prayer; and, being seated, we had talk with the women who had come together.

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 14
text: And a certain woman named Lydia, a trader in purple cloth of the town of Thyatira, and a God-fearing woman, gave ear to us: whose heart the Lord made open to give attention to the things which Paul was saying.

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 15
text: And when she and her family had had baptism, she made a request to us, saying, If it seems to you that I am true to the Lord, come into my house and be my guests. And she made us come.

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 16
text: And when we were going to the place of prayer, we came across a girl with a spirit which gave knowledge of the future, whose masters made great profit from her power.

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 17
text: She came after Paul and us, crying out and saying, These men are the servants of the Most High God, who are giving you news of the way of salvation.

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 18
text: And this she did on a number of days. But Paul was greatly troubled and, turning, said to the spirit, I give you orders in the name of Jesus Christ, to come out of her. And it came out that very hour.

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 19
text: But when her masters saw that their hope of profit was gone, they took Paul and Silas, pulling them into the market-place before the rulers;

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 20
text: And when they had taken them before the authorities, they said, These men, who are Jews, are greatly troubling our town;

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 21
text: Teaching rules of living which it is not right for us to have or to keep, being Romans.

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 22
text: And the people made an attack on them all together: and the authorities took their clothing off them, and gave orders for them to be whipped.

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 23
text: And when they had given them a great number of blows, they put them in prison, giving orders to the keeper of the prison to keep them safely:

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 24
text: And he, having such orders, put them into the inner prison with chains on their feet.

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 25
text: But about the middle of the night, Paul and Silas were making prayers and songs to God in the hearing of the prisoners;

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 26
text: And suddenly there was an earth-shock, so that the base of the prison was moved: and all the doors came open, and everyone's chains came off.

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 27
text: And the keeper, coming out of his sleep, and seeing the prison doors open, took his sword and was about to put himself to death, fearing that the prisoners had got away.

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 28
text: But Paul said in a loud voice, Do yourself no damage, for we are all here.

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 29
text: And he sent for lights and came rushing in and, shaking with fear, went down on his face before Paul and Silas,

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 30
text: And took them out and said, Sirs, what have I to do to get salvation?

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 31
text: And they said, Have faith in the Lord Jesus, and you and your family will have salvation.

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 32
text: And they gave the word of the Lord to him and to all who were in his house.

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 33
text: And that same hour of the night, he took them, and when he had given attention to their wounds, he and all his family had baptism straight away.

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 34
text: And he took them into his house and gave them food, and he was full of joy, having faith in God with all his family.

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 35
text: But when it was day, the authorities sent the police, saying, Let these men go.

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 36
text: And the keeper said to Paul, The authorities have given orders to let you go: come out now, and go in peace.

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 37
text: But Paul said to them, They have given us who are Romans a public whipping without judging us, and have put us in prison. Will they now send us out secretly? no, truly, let them come themselves and take us out.

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 38
text: And the police gave an account of these words to the authorities, and they were full of fear on hearing that they were Romans;

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 39
text: Then they came and made prayers to them, requesting them, when they had taken them out, to go away from the town.

title: Acts Chapter 16 Verse 40
text: And they came out of the prison and went to the house of Lydia: and when they had seen the brothers they gave them comfort and went away.

title: Acts Chapter 17 Verse 1
text: Now when they had gone through Amphipolis and Apollonia they came to Thessalonica, where there was a Synagogue of the Jews:

title: Acts Chapter 17 Verse 2
text: And Paul, as he generally did, went in to them, and on three Sabbath days had discussions with them from the holy Writings,

title: Acts Chapter 17 Verse 3
text: Saying to them clearly and openly that Christ had to be put to death and come back to life again; and that this Jesus, whom, he said, I am preaching to you, is the Christ.

title: Acts Chapter 17 Verse 4
text: And some of them had faith, and were joined to Paul and Silas; and a number of the God-fearing Greeks, and some of the chief women.

title: Acts Chapter 17 Verse 5
text: But the Jews, being moved with envy, took with them certain low persons from among the common people, and getting together a great number of people, made an outcry in the town, attacking the house of Jason with the purpose of taking them out to the people.

title: Acts Chapter 17 Verse 6
text: And when they were not able to get them, they took Jason and some of the brothers by force before the rulers of the town, crying, These men, who have made trouble all over the world have now come here;

title: Acts Chapter 17 Verse 7
text: Whom Jason has taken into his house: and they are acting against the orders of Caesar, saying that there is another king, Jesus.

title: Acts Chapter 17 Verse 8
text: And hearing these things the people and the rulers of the town were troubled.

title: Acts Chapter 17 Verse 9
text: And having made Jason and the others give an undertaking to keep the peace, they let them go.

title: Acts Chapter 17 Verse 10
text: And the brothers straight away sent Paul and Silas away by night to Beroea: and they, when they came there, went to the Synagogue of the Jews.

title: Acts Chapter 17 Verse 11
text: Now these were more noble than the Jews of Thessalonica, for they gave serious attention to the word, searching in the holy Writings every day, to see if these things were so.

title: Acts Chapter 17 Verse 12
text: And a number of them had faith, and no small number of the Greek women of high position and of the men.

title: Acts Chapter 17 Verse 13
text: But when the Jews of Thessalonica had news that Paul was preaching the word at Beroea, they came there, troubling the people and working them up.

title: Acts Chapter 17 Verse 14
text: So the brothers sent Paul straight away to the sea: but Silas and Timothy kept there still.

title: Acts Chapter 17 Verse 15
text: But those who went with Paul took him as far as Athens, and then went away, with orders from him to Silas and Timothy to come to him quickly.

title: Acts Chapter 17 Verse 16
text: Now while Paul was waiting for them at Athens, his spirit was troubled, for he saw all the town full of images of the gods.

title: Acts Chapter 17 Verse 17
text: So he had discussions in the Synagogue with the Jews and God-fearing Gentiles, and every day in the market-place with those who were there.

title: Acts Chapter 17 Verse 18
text: And some of those who were supporters of the theories of the Epicureans and the Stoics, had a meeting with him. And some said, What is this talker of foolish words saying? And others, He seems to be a preacher of strange gods: because he was preaching of Jesus and his coming back from the dead.

title: Acts Chapter 17 Verse 19
text: And they took him to Mars' Hill, saying, Will you make clear to us what is this new teaching of yours?

title: Acts Chapter 17 Verse 20
text: For you seem to us to say strange things, and we have a desire to get the sense of them.

title: Acts Chapter 17 Verse 21
text: (Now all the Athenians and the men from other lands who come there were giving all their time to talking or hearing of anything new.)

title: Acts Chapter 17 Verse 22
text: And Paul got to his feet on Mars' Hill and said, O men of Athens, I see that you are overmuch given to fear of the gods.

title: Acts Chapter 17 Verse 23
text: For when I came by, I was looking at the things to which you give worship, and I saw an altar with this writing on it, TO THE GOD OF WHOM THERE IS NO KNOWLEDGE. Now, what you, without knowledge, give worship to, I make clear to you.

title: Acts Chapter 17 Verse 24
text: The God who made the earth and everything in it, he, being Lord of heaven and earth, is not housed in buildings made with hands;

title: Acts Chapter 17 Verse 25
text: And he is not dependent on the work of men's hands, as if he had need of anything, for he himself gives to all life and breath and all things;

title: Acts Chapter 17 Verse 26
text: And he has made of one blood all the nations of men living on all the face of the earth, ordering their times and the limits of their lands,

title: Acts Chapter 17 Verse 27
text: So that they might make search for God, in order, if possible, to get knowledge of him and make discovery of him, though he is not far from every one of us:

title: Acts Chapter 17 Verse 28
text: For in him we have life and motion and existence; as certain of your verse writers have said, For we are his offspring.

title: Acts Chapter 17 Verse 29
text: If then we are the offspring of God, it is not right for us to have the idea that God is like gold or silver or stone, formed by the art or design of man.

title: Acts Chapter 17 Verse 30
text: Those times when men had no knowledge were overlooked by God; but now he gives orders to all men in every place to undergo a change of heart:

title: Acts Chapter 17 Verse 31
text: Because a day has been fixed in which all the world will be judged in righteousness by the man who has been marked out by him for this work; of which he has given a sign to all men by giving him back from the dead.

title: Acts Chapter 17 Verse 32
text: Now on hearing about the coming back from death, some of them made sport of it, but others said, Let us go more fully into this another time.

title: Acts Chapter 17 Verse 33
text: And so Paul went away from among them.

title: Acts Chapter 17 Verse 34
text: But some men gave him their support: among whom was Dionysius the Areopagite, and a woman named Damaris, and others with them.

title: Acts Chapter 18 Verse 1
text: After these things, he went away from Athens, and came to Corinth.

title: Acts Chapter 18 Verse 2
text: And there he came across a certain Jew named Aquila, a man of Pontus by birth, who not long before had come from Italy with his wife Priscilla, because Claudius had given orders that all Jews were to go away from Rome: and he came to them;

title: Acts Chapter 18 Verse 3
text: And because he was of the same trade, he was living with them, and they did their work together; for by trade they were tent-makers.

title: Acts Chapter 18 Verse 4
text: And every Sabbath he had discussions in the Synagogue, turning Jews and Greeks to the faith.

title: Acts Chapter 18 Verse 5
text: And when Silas and Timothy came down from Macedonia, Paul was completely given up to the word, preaching to the Jews that the Christ was Jesus.

title: Acts Chapter 18 Verse 6
text: And when they put themselves against him, and said evil words, he said, shaking his clothing, Your blood be on your heads, I am clean: from now I will go to the Gentiles.

title: Acts Chapter 18 Verse 7
text: And moving from there, he went into the house of a man named Titus Justus, a God-fearing man, whose house was very near the Synagogue.

title: Acts Chapter 18 Verse 8
text: And Crispus, the ruler of the Synagogue, with all his family, had faith in the Lord; and a great number of the people of Corinth, hearing the word, had faith and were given baptism.

title: Acts Chapter 18 Verse 9
text: And the Lord said to Paul in the night, in a vision, Have no fear and go on preaching:

title: Acts Chapter 18 Verse 10
text: For I am with you, and no one will make an attack on you to do you damage: for I have a number of people in this town.

title: Acts Chapter 18 Verse 11
text: And he was there for a year and six months, teaching the word of God among them.

title: Acts Chapter 18 Verse 12
text: But when Gallio was ruler of Achaia, all the Jews together made an attack on Paul, and took him to the judge's seat,

title: Acts Chapter 18 Verse 13
text: Saying, This man is teaching the people to give worship to God in a way which is against the law.

title: Acts Chapter 18 Verse 14
text: But when Paul was about to say something, Gallio said to the Jews, If this was anything to do with wrongdoing or crime, there would be a reason for me to give you a hearing:

title: Acts Chapter 18 Verse 15
text: But if it is a question of words or names or of your law, see to it yourselves; I will not be a judge of such things.

title: Acts Chapter 18 Verse 16
text: And he sent them away from the judge's seat.

title: Acts Chapter 18 Verse 17
text: And they all made an attack on Sosthenes, the ruler of the Synagogue, and gave him blows before the judge's seat; but Gallio gave no attention to these things.

title: Acts Chapter 18 Verse 18
text: And Paul, after waiting some days, went away from the brothers and went by ship to Syria, Priscilla and Aquila being with him; and he had had his hair cut off in Cenchrea, for he had taken an oath.

title: Acts Chapter 18 Verse 19
text: And they came down to Ephesus and he left them there: and he himself went into the Synagogue and had a discussion with the Jews.

title: Acts Chapter 18 Verse 20
text: And being requested by them to be there for a longer time, he said, No;

title: Acts Chapter 18 Verse 21
text: And went from them, saying, I will come back to you if God lets me; and he took ship from Ephesus.

title: Acts Chapter 18 Verse 22
text: And when he had come to land at Caesarea, he went to see the church, and then went down to Antioch.

title: Acts Chapter 18 Verse 23
text: And having been there for some time, he went through the country of Galatia and Phrygia in order, making the disciples strong in the faith.

title: Acts Chapter 18 Verse 24
text: Now a certain Jew named Apollos, an Alexandrian by birth, and a man of learning, came to Ephesus; and he had great knowledge of the holy Writings.

title: Acts Chapter 18 Verse 25
text: This man had been trained in the way of the Lord; and burning in spirit, he gave himself up to teaching the facts about Jesus, though he had knowledge only of John's baptism:

title: Acts Chapter 18 Verse 26
text: And he was preaching in the Synagogue without fear. But Priscilla and Aquila, hearing his words, took him in, and gave him fuller teaching about the way of God.

title: Acts Chapter 18 Verse 27
text: And when he had a desire to go over into Achaia, the brothers gave him help, and sent letters to the disciples requesting them to take him in among them: and when he had come, he gave much help to those who had faith through grace:

title: Acts Chapter 18 Verse 28
text: For he overcame the Jews in public discussion, making clear from the holy Writings that the Christ was Jesus.

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 1
text: And it came about that while Apollos was at Corinth, Paul, having gone through the higher country, came to Ephesus, where there were certain disciples:

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 2
text: And he said to them, Did you get the Holy Spirit when you had faith? And they said to him, No, we have had no knowledge of the Holy Spirit.

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 3
text: And he said, What sort of baptism did you have? And they said, The baptism of John.

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 4
text: And Paul said, John gave a baptism which goes with a change of heart, saying to the people that they were to have faith in him who was coming after him, that is, in Jesus.

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 5
text: And hearing this, they had baptism in the name of the Lord Jesus.

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 6
text: And when Paul had put his hands on them, the Holy Spirit came on them; and they had the power of talking in tongues, and acting like prophets.

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 7
text: And there were about twelve of these men.

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 8
text: And he went into the Synagogue, and for three months he was preaching there without fear, reasoning and teaching about the kingdom of God.

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 9
text: But because some of the people were hard-hearted and would not give hearing, saying evil words about the Way before the people, he went away from them, and kept the disciples separate, reasoning every day in the school of Tyrannus.

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 10
text: And this went on for two years, so that all those who were living in Asia had knowledge of the word of the Lord, Greeks as well as Jews.

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 11
text: And God did special works of power by the hands of Paul:

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 12
text: So that bits of linen and clothing from his body were taken to people who were ill, and their diseases went away from them and the evil spirits went out.

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 13
text: But some of the Jews who went from place to place driving out evil spirits, took it on themselves to make use of the name of the Lord Jesus over those who had evil spirits, saying, I give you orders, by Jesus, whom Paul is preaching.

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 14
text: And there were seven sons of a man named Sceva, a Jew and a chief priest, who did this.

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 15
text: And the evil spirit, answering, said to them, I have knowledge of Jesus, and of Paul, but who are you?

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 16
text: And the man in whom the evil spirit was, jumping on them, was stronger than the two of them, and overcame them, so that they went running from that house, wounded and without their clothing.

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 17
text: And this came to the ears of all those, Jews and Greeks, who were living at Ephesus; and fear came on them all, and the name of the Lord Jesus was made great.

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 18
text: And a number of those who had faith came and made a public statement of their sins and all their acts.

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 19
text: And a great number of those who were experts in strange arts took their books and put them on the fire in front of everyone: and when the books were valued they came to fifty thousand bits of silver.

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 20
text: So the word of the Lord was increased very greatly and was full of power.

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 21
text: Now after these things were ended, Paul came to a decision that when he had gone through Macedonia and Achaia he would go to Jerusalem, saying, After I have been there, I have a desire to see Rome.

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 22
text: And having sent two of his helpers, Timothy and Erastus, into Macedonia, he himself went on living in Asia for a time.

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 23
text: And about that time a great outcry took place about the Way.

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 24
text: For there was a certain man named Demetrius, a silver-worker, who made silver boxes for the images of Diana, and gave no small profit to the workmen;

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 25
text: Whom he got together, with other workmen of the same trade, and said to them, Men, it is clear that from this business we get our wealth.

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 26
text: And you see, for it has come to your ears, that not only at Ephesus, but almost all through Asia, this Paul has been teaching numbers of people and turning them away, saying that those are not gods who are made by men's hands:

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 27
text: And there is danger, not only that our trade may be damaged in the opinion of men, but that the holy place of the great goddess Diana may be no longer honoured, and that she to whom all Asia and the world give worship, will be put down from her high position.

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 28
text: And hearing this, they were very angry, crying out and saying, Great is Diana of Ephesus.

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 29
text: And the town was full of noise and trouble, and they all came running into the theatre, having taken by force Gaius and Aristarchus, men of Macedonia who were journeying in company with Paul.

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 30
text: And when Paul was about to go in to the people, the disciples did not let him.

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 31
text: And some of the rulers of Asia, being his friends, sent to him, requesting him seriously not to put himself in danger by going into the theatre.

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 32
text: And some said one thing, and some another: for there was no order in the meeting; and most of them had no idea why they had come together.

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 33
text: Then they took Alexander out from among the people, the Jews putting him forward. And Alexander, making a sign with his hand, was about to make a statement to the people in answer:

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 34
text: But when they saw that he was a Jew, all of them with one voice went on crying out for about two hours, Great is Diana of Ephesus.

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 35
text: And when the chief secretary had got the people quiet, he said, Men of Ephesus, is any man without knowledge that the town of Ephesus is the keeper of the holy place of the great Diana, who was sent down from Jupiter?

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 36
text: So then, because these things may not be doubted, it would be better for you to be quiet, and do nothing unwise.

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 37
text: For you have taken these men, who are not doing damage to the holy place or talking against our goddess.

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 38
text: If, then, Demetrius and the workmen who are with him have a protest to make against any man, the law is open to them, and there are judges; let them put up a cause at law against one another.

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 39
text: But if any other business is in question, let it be taken up in the regular meeting.

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 40
text: For, truly, we are in danger of being made responsible for this day's trouble, there being no cause for it: and we are not able to give any reason for this coming together.

title: Acts Chapter 19 Verse 41
text: And when he had said this, he sent the meeting away.

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 1
text: And after the noise had come to an end, Paul, having sent for the disciples and given them comfort, went away from them to Macedonia.

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 2
text: And when he had gone through those parts and given them much teaching, he came into Greece.

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 3
text: And when he had been there three months, because the Jews had made a secret design against him when he was about to take ship for Syria, he made a decision to go back through Macedonia.

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 4
text: And Sopater of Beroea, the son of Pyrrhus, and Aristarchus and Secundus of Thessalonica, and Gaius of Derbe, and Timothy, and Tychicus and Trophimus of Asia, went with him as far as Asia.

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 5
text: But these had gone before, and were waiting for us at Troas.

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 6
text: And we went away from Philippi by ship after the days of unleavened bread, and came to them at Troas in five days; and we were there for seven days.

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 7
text: And on the first day of the week, when we had come together for the holy meal, Paul gave them a talk, for it was his purpose to go away on the day after; and he went on talking till after the middle of the night.

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 8
text: And there were a number of lights in the room where we had come together.

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 9
text: And a certain young man named Eutychus, who was seated in the window, went into a deep sleep; and while Paul went on talking, being overcome by sleep, he had a fall from the third floor, and was taken up dead.

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 10
text: And Paul went down and, falling on him, took him in his arms and said, Do not be troubled, for his life is in him.

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 11
text: And when he had gone up, and had taken the broken bread, he went on talking to them for a long time, even till dawn, and then he went away.

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 12
text: And they took the boy in, living, and were greatly comforted.

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 13
text: But we, going before him by ship, went to Assos with the purpose of taking Paul in there: for so he had given orders, because he himself was coming by land.

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 14
text: And when he came up with us at Assos, we took him in the ship and went on to Mitylene.

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 15
text: And going from there by sea, we came on the day after opposite Chios, and touching at Samos on the day after that, we came on the third day to Miletus.

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 16
text: For Paul's purpose was to go past Ephesus, so that he might not be kept in Asia; for he was going quickly, in order, if possible, to be at Jerusalem on the day of Pentecost.

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 17
text: And from Miletus he sent to Ephesus for the rulers of the church.

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 18
text: And when they had come, he said to them, You yourselves have seen what my life has been like all the time from the day when I first came into Asia,

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 19
text: Doing the Lord's work without pride, through all the sorrow and troubles which came on me because of the evil designs of the Jews:

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 20
text: And how I kept back nothing which might be of profit to you, teaching you publicly and privately,

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 21
text: Preaching to Jews and to Greeks the need for a turning of the heart to God, and faith in the Lord Jesus Christ.

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 22
text: And now, as you see, I am going to Jerusalem, a prisoner in spirit, having no knowledge of what will come to me there:

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 23
text: Only that the Holy Spirit makes clear to me in every town that prison and pains are waiting for me.

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 24
text: But I put no value on my life, if only at the end of it I may see the work complete which was given to me by the Lord Jesus, to be a witness of the good news of the grace of God.

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 25
text: And now I am conscious that you, among whom I have gone about preaching the kingdom, will not see my face again.

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 26
text: And so I say to you this day that I am clean from the blood of all men.

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 27
text: For I have not kept back from you anything of the purpose of God.

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 28
text: Give attention to yourselves, and to all the flock which the Holy Spirit has given into your care, to give food to the church of God, for which he gave his blood.

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 29
text: I am conscious that after I am gone, evil wolves will come in among you, doing damage to the flock;

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 30
text: And from among yourselves will come men who will give wrong teaching, turning away the disciples after them.

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 31
text: So keep watch, having in mind that for three years without resting I was teaching every one of you, day and night, with weeping.

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 32
text: And now, I give you into the care of God and the word of his grace, which is able to make you strong and to give you your heritage among all the saints.

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 33
text: I have had no desire for any man's silver or gold or clothing.

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 34
text: You yourselves have seen that with these hands I got what was necessary for me and those who were with me.

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 35
text: In all things I was an example to you of how, in your lives, you are to give help to the feeble, and keep in memory the words of the Lord Jesus, how he himself said, There is a greater blessing in giving than in getting.

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 36
text: And having said these words, he went down on his knees in prayer with them all.

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 37
text: And they were all weeping, falling on Paul's neck and kissing him,

title: Acts Chapter 20 Verse 38
text: Being sad most of all because he had said that they would not see his face again. And so they went with him to the ship.

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 1
text: And after parting from them, we put out to sea and came straight to Cos, and the day after to Rhodes, and from there to Patara:

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 2
text: And as there was a ship going to Phoenicia, we went in it.

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 3
text: And when we had come in view of Cyprus, going past it on our left, we went on to Syria, and came to land at Tyre: for there the goods which were in the ship had to be taken out.

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 4
text: And meeting the disciples we were there for seven days: and they gave Paul orders through the Spirit not to go up to Jerusalem.

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 5
text: And when these days came to an end, we went on our journey; and they all, with their wives and children, came with us on our way till we were out of the town: and after going on our knees in prayer by the sea,

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 6
text: We said our last words to one another, and got into the ship, and they went back to their houses.

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 7
text: And journeying by ship from Tyre we came to Ptolemais; and there we had talk with the brothers and were with them for one day.

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 8
text: And on the day after, we went away and came to Caesarea, where we were guests in the house of Philip, the preacher, who was one of the seven.

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 9
text: And he had four daughters, virgins, who were prophets.

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 10
text: And while we were waiting there for some days, a certain prophet, named Agabus, came down from Judaea.

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 11
text: And he came to us, and took the band of Paul's clothing, and putting it round his feet and hands, said, The Holy Spirit says these words, So will the Jews do to the man who is the owner of this band, and they will give him up into the hands of the Gentiles.

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 12
text: And hearing these things, we and those who were living in that place made request to him not to go to Jerusalem.

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 13
text: Then Paul said, What are you doing, weeping and wounding my heart? for I am ready, not only to be a prisoner, but to be put to death at Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus.

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 14
text: And as he might not be moved we did no more, saying, Let the purpose of God be done.

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 15
text: And after these days we got ready and went up to Jerusalem.

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 16
text: And some of the disciples from Caesarea went with us, taking a certain Mnason of Cyprus, one of the early disciples, in whose house we were to be living.

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 17
text: And when we came to Jerusalem, the brothers were pleased to see us.

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 18
text: And on the day after, Paul went with us to James, and all the rulers of the church were present.

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 19
text: And when he had said how glad he was to see them, he gave them a detailed account of the things which God had done through his work among the Gentiles.

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 20
text: And hearing it, they gave praise to God; and they said to him, You see, brother, what thousands there are among the Jews, who have the faith; and they all have a great respect for the law:

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 21
text: And they have had news of you, how you have been teaching all the Jews among the Gentiles to give up the law of Moses, and not to give circumcision to their children, and not to keep the old rules.

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 22
text: What then is the position? They will certainly get news that you have come.

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 23
text: Do this, then, which we say to you: We have four men who have taken an oath;

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 24
text: Go with these, and make yourself clean with them, and make the necessary payments for them, so that they may be free from their oath: and everyone will see that the statements made about you are not true, but that you put yourself under rule, and keep the law.

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 25
text: But as to the Gentiles who have the faith, we sent a letter, giving our decision that they were to keep themselves from offerings made to false gods, and from blood, and from the flesh of animals put to death in ways against the law, and from the evil desires of the body.

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 26
text: Then Paul took the men, and on the day after, making himself clean with them, he went into the Temple, giving out the statement that the days necessary for making them clean were complete, till the offering was made for every one of them.

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 27
text: And when the seven days were almost ended, the Jews from Asia, seeing him in the Temple, got the people together and put their hands on him,

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 28
text: Crying out, Men of Israel, come to our help: this is the man who is teaching all men everywhere against the people and the law and this place: and in addition, he has taken Greeks into the Temple, and made this holy place unclean.

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 29
text: For they had seen him before in the town with Trophimus of Ephesus, and had the idea that Paul had taken him with him into the Temple.

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 30
text: And all the town was moved, and the people came running together and put their hands on Paul, pulling him out of the Temple: and then the doors were shut.

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 31
text: And while they were attempting to put him to death, news came to the chief captain of the band that all Jerusalem was out of control.

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 32
text: And straight away he took some armed men and went quickly down to them: and the Jews, seeing them, gave no more blows to Paul.

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 33
text: Then the chief captain came near and took him, and gave orders for him to be put in chains, questioning them as to who he was and what he had done.

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 34
text: And some said one thing and some another, among the people: and as he was not able to get a knowledge of the facts because of the noise, he gave orders for Paul to be taken into the army building.

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 35
text: And when he came on to the steps, he was lifted up by the armed men, because of the force of the people;

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 36
text: For a great mass of people came after them, crying out, Away with him!

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 37
text: And when Paul was about to be taken into the building, he said to the chief captain, May I say something to you? And he said, Have you a knowledge of Greek?

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 38
text: Are you by chance the Egyptian who, before this, got the people worked up against the government and took four thousand men of the Assassins out into the waste land?

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 39
text: But Paul said, I am a Jew of Tarsus in Cilicia, which is not an unimportant town: I make a request to you to let me say a word to the people.

title: Acts Chapter 21 Verse 40
text: And when he let him do so, Paul, from the steps, made a sign with his hand to the people, and when they were all quiet, he said to them in the Hebrew language,

title: Acts Chapter 22 Verse 1
text: My brothers and fathers, give ear to the story of my life which I now put before you.

title: Acts Chapter 22 Verse 2
text: And, hearing him talking in the Hebrew language, they became the more quiet, and he said,

title: Acts Chapter 22 Verse 3
text: I am a Jew of Tarsus in Cilicia by birth, but I had my education in this town at the feet of Gamaliel, being trained in the keeping of every detail of the law of our fathers; given up to the cause of God with all my heart, as you are today.

title: Acts Chapter 22 Verse 4
text: And I made attacks on this Way, even to death, taking men and women and putting them in prison.

title: Acts Chapter 22 Verse 5
text: Of which the high priest will be a witness, and all the rulers, from whom I had letters to the brothers; and I went into Damascus, to take those who were there as prisoners to Jerusalem for punishment.

title: Acts Chapter 22 Verse 6
text: And it came about that while I was on my journey, coming near to Damascus, about the middle of the day, suddenly I saw a great light from heaven shining round me.

title: Acts Chapter 22 Verse 7
text: And when I went down on the earth, a voice came to my ears saying to me, Saul, Saul, why are you attacking me so cruelly?

title: Acts Chapter 22 Verse 8
text: And I, answering, said, Who are you; Lord? And he said to me, I am Jesus of Nazareth, whom you are attacking.

title: Acts Chapter 22 Verse 9
text: And those who were with me saw the light, but the voice of him who was talking to me came not to their ears.

title: Acts Chapter 22 Verse 10
text: And I said, What have I to do, Lord? And the Lord said to me, Get up, and go into Damascus; and it will be made clear to you what you have to do.

title: Acts Chapter 22 Verse 11
text: And because I was unable to see because of the glory of that light, those who were with me took me by the hand, and so I came to Damascus.

title: Acts Chapter 22 Verse 12
text: And one Ananias, a God-fearing man, who kept the law, and of whom all the Jews in that place had a high opinion,

title: Acts Chapter 22 Verse 13
text: Came to my side and said, Brother Saul, let your eyes be open. And in that very hour I was able to see him.

title: Acts Chapter 22 Verse 14
text: And he said, You have been marked out by the God of our fathers to have knowledge of his purpose, and to see the Upright One and to give ear to the words of his mouth.

title: Acts Chapter 22 Verse 15
text: For you will be a witness for him to all men of what you have seen and of what has come to your ears.

title: Acts Chapter 22 Verse 16
text: And now, why are you waiting? get up, and have baptism, for the washing away of your sins, giving worship to his name.

title: Acts Chapter 22 Verse 17
text: And it came about that when I had come back to Jerusalem, while I was at prayer in the Temple, my senses became more than naturally clear,

title: Acts Chapter 22 Verse 18
text: And I saw him saying to me, Go out of Jerusalem straight away because they will not give hearing to your witness about me.

title: Acts Chapter 22 Verse 19
text: And I said, Lord, they themselves have knowledge that I went through the Synagogues putting in prison and whipping all those who had faith in you:

title: Acts Chapter 22 Verse 20
text: And when Stephen your witness was put to death, I was there, giving approval, and looking after the clothing of those who put him to death.

title: Acts Chapter 22 Verse 21
text: And he said to me, Go, for I will send you far away to the Gentiles.

title: Acts Chapter 22 Verse 22
text: And they gave him a hearing as far as this word; then with loud voices they said, Away with this man from the earth; it is not right for him to be living.

title: Acts Chapter 22 Verse 23
text: And while they were crying out, and pulling off their clothing, and sending dust into the air,

title: Acts Chapter 22 Verse 24
text: The chief captain gave orders for him to be taken into the army building, saying that he would put him to the test by whipping, so that he might have knowledge of the reason why they were crying out so violently against him.

title: Acts Chapter 22 Verse 25
