title: Romans Chapter 10 Verse 18
text: But I say, Did not the word come to their ears? Yes, certainly: Their sound has gone out into all the earth, and their words to the ends of the world.

title: Romans Chapter 10 Verse 19
text: But I say, Had Israel no knowledge? First Moses says, You will be moved to envy by that which is not a nation, and by a foolish people I will make you angry.

title: Romans Chapter 10 Verse 20
text: And Isaiah says without fear, Those who were not searching for me made discovery of me; and I was seen by those whose hearts were turned away from me.

title: Romans Chapter 10 Verse 21
text: But about Israel he says; All the day my hands have been stretched out to a people whose hearts were turned away, and who put themselves against my word.

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 1
text: So I say, Has God put his people on one side? Let there be no such thought. For I am of Israel, of the seed of Abraham, of the tribe of Benjamin.

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 2
text: God has not put away the people of his selection. Or have you no knowledge of what is said about Elijah in the holy Writings? how he says words to God against Israel,

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 3
text: Lord, they have put your prophets to death, and made waste your altars, and now I am the last, and they are searching for me to take away my life.

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 4
text: But what answer does God make to him? I have still seven thousand men whose knees have not been bent to Baal.

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 5
text: In the same way, there are at this present time some who are marked out by the selection of grace.

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 6
text: But if it is of grace, then it is no longer of works: or grace would not be grace.

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 7
text: What then? That which Israel was searching for he did not get, but those of the selection got it and the rest were made hard.

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 8
text: As it was said in the holy Writings, God gave them a spirit of sleep, eyes which might not see, and ears which have no hearing, to this day.

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 9
text: And David says, Let their table be made a net for taking them, and a stone in their way, and a punishment:

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 10
text: Let their eyes be made dark so that they may not see, and let their back be bent down at all times.

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 11
text: So I say, Were their steps made hard in order that they might have a fall? In no way: but by their fall salvation has come to the Gentiles, so that they might be moved to envy.

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 12
text: Now, if their fall is the wealth of the world, and their loss the wealth of the Gentiles, how much greater will be the glory when they are made full?

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 13
text: But I say to you, Gentiles, in so far as I am the Apostle of the Gentiles, I make much of my position:

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 14
text: If in any way those who are of my flesh may be moved to envy, so that some of them may get salvation by me.

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 15
text: For, if by their putting away, the rest of men have been made friends with God, what will their coming back again be, but life from the dead?

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 16
text: And if the first-fruit is holy, so is the mass: and if the root is holy, so are the branches.

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 17
text: But if some of the branches were broken off, and you, an olive-tree of the fields, were put in among them, and were given a part with them in the root by which the olive-tree is made fertile,

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 18
text: Do not be uplifted in pride over the branches: because it is not you who are the support of the root, but it is by the root that you are supported.

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 19
text: You will say, Branches were broken off so that I might be put in.

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 20
text: Truly, because they had no faith they were broken off, and you have your place by reason of your faith. Do not be lifted up in pride, but have fear;

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 21
text: For, if God did not have mercy on the natural branches, he will not have mercy on you.

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 22
text: See then that God is good but his rules are fixed: to those who were put away he was hard, but to you he has been good, on the condition that you keep in his mercy; if not, you will be cut off as they were.

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 23
text: And they, if they do not go on without faith, will be united to the tree again, because God is able to put them in again.

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 24
text: For if you were cut out of a field olive-tree, and against the natural use were united to a good olive-tree, how much more will these, the natural branches, be united again with the olive-tree which was theirs?

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 25
text: For it is my desire, brothers, that this secret may be clear to you, so that you may not have pride in your knowledge, that Israel has been made hard in part, till all the Gentiles have come in;

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 26
text: And so all Israel will get salvation: as it is said in the holy Writings, There will come out of Zion the One who makes free; by him wrongdoing will be taken away from Jacob:

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 27
text: And this is my agreement with them, when I will take away their sins.

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 28
text: As far as the good news is in question, they are cut off from God on account of you, but as far as the selection is in question, they are loved on account of the fathers.

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 29
text: Because God's selection and his mercies may not be changed.

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 30
text: For as you, in time past, were not under the rule of God, but now have got mercy through their turning away,

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 31
text: So in the same way these have gone against the orders of God, so that by the mercy given to you they may now get mercy.

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 32
text: For God has let them all go against his orders, so that he might have mercy on them all.

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 33
text: O how deep is the wealth of the wisdom and knowledge of God! no one is able to make discovery of his decisions, and his ways may not be searched out.

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 34
text: Who has knowledge of the mind of the Lord? or who has taken part in his purposes?

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 35
text: Or who has first given to him, and it will be given back to him again?

title: Romans Chapter 11 Verse 36
text: For of him, and through him, and to him, are all things. To him be the glory for ever. So be it.

title: Romans Chapter 12 Verse 1
text: For this reason I make request to you, brothers, by the mercies of God, that you will give your bodies as a living offering, holy, pleasing to God, which is the worship it is right for you to give him.

title: Romans Chapter 12 Verse 2
text: And let not your behaviour be like that of this world, but be changed and made new in mind, so that by experience you may have knowledge of the good and pleasing and complete purpose of God.

title: Romans Chapter 12 Verse 3
text: But I say to every one of you, through the grace given to me, not to have an over-high opinion of himself, but to have wise thoughts, as God has given to every one a measure of faith.

title: Romans Chapter 12 Verse 4
text: For, as we have a number of parts in one body, but all the parts have not the same use,

title: Romans Chapter 12 Verse 5
text: So we, though we are a number of persons, are one body in Christ, and are dependent on one another;

title: Romans Chapter 12 Verse 6
text: And having different qualities by reason of the grace given to us, such as the quality of a prophet, let it be made use of in relation to the measure of our faith;

title: Romans Chapter 12 Verse 7
text: Or the position of a Deacon of the church, let a man give himself to it; or he who has the power of teaching, let him make use of it;

title: Romans Chapter 12 Verse 8
text: He who has the power of comforting, let him do so; he who gives, let him give freely; he who has the power of ruling, let him do it with a serious mind; he who has mercy on others, let it be with joy.

title: Romans Chapter 12 Verse 9
text: Let love be without deceit. Be haters of what is evil; keep your minds fixed on what is good.

title: Romans Chapter 12 Verse 10
text: Be kind to one another with a brother's love, putting others before yourselves in honour;

title: Romans Chapter 12 Verse 11
text: Be not slow in your work, but be quick in spirit, as the Lord's servants;

title: Romans Chapter 12 Verse 12
text: Being glad in hope, quiet in trouble, at all times given to prayer,

title: Romans Chapter 12 Verse 13
text: Giving to the needs of the saints, ready to take people into your houses.

title: Romans Chapter 12 Verse 14
text: Give blessing and not curses to those who are cruel to you.

title: Romans Chapter 12 Verse 15
text: Take part in the joy of those who are glad, and in the grief of those who are sorrowing.

title: Romans Chapter 12 Verse 16
text: Be in harmony with one another. Do not have a high opinion of yourselves, but be in agreement with common people. Do not give yourselves an air of wisdom.

title: Romans Chapter 12 Verse 17
text: Do not give evil for evil to any man. Let all your business be well ordered in the eyes of all men.

title: Romans Chapter 12 Verse 18
text: As far as it is possible for you be at peace with all men.

title: Romans Chapter 12 Verse 19
text: Do not give punishment for wrongs done to you, dear brothers, but give way to the wrath of God; for it is said in the holy Writings, Punishment is mine, I will give reward, says the Lord.

title: Romans Chapter 12 Verse 20
text: But if one who has hate for you is in need of food or of drink, give it to him, for in so doing you will put coals of fire on his head.

title: Romans Chapter 12 Verse 21
text: Do not let evil overcome you, but overcome evil by good.

title: Romans Chapter 13 Verse 1
text: Let everyone put himself under the authority of the higher powers, because there is no power which is not of God, and all powers are ordered by God.

title: Romans Chapter 13 Verse 2
text: For which reason everyone who puts himself against the authority puts himself against the order of God: and those who are against it will get punishment for themselves.

title: Romans Chapter 13 Verse 3
text: For rulers are not a cause of fear to the good work but to the evil. If you would have no fear of the authority, do good and you will have praise;

title: Romans Chapter 13 Verse 4
text: For he is the servant of God to you for good. But if you do evil, have fear; for the sword is not in his hand for nothing: he is God's servant, making God's punishment come on the evil-doer.

title: Romans Chapter 13 Verse 5
text: So put yourselves under the authority, not for fear of wrath, but because you have the knowledge of what is right.

title: Romans Chapter 13 Verse 6
text: For the same reason, make payment of taxes; because the authority is God's servant, to take care of such things at all times.

title: Romans Chapter 13 Verse 7
text: Give to all what is their right: taxes to him whose they are, payment to him whose right it is, fear to whom fear, honour to whom honour is to be given.

title: Romans Chapter 13 Verse 8
text: Be in debt for nothing, but to have love for one another: for he who has love for his neighbour has kept all the law.

title: Romans Chapter 13 Verse 9
text: And this, Do not be untrue in married life, Do not put to death, Do not take what is another's, Do not have desire for what is another's, and if there is any other order, it is covered by this word, Have love for your neighbour as for yourself.

title: Romans Chapter 13 Verse 10
text: Love does no wrong to his neighbour, so love makes the law complete.

title: Romans Chapter 13 Verse 11
text: See then that the time has come for you to be awake from sleep: for now is your salvation nearer than when you first had faith.

title: Romans Chapter 13 Verse 12
text: The night is far gone, and the day is near: so let us put off the works of the dark, arming ourselves with light,

title: Romans Chapter 13 Verse 13
text: With right behaviour as in the day; not in pleasure-making and drinking, not in bad company and unclean behaviour, not in fighting and envy.

title: Romans Chapter 13 Verse 14
text: But put on the Lord Jesus Christ, and do not give thought to the flesh to do its desires.

title: Romans Chapter 14 Verse 1
text: Do not put on one side him who is feeble in faith, and do not put him in doubt by your reasonings.

title: Romans Chapter 14 Verse 2
text: One man has faith to take all things as food: another who is feeble in faith takes only green food.

title: Romans Chapter 14 Verse 3
text: Let not him who takes food have a low opinion of him who does not: and let not him who does not take food be a judge of him who does; for he has God's approval.

title: Romans Chapter 14 Verse 4
text: Who are you to make yourself a judge of another man's servant? it is to his master that he is responsible for good or bad. Yes, his place will be safe, because the Lord is able to keep him from falling.

title: Romans Chapter 14 Verse 5
text: This man puts one day before another: to that man they are the same. Let every man be certain in his mind.

title: Romans Chapter 14 Verse 6
text: He who keeps the day, keeps it to the Lord; and he who takes food, takes it as to the Lord, for he gives praise to God; and he who does not take food, to the Lord he takes it not, and gives praise to God.

title: Romans Chapter 14 Verse 7
text: For every man's life and every man's death has a relation to others as well as to himself.

title: Romans Chapter 14 Verse 8
text: As long as we have life we are living to the Lord; or if we give up our life it is to the Lord; so if we are living, or if our life comes to an end, we are the Lord's.

title: Romans Chapter 14 Verse 9
text: And for this purpose Christ went into death and came back again, that he might be the Lord of the dead and of the living.

title: Romans Chapter 14 Verse 10
text: But you, why do you make yourself your brother's judge? or again, why have you no respect for your brother? because we will all have to take our place before God as our judge.

title: Romans Chapter 14 Verse 11
text: For it is said in the holy Writings, By my life, says the Lord, to me every knee will be bent, and every tongue will give worship to God.

title: Romans Chapter 14 Verse 12
text: So every one of us will have to give an account of himself to God.

title: Romans Chapter 14 Verse 13
text: Then let us not be judges of one another any longer: but keep this in mind, that no man is to make it hard for his brother, or give him cause for doubting.

title: Romans Chapter 14 Verse 14
text: I am conscious of this, and am certain in the Lord Jesus, that nothing is unclean in itself; but for the man in whose opinion it is unclean, for him it is unclean.

title: Romans Chapter 14 Verse 15
text: And if because of food your brother is troubled, then you are no longer going on in the way of love. Do not let your food be destruction to him for whom Christ went into death.

title: Romans Chapter 14 Verse 16
text: Let it not be possible for men to say evil about your good:

title: Romans Chapter 14 Verse 17
text: For the kingdom of God is not food and drink, but righteousness and peace and joy in the Holy Spirit.

title: Romans Chapter 14 Verse 18
text: And he who in these things is Christ's servant, is pleasing to God and has the approval of men.

title: Romans Chapter 14 Verse 19
text: So then, let us go after the things which make peace, and the things by which we may be a help to one another.

title: Romans Chapter 14 Verse 20
text: Do not let the work of God come to nothing on account of food. All things are certainly clean; but it is evil for that man who by taking food makes it hard for another.

title: Romans Chapter 14 Verse 21
text: It is better not to take meat or wine or to do anything which might be a cause of trouble to your brother.

title: Romans Chapter 14 Verse 22
text: The faith which you have, have it to yourself before God. Happy is the man who is not judged by that to which he gives approval.

title: Romans Chapter 14 Verse 23
text: But he who is in doubt is judged if he takes food, because he does it not in faith; and whatever is not of faith is sin.

title: Romans Chapter 15 Verse 1
text: We who are strong have to be a support to the feeble, and not give pleasure to ourselves.

title: Romans Chapter 15 Verse 2
text: Let every one of us give pleasure to his neighbour for his good, to make him strong.

title: Romans Chapter 15 Verse 3
text: For Christ did not give pleasure to himself, but, as it is said, The bitter words of those who were angry with you came on me.

title: Romans Chapter 15 Verse 4
text: Now those things which were put down in writing before our time were for our learning, so that through quiet waiting and through the comfort of the holy Writings we might have hope.

title: Romans Chapter 15 Verse 5
text: Now may the God who gives comfort and strength in waiting make you of the same mind with one another in harmony with Christ Jesus:

title: Romans Chapter 15 Verse 6
text: So that with one mouth you may give glory to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.

title: Romans Chapter 15 Verse 7
text: So then, take one another to your hearts, as Christ took us, to the glory of God.

title: Romans Chapter 15 Verse 8
text: Now I say that Christ has been made a servant of the circumcision to give effect to the undertakings given by God to the fathers,

title: Romans Chapter 15 Verse 9
text: And so that the Gentiles might give glory to God for his mercy; as it is said, For this reason I will give praise to you among the Gentiles, and I will make a song to your name.

title: Romans Chapter 15 Verse 10
text: And again he says, Take part, you Gentiles, in the joy of his people.

title: Romans Chapter 15 Verse 11
text: And again, Give praise to the Lord, all you Gentiles; and let all the nations give praise to him.

title: Romans Chapter 15 Verse 12
text: And again Isaiah says, There will be the root of Jesse, and he who comes to be the ruler over the Gentiles; in him will the Gentiles put their hope.

title: Romans Chapter 15 Verse 13
text: Now may the God of hope make you full of joy and peace through faith, so that all hope may be yours in the power of the Holy Spirit.

title: Romans Chapter 15 Verse 14
text: And I myself am certain of you, brothers, that you are full of what is good, complete in all knowledge, able to give direction to one another.

title: Romans Chapter 15 Verse 15
text: But I have, in some measure, less fear in writing to you to put these things before you again, because of the grace which was given to me by God,

title: Romans Chapter 15 Verse 16
text: To be a servant of Christ Jesus to the Gentiles, doing the work of a priest in the good news of God, so that the offering of the Gentiles might be pleasing to God, being made holy by the Holy Spirit.

title: Romans Chapter 15 Verse 17
text: So I have pride in Christ Jesus in the things which are God's.

title: Romans Chapter 15 Verse 18
text: And I will keep myself from talking of anything but those things which Christ has done by me to put the Gentiles under his rule in word and in act,

title: Romans Chapter 15 Verse 19
text: By signs and wonders, in the power of the Holy Spirit; so that from Jerusalem and round about as far as Illyricum I have given all the good news of Christ;

title: Romans Chapter 15 Verse 20
text: Making it my purpose not to take the good news where Christ was named, so that my work might not be resting on that of others;

title: Romans Chapter 15 Verse 21
text: But as it is said in the holy Writings, They will see, to whom the news of him had not been given, and those to whose ears it had not come will have knowledge.

title: Romans Chapter 15 Verse 22
text: For which reason I was frequently kept from coming to you:

title: Romans Chapter 15 Verse 23
text: But now, having no longer any place in these parts and having had for a number of years a great desire to come to you,

title: Romans Chapter 15 Verse 24
text: Whenever I go to Spain (for it is my hope to see you on my way, and to be sent on there by you, if first I may in some measure have been comforted by your company)--

title: Romans Chapter 15 Verse 25
text: But now I go to Jerusalem, taking help for the saints.

title: Romans Chapter 15 Verse 26
text: For it has been the good pleasure of those of Macedonia and Achaia to send a certain amount of money for the poor among the saints at Jerusalem.

title: Romans Chapter 15 Verse 27
text: Yes, it has been their good pleasure; and they are in their debt. For if the Gentiles have had a part in the things of the Spirit which were theirs, it is right for them, in the same way, to give them help in the things of the flesh.

title: Romans Chapter 15 Verse 28
text: So when I have done this, and have given them this fruit of love, I will go on by you into Spain.

title: Romans Chapter 15 Verse 29
text: And I am certain that when I come, I will be full of the blessing of Christ.

title: Romans Chapter 15 Verse 30
text: Now I make request to you, brothers, by our Lord Jesus Christ, and by the love of the Spirit, that you will be working together with me in your prayers to God for me;

title: Romans Chapter 15 Verse 31
text: So that I may be kept safe from those in Judaea who have not put themselves under the rule of God, and that the help which I am taking for Jerusalem may be pleasing to the saints;

title: Romans Chapter 15 Verse 32
text: So that I may come to you in joy by the good pleasure of God, and have rest with you.

title: Romans Chapter 15 Verse 33
text: Now may the God of peace be with you all. So be it.

title: Romans Chapter 16 Verse 1
text: It is my desire to say a good word for Phoebe, who is a servant of the church in Cenchreae:

title: Romans Chapter 16 Verse 2
text: That you will take her in kindly, after the way of the saints, as one who is the Lord's, and give her help in anything in which she may have need of you: because she has been a help to a great number and to myself.

title: Romans Chapter 16 Verse 3
text: Give my love to Prisca and Aquila, workers with me in Christ Jesus,

title: Romans Chapter 16 Verse 4
text: Who for my life put their necks in danger; to whom not only I but all the churches of the Gentiles are in debt:

title: Romans Chapter 16 Verse 5
text: And say a kind word to the church which is in their house. Give my love to my dear Epaenetus, who is the first fruit of Asia to Christ.

title: Romans Chapter 16 Verse 6
text: Give my love to Mary, who gave much care to you.

title: Romans Chapter 16 Verse 7
text: Give my love to Andronicus and Junia, my relations, who were in prison with me, who are noted among the Apostles, and who were in Christ before me.

title: Romans Chapter 16 Verse 8
text: Give my love to Ampliatus, who is dear to me in the Lord,

title: Romans Chapter 16 Verse 9
text: Give my love to Urbanus, a worker in Christ with us, and to my dear Stachys.

title: Romans Chapter 16 Verse 10
text: Give my love to Apelles, who has the approval of Christ. Say a kind word to those who are of the house of Aristobulus.

title: Romans Chapter 16 Verse 11
text: Give my love to Herodion, my relation. Say a kind word to those of the house of Narcissus, who are in the Lord.

title: Romans Chapter 16 Verse 12
text: Give my love to Tryphaena and Tryphosa, workers in the Lord. Give my love to my dear Persis, who did much work in the Lord.

title: Romans Chapter 16 Verse 13
text: Give my love to Rufus, one of the Lord's selection, and to his mother and mine.

title: Romans Chapter 16 Verse 14
text: Give my love to Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermes, Patrobas, Hermas, and the brothers who are with them.

title: Romans Chapter 16 Verse 15
text: Give my love to Philologus and Julia, Nereus and his sister, and Olympas, and all the saints who are with them.

title: Romans Chapter 16 Verse 16
text: Give one another a holy kiss. All the churches of Christ send their love to you.

title: Romans Chapter 16 Verse 17
text: Now, it is my desire, brothers, that you will take note of those who are causing division and trouble among you, quite against the teaching which was given to you: and keep away from them.

title: Romans Chapter 16 Verse 18
text: For such people are not servants of the Lord Christ, but of their stomachs; and by their smooth and well-said words the hearts of those who have no knowledge of evil are tricked.

title: Romans Chapter 16 Verse 19
text: For all have knowledge of how you do what you are ordered. For this reason I have joy in you, but it is my desire that you may be wise in what is good, and without knowledge of evil.

title: Romans Chapter 16 Verse 20
text: And the God of peace will be crushing Satan under your feet before long. The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.

title: Romans Chapter 16 Verse 21
text: Timothy, who is working with me, sends his love to you, so do Lucius and Jason and Sosipater, my relations.

title: Romans Chapter 16 Verse 22
text: I, Tertius, who have done the writing of this letter, send love in the Lord.

title: Romans Chapter 16 Verse 23
text: Gaius, with whom I am living, whose house is open to all the church, sends his love, so does Erastus, the manager of the accounts of the town, and Quartus, the brother.

title: Romans Chapter 16 Verse 25
text: Now to him who is able to make you strong in agreement with the good news which I gave you and the preaching of Jesus Christ, in the light of the revelation of that secret which has been kept through times eternal,

title: Romans Chapter 16 Verse 26
text: But is now made clear; and by the writings of the prophets, by the order of the eternal God, the knowledge of it has been given to all the nations, so that they may come under the rule of the faith;

title: Romans Chapter 16 Verse 27
text: To the only wise God, through Jesus Christ, be the glory for ever. So be it.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: Paul, an Apostle of Jesus Christ by the purpose of God, and Sosthenes the brother,

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: To the church of God which is in Corinth, to those who have been made holy in Christ Jesus, saints by the selection of God, with all those who in every place give honour to the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, their Lord and ours:

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: I give praise to my God for you at all times, because of the grace of God which has been given to you in Christ Jesus;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: So that in him you have wealth in all things, in word and in knowledge of every sort;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: Even as the witness of the Christ has been made certain among you:

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: So that having every grace you are living in the hope of the revelation of our Lord Jesus Christ;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: Who will give you strength to the end, to be free from all sin in the day of our Lord Jesus Christ.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: God is true, through whom you have been given a part with his Son, Jesus Christ our Lord.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: Now I make request to you, my brothers, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that you will all say the same thing, and that there may be no divisions among you, so that you may be in complete agreement, in the same mind and in the same opinion.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: Because it has come to my knowledge, through those of the house of Chloe, that there are divisions among you, my brothers.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: That is, that some of you say, I am of Paul; some say, I am of Apollos; some say, I am of Cephas; and some say, I am Christ's.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: Is there a division in Christ? was Paul nailed to the cross for you? or were you given baptism in the name of Paul?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: I give praise to God that not one of you had baptism from me, but Crispus and Gaius;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: So that no one may be able to say that you had baptism in my name.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: And I gave baptism to the house of Stephanas; but I am not certain that any others had baptism from me.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: For Christ sent me, not to give baptism, but to be a preacher of the good news: not with wise words, for fear that the cross of Christ might be made of no value.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: For the word of the cross seems foolish to those who are on the way to destruction; but to us who are on the way to salvation it is the power of God.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 19
text: As it says in the holy Writings, I will put an end to the wisdom of the wise, and will put on one side the designs of those who have knowledge.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 20
text: Where is the wise? where is he who has knowledge of the law? where is the man of this world who has a love of discussion? has not God made foolish the wisdom of this world?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 21
text: For because, by the purpose of God, the world, with all its wisdom, had not the knowledge of God, it was God's pleasure, by so foolish a thing as preaching, to give salvation to those who had faith in him.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 22
text: Seeing that the Jews make request for signs, and the Greeks are looking for knowledge:

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 23
text: But we give the good news of Christ on the cross, a hard thing to the Jews, and a foolish thing to the Gentiles;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 24
text: But to those of God's selection, Jews and Greeks, Christ is the power and the wisdom of God.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 25
text: Because what seems foolish in God is wiser than men; and what seems feeble in God is stronger than men.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 26
text: For you see God's design for you, my brothers, that he has not taken a great number of the wise after the flesh, not the strong, not the noble:

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 27
text: But God made selection of the foolish things of this world so that he might put the wise to shame; and the feeble things that he might put to shame the strong;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 28
text: And the low things of the world, and the things without honour, did God make selection of, yes, even the things which are not, so that he might make as nothing the things which are:

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 29
text: So that no flesh might have glory before God.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 30
text: But God has given you a place in Christ Jesus, through whom God has given us wisdom and righteousness and salvation, and made us holy:

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 31
text: So that, as it is said in the holy Writings, Whoever has a desire for glory, let his glory be in the Lord.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: And when I came to you, my brothers, I did not come with wise words of knowledge, putting before you the secret of God.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: For I had made the decision to have knowledge of nothing among you but only of Jesus Christ on the cross.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: And I was with you without strength, in fear and in doubt.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: And in my preaching there were no honeyed words of wisdom, but I was dependent on the power of the Spirit to make it clear to you:

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: So that your faith might be based not on man's wisdom but on the power of God.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: But still we have wisdom for those who are complete in knowledge, though not the wisdom of this world, and not of the rulers of this world, who are coming to nothing:

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: But we give the news of the secret wisdom of God, which he had kept in store before the world came into existence, for our glory;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: Of which not one of the rulers of this world had knowledge: for if they had, they would not have put the Lord of glory on the cross:

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: But as it says in the holy Writings, Things which the eye saw not, and which had not come to the ears or into the heart of man, such things as God has made ready for those who have love for him.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: But God has given us the revelation of these things through his Spirit, for the Spirit makes search into all things, even the deep things of God.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: For who has knowledge of the things of a man but the spirit of the man which is in him? in the same way, no one has knowledge of the things of God but the Spirit of God.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: But we have not the spirit of the world, but the Spirit which comes from God, so that we may have knowledge of the things which are freely given to us by God.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: And these are the things which we say, not in the language of man's wisdom, but in words given to us by the Spirit, judging the things of the spirit by the help of the Spirit.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: For the natural man is not able to take in the things of the Spirit of God: for they seem foolish to him, and he is not able to have knowledge of them, because such knowledge comes only through the Spirit.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: But he who has the Spirit, though judging all things, is himself judged by no one.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: For who has knowledge of the mind of the Lord, so as to be his teacher? But we have the mind of Christ.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: And the teaching I gave you, my brothers, was such as I was able to give, not to those who have the Spirit, but to those who are still in the flesh, even to children in Christ.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: I gave you milk and not meat, because you were, then, unable to take it, and even now you are not able;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: Because you are still in the flesh: for when there is envy and division among you, are you not still walking after the way of the flesh, even as natural men?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: For when one says, I am of Paul; and another says, I am of Apollos; are you not talking like natural men?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: What then is Apollos? and what is Paul? They are but servants who gave you the good news as God gave it to them.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: I did the planting, Apollos did the watering, but God gave the increase.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: So then the planter is nothing, and the waterer is nothing; but God who gives the increase.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: Now the planter and the waterer are working for the same end: but they will have their separate rewards in the measure of their work.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: For we are workers with God: you are God's planting, God's building.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: In the measure of the grace given to me, I, as a wise master-builder, have put the base in position, and another goes on building on it. But let every man take care what he puts on it.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: For there is no other base for the building but that which has been put down, which is Jesus Christ.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: But on the base a man may put gold, silver, stones of great price, wood, dry grass, cut stems;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: Every man's work will be made clear in that day, because it will be tested by fire; and the fire itself will make clear the quality of every man's work.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: If any man's work comes through the test, he will have a reward.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: If the fire puts an end to any man's work, it will be his loss: but he will get salvation himself, though as by fire.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: Do you not see that you are God's holy house, and that the Spirit of God has his place in you?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: If anyone makes the house of God unclean, God will put an end to him; for the house of God is holy, and you are his house.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 18
text: Let no man have a false idea. If any man seems to himself to be wise among you, let him become foolish, so that he may be wise.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 19
text: For the wisdom of this world is foolish before God. As it is said in the holy Writings, He who takes the wise in their secret designs:

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 20
text: And again, The Lord has knowledge of the reasonings of the wise, that they are nothing.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 21
text: So let no one take pride in men. For all things are yours;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 22
text: Paul, or Apollos, or Cephas, or the world, or life, or death, or things present, or things to come; all are yours;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 23
text: And you are Christ's; and Christ is God's.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: Let us be judged as servants of Christ, and as those who are responsible for the secret things of God.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: And it is right for such servants to be safe persons.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: But it is a small thing to me that I am judged by you or by man's judging; I am not even a judge of myself.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: For I am not conscious of any wrong in myself; but this does not make me clear, for it is the Lord who is my judge.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: For this reason let there be no judging before the time, till the Lord comes, who will make clear the secret things of the dark, and the designs of the heart; and then will every man have his praise from God.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: My brothers, it is because of you that I have taken Apollos and myself as examples of these things, so that in us you might see that it is not wise to go farther than what is in the holy Writings, so that no one of you may be lifted up against his brother.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: For who made you better than your brother? or what have you that has not been given to you? but if it has been given to you, what cause have you for pride, as if it had not been given to you?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: For even now you are full, even now you have wealth, you have been made kings without us: truly, I would be glad if you were kings, so that we might be kings with you.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: For it seems to me that God has put us the Apostles last of all, as men whose fate is death: for we are put on view to the world, and to angels, and to men.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: We are made to seem foolish for Christ, but you are wise in Christ; we are feeble, but you are strong; you have glory, but we have shame.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: Even to this hour we are without food, drink, and clothing, we are given blows and have no certain resting-place;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: And with our hands we do the hardest work: when they give us curses we give blessings, when we undergo punishment we take it quietly;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: When evil things are said about us we give gentle answers: we are made as the unclean things of the world, as that for which no one has any use, even till now.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: I am not saying these things to put you to shame, but so that, as my dear children, you may see what is right.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: For even if you had ten thousand teachers in Christ, you have not more than one father: for in Christ Jesus I have given birth to you through the good news.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: So my desire is that you take me as your example.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 17
text: For this cause I have sent Timothy to you, who is my dear and true child in the Lord; he will make clear to you my ways in Christ, even as I am teaching everywhere in every church.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 18
text: Now some are full of pride, as if I was not coming to you.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 19
text: But I will come to you in a short time, if it is pleasing to the Lord, and I will take note, not of the word of those who are full of pride, but of the power.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 20
text: For the kingdom of God is not in word but in power.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 21
text: What is your desire? is my coming to be with punishment, or is it to be in love and a gentle spirit?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: It is said, in fact, that there is among you a sin of the flesh, such as is not seen even among the Gentiles, that one of you has his father's wife.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: And in place of feeling sorrow, you are pleased with yourselves, so that he who has done this thing has not been sent away from among you.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: For I myself, being present in spirit though not in body, have come to a decision about him who has done this thing;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: In the name of our Lord Jesus, when you have come together with my spirit, with the power of our Lord Jesus,

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: That this man is to be handed over to Satan for the destruction of the flesh, so that his spirit may have forgiveness in the day of the Lord Jesus.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: This pride of yours is not good. Do you not see that a little leaven makes a change in all the mass?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: Take away, then, the old leaven, so that you may be a new mass, even as you are without leaven. For Christ has been put to death as our Passover.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: Let us then keep the feast, not with old leaven, and not with the leaven of evil thoughts and acts, but with the unleavened bread of true thoughts and right feelings.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: In my letter I said to you that you were not to keep company with those who go after the desires of the flesh;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: But I had not in mind the sinners who are outside the church, or those who have a desire for and take the property of others, or those who give worship to images; for it is not possible to keep away from such people without going out of the world completely:

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: But the sense of my letter was that if a brother had the name of being one who went after the desires of the flesh, or had the desire for other people's property, or was in the way of using violent language, or being the worse for drink, or took by force what was not his, you might not keep company with such a one, or take food with him.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: For it is no business of mine to be judging those who are outside; but it is yours to be judging those who are among you;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: As for those who are outside, God is their judge. So put away the evil man from among you.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: How is it, that if any one of you has a cause at law against another, he takes it before a Gentile judge and not before the saints?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: Is it not certain that the saints will be the judges of the world? if then the world will be judged by you, are you unable to give a decision about the smallest things?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: Is it not certain that we are to be the judges of angels? how much more then of the things of this life?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: If then there are questions to be judged in connection with the things of this life, why do you put them in the hands of those who have no position in the church?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: I say this to put you to shame. Is there not among you one wise man who may be able to give a decision between his brothers?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: But a brother who has a cause at law against another takes it before Gentile judges.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: More than this, it is not to your credit to have causes at law with one another at all. Why not put up with wrong? why not undergo loss?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: So far from doing this, you yourselves do wrong and take your brothers' property.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: Have you not knowledge that evil-doers will have no part in the kingdom of God? Have no false ideas about this: no one who goes after the desires of the flesh, or gives worship to images, or is untrue when married, or is less than a man, or makes a wrong use of men,

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: Or is a thief, or the worse for drink, or makes use of strong language, or takes by force what is not his, will have any part in the kingdom of God.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: And such were some of you; but you have been washed, you have been made holy, you have been given righteousness in the name of the Lord Jesus Christ and in the Spirit of our God.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 12
text: I am free to do all things; but not all things are wise. I am free to do all things; but I will not let myself come under the power of any.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 13
text: Food is for the stomach and the stomach for food, and God will put an end to them together. But the body is not for the desires of the flesh, but for the Lord; and the Lord for the body:

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 14
text: And God who made the Lord Jesus come back from the dead will do the same for us by his power.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 15
text: Do you not see that your bodies are part of the body of Christ? how then may I take what is a part of the body of Christ and make it a part of the body of a loose woman? such a thing may not be.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 16
text: Or do you not see that he who is joined to a loose woman is one body with her? for God has said, The two of them will become one flesh.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 17
text: But he who is united to the Lord is one spirit.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 18
text: Keep away from the desires of the flesh. Every sin which a man does is outside of the body; but he who goes after the desires of the flesh does evil to his body.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 19
text: Or are you not conscious that your body is a house for the Holy Spirit which is in you, and which has been given to you by God? and you are not the owners of yourselves;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 20
text: For a payment has been made for you: let God be honoured in your body.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: Now, as to the things in your letter to me: It is good for a man to have nothing to do with a woman.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: But because of the desires of the flesh, let every man have his wife, and every woman her husband.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: Let the husband give to the wife what is right; and let the wife do the same to the husband.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: The wife has not power over her body, but the husband; and in the same way the husband has not power over his body, but the wife.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: Do not keep back from one another what is right, but only for a short time, and by agreement, so that you may give yourselves to prayer, and come together again; so that Satan may not get the better of you through your loss of self-control.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: But this I say as my opinion, and not as an order of the Lord.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: It is my desire that all men might be even as I am. But every man has the power of his special way of life given him by God, one in this way and one in that.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: But I say to the unmarried and to the widows, It is good for them to be even as I am.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 9
text: But if they have not self-control let them get married; for married life is better than the burning of desire.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 10
text: But to the married I give orders, though not I but the Lord, that the wife may not go away from her husband

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 11
text: (Or if she goes away from him, let her keep unmarried, or be united to her husband again); and that the husband may not go away from his wife.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 12
text: But to the rest I say, and not the Lord; If a brother has a wife who is not a Christian, and it is her desire to go on living with him, let him not go away from her.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 13
text: And if a woman has a husband who is not a Christian, and it is his desire to go on living with her, let her not go away from her husband.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 14
text: For the husband who has not faith is made holy through his Christian wife, and the wife who is not a Christian is made holy through the brother: if not, your children would be unholy, but now are they holy.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 15
text: But if the one who is not a Christian has a desire to go away, let it be so: the brother or the sister in such a position is not forced to do one thing or the other: but it is God's pleasure that we may be at peace with one another.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 16
text: For how may you be certain, O wife, that you will not be the cause of salvation to your husband? or you, O husband, that you may not do the same for your wife?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 17
text: Only, as the Lord has given to a man, and as is the purpose of God for him, so let him go on living. And these are my orders for all the churches.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 18
text: If any man who is a Christian has had circumcision, let him keep so; and if any man who is a Christian has not had circumcision, let him make no change.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 19
text: Circumcision is nothing, and its opposite is nothing, but only doing the orders of God is of value.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 20
text: Let every man keep the position in which he has been placed by God.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 21
text: If you were a servant when you became a Christian, let it not be a grief to you; but if you have a chance to become free, make use of it.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 22
text: For he who was a servant when he became a Christian is the Lord's free man; and he who was free when he became a Christian is the Lord's servant.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 23
text: It is the Lord who has made payment for you: be not servants of men.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 24
text: My brothers, let every man keep in that condition which is the purpose of God for him.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 25
text: Now about virgins I have no orders from the Lord: but I give my opinion as one to whom the Lord has given mercy to be true to him.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 26
text: In my opinion then, because of the present trouble, it is good for a man to keep as he is.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 27
text: If you are married to a wife, make no attempt to get free from her: if you are free from a wife, do not take a wife.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 28
text: If you get married it is not a sin; and if an unmarried woman gets married it is not a sin. But those who do so will have trouble in the flesh. But I will not be hard on you.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 29
text: But I say this, my brothers, the time is short; and from now it will be wise for those who have wives to be as if they had them not;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 30
text: And for those who are in sorrow, to give no signs of it; and for those who are glad, to give no signs of joy; and for those who are getting property, to be as if they had nothing;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 31
text: And for those who make use of the world, not to be using it fully; for this world's way of life will quickly come to an end.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 32
text: But it is my desire for you to be free from cares. The unmarried man gives his mind to the things of the Lord, how he may give pleasure to the Lord:

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 33
text: But the married man gives his attention to the things of this world, how he may give pleasure to his wife.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 34
text: And the wife is not the same as the virgin. The virgin gives her mind to the things of the Lord, so that she may be holy in body and in spirit: but the married woman takes thought for the things of the world, how she may give pleasure to her husband.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 35
text: Now I say this for your profit; not to make things hard for you, but because of what is right, and so that you may be able to give all your attention to the things of the Lord.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 36
text: But if, in any man's opinion, he is not doing what is right for his virgin, if she is past her best years, and there is need for it, let him do what seems right to him; it is no sin; let them be married.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 37
text: But the man who is strong in mind and purpose, who is not forced but has control over his desires, does well if he comes to the decision to keep her a virgin.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 38
text: So then, he who gets married to his virgin does well, and he who keeps her unmarried does better.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 39
text: It is right for a wife to be with her husband as long as he is living; but when her husband is dead, she is free to be married to another; but only to a Christian.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 40
text: But it will be better for her to keep as she is, in my opinion: and it seems to me that I have the Spirit of God.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 1
text: Now about things offered to images: we all seem to ourselves to have knowledge. Knowledge gives pride, but love gives true strength.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 2
text: If anyone seems to himself to have knowledge, so far he has not the right sort of knowledge about anything;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 3
text: But if anyone has love for God, God has knowledge of him.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 4
text: So, then, as to the question of taking food offered to images, we are certain that an image is nothing in the world, and that there is no God but one.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 5
text: For though there are those who have the name of gods, in heaven or on earth, as there are a number of gods and a number of lords,

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 6
text: There is for us only one God, the Father, of whom are all things, and we are for him; and one Lord, Jesus Christ, through whom are all things, and we have our being through him.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 7
text: Still, all men have not that knowledge: but some, being used till now to the image, are conscious that they are taking food which has been offered to the image; and because they are not strong in the faith, their minds are troubled.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 8
text: But God's approval of us is not based on the food we take: if we do not take it we are no worse for it; and if we take it we are no better.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 9
text: But take care that this power of yours does not give cause for trouble to the feeble.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 10
text: For if a man sees you, who have knowledge, taking food as a guest in the house of an image, will it not give him, if he is feeble, the idea that he may take food offered to images?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 11
text: And so, through your knowledge, you are the cause of destruction to your brother, for whom Christ underwent death.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 12
text: And in this way, doing evil to the brothers, and causing trouble to those whose faith is feeble, you are sinning against Christ.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 13
text: For this reason, if food is a cause of trouble to my brother, I will give up taking meat for ever, so that I may not be a cause of trouble to my brother.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 1
text: Am I not free? am I not an Apostle? have I not seen Jesus our Lord? are you not my work in the Lord?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 2
text: If to others I am not an Apostle, at least I am one to you: for the fact that you are Christians is the sign that I am an Apostle.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 3
text: My answer to those who are judging me is this.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 4
text: Have we no right to take food and drink?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 5
text: Have we no right to take about with us a Christian wife, like the rest of the Apostles, and the brothers of the Lord, and Cephas?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 6
text: Or I only and Barnabas, have we no right to take a rest from work?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 7
text: Who ever goes to war without looking to someone to be responsible for his payment? who puts in vines and does not take the fruit of them? or who takes care of sheep without drinking of their milk?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 8
text: Am I talking as a man? does not the law say the same?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 9
text: For it says in the law of Moses, It is not right to keep the ox from taking the grain when he is crushing it. Is it for the oxen that God is giving orders?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 10
text: Or has he us in mind? Yes, it was said for us; because it is right for the ploughman to do his ploughing in hope, and for him who is crushing the grain to do his work hoping for a part in the fruits of it.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 11
text: If we have been planting the things of the Spirit for you, does it seem a great thing for you to give us a part in your things of this world?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 12
text: If others have a part in this right over you, have we not even more? But we did not make use of our right, so that we might put nothing in the way of the good news of Christ.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 13
text: Do you not see that the servants of the holy things get their living from the Temple, and the servants of the altar have their part in the food which is offered on the altar?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 14
text: Even so did the Lord give orders that the preachers of the good news might get their living from the good news.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 15
text: But I have not made use of any of these things: and I am not writing this in the hope that it may be so for me: for it would be better for me to undergo death, than for any man to make this pride of mine of no effect.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 16
text: For if I am a preacher of the good news, I have no cause for pride in this; because I am forced to do so, for a curse is on me if I do not.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 17
text: But if I do it gladly, I have a reward; and if not, I am under orders to do it.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 18
text: What then is my reward? This, that when I am giving the good news, I may give it without payment, not making use of my rights as a preacher of the good news.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 19
text: For though I was free from all men, I made myself a servant to all, so that more might have salvation.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 20
text: And to the Jews I was as a Jew, so that I might give the good news to them; to those under the law I was the same, not as being myself under the law, but so that I might give the good news to those under the law.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 21
text: To those without the law I was as one without the law, not as being without law to God, but as under law to Christ, so that I might give the good news to those without the law.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 22
text: To the feeble, I was as one who is feeble, so that they might have salvation: I have been all things to all men, so that some at least might have salvation.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 23
text: And I do all things for the cause of the good news, so that I may have a part in it.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 24
text: Do you not see that in a running competition all take part, but only one gets the reward? So let your minds be fixed on the reward.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 25
text: And every man who takes part in the sports has self-control in all things. Now they do it to get a crown which is of this world, but we for an eternal crown.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 26
text: So then I am running, not uncertainly; so I am fighting, not as one who gives blows in the air:

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 27
text: But I give blows to my body, and keep it under control, for fear that, after having given the good news to others, I myself might not have God's approval.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 1
text: For it is my desire, my brothers, that you may keep in mind how all our fathers were under the cloud, and they all went through the sea;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 2
text: And they all had baptism from Moses in the cloud and in the sea;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 3
text: And they all took the same holy food;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 4
text: And the same holy drink: for they all took of the water from the holy rock which came after them: and the rock was Christ.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 5
text: But with most of them God was not pleased: for they came to their end in the waste land.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 6
text: Now these things were for an example to us, so that our hearts might not go after evil things, as they did.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 7
text: Then do not go after false gods, as some of them did; as it is said in the holy Writings, After resting and feasting, the people got up to take their pleasure.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 8
text: Again, let us not give way to the desires of the flesh, as some of them did, of whom twenty-three thousand came to their end in one day.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 9
text: And let us not put the Lord to the test, as some of them did, and came to their death by snakes.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 10
text: And do not say evil things against the Lord, as some of them did, and destruction overtook them.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 11
text: Now these things were done as an example; and were put down in writing for our teaching, on whom the last days have come.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 12
text: So let him who seems to himself to be safe go in fear of a fall.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 13
text: You have been put to no test but such as is common to man: and God is true, who will not let any test come on you which you are not able to undergo; but he will make with the test a way out of it, so that you may be able to go through it.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 14
text: For this cause, my dear brothers, give no worship to false gods.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 15
text: What I am saying is for wise men, do you be the judges of it.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 16
text: The cup of blessing which we take, does it not give us a part in the blood of Christ? and is not the broken bread a taking part in the body of Christ?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 17
text: Because we, being a number of persons, are one bread, we are one body: for we all take part in the one bread.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 18
text: See Israel after the flesh: do not those who take as food the offerings of the altar take a part in the altar?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 19
text: Do I say, then, that what is offered to images is anything, or that the image is anything?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 20
text: What I say is that the things offered by the Gentiles are offered to evil spirits and not to God; and it is not my desire for you to have any part with evil spirits.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 21
text: It is not possible for you, at the same time, to take the cup of the Lord and the cup of evil spirits; you may not take part in the table of the Lord and the table of evil spirits.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 22
text: Or may we be the cause of envy to the Lord? are we stronger than he?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 23
text: We are free to do all things, but there are things which it is not wise to do. We are free to do all things, but not all things are for the common good.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 24
text: Let a man give attention not only to what is good for himself, but equally to his neighbour's good.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 25
text: Whatever meat may be had at the public market, take as food without question of right or wrong;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 26
text: For the earth is the Lord's and all things in it.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 27
text: If a Gentile makes a feast for you, and you are pleased to go as a guest, take whatever is put before you, without question of right or wrong.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 28
text: But if anyone says to you, This food has been used as an offering, do not take it, on account of him who said it, and on account of his sense of right and wrong:

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 29
text: Right and wrong, I say, not for you, but for the other man; for the fact that I am free is not dependent on another man's sense of right or wrong.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 30
text: But if I give praise to God for the food which I take, let no man say evil of me for that reason.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 31
text: So then, if it is a question of food or drink, or any other thing, whatever you do, do all to the glory of God.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 32
text: Give no cause of trouble to Jews, or to Greeks, or to the church of God.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 33
text: Even as I give way to all men in all things, not looking for profit for myself, but for the good of others, that they may get salvation.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 1
text: So take me for your example, even as I take Christ for mine.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 2
text: Now I am pleased to see that you keep me in memory in all things, and that you give attention to the teaching which was handed down from me to you.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 3
text: But it is important for you to keep this fact in mind, that the head of every man is Christ; and the head of the woman is the man, and the head of Christ is God.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 4
text: Every man who takes part in prayer, or gives teaching as a prophet, with his head covered, puts shame on his head.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 5
text: But every woman who does so with her head unveiled, puts shame on her head: for it is the same as if her hair was cut off.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 6
text: For if a woman is not veiled, let her hair be cut off; but if it is a shame to a woman to have her hair cut off, let her be veiled.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 7
text: For it is not right for a man to have his head covered, because he is the image and glory of God: but the woman is the glory of the man.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 8
text: For the man did not come from the woman, but the woman from the man.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 9
text: And the man was not made for the woman, but the woman for the man.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 10
text: For this reason it is right for the woman to have a sign of authority on her head, because of the angels.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 11
text: But the woman is not separate from the man, and the man is not separate from the woman in the Lord.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 12
text: For as the woman is from the man, so the man is through the woman; but all things are from God.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 13
text: Be judges yourselves of the question: does it seem right for a woman to take part in prayer unveiled?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 14
text: Does it not seem natural to you that if a man has long hair, it is a cause of shame to him?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 15
text: But if a woman has long hair, it is a glory to her: for her hair is given to her for a covering.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 16
text: But if any man will not be ruled in this question, this is not our way of doing things, and it is not done in the churches of God.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 17
text: But in giving you this order, there is one thing about which I am not pleased: it is that when you come together it is not for the better but for the worse.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 18
text: For first of all, it has come to my ears that when you come together in the church, there are divisions among you, and I take the statement to be true in part.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 19
text: For divisions are necessary among you, in order that those who have God's approval may be clearly seen among you.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 20
text: But now, when you come together, it is not possible to take the holy meal of the Lord:

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 21
text: For when you take your food, everyone takes his meal before the other; and one has not enough food, and another is the worse for drink.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 22
text: What? have you not houses to take your meals in? or have you no respect for the church of God, putting the poor to shame? What am I to say to you? am I to give you praise? certainly not.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 23
text: For it was handed down to me from the Lord, as I gave it to you, that the Lord Jesus, on the night when Judas was false to him, took bread,

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 24
text: And when it had been broken with an act of praise, he said, This is my body which is for you: do this in memory of me.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 25
text: In the same way, with the cup, after the meal, he said, This cup is the new testament in my blood: do this, whenever you take it, in memory of me.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 26
text: For whenever you take the bread and the cup you give witness to the Lord's death till he comes.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 27
text: If, then, anyone takes the bread or the cup of the Lord in the wrong spirit, he will be responsible for the body and blood of the Lord.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 28
text: But let no man take of the bread and the cup without testing himself.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 29
text: For a man puts himself in danger, if he takes part in the holy meal without being conscious that it is the Lord's body.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 30
text: For this cause a number of you are feeble and ill, and a number are dead.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 31
text: But if we were true judges of ourselves, punishment would not come on us.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 32
text: But if punishment does come, it is sent by the Lord, so that we may be safe when the world is judged.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 33
text: So then, my brothers, when you come together to the holy meal of the Lord, let there be waiting for one another.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 34
text: If any man is in need of food, let him take his meal in his house; so that you may not come together to your damage. And the rest I will put in order when I come.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 1
text: But about the things of the spirit, my brothers, it is not right for you to be without teaching.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 2
text: You are conscious that when you were Gentiles, in whatever way you were guided, you went after images without voice or power.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 3
text: So it is my desire for you to be clear about this; that no one is able to say by the Spirit of God that Jesus is cursed; and no one is able to say that Jesus is Lord, but by the Holy Spirit.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 4
text: Now there are different qualities given to men, but the same Spirit.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 5
text: And there are different sorts of servants, but the same Lord.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 6
text: And there are different operations, but the same God, who is working all things in all.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 7
text: But to every man some form of the Spirit's working is given for the common good.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 8
text: For to one are given words of wisdom through the Spirit; and to another words of knowledge through the same Spirit:

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 9
text: To another faith in the same Spirit; and to another the power of taking away disease, by the one Spirit;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 10
text: And to another the power of working wonders; and to another the prophet's word; and to another the power of testing spirits; to another different sorts of tongues; and to another the power of making clear the sense of the tongues:

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 11
text: But all these are the operations of the one and the same Spirit, giving to every man separately as his pleasure is.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 12
text: For as the body is one, and has a number of parts, and all the parts make one body, so is Christ.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 13
text: For through the baptism of the one Spirit we were all formed into one body, Jews or Greeks, servants or free men, and were all made full of the same Spirit.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 14
text: For the body is not one part, but a number of parts.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 15
text: If the foot says, Because I am not the hand, I am not a part of the body; it is no less a part of the body.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 16
text: And if the ear says, Because I am not the eye, I am not a part of the body; it is a part of the body all the same.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 17
text: If all the body was an eye, where would be the hearing? if all was hearing, where would be the smelling?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 18
text: But now God has put every one of the parts in the body as it was pleasing to him.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 19
text: And if they were all one part, where would the body be?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 20
text: But now they are all different parts, but one body.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 21
text: And the eye may not say to the hand, I have no need of you: or again the head to the feet, I have no need of you.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 22
text: No, those parts which seem to be feeble are the more necessary;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 23
text: And to those parts of the body which seem to have less honour we give all the more honour; and to those parts of the body which are a cause of shame to us we give the greater respect;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 24
text: But those parts of the body which are beautiful have no need of such care: and so the body has been joined together by God in such a way as to give more honour to those parts which had need of it;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 25
text: So that there might be no division in the body; but all the parts might have the same care for one another.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 26
text: And if there is pain in one part of the body, all the parts will be feeling it; or if one part is honoured, all the parts will be glad.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 27
text: Now you are the body of Christ, and every one of you the separate parts of it.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 28
text: And God has put some in the church, first, Apostles; second, prophets; third, teachers; then those with wonder-working powers, then those with the power of taking away disease, helpers, wise guides, users of strange tongues.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 29
text: Are all Apostles? are all prophets? are all teachers? have all the power of working wonders?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 30
text: Are all able to take away disease? have all the power of tongues? are all able to give their sense?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 31
text: But let your desires be turned to the more important things given by the Spirit. And now I am pointing out to you an even better way.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 13 Verse 1
text: If I make use of the tongues of men and of angels, and have not love, I am like sounding brass, or a loud-tongued bell.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 13 Verse 2
text: And if I have a prophet's power, and have knowledge of all secret things; and if I have all faith, by which mountains may be moved from their place, but have not love, I am nothing.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 13 Verse 3
text: And if I give all my goods to the poor, and if I give my body to be burned, but have not love, it is of no profit to me.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 13 Verse 4
text: Love is never tired of waiting; love is kind; love has no envy; love has no high opinion of itself, love has no pride;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 13 Verse 5
text: Love's ways are ever fair, it takes no thought for itself; it is not quickly made angry, it takes no account of evil;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 13 Verse 6
text: It takes no pleasure in wrongdoing, but has joy in what is true;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 13 Verse 7
text: Love has the power of undergoing all things, having faith in all things, hoping all things.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 13 Verse 8
