text: Though the prophet's word may come to an end, tongues come to nothing, and knowledge have no more value, love has no end.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 13 Verse 9
text: For our knowledge is only in part, and the prophet's word gives only a part of what is true:

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 13 Verse 10
text: But when that which is complete is come, then that which is in part will be no longer necessary.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 13 Verse 11
text: When I was a child, I made use of a child's language, I had a child's feelings and a child's thoughts: now that I am a man, I have put away the things of a child.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 13 Verse 12
text: For now we see things in a glass, darkly; but then face to face: now my knowledge is in part; then it will be complete, even as God's knowledge of me.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 13 Verse 13
text: But now we still have faith, hope, love, these three; and the greatest of these is love.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 1
text: Go after love; still desiring to have the things which the Spirit gives, but most of all that you may have the prophet's power.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 2
text: For he who makes use of tongues is not talking to men but to God; because no one has the sense of what he is saying; but in the Spirit he is talking of secret things.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 3
text: But the word of the prophet gives men knowledge and comfort and strength.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 4
text: He who makes use of tongues may do good to himself; but he who gives the prophet's word does good to the church.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 5
text: Now though it is my desire for you all to have the power of tongues, it would give me more pleasure to be hearing the prophet's word from you; for this is a greater thing than using tongues, if the sense is not given at the same time, for the good of the church.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 6
text: But, now, my brothers, if I come to you using tongues, what profit will it be to you, if I do not give you a revelation, or knowledge, or the word of the prophet, or teaching?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 7
text: Even things without life, having a voice, such as a music-pipe or other instrument, if they do not give out different sounds, who may be certain what is being played?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 8
text: For if the war-horn gives out an uncertain note, who will get ready for the fight?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 9
text: So if you, in using a strange tongue, say words which have no sense, how will anyone take in what you are saying? for you will be talking to the air.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 10
text: There are, it may be, a number of different voices in the world, and no voice is without sense.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 11
text: But if the sense of the voice is not clear to me, I am like a man from a strange country to him who is talking, and he will be the same to me.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 12
text: So if you are desiring the things which the Spirit gives, let your minds be turned first to the things which are for the good of the church.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 13
text: For this reason, let the man who has the power of using tongues make request that he may, at the same time, be able to give the sense.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 14
text: For if I make use of tongues in my prayers, my spirit makes the prayer, but not my mind.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 15
text: What then? let my prayer be from the spirit, and equally from the mind; let my song be from the spirit, and equally from mind.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 16
text: For if you give a blessing with the spirit, how will the man who has no knowledge say, So be it, after your prayer, seeing that he has not taken in what you are saying?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 17
text: For your giving of the blessing is certainly well done, but of no profit to the man without knowledge.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 18
text: I give praise to God that I am able to make use of tongues more than you all:

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 19
text: But in the church it would be better for me to make use of five words of which the sense was clear, so that others might have profit, than ten thousand words in a strange tongue.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 20
text: My brothers, do not be children in mind: in evil be as little children, but in mind be of full growth.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 21
text: In the law it is said, By men of other tongues and by strange lips will my words come to this people; and not even so will they give ear to me, says the Lord.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 22
text: For this reason tongues are for a sign, not to those who have faith, but to those who have not: but the prophet's word is for those who have faith, and not for the rest who have not.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 23
text: If, then, the church has come together, and all are using tongues, and there come in men without knowledge or faith, will they not say that you are unbalanced?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 24
text: But if all are teaching as prophets, and a man without faith or knowledge comes in, he is tested by all, he is judged by all;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 25
text: The secrets of his heart are made clear; and he will go down on his face and give worship to God, saying that God is truly among you.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 26
text: What is it then, my brothers? when you come together everyone has a holy song, or a revelation, or a tongue, or is giving the sense of it. Let everything be done for the common good.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 27
text: If any man makes use of a tongue, let it not be more than two, or at the most three, and in turn; and let someone give the sense:

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 28
text: But if there is no one to give the sense, let him keep quiet in the church; and let his words be to himself and to God.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 29
text: And let the prophets give their words, but not more than two or three, and let the others be judges of what they say.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 30
text: But if a revelation is given to another who is seated near, let the first be quiet.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 31
text: For you may all be prophets in turn so that all may get knowledge and comfort;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 32
text: And the spirits of the prophets are controlled by the prophets;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 33
text: For God is not a God whose ways are without order, but a God of peace; as in all the churches of the saints.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 34
text: Let women keep quiet in the churches: for it is not right for them to be talking; but let them be under control, as it says in the law.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 35
text: And if they have a desire for knowledge about anything, let them put questions to their husbands privately: for talking in the church puts shame on a woman.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 36
text: What? was it from you that the word of God went out? or did it only come in to you?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 37
text: If any man seems to himself to be a prophet or to have the Spirit, let him take note of the things which I am writing to you, as being the word of the Lord.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 38
text: But if any man is without knowledge, let him be so.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 39
text: So then, my brothers, let it be your chief desire to be prophets; but let no one be stopped from using tongues.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Verse 40
text: Let all things be done in the right and ordered way.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 1
text: Now I am going to make clear to you, my brothers, what the good news was which I gave to you, and which you took, and on which your faith is based,

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 2
text: By which you have salvation; that is to say, the form in which it was given to you, if it is fixed in your minds, and if your faith in it is not without effect.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 3
text: For I gave to you first of all what was handed down to me, how Christ underwent death for our sins, as it says in the Writings;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 4
text: And he was put in the place of the dead; and on the third day he came back from the dead, as it says in the Writings;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 5
text: And he was seen by Cephas; then by the twelve;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 6
text: Then by more than five hundred brothers at the same time, most of whom are still living, but some are sleeping;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 7
text: Then he was seen by James; then by all the Apostles.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 8
text: And last of all, as by one whose birth was out of the right time, he was seen by me.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 9
text: For I am the least of the Apostles, having no right to be named an Apostle, because of my cruel attacks on the church of God.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 10
text: But by the grace of God, I am what I am: and his grace which was given to me has not been for nothing; for I did more work than all of them; though not I, but the grace of God which was with me.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 11
text: If then it is I who am the preacher, or they, this is our word, and to this you have given your faith.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 12
text: Now if the good news says that Christ came back from the dead, how do some of you say that there is no coming back from the dead?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 13
text: But if there is no coming back from the dead, then Christ has not come back from the dead:

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 14
text: And if Christ did not come again from the dead, then our good news and your faith in it are of no effect.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 15
text: Yes, and we are seen to be false witnesses of God; because we gave witness of God that by his power Christ came again from the dead: which is not true if there is no coming back from the dead.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 16
text: For if it is not possible for the dead to come to life again, then Christ has not come to life again:

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 17
text: And if that is so, your faith is of no effect; you are still in your sins.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 18
text: And, in addition, the dead in Christ have gone to destruction.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 19
text: If in this life only we have hope in Christ, we are of all men most unhappy.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 20
text: But now Christ has truly come back from the dead, the first-fruits of those who are sleeping.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 21
text: For as by man came death, so by man there is a coming back from the dead.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 22
text: For as in Adam death comes to all, so in Christ will all come back to life.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 23
text: But every man in his right order: Christ the first-fruits; then those who are Christ's at his coming.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 24
text: Then comes the end, when he will give up the kingdom to God, even the Father; when he will have put an end to all rule and to all authority and power.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 25
text: For his rule will go on till he has put all those who are against him under his feet.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 26
text: The last power to come to an end is death.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 27
text: For, as it says, He has put all things under his feet. But when he says, All things are put under him, it is clear that it is not said about him who put all things under him.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 28
text: And when all things have been put under him, then will the Son himself be under him who put all things under him, so that God may be all in all.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 29
text: Again, what will they do who are given baptism for the dead? if the dead do not come back at all, why are people given baptism for them?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 30
text: And why are we in danger every hour?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 31
text: Yes, truly, by your pride in me, my brothers in Christ Jesus our Lord, my life is one long death.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 32
text: If, after the way of men, I was fighting with beasts at Ephesus, what profit is it to me? If the dead do not come to life again, let us take our pleasure in feasting, for tomorrow we come to an end.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 33
text: Do not be tricked by false words: evil company does damage to good behaviour.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 34
text: Be awake to righteousness and keep yourselves from sin; for some have no knowledge of God: I say this to put you to shame.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 35
text: But someone will say, How do the dead come back? and with what sort of body do they come?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 36
text: Foolish man, it is necessary for the seed which you put into the earth to undergo death in order that it may come to life again:

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 37
text: And when you put it into the earth, you do not put in the body which it will be, but only the seed, of grain or some other sort of plant;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 38
text: But God gives it a body, as it is pleasing to him, and to every seed its special body.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 39
text: All flesh is not the same flesh: but there is one flesh of men, another of beasts, another of birds, and another of fishes.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 40
text: And there are bodies of heaven and bodies of earth, but the glory of the one is different from that of the other.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 41
text: There is one glory of the sun, and another glory of the moon, and another glory of the stars; for the glory of one star is different from that of another.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 42
text: So is it with the coming back from the dead. It is planted in death; it comes again in life:

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 43
text: It is planted in shame; it comes again in glory: feeble when it is planted, it comes again in power:

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 44
text: It is planted a natural body; it comes again as a body of the spirit. If there is a natural body, there is equally a body of the spirit.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 45
text: And so it is said, The first man Adam was a living soul. The last Adam is a life-giving spirit.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 46
text: But that which is natural comes before that which is of the spirit.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 47
text: The first man is from the earth, and of the earth: the second man is from heaven.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 48
text: Those who are of the earth are like the man who was from the earth: and those who are of heaven are like the one from heaven.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 49
text: And in the same way as we have taken on us the image of the man from the earth, so we will take on us the image of the one from heaven.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 50
text: Now I say this, my brothers, that it is not possible for flesh and blood to have a part in the kingdom of God; and death may not have a part in life.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 51
text: See, I am giving you the revelation of a secret: we will not all come to the sleep of death, but we will all be changed.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 52
text: In a second, in the shutting of an eye, at the sound of the last horn: for at that sound the dead will come again, free for ever from the power of death, and we will be changed.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 53
text: For this body which comes to destruction will be made free from the power of death, and the man who is under the power of death will put on eternal life.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 54
text: But when this has taken place, then that which was said in the Writings will come true, Death is overcome by life.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 55
text: O death, where is your power? O death, where are your pains?

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 56
text: The pain of death is sin; and the power of sin is the law:

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 57
text: But praise be to God who gives us strength to overcome through our Lord Jesus Christ.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Verse 58
text: For this cause, my dear brothers, be strong in purpose and unmoved, ever giving yourselves to the work of the Lord, because you are certain that your work is not without effect in the Lord.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 16 Verse 1
text: Now about the giving of money for the saints, as I gave orders to the churches of Galatia, so do you.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 16 Verse 2
text: On the first day of the week, let every one of you put by him in store, in measure as he has done well in business, so that it may not be necessary to get money together when I come.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 16 Verse 3
text: And when I come, I will send the men of your selection with letters to take the money you have got together to Jerusalem.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 16 Verse 4
text: And if it is possible for me to go there, they will go with me.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 16 Verse 5
text: But I will come to you after I have gone through Macedonia, for that is my purpose;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 16 Verse 6
text: But I may be with you for a time, or even for the winter, so that you may see me on my way, wherever I go.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 16 Verse 7
text: For it is not my desire to see you now, on my way; because it is my hope to be with you for some time, if that is the Lord's pleasure.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 16 Verse 8
text: But I will be at Ephesus till Pentecost;

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 16 Verse 9
text: For a great and important door there is open to me, and there are a number of people against me.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 16 Verse 10
text: Now if Timothy comes, see that he is with you without fear; because he is doing the Lord's work, even as I am:

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 16 Verse 11
text: See then that he has the honour which is right. But send him on his way in peace, so that he may come to me: for I am looking for him with the brothers.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 16 Verse 12
text: But as for Apollos, the brother, I had a great desire for him to come to you with the brothers, but it was not his pleasure to come now; but he will come when he has a chance.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 16 Verse 13
text: Be on the watch, unmoved in the faith, and be strong like men.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 16 Verse 14
text: Let all you do be done in love.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 16 Verse 15
text: Now I make my request to you, my brothers, for you have knowledge that the house of Stephanas is the first-fruits of Achaia, and that they have made themselves the servants of the saints,

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 16 Verse 16
text: That you put yourselves under such, and under everyone who is helping the Lord's work.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 16 Verse 17
text: And I am glad of the coming of Stephanas and Fortunatus and Achaicus: for they have done what was needed to make your work complete.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 16 Verse 18
text: For they gave comfort to my spirit and to yours: for which cause give respect to such people.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 16 Verse 19
text: The churches of Asia send their love to you. So do Aquila and Prisca, with the church which is in their house.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 16 Verse 20
text: All the brothers send their love to you. Give one another a holy kiss.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 16 Verse 21
text: I, Paul, send you these words of love in my writing.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 16 Verse 22
text: If any man has not love for the Lord, let him be cursed. Maran atha (our Lord comes).

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 16 Verse 23
text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.

title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 16 Verse 24
text: My love be with you all in Christ Jesus. So be it.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: Paul, an Apostle of Jesus Christ by the purpose of God, and Timothy the brother, to the church of God which is in Corinth, with all the saints who are in all Achaia:

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: Praise be to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies and the God of all comfort;

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: Who gives us comfort in all our troubles, so that we may be able to give comfort to others who are in trouble, through the comfort with which we ourselves are comforted by God.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: For as we undergo more of the pain which Christ underwent, so through Christ does our comfort become greater.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: But if we are troubled, it is for your comfort and salvation; or if we are comforted, it is for your comfort, which takes effect through your quiet undergoing of the same troubles which we undergo:

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: And our hope for you is certain; in the knowledge that as you take part in the troubles, so you will take part in the comfort.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: For it is our desire that you may not be without knowledge of our trouble which came on us in Asia, that the weight of it was very great, more than our power, so that it seemed that we had no hope even of life:

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: Yes, we ourselves have had the answer of death in ourselves, so that our hope might not be in ourselves, but in God who is able to give life to the dead:

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: Who gave us salvation from so great a death: on whom we have put our hope that he will still go on to give us salvation;

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: You at the same time helping together by your prayer for us; so that for what has been given to us through a number of persons, praise may go up to God for us from all of them.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: For our glory is in this, in the knowledge which we have that our way of life in the world, and most of all in relation to you, has been holy and true in the eyes of God; not in the wisdom of the flesh, but in the grace of God.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: For in our letters we say no other things to you, but those which you are reading, and to which you give agreement, and, it is my hope, will go on doing so to the end:

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: Even as you have been ready, in part, to say that we are your glory, in the same way that you are ours, in the day of the Lord Jesus.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: And being certain of this, it was my purpose to come to you before, so that you might have a second grace;

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: And by way of Corinth to go into Macedonia, and from there to come back again to you, so that you might send me on my way to Judaea.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: If then I had such a purpose, did I seem to be changing suddenly? or am I guided in my purposes by the flesh, saying, Yes, today, and, No, tomorrow?

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: As God is true, our word to you is not Yes and No.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 19
text: For the Son of God, Jesus Christ, whom we were preaching among you, even I and Silvanus and Timothy, was not Yes and No, but in him is Yes.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 20
text: For he is the Yes to all the undertakings of God: and by him all the words of God are made certain and put into effect, to the glory of God through us.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 21
text: Now he who makes our faith strong together with you, in Christ, and has given us of his grace, is God;

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 22
text: And it is he who has put his stamp on us, even the Spirit, as the sign in our hearts of the coming glory.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 23
text: But God is my witness that it was in pity for you that I did not come to Corinth at that time.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 1 Verse 24
text: Not that we have authority over your faith, but we are helpers of your joy: for it is faith which is your support.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: But it was my decision for myself, not to come again to you with sorrow.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: For if I give you sorrow, who then will make me glad, but he who is made sad by me?

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: And I said this very thing in my letter, for fear that when I came I might have sorrow from those from whom it was right for me to have joy; being certain of this, that my joy is the joy of you all.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: For out of much trouble and pain of heart and much weeping I sent my letter to you; not to give you sorrow, but so that you might see how great is the love which I have to you.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: But if anyone has been a cause of sorrow, he has been so, not to me only, but in some measure to all of you (I say this that I may not be over-hard on you).

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: Let it be enough for such a man to have undergone the punishment which the church put on him;

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: So that now, on the other hand, it is right for him to have forgiveness and comfort from you, for fear that his sorrow may be over-great.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: For which cause my desire is that you will make your love to him clear by your acts.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: And for the same reason I sent you a letter so that I might be certain of your desire to do my orders in all things.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: But if you give forgiveness to anyone, I do the same: for if I have given forgiveness for anything, I have done it because of you, in the person of Christ;

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: So that Satan may not get the better of us: for we are not without knowledge of his designs.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: Now when I came to Troas for the good news of Christ, and there was an open door for me in the Lord,

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: I had no rest in my spirit because Titus my brother was not there: so I went away from them, and came into Macedonia.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: But praise be to God who makes us strong to overcome in Christ, and makes clear through us in every place the value of the knowledge of him.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: For we are a sweet perfume of Christ to God in those who are getting salvation and in those who are going to destruction;

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: To the one it is a perfume of death to death; to the other a perfume of life to life. And who is enough for such things?

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: For we are not like the great number who make use of the word of God for profit: but our words are true, as from God, being said as before God in Christ.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: Do we seem to be again attempting to put ourselves in the right? or have we need, as some have, of letters of approval to you or from you?

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: You yourselves are our letter, whose writing is in our heart, open for every man's reading and knowledge;

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: For you are clearly a letter of Christ, the fruit of our work, recorded not with ink, but with the Spirit of the living God; not in stone, but in hearts of flesh.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: And this is the certain faith which we have in God through Christ:

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: Not as if we were able by ourselves to do anything for which we might take the credit; but our power comes from God;

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: Who has made us able to be servants of a new agreement; not of the letter, but of the Spirit: for the letter gives death, but the Spirit gives life.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: For if the operation of the law, giving death, recorded in letters on stone, came with glory, so that the eyes of the children of Israel had to be turned away from the face of Moses because of its glory, a glory which was only for a time:

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: Will not the operation of the Spirit have a much greater glory?

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: For if the operation of the law, producing punishment, had its glory, how much greater will be the operation of the Spirit causing righteousness?

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: For the glory of the first no longer seems to be glory, because of the greater glory of that which comes after.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: For if the order which was for a time had its glory, much more will the eternal order have its glory.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: Having then such a hope, we keep nothing back,

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: And are not like Moses, who put a veil on his face, so that the children of Israel might not see clearly to the end of the present order of things:

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: But their minds were made hard: for to this very day at the reading of the old agreement the same veil is still unlifted; though it is taken away in Christ.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: But to this day, at the reading of the law of Moses, a veil is over their heart.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: But when it is turned to the Lord, the veil will be taken away.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: Now the Lord is the Spirit: and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there the heart is free.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 3 Verse 18
text: But we all, with unveiled face giving back as in a glass the glory of the Lord, are changed into the same image from glory to glory, even as from the Lord who is the Spirit.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: For this reason, because we have been made servants of this new order, through the mercy given to us, we are strong:

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: And we have given up the secret things of shame, not walking in false ways, and not making use of the word of God with deceit; but by the revelation of what is true, as before God, we have the approval of every man's sense of right and wrong.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: But if our good news is veiled, it is veiled from those who are on the way to destruction:

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: Because the god of this world has made blind the minds of those who have not faith, so that the light of the good news of the glory of Christ, who is the image of God, might not be shining on them.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: For our preaching is not about ourselves, but about Christ Jesus as Lord, and ourselves as your servants through Jesus.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: Seeing that it is God who said, Let light be shining out of the dark, who has put in our hearts the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: But we have this wealth in vessels of earth, so that it may be seen that the power comes not from us but from God;

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: Troubles are round us on every side, but we are not shut in; things are hard for us, but we see a way out of them;

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: We are cruelly attacked, but not without hope; we are made low, but we are not without help;

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: In our bodies there is ever the mark of the death of Jesus, so that the life of Jesus may be seen in our bodies.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: For, while living, we are still being given up to death because of Jesus, so that the life of Jesus may be seen in our flesh, though it is under the power of death.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: So then, death is working in us, but life in you.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: But having the same spirit of faith, as it is said in the Writings, The words of my mouth came from the faith in my heart; in the same way, our words are the outcome of our faith;

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: Because we are certain that he who made the Lord Jesus come back from the dead, will do the same for us, and will give us a place in his glory with you.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: For we go through all things on account of you, because the greater the number to whom the grace is given, the greater is the praise to the glory of God.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: For which cause we do not give way to weariness; but though our outer man is getting feebler, our inner man is made new day by day.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 17
text: For our present trouble, which is only for a short time, is working out for us a much greater weight of glory;

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 4 Verse 18
text: While our minds are not on the things which are seen, but on the things which are not seen: for the things which are seen are for a time; but the things which are not seen are eternal.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: For we are conscious that if this our tent of flesh is taken down, we have a building from God, a house not made with hands, eternal, in heaven.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: For in this we are crying in weariness, greatly desiring to be clothed with our house from heaven:

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: So that our spirits may not be unclothed.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: For truly, we who are in this tent do give out cries of weariness, for the weight of care which is on us; not because we are desiring to be free from the body, but so that we may have our new body, and death may be overcome by life.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: Now he who has made us for this very thing is God, who has given us the Spirit as a witness of what is to come.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: So, then, we are ever without fear, and though conscious that while we are in the body we are away from the Lord,

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: (For we are walking by faith, not by seeing,)

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: We are without fear, desiring to be free from the body, and to be with the Lord.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: For this reason we make it our purpose, in the body or away from it, to be well-pleasing to him.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: For we all have to come before Christ to be judged; so that every one of us may get his reward for the things done in the body, good or bad.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: Having in mind, then, the fear of the Lord, we put these things before men, but God sees our hearts; and it is my hope that we may seem right in your eyes.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: We are not again requesting your approval, but we are giving you the chance of taking pride in us, so that you may be able to give an answer to those whose glory is in seeming, and not in the heart.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: For if we are foolish, it is to God; or if we are serious, it is for you.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: For it is the love of Christ which is moving us; because we are of the opinion that if one was put to death for all, then all have undergone death;

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 5 Verse 15
text: And that he underwent death for all, so that the living might no longer be living to themselves, but to him who underwent death for them and came back from the dead.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 5 Verse 16
text: For this reason, from this time forward we have knowledge of no man after the flesh: even if we have had knowledge of Christ after the flesh, we have no longer any such knowledge.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 5 Verse 17
text: So if any man is in Christ, he is in a new world: the old things have come to an end; they have truly become new.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 5 Verse 18
text: But all things are of God, who has made us at peace with himself through Christ, and has given to us the work of making peace;

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 5 Verse 19
text: That is, that God was in Christ making peace between the world and himself, not putting their sins to their account, and having given to us the preaching of this news of peace.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 5 Verse 20
text: So we are the representatives of Christ, as if God was making a request to you through us: we make our request to you, in the name of Christ, be at peace with God.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 5 Verse 21
text: For him who had no knowledge of sin God made to be sin for us; so that we might become the righteousness of God in him.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: We then, working together with God, make our request to you not to take the grace of God to no purpose.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: (For he says, I have given ear to you at a good time, and I have been your helper in a day of salvation: see, now is the good time; now is the day of salvation):

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: Giving no cause for trouble in anything, so that no one may be able to say anything against our work;

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: But in everything making it clear that we are the servants of God, in quiet strength, in troubles, in need, in sorrow,

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: In blows, in prisons, in attacks, in hard work, in watchings, in going without food;

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: In a clean heart, in knowledge, in long waiting, in being kind, in the Holy Spirit, in true love,

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: In the true word, in the power of God; with the arms of righteousness on the right hand and on the left,

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: By glory and by shame, by an evil name and a good name; as untrue, and still true;

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: Unnoted, but still kept fully in mind; as near to death, but still living; as undergoing punishment, but not put to death;

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: As full of sorrow, but ever glad; as poor, but giving wealth to others; as having nothing, but still having all things.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: Our mouth is open to you, O Corinthians, our heart is wide.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 12
text: It is not our feelings to you which are narrow, but yours to us.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 13
text: Now to give me back payment of the same sort (I am talking as to my children), let your hearts be wide open to me.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 14
text: Do not keep company with those who have not faith: for what is there in common between righteousness and evil, or between light and dark?

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 15
text: And what agreement is there between Christ and the Evil One? or what part has one who has faith with one who has not?

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 16
text: And what agreement has the house of God with images? for we are a house of the living God; even as God has said, I will be living among them, and walking with them; and I will be their God, and they will be my people.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 17
text: For which cause, Come out from among them, and be separate, says the Lord, and let no unclean thing come near you; and I will take you for myself,

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 6 Verse 18
text: And will be a Father to you; and you will be my sons and daughters, says the Lord, the Ruler of all.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: Because God, then, will give us such rewards, dear brothers, let us make ourselves clean from all evil of flesh and spirit, and become completely holy in the fear of God.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: Let your hearts be open to us: we have done no man wrong, no man has been damaged by us, we have made no profit out of any man,

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: It is not with the purpose of judging you that I say this: for I have said before that you are in our hearts for life and death together.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: My words to you are without fear, I am full of pride on account of you: I have great comfort and joy in all our troubles.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: For even when we had come into Macedonia our flesh had no rest, but we were troubled on every side; there were fightings outside and fears inside.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: But God who gives comfort to the poor in spirit gave us comfort by the coming of Titus;

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: And not by his coming only, but by the comfort which he had in you, while he gave us word of your desire, your sorrow, your care for me; so that I was still more glad.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: For though my letter gave you pain, I have no regret for it now, though I had before; for I see that the letter gave you pain, but only for a time.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 9
text: Now I am glad, not that you had sorrow, but that your sorrow was the cause of a change of heart; for yours was a holy sorrow so that you might undergo no loss by us in anything.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 10
text: For the sorrow which God gives is the cause of salvation through a change of heart, in which there is no reason for grief: but the sorrow of the world is a cause of death.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 11
text: For you see what care was produced in you by this very sorrow of yours before God, what clearing of yourselves, what wrath against sin, what fear, what desire, what serious purpose, what punishment. In everything you have made it clear that you are free from sin in this business.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 12
text: So though I sent you a letter, it was not only because of the man who did the wrong, or because of him to whom the wrong was done, but so that your true care for us might be made clear in the eyes of God.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 13
text: So we have been comforted: and we had the greater joy in our comfort because of the joy of Titus, for his spirit had been made glad by you all.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 14
text: For I was not put to shame in anything in which I may have made clear to him my pride in you; but as we said nothing to you but what was true, so the good things which I said to Titus about you were seen by him to be true.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 15
text: And his love to you is the more increased by his memory of you all, how you gave way to his authority, and how you took him to your hearts with fear and honour.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 7 Verse 16
text: It gives me great joy to see you answering to my good opinion of you in every way.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 1
text: And now we give you news, brothers, about the grace of God which has been given to the churches of Macedonia;

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 2
text: How while they were undergoing every sort of trouble, and were in the greatest need, they took all the greater joy in being able to give freely to the needs of others.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 3
text: For I give them witness, that as they were able, and even more than they were able, they gave from the impulse of their hearts,

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 4
text: Seriously requesting us that they might have a part in this grace of being servants to the needs of the saints:

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 5
text: And going even farther than our hope, they first gave themselves to the Lord and to us after the purpose of God.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 6
text: So that we made a request to Titus that, as he had made a start before, so he might make this grace complete in you.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 7
text: And that as you are full of every good thing, of faith, of the word, of knowledge, of a ready mind, and of love to us, so you may be full of this grace in the same way.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 8
text: I am not giving you an order, but using the ready mind of others as a test of the quality of your love.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 9
text: For you see the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, how though he had wealth, he became poor on your account, so that through his need you might have wealth.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 10
text: And in this I give my opinion: for it is to your profit, who were the first to make a start a year before, not only to do this, but to make clear that your minds were more than ready to do it.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 11
text: Then make the doing of it complete; so that as you had a ready mind, you may give effect to it as you are able.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 12
text: For if there is a ready mind, a man will have God's approval in the measure of what he has, and not of what he has not.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 13
text: And I am not saying this so that others may get off free, while the weight comes on you:

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 14
text: But so that things may be equal; that from those things of which you have more than enough at the present time their need may be helped, and that if you are in any need they may be a help to you in the same way, making things equal.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 15
text: As it says in the Writings, He who had taken up much had nothing over and he who had little had enough.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 16
text: But praise be to God, who puts the same care for you into the heart of Titus.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 17
text: For while he gladly gave ear to our request, he was interested enough to go to you from the impulse of his heart.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 18
text: And with him we have sent a brother whose praise in the good news has gone through all the churches;

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 19
text: And not only so, but he was marked out by the churches to go with us in the grace of this giving which we have undertaken to the glory of the Lord and to make clear that our mind was ready:

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 20
text: And so that no man might be able to say anything against us in the business of this giving which has been put into our hands:

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 21
text: For the business has been so ordered by us as to have the approval, not only of the Lord, but of men.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 22
text: And we have sent with them our brother, whose ready spirit has been made clear to us at times and in ways without number, but it is now all the more so because of the certain faith which he has in you.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 23
text: If any question comes up about Titus, he is my brother-worker, working with me for you; or about the others, they are the representatives of the churches to the glory of Christ.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 8 Verse 24
text: Make clear then to them, as representatives of the churches, the quality of your love, and that the things which we have said about you are true.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 1
text: But there is no need for me to say anything in my letter about the giving to the saints:

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 2
text: For I have before made clear to those of Macedonia my pride in your ready mind, saying to them that Achaia has been ready for a year back; and a great number have been moved to do the same by your example.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 3
text: But I have sent the brothers, so that the good things we said about you may be seen to be true, and that, as I said, you may be ready:

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 4
text: For fear that, if any from Macedonia come with me, and you are not ready, we (not to say, you) might be put to shame in this thing.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 5
text: So it seemed to me wise for the brothers to go before, and see that the amount which you had undertaken to give was ready, so that it might be a cause for praise, and not as if we were making profit out of you.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 6
text: But in the Writings it says, He who puts in only a small number of seeds, will get in the same; and he who puts them in from a full hand, will have produce in full measure from them.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 7
text: Let every man do after the purpose of his heart; not giving with grief, or by force: for God takes pleasure in a ready giver.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 8
text: And God is able to give you all grace in full measure; so that ever having enough of all things, you may be full of every good work:

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 9
text: As it is said in the Writings, He has sent out far and wide, he has given to the poor; his righteousness is for ever.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 10
text: And he who gives seed for putting into the field and bread for food, will take care of the growth of your seed, at the same time increasing the fruits of your righteousness;

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 11
text: Your wealth being increased in everything, with a simple mind, causing praise to God through us.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 12
text: For this work of giving not only takes care of the needs of the saints, but is the cause of much praise to God;

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 13
text: For when, through this work of giving, they see what you are, they give glory to God for the way in which you have given yourselves to the good news of Christ, and for the wealth of your giving to them and to all;

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 14
text: While their hearts go out to you in love and in prayer for you, because of the great grace of God which is in you.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 9 Verse 15
text: Praise be to God for what he has given, which words have no power to say.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 1
text: Now I, Paul, myself make request to you by the quiet and gentle behaviour of Christ, I who am poor in spirit when with you, but who say what is in my mind to you without fear when I am away from you:

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 2
text: Yes, I make my request to you, so that when I am with you I may not have to make use of the authority which may be needed against some to whom we seem to be walking after the flesh.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 3
text: For though we may be living in the flesh, we are not fighting after the way of the flesh

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 4
text: (For the arms with which we are fighting are not those of the flesh, but are strong before God for the destruction of high places);

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 5
text: Putting an end to reasonings, and every high thing which is lifted up against the knowledge of God, and causing every thought to come under the authority of Christ;

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 6
text: Being ready to give punishment to whatever is against his authority, after you have made it clear that you are completely under his control.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 7
text: Give attention to the things which are before you. If any man seems to himself to be Christ's, let him keep in mind that we are as much Christ's as he is.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 8
text: For though I might take pride in our authority (which the Lord gave for building you up, and not for your destruction), it will not be a cause of shame to me:

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 9
text: That I may not seem to have the desire of causing you fear by my letters.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 10
text: For his letters, they say, have weight and are strong; but in body he is feeble, and his way of talking has little force.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 11
text: Let those who say this keep in mind that, what we are in word by letters when we are away, so will we be in act when we are present.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 12
text: For we will not make comparison of ourselves with some of those who say good things about themselves: but these, measuring themselves by themselves, and making comparison of themselves with themselves, are not wise.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 13
text: We will not give glory to ourselves in over-great measure, but after the measure of the rule which God has given us, a measure which comes even to you.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 14
text: For we have no need to make ourselves seem more than we are, as if our authority did not come as far as to you: for we came even as far as you with the good news of Christ:

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 15
text: Not taking credit to ourselves for what is not our business, that is, for the work of others; but having hope that, with the growth of your faith, we may get the credit for an increase which is the effect of our work,

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 16
text: So that we may be able to go on and take the good news to countries still farther away than you are, and not take credit for another man's work in making things ready to our hand.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 17
text: But whoever has a desire for glory, let his glory be in the Lord.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 10 Verse 18
text: For the Lord's approval of a man is not dependent on his opinion of himself, but on the Lord's opinion of him.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 1
text: Put up with me if I am a little foolish: but, truly, you do put up with me.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 2
text: For I have a very great care for you: because you have been married by me to one husband, and it is my desire to give you completely holy to Christ.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 3
text: But I have a fear, that in some way, as Eve was tricked by the deceit of the snake, your minds may be turned away from their simple and holy love for Christ.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 4
text: For if anyone comes preaching another Jesus from the one whose preachers we are, or if you have got a different spirit, or a different sort of good news from those which came to you, how well you put up with these things.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 5
text: For in my opinion, I am in no way less than the most important of the Apostles.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 6
text: But though I am rough in my way of talking, I am not so in knowledge, as we have made clear to all by our acts among you.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 7
text: Or did I do wrong in making myself low so that you might be lifted up, because I gave you the good news of God without reward?

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 8
text: I took money from other churches as payment for my work, so that I might be your servant;

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 9
text: And when I was present with you, and was in need, I let no man be responsible for me; for the brothers, when they came from Macedonia, gave me whatever was needed; and in everything I kept myself from being a trouble to you, and I will go on doing so.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 10
text: As the true word of Christ is in me, I will let no man take from me this my cause of pride in the country of Achaia.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 11
text: Why? because I have no love for you? let God be judge.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 12
text: But what I do, that I will go on doing, so that I may give no chance to those who are looking for one; so that, in the cause of their pride, they may be seen to be the same as we are.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 13
text: For such men are false Apostles, workers of deceit, making themselves seem like Apostles of Christ.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 14
text: And it is no wonder; for even Satan himself is able to take the form of an angel of light.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 15
text: So it is no great thing if his servants make themselves seem to be servants of righteousness; whose end will be the reward of their works.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 16
text: I say again, Let me not seem foolish to anyone; but if I do, put up with me as such, so that I may take a little glory to myself.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 17
text: What I am now saying is not by the order of the Lord, but as a foolish person, taking credit to myself, as it seems.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 18
text: Seeing that there are those who take credit to themselves after the flesh, I will do the same.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 19
text: For you put up with the foolish gladly, being wise yourselves.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 20
text: You put up with a man if he makes servants of you, if he makes profit out of you, if he makes you prisoners, if he puts himself in a high place, if he gives you blows on the face.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 21
text: I say this by way of shaming ourselves, as if we had been feeble. But if anyone puts himself forward (I am talking like a foolish person), I will do the same.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 22
text: Are they Hebrews? so am I. Are they of Israel? so am I. Are they the seed of Abraham? so am I.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 23
text: Are they servants of Christ? (I am talking foolishly) I am more so; I have had more experience of hard work, of prisons, of blows more than measure, of death.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 24
text: Five times the Jews gave me forty blows but one.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 25
text: Three times I was whipped with rods, once I was stoned, three times the ship I was in came to destruction at sea, a night and a day I have been in the water;

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 26
text: In frequent travels, in dangers on rivers, in dangers from outlaws, in dangers from my countrymen, in dangers from the Gentiles, in dangers in the town, in dangers in the waste land, in dangers at sea, in dangers among false brothers;

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 27
text: In hard work and weariness, in frequent watchings, going without food and drink, cold and in need of clothing.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 28
text: In addition to all the other things, there is that which comes on me every day, the care of all the churches.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 29
text: Who is feeble and I am not feeble? who is in danger of falling, and I am not angry?

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 30
text: If I have to take credit to myself, I will do so in the things in which I am feeble.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 31
text: The God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, to whom be praise for ever, is witness that the things which I say are true.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 32
text: In Damascus, the ruler under Aretas the king kept watch over the town of the people of Damascus, in order to take me:

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Verse 33
text: And being let down in a basket from the wall through a window, I got free from his hands.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 1
text: As it is necessary for me to take glory to myself, though it is not a good thing, I will come to visions and revelations of the Lord.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 2
text: I have knowledge of a man in Christ, fourteen years back (if he was in the body, or out of the body, I am not able to say, but God only), who was taken up to the third heaven.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 3
text: And I have knowledge of such a man (if he was in the body, or out of the body, I am not able to say, but God only),

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 4
text: How he was taken up into Paradise, and words came to his ears which may not be said, and which man is not able to say.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 5
text: On account of such a one I will have glory: for myself I will take no glory, but only in my feeble body.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 6
text: For if I had a desire to take credit to myself, it would not be foolish, for I would be saying what is true: but I will not, for fear that I might seem to any man more than he sees me to be, or has word from me that I am.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 7
text: And because the revelations were so very great, in order that I might not be overmuch lifted up, there was given to me a thorn in the flesh, one sent from Satan to give me pain.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 8
text: And about this thing I made request to the Lord three times that it might be taken away from me.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 9
text: And he said to me, My grace is enough for you, for my power is made complete in what is feeble. Most gladly, then, will I take pride in my feeble body, so that the power of Christ may be on me.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 10
text: So I take pleasure in being feeble, in unkind words, in needs, in cruel attacks, in troubles, on account of Christ: for when I am feeble, then am I strong.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 11
text: I have been forced by you to become foolish, though it was right for my praise to have come from you: for in no way was I less than the chief of the Apostles, though I am nothing.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 12
text: Truly the signs of an Apostle were done among you in quiet strength, with wonders and acts of power.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 13
text: For what is there in which you were made less than the other churches, but in the one thing that I was not a trouble to you? Let me have forgiveness for this wrong.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 14
text: This is now the third time that I am ready to come to you; and I will not be a trouble to you: my desire is for you, not for your property: for it is not the children's business to make store for their fathers, but the fathers for the children.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 15
text: And I will gladly give all I have for your souls. If I have the more love for you, am I to be loved the less?

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 16
text: But let it be so, that I was not a trouble to you myself; but (someone may say) being false, I took you with deceit.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 17
text: Did I make a profit out of you by any of those whom I sent to you?

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 18
text: I gave orders to Titus, and I sent the brother with him. Did Titus make any profit out of you? were we not guided by the same Spirit, in the same ways?

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 19
text: It may seem to you that all this time we have been attempting to put ourselves in the right; but we are saying these things before God in Christ. For all things, dear brothers, are for your profit.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 20
text: For I have a fear that, when I come, you may not be answering to my desire, and that I may not be answering to yours; that there may be fighting, hate, angry feeling, divisions, evil talk about others, secrets, thoughts of pride, outbursts against authority;

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 12 Verse 21
text: And that when I come again, my God may put me to shame among you, and I may have grief for those who have done wrong before and have had no regret for their unclean ways, and for the evil desires of the flesh to which they have given way.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 13 Verse 1
text: This is the third time that I am coming to you. From the mouth of two or three witnesses will every word be made certain.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 13 Verse 2
text: I said before, and still say it before I come, as being present for the second time, though I am still away from you, to those who have done wrong before, and to all the others, that if I come again I will not have pity;

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 13 Verse 3
text: Seeing that you are looking for a sign of Christ giving out his word in me; who is not feeble in relation to you, but is strong in you:

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 13 Verse 4
text: For he was feeble in that he was put to death on the cross, but he is living by the power of God. And we are feeble in him, but we will be living with him through the power of God in relation to you.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 13 Verse 5
text: Make a test of yourselves, if you are in the faith; make certain of yourselves. Or are you not conscious in yourselves that Jesus Christ is in you, if you are truly Christ's?

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 13 Verse 6
text: But it is my hope that you will have no doubt that we are truly Christ's.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 13 Verse 7
text: Now our prayer to God is that you may do no evil; not in order that it may be put to our credit, but so that you may do what is right, whatever we may seem.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 13 Verse 8
text: Because we are able to do nothing against what is true, but only for it.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 13 Verse 9
text: For we are glad when we are feeble and you are strong: and this is our prayer, even that you may be made complete.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 13 Verse 10
text: For this cause I am writing these things while I am away, so that there may be need for me, when I am present, to make use of sharp measures, by the authority which the Lord has given me for building up and not for destruction.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 13 Verse 11
text: Let this be my last word, brothers; be glad; be complete; be comforted; be of the same mind; be at peace with one another: and the God of love and peace will be with you.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 13 Verse 12
text: Give one another a holy kiss.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 13 Verse 13
text: All the saints send their love to you.

title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 13 Verse 14
text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, and the love of God, and the harmony of the Holy Spirit, be with you all.

title: Galatians Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: Paul, an Apostle (not from men, and not through man, but through Jesus Christ, and God the Father, who made him come back from the dead),

title: Galatians Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: And all the brothers who are with me, to the churches of Galatia:

title: Galatians Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: Grace to you and peace from God the Father and our Lord Jesus Christ,

title: Galatians Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: Who gave himself for our sins, so that he might make us free from this present evil world, after the purpose of our God and Father:

title: Galatians Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: To whom be the glory for ever and ever. So be it.

title: Galatians Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: I am surprised that you are being so quickly turned away from him whose word came to you in the grace of Christ, to good news of a different sort;

title: Galatians Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: Which is not another sort: only there are some who give you trouble, desiring to make changes in the good news of Christ.

title: Galatians Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: But even if we, or an angel from heaven, were to be a preacher to you of good news other than that which we have given you, let there be a curse on him.

title: Galatians Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: As we have said before, so say I now again, If any man is a preacher to you of any good news other than that which has been given to you, let there be a curse on him.

title: Galatians Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: Am I now using arguments to men, or God? or is it my desire to give men pleasure? if I was still pleasing men, I would not be a servant of Christ.

title: Galatians Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: Because I say to you, my brothers, that the good news of which I was the preacher is not man's.

title: Galatians Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: For I did not get it from man, and I was not given teaching in it, but it came to me through revelation of Jesus Christ.

title: Galatians Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: For news has come to you of my way of life in the past in the Jews' religion, how I was cruel without measure to the church of God, and did great damage to it:

title: Galatians Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: And I went farther in the Jews' religion than a number of my generation among my countrymen, having a more burning interest in the beliefs handed down from my fathers.

title: Galatians Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: But when it was the good pleasure of God, by whom I was marked out even from my mother's body, through his grace,

title: Galatians Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: To give the revelation of his Son in me, so that I might give the news of him to the Gentiles; then I did not take the opinion of flesh and blood,

title: Galatians Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: And I went not up to Jerusalem to those who were Apostles before me; but I went away into Arabia, and again I came back to Damascus.

title: Galatians Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: Then after three years I went up to Jerusalem to see Cephas, and was there with him fifteen days.

title: Galatians Chapter 1 Verse 19
text: But of the other Apostles I saw only James, the Lord's brother.

title: Galatians Chapter 1 Verse 20
text: Now God is witness that the things which I am writing to you are true.

title: Galatians Chapter 1 Verse 21
text: Then I came to the parts of Syria and Cilicia.

title: Galatians Chapter 1 Verse 22
text: And the churches of Judaea which were in Christ still had no knowledge of my face or person:

title: Galatians Chapter 1 Verse 23
text: Only it came to their ears that he who at one time was cruel to us is now preaching the faith which before had been attacked by him;

title: Galatians Chapter 1 Verse 24
text: And they gave glory to God in me.

title: Galatians Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: Then after the space of fourteen years I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas, taking Titus with me.

title: Galatians Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: And I went up by revelation; and I put before them the good news which I was preaching among the Gentiles, but privately before those who were of good name, so that the work which I was or had been doing might not be without effect.

title: Galatians Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: But not even Titus who was with me, being a Greek, was made to undergo circumcision:

title: Galatians Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: And that because of the false brothers let in secretly, who came searching out our free condition which we have in Christ Jesus, so that they might make servants of us;

title: Galatians Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: To whom we gave way not even for an hour; so that the true words of the good news might still be with you.

title: Galatians Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: But from those who seemed to be important (whatever they were has no weight with me: God does not take man's person into account): those who seemed to be important gave nothing new to me;

title: Galatians Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: But, quite the opposite, when they saw that I had been made responsible for preaching the good news to those without circumcision, even as Peter had been for those of the circumcision

title: Galatians Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: (Because he who was working in Peter as the Apostle of the circumcision was working no less in me among the Gentiles);

title: Galatians Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: When they saw the grace which was given to me, James and Cephas and John, who had the name of being pillars, gave to me and Barnabas their right hands as friends so that we might go to the Gentiles, and they to the circumcision;

title: Galatians Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: Only it was their desire that we would give thought to the poor; which very thing I had much in mind to do.

title: Galatians Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: But when Cephas came to Antioch, I made a protest against him to his face, because he was clearly in the wrong.

title: Galatians Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: For before certain men came from James, he did take food with the Gentiles: but when they came, he went back and made himself separate, fearing those who were of the circumcision.

title: Galatians Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: And the rest of the Jews went after him, so that even Barnabas was overcome by their false ways.

title: Galatians Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: But when I saw that they were not living uprightly in agreement with the true words of the good news, I said to Cephas before them all, If you, being a Jew, are living like the Gentiles, and not like the Jews, how will you make the Gentiles do the same as the Jews?

title: Galatians Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: We being Jews by birth, and not sinners of the Gentiles,

title: Galatians Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: Being conscious that a man does not get righteousness by the works of the law, but through faith in Jesus Christ, we had faith in Christ Jesus, so that we might get righteousness by faith in Christ, and not by the works of the law: because by the works of the law will no flesh get righteousness.

title: Galatians Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: But if, while we were desiring to get righteousness through Christ, we ourselves were seen to be sinners, is Christ a servant of sin? In no way!

title: Galatians Chapter 2 Verse 18
text: For if I put up again those things which I gave to destruction, I am seen to be a wrongdoer.

title: Galatians Chapter 2 Verse 19
text: For I, through the law, have become dead to the law, so that I might be living to God.

title: Galatians Chapter 2 Verse 20
text: I have been put to death on the cross with Christ; still I am living; no longer I, but Christ is living in me; and that life which I now am living in the flesh I am living by faith, the faith of the Son of God, who in love for me, gave himself up for me.

title: Galatians Chapter 2 Verse 21
text: I do not make the grace of God of no effect: because if righteousness is through the law, then Christ was put to death for nothing.

title: Galatians Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: O foolish Galatians, by what strange powers have you been tricked, to whom it was made clear that Jesus Christ was put to death on the cross?

title: Galatians Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: Give me an answer to this one question, Did the Spirit come to you through the works of the law, or by the hearing of faith?

title: Galatians Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: Are you so foolish? having made a start in the Spirit, will you now be made complete in the flesh?

title: Galatians Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: Did you undergo such a number of things to no purpose? if it is in fact to no purpose.

title: Galatians Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: He who gives you the Spirit, and does works of power among you, is it by the works of law, or by the hearing of faith?

title: Galatians Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: Even as Abraham had faith in God, and it was put to his account as righteousness.

title: Galatians Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: Be certain, then, that those who are of faith, the same are sons of Abraham.

title: Galatians Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: And the holy Writings, seeing before the event that God would give the Gentiles righteousness by faith, gave the good news before to Abraham, saying, In you will all the nations have a blessing.

title: Galatians Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: So then those who are of faith have a part in the blessing of Abraham who was full of faith.

title: Galatians Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: For all who are of the works of the law are under a curse: because it is said in the Writings, A curse is on everyone who does not keep on doing all the things which are ordered in the book of the law.

title: Galatians Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: Now that no man gets righteousness by the law in the eyes of God, is clear; because, The upright will be living by faith.

title: Galatians Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: And the law is not of faith; but, He who does them will have life by them.

title: Galatians Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: Christ has made us free from the curse of the law, having become a curse for us: because it is said in the Writings, A curse on everyone who is put to death by hanging on a tree:

title: Galatians Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: So that on the Gentiles might come the blessing of Abraham in Christ Jesus; in order that we through faith might have the Spirit which God had undertaken to give.

title: Galatians Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: Brothers, as men would say, even a man's agreement, when it has been made certain, may not be put on one side, or have additions made to it.

title: Galatians Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: Now to Abraham were the undertakings given, and to his seed. He says not, And to seeds, as of a great number; but as of one, he says, And to your seed, which is Christ.

title: Galatians Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: Now this I say: The law, which came four hundred and thirty years after, does not put an end to the agreement made before by God, so as to make the undertaking without effect.

title: Galatians Chapter 3 Verse 18
text: Because if the heritage is by the law, it is no longer dependent on the word of God; but God gave it to Abraham by his word.

title: Galatians Chapter 3 Verse 19
text: What then is the law? It was an addition made because of sin, till the coming of the seed to whom the undertaking had been given; and it was ordered through angels by the hand of a go-between.

title: Galatians Chapter 3 Verse 20
text: Now a go-between is not a go-between of one; but God is one.

title: Galatians Chapter 3 Verse 21
text: Is the law then against the words of God? in no way; because if there had been a law which was able to give life, truly righteousness would have been by the law.

title: Galatians Chapter 3 Verse 22
text: However, the holy Writings have put all things under sin, so that that for which God gave the undertaking, based on faith in Jesus Christ, might be given to those who have such faith.

title: Galatians Chapter 3 Verse 23
text: But before faith came, we were kept in prison under the law, waiting for the revelation of the faith which was to come.

title: Galatians Chapter 3 Verse 24
text: So the law has been a servant to take us to Christ, so that we might have righteousness by faith.

title: Galatians Chapter 3 Verse 25
text: But now that faith is come, we are no longer under a servant.

title: Galatians Chapter 3 Verse 26
text: Because you are all sons of God through faith in Christ Jesus.

title: Galatians Chapter 3 Verse 27
