text: But we make this request to you, my brothers: give attention to those who are working among you, who are over you in the Lord to keep order among you;

title: 1 Thessalonians Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: And have a high opinion of them in love because of their work. Be at peace among yourselves.

title: 1 Thessalonians Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: And our desire is that you will keep control over those whose lives are not well ordered, giving comfort to the feeble-hearted, supporting those with little strength, and putting up with much from all.

title: 1 Thessalonians Chapter 5 Verse 15
text: Let no one give evil for evil; but ever go after what is good, for one another and for all.

title: 1 Thessalonians Chapter 5 Verse 16
text: Have joy at all times.

title: 1 Thessalonians Chapter 5 Verse 17
text: Keep on with your prayers.

title: 1 Thessalonians Chapter 5 Verse 18
text: In everything give praise: for this is the purpose of God in Christ Jesus for you.

title: 1 Thessalonians Chapter 5 Verse 19
text: Do not put out the light of the Spirit;

title: 1 Thessalonians Chapter 5 Verse 20
text: Do not make little of the words of the prophets;

title: 1 Thessalonians Chapter 5 Verse 21
text: Let all things be tested; keep to what is good;

title: 1 Thessalonians Chapter 5 Verse 22
text: Keep from every form of evil.

title: 1 Thessalonians Chapter 5 Verse 23
text: And may the God of peace himself make you holy in every way; and may your spirit and soul and body be free from all sin at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.

title: 1 Thessalonians Chapter 5 Verse 24
text: God, by whom you have been marked out in his purpose, is unchanging and will make it complete.

title: 1 Thessalonians Chapter 5 Verse 25
text: Brothers, keep us in mind in your prayers.

title: 1 Thessalonians Chapter 5 Verse 26
text: Give all the brothers a holy kiss.

title: 1 Thessalonians Chapter 5 Verse 27
text: I give orders in the name of the Lord that all the brothers are to be present at the reading of this letter.

title: 1 Thessalonians Chapter 5 Verse 28
text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: Paul and Silvanus and Timothy, to the church of the Thessalonians in God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ:

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: Grace to you and peace from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: It is right for us to give praise to God at all times for you, brothers, because of the great increase of your faith, and the wealth of your love for one another;

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: So that we ourselves take pride in you in the churches of God for your untroubled mind and your faith in all the troubles and sorrows which you are going through;

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: Which is a clear sign of the decision which God in his righteousness has made; to give you a part in his kingdom, for which you have undergone this pain;

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: For it is an act of righteousness on God's part to give trouble as their reward to those who are troubling you,

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: And to you who are troubled, rest with us, when the Lord Jesus comes from heaven with the angels of his power in flames of fire,

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: To give punishment to those who have no knowledge of God, and to those who do not give ear to the good news of our Lord Jesus:

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: Whose reward will be eternal destruction from the face of the Lord and from the glory of his strength,

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: At his coming, when he will have glory in his saints, and will be a cause of wonder in all those who had faith (because our witness among you had effect) in that day.

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: For this reason, you are ever in our prayers, that you may seem to our God such as may have a part in his purpose and that by his power he will make all his good purpose, and the work of faith, complete;

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: So that glory may be given to the name of our Lord Jesus through you, and you may have glory in him, by the grace of our God and the Lord Jesus Christ.

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: Now as to the coming of the Lord Jesus Christ, and our meeting with him, it is our desire, my brothers,

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: That you may not be moved in mind or troubled by a spirit, or by a word, or by a letter as from us, with the suggestion that the day of the Lord is even now come;

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: Give no belief to false words: because there will first be a falling away from the faith, and the revelation of the man of sin, the son of destruction,

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: Who puts himself against all authority, lifting himself up over all which is named God or is given worship; so that he takes his seat in the Temple of God, putting himself forward as God.

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: Have you no memory of what I said when I was with you, giving you word of these things?

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: And now it is clear to you what is keeping back his revelation till the time comes for him to be seen.

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: For the secret of evil is even now at work: but there is one who is keeping back the evil till he is taken out of the way.

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: And then will come the revelation of that evil one, whom the Lord Jesus will put to death with the breath of his mouth, and give to destruction by the revelation of his coming;

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: Even the one whose coming is marked by the working of Satan, with all power and signs and false wonders,

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: And with every deceit of wrongdoing among those whose fate is destruction; because they were quite without that love of the true faith by which they might have salvation.

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: And for this cause, God will give them up to the power of deceit and they will put their faith in what is false:

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: So that they all may be judged, who had no faith in what is true, but took pleasure in evil.

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: But it is right for us to give praise to God at all times for you, brothers, loved by the Lord, because it was the purpose of God from the first that you might have salvation, being made holy by the Spirit and by faith in what is true:

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: And in this purpose he gave you a part through the good news of which we were the preachers, even that you might have part in the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: So then, brothers, be strong in purpose, and keep the teaching which has been given to you by word or by letter from us.

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: Now our Lord Jesus Christ himself, and God our Father who had love for us and has given us eternal comfort and good hope through grace,

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: Give you comfort and strength in every good work and word.

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: For the rest, my brothers, let there be prayer for us that the word of the Lord may go forward with increasing glory, even as it does with you;

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: And that we may be made free from foolish and evil men; for not all have faith.

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: But the Lord is true, who will give you strength and keep you safe from evil.

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: And we have faith in the Lord about you, that you are doing and will do the things about which we give you orders.

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: And may your hearts be guided by the Lord into the love of God and quiet waiting for Christ.

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: Now we give you orders, brothers, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, to keep away from all those whose behaviour is not well ordered and in harmony with the teaching which they had from us.

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: For you yourselves are used to taking us as your example, because our life among you was ruled by order,

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: And we did not take food from any man for nothing, but were working hard night and day not to be a trouble to any of you:

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: Not because we have not the right, but to make ourselves an example to you, so that you might do the same.

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: For even when we were with you we gave you orders, saying, If any man does no work, let him not have food.

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: For it has come to our ears that there are some among you whose behaviour is uncontrolled, who do no work at all, but are over-interested in the business of others.

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: Now to such we give orders and make request in the Lord Jesus, that, working quietly, they get their living.

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: And you, my brothers, do not get tired of well-doing.

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: And if any man does not give attention to what we have said in this letter, take note of that man, and keep away from him, so that he may be shamed.

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: Have no feeling of hate for him, but take him in hand seriously as a brother.

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: Now the Lord of peace himself give you peace at all times and in every way. May the Lord be with you all.

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: These words of love to you at the end are in my writing, Paul's writing, and this is the mark of every letter from me.

title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 3 Verse 18
text: May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: Paul, an Apostle of Jesus Christ, by the order of God our Saviour and Christ Jesus our hope;

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: To Timothy, my true child in the faith: Grace, mercy, peace, from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: It was my desire, when I went on into Macedonia, that you might make a stop at Ephesus, to give orders to certain men not to put forward a different teaching,

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: Or to give attention to stories and long lists of generations, from which come questionings and doubts, in place of God's ordered way of life which is in faith;

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: But the effect of the order is love coming from a clean heart, and a knowledge of what is right, and true faith:

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: From which some have been turned away, giving themselves to foolish talking;

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: Desiring to be teachers of the law, though they have no knowledge of what they say or of the statements which they make so certainly.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: We are conscious that the law is good, if a man makes a right use of it,

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: With the knowledge that the law is made, not for the upright man, but for those who have no respect for law and order, for evil men and sinners, for the unholy and those who have no religion, for those who put their fathers or mothers to death, for takers of life,

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: For those who go after loose women, for those with unnatural desires, for those who take men prisoners, who make false statements and false oaths, and those who do any other things against the right teaching,

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: Which may be seen in the good news of the glory of the great God, which was given into my care.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: I give praise to him who gave me power, Christ Jesus our Lord, because he took me to be true, making me his servant,

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: Though I had said violent words against God, and done cruel acts, causing great trouble: but I was given mercy, because I did it without knowledge, not having faith;

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: And the grace of our Lord was very great, with faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: It is a true saying, in which all may put their faith, that Christ Jesus came into the world to give salvation to sinners, of whom I am the chief:

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: But for this reason I was given mercy, so that in me, the chief of sinners, Jesus Christ might make clear all his mercy, as an example to those who in the future would have faith in him to eternal life.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: Now to the King eternal, ever-living, unseen, the only God, be honour and glory for ever and ever. So be it.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: This order I give to you, Timothy my son, in harmony with the words of the prophets about you, so that by them you may be strong, fighting the good fight,

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 19
text: Keeping faith, and being conscious of well-doing; for some, by not doing these things, have gone wrong in relation to the faith:

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 20
text: Such are Hymenaeus and Alexander, whom I have given up to Satan, so that they may say no more evil words against God.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: My desire is, first of all, that you will make requests and prayers and give praise for all men;

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: For kings and all those in authority; so that we may have a calm and quiet life in all fear of God and serious behaviour.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: This is good and pleasing in the eyes of God our Saviour;

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: Whose desire is that all men may have salvation and come to the knowledge of what is true.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: For there is one God and one peacemaker between God and men, the man Christ Jesus,

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: Who gave himself as an offering for all; witness of which was to be given at the right time;

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: And of this I became a preacher and an Apostle (what I say is true, not false,) and a teacher of the Gentiles in the true faith.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: It is my desire, then, that in every place men may give themselves to prayer, lifting up holy hands, without wrath or argument.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: And that women may be dressed in simple clothing, with a quiet and serious air; not with twisted hair and gold or jewels or robes of great price;

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: But clothed with good works, as is right for women who are living in the fear of God.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: Let a woman quietly take the place of a learner and be under authority.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: In my opinion it is right for a woman not to be a teacher, or to have rule over a man, but to be quiet.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: For Adam was first formed, then Eve;

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: And Adam was not taken by deceit, but the woman, being tricked, became a wrongdoer.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: But if they go on in faith and love and holy self-control, she will be kept safe at the time of childbirth.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: This is a true saying, A man desiring the position of a Bishop has a desire for a good work.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: The Bishop, then, is to be a man of good name, the husband of one wife, self-controlled, serious-minded, having respect for order, opening his house freely to guests, a ready teacher;

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: Not quickly moved to wrath or blows, but gentle; no fighter, no lover of money;

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: Ruling his house well, having his children under control with all serious behaviour;

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: (For if a man has not the art of ruling his house, how will he take care of the church of God?)

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: Not one newly taken into the church, for fear that, through his high opinion of himself, he may come into the same sin as the Evil One.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: And he is to have a good name among those outside the church, so that nothing may be said against him and he may not be taken by the designs of the Evil One.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: Deacons, in the same way, are to be serious in their behaviour, not false in word, not given to taking much wine or greatly desiring the wealth of this world;

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: Keeping the secret of the faith in a heart free from sin.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: And let these first be put to the test; then let them become Deacons if there is nothing against them.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: Women are to be serious in behaviour, saying no evil of others, controlling themselves, true in all things.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: Let Deacons be husbands of one wife, ruling their children and their houses well.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: For those who have done good work as Deacons get for themselves a good position and become free from fear in the faith which is in Christ Jesus.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: I am writing these things to you, though I am hoping to come to you before long;

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: But if I am long in coming, this will make clear to you what behaviour is right for men in the house of God, which is the church of the living God, the pillar and base of what is true.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: And without argument, great is the secret of religion: He who was seen in the flesh, who was given God's approval in the spirit, was seen by the angels, of whom the good news was given among the nations, in whom the world had faith, who was taken up in glory.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: But the Spirit says clearly that in later times some will be turned away from the faith, giving their minds to spirits of deceit, and the teachings of evil spirits,

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: Through the false ways of men whose words are untrue, whose hearts are burned as with a heated iron;

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: Who keep men from being married and from taking food which God made to be taken with praise by those who have faith and true knowledge.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: Because everything which God has made is good, and nothing is evil, if it is taken with praise:

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: For it is made holy by the word of God and by prayer.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: If you keep these things before the minds of the brothers, you will be a good servant of Christ Jesus, trained in the words of the faith and of the right teaching which has been your guide:

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: But have nothing to do with unclean and foolish stories. Give yourself training in religion:

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: For the training of the body is of profit for a little, but religion is of profit in every way, giving hope for the life which now is, and for that which is to come.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: This is a true saying, in which all may put their faith.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: And this is the purpose of all our work and our fighting, because our hope is in the living God, who is the Saviour of all men, and specially of those who have faith.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: Let these be your orders and your teaching.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: Let no one make little of you because you are young, but be an example to the church in word, in behaviour, in love, in faith, in holy living.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: Till I come, give attention to the reading of the holy Writings, to comforting the saints, and to teaching.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: Make use of that grace in you, which was given to you by the word of the prophets, when the rulers of the church put their hands on you.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: Have a care for these things; give yourself to them with all your heart, so that all may see how you go forward.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: Give attention to yourself and your teaching. Go on in these things; for in doing so you will get salvation for yourself and for those who give hearing to you.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: Do not say sharp words to one who has authority in the church, but let your talk be as to a father, and to the younger men as to brothers:

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: To the older women as to mothers, to the younger as to sisters, with a clean heart.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: Give honour to widows who are truly widows.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: But if any widow has children or children's children, let these see that it is right to take care of their family and their fathers and mothers: for this is pleasing in the eyes of God.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: Now she who is truly a widow and without family puts her hope in God, giving herself to prayer day and night.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: But she who gives herself to pleasure is dead while she is living.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: Give orders to this effect, so that no evil may be said of anyone.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: If anyone has no care for his family and those in his house, he is false to the faith, and is worse than one who has no faith.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: Let no woman be numbered among the widows who is under sixty years old, and only if she has been the wife of one man,

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: And if witness is given of her good works; if she has had the care of children, if she has been kind to travellers, washing the feet of the saints, helping those who are in trouble, giving herself to good works.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: But to the younger widows say No: for when their love is turned away from Christ, they have a desire to be married;

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: And they are judged because they have been false to their first faith;

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: And they get into the way of doing no work, going about from house to house; and not only doing no work, but talking foolishly, being over-interested in the business of others, saying things which they have no right to say.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: So it is my desire that the younger widows may be married and have children, controlling their families, and giving the Evil One no chance to say anything against them,

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 5 Verse 15
text: For even now some are turned away to Satan.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 5 Verse 16
text: If any woman of the faith has relations who are widows, let her give them help, so that the care of them does not come on the church, and so it may give help to those who are truly widowed.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 5 Verse 17
text: Let rulers whose rule is good be honoured twice over, specially those whose work is preaching and teaching.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 5 Verse 18
text: For the Writings say, It is not right to keep the ox from taking the grain when he is crushing it. And, The worker has a right to his reward.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 5 Verse 19
text: Do not take as true any statement made against one in authority, but only if two or three give witness to it.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 5 Verse 20
text: Say sharp words to sinners when all are present, so that the rest may be in fear.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 5 Verse 21
text: I give you orders before God and Christ Jesus and the angels of God's selection, to keep these orders without giving thought to one side more than another.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 5 Verse 22
text: Do not put hands on any man without thought, and have no part in other men's sins: keep yourself clean.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 5 Verse 23
text: Do not take only water as your drink, but take a little wine for the good of your stomach, and because you are frequently ill.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 5 Verse 24
text: The sins of some men are clearly seen, going before them to be judged; but with others, their sins go after them.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 5 Verse 25
text: In the same way, there are good works which are clearly seen; and those which are not so, may not be kept secret.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: Let all who are servants under the yoke give all honour to their masters, so that no evil may be said against the name of God and his teaching.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: And let those whose masters are of the faith have respect for them because they are brothers, working for them the more readily, because those who take part in the good work are of the faith and are dear. Give orders and teaching about these things.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: If any man gives different teaching, not in agreement with the true words of our Lord Jesus Christ, and with the teaching which is in agreement with true religion,

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: He has an over-high opinion of himself; being without knowledge, having only an unhealthy love of questionings and wars of words, from which come envy, fighting, cruel words, evil thoughts,

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: Bitter talk of men who, being evil in mind and dead to what is true, take the faith to be a way of making profit.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: But true faith, with peace of mind, is of great profit:

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: For we came into the world with nothing, and we are not able to take anything out;

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: But if we have food and a roof over us, let that be enough.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: But those who have a desire for wealth are falling into danger, and are taken as in a net by a number of foolish and damaging desires, through which men are overtaken by death and destruction.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: For the love of money is a root of all evil: and some whose hearts were fixed on it have been turned away from the faith, and been wounded with unnumbered sorrows.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: But you, O man of God, keep yourself from these things, and go after righteousness, religion, faith, love, a quiet mind, gentle behaviour.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 6 Verse 12
text: Be fighting the good fight of the faith; take for yourself the life eternal, for which you were marked out, and of which you gave witness in the eyes of all.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 6 Verse 13
text: I give you orders before God, the giver of life, and Christ Jesus, who before Pontius Pilate gave witness to the faith,

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 6 Verse 14
text: To keep the word untouched by evil, clear from all shame, till the revelation of our Lord Jesus Christ:

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 6 Verse 15
text: Which at the right time he will make clear, who is the eternal and only Ruler, King of kings, and Lord of lords;

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 6 Verse 16
text: Who only has life for ever, living in light to which no man may come near; whom no man has seen or is able to see: to whom be honour and power for ever. So be it.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 6 Verse 17
text: Give orders to those who have money and goods in this life, not to be lifted up in their minds, or to put their hope in the uncertain chances of wealth, but in God who gives us in full measure all things for our use;

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 6 Verse 18
text: And to do good, having wealth in good works, being quick to give, taking part with one another;

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 6 Verse 19
text: Making ready for themselves a safe place for the time to come, so that the true life may be theirs.

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 6 Verse 20
text: O Timothy, take good care of that which is given to you, turning away from the wrong and foolish talk and arguments of that knowledge which is falsely so named;

title: 1 Timothy Chapter 6 Verse 21
text: Through which some, who gave their minds to it, have been turned away from the faith. Grace be with you.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: Paul, an Apostle of Jesus Christ by the purpose of God, in the hope of the life which is in Christ Jesus,

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: To Timothy, my well-loved child: Grace, mercy, peace, from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: I give praise to God, whose servant I have been, with a heart free from sin, from the time of my fathers, because in my prayers at all times the thought of you is with me, night and day

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: Desiring to see you, keeping in my memory your weeping, so that I may be full of joy;

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: Having in mind your true faith, which first was in your mother's mother Lois, and in your mother Eunice, and, I am certain, is now in you.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: For this reason I say to you, Let that grace of God which is in you, given to you by my hands, have living power.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: For God did not give us a spirit of fear, but of power and of love and of self-control.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: Have no feeling of shame, then, for the witness of our Lord or for me, his prisoner: but undergo all things for the good news in the measure of the power of God;

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: Who gave us salvation, marking us out for his purpose, not on account of our works, but in the measure of his purpose and his grace, which was given to us in Christ Jesus before times eternal,

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: But has now been made clear by the revelation of our Saviour Christ Jesus, who put an end to death and made life unending come to light through the good news,

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: Of which I was made a preacher and an Apostle and a teacher;

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: And for which I undergo these things: but I have no feeling of shame. For I have knowledge of him in whom I have faith, and I am certain that he is able to keep that which I have given into his care till that day.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: Keep the form of those true words which you had from me, in faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: That good thing which was given to you keep safe, through the Holy Spirit which is in us.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: You have had news that all those in Asia went away from me; among whom are Phygelus and Hermogenes:

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: May the Lord give mercy to the house of Onesiphorus because he frequently gave me help, and had no feeling of shame because I was in chains;

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: But when he was in Rome, he went in search of me everywhere, and came to me

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: (May he have the Lord's mercy in that day); and of all he did for me at Ephesus you have full knowledge.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: So then, my child, be strong in the grace which is in Christ Jesus.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: And the things which I have said to you before a number of witnesses, give to those of the faith, so that they may be teachers of others.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: Be ready to do without the comforts of life, as one of the army of Christ Jesus.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: A fighting man, when he is with the army, keeps himself free from the business of this life so that he may be pleasing to him who has taken him into his army.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: And if a man takes part in a competition he does not get the crown if he has not kept the rules.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: It is right for the worker in the fields to be the first to take of the fruit.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: Give thought to what I say; for the Lord will give you wisdom in all things.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: Keep in mind Jesus Christ, of the seed of David, who came back from the dead, as my good news gives witness:

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: In which I put up with the hardest conditions, even prison chains, like one who has done a crime; but the word of God is not in chains.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: But I undergo all things for the saints, so that they may have salvation in Christ Jesus with eternal glory.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: This is a true saying: If we undergo death with him, then will we be living with him:

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: If we go on to the end, then we will be ruling with him: if we say we have no knowledge of him, then he will say he has no knowledge of us:

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: If we are without faith, still he keeps faith, for he will never be untrue to himself.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: Put these things before them, giving them orders in the name of the Lord to keep themselves from fighting about words, which is of no profit, only causing error in their hearers.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: Let it be your care to get the approval of God, as a workman who has no cause for shame, giving the true word in the right way.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: But take no part in wrong and foolish talk, for those who do so will go farther into evil,

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: And their words will be like poisoned wounds in the flesh: such are Hymenaeus and Philetus;

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 18
text: Men whose ideas are all false, who say that the coming back from the dead has even now taken place, overturning the faith of some.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 19
text: But God's strong base is unchanging, having this sign, The Lord has knowledge of those who are his: and, Let everyone by whom the name of the Lord is named be turned away from evil.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 20
text: Now in a great house there are not only vessels of gold and silver, but others of wood and earth, and some which are honoured and some without honour.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 21
text: If a man makes himself clean from these, he will be a vessel for honour, made holy, ready for the master's use, ready for every good work.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 22
text: But keep yourself from those desires of the flesh which are strong when the body is young, and go after righteousness, faith, love, peace, with those whose prayers go up to the Lord from a clean heart.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 23
text: And put away foolish and uncontrolled questionings, seeing that they are a cause of trouble.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 24
text: For it is not right for the Lord's servant to make trouble, but he is to be gentle to all, ready in teaching, putting up with wrong,

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 25
text: Gently guiding those who go against the teaching; if by chance God may give them a change of heart and true knowledge,

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 2 Verse 26
text: And so they may get themselves free from the net of the Evil One, being made the prisoners of the Lord's servant, for the purpose of God.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: But be certain of this, that in the last days times of trouble will come.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: For men will be lovers of self, lovers of money, uplifted in pride, given to bitter words, going against the authority of their fathers, never giving praise, having no religion,

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: Without natural love, bitter haters, saying evil of others, violent and uncontrolled, hating all good,

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: False to their friends, acting without thought, lifted up in mind, loving pleasure more than God;

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: Having a form of religion, but turning their backs on the power of it: go not with these.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: For these are they who go secretly into houses, making prisoners of foolish women, weighted down with sin, turned from the way by their evil desires,

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: Ever learning, and never coming to the knowledge of what is true.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: And as James and Jambres went against Moses, so do these go against what is true: men of evil minds, who, tested by faith, are seen to be false.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: But they will go no farther: for their foolish behaviour will be clear to all men, as theirs was in the end.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: But you took as your example my teaching, behaviour, purpose, and faith; my long waiting, my love, my quiet undergoing of trouble;

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: My punishments and pain; the things which came to me at Antioch, at Iconium, at Lystra; the cruel attacks made on me: and the Lord made me free from them all.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: Yes, and all whose purpose is to be living in the knowledge of God in Christ Jesus, will be cruelly attacked.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: Evil and false men will become worse and worse, using deceit and themselves overcome by deceit.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: But see that you keep to the teaching you have been given and the things of which you are certain, conscious of who has been your teacher;

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: And that from the time when you were a child, you have had knowledge of the holy Writings, which are able to make you wise to salvation, through faith in Christ Jesus.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: Every holy Writing which comes from God is of profit for teaching, for training, for guiding, for education in righteousness:

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: So that the man of God may be complete, trained and made ready for every good work.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: I give you orders, before God and Christ Jesus, who will be the judge of the living and the dead, and by his revelation and his kingdom;

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: Be preaching the word at all times, in every place; make protests, say sharp words, give comfort, with long waiting and teaching;

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: For the time will come when they will not take the true teaching; but, moved by their desires, they will get for themselves a great number of teachers for the pleasure of hearing them;

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: And shutting their ears to what is true, will be turned away to belief in foolish stories.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: But be self-controlled in all things, do without comfort, go on preaching the good news, completing the work which has been given you to do.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: For I am even now being offered, and my end is near.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: I have made a good fight, I have come to the end of my journey, I have kept the faith:

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: From now on, the crown of righteousness is made ready for me, which the Lord, the upright judge, Will give to me at that day: and not only to me, but to all those who have had love for his revelation.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: Do your best to come to me before long:

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: For Demas has gone away from me, for love of this present life, and has gone to Thessalonica: Crescens has gone to Galatia, Titus to Dalmatia.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: Only Luke is with me. Get Mark and take him with you; for he is of use to me in the work.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: Tychicus I sent to Ephesus.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: The coat which I did not take from Troas and which is with Carpus, get when you come, and the books, specially the papers.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: Alexander the copper-worker did me much wrong: the Lord will give him the reward of his works:

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: But be on the watch for him, for he was violent in his attacks on our teaching.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: At my first meeting with my judges, no one took my part, but all went away from me. May it not be put to their account.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 17
text: But the Lord was by my side and gave me strength; so that through me the news might be given out in full measure, and all the Gentiles might give ear: and I was taken out of the mouth of the lion.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 18
text: The Lord will keep me safe from every evil work and will give me salvation in his kingdom in heaven: to whom be glory for ever and ever. So be it.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 19
text: Give my love to Prisca and Aquila and those of the house of Onesiphorus.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 20
text: Erastus was stopping at Corinth; but Trophimus, when I last saw him was at Miletus, ill.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 21
text: Do your best to come before the winter. Eubulus sends you his love, and Pudens and Linus and Claudia, and all the brothers.

title: 2 Timothy Chapter 4 Verse 22
text: The Lord be with your spirit. Grace be with you.

title: Titus Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: Paul, a servant of God, and an Apostle of Jesus Christ, in agreement with the faith of the saints of God and the full knowledge of what is true in harmony with religion,

title: Titus Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: In the hope of eternal life, which was made certain before eternal time, by the word of God who is ever true;

title: Titus Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: Who, in his time, made clear his word in the good news, of which, by the order of God our Saviour, I became a preacher;

title: Titus Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: To Titus, my true child in our common faith: Grace and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Saviour.

title: Titus Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: I did not take you with me when I went away from Crete, so that you might do what was necessary to put things in order there, placing men in authority over the churches in every town, as I said to you;

title: Titus Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: Men having a good record, husbands of one wife, whose children are of the faith, children of whom it may not be said that they are given to loose living or are uncontrolled.

title: Titus Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: For it is necessary for a Bishop to be a man of virtue, as God's servant; not pushing himself forward, not quickly moved to wrath or blows, not desiring profit for himself;

title: Titus Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: But opening his house freely to guests; a lover of what is good, serious-minded, upright, holy, self-controlled;

title: Titus Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: Keeping to the true word of the teaching, so that he may be able to give comfort by right teaching and overcome the arguments of the doubters.

title: Titus Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: For there are men who are not ruled by law; foolish talkers, false teachers, specially those of the circumcision,

title: Titus Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: By whom some families have been completely overturned; who take money for teaching things which are not right; these will have to be stopped.

title: Titus Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: One of their prophets has said, The men of Crete are ever false, evil beasts, lovers of food, hating work.

title: Titus Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: This witness is true. So say sharp words to them so that they may come to the right faith,

title: Titus Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: Giving no attention to the fictions of the Jews and the rules of men who have no true knowledge.

title: Titus Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: To the clean in heart all things are clean: but to those who are unclean and without faith nothing is clean; they become unclean in mind and in thought.

title: Titus Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: They say that they have knowledge of God, while by their acts they are turning their backs on him; they are hated by all, hard-hearted, and judged to be without value for any good work.

title: Titus Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: But let your words be in agreement with true and right teaching:

title: Titus Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: That old men are to be simple in their tastes, serious, wise, true in faith, in love, and of a quiet mind.

title: Titus Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: That old women are to be self-respecting in behaviour, not saying evil of others, not given to taking much wine, teachers of that which is good,

title: Titus Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: Training the younger women to have love for their husbands and children,

title: Titus Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: To be wise in mind, clean in heart, kind; working in their houses, living under the authority of their husbands; so that no evil may be said of the word of God.

title: Titus Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: To the young men give orders to be wise and serious-minded:

title: Titus Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: In all things see that you are an example of good works; holy in your teaching, serious in behaviour,

title: Titus Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: Saying true and right words, against which no protest may be made, so that he who is not on our side may be put to shame, unable to say any evil of us.

title: Titus Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: Servants are to be under the authority of their masters, pleasing them in all things, without argument;

title: Titus Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: Not taking what is not theirs, but giving clear signs of their good faith, in all things doing credit to the teaching of God our Saviour.

title: Titus Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: For the grace of God has come, giving salvation to all men,

title: Titus Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: Training us so that, turning away from evil and the desires of this world, we may be living wisely and uprightly in the knowledge of God in this present life;

title: Titus Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: Looking for the glad hope, the revelation of the glory of our great God and Saviour Jesus Christ;

title: Titus Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: Who gave himself for us, so that he might make us free from all wrongdoing, and make for himself a people clean in heart and on fire with good works.

title: Titus Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: On all these points give teaching and help, and make clear what is right with all authority. Let all men give you honour.

title: Titus Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: Make clear to them that they are to put themselves under rulers and authorities, to do what they are ordered, to be ready for every good work,

title: Titus Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: To say no evil of any man, not to be fighters, to give way to others, to be gentle in behaviour to all men.

title: Titus Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: For in the past we were foolish, hard in heart, turned from the true way, servants of evil desires and pleasures, living in bad feeling and envy, hated and hating one another.

title: Titus Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: But when the mercy of God our Saviour, and his love to man was seen,

title: Titus Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: Not by works of righteousness which we did ourselves, but in the measure of his mercy, he gave us salvation, through the washing of the new birth and the giving of new life in the Holy Spirit,

title: Titus Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: Which he gave us freely through Jesus Christ our Saviour;

title: Titus Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: So that, having been given righteousness through grace, we might have a part in the heritage, the hope of eternal life.

title: Titus Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: This is a true saying; and it is my desire that you may give certain witness about these things, so that those who have had faith in God may give attention to good works. These things are good and of profit to men;

title: Titus Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: But have nothing to do with foolish questionings, and lists of generations, and fights and arguments about the law; for they are of no profit and foolish.

title: Titus Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: A man whose opinions are not those of the church, after a first and second protest, is to be kept out of your society;

title: Titus Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: Clearly he is in error and a sinner, being self-judged.

title: Titus Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: When I send Artemas or Tychicus to you, do your best to come to me at Nicopolis: for it is my purpose to be there for the winter.

title: Titus Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: Send Zenas, the man of law, and Apollos on their journey with all care, so that they may be in need of nothing.

title: Titus Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: And let our people go on with good works for necessary purposes, so that they may not be without fruit.

title: Titus Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: All who are with me send you their love. Give our love to our friends in the faith. Grace be with you all.

title: Philemon Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: Paul, a prisoner of Jesus Christ, and Timothy our brother, to Philemon, our dear helper in the faith,

title: Philemon Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: And to Apphia, our sister, and to Archippus, our brother in God's army, and to the church in your house:

title: Philemon Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

title: Philemon Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: I give praise to God at all times and make prayer for you,

title: Philemon Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: Hearing of the love and the faith which you have to the Lord Jesus and to all the saints;

title: Philemon Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: That the faith which you have in common with them may be working with power, in the knowledge of every good thing in you, for Christ.

title: Philemon Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: For I had great joy and comfort in your love, because the hearts of the saints have been made strong again through you, brother.

title: Philemon Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: And so, though I might, in the name of Christ, give you orders to do what is right,

title: Philemon Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: Still, because of love, in place of an order, I make a request to you, I, Paul, an old man and now a prisoner of Christ Jesus:

title: Philemon Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: My request is for my child Onesimus, the child of my chains,

title: Philemon Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: Who in the past was of no profit to you, but now is of profit to you and to me:

title: Philemon Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: Whom I have sent back to you, him who is my very heart:

title: Philemon Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: Though my desire was to keep him with me, to be my servant in the chains of the good news, in your place:

title: Philemon Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: But without your approval I would do nothing; so that your good works might not be forced, but done freely from your heart.

title: Philemon Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: For it is possible that for this reason he was parted from you for a time, so that you might have him for ever;

title: Philemon Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: No longer as a servant, but more than a servant, a brother, very dear to me specially, but much more to you, in the flesh as well as in the Lord.

title: Philemon Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: If then you take me to be your friend and brother, take him in as myself.

title: Philemon Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: If he has done you any wrong or is in debt to you for anything, put it to my account.

title: Philemon Chapter 1 Verse 19
text: I, Paul, writing this myself, say, I will make payment to you: and I do not say to you that you are in debt to me even for your life.

title: Philemon Chapter 1 Verse 20
text: So brother, let me have joy of you in the Lord: give new life to my heart in Christ.

title: Philemon Chapter 1 Verse 21
text: Being certain that you will do my desire, I am writing to you, in the knowledge that you will do even more than I say.

title: Philemon Chapter 1 Verse 22
text: And make a room ready for me; for I am hoping that through your prayers I will be given to you.

title: Philemon Chapter 1 Verse 23
text: Epaphras, my brother-prisoner in Christ Jesus, sends you his love;

title: Philemon Chapter 1 Verse 24
text: And so do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, my brother-workers.

title: Philemon Chapter 1 Verse 25
text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. So be it.

title: Hebrews Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: In times past the word of God came to our fathers through the prophets, in different parts and in different ways;

title: Hebrews Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: But now, at the end of these days, it has come to us through his Son, to whom he has given all things for a heritage, and through whom he made the order of the generations;

title: Hebrews Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: Who, being the outshining of his glory, the true image of his substance, supporting all things by the word of his power, having given himself as an offering making clean from sins, took his seat at the right hand of God in heaven;

title: Hebrews Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: Having become by so much better than the angels, as the name which is his heritage is more noble than theirs.

title: Hebrews Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: To which of the angels did God say at any time, You are my Son, this day I have given you being? or, I will be his Father, and he will be my Son?

title: Hebrews Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: And again, when he is sending his only Son into the world, he says, Let all the angels of God give him worship.

title: Hebrews Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: And of the angels he says, Who makes his angels winds, and his servants flames of fire:

title: Hebrews Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: But of the Son he says, Your seat of power, O God, is for ever and ever; and the rod of your kingdom is a rod of righteousness.

title: Hebrews Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: You have been a lover of righteousness and a hater of evil; and so God, your God, has put the oil of joy on your head more than on the heads of those who are with you.

title: Hebrews Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: You, Lord, at the first did put the earth on its base, and the heavens are the works of your hands:

title: Hebrews Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: They will come to their end; but you are for ever; they will become old as a robe;

title: Hebrews Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: They will be rolled up like a cloth, even like a robe, and they will be changed: but you are the same and your years will have no end.

title: Hebrews Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: But of which of the angels has he said at any time, Take your seat at my right hand till I put all those who are against you under your feet?

title: Hebrews Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: Are they not all helping spirits, who are sent out as servants to those whose heritage will be salvation?

title: Hebrews Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: For this reason there is the more need for us to give attention to the things which have come to our ears, for fear that by chance we might be slipping away.

title: Hebrews Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: Because if the word which came through the angels was fixed, and in the past every evil act against God's orders was given its full punishment;

title: Hebrews Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: What will come on us, if we do not give our minds to such a great salvation? a salvation of which our fathers first had knowledge through the words of the Lord, and which was made certain to us by those to whom his words came;

title: Hebrews Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: And God was a witness with them, by signs and wonders, and by more than natural powers, and by his distribution of the Holy Spirit at his pleasure.

title: Hebrews Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: For he did not make the angels rulers over the world to come, of which I am writing.

title: Hebrews Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: But a certain writer has given his witness, saying, What is man, that you keep him in mind? what is the son of man, that you take him into account?

title: Hebrews Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: You made him a little lower than the angels; you gave him a crown of glory and honour, and made him ruler over all the works of your hands:

title: Hebrews Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: You put all things under his feet. For in making man the ruler over all things, God did not put anything outside his authority; though we do not see everything under him now.

title: Hebrews Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: But we see him who was made a little lower than the angels, even Jesus, crowned with glory and honour, because he let himself be put to death so that by the grace of God he might undergo death for all men.

title: Hebrews Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: Because it was right for him, for whom and through whom all things have being, in guiding his sons to glory, to make the captain of their salvation complete through pain.

title: Hebrews Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: For he who makes holy and those who are made holy are all of one family; and for this reason it is no shame for him to give them the name of brothers,

title: Hebrews Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: Saying, I will give the knowledge of your name to my brothers, I will make a song of praise to you before the church.

title: Hebrews Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: And again he says, I will put my faith in him. And again, See, I am here, and the children which God has given to me.

title: Hebrews Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: And because the children are flesh and blood, he took a body himself and became like them; so that by his death he might put an end to him who had the power of death, that is to say, the Evil One;

title: Hebrews Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: And let those who all their lives were in chains because of their fear of death, go free.

title: Hebrews Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: For, truly, he does not take on the life of angels, but that of the seed of Abraham.

title: Hebrews Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: Because of this it was necessary for him to be made like his brothers in every way, so that he might be a high priest full of mercy and keeping faith in everything to do with God, making offerings for the sins of the people.

title: Hebrews Chapter 2 Verse 18
text: For having been put to the test himself, he is able to give help to others when they are tested.

title: Hebrews Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: For this reason, holy brothers, marked out to have a part in heaven, give thought to Jesus the representative and high priest of our faith;

title: Hebrews Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: Who kept faith with God who gave him his place, even as Moses did in all his house.

title: Hebrews Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: And it was right for this man to have more honour than Moses, even as the builder of a house has more honour than the house.
